name: The Opening
intro: This Meccan sûrah, which is recited a total of seventeen times in the five daily prayers, serves as the cornerstone of the Quran. It sums up the relationship between the Creator and His creation, Allah’s undisputed authority in this world and the Hereafter, and humanity’s constant dependence on Him for guidance and assistance. The underlying theme is to acknowledge that He is the only god worthy of worship—a simple truth which the disbelievers fail to grasp. All fundamental principles encapsulated in this sûrah are spelled out in the rest of the Quran. Prayer for Guidance

verses.text: In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
verses.translation: In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.

verses.text: All praise is for Allah—Lord of all worlds,[1]
verses.translation: All praise is for Allah—Lord of all worlds,[1]

verses.text: the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful,
verses.translation: the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful,

verses.text: Master of the Day of Judgment.
verses.translation: Master of the Day of Judgment.

verses.text: You ˹alone˺ we worship and You ˹alone˺ we ask for help.
verses.translation: You ˹alone˺ we worship and You ˹alone˺ we ask for help.

verses.text: Guide us along the Straight Path,
verses.translation: Guide us along the Straight Path,

verses.text: the Path of those You have blessed—not those You are displeased with, or those who are astray.[2] *** -- 33 of 694 --
verses.translation: the Path of those You have blessed—not those You are displeased with, or those who are astray.[2] *** -- 33 of 694 --

name: The Cow
intro: This Medinian sûrah, which takes its name from the story of the cow in verses 67–73, details the main concepts of the previous sûrah, with emphasis on the qualities of the believers, disbelievers, and hypocrites; Allah’s power to create and resurrect; the enmity of Satan towards Adam ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) and his descendants; as well as Allah’s covenant with Moses ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) and the Children of Israel. Several rulings are given in regards to marital relationships, bequest, jihad, fasting, pilgrimage, donations, debts, and interest. Unlike the next sûrah, which focuses on the Christian perception of Jesus, this sûrah dedicates a sizable portion to Jewish attitudes and practices. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Qualities of the Believers

verses.text: Alif-Lãm-Mĩm.[3]
verses.translation: Alif-Lãm-Mĩm.[3]

verses.text: This is the Book! There is no doubt about it[4]—a guide for those mindful ˹of Allah˺,[5]
verses.translation: This is the Book! There is no doubt about it[4]—a guide for those mindful ˹of Allah˺,[5]

verses.text: who believe in the unseen,[6] establish prayer, and donate from what We have provided for them,
verses.translation: who believe in the unseen,[6] establish prayer, and donate from what We have provided for them,

verses.text: and who believe in what has been revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺[7] and what was revealed before you, and have sure faith in the Hereafter.
verses.translation: and who believe in what has been revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺[7] and what was revealed before you, and have sure faith in the Hereafter.

verses.text: It is they who are ˹truly˺ guided by their Lord, and it is they who will be successful. Qualities of the Disbelievers
verses.translation: It is they who are ˹truly˺ guided by their Lord, and it is they who will be successful. Qualities of the Disbelievers

verses.text: As for those who persist in disbelief, it is the same whether you warn them or not—they will never believe.
verses.translation: As for those who persist in disbelief, it is the same whether you warn them or not—they will never believe.

verses.text: Allah has sealed their hearts and their hearing, and their sight is covered. They will suffer a tremendous punishment. Qualities of the Hypocrites
verses.translation: Allah has sealed their hearts and their hearing, and their sight is covered. They will suffer a tremendous punishment. Qualities of the Hypocrites

verses.text: And there are some who say, “We believe in Allah and the Last Day,” yet they are not ˹true˺ believers.
verses.translation: And there are some who say, “We believe in Allah and the Last Day,” yet they are not ˹true˺ believers.

verses.text: They seek to deceive Allah and the believers, yet they only deceive themselves, but they fail to perceive it.
verses.translation: They seek to deceive Allah and the believers, yet they only deceive themselves, but they fail to perceive it.

verses.text: There is sickness in their hearts, and Allah ˹only˺ lets their sickness increase. They will suffer a painful punishment for their lies.
verses.translation: There is sickness in their hearts, and Allah ˹only˺ lets their sickness increase. They will suffer a painful punishment for their lies.

verses.text: When they are told, “Do not spread corruption in the land,” they reply, “We are only peace-makers!”[8]
verses.translation: When they are told, “Do not spread corruption in the land,” they reply, “We are only peace-makers!”[8]

verses.text: Indeed, it is they who are the corruptors, but they fail to perceive it.
verses.translation: Indeed, it is they who are the corruptors, but they fail to perceive it.

verses.text: And when they are told, “Believe as others believe,” they reply, “Will we believe as the fools believe?” Indeed, it is they who are fools, but they do not know.
verses.translation: And when they are told, “Believe as others believe,” they reply, “Will we believe as the fools believe?” Indeed, it is they who are fools, but they do not know.

verses.text: When they meet the believers they say, “We believe.” But when alone with their evil associates they say, “We are definitely with you; we were only mocking.”
verses.translation: When they meet the believers they say, “We believe.” But when alone with their evil associates they say, “We are definitely with you; we were only mocking.”

verses.text: Allah will throw their mockery back at them, leaving them to continue wandering blindly in their defiance.
verses.translation: Allah will throw their mockery back at them, leaving them to continue wandering blindly in their defiance.

verses.text: They are the ones who trade guidance for misguidance. But this trade is profitless, and they are not ˹rightly˺ guided. Hypocrites’ Example
verses.translation: They are the ones who trade guidance for misguidance. But this trade is profitless, and they are not ˹rightly˺ guided. Hypocrites’ Example

verses.text: Their example is that of someone who kindles a fire, but when it lights up all around them, Allah takes away their light, leaving them in complete darkness—unable to see.
verses.translation: Their example is that of someone who kindles a fire, but when it lights up all around them, Allah takes away their light, leaving them in complete darkness—unable to see.

verses.text: They are ˹wilfully˺ deaf, dumb, and blind, so they will never return ˹to the Right Path˺. Another Example
verses.translation: They are ˹wilfully˺ deaf, dumb, and blind, so they will never return ˹to the Right Path˺. Another Example

verses.text: Or ˹those caught in˺ a rainstorm from the sky with darkness, thunder, and lightning. They press their fingers into their ears at the sound of every thunder-clap for fear of death. And Allah encompasses the disbelievers ˹by His might˺.
verses.translation: Or ˹those caught in˺ a rainstorm from the sky with darkness, thunder, and lightning. They press their fingers into their ears at the sound of every thunder-clap for fear of death. And Allah encompasses the disbelievers ˹by His might˺.

verses.text: It is as if the lightning were about to snatch away their sight. Whenever lightning strikes, they walk in its light, but when darkness covers them, they stand still. Had Allah willed, He could have taken away their hearing and sight. Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything. Order to Worship Allah Alone
verses.translation: It is as if the lightning were about to snatch away their sight. Whenever lightning strikes, they walk in its light, but when darkness covers them, they stand still. Had Allah willed, He could have taken away their hearing and sight. Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything. Order to Worship Allah Alone

verses.text: O humanity! Worship your Lord, Who created you and those before you, so that you may become mindful ˹of Him˺.
verses.translation: O humanity! Worship your Lord, Who created you and those before you, so that you may become mindful ˹of Him˺.

verses.text: ˹He is the One˺ Who has made the earth a place of settlement for you and the sky a canopy; and sends down rain from the sky, causing fruits to grow as a provision for you. So do not knowingly set up equals to Allah ˹in worship˺. The Challenge of the Quran
verses.translation: ˹He is the One˺ Who has made the earth a place of settlement for you and the sky a canopy; and sends down rain from the sky, causing fruits to grow as a provision for you. So do not knowingly set up equals to Allah ˹in worship˺. The Challenge of the Quran

verses.text: And if you are in doubt about what We have revealed to Our servant,[9] then produce a sûrah like it and call your helpers other than Allah, if what you say is true.
verses.translation: And if you are in doubt about what We have revealed to Our servant,[9] then produce a sûrah like it and call your helpers other than Allah, if what you say is true.

verses.text: But if you are unable to do so—and you will never be able to do so—then fear the Fire fuelled with people and stones, which is prepared for the disbelievers. Reward of the Believers
verses.translation: But if you are unable to do so—and you will never be able to do so—then fear the Fire fuelled with people and stones, which is prepared for the disbelievers. Reward of the Believers

verses.text: Give good news ˹O Prophet˺ to those who believe and do good that they will have Gardens under which rivers flow. Whenever provided with fruit, they will say, “This is what we were given before,” for they will be served fruit that looks similar ˹but tastes different˺. They will have pure spouses, [10] and they will be there forever. Wisdom Behind Parables
verses.translation: Give good news ˹O Prophet˺ to those who believe and do good that they will have Gardens under which rivers flow. Whenever provided with fruit, they will say, “This is what we were given before,” for they will be served fruit that looks similar ˹but tastes different˺. They will have pure spouses, [10] and they will be there forever. Wisdom Behind Parables

verses.text: Surely Allah does not shy away from using the parable of a mosquito or what is even smaller. As for the believers, they know that it is the truth from their Lord. And as for the disbelievers, they argue, “What does Allah mean by such a parable?” Through this ˹test˺, He leaves many to stray, and guides many. And He leaves none to stray except the rebellious—
verses.translation: Surely Allah does not shy away from using the parable of a mosquito or what is even smaller. As for the believers, they know that it is the truth from their Lord. And as for the disbelievers, they argue, “What does Allah mean by such a parable?” Through this ˹test˺, He leaves many to stray, and guides many. And He leaves none to stray except the rebellious—

verses.text: those who violate Allah’s covenant after it has been affirmed, break whatever ˹ties˺ Allah has ordered to be maintained, and spread corruption in the land. It is they who are the ˹true˺ losers. Allah’s Creation
verses.translation: those who violate Allah’s covenant after it has been affirmed, break whatever ˹ties˺ Allah has ordered to be maintained, and spread corruption in the land. It is they who are the ˹true˺ losers. Allah’s Creation

verses.text: How can you deny Allah? You were lifeless and He gave you life, then He will cause you to die and again bring you to life, and then to Him you will ˹all˺ be returned.
verses.translation: How can you deny Allah? You were lifeless and He gave you life, then He will cause you to die and again bring you to life, and then to Him you will ˹all˺ be returned.

verses.text: He is the One Who created everything in the earth for you. Then He turned towards the heaven, forming it into seven heavens. And He has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things. Honouring Adam
verses.translation: He is the One Who created everything in the earth for you. Then He turned towards the heaven, forming it into seven heavens. And He has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things. Honouring Adam

verses.text: ˹Remember˺ when your Lord said to the angels, “I am going to place a successive ˹human˺ authority on earth.” They asked ˹Allah˺, “Will You place in it someone who will spread corruption there and shed blood while we glorify Your praises and proclaim Your holiness?” Allah responded, “I know what you do not know.”[11]
verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when your Lord said to the angels, “I am going to place a successive ˹human˺ authority on earth.” They asked ˹Allah˺, “Will You place in it someone who will spread corruption there and shed blood while we glorify Your praises and proclaim Your holiness?” Allah responded, “I know what you do not know.”[11]

verses.text: He taught Adam the names of all things, then He presented them to the angels and said, “Tell Me the names of these, if what you say is true?[12]”
verses.translation: He taught Adam the names of all things, then He presented them to the angels and said, “Tell Me the names of these, if what you say is true?[12]”

verses.text: They replied, “Glory be to You! We have no knowledge except what You have taught us. You are truly the All-Knowing, All-Wise.”
verses.translation: They replied, “Glory be to You! We have no knowledge except what You have taught us. You are truly the All-Knowing, All-Wise.”

verses.text: Allah said, “O Adam! Inform them of their names.” Then when Adam did, Allah said, “Did I not tell you that I know the secrets of the heavens and the earth, and I know what you reveal and what you conceal?”
verses.translation: Allah said, “O Adam! Inform them of their names.” Then when Adam did, Allah said, “Did I not tell you that I know the secrets of the heavens and the earth, and I know what you reveal and what you conceal?”

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when We said to the angels, “Prostrate before Adam,”[13] so they all did—but not Iblîs,[14] who refused and acted arrogantly,[15] becoming unfaithful. Temptation and Fall
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when We said to the angels, “Prostrate before Adam,”[13] so they all did—but not Iblîs,[14] who refused and acted arrogantly,[15] becoming unfaithful. Temptation and Fall

verses.text: We cautioned, “O Adam! Live with your wife in Paradise and eat as freely as you please, but do not approach this tree, or else you will be wrongdoers.”
verses.translation: We cautioned, “O Adam! Live with your wife in Paradise and eat as freely as you please, but do not approach this tree, or else you will be wrongdoers.”

verses.text: But Satan deceived them—leading to their fall from the ˹blissful˺ state they were in,[16] and We said, “Descend from the heavens ˹to the earth˺ as enemies to each other.[17] You will find in the earth a residence and provision for your appointed stay.”
verses.translation: But Satan deceived them—leading to their fall from the ˹blissful˺ state they were in,[16] and We said, “Descend from the heavens ˹to the earth˺ as enemies to each other.[17] You will find in the earth a residence and provision for your appointed stay.”

verses.text: Then Adam was inspired with words ˹of prayer˺ by his Lord,[18] so He accepted his repentance. Surely He is the Accepter of Repentance, Most Merciful.
verses.translation: Then Adam was inspired with words ˹of prayer˺ by his Lord,[18] so He accepted his repentance. Surely He is the Accepter of Repentance, Most Merciful.

verses.text: We said, “Descend all of you! Then when guidance comes to you from Me, whoever follows it, there will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve.
verses.translation: We said, “Descend all of you! Then when guidance comes to you from Me, whoever follows it, there will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve.

verses.text: But those who disbelieve and deny Our signs will be the residents of the Fire. They will be there forever.” Advice to the Israelites
verses.translation: But those who disbelieve and deny Our signs will be the residents of the Fire. They will be there forever.” Advice to the Israelites

verses.text: O children of Israel![19] Remember My favours upon you. Fulfil your covenant and I will fulfil Mine, and stand in awe of Me ˹alone˺.
verses.translation: O children of Israel![19] Remember My favours upon you. Fulfil your covenant and I will fulfil Mine, and stand in awe of Me ˹alone˺.

verses.text: Believe in My revelations which confirm your Scriptures.[20] Do not be the first to deny them or trade them for a fleeting gain.[21] And be mindful of Me.
verses.translation: Believe in My revelations which confirm your Scriptures.[20] Do not be the first to deny them or trade them for a fleeting gain.[21] And be mindful of Me.

verses.text: Do not mix truth with falsehood or hide the truth knowingly.
verses.translation: Do not mix truth with falsehood or hide the truth knowingly.

verses.text: Establish prayer, pay alms-tax,[22] and bow down with those who bow down. More Advice
verses.translation: Establish prayer, pay alms-tax,[22] and bow down with those who bow down. More Advice

verses.text: Do you preach righteousness and fail to practice it yourselves, although you read the Scripture? Do you not understand?
verses.translation: Do you preach righteousness and fail to practice it yourselves, although you read the Scripture? Do you not understand?

verses.text: And seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, it is a burden except for the humble—
verses.translation: And seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, it is a burden except for the humble—

verses.text: those who are certain that they will meet their Lord and to Him they will return. Allah’s Favours upon the Israelites 1) Honour
verses.translation: those who are certain that they will meet their Lord and to Him they will return. Allah’s Favours upon the Israelites 1) Honour

verses.text: O Children of Israel! Remember ˹all˺ the favours I granted you and how I honoured you above the others.[23]
verses.translation: O Children of Israel! Remember ˹all˺ the favours I granted you and how I honoured you above the others.[23]

verses.text: Guard yourselves against the Day on which no soul will be of help to another. No intercession[24] will be accepted, no ransom taken, and no help will be given. Favour 2) Ending Persecution
verses.translation: Guard yourselves against the Day on which no soul will be of help to another. No intercession[24] will be accepted, no ransom taken, and no help will be given. Favour 2) Ending Persecution

verses.text: ˹Remember˺ how We delivered you from the people of Pharaoh, who afflicted you with dreadful torment, slaughtering your sons and keeping your women. That was a severe test from your Lord. Favour 3) Parting the Sea
verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ how We delivered you from the people of Pharaoh, who afflicted you with dreadful torment, slaughtering your sons and keeping your women. That was a severe test from your Lord. Favour 3) Parting the Sea

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when We parted the sea, rescued you, and drowned Pharaoh’s people before your very eyes. Favour 4) Forgiving Calf-Worship
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when We parted the sea, rescued you, and drowned Pharaoh’s people before your very eyes. Favour 4) Forgiving Calf-Worship

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when We appointed forty nights for Moses, then you worshipped the calf in his absence, acting wrongfully.
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when We appointed forty nights for Moses, then you worshipped the calf in his absence, acting wrongfully.

verses.text: Even then We ˹still˺ forgave you so perhaps you would be grateful. Favour 5) Revealing the Torah
verses.translation: Even then We ˹still˺ forgave you so perhaps you would be grateful. Favour 5) Revealing the Torah

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when We gave Moses the Scripture—the standard ˹to distinguish between right and wrong˺ that perhaps you would be ˹rightly˺ guided. Favour 6) The Way to Forgiveness
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when We gave Moses the Scripture—the standard ˹to distinguish between right and wrong˺ that perhaps you would be ˹rightly˺ guided. Favour 6) The Way to Forgiveness

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when Moses said to his people, “O my people! Surely you have wronged yourselves by worshipping the calf, so turn in repentance to your Creator and execute ˹the calf-worshippers among˺ yourselves. That is best for you in the sight of your Creator.” Then He accepted your repentance. Surely He is the Accepter of Repentance, Most Merciful. Favour 7) Forgiving the Demand to See Allah
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when Moses said to his people, “O my people! Surely you have wronged yourselves by worshipping the calf, so turn in repentance to your Creator and execute ˹the calf-worshippers among˺ yourselves. That is best for you in the sight of your Creator.” Then He accepted your repentance. Surely He is the Accepter of Repentance, Most Merciful. Favour 7) Forgiving the Demand to See Allah

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when you said, “O Moses! We will never believe you until we see Allah with our own eyes,” so a thunderbolt struck you while you were looking on.
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when you said, “O Moses! We will never believe you until we see Allah with our own eyes,” so a thunderbolt struck you while you were looking on.

verses.text: Then We brought you back to life after your death, so that perhaps you would be grateful. Favour 8) Food and Shade
verses.translation: Then We brought you back to life after your death, so that perhaps you would be grateful. Favour 8) Food and Shade

verses.text: And ˹remember when˺ We shaded you with clouds and sent down to you manna and quails,[25] ˹saying˺, “Eat from the good things We have provided for you.” The evildoers ˹certainly˺ did not wrong Us, but wronged themselves. Favour 9) Permission to Enter Jerusalem
verses.translation: And ˹remember when˺ We shaded you with clouds and sent down to you manna and quails,[25] ˹saying˺, “Eat from the good things We have provided for you.” The evildoers ˹certainly˺ did not wrong Us, but wronged themselves. Favour 9) Permission to Enter Jerusalem

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when We said, “Enter this city and eat freely from wherever you please; enter the gate with humility, saying, ‘Absolve us.’ We will forgive your sins and multiply the reward for the good-doers.”
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when We said, “Enter this city and eat freely from wherever you please; enter the gate with humility, saying, ‘Absolve us.’ We will forgive your sins and multiply the reward for the good-doers.”

verses.text: But the wrongdoers changed the words they were commanded to say. So We sent down a punishment from the heavens upon them for their rebelliousness. Favour 10) Water for All
verses.translation: But the wrongdoers changed the words they were commanded to say. So We sent down a punishment from the heavens upon them for their rebelliousness. Favour 10) Water for All

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when Moses prayed for water for his people, We said, “Strike the rock with your staff.” Then twelve springs gushed out, ˹and˺ each tribe knew its drinking place. ˹We then said,˺ “Eat and drink of Allah’s provisions, and do not go about spreading corruption in the land.” Punishment for Defiance
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when Moses prayed for water for his people, We said, “Strike the rock with your staff.” Then twelve springs gushed out, ˹and˺ each tribe knew its drinking place. ˹We then said,˺ “Eat and drink of Allah’s provisions, and do not go about spreading corruption in the land.” Punishment for Defiance

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when you said, “O Moses! We cannot endure the same meal ˹every day˺. So ˹just˺ call upon your Lord on our behalf, He will bring forth for us some of what the earth produces of herbs, cucumbers, garlic, lentils, and onions.” Moses scolded ˹them˺, “Do you exchange what is better for what is worse? ˹You can˺ go down to any village and you will find what you have asked for.” They were stricken with disgrace and misery, and they invited the displeasure of Allah for rejecting Allah’s signs and unjustly killing the prophets. This is ˹a fair reward˺ for their disobedience and violations. Reward of the Believers
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when you said, “O Moses! We cannot endure the same meal ˹every day˺. So ˹just˺ call upon your Lord on our behalf, He will bring forth for us some of what the earth produces of herbs, cucumbers, garlic, lentils, and onions.” Moses scolded ˹them˺, “Do you exchange what is better for what is worse? ˹You can˺ go down to any village and you will find what you have asked for.” They were stricken with disgrace and misery, and they invited the displeasure of Allah for rejecting Allah’s signs and unjustly killing the prophets. This is ˹a fair reward˺ for their disobedience and violations. Reward of the Believers

verses.text: Indeed, the believers, Jews, Christians, and Sabians[26]—whoever ˹truly˺ believes in Allah and the Last Day and does good will have their reward with their Lord. And there will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve.[27] Allah’s Covenant with the Israelites
verses.translation: Indeed, the believers, Jews, Christians, and Sabians[26]—whoever ˹truly˺ believes in Allah and the Last Day and does good will have their reward with their Lord. And there will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve.[27] Allah’s Covenant with the Israelites

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when We took a covenant from you and raised the mountain above you ˹saying˺, “Hold firmly to that ˹Scripture˺ which We have given you and observe its teachings so perhaps you will become mindful ˹of Allah˺.”
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when We took a covenant from you and raised the mountain above you ˹saying˺, “Hold firmly to that ˹Scripture˺ which We have given you and observe its teachings so perhaps you will become mindful ˹of Allah˺.”

verses.text: Yet you turned away afterwards. Had it not been for Allah’s grace and mercy upon you, you would have certainly been of the losers. Punishment for the Sabbath-Breakers
verses.translation: Yet you turned away afterwards. Had it not been for Allah’s grace and mercy upon you, you would have certainly been of the losers. Punishment for the Sabbath-Breakers

verses.text: You are already aware of those of you who broke the Sabbath. We said to them, “Be disgraced apes!”[28]
verses.translation: You are already aware of those of you who broke the Sabbath. We said to them, “Be disgraced apes!”[28]

verses.text: So We made their fate an example to present and future generations, and a lesson to the God-fearing. Story of the Cow
verses.translation: So We made their fate an example to present and future generations, and a lesson to the God-fearing. Story of the Cow

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when Moses said to his people, “Allah commands you to sacrifice a cow.”[29] They replied, “Are you mocking us?” Moses responded, “I seek refuge in Allah from acting foolishly!”
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when Moses said to his people, “Allah commands you to sacrifice a cow.”[29] They replied, “Are you mocking us?” Moses responded, “I seek refuge in Allah from acting foolishly!”

verses.text: They said, “Call upon your Lord to clarify for us what type ˹of cow˺ it should be!” He replied, “Allah says, ‘The cow should neither be old nor young but in between. So do as you are commanded!’”
verses.translation: They said, “Call upon your Lord to clarify for us what type ˹of cow˺ it should be!” He replied, “Allah says, ‘The cow should neither be old nor young but in between. So do as you are commanded!’”

verses.text: They said, “Call upon your Lord to specify for us its colour.” He replied, “Allah says, ‘It should be a bright yellow cow—pleasant to see.’”
verses.translation: They said, “Call upon your Lord to specify for us its colour.” He replied, “Allah says, ‘It should be a bright yellow cow—pleasant to see.’”

verses.text: Again they said, “Call upon your Lord so that He may make clear to us which cow, for all cows look the same to us. Then, Allah willing, we will be guided ˹to the right one˺.”
verses.translation: Again they said, “Call upon your Lord so that He may make clear to us which cow, for all cows look the same to us. Then, Allah willing, we will be guided ˹to the right one˺.”

verses.text: He replied, “Allah says, ‘It should have been used neither to till the soil nor water the fields; wholesome and without blemish.’” They said, “Now you have come with the truth.” Yet they still slaughtered it hesitantly!
verses.translation: He replied, “Allah says, ‘It should have been used neither to till the soil nor water the fields; wholesome and without blemish.’” They said, “Now you have come with the truth.” Yet they still slaughtered it hesitantly!

verses.text: ˹This is˺ when a man was killed and you disputed who the killer was, but Allah revealed what you concealed.
verses.translation: ˹This is˺ when a man was killed and you disputed who the killer was, but Allah revealed what you concealed.

verses.text: So We instructed, “Strike the dead body with a piece of the cow.” This is how ˹easily˺ Allah brings the dead to life, showing you His signs so that you may understand.
verses.translation: So We instructed, “Strike the dead body with a piece of the cow.” This is how ˹easily˺ Allah brings the dead to life, showing you His signs so that you may understand.

verses.text: Even then your hearts became hardened like a rock or even harder, for some rocks gush rivers; others split, spilling water; while others are humbled in awe of Allah. And Allah is never unaware of what you do. Disobedient Israelites
verses.translation: Even then your hearts became hardened like a rock or even harder, for some rocks gush rivers; others split, spilling water; while others are humbled in awe of Allah. And Allah is never unaware of what you do. Disobedient Israelites

verses.text: Do you ˹believers still˺ expect them to be true to you, though a group of them would hear the word of Allah then knowingly corrupt it after understanding it?
verses.translation: Do you ˹believers still˺ expect them to be true to you, though a group of them would hear the word of Allah then knowingly corrupt it after understanding it?

verses.text: When they meet the believers they say, “We believe.” But in private they say ˹to each other˺, “Will you disclose to the believers the knowledge Allah has revealed to you,[30] so that they may use it against you before your Lord? Do you not understand?”
verses.translation: When they meet the believers they say, “We believe.” But in private they say ˹to each other˺, “Will you disclose to the believers the knowledge Allah has revealed to you,[30] so that they may use it against you before your Lord? Do you not understand?”

verses.text: Do they not know that Allah is aware of what they conceal and what they reveal?
verses.translation: Do they not know that Allah is aware of what they conceal and what they reveal?

verses.text: And among them are the illiterate who know nothing about the Scripture except lies, and ˹so˺ they ˹wishfully˺ speculate.
verses.translation: And among them are the illiterate who know nothing about the Scripture except lies, and ˹so˺ they ˹wishfully˺ speculate.

verses.text: So woe[31] to those who distort the Scripture with their own hands then say, “This is from Allah”—seeking a fleeting gain! So woe to them for what their hands have written, and woe to them for what they have earned. Argument and Refutation
verses.translation: So woe[31] to those who distort the Scripture with their own hands then say, “This is from Allah”—seeking a fleeting gain! So woe to them for what their hands have written, and woe to them for what they have earned. Argument and Refutation

verses.text: ˹Some of˺ the Jews claim, “The Fire will not touch us except for a number of days.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Have you taken a pledge from Allah— for Allah never breaks His word—or are you ˹just˺ saying about Allah what you do not know?”
verses.translation: ˹Some of˺ the Jews claim, “The Fire will not touch us except for a number of days.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Have you taken a pledge from Allah— for Allah never breaks His word—or are you ˹just˺ saying about Allah what you do not know?”

verses.text: But no! Those who commit evil and are engrossed in sin will be the residents of the Fire. They will be there forever.
verses.translation: But no! Those who commit evil and are engrossed in sin will be the residents of the Fire. They will be there forever.

verses.text: And those who believe and do good will be the residents of Paradise. They will be there forever. The Israelites’ Failure to Keep Covenants
verses.translation: And those who believe and do good will be the residents of Paradise. They will be there forever. The Israelites’ Failure to Keep Covenants

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when We took a covenant from the children of Israel ˹stating˺, “Worship none but Allah; be kind to parents, relatives, orphans and the needy; speak kindly to people; establish prayer; and pay alms-tax.” But you ˹Israelites˺ turned away—except for a few of you—and were indifferent.
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when We took a covenant from the children of Israel ˹stating˺, “Worship none but Allah; be kind to parents, relatives, orphans and the needy; speak kindly to people; establish prayer; and pay alms-tax.” But you ˹Israelites˺ turned away—except for a few of you—and were indifferent.

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when We took your covenant that you would neither shed each other’s blood nor expel each other from their homes, you gave your pledge and bore witness.
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when We took your covenant that you would neither shed each other’s blood nor expel each other from their homes, you gave your pledge and bore witness.

verses.text: But here you are, killing each other and expelling some of your people from their homes, aiding one another in sin and aggression; and when those ˹expelled˺ come to you as captives, you still ransom them—though expelling them was unlawful for you.[32] Do you believe in some of the Scripture and reject the rest? Is there any reward for those who do so among you other than disgrace in this worldly life and being subjected to the harshest punishment on the Day of Judgment? For Allah is never unaware of what you do.
verses.translation: But here you are, killing each other and expelling some of your people from their homes, aiding one another in sin and aggression; and when those ˹expelled˺ come to you as captives, you still ransom them—though expelling them was unlawful for you.[32] Do you believe in some of the Scripture and reject the rest? Is there any reward for those who do so among you other than disgrace in this worldly life and being subjected to the harshest punishment on the Day of Judgment? For Allah is never unaware of what you do.

verses.text: These are the ones who trade the Hereafter for the life of this world. So their punishment will not be reduced, nor will they be helped. Denying Allah’s Prophets
verses.translation: These are the ones who trade the Hereafter for the life of this world. So their punishment will not be reduced, nor will they be helped. Denying Allah’s Prophets

verses.text: Indeed, We gave Moses the Book and sent after him successive messengers. And We gave Jesus, son of Mary, clear proofs and supported him with the holy spirit.[33] Why is it that every time a messenger comes to you ˹Israelites˺ with something you do not like, you become arrogant, rejecting some and killing others?
verses.translation: Indeed, We gave Moses the Book and sent after him successive messengers. And We gave Jesus, son of Mary, clear proofs and supported him with the holy spirit.[33] Why is it that every time a messenger comes to you ˹Israelites˺ with something you do not like, you become arrogant, rejecting some and killing others?

verses.text: They say, “Our hearts are unreceptive!”[34] In fact, Allah has condemned them for their disbelief. They have but little faith. Rejecting the Quran
verses.translation: They say, “Our hearts are unreceptive!”[34] In fact, Allah has condemned them for their disbelief. They have but little faith. Rejecting the Quran

verses.text: Although they used to pray for victory ˹by means of the Prophet˺ over the polytheists,[35] when there came to them a Book from Allah which they recognized,[36] confirming the Scripture they had ˹in their hands˺, they rejected it. So may Allah’s condemnation be upon the disbelievers.
verses.translation: Although they used to pray for victory ˹by means of the Prophet˺ over the polytheists,[35] when there came to them a Book from Allah which they recognized,[36] confirming the Scripture they had ˹in their hands˺, they rejected it. So may Allah’s condemnation be upon the disbelievers.

verses.text: Miserable is the price they have sold their souls for—denying Allah’s revelation and resenting Allah for granting His grace to whoever He wills of His servants! They have earned wrath upon wrath. And such disbelievers will suffer a humiliating punishment. Excuse for Rejecting the Quran
verses.translation: Miserable is the price they have sold their souls for—denying Allah’s revelation and resenting Allah for granting His grace to whoever He wills of His servants! They have earned wrath upon wrath. And such disbelievers will suffer a humiliating punishment. Excuse for Rejecting the Quran

verses.text: When it is said to them: “Believe in what Allah has revealed,” they reply, “We only believe in what was sent down to us,” and they deny what came afterwards, though it is the truth confirming their own Scriptures! Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Why then did you kill Allah’s prophets before, if you are ˹truly˺ believers?” Moses Was Defied Too
verses.translation: When it is said to them: “Believe in what Allah has revealed,” they reply, “We only believe in what was sent down to us,” and they deny what came afterwards, though it is the truth confirming their own Scriptures! Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Why then did you kill Allah’s prophets before, if you are ˹truly˺ believers?” Moses Was Defied Too

verses.text: Indeed, Moses came to you with clear proofs, then you worshipped the calf in his absence, acting wrongfully.
verses.translation: Indeed, Moses came to you with clear proofs, then you worshipped the calf in his absence, acting wrongfully.

verses.text: And when We took your covenant and raised the mountain above you ˹saying˺, “Hold firmly to that ˹Scripture˺ which We have given you and obey,” they answered, “We hear and disobey.” The love of the calf was rooted in their hearts because of their disbelief. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “How evil is what your ˹so-called˺ belief prompts you to do, if you ˹actually˺ believe ˹in the Torah˺!” Clinging to Life
verses.translation: And when We took your covenant and raised the mountain above you ˹saying˺, “Hold firmly to that ˹Scripture˺ which We have given you and obey,” they answered, “We hear and disobey.” The love of the calf was rooted in their hearts because of their disbelief. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “How evil is what your ˹so-called˺ belief prompts you to do, if you ˹actually˺ believe ˹in the Torah˺!” Clinging to Life

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “If the ˹eternal˺ Home of the Hereafter with Allah is exclusively for you ˹Israelites˺ out of all humanity, then wish for death if what you say is true!”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “If the ˹eternal˺ Home of the Hereafter with Allah is exclusively for you ˹Israelites˺ out of all humanity, then wish for death if what you say is true!”

verses.text: But they will never wish for that because of what their hands have done.[37] And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of the wrongdoers.
verses.translation: But they will never wish for that because of what their hands have done.[37] And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of the wrongdoers.

verses.text: You will surely find them clinging to life more eagerly than any other people, even more than polytheists. Each one of them wishes to live a thousand years. But even if they were to live that long, it would not save them from the punishment. And Allah is All-Seeing of what they do. Rejecting the Truth
verses.translation: You will surely find them clinging to life more eagerly than any other people, even more than polytheists. Each one of them wishes to live a thousand years. But even if they were to live that long, it would not save them from the punishment. And Allah is All-Seeing of what they do. Rejecting the Truth

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Whoever is an enemy of Gabriel should know that he revealed this ˹Quran˺ to your heart by Allah’s Will, confirming what came before it—a guide and good news for the believers.”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Whoever is an enemy of Gabriel should know that he revealed this ˹Quran˺ to your heart by Allah’s Will, confirming what came before it—a guide and good news for the believers.”

verses.text: Whoever is an enemy of Allah, His angels, His messengers, Gabriel, and Michael, then ˹let them know that˺ Allah is certainly the enemy of the disbelievers.
verses.translation: Whoever is an enemy of Allah, His angels, His messengers, Gabriel, and Michael, then ˹let them know that˺ Allah is certainly the enemy of the disbelievers.

verses.text: Indeed, We have sent down to you ˹O Prophet˺ clear revelations. ˹But˺ none will deny them except the rebellious.
verses.translation: Indeed, We have sent down to you ˹O Prophet˺ clear revelations. ˹But˺ none will deny them except the rebellious.

verses.text: Why is it that every time they make a covenant, a group of them casts it aside? In fact, most of them do not believe.
verses.translation: Why is it that every time they make a covenant, a group of them casts it aside? In fact, most of them do not believe.

verses.text: Now, when a messenger from Allah has come to them— confirming their own Scriptures—some of the People of the Book cast the Book of Allah behind their backs as if they did not know. Attachment to Magic
verses.translation: Now, when a messenger from Allah has come to them— confirming their own Scriptures—some of the People of the Book cast the Book of Allah behind their backs as if they did not know. Attachment to Magic

verses.text: They ˹instead˺ followed the magic promoted by the devils during the reign of Solomon. Never did Solomon disbelieve, rather the devils disbelieved. They taught magic to the people, along with what had been revealed to the two angels, Hârût and Mârût, in Babylon.[38] The two angels never taught anyone without saying, “We are only a test ˹for you˺, so do not abandon ˹your˺ faith.” Yet people learned ˹magic˺ that caused a rift ˹even˺ between husband and wife; although their magic could not harm anyone except by Allah’s Will. They learned what harmed them and did not benefit them—although they already knew that whoever buys into magic would have no share in the Hereafter. Miserable indeed was the price for which they sold their souls, if only they knew!
verses.translation: They ˹instead˺ followed the magic promoted by the devils during the reign of Solomon. Never did Solomon disbelieve, rather the devils disbelieved. They taught magic to the people, along with what had been revealed to the two angels, Hârût and Mârût, in Babylon.[38] The two angels never taught anyone without saying, “We are only a test ˹for you˺, so do not abandon ˹your˺ faith.” Yet people learned ˹magic˺ that caused a rift ˹even˺ between husband and wife; although their magic could not harm anyone except by Allah’s Will. They learned what harmed them and did not benefit them—although they already knew that whoever buys into magic would have no share in the Hereafter. Miserable indeed was the price for which they sold their souls, if only they knew!

verses.text: If only they were faithful and mindful ˹of Allah˺, there would have been a better reward from Allah, if only they knew! Advice for the Believers
verses.translation: If only they were faithful and mindful ˹of Allah˺, there would have been a better reward from Allah, if only they knew! Advice for the Believers

verses.text: O believers! Do not say, “Râ’ina.” [Herd us!] But say, “Un ẓurna,” [Tend to us!] and listen ˹attentively˺.[39] And the disbelievers will suffer a painful punishment.
verses.translation: O believers! Do not say, “Râ’ina.” [Herd us!] But say, “Un ẓurna,” [Tend to us!] and listen ˹attentively˺.[39] And the disbelievers will suffer a painful punishment.

verses.text: The disbelievers from the People of the Book and the polytheists would not want you to receive any blessing from your Lord, but Allah selects whoever He wills for His mercy. And Allah is the Lord of infinite bounty. Obeying the Messenger
verses.translation: The disbelievers from the People of the Book and the polytheists would not want you to receive any blessing from your Lord, but Allah selects whoever He wills for His mercy. And Allah is the Lord of infinite bounty. Obeying the Messenger

verses.text: If We ever abrogate[40] a verse or cause it to be forgotten, We replace it with a better or similar one. Do you not know that Allah is Most Capable of everything?
verses.translation: If We ever abrogate[40] a verse or cause it to be forgotten, We replace it with a better or similar one. Do you not know that Allah is Most Capable of everything?

verses.text: Do you not know that the kingdom of the heavens and the earth belongs ˹only˺ to Allah, and you have no guardian or helper besides Allah?
verses.translation: Do you not know that the kingdom of the heavens and the earth belongs ˹only˺ to Allah, and you have no guardian or helper besides Allah?

verses.text: Or do you ˹believers˺ intend to ask of your Messenger as Moses was asked before?[41] But whoever trades belief for disbelief has truly strayed from the Right Way. Adhering to the Straight Path
verses.translation: Or do you ˹believers˺ intend to ask of your Messenger as Moses was asked before?[41] But whoever trades belief for disbelief has truly strayed from the Right Way. Adhering to the Straight Path

verses.text: Many among the People of the Book wish they could turn you ˹believers˺ back to disbelief because of their envy, after the truth has been made clear to them. Pardon and bear with them until Allah delivers His decision. Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything.
verses.translation: Many among the People of the Book wish they could turn you ˹believers˺ back to disbelief because of their envy, after the truth has been made clear to them. Pardon and bear with them until Allah delivers His decision. Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything.

verses.text: Establish prayer, and pay alms-tax. Whatever good you send forth for yourselves, you will ˹certainly˺ find ˹its reward˺ with Allah. Surely Allah is All-Seeing of what you do. Claims and Refutations
verses.translation: Establish prayer, and pay alms-tax. Whatever good you send forth for yourselves, you will ˹certainly˺ find ˹its reward˺ with Allah. Surely Allah is All-Seeing of what you do. Claims and Refutations

verses.text: The Jews and Christians each claim that none will enter Paradise except those of their own faith. These are their desires. Reply, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Show ˹me˺ your proof if what you say is true.”
verses.translation: The Jews and Christians each claim that none will enter Paradise except those of their own faith. These are their desires. Reply, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Show ˹me˺ your proof if what you say is true.”

verses.text: But no! Whoever submits themselves to Allah and does good will have their reward with their Lord. And there will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve.
verses.translation: But no! Whoever submits themselves to Allah and does good will have their reward with their Lord. And there will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve.

verses.text: The Jews say, “The Christians have nothing to stand on” and the Christians say, “The Jews have nothing to stand on,” although both recite the Scriptures. And those ˹pagans˺ who have no knowledge say the same ˹about people of faith˺. Surely Allah will judge between them on the Day of Judgment regarding their dispute. Condemning Attacks on Places of Worship
verses.translation: The Jews say, “The Christians have nothing to stand on” and the Christians say, “The Jews have nothing to stand on,” although both recite the Scriptures. And those ˹pagans˺ who have no knowledge say the same ˹about people of faith˺. Surely Allah will judge between them on the Day of Judgment regarding their dispute. Condemning Attacks on Places of Worship

verses.text: Who does more wrong than those who prevent Allah’s Name from being mentioned in His places of worship and strive to destroy them? Such people have no right to enter these places except with fear.[42] For them there is disgrace in this world, and they will suffer a tremendous punishment in the Hereafter.
verses.translation: Who does more wrong than those who prevent Allah’s Name from being mentioned in His places of worship and strive to destroy them? Such people have no right to enter these places except with fear.[42] For them there is disgrace in this world, and they will suffer a tremendous punishment in the Hereafter.

verses.text: To Allah belong the east and the west, so wherever you turn you are facing ˹towards˺ Allah.[43] Surely Allah is All- Encompassing,[44] All-Knowing. Allah is in No Need of Children
verses.translation: To Allah belong the east and the west, so wherever you turn you are facing ˹towards˺ Allah.[43] Surely Allah is All- Encompassing,[44] All-Knowing. Allah is in No Need of Children

verses.text: They[45] say, “Allah has offspring.”[46] Glory be to Him! In fact, to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth—all are subject to His Will.
verses.translation: They[45] say, “Allah has offspring.”[46] Glory be to Him! In fact, to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth—all are subject to His Will.

verses.text: ˹He is˺ the Originator of the heavens and the earth! When He decrees a matter, He simply tells it, “Be!” And it is! True Guidance
verses.translation: ˹He is˺ the Originator of the heavens and the earth! When He decrees a matter, He simply tells it, “Be!” And it is! True Guidance

verses.text: Those who have no knowledge say, “If only Allah would speak to us or a sign would come to us!” The same was said by those who came before. Their hearts are all alike. Indeed, We have made the signs clear for people of sure faith.
verses.translation: Those who have no knowledge say, “If only Allah would speak to us or a sign would come to us!” The same was said by those who came before. Their hearts are all alike. Indeed, We have made the signs clear for people of sure faith.

verses.text: We have surely sent you with the truth ˹O Prophet˺ as a deliverer of good news and a warner. And you will not be accountable for the residents of the Hellfire.
verses.translation: We have surely sent you with the truth ˹O Prophet˺ as a deliverer of good news and a warner. And you will not be accountable for the residents of the Hellfire.

verses.text: Never will the Jews or Christians be pleased with you, until you follow their faith. Say, “Allah’s guidance is the only ˹true˺ guidance.” And if you were to follow their desires after ˹all˺ the knowledge that has come to you, there would be none to protect or help you against Allah.
verses.translation: Never will the Jews or Christians be pleased with you, until you follow their faith. Say, “Allah’s guidance is the only ˹true˺ guidance.” And if you were to follow their desires after ˹all˺ the knowledge that has come to you, there would be none to protect or help you against Allah.

verses.text: Those We have given the Book follow it as it should be followed. It is they who ˹truly˺ believe in it. As for those who reject it, it is they who are the losers. Reminder of Favours upon the Israelites
verses.translation: Those We have given the Book follow it as it should be followed. It is they who ˹truly˺ believe in it. As for those who reject it, it is they who are the losers. Reminder of Favours upon the Israelites

verses.text: O Children of Israel! Remember My favours upon you and how I honoured you above the others.
verses.translation: O Children of Israel! Remember My favours upon you and how I honoured you above the others.

verses.text: And guard yourselves against the Day when no soul will be of any help to another. No ransom will be taken, no intercession accepted, and no help will be given. Abraham in Mecca
verses.translation: And guard yourselves against the Day when no soul will be of any help to another. No ransom will be taken, no intercession accepted, and no help will be given. Abraham in Mecca

verses.text: ˹Remember˺ when Abraham was tested by his Lord with ˹certain˺ commandments, which he fulfilled. Allah said, “I will certainly make you into a role model for the people.” Abraham asked, “What about my offspring?” Allah replied, “My covenant is not extended to the wrongdoers.”
verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when Abraham was tested by his Lord with ˹certain˺ commandments, which he fulfilled. Allah said, “I will certainly make you into a role model for the people.” Abraham asked, “What about my offspring?” Allah replied, “My covenant is not extended to the wrongdoers.”

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when We made the Sacred House[47] a centre and a sanctuary for the people ˹saying˺, “˹You may˺ take the standing-place of Abraham[48] as a site of prayer.” And We entrusted Abraham and Ishmael to purify My House for those who circle it, who meditate in it, and who bow and prostrate themselves ˹in prayer˺. Abraham’s Prayers
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when We made the Sacred House[47] a centre and a sanctuary for the people ˹saying˺, “˹You may˺ take the standing-place of Abraham[48] as a site of prayer.” And We entrusted Abraham and Ishmael to purify My House for those who circle it, who meditate in it, and who bow and prostrate themselves ˹in prayer˺. Abraham’s Prayers

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when Abraham said, “My Lord, make this city ˹of Mecca˺ secure and provide fruits to its people—those among them who believe in Allah and the Last Day.” He answered, “As for those who disbelieve, I will let them enjoy themselves for a little while, then I will condemn them to the torment of the Fire. What an evil destination!” Raising the Foundation of the Sacred House
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when Abraham said, “My Lord, make this city ˹of Mecca˺ secure and provide fruits to its people—those among them who believe in Allah and the Last Day.” He answered, “As for those who disbelieve, I will let them enjoy themselves for a little while, then I will condemn them to the torment of the Fire. What an evil destination!” Raising the Foundation of the Sacred House

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when Abraham raised the foundation of the House with Ishmael, ˹both praying,˺ “Our Lord! Accept ˹this˺ from us. You are indeed the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when Abraham raised the foundation of the House with Ishmael, ˹both praying,˺ “Our Lord! Accept ˹this˺ from us. You are indeed the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

verses.text: Our Lord! Make us both ˹fully˺ submit to You[49] and from our descendants a nation that will submit to you. Show us our rituals, and turn to us in grace. You are truly the Accepter of Repentance, Most Merciful.
verses.translation: Our Lord! Make us both ˹fully˺ submit to You[49] and from our descendants a nation that will submit to you. Show us our rituals, and turn to us in grace. You are truly the Accepter of Repentance, Most Merciful.

verses.text: Our Lord! Raise from among them a messenger who will recite to them Your revelations, teach them the Book and wisdom, and purify them. Indeed, You ˹alone˺ are the Almighty, All- Wise.” One God
verses.translation: Our Lord! Raise from among them a messenger who will recite to them Your revelations, teach them the Book and wisdom, and purify them. Indeed, You ˹alone˺ are the Almighty, All- Wise.” One God

verses.text: And who would reject the faith of Abraham except a fool! We certainly chose him in this life, and in the Hereafter he will surely be among the righteous.
verses.translation: And who would reject the faith of Abraham except a fool! We certainly chose him in this life, and in the Hereafter he will surely be among the righteous.

verses.text: When his Lord ordered him, “Submit ˹to My Will˺,” he responded, “I submit to the Lord of all worlds.”
verses.translation: When his Lord ordered him, “Submit ˹to My Will˺,” he responded, “I submit to the Lord of all worlds.”

verses.text: This was the advice of Abraham—as well as Jacob—to his children, ˹saying˺, “Indeed, Allah has chosen for you this faith; so do not die except in ˹a state of full˺ submission.”
verses.translation: This was the advice of Abraham—as well as Jacob—to his children, ˹saying˺, “Indeed, Allah has chosen for you this faith; so do not die except in ˹a state of full˺ submission.”

verses.text: Or did you witness when death came to Jacob? He asked his children, “Who will you worship after my passing?” They replied, “We will ˹continue to˺ worship your God, the God of your forefathers— Abraham, Ishmael, and Isaac—the One God. And to Him we ˹all˺ submit.”
verses.translation: Or did you witness when death came to Jacob? He asked his children, “Who will you worship after my passing?” They replied, “We will ˹continue to˺ worship your God, the God of your forefathers— Abraham, Ishmael, and Isaac—the One God. And to Him we ˹all˺ submit.”

verses.text: That was a community that had already gone before. For them is what they earned and for you is what you have earned. And you will not be accountable for what they have done. Prophets of Islam
verses.translation: That was a community that had already gone before. For them is what they earned and for you is what you have earned. And you will not be accountable for what they have done. Prophets of Islam

verses.text: The Jews and Christians each say, “Follow our faith to be ˹rightly˺ guided.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “No! We follow the faith of Abraham, the upright—who was not a polytheist.”
verses.translation: The Jews and Christians each say, “Follow our faith to be ˹rightly˺ guided.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “No! We follow the faith of Abraham, the upright—who was not a polytheist.”

verses.text: Say, ˹O believers,˺ “We believe in Allah and what has been revealed to us; and what was revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and his descendants; and what was given to Moses, Jesus, and other prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them. And to Allah we all submit.”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O believers,˺ “We believe in Allah and what has been revealed to us; and what was revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and his descendants; and what was given to Moses, Jesus, and other prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them. And to Allah we all submit.”

verses.text: So if they believe in what you believe, then they will indeed be ˹rightly˺ guided. But if they turn away, they are simply opposed ˹to the truth˺. But Allah will spare you their evil. For He is the All-Hearing, All-Knowing. Many Messengers; One Message
verses.translation: So if they believe in what you believe, then they will indeed be ˹rightly˺ guided. But if they turn away, they are simply opposed ˹to the truth˺. But Allah will spare you their evil. For He is the All-Hearing, All-Knowing. Many Messengers; One Message

verses.text: This is the ˹natural˺ Way of Allah. And who is better than Allah in ordaining a way? And we worship ˹none but˺ Him.
verses.translation: This is the ˹natural˺ Way of Allah. And who is better than Allah in ordaining a way? And we worship ˹none but˺ Him.

verses.text: Say, “Would you dispute with us about Allah, while He is our Lord and your Lord? We are accountable for our deeds and you for yours. And we are devoted to Him ˹alone˺.
verses.translation: Say, “Would you dispute with us about Allah, while He is our Lord and your Lord? We are accountable for our deeds and you for yours. And we are devoted to Him ˹alone˺.

verses.text: Or do you claim that Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and his descendants were all Jews or Christians?” Say, “Who is more knowledgeable: you or Allah?” Who does more wrong than those who hide the testimony they received from Allah? And Allah is never unaware of what you do.
verses.translation: Or do you claim that Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and his descendants were all Jews or Christians?” Say, “Who is more knowledgeable: you or Allah?” Who does more wrong than those who hide the testimony they received from Allah? And Allah is never unaware of what you do.

verses.text: That was a community that had already gone before. For them is what they earned and for you is what you have earned. And you will not be accountable for what they have done. New Direction of Prayer
verses.translation: That was a community that had already gone before. For them is what they earned and for you is what you have earned. And you will not be accountable for what they have done. New Direction of Prayer

verses.text: The foolish among the people will ask, “Why did they turn away from the direction of prayer they used to face?”[50] Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “The east and west belong ˹only˺ to Allah. He guides whoever He wills to the Straight Path.”
verses.translation: The foolish among the people will ask, “Why did they turn away from the direction of prayer they used to face?”[50] Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “The east and west belong ˹only˺ to Allah. He guides whoever He wills to the Straight Path.”

verses.text: And so We have made you ˹believers˺ an upright[51] community so that you may be witnesses over humanity and that the Messenger may be a witness over you. We assigned your former direction of prayer only to distinguish those who would remain faithful to the Messenger from those who would lose faith. It was certainly a difficult test except for those ˹rightly˺ guided by Allah. And Allah would never discount your ˹previous acts of˺ faith. Surely Allah is Ever Gracious and Most Merciful to humanity. Order to Face Mecca in Prayer
verses.translation: And so We have made you ˹believers˺ an upright[51] community so that you may be witnesses over humanity and that the Messenger may be a witness over you. We assigned your former direction of prayer only to distinguish those who would remain faithful to the Messenger from those who would lose faith. It was certainly a difficult test except for those ˹rightly˺ guided by Allah. And Allah would never discount your ˹previous acts of˺ faith. Surely Allah is Ever Gracious and Most Merciful to humanity. Order to Face Mecca in Prayer

verses.text: Indeed, We see you ˹O Prophet˺ turning your face towards heaven. Now We will make you turn towards a direction ˹of prayer˺ that will please you. So turn your face towards the Sacred Mosque ˹in Mecca˺—wherever you are, turn your faces towards it. Those who were given the Scripture certainly know this to be the truth from their Lord. And Allah is never unaware of what they do.
verses.translation: Indeed, We see you ˹O Prophet˺ turning your face towards heaven. Now We will make you turn towards a direction ˹of prayer˺ that will please you. So turn your face towards the Sacred Mosque ˹in Mecca˺—wherever you are, turn your faces towards it. Those who were given the Scripture certainly know this to be the truth from their Lord. And Allah is never unaware of what they do.

verses.text: Even if you were to bring every proof to the People of the Book, they would not accept your direction ˹of prayer˺, nor would you accept theirs; nor would any of them accept the direction ˹of prayer˺ of another. And if you were to follow their desires after ˹all˺ the knowledge that has come to you, then you would certainly be one of the wrongdoers. The Truth About the Prophet
verses.translation: Even if you were to bring every proof to the People of the Book, they would not accept your direction ˹of prayer˺, nor would you accept theirs; nor would any of them accept the direction ˹of prayer˺ of another. And if you were to follow their desires after ˹all˺ the knowledge that has come to you, then you would certainly be one of the wrongdoers. The Truth About the Prophet

verses.text: Those We have given the Scripture recognize this ˹Prophet˺ as they recognize their own children. Yet a group of them hides the truth knowingly.
verses.translation: Those We have given the Scripture recognize this ˹Prophet˺ as they recognize their own children. Yet a group of them hides the truth knowingly.

verses.text: ˹This is˺ the truth from your Lord, so do not ever be one of those who doubt.
verses.translation: ˹This is˺ the truth from your Lord, so do not ever be one of those who doubt.

verses.text: Everyone turns to their own direction ˹of prayer˺. So compete with one another in doing good. Wherever you are, Allah will bring you all together ˹for judgment˺. Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything. Order to Face the Sacred Mosque
verses.translation: Everyone turns to their own direction ˹of prayer˺. So compete with one another in doing good. Wherever you are, Allah will bring you all together ˹for judgment˺. Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything. Order to Face the Sacred Mosque

verses.text: Wherever you are ˹O Prophet˺, turn your face towards the Sacred Mosque. This is certainly the truth from your Lord. And Allah is never unaware of what you ˹all˺ do.
verses.translation: Wherever you are ˹O Prophet˺, turn your face towards the Sacred Mosque. This is certainly the truth from your Lord. And Allah is never unaware of what you ˹all˺ do.

verses.text: Wherever you are ˹O Prophet˺, turn your face towards the Sacred Mosque. And wherever you ˹believers˺ are, face towards it, so that people will have no argument against you, except the wrongdoers among them. Do not fear them; fear Me, so that I may ˹continue to˺ perfect My favour upon you and so you may be ˹rightly˺ guided. Allah’s Favour upon the Believers
verses.translation: Wherever you are ˹O Prophet˺, turn your face towards the Sacred Mosque. And wherever you ˹believers˺ are, face towards it, so that people will have no argument against you, except the wrongdoers among them. Do not fear them; fear Me, so that I may ˹continue to˺ perfect My favour upon you and so you may be ˹rightly˺ guided. Allah’s Favour upon the Believers

verses.text: Since We have sent you a messenger from among yourselves—reciting to you Our revelations, purifying you, teaching you the Book and wisdom, and teaching you what you never knew—
verses.translation: Since We have sent you a messenger from among yourselves—reciting to you Our revelations, purifying you, teaching you the Book and wisdom, and teaching you what you never knew—

verses.text: remember Me; I will remember you. And thank Me, and never be ungrateful. Patience in Difficult Times
verses.translation: remember Me; I will remember you. And thank Me, and never be ungrateful. Patience in Difficult Times

verses.text: O believers! Seek comfort in patience and prayer. Allah is truly with those who are patient.
verses.translation: O believers! Seek comfort in patience and prayer. Allah is truly with those who are patient.

verses.text: Never say that those martyred in the cause of Allah are dead—in fact, they are alive! But you do not perceive it.
verses.translation: Never say that those martyred in the cause of Allah are dead—in fact, they are alive! But you do not perceive it.

verses.text: We will certainly test you with a touch of fear and famine and loss of property, life, and crops. Give good news to those who patiently endure—
verses.translation: We will certainly test you with a touch of fear and famine and loss of property, life, and crops. Give good news to those who patiently endure—

verses.text: who, when faced with a disaster, say, “Surely to Allah we belong and to Him we will ˹all˺ return.”
verses.translation: who, when faced with a disaster, say, “Surely to Allah we belong and to Him we will ˹all˺ return.”

verses.text: They are the ones who will receive Allah’s blessings and mercy. And it is they who are ˹rightly˺ guided. A Pilgrimage Ritual
verses.translation: They are the ones who will receive Allah’s blessings and mercy. And it is they who are ˹rightly˺ guided. A Pilgrimage Ritual

verses.text: Indeed, ˹the hills of˺ Ṣafa and Marwah[52] are among the symbols of Allah. So whoever performs the pilgrimage or minor pilgrimage,[53] let them walk between ˹the two hills˺. And whoever does good willingly, Allah is truly Appreciative, All-Knowing. Warning to the Disbelievers
verses.translation: Indeed, ˹the hills of˺ Ṣafa and Marwah[52] are among the symbols of Allah. So whoever performs the pilgrimage or minor pilgrimage,[53] let them walk between ˹the two hills˺. And whoever does good willingly, Allah is truly Appreciative, All-Knowing. Warning to the Disbelievers

verses.text: Those who hide the clear proofs and guidance that We have revealed— after We made it clear for humanity in the Book—will be condemned by Allah and ˹all˺ those who condemn.
verses.translation: Those who hide the clear proofs and guidance that We have revealed— after We made it clear for humanity in the Book—will be condemned by Allah and ˹all˺ those who condemn.

verses.text: As for those who repent, mend their ways, and let the truth be known, they are the ones to whom I will turn ˹in forgiveness˺, for I am the Accepter of Repentance, Most Merciful.
verses.translation: As for those who repent, mend their ways, and let the truth be known, they are the ones to whom I will turn ˹in forgiveness˺, for I am the Accepter of Repentance, Most Merciful.

verses.text: Surely those who disbelieve and die as disbelievers are condemned by Allah, the angels, and all of humanity.
verses.translation: Surely those who disbelieve and die as disbelievers are condemned by Allah, the angels, and all of humanity.

verses.text: They will be in Hell forever. Their punishment will not be lightened, nor will they be delayed ˹from it˺. Allah’s Great Signs
verses.translation: They will be in Hell forever. Their punishment will not be lightened, nor will they be delayed ˹from it˺. Allah’s Great Signs

verses.text: Your God is ˹only˺ One God. There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
verses.translation: Your God is ˹only˺ One God. There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.

verses.text: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth; the alternation of the day and the night; the ships that sail the sea for the benefit of humanity; the rain sent down by Allah from the skies, reviving the earth after its death; the scattering of all kinds of creatures throughout; the shifting of the winds; and the clouds drifting between the heavens and the earth—˹in all of this˺ are surely signs for people of understanding. Associating Others with Allah
verses.translation: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth; the alternation of the day and the night; the ships that sail the sea for the benefit of humanity; the rain sent down by Allah from the skies, reviving the earth after its death; the scattering of all kinds of creatures throughout; the shifting of the winds; and the clouds drifting between the heavens and the earth—˹in all of this˺ are surely signs for people of understanding. Associating Others with Allah

verses.text: Still there are some who take others as Allah’s equal—they love them as they should love Allah—but the ˹true˺ believers love Allah even more. If only the wrongdoers could see the ˹horrible˺ punishment ˹awaiting them˺, they would certainly realize that all power belongs to Allah and that Allah is indeed severe in punishment. Losers Disowning Each Other
verses.translation: Still there are some who take others as Allah’s equal—they love them as they should love Allah—but the ˹true˺ believers love Allah even more. If only the wrongdoers could see the ˹horrible˺ punishment ˹awaiting them˺, they would certainly realize that all power belongs to Allah and that Allah is indeed severe in punishment. Losers Disowning Each Other

verses.text: ˹Consider the Day˺ when those who misled others will disown their followers—when they face the torment—and the bonds that united them will be cut off.
verses.translation: ˹Consider the Day˺ when those who misled others will disown their followers—when they face the torment—and the bonds that united them will be cut off.

verses.text: The ˹misled˺ followers will cry, “If only we could have a second chance, we would disown them as they disowned us.” And so Allah will make them remorseful of their misdeeds. And they will never ˹be able to˺ leave the Fire. Warning Against Satan
verses.translation: The ˹misled˺ followers will cry, “If only we could have a second chance, we would disown them as they disowned us.” And so Allah will make them remorseful of their misdeeds. And they will never ˹be able to˺ leave the Fire. Warning Against Satan

verses.text: O humanity! Eat from what is lawful and good on the earth and do not follow Satan’s footsteps. He is truly your sworn enemy.
verses.translation: O humanity! Eat from what is lawful and good on the earth and do not follow Satan’s footsteps. He is truly your sworn enemy.

verses.text: He only incites you to commit evil and indecency, and to claim against Allah what you do not know. Blind Following
verses.translation: He only incites you to commit evil and indecency, and to claim against Allah what you do not know. Blind Following

verses.text: When it is said to them, “Follow what Allah has revealed,” they reply, “No! We ˹only˺ follow what we found our forefathers practicing.” ˹Would they still do so,˺ even if their forefathers had ˹absolutely˺ no understanding or guidance? Example of the Disbelievers
verses.translation: When it is said to them, “Follow what Allah has revealed,” they reply, “No! We ˹only˺ follow what we found our forefathers practicing.” ˹Would they still do so,˺ even if their forefathers had ˹absolutely˺ no understanding or guidance? Example of the Disbelievers

verses.text: The example of the disbelievers ˹not responding to the Messenger’s warning˺ is like a flock not comprehending the calls and cries of the shepherd. ˹They are wilfully˺ deaf, dumb and blind so they have no understanding. Forbidden Foods
verses.translation: The example of the disbelievers ˹not responding to the Messenger’s warning˺ is like a flock not comprehending the calls and cries of the shepherd. ˹They are wilfully˺ deaf, dumb and blind so they have no understanding. Forbidden Foods

verses.text: O believers! Eat from the good things We have provided for you. And give thanks to Allah if you ˹truly˺ worship Him ˹alone˺.
verses.translation: O believers! Eat from the good things We have provided for you. And give thanks to Allah if you ˹truly˺ worship Him ˹alone˺.

verses.text: He has only forbidden you ˹to eat˺ carrion, blood, swine,[54] and what is slaughtered in the name of any other than Allah. But if someone is compelled by necessity —neither driven by desire nor exceeding immediate need—they will not be sinful. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Hiding the Truth
verses.translation: He has only forbidden you ˹to eat˺ carrion, blood, swine,[54] and what is slaughtered in the name of any other than Allah. But if someone is compelled by necessity —neither driven by desire nor exceeding immediate need—they will not be sinful. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Hiding the Truth

verses.text: Indeed, those who hide Allah’s revelations, trading them for a fleeting gain consume nothing but fire into their bellies. Allah will neither speak to them on the Day of Judgment, nor will He purify them. And they will suffer a painful punishment.
verses.translation: Indeed, those who hide Allah’s revelations, trading them for a fleeting gain consume nothing but fire into their bellies. Allah will neither speak to them on the Day of Judgment, nor will He purify them. And they will suffer a painful punishment.

verses.text: They are the ones who trade guidance for misguidance and forgiveness for punishment. How persistent are they in pursuit of the Fire!
verses.translation: They are the ones who trade guidance for misguidance and forgiveness for punishment. How persistent are they in pursuit of the Fire!

verses.text: That is because Allah has revealed the Book in truth. And surely those who differ regarding it are totally engrossed in opposition. True Righteousness
verses.translation: That is because Allah has revealed the Book in truth. And surely those who differ regarding it are totally engrossed in opposition. True Righteousness

verses.text: Righteousness is not in turning your faces towards the east or the west. Rather, the righteous are those who believe in Allah, the Last Day, the angels, the Books, and the prophets; who give charity out of their cherished wealth to relatives, orphans, the poor, ˹needy˺ travellers, beggars, and for freeing captives; who establish prayer, pay alms-tax, and keep the pledges they make; and who are patient in times of suffering, adversity, and in ˹the heat of˺ battle. It is they who are true ˹in faith˺, and it is they who are mindful ˹of Allah˺. Law of Retaliation[55]
verses.translation: Righteousness is not in turning your faces towards the east or the west. Rather, the righteous are those who believe in Allah, the Last Day, the angels, the Books, and the prophets; who give charity out of their cherished wealth to relatives, orphans, the poor, ˹needy˺ travellers, beggars, and for freeing captives; who establish prayer, pay alms-tax, and keep the pledges they make; and who are patient in times of suffering, adversity, and in ˹the heat of˺ battle. It is they who are true ˹in faith˺, and it is they who are mindful ˹of Allah˺. Law of Retaliation[55]

verses.text: O believers! ˹The law of˺ retaliation is set for you in cases of murder— a free man for a free man, a slave for a slave, and a female for a female.[56] But if the offender is pardoned by the victim’s guardian,[57] then blood- money should be decided fairly[58] and payment should be made courteously. This is a concession and a mercy from your Lord. But whoever transgresses after that will suffer a painful punishment.
verses.translation: O believers! ˹The law of˺ retaliation is set for you in cases of murder— a free man for a free man, a slave for a slave, and a female for a female.[56] But if the offender is pardoned by the victim’s guardian,[57] then blood- money should be decided fairly[58] and payment should be made courteously. This is a concession and a mercy from your Lord. But whoever transgresses after that will suffer a painful punishment.

verses.text: There is ˹security of˺ life for you in ˹the law of˺ retaliation, O people of reason, so that you may become mindful ˹of Allah˺. Last Will and Bequests
