verses.text: Indeed, those who have the best claim to Abraham are his followers, this Prophet,[143] and the believers. And Allah is the Guardian of those who believe. Distorting the Truth
verses.translation: Indeed, those who have the best claim to Abraham are his followers, this Prophet,[143] and the believers. And Allah is the Guardian of those who believe. Distorting the Truth

verses.text: Some of the People of the Book wish to mislead you ˹believers˺. They mislead none but themselves, yet they fail to perceive it.
verses.translation: Some of the People of the Book wish to mislead you ˹believers˺. They mislead none but themselves, yet they fail to perceive it.

verses.text: O People of the Book! Why do you reject the signs of Allah while you bear witness ˹to their truth˺?
verses.translation: O People of the Book! Why do you reject the signs of Allah while you bear witness ˹to their truth˺?

verses.text: O People of the Book! Why do you mix the truth with falsehood and hide the truth knowingly? Deception Exposed
verses.translation: O People of the Book! Why do you mix the truth with falsehood and hide the truth knowingly? Deception Exposed

verses.text: A group among the People of the Book said ˹to one another˺, “Believe in what has been revealed to the believers in the morning and reject it in the evening, so they may abandon their faith.
verses.translation: A group among the People of the Book said ˹to one another˺, “Believe in what has been revealed to the believers in the morning and reject it in the evening, so they may abandon their faith.

verses.text: And only believe those who follow your religion.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Surely, ˹the only˺ true guidance is Allah’s guidance.” ˹They also said,˺ “Do not believe that someone will receive ˹revealed˺ knowledge similar to yours or argue against you before your Lord.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Indeed, all bounty is in the Hands of Allah— He grants it to whoever He wills. And Allah is All-Bountiful, All- Knowing.”
verses.translation: And only believe those who follow your religion.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Surely, ˹the only˺ true guidance is Allah’s guidance.” ˹They also said,˺ “Do not believe that someone will receive ˹revealed˺ knowledge similar to yours or argue against you before your Lord.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Indeed, all bounty is in the Hands of Allah— He grants it to whoever He wills. And Allah is All-Bountiful, All- Knowing.”

verses.text: He chooses whoever He wills to receive His mercy. And Allah is the Lord of infinite bounty. Honouring Trusts
verses.translation: He chooses whoever He wills to receive His mercy. And Allah is the Lord of infinite bounty. Honouring Trusts

verses.text: There are some among the People of the Book who, if entrusted with a stack of gold, will readily return it. Yet there are others who, if entrusted with a single coin, will not repay it unless you constantly demand it. This is because they say, “We are not accountable for ˹exploiting˺ the Gentiles.”[144] And ˹so˺ they attribute lies to Allah knowingly.
verses.translation: There are some among the People of the Book who, if entrusted with a stack of gold, will readily return it. Yet there are others who, if entrusted with a single coin, will not repay it unless you constantly demand it. This is because they say, “We are not accountable for ˹exploiting˺ the Gentiles.”[144] And ˹so˺ they attribute lies to Allah knowingly.

verses.text: Absolutely! Those who honour their trusts and shun evil—surely Allah loves those who are mindful ˹of Him˺. Breaking Allah’s Covenant
verses.translation: Absolutely! Those who honour their trusts and shun evil—surely Allah loves those who are mindful ˹of Him˺. Breaking Allah’s Covenant

verses.text: Indeed, those who trade Allah’s covenant and their oaths for a fleeting gain will have no share in the Hereafter. Allah will neither speak to them, nor look at them, nor purify them on the Day of Judgment. And they will suffer a painful punishment. Distorting the Scripture
verses.translation: Indeed, those who trade Allah’s covenant and their oaths for a fleeting gain will have no share in the Hereafter. Allah will neither speak to them, nor look at them, nor purify them on the Day of Judgment. And they will suffer a painful punishment. Distorting the Scripture

verses.text: There are some among them who distort the Book with their tongues to make you think this ˹distortion˺ is from the Book—but it is not what the Book says. They say, “It is from Allah”—but it is not from Allah. And ˹so˺ they attribute lies to Allah knowingly. Prophets Never Claim Divinity
verses.translation: There are some among them who distort the Book with their tongues to make you think this ˹distortion˺ is from the Book—but it is not what the Book says. They say, “It is from Allah”—but it is not from Allah. And ˹so˺ they attribute lies to Allah knowingly. Prophets Never Claim Divinity

verses.text: It is not appropriate for someone who Allah has blessed with the Scripture, wisdom, and prophethood to say to people, “Worship me instead of Allah.” Rather, he would say, “Be devoted to the worship of your Lord ˹alone˺”—in accordance with what these prophets read in the Scripture and what they taught.
verses.translation: It is not appropriate for someone who Allah has blessed with the Scripture, wisdom, and prophethood to say to people, “Worship me instead of Allah.” Rather, he would say, “Be devoted to the worship of your Lord ˹alone˺”—in accordance with what these prophets read in the Scripture and what they taught.

verses.text: And he would never ask you to take angels and prophets as lords. Would he ask you to disbelieve after you have submitted? Allah’s Covenant with Prophets
verses.translation: And he would never ask you to take angels and prophets as lords. Would he ask you to disbelieve after you have submitted? Allah’s Covenant with Prophets

verses.text: ˹Remember˺ when Allah made a covenant with the prophets, ˹saying,˺ “Now that I have given you the Book and wisdom, if there comes to you a messenger[145] confirming what you have, you must believe in him and support him.” He added, “Do you affirm this covenant and accept this commitment?” They said, “Yes, we do.” Allah said, “Then bear witness, and I too am a Witness.”
verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when Allah made a covenant with the prophets, ˹saying,˺ “Now that I have given you the Book and wisdom, if there comes to you a messenger[145] confirming what you have, you must believe in him and support him.” He added, “Do you affirm this covenant and accept this commitment?” They said, “Yes, we do.” Allah said, “Then bear witness, and I too am a Witness.”

verses.text: Whoever turns back after this, they will be the rebellious. Full Submission
verses.translation: Whoever turns back after this, they will be the rebellious. Full Submission

verses.text: Do they desire a way other than Allah’s—knowing that all those in the heavens and the earth submit to His Will, willingly or unwillingly, and to Him they will ˹all˺ be returned? Prophets of Islam
verses.translation: Do they desire a way other than Allah’s—knowing that all those in the heavens and the earth submit to His Will, willingly or unwillingly, and to Him they will ˹all˺ be returned? Prophets of Islam

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “We believe in Allah and what has been revealed to us and what was revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and his descendants; and what was given to Moses, Jesus, and other prophets from their Lord—we make no distinction between any of them, and to Him we ˹fully˺ submit.” The Only Way
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “We believe in Allah and what has been revealed to us and what was revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and his descendants; and what was given to Moses, Jesus, and other prophets from their Lord—we make no distinction between any of them, and to Him we ˹fully˺ submit.” The Only Way

verses.text: Whoever seeks a way other than Islam,[146] it will never be accepted from them, and in the Hereafter they will be among the losers. Deviating from the Right Path
verses.translation: Whoever seeks a way other than Islam,[146] it will never be accepted from them, and in the Hereafter they will be among the losers. Deviating from the Right Path

verses.text: How will Allah guide a people who chose to disbelieve after they had believed, acknowledged the Messenger to be true, and received clear proofs? For Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
verses.translation: How will Allah guide a people who chose to disbelieve after they had believed, acknowledged the Messenger to be true, and received clear proofs? For Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

verses.text: Their reward is that they will be condemned by Allah, the angels, and all of humanity.
verses.translation: Their reward is that they will be condemned by Allah, the angels, and all of humanity.

verses.text: They will be in Hell forever. Their punishment will not be lightened, nor will they be delayed ˹from it˺.
verses.translation: They will be in Hell forever. Their punishment will not be lightened, nor will they be delayed ˹from it˺.

verses.text: As for those who repent afterwards and mend their ways, then surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Dying in a State of Disbelief
verses.translation: As for those who repent afterwards and mend their ways, then surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Dying in a State of Disbelief

verses.text: Indeed, those who disbelieve after having believed then increase in disbelief, their repentance will never be accepted.[147] It is they who are astray.
verses.translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve after having believed then increase in disbelief, their repentance will never be accepted.[147] It is they who are astray.

verses.text: Indeed, if each of those who disbelieve then die as disbelievers were to offer a ransom of enough gold to fill the whole world, it would never be accepted from them. It is they who will suffer a painful punishment, and they will have no helpers. Righteous Giving
verses.translation: Indeed, if each of those who disbelieve then die as disbelievers were to offer a ransom of enough gold to fill the whole world, it would never be accepted from them. It is they who will suffer a painful punishment, and they will have no helpers. Righteous Giving

verses.text: You will never achieve righteousness until you donate some of what you cherish. And whatever you give is certainly well known to Allah. Jacob’s Dietary Restriction
verses.translation: You will never achieve righteousness until you donate some of what you cherish. And whatever you give is certainly well known to Allah. Jacob’s Dietary Restriction

verses.text: All food was lawful for the children of Israel, except what Israel[148] made unlawful for himself before the Torah was revealed.[149] Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Bring the Torah and read it, if your claims are true.”
verses.translation: All food was lawful for the children of Israel, except what Israel[148] made unlawful for himself before the Torah was revealed.[149] Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Bring the Torah and read it, if your claims are true.”

verses.text: Then whoever still fabricates lies about Allah, they will be the ˹true˺ wrongdoers.
verses.translation: Then whoever still fabricates lies about Allah, they will be the ˹true˺ wrongdoers.

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Allah has declared the truth. So follow the Way of Abraham, the upright—who was not a polytheist.” Pilgrimage to the Sacred House in Mecca
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Allah has declared the truth. So follow the Way of Abraham, the upright—who was not a polytheist.” Pilgrimage to the Sacred House in Mecca

verses.text: Surely the first House ˹of worship˺ established for humanity is the one at Bakkah—a blessed sanctuary and a guide for ˹all˺ people.
verses.translation: Surely the first House ˹of worship˺ established for humanity is the one at Bakkah—a blessed sanctuary and a guide for ˹all˺ people.

verses.text: In it are clear signs and the standing-place of Abraham. Whoever enters it should be safe. Pilgrimage to this House is an obligation by Allah upon whoever is able among the people.[150] And whoever disbelieves, then surely Allah is not in need of ˹any of His˺ creation. Rejecting the Truth
verses.translation: In it are clear signs and the standing-place of Abraham. Whoever enters it should be safe. Pilgrimage to this House is an obligation by Allah upon whoever is able among the people.[150] And whoever disbelieves, then surely Allah is not in need of ˹any of His˺ creation. Rejecting the Truth

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “O People of the Book! Why do you deny the revelations of Allah, when Allah is a Witness to what you do?”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “O People of the Book! Why do you deny the revelations of Allah, when Allah is a Witness to what you do?”

verses.text: Say, “O People of the Book! Why do you turn the believers away from the Way of Allah—striving to make it ˹appear˺ crooked, while you are witnesses ˹to its truth˺? And Allah is never unaware of what you do.” Warning Against Evil Influence
verses.translation: Say, “O People of the Book! Why do you turn the believers away from the Way of Allah—striving to make it ˹appear˺ crooked, while you are witnesses ˹to its truth˺? And Allah is never unaware of what you do.” Warning Against Evil Influence

verses.text: O believers! If you were to yield to a group of those who were given the Scripture, they would turn you back from belief to disbelief.
verses.translation: O believers! If you were to yield to a group of those who were given the Scripture, they would turn you back from belief to disbelief.

verses.text: How can you disbelieve when Allah’s revelations are recited to you and His Messenger is in your midst? Whoever holds firmly to Allah is surely guided to the Straight Path. Warning Against Disunity
verses.translation: How can you disbelieve when Allah’s revelations are recited to you and His Messenger is in your midst? Whoever holds firmly to Allah is surely guided to the Straight Path. Warning Against Disunity

verses.text: O believers! Be mindful of Allah in the way He deserves,[151] and do not die except in ˹a state of full˺ submission ˹to Him˺.[152]
verses.translation: O believers! Be mindful of Allah in the way He deserves,[151] and do not die except in ˹a state of full˺ submission ˹to Him˺.[152]

verses.text: And hold firmly to the rope of Allah[153] and do not be divided. Remember Allah’s favour upon you when you were enemies, then He united your hearts, so you—by His grace—became brothers. And you were at the brink of a fiery pit and He saved you from it. This is how Allah makes His revelations clear to you, so that you may be ˹rightly˺ guided.
verses.translation: And hold firmly to the rope of Allah[153] and do not be divided. Remember Allah’s favour upon you when you were enemies, then He united your hearts, so you—by His grace—became brothers. And you were at the brink of a fiery pit and He saved you from it. This is how Allah makes His revelations clear to you, so that you may be ˹rightly˺ guided.

verses.text: Let there be a group among you who call ˹others˺ to goodness, encourage what is good, and forbid what is evil—it is they who will be successful.
verses.translation: Let there be a group among you who call ˹others˺ to goodness, encourage what is good, and forbid what is evil—it is they who will be successful.

verses.text: And do not be like those who split ˹into sects˺ and differed after clear proofs had come to them. It is they who will suffer a tremendous punishment. The Joyful and the Miserable
verses.translation: And do not be like those who split ˹into sects˺ and differed after clear proofs had come to them. It is they who will suffer a tremendous punishment. The Joyful and the Miserable

verses.text: On that Day some faces will be bright while others gloomy. To the gloomy-faced it will be said, “Did you disbelieve after having believed? So taste the punishment for your disbelief.”
verses.translation: On that Day some faces will be bright while others gloomy. To the gloomy-faced it will be said, “Did you disbelieve after having believed? So taste the punishment for your disbelief.”

verses.text: As for the bright-faced, they will be in Allah’s mercy, where they will remain forever.
verses.translation: As for the bright-faced, they will be in Allah’s mercy, where they will remain forever.

verses.text: These are Allah’s revelations We recite to you ˹O Prophet˺ in truth. And Allah desires no injustice to ˹His˺ creation.
verses.translation: These are Allah’s revelations We recite to you ˹O Prophet˺ in truth. And Allah desires no injustice to ˹His˺ creation.

verses.text: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And to Allah ˹all˺ matters will be returned ˹for judgment˺. Excellence of the Muslim Nation
verses.translation: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And to Allah ˹all˺ matters will be returned ˹for judgment˺. Excellence of the Muslim Nation

verses.text: You are the best community ever raised for humanity—you encourage good, forbid evil, and believe in Allah. Had the People of the Book believed, it would have been better for them. Some of them are faithful, but most are rebellious. Reward of the Rebellious
verses.translation: You are the best community ever raised for humanity—you encourage good, forbid evil, and believe in Allah. Had the People of the Book believed, it would have been better for them. Some of them are faithful, but most are rebellious. Reward of the Rebellious

verses.text: They can never inflict harm on you, except a little annoyance.[154] But if they meet you in battle, they will flee and they will have no helpers.
verses.translation: They can never inflict harm on you, except a little annoyance.[154] But if they meet you in battle, they will flee and they will have no helpers.

verses.text: They will be stricken with disgrace wherever they go, unless they are protected by a covenant with Allah or a treaty with the people. They have invited the displeasure of Allah and have been branded with misery for rejecting Allah’s revelations and murdering ˹His˺ prophets unjustly. This is ˹a fair reward˺ for their disobedience and violations. Upright People of the Book
verses.translation: They will be stricken with disgrace wherever they go, unless they are protected by a covenant with Allah or a treaty with the people. They have invited the displeasure of Allah and have been branded with misery for rejecting Allah’s revelations and murdering ˹His˺ prophets unjustly. This is ˹a fair reward˺ for their disobedience and violations. Upright People of the Book

verses.text: Yet they are not all alike: there are some among the People of the Book who are upright, who recite Allah’s revelations throughout the night, prostrating ˹in prayer˺.
verses.translation: Yet they are not all alike: there are some among the People of the Book who are upright, who recite Allah’s revelations throughout the night, prostrating ˹in prayer˺.

verses.text: They believe in Allah and the Last Day, encourage good and forbid evil, and race with one another in doing good. They are ˹truly˺ among the righteous.
verses.translation: They believe in Allah and the Last Day, encourage good and forbid evil, and race with one another in doing good. They are ˹truly˺ among the righteous.

verses.text: They will never be denied the reward for any good they have done. And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of those mindful ˹of Him˺. Warning Against Hypocrites
verses.translation: They will never be denied the reward for any good they have done. And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of those mindful ˹of Him˺. Warning Against Hypocrites

verses.text: Indeed, neither the wealth nor children of the disbelievers will be of any benefit to them against Allah. It is they who will be the residents of the Fire. They will be there forever.
verses.translation: Indeed, neither the wealth nor children of the disbelievers will be of any benefit to them against Allah. It is they who will be the residents of the Fire. They will be there forever.

verses.text: The good they do in this worldly life is like the harvest of an evil people struck by a bitter wind, destroying it ˹completely˺. Allah never wronged them, but they wronged themselves. Association with Hypocrites
verses.translation: The good they do in this worldly life is like the harvest of an evil people struck by a bitter wind, destroying it ˹completely˺. Allah never wronged them, but they wronged themselves. Association with Hypocrites

verses.text: O believers! Do not associate closely with others who would not miss a chance to harm you. Their only desire is to see you suffer. Their prejudice has become evident from what they say—and what their hearts hide is far worse. We have made Our revelations clear to you, if only you understood.
verses.translation: O believers! Do not associate closely with others who would not miss a chance to harm you. Their only desire is to see you suffer. Their prejudice has become evident from what they say—and what their hearts hide is far worse. We have made Our revelations clear to you, if only you understood.

verses.text: Here you are! You love them but they do not love you, and you believe in all Scriptures. When they meet you they say, “We believe.” But when alone, they bite their fingertips in rage. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “˹May you˺ die of your rage!” Surely Allah knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart.
verses.translation: Here you are! You love them but they do not love you, and you believe in all Scriptures. When they meet you they say, “We believe.” But when alone, they bite their fingertips in rage. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “˹May you˺ die of your rage!” Surely Allah knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart.

verses.text: When you ˹believers˺ are touched with good, they grieve; but when you are afflicted with evil, they rejoice. ˹Yet,˺ if you are patient and mindful ˹of Allah˺, their schemes will not harm you in the least. Surely Allah is Fully Aware of what they do. The Battle of U ḥud[155]
verses.translation: When you ˹believers˺ are touched with good, they grieve; but when you are afflicted with evil, they rejoice. ˹Yet,˺ if you are patient and mindful ˹of Allah˺, their schemes will not harm you in the least. Surely Allah is Fully Aware of what they do. The Battle of U ḥud[155]

verses.text: ˹Remember, O Prophet,˺ when you left your home in the early morning to position the believers in the battlefield. And Allah is All-Hearing, All- Knowing.
verses.translation: ˹Remember, O Prophet,˺ when you left your home in the early morning to position the believers in the battlefield. And Allah is All-Hearing, All- Knowing.

verses.text: ˹Remember˺ when two groups among you ˹believers˺ were about to cower, then Allah reassured them. So in Allah let the believers put their trust. The Battle of Badr
verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when two groups among you ˹believers˺ were about to cower, then Allah reassured them. So in Allah let the believers put their trust. The Battle of Badr

verses.text: Indeed, Allah made you victorious at Badr when you were ˹vastly˺ outnumbered. So be mindful of Allah, perhaps you will be grateful.
verses.translation: Indeed, Allah made you victorious at Badr when you were ˹vastly˺ outnumbered. So be mindful of Allah, perhaps you will be grateful.

verses.text: ˹Remember, O Prophet,˺ when you said to the believers, “Is it not enough that your Lord will send down a reinforcement of three thousand angels for your aid?”
verses.translation: ˹Remember, O Prophet,˺ when you said to the believers, “Is it not enough that your Lord will send down a reinforcement of three thousand angels for your aid?”

verses.text: Most certainly, if you ˹believers˺ are firm and mindful ˹of Allah˺ and the enemy launches a sudden attack on you, Allah will reinforce you with five thousand angels designated ˹for battle˺.
verses.translation: Most certainly, if you ˹believers˺ are firm and mindful ˹of Allah˺ and the enemy launches a sudden attack on you, Allah will reinforce you with five thousand angels designated ˹for battle˺.

verses.text: Allah ordained this ˹reinforcement˺ only as good news for you and reassurance for your hearts. And victory comes only from Allah—the Almighty, All-Wise—
verses.translation: Allah ordained this ˹reinforcement˺ only as good news for you and reassurance for your hearts. And victory comes only from Allah—the Almighty, All-Wise—

verses.text: to destroy a group of the disbelievers and humble the rest, causing them to withdraw in disappointment. Allah Is the Judge
verses.translation: to destroy a group of the disbelievers and humble the rest, causing them to withdraw in disappointment. Allah Is the Judge

verses.text: You ˹O Prophet˺ have no say in the matter.[156] It is up to Allah to turn to them in mercy or punish them, for indeed they are wrongdoers.
verses.translation: You ˹O Prophet˺ have no say in the matter.[156] It is up to Allah to turn to them in mercy or punish them, for indeed they are wrongdoers.

verses.text: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. He forgives whoever He wills, and punishes whoever He wills. And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Warning Against Interest
verses.translation: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. He forgives whoever He wills, and punishes whoever He wills. And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Warning Against Interest

verses.text: O believers! Do not consume interest, multiplying it many times over. And be mindful of Allah, so you may prosper.
verses.translation: O believers! Do not consume interest, multiplying it many times over. And be mindful of Allah, so you may prosper.

verses.text: Guard yourselves against the Fire prepared for the disbelievers.
verses.translation: Guard yourselves against the Fire prepared for the disbelievers.

verses.text: Obey Allah and the Messenger, so you may be shown mercy. Reward of the Righteous
verses.translation: Obey Allah and the Messenger, so you may be shown mercy. Reward of the Righteous

verses.text: And hasten towards forgiveness from your Lord and a Paradise as vast as the heavens and the earth, prepared for those mindful ˹of Allah˺.
verses.translation: And hasten towards forgiveness from your Lord and a Paradise as vast as the heavens and the earth, prepared for those mindful ˹of Allah˺.

verses.text: ˹They are˺ those who donate in prosperity and adversity, control their anger, and pardon others. And Allah loves the good-doers.
verses.translation: ˹They are˺ those who donate in prosperity and adversity, control their anger, and pardon others. And Allah loves the good-doers.

verses.text: ˹They are˺ those who, upon committing an evil deed or wronging themselves, remember Allah and seek forgiveness and do not knowingly persist in sin—and who forgives sins except Allah?
verses.translation: ˹They are˺ those who, upon committing an evil deed or wronging themselves, remember Allah and seek forgiveness and do not knowingly persist in sin—and who forgives sins except Allah?

verses.text: Their reward is forgiveness from their Lord and Gardens under which rivers flow, staying there forever. How excellent is the reward for those who work ˹righteousness˺! Battle Between Good and Evil
verses.translation: Their reward is forgiveness from their Lord and Gardens under which rivers flow, staying there forever. How excellent is the reward for those who work ˹righteousness˺! Battle Between Good and Evil

verses.text: Similar situations came to pass before you, so travel throughout the land and see the fate of the deniers.
verses.translation: Similar situations came to pass before you, so travel throughout the land and see the fate of the deniers.

verses.text: This[157] is an insight to humanity —a guide and a lesson to the God-fearing. Reassuring the Believers
verses.translation: This[157] is an insight to humanity —a guide and a lesson to the God-fearing. Reassuring the Believers

verses.text: Do not falter or grieve, for you will have the upper hand, if you are ˹true˺ believers.
verses.translation: Do not falter or grieve, for you will have the upper hand, if you are ˹true˺ believers.

verses.text: If you have suffered injuries ˹at Uḥud˺, they suffered similarly ˹at Badr˺. We alternate these days ˹of victory and defeat˺ among people so that Allah may reveal the ˹true˺ believers, choose martyrs from among you—and Allah does not like the wrongdoers—
verses.translation: If you have suffered injuries ˹at Uḥud˺, they suffered similarly ˹at Badr˺. We alternate these days ˹of victory and defeat˺ among people so that Allah may reveal the ˹true˺ believers, choose martyrs from among you—and Allah does not like the wrongdoers—

verses.text: and distinguish the ˹true˺ believers and destroy the disbelievers. Believers Tested
verses.translation: and distinguish the ˹true˺ believers and destroy the disbelievers. Believers Tested

verses.text: Do you think you will enter Paradise without Allah proving which of you ˹truly˺ struggled ˹for His cause˺ and patiently endured?
verses.translation: Do you think you will enter Paradise without Allah proving which of you ˹truly˺ struggled ˹for His cause˺ and patiently endured?

verses.text: You certainly wished ˹for the opportunity˺ for martyrdom before encountering it, now you have seen it with your own eyes. Believers Disheartened[158]
verses.translation: You certainly wished ˹for the opportunity˺ for martyrdom before encountering it, now you have seen it with your own eyes. Believers Disheartened[158]

verses.text: Muḥammad is no more than a messenger; other messengers have gone before him. If he were to die or to be killed, would you regress into disbelief? Those who do so will not harm Allah whatsoever. And Allah will reward those who are grateful.
verses.translation: Muḥammad is no more than a messenger; other messengers have gone before him. If he were to die or to be killed, would you regress into disbelief? Those who do so will not harm Allah whatsoever. And Allah will reward those who are grateful.

verses.text: No soul can ever die without Allah’s Will at the destined time. Those who desire worldly gain, We will let them have it, and those who desire heavenly reward, We will grant it to them. And We will reward those who are grateful. Reward of the Steadfast
verses.translation: No soul can ever die without Allah’s Will at the destined time. Those who desire worldly gain, We will let them have it, and those who desire heavenly reward, We will grant it to them. And We will reward those who are grateful. Reward of the Steadfast

verses.text: ˹Imagine˺ how many devotees fought along with their prophets and never faltered despite whatever ˹losses˺ they suffered in the cause of Allah, nor did they weaken or give in! Allah loves those who persevere.
verses.translation: ˹Imagine˺ how many devotees fought along with their prophets and never faltered despite whatever ˹losses˺ they suffered in the cause of Allah, nor did they weaken or give in! Allah loves those who persevere.

verses.text: And all they said was, “Our Lord! Forgive our sins and excesses, make our steps firm, and grant us victory over the disbelieving people.”
verses.translation: And all they said was, “Our Lord! Forgive our sins and excesses, make our steps firm, and grant us victory over the disbelieving people.”

verses.text: So Allah gave them the reward of this world and the excellent reward of the Hereafter. For Allah loves the good-doers. Yielding to the Disbelievers
verses.translation: So Allah gave them the reward of this world and the excellent reward of the Hereafter. For Allah loves the good-doers. Yielding to the Disbelievers

verses.text: O believers! If you yield to the disbelievers, they will drag you back to disbelief—and you will become losers.
verses.translation: O believers! If you yield to the disbelievers, they will drag you back to disbelief—and you will become losers.

verses.text: But no! Allah is your Guardian, and He is the best Helper.
verses.translation: But no! Allah is your Guardian, and He is the best Helper.

verses.text: We will cast horror into the hearts of the disbelievers for associating ˹false gods˺ with Allah—a practice He has never authorized. The Fire will be their home—what an evil place for the wrongdoers to stay! Victory Denied at U ḥud
verses.translation: We will cast horror into the hearts of the disbelievers for associating ˹false gods˺ with Allah—a practice He has never authorized. The Fire will be their home—what an evil place for the wrongdoers to stay! Victory Denied at U ḥud

verses.text: Indeed, Allah fulfilled His promise to you when you ˹initially˺ swept them away by His Will, then your courage weakened and you disputed about the command and disobeyed,[159] after Allah had brought victory within your reach. Some of you were after worldly gain while others desired a heavenly reward. He denied you victory over them as a test, yet He has pardoned you. And Allah is Gracious to the believers. The Army Retreats
verses.translation: Indeed, Allah fulfilled His promise to you when you ˹initially˺ swept them away by His Will, then your courage weakened and you disputed about the command and disobeyed,[159] after Allah had brought victory within your reach. Some of you were after worldly gain while others desired a heavenly reward. He denied you victory over them as a test, yet He has pardoned you. And Allah is Gracious to the believers. The Army Retreats

verses.text: ˹Remember˺ when you were running far away ˹in panic˺—not looking at anyone—while the Messenger was calling to you from behind! So Allah rewarded your disobedience with distress upon distress. Now, do not grieve over the victory you were denied or the injury you suffered. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when you were running far away ˹in panic˺—not looking at anyone—while the Messenger was calling to you from behind! So Allah rewarded your disobedience with distress upon distress. Now, do not grieve over the victory you were denied or the injury you suffered. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.

verses.text: Then after distress, He sent down serenity in the form of drowsiness overcoming some of you, while others were disturbed by evil thoughts about Allah—the thoughts of ˹pre-Islamic˺ ignorance. They ask, “Do we have a say in the matter?” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “All matters are destined by Allah.” They conceal in their hearts what they do not reveal to you. They say ˹to themselves˺, “If we had any say in the matter, none of us would have come to die here.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Even if you were to remain in your homes, those among you who were destined to be killed would have met the same fate.” Through this, Allah tests what is within you and purifies what is in your hearts. And Allah knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart. The Deserters
verses.translation: Then after distress, He sent down serenity in the form of drowsiness overcoming some of you, while others were disturbed by evil thoughts about Allah—the thoughts of ˹pre-Islamic˺ ignorance. They ask, “Do we have a say in the matter?” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “All matters are destined by Allah.” They conceal in their hearts what they do not reveal to you. They say ˹to themselves˺, “If we had any say in the matter, none of us would have come to die here.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Even if you were to remain in your homes, those among you who were destined to be killed would have met the same fate.” Through this, Allah tests what is within you and purifies what is in your hearts. And Allah knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart. The Deserters

verses.text: Indeed, those ˹believers˺ who fled on the day when the two armies met were made to slip by Satan because of their misdeeds. But Allah has pardoned them. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Forbearing. It Is All Destined
verses.translation: Indeed, those ˹believers˺ who fled on the day when the two armies met were made to slip by Satan because of their misdeeds. But Allah has pardoned them. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Forbearing. It Is All Destined

verses.text: O believers! Do not be like the unfaithful[160] who say about their brothers who travel throughout the land or engage in battle, “If they had stayed with us, they would not have died or been killed.” Allah makes such thinking a cause of agony in their hearts. It is Allah who gives life and causes death. And Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.
verses.translation: O believers! Do not be like the unfaithful[160] who say about their brothers who travel throughout the land or engage in battle, “If they had stayed with us, they would not have died or been killed.” Allah makes such thinking a cause of agony in their hearts. It is Allah who gives life and causes death. And Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.

verses.text: Should you be martyred or die in the cause of Allah, then His forgiveness and mercy are far better than whatever ˹wealth˺ those ˹who stay behind˺ accumulate.
verses.translation: Should you be martyred or die in the cause of Allah, then His forgiveness and mercy are far better than whatever ˹wealth˺ those ˹who stay behind˺ accumulate.

verses.text: Whether you die or are martyred—all of you will be gathered before Allah. Prophet’s Kindness to the Believers
verses.translation: Whether you die or are martyred—all of you will be gathered before Allah. Prophet’s Kindness to the Believers

verses.text: It is out of Allah’s mercy that you ˹O Prophet˺ have been lenient with them. Had you been cruel or hard-hearted, they would have certainly abandoned you. So pardon them, ask Allah’s forgiveness for them, and consult with them in ˹conducting˺ matters. Once you make a decision, put your trust in Allah. Surely Allah loves those who trust in Him. Victory Is from Allah
verses.translation: It is out of Allah’s mercy that you ˹O Prophet˺ have been lenient with them. Had you been cruel or hard-hearted, they would have certainly abandoned you. So pardon them, ask Allah’s forgiveness for them, and consult with them in ˹conducting˺ matters. Once you make a decision, put your trust in Allah. Surely Allah loves those who trust in Him. Victory Is from Allah

verses.text: If Allah helps you, none can defeat you. But if He denies you help, then who else can help you? So in Allah let the believers put their trust. Spoils of War
verses.translation: If Allah helps you, none can defeat you. But if He denies you help, then who else can help you? So in Allah let the believers put their trust. Spoils of War

verses.text: It is not appropriate for a prophet to illegally withhold spoils of war. And whoever does so, it will be held against them on the Day of Judgment. Then every soul will be paid in full for what it has done, and none will be wronged. Good-Doers and Wrongdoers
verses.translation: It is not appropriate for a prophet to illegally withhold spoils of war. And whoever does so, it will be held against them on the Day of Judgment. Then every soul will be paid in full for what it has done, and none will be wronged. Good-Doers and Wrongdoers

verses.text: Are those who seek Allah’s pleasure like those who deserve Allah’s wrath? Hell is their home. What an evil destination!
verses.translation: Are those who seek Allah’s pleasure like those who deserve Allah’s wrath? Hell is their home. What an evil destination!

verses.text: They ˹each˺ have varying degrees in the sight of Allah. And Allah is All-Seeing of what they do. The Prophet as a Blessing
verses.translation: They ˹each˺ have varying degrees in the sight of Allah. And Allah is All-Seeing of what they do. The Prophet as a Blessing

verses.text: Indeed, Allah has done the believers a ˹great˺ favour by raising a messenger from among them—reciting to them His revelations, purifying them, and teaching them the Book and wisdom. For indeed they had previously been clearly astray. Lessons from the Battle of U ḥud
verses.translation: Indeed, Allah has done the believers a ˹great˺ favour by raising a messenger from among them—reciting to them His revelations, purifying them, and teaching them the Book and wisdom. For indeed they had previously been clearly astray. Lessons from the Battle of U ḥud

verses.text: Why is it when you suffered casualties ˹at Uḥud˺—although you had made your enemy suffer twice as much ˹at Badr˺—you protested, “How could this be?”? Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “It is because of your disobedience.” Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything.
verses.translation: Why is it when you suffered casualties ˹at Uḥud˺—although you had made your enemy suffer twice as much ˹at Badr˺—you protested, “How could this be?”? Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “It is because of your disobedience.” Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything.

verses.text: So what you suffered on the day the two armies met was by Allah’s Will, so that He might distinguish the ˹true˺ believers
verses.translation: So what you suffered on the day the two armies met was by Allah’s Will, so that He might distinguish the ˹true˺ believers

verses.text: and expose the hypocrites. When it was said to them, “Come fight in the cause of Allah or ˹at least˺ defend yourselves,” they replied, “If we had known there was fighting, we would have definitely gone with you.” They were closer to disbelief than to belief on that day—for saying with their mouths what was not in their hearts. Allah is All-Knowing of what they hide.
verses.translation: and expose the hypocrites. When it was said to them, “Come fight in the cause of Allah or ˹at least˺ defend yourselves,” they replied, “If we had known there was fighting, we would have definitely gone with you.” They were closer to disbelief than to belief on that day—for saying with their mouths what was not in their hearts. Allah is All-Knowing of what they hide.

verses.text: Those who sat at home, saying about their brothers, “Had they listened to us, they would not have been killed.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Try not to die[161] if what you say is true!” Martyrs Honoured
verses.translation: Those who sat at home, saying about their brothers, “Had they listened to us, they would not have been killed.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Try not to die[161] if what you say is true!” Martyrs Honoured

verses.text: Never think of those martyred in the cause of Allah as dead. In fact, they are alive with their Lord, well provided for—
verses.translation: Never think of those martyred in the cause of Allah as dead. In fact, they are alive with their Lord, well provided for—

verses.text: rejoicing in Allah’s bounties and being delighted for those yet to join them. There will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve.
verses.translation: rejoicing in Allah’s bounties and being delighted for those yet to join them. There will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve.

verses.text: They are joyful for receiving Allah’s grace and bounty, and that Allah does not deny the reward of the believers. Reward of the Steadfast
verses.translation: They are joyful for receiving Allah’s grace and bounty, and that Allah does not deny the reward of the believers. Reward of the Steadfast

verses.text: ˹As for˺ those who responded to the call of Allah and His Messenger after their injury,[162] those of them who did good and were mindful ˹of Allah˺ will have a great reward.
verses.translation: ˹As for˺ those who responded to the call of Allah and His Messenger after their injury,[162] those of them who did good and were mindful ˹of Allah˺ will have a great reward.

verses.text: Those who were warned, “Your enemies have mobilized their forces against you, so fear them,” the warning only made them grow stronger in faith and they replied, “Allah ˹alone˺ is sufficient ˹as an aid˺ for us and ˹He˺ is the best Protector.”
verses.translation: Those who were warned, “Your enemies have mobilized their forces against you, so fear them,” the warning only made them grow stronger in faith and they replied, “Allah ˹alone˺ is sufficient ˹as an aid˺ for us and ˹He˺ is the best Protector.”

verses.text: So they returned with Allah’s favours and grace, suffering no harm. For they sought to please Allah. And surely Allah is ˹the˺ Lord of infinite bounty.
verses.translation: So they returned with Allah’s favours and grace, suffering no harm. For they sought to please Allah. And surely Allah is ˹the˺ Lord of infinite bounty.

verses.text: That ˹warning˺ was only ˹from˺ Satan, trying to prompt you to fear his followers. [163] So do not fear them; fear Me if you are ˹true˺ believers. Disbelievers’ Delusion
verses.translation: That ˹warning˺ was only ˹from˺ Satan, trying to prompt you to fear his followers. [163] So do not fear them; fear Me if you are ˹true˺ believers. Disbelievers’ Delusion

verses.text: ˹O Prophet!˺ Do not grieve for those who race to disbelieve—surely they will not harm Allah in the least. It is Allah’s Will to disallow them a share in the Hereafter, and they will suffer a tremendous punishment.
verses.translation: ˹O Prophet!˺ Do not grieve for those who race to disbelieve—surely they will not harm Allah in the least. It is Allah’s Will to disallow them a share in the Hereafter, and they will suffer a tremendous punishment.

verses.text: Those who trade belief for disbelief will never harm Allah in the least, and they will suffer a painful punishment.
verses.translation: Those who trade belief for disbelief will never harm Allah in the least, and they will suffer a painful punishment.

verses.text: Those who disbelieve should not think that living longer is good for them. They are only given more time to increase in sin, and they will suffer a humiliating punishment. Sincerity Test
verses.translation: Those who disbelieve should not think that living longer is good for them. They are only given more time to increase in sin, and they will suffer a humiliating punishment. Sincerity Test

verses.text: Allah would not leave the believers in the condition you were in, until He distinguished the good from the evil ˹among you˺. Nor would Allah ˹directly˺ reveal to you the unseen,[164] but He chooses whoever He wills as a messenger. So believe in Allah and His messengers. And if you are faithful and mindful ˹of Allah˺, you will receive a great reward. Reward of the Stingy
verses.translation: Allah would not leave the believers in the condition you were in, until He distinguished the good from the evil ˹among you˺. Nor would Allah ˹directly˺ reveal to you the unseen,[164] but He chooses whoever He wills as a messenger. So believe in Allah and His messengers. And if you are faithful and mindful ˹of Allah˺, you will receive a great reward. Reward of the Stingy

verses.text: And do not let those who ˹greedily˺ withhold Allah’s bounties think it is good for them—in fact, it is bad for them! They will be leashed ˹by their necks˺ on the Day of Judgment with whatever ˹wealth˺ they used to withhold. And Allah is the ˹sole˺ inheritor of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do. Blasphemy Exposed
verses.translation: And do not let those who ˹greedily˺ withhold Allah’s bounties think it is good for them—in fact, it is bad for them! They will be leashed ˹by their necks˺ on the Day of Judgment with whatever ˹wealth˺ they used to withhold. And Allah is the ˹sole˺ inheritor of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do. Blasphemy Exposed

verses.text: Indeed, Allah has heard those ˹among the Jews˺ who said, “Allah is poor; we are rich!” We have certainly recorded their slurs and their killing of prophets unjustly. Then We will say, “Taste the torment of burning!
verses.translation: Indeed, Allah has heard those ˹among the Jews˺ who said, “Allah is poor; we are rich!” We have certainly recorded their slurs and their killing of prophets unjustly. Then We will say, “Taste the torment of burning!

verses.text: This is ˹the reward˺ for what your hands have done. And Allah is never unjust to ˹His˺ creation.” Rejecting Allah’s Messengers
verses.translation: This is ˹the reward˺ for what your hands have done. And Allah is never unjust to ˹His˺ creation.” Rejecting Allah’s Messengers

verses.text: Those ˹are the same people˺ who say, “Allah has commanded us not to believe in any messenger unless he brings us an offering to be consumed by fire ˹from the sky˺.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Other prophets did in fact come to you[165] before me with clear proofs and ˹even˺ what you demanded—why then did you kill them, if what you say is true?”
verses.translation: Those ˹are the same people˺ who say, “Allah has commanded us not to believe in any messenger unless he brings us an offering to be consumed by fire ˹from the sky˺.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Other prophets did in fact come to you[165] before me with clear proofs and ˹even˺ what you demanded—why then did you kill them, if what you say is true?”

verses.text: If you are rejected by them, so too were messengers before you who came with clear proofs, divine Books, and enlightening Scriptures.[166] Death Is Inevitable
verses.translation: If you are rejected by them, so too were messengers before you who came with clear proofs, divine Books, and enlightening Scriptures.[166] Death Is Inevitable

verses.text: Every soul will taste death. And you will only receive your full reward on the Day of Judgment. Whoever is spared from the Fire and is admitted into Paradise will ˹indeed˺ triumph, whereas the life of this world is no more than the delusion of enjoyment. Patience Tested
verses.translation: Every soul will taste death. And you will only receive your full reward on the Day of Judgment. Whoever is spared from the Fire and is admitted into Paradise will ˹indeed˺ triumph, whereas the life of this world is no more than the delusion of enjoyment. Patience Tested

verses.text: You ˹believers˺ will surely be tested in your wealth and yourselves,[167] and you will certainly hear many hurtful words from those who were given the Scripture before you and ˹from˺ the polytheists. But if you are patient and mindful ˹of Allah˺—surely this is a resolve to aspire to. Breaking Allah’s Covenant
verses.translation: You ˹believers˺ will surely be tested in your wealth and yourselves,[167] and you will certainly hear many hurtful words from those who were given the Scripture before you and ˹from˺ the polytheists. But if you are patient and mindful ˹of Allah˺—surely this is a resolve to aspire to. Breaking Allah’s Covenant

verses.text: ˹Remember, O Prophet,˺ when Allah took the covenant of those who were given the Scripture to make it known to people and not hide it, yet they cast it behind their backs and traded it for a fleeting gain. What a miserable profit!
verses.translation: ˹Remember, O Prophet,˺ when Allah took the covenant of those who were given the Scripture to make it known to people and not hide it, yet they cast it behind their backs and traded it for a fleeting gain. What a miserable profit!

verses.text: Do not let those who rejoice in their misdeeds and love to take credit for what they have not done think they will escape torment. They will suffer a painful punishment. Allah’s Signs
verses.translation: Do not let those who rejoice in their misdeeds and love to take credit for what they have not done think they will escape torment. They will suffer a painful punishment. Allah’s Signs

verses.text: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is Most Capable of everything.
verses.translation: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is Most Capable of everything.

verses.text: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth and the alternation of the day and night there are signs for people of reason. A Prayer of the Righteous
verses.translation: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth and the alternation of the day and night there are signs for people of reason. A Prayer of the Righteous

verses.text: ˹They are˺ those who remember Allah while standing, sitting, and lying on their sides, and reflect on the creation of the heavens and the earth ˹and pray˺, “Our Lord! You have not created ˹all of˺ this without purpose. Glory be to You! Protect us from the torment of the Fire.
verses.translation: ˹They are˺ those who remember Allah while standing, sitting, and lying on their sides, and reflect on the creation of the heavens and the earth ˹and pray˺, “Our Lord! You have not created ˹all of˺ this without purpose. Glory be to You! Protect us from the torment of the Fire.

verses.text: Our Lord! Indeed, those You commit to the Fire will be ˹completely˺ disgraced! And the wrongdoers will have no helpers.
verses.translation: Our Lord! Indeed, those You commit to the Fire will be ˹completely˺ disgraced! And the wrongdoers will have no helpers.

verses.text: Our Lord! We have heard the caller[168] to ˹true˺ belief, ˹proclaiming,˺ ‘Believe in your Lord ˹alone˺,’ so we believed. Our Lord! Forgive our sins, absolve us of our misdeeds, and allow us ˹each˺ to die as one of the virtuous.
verses.translation: Our Lord! We have heard the caller[168] to ˹true˺ belief, ˹proclaiming,˺ ‘Believe in your Lord ˹alone˺,’ so we believed. Our Lord! Forgive our sins, absolve us of our misdeeds, and allow us ˹each˺ to die as one of the virtuous.

verses.text: Our Lord! Grant us what You have promised us through Your messengers and do not put us to shame on Judgment Day—for certainly You never fail in Your promise.” Prayers Answered
verses.translation: Our Lord! Grant us what You have promised us through Your messengers and do not put us to shame on Judgment Day—for certainly You never fail in Your promise.” Prayers Answered

verses.text: So their Lord responded to them: “I will never deny any of you—male or female—the reward of your deeds. Both are equal in reward. Those who migrated or were expelled from their homes, and were persecuted for My sake and fought and ˹some˺ were martyred—I will certainly forgive their sins and admit them into Gardens under which rivers flow, as a reward from Allah. And with Allah is the finest reward!” Disbelievers’ Brief Enjoyment
verses.translation: So their Lord responded to them: “I will never deny any of you—male or female—the reward of your deeds. Both are equal in reward. Those who migrated or were expelled from their homes, and were persecuted for My sake and fought and ˹some˺ were martyred—I will certainly forgive their sins and admit them into Gardens under which rivers flow, as a reward from Allah. And with Allah is the finest reward!” Disbelievers’ Brief Enjoyment

verses.text: Do not be deceived by the prosperity of the disbelievers throughout the land.
verses.translation: Do not be deceived by the prosperity of the disbelievers throughout the land.

verses.text: It is only a brief enjoyment. Then Hell will be their home—what an evil place to rest! Believers’ Everlasting Delight
verses.translation: It is only a brief enjoyment. Then Hell will be their home—what an evil place to rest! Believers’ Everlasting Delight

verses.text: But those who are mindful of their Lord will be in Gardens under which rivers flow, to stay there forever—as an accommodation from Allah. And what is with Allah is best for the virtuous. Believers Among People of the Book
verses.translation: But those who are mindful of their Lord will be in Gardens under which rivers flow, to stay there forever—as an accommodation from Allah. And what is with Allah is best for the virtuous. Believers Among People of the Book

verses.text: Indeed, there are some among the People of the Book who truly believe in Allah and what has been revealed to you ˹believers˺ and what was revealed to them. They humble themselves before Allah—never trading Allah’s revelations for a fleeting gain. Their reward is with their Lord. Surely Allah is swift in reckoning. Advice for Success
verses.translation: Indeed, there are some among the People of the Book who truly believe in Allah and what has been revealed to you ˹believers˺ and what was revealed to them. They humble themselves before Allah—never trading Allah’s revelations for a fleeting gain. Their reward is with their Lord. Surely Allah is swift in reckoning. Advice for Success

verses.text: O believers! Patiently endure, persevere, stand on guard,[169] and be mindful of Allah, so you may be successful. *** -- 87 of 694 --
verses.translation: O believers! Patiently endure, persevere, stand on guard,[169] and be mindful of Allah, so you may be successful. *** -- 87 of 694 --

name: Women
intro: This sûrah focuses on the rights of women (hence the sûrah’s name), the law of inheritance, care for orphans, lawful and unlawful women to marry, and standing for justice (see the remarkable example of justice to a Jew in verses 105-112). As the sûrah progresses, the focus shifts to the etiquette of striving in the cause of Allah and the relationship between Muslims and the People of the Book, culminating in a rebuttal to the claims about the crucifixion and divinity of Jesus ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص). Like the previous and the next sûrahs, this sûrah also deals with the issue of hypocrisy—a common theme in many other Medinian sûrahs. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Commitment to Allah and Kinship Ties

verses.text: O humanity! Be mindful of your Lord Who created you from a single soul, and from it He created its mate,[170] and through both He spread countless men and women. And be mindful of Allah—in Whose Name you appeal to one another—and ˹honour˺ family ties. Surely Allah is ever Watchful over you. Orphans Given back Their Wealth
verses.translation: O humanity! Be mindful of your Lord Who created you from a single soul, and from it He created its mate,[170] and through both He spread countless men and women. And be mindful of Allah—in Whose Name you appeal to one another—and ˹honour˺ family ties. Surely Allah is ever Watchful over you. Orphans Given back Their Wealth

verses.text: Give orphans their wealth ˹when they reach maturity˺, and do not exchange your worthless possessions for their valuables, nor cheat them by mixing their wealth with your own. For this would indeed be a great sin. Bridal Gifts
verses.translation: Give orphans their wealth ˹when they reach maturity˺, and do not exchange your worthless possessions for their valuables, nor cheat them by mixing their wealth with your own. For this would indeed be a great sin. Bridal Gifts

verses.text: If you fear you might fail to give orphan women their ˹due˺ rights ˹if you were to marry them˺, then marry other women of your choice—two, three, or four. But if you are afraid you will fail to maintain justice, then ˹content yourselves with˺ one[171] or those ˹bondwomen˺ in your possession.[172] This way you are less likely to commit injustice.
verses.translation: If you fear you might fail to give orphan women their ˹due˺ rights ˹if you were to marry them˺, then marry other women of your choice—two, three, or four. But if you are afraid you will fail to maintain justice, then ˹content yourselves with˺ one[171] or those ˹bondwomen˺ in your possession.[172] This way you are less likely to commit injustice.

verses.text: Give women ˹you wed˺ their due dowries graciously. But if they waive some of it willingly, then you may enjoy it freely with a clear conscience. Managing Wealth Responsibly
verses.translation: Give women ˹you wed˺ their due dowries graciously. But if they waive some of it willingly, then you may enjoy it freely with a clear conscience. Managing Wealth Responsibly

verses.text: Do not entrust the incapable ˹among your dependants˺ with your wealth which Allah has made a means of support for you—but feed and clothe them from it, and speak to them kindly. Orphans’ Wealth
verses.translation: Do not entrust the incapable ˹among your dependants˺ with your wealth which Allah has made a means of support for you—but feed and clothe them from it, and speak to them kindly. Orphans’ Wealth

verses.text: Test ˹the competence of˺ the orphans until they reach a marriageable age. Then if you feel they are capable of sound judgment, return their wealth to them. And do not consume it wastefully and hastily before they grow up ˹to demand it˺. If the guardian is well-off, they should not take compensation; but if the guardian is poor, let them take a reasonable provision. When you give orphans back their property, call in witnesses. And sufficient is Allah as a ˹vigilant˺ Reckoner. Inheritance Law[173] 1) Males and Females
verses.translation: Test ˹the competence of˺ the orphans until they reach a marriageable age. Then if you feel they are capable of sound judgment, return their wealth to them. And do not consume it wastefully and hastily before they grow up ˹to demand it˺. If the guardian is well-off, they should not take compensation; but if the guardian is poor, let them take a reasonable provision. When you give orphans back their property, call in witnesses. And sufficient is Allah as a ˹vigilant˺ Reckoner. Inheritance Law[173] 1) Males and Females

verses.text: For men there is a share in what their parents and close relatives leave, and for women there is a share in what their parents and close relatives leave—whether it is little or much. ˹These are˺ obligatory shares. Acts of Kindness
verses.translation: For men there is a share in what their parents and close relatives leave, and for women there is a share in what their parents and close relatives leave—whether it is little or much. ˹These are˺ obligatory shares. Acts of Kindness

verses.text: If ˹non-inheriting˺ relatives, orphans,[174] or the needy are present at the time of distribution, offer them a ˹small˺ provision from it and speak to them kindly. Caring for Orphans
verses.translation: If ˹non-inheriting˺ relatives, orphans,[174] or the needy are present at the time of distribution, offer them a ˹small˺ provision from it and speak to them kindly. Caring for Orphans

verses.text: Let the guardians be as concerned ˹for the orphans˺ as they would if they were to ˹die and˺ leave ˹their own˺ helpless children behind. So let them be mindful of Allah and speak equitably.
verses.translation: Let the guardians be as concerned ˹for the orphans˺ as they would if they were to ˹die and˺ leave ˹their own˺ helpless children behind. So let them be mindful of Allah and speak equitably.

verses.text: Indeed, those who unjustly consume orphans’ wealth ˹in fact˺ consume nothing but fire into their bellies. And they will be burned in a blazing Hell! Inheritance Law 2) Offspring and Parents
verses.translation: Indeed, those who unjustly consume orphans’ wealth ˹in fact˺ consume nothing but fire into their bellies. And they will be burned in a blazing Hell! Inheritance Law 2) Offspring and Parents

verses.text: Allah commands you regarding your children: the share of the male will be twice that of the female.[175] If you leave only two ˹or more˺ females, their share is two-thirds of the estate. But if there is only one female, her share will be one-half. Each parent is entitled to one-sixth if you leave offspring.[176] But if you are childless and your parents are the only heirs, then your mother will receive one-third.[177] But if you leave siblings, then your mother will receive one-sixth[178]—after the fulfilment of bequests and debts.[179] ˹Be fair to˺ your parents and children, as you do not ˹fully˺ know who is more beneficial to you.[180] ˹This is˺ an obligation from Allah. Surely Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. Inheritance Law 3) Spouses, 4) Maternal Siblings
verses.translation: Allah commands you regarding your children: the share of the male will be twice that of the female.[175] If you leave only two ˹or more˺ females, their share is two-thirds of the estate. But if there is only one female, her share will be one-half. Each parent is entitled to one-sixth if you leave offspring.[176] But if you are childless and your parents are the only heirs, then your mother will receive one-third.[177] But if you leave siblings, then your mother will receive one-sixth[178]—after the fulfilment of bequests and debts.[179] ˹Be fair to˺ your parents and children, as you do not ˹fully˺ know who is more beneficial to you.[180] ˹This is˺ an obligation from Allah. Surely Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. Inheritance Law 3) Spouses, 4) Maternal Siblings

verses.text: You will inherit half of what your wives leave if they are childless. But if they have children, then ˹your share is˺ one-fourth of the estate—after the fulfilment of bequests and debts. And your wives will inherit one-fourth of what you leave if you are childless. But if you have children, then your wives will receive one-eighth of your estate—after the fulfilment of bequests and debts. And if a man or a woman leaves neither parents nor children but only a brother or a sister ˹from their mother’s side˺, they will each inherit one-sixth, but if they are more than one, they ˹all˺ will share one-third of the estate[181]—after the fulfilment of bequests and debts without harm ˹to the heirs˺.[182] ˹This is˺ a commandment from Allah. And Allah is All-Knowing, Most Forbearing. Compliance with Inheritance Laws
verses.translation: You will inherit half of what your wives leave if they are childless. But if they have children, then ˹your share is˺ one-fourth of the estate—after the fulfilment of bequests and debts. And your wives will inherit one-fourth of what you leave if you are childless. But if you have children, then your wives will receive one-eighth of your estate—after the fulfilment of bequests and debts. And if a man or a woman leaves neither parents nor children but only a brother or a sister ˹from their mother’s side˺, they will each inherit one-sixth, but if they are more than one, they ˹all˺ will share one-third of the estate[181]—after the fulfilment of bequests and debts without harm ˹to the heirs˺.[182] ˹This is˺ a commandment from Allah. And Allah is All-Knowing, Most Forbearing. Compliance with Inheritance Laws

verses.text: These ˹entitlements˺ are the limits set by Allah. Whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger will be admitted into Gardens under which rivers flow, to stay there forever. That is the ultimate triumph!
verses.translation: These ˹entitlements˺ are the limits set by Allah. Whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger will be admitted into Gardens under which rivers flow, to stay there forever. That is the ultimate triumph!

verses.text: But whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger and exceeds their limits will be cast into Hell, to stay there forever. And they will suffer a humiliating punishment. Illegal Sexual Relationships[183]
verses.translation: But whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger and exceeds their limits will be cast into Hell, to stay there forever. And they will suffer a humiliating punishment. Illegal Sexual Relationships[183]

verses.text: ˹As for˺ those of your women who commit illegal intercourse—call four witnesses from among yourselves. If they testify, confine the offenders to their homes until they die or Allah ordains a ˹different˺ way for them.
verses.translation: ˹As for˺ those of your women who commit illegal intercourse—call four witnesses from among yourselves. If they testify, confine the offenders to their homes until they die or Allah ordains a ˹different˺ way for them.

verses.text: And the two among you who commit this sin—discipline them. If they repent and mend their ways, relieve them. Surely Allah is ever Accepting of Repentance, Most Merciful. Accepted and Rejected Repentance
verses.translation: And the two among you who commit this sin—discipline them. If they repent and mend their ways, relieve them. Surely Allah is ever Accepting of Repentance, Most Merciful. Accepted and Rejected Repentance

verses.text: Allah only accepts the repentance of those who commit evil ignorantly ˹or recklessly˺ then repent soon after[184]—Allah will pardon them. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
verses.translation: Allah only accepts the repentance of those who commit evil ignorantly ˹or recklessly˺ then repent soon after[184]—Allah will pardon them. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

verses.text: However, repentance is not accepted from those who knowingly persist in sin until they start dying, and then cry, “Now I repent!” nor those who die as disbelievers. For them We have prepared a painful punishment. Abusing Women Financially
verses.translation: However, repentance is not accepted from those who knowingly persist in sin until they start dying, and then cry, “Now I repent!” nor those who die as disbelievers. For them We have prepared a painful punishment. Abusing Women Financially

verses.text: O believers! It is not permissible for you to inherit women against their will[185] or mistreat them to make them return some of the dowry ˹as a ransom for divorce˺—unless they are found guilty of adultery.[186] Treat them fairly. If you happen to dislike them, you may hate something which Allah turns into a great blessing.
verses.translation: O believers! It is not permissible for you to inherit women against their will[185] or mistreat them to make them return some of the dowry ˹as a ransom for divorce˺—unless they are found guilty of adultery.[186] Treat them fairly. If you happen to dislike them, you may hate something which Allah turns into a great blessing.

verses.text: If you desire to replace a wife with another and you have given the former ˹even˺ a stack of gold ˹as a dowry˺, do not take any of it back. Would you ˹still˺ take it unjustly and very sinfully?
verses.translation: If you desire to replace a wife with another and you have given the former ˹even˺ a stack of gold ˹as a dowry˺, do not take any of it back. Would you ˹still˺ take it unjustly and very sinfully?

verses.text: And how could you take it back after having enjoyed each other intimately and she has taken from you a firm commitment?[187] Lawful and Unlawful Women to Marry[188]
verses.translation: And how could you take it back after having enjoyed each other intimately and she has taken from you a firm commitment?[187] Lawful and Unlawful Women to Marry[188]

verses.text: Do not marry former wives of your fathers—except what was done previously. It was indeed a shameful, despicable, and evil practice.
verses.translation: Do not marry former wives of your fathers—except what was done previously. It was indeed a shameful, despicable, and evil practice.

verses.text: ˹Also˺ forbidden to you for marriage are your mothers, your daughters, your sisters, your paternal and maternal aunts, your brother’s daughters, your sister’s daughters, your foster-mothers, your foster-sisters, your mothers-in- law, your stepdaughters under your guardianship if you have consummated marriage with their mothers—but if you have not, then you can marry them —nor the wives of your own sons, nor two sisters together at the same time —except what was done previously. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
verses.translation: ˹Also˺ forbidden to you for marriage are your mothers, your daughters, your sisters, your paternal and maternal aunts, your brother’s daughters, your sister’s daughters, your foster-mothers, your foster-sisters, your mothers-in- law, your stepdaughters under your guardianship if you have consummated marriage with their mothers—but if you have not, then you can marry them —nor the wives of your own sons, nor two sisters together at the same time —except what was done previously. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

verses.text: Also ˹forbidden are˺ married women—except ˹female˺ captives in your possession.[189] This is Allah’s commandment to you. ˹But˺ lawful to you are all beyond these—as long as you seek them with your wealth in a legal marriage, not in fornication. Give those you have consummated marriage with their due dowries. It is permissible to be mutually gracious regarding the set dowry. Surely Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. Marrying Bondwomen
verses.translation: Also ˹forbidden are˺ married women—except ˹female˺ captives in your possession.[189] This is Allah’s commandment to you. ˹But˺ lawful to you are all beyond these—as long as you seek them with your wealth in a legal marriage, not in fornication. Give those you have consummated marriage with their due dowries. It is permissible to be mutually gracious regarding the set dowry. Surely Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. Marrying Bondwomen

verses.text: But if any of you cannot afford to marry a free believing woman, then ˹let him marry˺ a believing bondwoman possessed by one of you. Allah knows best ˹the state of˺ your faith ˹and theirs˺. You are from one another. [190] So marry them with the permission of their owners,[191] giving them their dowry in fairness, if they are chaste, neither promiscuous nor having secret affairs. If they commit indecency after marriage, they receive half the punishment of free women.[192] This is for those of you who fear falling into sin. But if you are patient, it is better for you. And Allah is All- Forgiving, Most Merciful. Allah’s Grace
verses.translation: But if any of you cannot afford to marry a free believing woman, then ˹let him marry˺ a believing bondwoman possessed by one of you. Allah knows best ˹the state of˺ your faith ˹and theirs˺. You are from one another. [190] So marry them with the permission of their owners,[191] giving them their dowry in fairness, if they are chaste, neither promiscuous nor having secret affairs. If they commit indecency after marriage, they receive half the punishment of free women.[192] This is for those of you who fear falling into sin. But if you are patient, it is better for you. And Allah is All- Forgiving, Most Merciful. Allah’s Grace

verses.text: It is Allah’s Will to make things clear to you, guide you to the ˹noble˺ ways of those before you, and turn to you in mercy. For Allah is All- Knowing, All-Wise.
verses.translation: It is Allah’s Will to make things clear to you, guide you to the ˹noble˺ ways of those before you, and turn to you in mercy. For Allah is All- Knowing, All-Wise.

verses.text: And it is Allah’s Will to turn to you in grace, but those who follow their desires wish to see you deviate entirely ˹from Allah’s Way˺.
verses.translation: And it is Allah’s Will to turn to you in grace, but those who follow their desires wish to see you deviate entirely ˹from Allah’s Way˺.

verses.text: And it is Allah’s Will to lighten your burdens, for humankind was created weak. Prohibition of Abuse
verses.translation: And it is Allah’s Will to lighten your burdens, for humankind was created weak. Prohibition of Abuse

verses.text: O believers! Do not devour one another’s wealth illegally, but rather trade by mutual consent. And do not kill ˹each other or˺ yourselves. Surely Allah is ever Merciful to you.
verses.translation: O believers! Do not devour one another’s wealth illegally, but rather trade by mutual consent. And do not kill ˹each other or˺ yourselves. Surely Allah is ever Merciful to you.

verses.text: And whoever does this sinfully and unjustly, We will burn them in the Fire. That is easy for Allah. Avoiding Major Sins
verses.translation: And whoever does this sinfully and unjustly, We will burn them in the Fire. That is easy for Allah. Avoiding Major Sins

verses.text: If you avoid the major sins forbidden to you, We will absolve you of your ˹lesser˺ misdeeds and admit you into a place of honour.[193] Inheritance Law 5) Contentment
verses.translation: If you avoid the major sins forbidden to you, We will absolve you of your ˹lesser˺ misdeeds and admit you into a place of honour.[193] Inheritance Law 5) Contentment

verses.text: And do not crave what Allah has given some of you over others. Men will be rewarded according to their deeds and women ˹equally˺ according to theirs. Rather, ask Allah for His bounties. Surely Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things.
verses.translation: And do not crave what Allah has given some of you over others. Men will be rewarded according to their deeds and women ˹equally˺ according to theirs. Rather, ask Allah for His bounties. Surely Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things.

verses.text: And We have appointed heirs to what has been left by parents and next of kin. As for those you have made a pledge to, give them their share.[194] Surely Allah is a Witness over all things. Husbands as Providers and Protectors
verses.translation: And We have appointed heirs to what has been left by parents and next of kin. As for those you have made a pledge to, give them their share.[194] Surely Allah is a Witness over all things. Husbands as Providers and Protectors

verses.text: Men are the caretakers of women, as men have been provisioned by Allah over women and tasked with supporting them financially. And righteous women are devoutly obedient and, when alone, protective of what Allah has entrusted them with.[195] And if you sense ill-conduct from your women, advise them ˹first˺, ˹if they persist,˺ do not share their beds, ˹but if they still persist,˺ then discipline them ˹gently˺.[196] But if they change their ways, do not be unjust to them. Surely Allah is Most High, All-Great. Reconciling Married Couples
verses.translation: Men are the caretakers of women, as men have been provisioned by Allah over women and tasked with supporting them financially. And righteous women are devoutly obedient and, when alone, protective of what Allah has entrusted them with.[195] And if you sense ill-conduct from your women, advise them ˹first˺, ˹if they persist,˺ do not share their beds, ˹but if they still persist,˺ then discipline them ˹gently˺.[196] But if they change their ways, do not be unjust to them. Surely Allah is Most High, All-Great. Reconciling Married Couples

verses.text: If you anticipate a split between them, appoint a mediator from his family and another from hers. If they desire reconciliation, Allah will restore harmony between them. Surely Allah is All-Knowing, All-Aware. The Kind, the Stingy, and the Insincere
verses.translation: If you anticipate a split between them, appoint a mediator from his family and another from hers. If they desire reconciliation, Allah will restore harmony between them. Surely Allah is All-Knowing, All-Aware. The Kind, the Stingy, and the Insincere

verses.text: Worship Allah ˹alone˺ and associate none with Him. And be kind to parents, relatives, orphans, the poor, near and distant neighbours, close friends, ˹needy˺ travellers, and those ˹bondspeople˺ in your possession. Surely Allah does not like whoever is arrogant, boastful—
verses.translation: Worship Allah ˹alone˺ and associate none with Him. And be kind to parents, relatives, orphans, the poor, near and distant neighbours, close friends, ˹needy˺ travellers, and those ˹bondspeople˺ in your possession. Surely Allah does not like whoever is arrogant, boastful—

verses.text: those who are stingy, promote stinginess among people, and withhold Allah’s bounties. We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.
verses.translation: those who are stingy, promote stinginess among people, and withhold Allah’s bounties. We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.

verses.text: Likewise for those who spend their wealth to show off and do not believe in Allah or the Last Day. And whoever takes Satan as an associate —what an evil associate they have! Divine Justice
verses.translation: Likewise for those who spend their wealth to show off and do not believe in Allah or the Last Day. And whoever takes Satan as an associate —what an evil associate they have! Divine Justice
