verses.text: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Should we invoke, other than Allah, those ˹idols˺ which cannot benefit or harm us, and turn back to disbelief after Allah has guided us? ˹If we do so, we will be˺ like those disoriented by devils in the wilderness, while their companions call them to guidance, ˹saying˺, ‘Come to us!’ Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Allah’s guidance is the ˹only˺ true guidance. And we are commanded to submit to the Lord of all worlds,
verses.translation: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Should we invoke, other than Allah, those ˹idols˺ which cannot benefit or harm us, and turn back to disbelief after Allah has guided us? ˹If we do so, we will be˺ like those disoriented by devils in the wilderness, while their companions call them to guidance, ˹saying˺, ‘Come to us!’ Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Allah’s guidance is the ˹only˺ true guidance. And we are commanded to submit to the Lord of all worlds,

verses.text: establish prayer, and be mindful of Him. To Him you will all be gathered together.
verses.translation: establish prayer, and be mindful of Him. To Him you will all be gathered together.

verses.text: He is the One Who created the heavens and the earth in truth. On the Day ˹of Judgment˺ He will say, ‘Be!’ And there will be! His command is truth. All authority is His ˹alone˺[280] on the Day the Trumpet will be blown.[281] He is the Knower of all—seen or unseen. And He is the All-Wise, All-Aware.” Abraham Corrects His Father
verses.translation: He is the One Who created the heavens and the earth in truth. On the Day ˹of Judgment˺ He will say, ‘Be!’ And there will be! His command is truth. All authority is His ˹alone˺[280] on the Day the Trumpet will be blown.[281] He is the Knower of all—seen or unseen. And He is the All-Wise, All-Aware.” Abraham Corrects His Father

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when Abraham said to his father, Ȃzar, “Do you take idols as gods? It is clear to me that you and your people are entirely misguided.” Abraham Refutes Celestial Worship
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when Abraham said to his father, Ȃzar, “Do you take idols as gods? It is clear to me that you and your people are entirely misguided.” Abraham Refutes Celestial Worship

verses.text: We also showed Abraham the wonders of the heavens and the earth, so he would be sure in faith.
verses.translation: We also showed Abraham the wonders of the heavens and the earth, so he would be sure in faith.

verses.text: When the night grew dark upon him, he saw a star and said, “This is my Lord!” But when it set, he said, “I do not love things that set.”
verses.translation: When the night grew dark upon him, he saw a star and said, “This is my Lord!” But when it set, he said, “I do not love things that set.”

verses.text: Then when he saw the moon rising, he said, “This one is my Lord!” But when it disappeared, he said, “If my Lord does not guide me, I will certainly be one of the misguided people.”
verses.translation: Then when he saw the moon rising, he said, “This one is my Lord!” But when it disappeared, he said, “If my Lord does not guide me, I will certainly be one of the misguided people.”

verses.text: Then when he saw the sun shining, he said, “This must be my Lord—it is the greatest!” But again when it set, he declared, “O my people! I totally reject whatever you associate ˹with Allah in worship˺.
verses.translation: Then when he saw the sun shining, he said, “This must be my Lord—it is the greatest!” But again when it set, he declared, “O my people! I totally reject whatever you associate ˹with Allah in worship˺.

verses.text: I have turned my face towards the One Who has originated the heavens and the earth—being upright—and I am not one of the polytheists.” Abraham Debates His People
verses.translation: I have turned my face towards the One Who has originated the heavens and the earth—being upright—and I am not one of the polytheists.” Abraham Debates His People

verses.text: And his people argued with him. He responded, “Are you arguing with me about Allah, while He has guided me? I am not afraid of whatever ˹idols˺ you associate with Him—˹none can harm me,˺ unless my Lord so wills. My Lord encompasses everything in ˹His˺ knowledge. Will you not be mindful?
verses.translation: And his people argued with him. He responded, “Are you arguing with me about Allah, while He has guided me? I am not afraid of whatever ˹idols˺ you associate with Him—˹none can harm me,˺ unless my Lord so wills. My Lord encompasses everything in ˹His˺ knowledge. Will you not be mindful?

verses.text: And how should I fear your associate-gods, while you have no fear in associating ˹others˺ with Allah—a practice He has never authorized? Which side has more right to security? ˹Tell me˺ if you really know!”
verses.translation: And how should I fear your associate-gods, while you have no fear in associating ˹others˺ with Allah—a practice He has never authorized? Which side has more right to security? ˹Tell me˺ if you really know!”

verses.text: It is ˹only˺ those who are faithful and do not tarnish their faith with falsehood[282] who are guaranteed security and are ˹rightly˺ guided.
verses.translation: It is ˹only˺ those who are faithful and do not tarnish their faith with falsehood[282] who are guaranteed security and are ˹rightly˺ guided.

verses.text: This was the argument We gave Abraham against his people. We elevate in rank whoever We please. Surely your Lord is All-Wise, All-Knowing. Abraham and Other Noble Prophets
verses.translation: This was the argument We gave Abraham against his people. We elevate in rank whoever We please. Surely your Lord is All-Wise, All-Knowing. Abraham and Other Noble Prophets

verses.text: And We blessed him with Isaac and Jacob. We guided them all as We previously guided Noah and those among his descendants: David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron. This is how We reward the good-doers.
verses.translation: And We blessed him with Isaac and Jacob. We guided them all as We previously guided Noah and those among his descendants: David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron. This is how We reward the good-doers.

verses.text: Likewise, ˹We guided˺ Zachariah, John, Jesus, and Elias, who were all of the righteous.
verses.translation: Likewise, ˹We guided˺ Zachariah, John, Jesus, and Elias, who were all of the righteous.

verses.text: ˹We also guided˺ Ishmael, Elisha, Jonah, and Lot, favouring each over other people ˹of their time˺.
verses.translation: ˹We also guided˺ Ishmael, Elisha, Jonah, and Lot, favouring each over other people ˹of their time˺.

verses.text: And ˹We favoured˺ some of their forefathers, their descendants, and their brothers. We chose them and guided them to the Straight Path. Prophetic Guidance
verses.translation: And ˹We favoured˺ some of their forefathers, their descendants, and their brothers. We chose them and guided them to the Straight Path. Prophetic Guidance

verses.text: This is Allah’s guidance with which He guides whoever He wills of His servants. Had they associated others with Him ˹in worship˺, their ˹good˺ deeds would have been wasted.
verses.translation: This is Allah’s guidance with which He guides whoever He wills of His servants. Had they associated others with Him ˹in worship˺, their ˹good˺ deeds would have been wasted.

verses.text: Those were the ones to whom We gave the Scripture, wisdom, and prophethood. But if these ˹pagans˺ disbelieve in this ˹message˺, then We have already entrusted it to a people who will never disbelieve in it.[283]
verses.translation: Those were the ones to whom We gave the Scripture, wisdom, and prophethood. But if these ˹pagans˺ disbelieve in this ˹message˺, then We have already entrusted it to a people who will never disbelieve in it.[283]

verses.text: These ˹prophets˺ were ˹rightly˺ guided by Allah, so follow their guidance. Say, “I ask no reward of you for this ˹Quran˺—it is a reminder to the whole world.” Scriptures Denied
verses.translation: These ˹prophets˺ were ˹rightly˺ guided by Allah, so follow their guidance. Say, “I ask no reward of you for this ˹Quran˺—it is a reminder to the whole world.” Scriptures Denied

verses.text: And they[284] have not shown Allah His proper reverence when they said, “Allah has revealed nothing to any human being.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Who then revealed the Book brought forth by Moses as a light and guidance for people, which you split into separate sheets—revealing some and hiding much? You have been taught ˹through this Quran˺ what neither you nor your forefathers knew.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Allah ˹revealed it˺!” Then leave them to amuse themselves with falsehood. Quran for All
verses.translation: And they[284] have not shown Allah His proper reverence when they said, “Allah has revealed nothing to any human being.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Who then revealed the Book brought forth by Moses as a light and guidance for people, which you split into separate sheets—revealing some and hiding much? You have been taught ˹through this Quran˺ what neither you nor your forefathers knew.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Allah ˹revealed it˺!” Then leave them to amuse themselves with falsehood. Quran for All

verses.text: This is a blessed Book which We have revealed—confirming what came before it—so you may warn the Mother of Cities[285] and everyone around it. Those who believe in the Hereafter ˹truly˺ believe in it and guard their prayers. Fate of the Wicked
verses.translation: This is a blessed Book which We have revealed—confirming what came before it—so you may warn the Mother of Cities[285] and everyone around it. Those who believe in the Hereafter ˹truly˺ believe in it and guard their prayers. Fate of the Wicked

verses.text: Who does more wrong than the one who fabricates lies against Allah or claims, “I have received revelations!”—although nothing was revealed to them—or the one who says, “I can reveal the like of Allah’s revelations!”? If you ˹O Prophet˺ could only see the wrongdoers in the throes of death while the angels are stretching out their hands ˹saying˺, “Give up your souls! Today you will be rewarded with the torment of disgrace for telling lies about Allah and for being arrogant towards His revelations!”
verses.translation: Who does more wrong than the one who fabricates lies against Allah or claims, “I have received revelations!”—although nothing was revealed to them—or the one who says, “I can reveal the like of Allah’s revelations!”? If you ˹O Prophet˺ could only see the wrongdoers in the throes of death while the angels are stretching out their hands ˹saying˺, “Give up your souls! Today you will be rewarded with the torment of disgrace for telling lies about Allah and for being arrogant towards His revelations!”

verses.text: ˹Today˺ you have come back to Us all alone as We created you the first time —leaving behind everything We have provided you with. We do not see your intercessors with you—those you claimed were Allah’s partners ˹in worship˺. All your ties have been broken and all your claims have let you down.” Allah’s Power of Creation
verses.translation: ˹Today˺ you have come back to Us all alone as We created you the first time —leaving behind everything We have provided you with. We do not see your intercessors with you—those you claimed were Allah’s partners ˹in worship˺. All your ties have been broken and all your claims have let you down.” Allah’s Power of Creation

verses.text: Indeed, Allah is the One Who causes seeds and fruit stones to sprout. He brings forth the living from the dead and the dead from the living. That is Allah! How can you then be deluded ˹from the truth˺?
verses.translation: Indeed, Allah is the One Who causes seeds and fruit stones to sprout. He brings forth the living from the dead and the dead from the living. That is Allah! How can you then be deluded ˹from the truth˺?

verses.text: He causes the dawn to break, and has made the night for rest and ˹made˺ the sun and the moon ˹to travel˺ with precision. That is the design of the Almighty, All- Knowing.
verses.translation: He causes the dawn to break, and has made the night for rest and ˹made˺ the sun and the moon ˹to travel˺ with precision. That is the design of the Almighty, All- Knowing.

verses.text: And He is the One Who has made the stars as your guide through the darkness of land and sea. We have already made the signs clear for people who know.
verses.translation: And He is the One Who has made the stars as your guide through the darkness of land and sea. We have already made the signs clear for people who know.

verses.text: And He is the One Who originated you all from a single soul,[286] then assigned you a place to live and another to ˹be laid to˺ rest. We have already made the signs clear for people who comprehend.
verses.translation: And He is the One Who originated you all from a single soul,[286] then assigned you a place to live and another to ˹be laid to˺ rest. We have already made the signs clear for people who comprehend.

verses.text: And He is the One Who sends down rain from the sky—causing all kinds of plants to grow—producing green stalks from which We bring forth clustered grain. And from palm trees come clusters of dates hanging within reach. ˹There are˺ also gardens of grapevines, olives, and pomegranates, similar ˹in shape˺ but dissimilar ˹in taste˺. Look at their fruit as it yields and ripens! Indeed, in these are signs for people who believe. Allah Has No Children
verses.translation: And He is the One Who sends down rain from the sky—causing all kinds of plants to grow—producing green stalks from which We bring forth clustered grain. And from palm trees come clusters of dates hanging within reach. ˹There are˺ also gardens of grapevines, olives, and pomegranates, similar ˹in shape˺ but dissimilar ˹in taste˺. Look at their fruit as it yields and ripens! Indeed, in these are signs for people who believe. Allah Has No Children

verses.text: Yet they associate the jinn[287] with Allah ˹in worship˺, even though He created them, and they falsely attribute to Him sons[288] and daughters[289] out of ignorance. Glorified and Exalted is He above what they claim!
verses.translation: Yet they associate the jinn[287] with Allah ˹in worship˺, even though He created them, and they falsely attribute to Him sons[288] and daughters[289] out of ignorance. Glorified and Exalted is He above what they claim!

verses.text: ˹He is˺ the Originator of the heavens and earth. How could He have children when He has no mate? He created all things and has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of everything. Worship Allah Alone
verses.translation: ˹He is˺ the Originator of the heavens and earth. How could He have children when He has no mate? He created all things and has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of everything. Worship Allah Alone

verses.text: That is Allah—your Lord! There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. ˹He is˺ the Creator of all things, so worship Him ˹alone˺. And He is the Maintainer of everything.
verses.translation: That is Allah—your Lord! There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. ˹He is˺ the Creator of all things, so worship Him ˹alone˺. And He is the Maintainer of everything.

verses.text: No vision can encompass Him, but He encompasses all vision. For He is the Most Subtle, All-Aware.[290] Call to Humanity
verses.translation: No vision can encompass Him, but He encompasses all vision. For He is the Most Subtle, All-Aware.[290] Call to Humanity

verses.text: Indeed, there have come to you insights from your Lord. So whoever chooses to see, it is for their own good. But whoever chooses to be blind, it is to their own loss. And I am not a keeper over you.
verses.translation: Indeed, there have come to you insights from your Lord. So whoever chooses to see, it is for their own good. But whoever chooses to be blind, it is to their own loss. And I am not a keeper over you.

verses.text: And so We vary our signs to the extent that they will say, “You have studied ˹previous scriptures˺,”[291] and We make this ˹Quran˺ clear for people who know. Guidance Is from Allah Alone
verses.translation: And so We vary our signs to the extent that they will say, “You have studied ˹previous scriptures˺,”[291] and We make this ˹Quran˺ clear for people who know. Guidance Is from Allah Alone

verses.text: ˹O Prophet!˺ Follow what is revealed to you from your Lord—there is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him—and turn away from the polytheists.
verses.translation: ˹O Prophet!˺ Follow what is revealed to you from your Lord—there is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him—and turn away from the polytheists.

verses.text: Had Allah willed, they would not have been polytheists. We have not appointed you as their keeper, nor are you their maintainer. Allah Is the Judge
verses.translation: Had Allah willed, they would not have been polytheists. We have not appointed you as their keeper, nor are you their maintainer. Allah Is the Judge

verses.text: ˹O believers!˺ Do not insult what they invoke besides Allah or they will insult Allah spitefully out of ignorance. This is how We have made each people’s deeds appealing to them. Then to their Lord is their return, and He will inform them of what they used to do. Signs of No Use
verses.translation: ˹O believers!˺ Do not insult what they invoke besides Allah or they will insult Allah spitefully out of ignorance. This is how We have made each people’s deeds appealing to them. Then to their Lord is their return, and He will inform them of what they used to do. Signs of No Use

verses.text: They swear by Allah their most solemn oaths that if a sign were to come to them, they would certainly believe in it. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Signs are only with Allah.” What will make you ˹believers˺ realize that even if a sign were to come to them, they still would not believe?
verses.translation: They swear by Allah their most solemn oaths that if a sign were to come to them, they would certainly believe in it. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Signs are only with Allah.” What will make you ˹believers˺ realize that even if a sign were to come to them, they still would not believe?

verses.text: We turn their hearts and eyes away ˹from the truth˺ as they refused to believe at first, leaving them to wander blindly in their defiance.
verses.translation: We turn their hearts and eyes away ˹from the truth˺ as they refused to believe at first, leaving them to wander blindly in their defiance.

verses.text: Even if We had sent them the angels, made the dead speak to them, and assembled before their own eyes every sign ˹they demanded˺, they still would not have believed— unless Allah so willed. But most of them are ignorant ˹of this˺. The Deception
verses.translation: Even if We had sent them the angels, made the dead speak to them, and assembled before their own eyes every sign ˹they demanded˺, they still would not have believed— unless Allah so willed. But most of them are ignorant ˹of this˺. The Deception

verses.text: And so We have made for every prophet enemies—devilish humans and jinn—whispering to one another with elegant words of deception. Had it been your Lord’s Will, they would not have done such a thing. So leave them and their deceit,
verses.translation: And so We have made for every prophet enemies—devilish humans and jinn—whispering to one another with elegant words of deception. Had it been your Lord’s Will, they would not have done such a thing. So leave them and their deceit,

verses.text: so that the hearts of those who disbelieve in the Hereafter may be receptive to it, be pleased with it, and be persistent in their evil pursuits. The Perfect Book
verses.translation: so that the hearts of those who disbelieve in the Hereafter may be receptive to it, be pleased with it, and be persistent in their evil pursuits. The Perfect Book

verses.text: ˹Say, O Prophet,˺ “Should I seek a judge other than Allah while He is the One Who has revealed for you the Book ˹with the truth˺ perfectly explained?” Those who were given the Scripture know that it has been revealed ˹to you˺ from your Lord in truth. So do not be one of those who doubt.
verses.translation: ˹Say, O Prophet,˺ “Should I seek a judge other than Allah while He is the One Who has revealed for you the Book ˹with the truth˺ perfectly explained?” Those who were given the Scripture know that it has been revealed ˹to you˺ from your Lord in truth. So do not be one of those who doubt.

verses.text: The Word of your Lord has been perfected in truth and justice. None can change His Words. And He is the All-Hearing, All- Knowing. Most Are Deviant
verses.translation: The Word of your Lord has been perfected in truth and justice. None can change His Words. And He is the All-Hearing, All- Knowing. Most Are Deviant

verses.text: ˹O Prophet!˺ If you were to obey most of those on earth, they would lead you away from Allah’s Way. They follow nothing but assumptions and do nothing but lie.
verses.translation: ˹O Prophet!˺ If you were to obey most of those on earth, they would lead you away from Allah’s Way. They follow nothing but assumptions and do nothing but lie.

verses.text: Indeed, your Lord knows best who has strayed from His Way and who is ˹rightly˺ guided. Lawful and Unlawful Meat
verses.translation: Indeed, your Lord knows best who has strayed from His Way and who is ˹rightly˺ guided. Lawful and Unlawful Meat

verses.text: So eat only of what is slaughtered in Allah’s Name if you truly believe in His revelations.
verses.translation: So eat only of what is slaughtered in Allah’s Name if you truly believe in His revelations.

verses.text: Why should you not eat of what is slaughtered in Allah’s Name when He has already explained to you what He has forbidden to you—except when compelled by necessity? Many ˹deviants˺ certainly mislead others by their whims out of ignorance. Surely your Lord knows the transgressors best.
verses.translation: Why should you not eat of what is slaughtered in Allah’s Name when He has already explained to you what He has forbidden to you—except when compelled by necessity? Many ˹deviants˺ certainly mislead others by their whims out of ignorance. Surely your Lord knows the transgressors best.

verses.text: Shun all sin—open and secret. Indeed, those who commit sin will be punished for what they earn.
verses.translation: Shun all sin—open and secret. Indeed, those who commit sin will be punished for what they earn.

verses.text: Do not eat of what is not slaughtered in Allah’s Name. For that would certainly be ˹an act of˺ disobedience. Surely the devils whisper to their ˹human˺ associates to argue with you.[292] If you were to obey them, then you ˹too˺ would be polytheists. Metaphor for Believers and Disbelievers
verses.translation: Do not eat of what is not slaughtered in Allah’s Name. For that would certainly be ˹an act of˺ disobedience. Surely the devils whisper to their ˹human˺ associates to argue with you.[292] If you were to obey them, then you ˹too˺ would be polytheists. Metaphor for Believers and Disbelievers

verses.text: Can those who had been dead, to whom We gave life and a light with which they can walk among people, be compared to those in complete darkness from which they can never emerge?[293] That is how the misdeeds of the disbelievers have been made appealing to them.
verses.translation: Can those who had been dead, to whom We gave life and a light with which they can walk among people, be compared to those in complete darkness from which they can never emerge?[293] That is how the misdeeds of the disbelievers have been made appealing to them.

verses.text: And so We have placed in every society the most wicked to conspire in it. Yet they plot only against themselves, but they fail to perceive it. Craving Prophethood
verses.translation: And so We have placed in every society the most wicked to conspire in it. Yet they plot only against themselves, but they fail to perceive it. Craving Prophethood

verses.text: Whenever a sign comes to them, they say, “We will never believe until we receive what Allah’s messengers received.” Allah knows best where to place His message. The wicked will soon be overwhelmed by humiliation from Allah and a severe punishment for their evil plots. Open and Restricted Hearts
verses.translation: Whenever a sign comes to them, they say, “We will never believe until we receive what Allah’s messengers received.” Allah knows best where to place His message. The wicked will soon be overwhelmed by humiliation from Allah and a severe punishment for their evil plots. Open and Restricted Hearts

verses.text: Whoever Allah wills to guide, He opens their heart to Islam.[294] But whoever He wills to leave astray, He makes their chest tight and constricted as if they were climbing up into the sky. This is how Allah dooms those who disbelieve.
verses.translation: Whoever Allah wills to guide, He opens their heart to Islam.[294] But whoever He wills to leave astray, He makes their chest tight and constricted as if they were climbing up into the sky. This is how Allah dooms those who disbelieve.

verses.text: That is your Lord’s Path—perfectly straight. We have already made the signs clear to those who are mindful.
verses.translation: That is your Lord’s Path—perfectly straight. We have already made the signs clear to those who are mindful.

verses.text: They will have the Home of Peace with their Lord, Who will be their Guardian because of what they used to do. Humans and Jinn on Judgment Day
verses.translation: They will have the Home of Peace with their Lord, Who will be their Guardian because of what they used to do. Humans and Jinn on Judgment Day

verses.text: ˹Consider˺ the Day He will gather them ˹all˺ together and say, “O assembly of jinn! You misled humans in great numbers.” And their human associates will say, “Our Lord! We benefited from each other’s company, [295] but now we have reached the term which You appointed for us.” ˹Then˺ He will say, “The Fire is your home, yours to stay in forever, except whoever Allah wills to spare.”[296] Surely your Lord is All-Wise, All- Knowing.
verses.translation: ˹Consider˺ the Day He will gather them ˹all˺ together and say, “O assembly of jinn! You misled humans in great numbers.” And their human associates will say, “Our Lord! We benefited from each other’s company, [295] but now we have reached the term which You appointed for us.” ˹Then˺ He will say, “The Fire is your home, yours to stay in forever, except whoever Allah wills to spare.”[296] Surely your Lord is All-Wise, All- Knowing.

verses.text: This is how We make the wrongdoers ˹destructive˺ allies of one another because of their misdeeds. Confession of Evil Humans and Jinn
verses.translation: This is how We make the wrongdoers ˹destructive˺ allies of one another because of their misdeeds. Confession of Evil Humans and Jinn

verses.text: ˹Allah will ask,˺ “O assembly of jinn and humans! Did messengers not come from among you, proclaiming My revelations and warning you of the coming of this Day of yours?” They will say, “We confess against ourselves!” For they have been deluded by ˹their˺ worldly life. And they will testify against themselves that they were disbelievers.
verses.translation: ˹Allah will ask,˺ “O assembly of jinn and humans! Did messengers not come from among you, proclaiming My revelations and warning you of the coming of this Day of yours?” They will say, “We confess against ourselves!” For they have been deluded by ˹their˺ worldly life. And they will testify against themselves that they were disbelievers.

verses.text: This ˹sending of the messengers˺ is because your Lord would never destroy a society for their wrongdoing while its people are unaware ˹of the truth˺. The Good and the Evil
verses.translation: This ˹sending of the messengers˺ is because your Lord would never destroy a society for their wrongdoing while its people are unaware ˹of the truth˺. The Good and the Evil

verses.text: They will each be assigned ranks according to their deeds. And your Lord is not unaware of what they do. Allah Is Not in Need of His Creation
verses.translation: They will each be assigned ranks according to their deeds. And your Lord is not unaware of what they do. Allah Is Not in Need of His Creation

verses.text: Your Lord is the Self-Sufficient, Full of Mercy. If He wills, He can do away with you and replace you with whoever He wills, just as He produced you from the offspring of other people.
verses.translation: Your Lord is the Self-Sufficient, Full of Mercy. If He wills, He can do away with you and replace you with whoever He wills, just as He produced you from the offspring of other people.

verses.text: Indeed, what you have been promised will certainly come to pass. And you will have no escape. Warning to Meccan Pagans
verses.translation: Indeed, what you have been promised will certainly come to pass. And you will have no escape. Warning to Meccan Pagans

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “O my people! Persist in your ways, for I ˹too˺ will persist in mine. You will soon know who will fare best in the end. Indeed, the wrongdoers will never succeed.” Unfair Giving[297]
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “O my people! Persist in your ways, for I ˹too˺ will persist in mine. You will soon know who will fare best in the end. Indeed, the wrongdoers will never succeed.” Unfair Giving[297]

verses.text: The pagans set aside for Allah a share of the crops and cattle He created, saying, “This ˹portion˺ is for Allah,” so they claim, “and this ˹one˺ for our associate-gods.” Yet the portion of their associate-gods is not shared with Allah while Allah’s portion is shared with their associate-gods. What unfair judgment! Self-Destruction[298]
verses.translation: The pagans set aside for Allah a share of the crops and cattle He created, saying, “This ˹portion˺ is for Allah,” so they claim, “and this ˹one˺ for our associate-gods.” Yet the portion of their associate-gods is not shared with Allah while Allah’s portion is shared with their associate-gods. What unfair judgment! Self-Destruction[298]

verses.text: Likewise, the pagans’ evil associates have made it appealing to them to kill their own children—only leading to their destruction as well as confusion in their faith. Had it been Allah’s Will, they would not have done such a thing. So leave them and their falsehood. Idols’ Share in Cattle and Crops
verses.translation: Likewise, the pagans’ evil associates have made it appealing to them to kill their own children—only leading to their destruction as well as confusion in their faith. Had it been Allah’s Will, they would not have done such a thing. So leave them and their falsehood. Idols’ Share in Cattle and Crops

verses.text: They say, “These cattle and crops are reserved—none may eat them except those we permit,” so they claim. Some other cattle are exempted from labour and others are not slaughtered in Allah’s Name—falsely attributing lies to Him. He will repay them for their lies.
verses.translation: They say, “These cattle and crops are reserved—none may eat them except those we permit,” so they claim. Some other cattle are exempted from labour and others are not slaughtered in Allah’s Name—falsely attributing lies to Him. He will repay them for their lies.

verses.text: They ˹also˺ say, “The offspring of this cattle is reserved for our males and forbidden to our females; but if it is stillborn, they may all share it.” He will repay them for their falsehood. Surely He is All-Wise, All-Knowing. Lost in Ignorance
verses.translation: They ˹also˺ say, “The offspring of this cattle is reserved for our males and forbidden to our females; but if it is stillborn, they may all share it.” He will repay them for their falsehood. Surely He is All-Wise, All-Knowing. Lost in Ignorance

verses.text: Lost indeed are those who have murdered their own children foolishly out of ignorance and have forbidden what Allah has provided for them— falsely attributing lies to Allah. They have certainly strayed and are not ˹rightly˺ guided. Allah’s Bounties
verses.translation: Lost indeed are those who have murdered their own children foolishly out of ignorance and have forbidden what Allah has provided for them— falsely attributing lies to Allah. They have certainly strayed and are not ˹rightly˺ guided. Allah’s Bounties

verses.text: He is the One Who produces gardens—both cultivated and wild[299]— and palm trees, crops of different flavours, olives, and pomegranates— similar ˹in shape˺, but dissimilar ˹in taste˺. Eat from the fruit they bear and pay the dues at harvest, but do not waste. Surely He does not like the wasteful. Four Pairs of Cattle, Male and Female[300]
verses.translation: He is the One Who produces gardens—both cultivated and wild[299]— and palm trees, crops of different flavours, olives, and pomegranates— similar ˹in shape˺, but dissimilar ˹in taste˺. Eat from the fruit they bear and pay the dues at harvest, but do not waste. Surely He does not like the wasteful. Four Pairs of Cattle, Male and Female[300]

verses.text: Some cattle are fit for labour, others are too small.[301] Eat of what Allah has provided for you and do not follow Satan’s footsteps. Certainly, he is your sworn enemy.
verses.translation: Some cattle are fit for labour, others are too small.[301] Eat of what Allah has provided for you and do not follow Satan’s footsteps. Certainly, he is your sworn enemy.

verses.text: ˹Allah has created˺ four pairs: a pair of sheep and a pair of goats—ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Has He forbidden ˹to you˺ the two males or the two females or what is in the wombs of the two females? Tell me with knowledge, if what you say is true.”—
verses.translation: ˹Allah has created˺ four pairs: a pair of sheep and a pair of goats—ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Has He forbidden ˹to you˺ the two males or the two females or what is in the wombs of the two females? Tell me with knowledge, if what you say is true.”—

verses.text: and a pair of camels and a pair of oxen. Ask ˹them˺, “Has He forbidden ˹to you˺ the two males or the two females or what is in the wombs of the two females? Or were you present when Allah gave you this commandment?” Who does more wrong than those who fabricate lies against Allah to mislead others without ˹any˺ knowledge? Surely Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people. Meat Forbidden to Muslims
verses.translation: and a pair of camels and a pair of oxen. Ask ˹them˺, “Has He forbidden ˹to you˺ the two males or the two females or what is in the wombs of the two females? Or were you present when Allah gave you this commandment?” Who does more wrong than those who fabricate lies against Allah to mislead others without ˹any˺ knowledge? Surely Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people. Meat Forbidden to Muslims

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I do not find in what has been revealed to me anything forbidden to eat except carrion, running blood, swine—which is impure—or a sinful offering in the name of any other than Allah. But if someone is compelled by necessity—neither driven by desire nor exceeding immediate need—then surely your Lord is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.” Meat Forbidden to Jews
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I do not find in what has been revealed to me anything forbidden to eat except carrion, running blood, swine—which is impure—or a sinful offering in the name of any other than Allah. But if someone is compelled by necessity—neither driven by desire nor exceeding immediate need—then surely your Lord is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.” Meat Forbidden to Jews

verses.text: For those who are Jewish, We forbade every animal with undivided hoofs and the fat of oxen and sheep except what is joined to their backs or intestines or mixed with bone. In this way We rewarded them for their violations. And We are certainly truthful.
verses.translation: For those who are Jewish, We forbade every animal with undivided hoofs and the fat of oxen and sheep except what is joined to their backs or intestines or mixed with bone. In this way We rewarded them for their violations. And We are certainly truthful.

verses.text: But if they deny you ˹O Prophet˺, say, “Your Lord is infinite in mercy, yet His punishment will not be averted from the wicked people.” Free Choice
verses.translation: But if they deny you ˹O Prophet˺, say, “Your Lord is infinite in mercy, yet His punishment will not be averted from the wicked people.” Free Choice

verses.text: The polytheists will argue, “Had it been Allah’s Will, neither we nor our forefathers would have associated others with Him ˹in worship˺ or made anything unlawful.” Likewise, those before them rejected the truth until they tasted Our punishment. Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Do you have any knowledge that you can produce for us? Surely you follow nothing but ˹false˺ assumptions and you do nothing but lie.”
verses.translation: The polytheists will argue, “Had it been Allah’s Will, neither we nor our forefathers would have associated others with Him ˹in worship˺ or made anything unlawful.” Likewise, those before them rejected the truth until they tasted Our punishment. Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Do you have any knowledge that you can produce for us? Surely you follow nothing but ˹false˺ assumptions and you do nothing but lie.”

verses.text: Say, “Allah has the most conclusive argument. Had it been His Will, He would have easily imposed guidance upon all of you.”
verses.translation: Say, “Allah has the most conclusive argument. Had it been His Will, He would have easily imposed guidance upon all of you.”

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Bring your witnesses who can testify that Allah has forbidden this.” If they ˹falsely˺ testify, do not testify with them. And do not follow the desires of those who deny Our proofs, disbelieve in the Hereafter, and set up equals with their Lord. Allah’s Commandments
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Bring your witnesses who can testify that Allah has forbidden this.” If they ˹falsely˺ testify, do not testify with them. And do not follow the desires of those who deny Our proofs, disbelieve in the Hereafter, and set up equals with their Lord. Allah’s Commandments

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Come! Let me recite to you what your Lord has forbidden to you: do not associate others with Him ˹in worship˺. ˹Do not fail to˺ honour your parents. Do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for you and for them. Do not come near indecencies, openly or secretly. Do not take a ˹human˺ life—made sacred by Allah—except with ˹legal˺ right.[302] This is what He has commanded you, so perhaps you will understand.
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Come! Let me recite to you what your Lord has forbidden to you: do not associate others with Him ˹in worship˺. ˹Do not fail to˺ honour your parents. Do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for you and for them. Do not come near indecencies, openly or secretly. Do not take a ˹human˺ life—made sacred by Allah—except with ˹legal˺ right.[302] This is what He has commanded you, so perhaps you will understand.

verses.text: And do not come near the wealth of the orphan—unless intending to enhance it—until they attain maturity. Give full measure and weigh with justice. We never require of any soul more than what it can afford. Whenever you speak,[303] maintain justice—even regarding a close relative. And fulfil your covenant with Allah. This is what He has commanded you, so perhaps you will be mindful.
verses.translation: And do not come near the wealth of the orphan—unless intending to enhance it—until they attain maturity. Give full measure and weigh with justice. We never require of any soul more than what it can afford. Whenever you speak,[303] maintain justice—even regarding a close relative. And fulfil your covenant with Allah. This is what He has commanded you, so perhaps you will be mindful.

verses.text: Indeed, that is My Path—perfectly straight. So follow it and do not follow other ways, for they will lead you away from His Way. This is what He has commanded you, so perhaps you will be conscious ˹of Allah˺.” The Torah
verses.translation: Indeed, that is My Path—perfectly straight. So follow it and do not follow other ways, for they will lead you away from His Way. This is what He has commanded you, so perhaps you will be conscious ˹of Allah˺.” The Torah

verses.text: Additionally, We gave Moses the Scripture, completing the favour upon those who do good, detailing everything, and as a guide and a mercy, so perhaps they would be certain of the meeting with their Lord. The Quran
verses.translation: Additionally, We gave Moses the Scripture, completing the favour upon those who do good, detailing everything, and as a guide and a mercy, so perhaps they would be certain of the meeting with their Lord. The Quran

verses.text: This is a blessed Book We have revealed. So follow it and be mindful ˹of Allah˺, so you may be shown mercy.
verses.translation: This is a blessed Book We have revealed. So follow it and be mindful ˹of Allah˺, so you may be shown mercy.

verses.text: You ˹pagans˺ can no longer say, “Scriptures were only revealed to two groups before us and we were unaware of their teachings.”
verses.translation: You ˹pagans˺ can no longer say, “Scriptures were only revealed to two groups before us and we were unaware of their teachings.”

verses.text: Nor can you say, “If only the Scriptures had been revealed to us, we would have been better guided than they.” Now there has come to you from your Lord a clear proof[304]—a guide and mercy. Who then does more wrong than those who deny Allah’s revelations and turn away from them? We will reward those who turn away from Our revelations with a dreadful punishment for turning away. Waiting for the Apocalypse?
verses.translation: Nor can you say, “If only the Scriptures had been revealed to us, we would have been better guided than they.” Now there has come to you from your Lord a clear proof[304]—a guide and mercy. Who then does more wrong than those who deny Allah’s revelations and turn away from them? We will reward those who turn away from Our revelations with a dreadful punishment for turning away. Waiting for the Apocalypse?

verses.text: Are they awaiting the coming of the angels, or your Lord ˹Himself˺, or some of your Lord’s ˹major˺ signs? On the Day your Lord’s signs arrive, belief will not benefit those who did not believe earlier or those who did no good through their faith.[305] Say, “Keep waiting! We too are waiting.” Not Responsible
verses.translation: Are they awaiting the coming of the angels, or your Lord ˹Himself˺, or some of your Lord’s ˹major˺ signs? On the Day your Lord’s signs arrive, belief will not benefit those who did not believe earlier or those who did no good through their faith.[305] Say, “Keep waiting! We too are waiting.” Not Responsible

verses.text: Indeed, you ˹O Prophet˺ are not responsible whatsoever for those who have divided their faith and split into sects. Their judgment rests only with Allah. And He will inform them of what they used to do. Reward for Good and Evil Deeds
verses.translation: Indeed, you ˹O Prophet˺ are not responsible whatsoever for those who have divided their faith and split into sects. Their judgment rests only with Allah. And He will inform them of what they used to do. Reward for Good and Evil Deeds

verses.text: Whoever comes with a good deed will be rewarded tenfold. But whoever comes with a bad deed will be punished for only one. None will be wronged. Way of Life
verses.translation: Whoever comes with a good deed will be rewarded tenfold. But whoever comes with a bad deed will be punished for only one. None will be wronged. Way of Life

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Surely my Lord has guided me to the Straight Path, a perfect way, the faith of Abraham, the upright, who was not one of the polytheists.”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Surely my Lord has guided me to the Straight Path, a perfect way, the faith of Abraham, the upright, who was not one of the polytheists.”

verses.text: Say, “Surely my prayer, my worship, my life, and my death are all for Allah—Lord of all worlds.
verses.translation: Say, “Surely my prayer, my worship, my life, and my death are all for Allah—Lord of all worlds.

verses.text: He has no partner. So I am commanded, and so I am the first to submit.” Divine Justice
verses.translation: He has no partner. So I am commanded, and so I am the first to submit.” Divine Justice

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Should I seek a lord other than Allah while He is the Lord of everything?” No one will reap except what they sow. No soul burdened with sin will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you of your differences. Test of Life
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Should I seek a lord other than Allah while He is the Lord of everything?” No one will reap except what they sow. No soul burdened with sin will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you of your differences. Test of Life

verses.text: He is the One Who has placed you as successors on earth and elevated some of you in rank over others, so He may test you with what He has given you. Surely your Lord is swift in punishment, but He is certainly All- Forgiving, Most Merciful. *** -- 142 of 694 --

name: The Heights
intro: This sûrah takes its name from the heights mentioned in verse 46. Like many other Meccan sûrahs, it recounts the stories of earlier prophets who were denied by their own people and how the deniers were eventually destroyed. As mentioned in the previous sûrah (6:10-11), these stories are meant to reassure the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) and warn his people of Allah’s torment. The story of Satan’s arrogance and Adam’s temptation and fall are detailed, along with lessons for the believers to beware of Satan’s whispers. Details about Paradise and Hell (verses 36-53) here are unmatched by any previous sûrah. The powerlessness of idols is further emphasized. Full obedience to Allah and His prophets is stressed in this sûrah and the next. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Advice to the Prophet

verses.text: Alif-Lãm-Mĩm- Ṣãd.
verses.translation: Alif-Lãm-Mĩm- Ṣãd.

verses.text: ˹This is˺ a Book sent down to you ˹O Prophet˺— do not let anxiety into your heart regarding it—so with it you may warn ˹the disbelievers˺, and as a reminder to the believers. Advice to Humanity
verses.translation: ˹This is˺ a Book sent down to you ˹O Prophet˺— do not let anxiety into your heart regarding it—so with it you may warn ˹the disbelievers˺, and as a reminder to the believers. Advice to Humanity

verses.text: Follow what has been sent down to you from your Lord, and do not take others as guardians besides Him. How seldom are you mindful!
verses.translation: Follow what has been sent down to you from your Lord, and do not take others as guardians besides Him. How seldom are you mindful!

verses.text: ˹Imagine˺ how many societies We have destroyed! Our torment took them by surprise ˹while sleeping˺ at night or midday.
verses.translation: ˹Imagine˺ how many societies We have destroyed! Our torment took them by surprise ˹while sleeping˺ at night or midday.

verses.text: Their only cry—when overwhelmed by Our torment—was, “We have indeed been wrongdoers.” Response to Messengers
verses.translation: Their only cry—when overwhelmed by Our torment—was, “We have indeed been wrongdoers.” Response to Messengers

verses.text: We will surely question those who received messengers and We will question the messengers ˹themselves˺.
verses.translation: We will surely question those who received messengers and We will question the messengers ˹themselves˺.

verses.text: Then We will give them a full account with sure knowledge—for We were never absent. Weighing Deeds on Judgment Day
verses.translation: Then We will give them a full account with sure knowledge—for We were never absent. Weighing Deeds on Judgment Day

verses.text: The weighing on that Day will be just. As for those whose scale will be heavy ˹with good deeds˺, ˹only˺ they will be successful.
verses.translation: The weighing on that Day will be just. As for those whose scale will be heavy ˹with good deeds˺, ˹only˺ they will be successful.

verses.text: But those whose scale is light, they have doomed themselves for wrongfully denying Our signs. Satan’s Arrogance
verses.translation: But those whose scale is light, they have doomed themselves for wrongfully denying Our signs. Satan’s Arrogance

verses.text: We have indeed established you on earth and provided you with a means of livelihood. ˹Yet˺ you seldom give any thanks.
verses.translation: We have indeed established you on earth and provided you with a means of livelihood. ˹Yet˺ you seldom give any thanks.

verses.text: Surely We created you,[306] then shaped you, then said to the angels, “Prostrate before Adam,” so they all did—but not Iblîs,[307] who refused to prostrate with the others.
verses.translation: Surely We created you,[306] then shaped you, then said to the angels, “Prostrate before Adam,” so they all did—but not Iblîs,[307] who refused to prostrate with the others.

verses.text: Allah asked, “What prevented you from prostrating when I commanded you?” He replied, “I am better than he is: You created me from fire and him from clay.”
verses.translation: Allah asked, “What prevented you from prostrating when I commanded you?” He replied, “I am better than he is: You created me from fire and him from clay.”

verses.text: Allah said, “Then get down from Paradise! It is not for you to be arrogant here. So get out! You are truly one of the disgraced.”
verses.translation: Allah said, “Then get down from Paradise! It is not for you to be arrogant here. So get out! You are truly one of the disgraced.”

verses.text: He appealed, “Then delay my end until the Day of their resurrection.”
verses.translation: He appealed, “Then delay my end until the Day of their resurrection.”

verses.text: Allah said, “You are delayed ˹until the appointed Day˺.”[308]
verses.translation: Allah said, “You are delayed ˹until the appointed Day˺.”[308]

verses.text: He said, “For leaving me to stray I will lie in ambush for them on Your Straight Path.
verses.translation: He said, “For leaving me to stray I will lie in ambush for them on Your Straight Path.

verses.text: I will approach them from their front, their back, their right, their left, and then You will find most of them ungrateful.”
verses.translation: I will approach them from their front, their back, their right, their left, and then You will find most of them ungrateful.”

verses.text: Allah said, “Get out of Paradise! You are disgraced and rejected! I will certainly fill up Hell with you and your followers all together.” Adam and Eve: Temptation and Fall
verses.translation: Allah said, “Get out of Paradise! You are disgraced and rejected! I will certainly fill up Hell with you and your followers all together.” Adam and Eve: Temptation and Fall

verses.text: ˹Allah said,˺ “O Adam! Live with your wife in Paradise and eat from wherever you please, but do not approach this tree, or else you will be wrongdoers.”
verses.translation: ˹Allah said,˺ “O Adam! Live with your wife in Paradise and eat from wherever you please, but do not approach this tree, or else you will be wrongdoers.”

verses.text: Then Satan tempted them in order to expose what was hidden of their nakedness. He said, “Your Lord has forbidden this tree to you only to prevent you from becoming angels or immortals.”
verses.translation: Then Satan tempted them in order to expose what was hidden of their nakedness. He said, “Your Lord has forbidden this tree to you only to prevent you from becoming angels or immortals.”

verses.text: And he swore to them, “I am truly your sincere advisor.”
verses.translation: And he swore to them, “I am truly your sincere advisor.”

verses.text: So he brought about their fall through deception. And when they tasted of the tree, their nakedness was exposed to them, prompting them to cover themselves with leaves from Paradise. Then their Lord called out to them, “Did I not forbid you from that tree and ˹did I not˺ tell you that Satan is your sworn enemy?”
verses.translation: So he brought about their fall through deception. And when they tasted of the tree, their nakedness was exposed to them, prompting them to cover themselves with leaves from Paradise. Then their Lord called out to them, “Did I not forbid you from that tree and ˹did I not˺ tell you that Satan is your sworn enemy?”

verses.text: They replied, “Our Lord! We have wronged ourselves. If You do not forgive us and have mercy on us, we will certainly be losers.”
verses.translation: They replied, “Our Lord! We have wronged ourselves. If You do not forgive us and have mercy on us, we will certainly be losers.”

verses.text: Allah said, “Descend as enemies to each other.[309] You will find in the earth a residence and provision for your appointed stay.”
verses.translation: Allah said, “Descend as enemies to each other.[309] You will find in the earth a residence and provision for your appointed stay.”

verses.text: He added, “There you will live, there you will die, and from there you will be resurrected.” Best Clothing
verses.translation: He added, “There you will live, there you will die, and from there you will be resurrected.” Best Clothing

verses.text: O children of Adam! We have provided for you clothing to cover your nakedness and as an adornment. However, the best clothing is righteousness. This is one of Allah’s bounties, so perhaps you will be mindful. Warning Against Satan
verses.translation: O children of Adam! We have provided for you clothing to cover your nakedness and as an adornment. However, the best clothing is righteousness. This is one of Allah’s bounties, so perhaps you will be mindful. Warning Against Satan

verses.text: O children of Adam! Do not let Satan deceive you as he tempted your parents out of Paradise and caused their cover to be removed in order to expose their nakedness. Surely he and his soldiers watch you from where you cannot see them. We have made the devils allies of those who disbelieve.
verses.translation: O children of Adam! Do not let Satan deceive you as he tempted your parents out of Paradise and caused their cover to be removed in order to expose their nakedness. Surely he and his soldiers watch you from where you cannot see them. We have made the devils allies of those who disbelieve.

verses.text: Whenever they commit a shameful deed,[310] they say, “We found our forefathers doing it and Allah has commanded us to do it.” Say, “No! Allah never commands what is shameful. How can you attribute to Allah what you do not know?”
verses.translation: Whenever they commit a shameful deed,[310] they say, “We found our forefathers doing it and Allah has commanded us to do it.” Say, “No! Allah never commands what is shameful. How can you attribute to Allah what you do not know?”

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “My Lord has commanded uprightness and dedication ˹to Him alone˺ in worship, calling upon Him with sincere devotion. Just as He first brought you into being, you will be brought to life again.”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “My Lord has commanded uprightness and dedication ˹to Him alone˺ in worship, calling upon Him with sincere devotion. Just as He first brought you into being, you will be brought to life again.”

verses.text: He has guided some, while others are destined to stray. They have taken devils as their masters instead of Allah— thinking they are ˹rightly˺ guided. The Lawful and the Forbidden
verses.translation: He has guided some, while others are destined to stray. They have taken devils as their masters instead of Allah— thinking they are ˹rightly˺ guided. The Lawful and the Forbidden

verses.text: O Children of Adam! Dress properly whenever you are at worship. Eat and drink, but do not waste. Surely He does not like the wasteful.
verses.translation: O Children of Adam! Dress properly whenever you are at worship. Eat and drink, but do not waste. Surely He does not like the wasteful.

verses.text: Ask, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Who has forbidden the adornments and lawful provisions Allah has brought forth for His servants?” Say, “They are for the enjoyment of the believers in this worldly life, but they will be exclusively theirs on the Day of Judgment.[311] This is how We make Our revelations clear for people of knowledge.”
verses.translation: Ask, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Who has forbidden the adornments and lawful provisions Allah has brought forth for His servants?” Say, “They are for the enjoyment of the believers in this worldly life, but they will be exclusively theirs on the Day of Judgment.[311] This is how We make Our revelations clear for people of knowledge.”

verses.text: Say, “My Lord has only forbidden open and secret indecencies, sinfulness, unjust aggression, associating ˹others˺ with Allah ˹in worship˺—a practice He has never authorized—and attributing to Allah what you do not know.”
verses.translation: Say, “My Lord has only forbidden open and secret indecencies, sinfulness, unjust aggression, associating ˹others˺ with Allah ˹in worship˺—a practice He has never authorized—and attributing to Allah what you do not know.”

verses.text: For each community there is an appointed term. When their time arrives, they can neither delay it for a moment, nor could they advance it. Receiving the Truth
verses.translation: For each community there is an appointed term. When their time arrives, they can neither delay it for a moment, nor could they advance it. Receiving the Truth

verses.text: O children of Adam! When messengers from among yourselves come to you reciting My revelations—whoever shuns evil and mends their ways, there will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve.
verses.translation: O children of Adam! When messengers from among yourselves come to you reciting My revelations—whoever shuns evil and mends their ways, there will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve.

verses.text: But those who receive Our revelations with denial and arrogance will be the residents of the Fire. They will be there forever. Evil Leaders and Their Followers
verses.translation: But those who receive Our revelations with denial and arrogance will be the residents of the Fire. They will be there forever. Evil Leaders and Their Followers

verses.text: Who does more wrong than those who fabricate lies against Allah or deny His revelations? They will receive what is destined for them,[312] until Our messenger-angels arrive to take their souls, asking them, “Where are those ˹false gods˺ you used to invoke besides Allah?” They will cry, “They have failed us,” and they will confess against themselves that they were indeed disbelievers.
verses.translation: Who does more wrong than those who fabricate lies against Allah or deny His revelations? They will receive what is destined for them,[312] until Our messenger-angels arrive to take their souls, asking them, “Where are those ˹false gods˺ you used to invoke besides Allah?” They will cry, “They have failed us,” and they will confess against themselves that they were indeed disbelievers.

verses.text: Allah will say, “Enter the Fire along with the ˹evil˺ groups of jinn and humans that preceded you.” Whenever a group enters Hell, it will curse the preceding one until they are all gathered inside, the followers will say about their leaders, “Our Lord! They have misled us, so multiply their torment in the Fire.” He will answer, “It has already been multiplied for all, but you do not know.”
verses.translation: Allah will say, “Enter the Fire along with the ˹evil˺ groups of jinn and humans that preceded you.” Whenever a group enters Hell, it will curse the preceding one until they are all gathered inside, the followers will say about their leaders, “Our Lord! They have misled us, so multiply their torment in the Fire.” He will answer, “It has already been multiplied for all, but you do not know.”

verses.text: Then the leaders will say to their followers, “You were no better than us! So taste the torment for what you used to commit.” Punishment of the Disbelievers
verses.translation: Then the leaders will say to their followers, “You were no better than us! So taste the torment for what you used to commit.” Punishment of the Disbelievers

verses.text: Surely those who receive our revelations with denial and arrogance, the gates of heaven will not be opened for them, nor will they enter Paradise until a camel passes through the eye of a needle. This is how We reward the wicked.
verses.translation: Surely those who receive our revelations with denial and arrogance, the gates of heaven will not be opened for them, nor will they enter Paradise until a camel passes through the eye of a needle. This is how We reward the wicked.

verses.text: Hell will be their bed; flames will be their cover. This is how We reward the wrongdoers. Reward of the Believers
verses.translation: Hell will be their bed; flames will be their cover. This is how We reward the wrongdoers. Reward of the Believers

verses.text: As for those who believe and do good—We never require of any soul more than what it can afford—it is they who will be the residents of Paradise. They will be there forever.
verses.translation: As for those who believe and do good—We never require of any soul more than what it can afford—it is they who will be the residents of Paradise. They will be there forever.

verses.text: We will remove whatever bitterness they had in their hearts.[313] Rivers will flow under their feet. And they will say, “Praise be to Allah for guiding us to this. We would have never been guided if Allah had not guided us. The messengers of our Lord had certainly come with the truth.” It will be announced to them, “This is Paradise awarded to you for what you used to do.” The Lord’s Promise
verses.translation: We will remove whatever bitterness they had in their hearts.[313] Rivers will flow under their feet. And they will say, “Praise be to Allah for guiding us to this. We would have never been guided if Allah had not guided us. The messengers of our Lord had certainly come with the truth.” It will be announced to them, “This is Paradise awarded to you for what you used to do.” The Lord’s Promise

verses.text: The residents of Paradise will call out to the residents of the Fire, “We have certainly found our Lord’s promise to be true. Have you too found your Lord’s promise to be true?” They will reply, “Yes, we have!” Then a caller will announce to both, “May Allah’s condemnation be upon the wrongdoers,
verses.translation: The residents of Paradise will call out to the residents of the Fire, “We have certainly found our Lord’s promise to be true. Have you too found your Lord’s promise to be true?” They will reply, “Yes, we have!” Then a caller will announce to both, “May Allah’s condemnation be upon the wrongdoers,

verses.text: those who hindered ˹others˺ from Allah’s Way, strived to make it ˹appear˺ crooked, and disbelieved in the Hereafter.” People on the Heights[314]
verses.translation: those who hindered ˹others˺ from Allah’s Way, strived to make it ˹appear˺ crooked, and disbelieved in the Hereafter.” People on the Heights[314]

verses.text: There will be a barrier between Paradise and Hell. And on the heights ˹of that barrier˺ will be people[315] who will recognize ˹the residents of˺ both by their appearance.[316] They will call out to the residents of Paradise, “Peace be upon you!” They will have not yet entered Paradise, but eagerly hope to.
verses.translation: There will be a barrier between Paradise and Hell. And on the heights ˹of that barrier˺ will be people[315] who will recognize ˹the residents of˺ both by their appearance.[316] They will call out to the residents of Paradise, “Peace be upon you!” They will have not yet entered Paradise, but eagerly hope to.

verses.text: When their eyes will turn towards the residents of Hell, they will pray, “Our Lord! Do not join us with the wrongdoing people.”
verses.translation: When their eyes will turn towards the residents of Hell, they will pray, “Our Lord! Do not join us with the wrongdoing people.”

verses.text: Those on the heights will call out to some ˹tyrants in the Fire˺, who they will recognize by their appearance, saying, “Your large numbers and arrogance are of no use ˹today˺!
verses.translation: Those on the heights will call out to some ˹tyrants in the Fire˺, who they will recognize by their appearance, saying, “Your large numbers and arrogance are of no use ˹today˺!

verses.text: Are these ˹humble believers˺ the ones you swore would never be shown Allah’s mercy?” ˹Finally, those on the heights will be told:˺ “Enter Paradise! There will be no fear for you, nor will you grieve.” Disbelievers Begging Believers
verses.translation: Are these ˹humble believers˺ the ones you swore would never be shown Allah’s mercy?” ˹Finally, those on the heights will be told:˺ “Enter Paradise! There will be no fear for you, nor will you grieve.” Disbelievers Begging Believers

verses.text: The residents of the Fire will then cry out to the residents of Paradise, “Aid us with some water or any provision Allah has granted you.” They will reply, “Allah has forbidden both to the disbelievers,
verses.translation: The residents of the Fire will then cry out to the residents of Paradise, “Aid us with some water or any provision Allah has granted you.” They will reply, “Allah has forbidden both to the disbelievers,

verses.text: those who took this[317] faith ˹of Islam˺ as mere amusement and play and were deluded by ˹their˺ worldly life.” ˹Allah will say,˺ “Today We will ignore them just as they ignored the coming of this Day of theirs and for rejecting Our revelations.” Too Late
verses.translation: those who took this[317] faith ˹of Islam˺ as mere amusement and play and were deluded by ˹their˺ worldly life.” ˹Allah will say,˺ “Today We will ignore them just as they ignored the coming of this Day of theirs and for rejecting Our revelations.” Too Late

verses.text: We have certainly brought them a Book which We explained with knowledge—a guide and mercy for those who believe.
verses.translation: We have certainly brought them a Book which We explained with knowledge—a guide and mercy for those who believe.

verses.text: Do they only await the fulfilment ˹of its warning˺? The Day it will be fulfilled, those who ignored it before will say, “The messengers of our Lord certainly came with the truth. Are there any intercessors who can plead on our behalf? Or can we be sent back so we may do ˹good,˺ unlike what we used to do?” They will have certainly ruined themselves, and whatever ˹gods˺ they fabricated will fail them. The Almighty Creator
verses.translation: Do they only await the fulfilment ˹of its warning˺? The Day it will be fulfilled, those who ignored it before will say, “The messengers of our Lord certainly came with the truth. Are there any intercessors who can plead on our behalf? Or can we be sent back so we may do ˹good,˺ unlike what we used to do?” They will have certainly ruined themselves, and whatever ˹gods˺ they fabricated will fail them. The Almighty Creator

verses.text: Indeed your Lord is Allah Who created the heavens and the earth in six Days,[318] then established Himself on the Throne. He makes the day and night overlap in rapid succession. He created the sun, the moon, and the stars—all subjected by His command. The creation and the command belong to Him ˹alone˺. Blessed is Allah—Lord of all worlds!
verses.translation: Indeed your Lord is Allah Who created the heavens and the earth in six Days,[318] then established Himself on the Throne. He makes the day and night overlap in rapid succession. He created the sun, the moon, and the stars—all subjected by His command. The creation and the command belong to Him ˹alone˺. Blessed is Allah—Lord of all worlds!

verses.text: Call upon your Lord humbly and secretly. Surely He does not like the transgressors.
verses.translation: Call upon your Lord humbly and secretly. Surely He does not like the transgressors.

verses.text: Do not spread corruption in the land after it has been set in order. And call upon Him with hope and fear. Indeed, Allah’s mercy is always close to the good-doers. Parable of Resurrection
verses.translation: Do not spread corruption in the land after it has been set in order. And call upon Him with hope and fear. Indeed, Allah’s mercy is always close to the good-doers. Parable of Resurrection

verses.text: He is the One Who sends the winds ushering in His mercy. When they bear heavy clouds, We drive them to a lifeless land and then cause rain to fall, producing every type of fruit. Similarly, We will bring the dead to life, so perhaps you will be mindful. Parable of Believers and Disbelievers
verses.translation: He is the One Who sends the winds ushering in His mercy. When they bear heavy clouds, We drive them to a lifeless land and then cause rain to fall, producing every type of fruit. Similarly, We will bring the dead to life, so perhaps you will be mindful. Parable of Believers and Disbelievers

verses.text: The fertile land produces abundantly by the Will of its Lord, whereas the infertile land hardly produces anything. This is how We vary ˹Our˺ lessons to those who are thankful. Prophet Noah
verses.translation: The fertile land produces abundantly by the Will of its Lord, whereas the infertile land hardly produces anything. This is how We vary ˹Our˺ lessons to those who are thankful. Prophet Noah

verses.text: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people. He said, “O my people! Worship Allah—you have no other god except Him. I truly fear for you the torment of a tremendous Day.” His People’s Response
verses.translation: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people. He said, “O my people! Worship Allah—you have no other god except Him. I truly fear for you the torment of a tremendous Day.” His People’s Response

verses.text: But the chiefs of his people said, “We surely see that you are clearly misguided.”
verses.translation: But the chiefs of his people said, “We surely see that you are clearly misguided.”

verses.text: He replied, “O my people! I am not misguided! But I am a messenger from the Lord of all worlds,
verses.translation: He replied, “O my people! I am not misguided! But I am a messenger from the Lord of all worlds,

verses.text: conveying to you my Lord’s messages and giving you ˹sincere˺ advice. And I know from Allah what you do not know.
verses.translation: conveying to you my Lord’s messages and giving you ˹sincere˺ advice. And I know from Allah what you do not know.

verses.text: Do you find it astonishing that a reminder should come to you from your Lord through one of your own, warning you, so you may beware and perhaps be shown mercy?” The Fate of His People
verses.translation: Do you find it astonishing that a reminder should come to you from your Lord through one of your own, warning you, so you may beware and perhaps be shown mercy?” The Fate of His People

verses.text: But they rejected him, so We saved him and those with him in the Ark, and drowned those who rejected Our signs. They were certainly a blind people. Prophet Hûd
verses.translation: But they rejected him, so We saved him and those with him in the Ark, and drowned those who rejected Our signs. They were certainly a blind people. Prophet Hûd

verses.text: And to the people of ’Âd We sent their brother Hûd. He said, “O my people! Worship Allah—you have no other god except Him. Will you not then fear Him?” His People’s Response
verses.translation: And to the people of ’Âd We sent their brother Hûd. He said, “O my people! Worship Allah—you have no other god except Him. Will you not then fear Him?” His People’s Response

verses.text: The disbelieving chiefs of his people responded, “We surely see you as a fool, and we certainly think you are a liar.”
verses.translation: The disbelieving chiefs of his people responded, “We surely see you as a fool, and we certainly think you are a liar.”

verses.text: Hûd replied, “O my people! I am no fool! But I am a messenger from the Lord of all worlds,
verses.translation: Hûd replied, “O my people! I am no fool! But I am a messenger from the Lord of all worlds,

verses.text: conveying to you my Lord’s messages. And I am your sincere advisor.
verses.translation: conveying to you my Lord’s messages. And I am your sincere advisor.

verses.text: Do you find it astonishing that a reminder should come to you from your Lord through one of your own so he may warn you? Remember that He made you successors after the people of Noah and increased you greatly in stature. So remember Allah’s favours, so you may be successful.”
verses.translation: Do you find it astonishing that a reminder should come to you from your Lord through one of your own so he may warn you? Remember that He made you successors after the people of Noah and increased you greatly in stature. So remember Allah’s favours, so you may be successful.”

verses.text: They said, “Have you come to us so that we would worship Allah alone and abandon what our forefathers used to worship? Then bring us what you threaten us with, if what you say is true!”
verses.translation: They said, “Have you come to us so that we would worship Allah alone and abandon what our forefathers used to worship? Then bring us what you threaten us with, if what you say is true!”

verses.text: He said, “You will certainly be subjected to your Lord’s torment and wrath. Do you dispute with me regarding the so-called gods which you and your forefathers have made up —a practice Allah has never authorized? Then wait! I too am waiting with you.” The Fate of His People
verses.translation: He said, “You will certainly be subjected to your Lord’s torment and wrath. Do you dispute with me regarding the so-called gods which you and your forefathers have made up —a practice Allah has never authorized? Then wait! I too am waiting with you.” The Fate of His People

verses.text: So We saved him and those with him by Our mercy and uprooted those who denied Our signs. They were not believers. Prophet Ṣâli ḥ
verses.translation: So We saved him and those with him by Our mercy and uprooted those who denied Our signs. They were not believers. Prophet Ṣâli ḥ

verses.text: And to the people of Thamûd We sent their brother Ṣâliḥ. He said, “O my people! Worship Allah—you have no other god except Him. A clear proof has come to you from your Lord: this is Allah’s she-camel as a sign to you. So leave her to graze ˹freely˺ on Allah’s land and do not harm her, or else you will be overcome by a painful punishment.
verses.translation: And to the people of Thamûd We sent their brother Ṣâliḥ. He said, “O my people! Worship Allah—you have no other god except Him. A clear proof has come to you from your Lord: this is Allah’s she-camel as a sign to you. So leave her to graze ˹freely˺ on Allah’s land and do not harm her, or else you will be overcome by a painful punishment.

verses.text: Remember when He made you successors after ’Âd and established you in the land—˹and˺ you built palaces on its plains and carved homes into mountains. So remember Allah’s favours, and do not go about spreading corruption in the land.” His People’s Response
verses.translation: Remember when He made you successors after ’Âd and established you in the land—˹and˺ you built palaces on its plains and carved homes into mountains. So remember Allah’s favours, and do not go about spreading corruption in the land.” His People’s Response

verses.text: The arrogant chiefs of his people asked the lowly who believed among them, “Are you certain that Ṣâliḥ has been sent by his Lord?” They replied, “We certainly believe in what he has been sent with.”
verses.translation: The arrogant chiefs of his people asked the lowly who believed among them, “Are you certain that Ṣâliḥ has been sent by his Lord?” They replied, “We certainly believe in what he has been sent with.”

verses.text: The arrogant said, “We surely reject what you believe in.”
verses.translation: The arrogant said, “We surely reject what you believe in.”

verses.text: Then they killed the she-camel —defying their Lord’s command—and challenged ˹Ṣâliḥ˺, “Bring us what you threaten us with, if you are ˹truly˺ one of the messengers.” The Fate of His People
verses.translation: Then they killed the she-camel —defying their Lord’s command—and challenged ˹Ṣâliḥ˺, “Bring us what you threaten us with, if you are ˹truly˺ one of the messengers.” The Fate of His People

verses.text: Then an ˹overwhelming˺ earthquake struck them, and they fell lifeless in their homes.
verses.translation: Then an ˹overwhelming˺ earthquake struck them, and they fell lifeless in their homes.

verses.text: So he turned away from them, saying, “O my people! Surely I conveyed to you my Lord’s message and gave you ˹sincere˺ advice, but you do not like ˹sincere˺ advisors.” Prophet Lot
verses.translation: So he turned away from them, saying, “O my people! Surely I conveyed to you my Lord’s message and gave you ˹sincere˺ advice, but you do not like ˹sincere˺ advisors.” Prophet Lot

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when Lot scolded ˹the men of˺ his people, ˹saying,˺ “Do you commit a shameful deed that no man has ever done before?
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when Lot scolded ˹the men of˺ his people, ˹saying,˺ “Do you commit a shameful deed that no man has ever done before?

verses.text: You lust after men instead of women! You are certainly transgressors.” His People’s Response
verses.translation: You lust after men instead of women! You are certainly transgressors.” His People’s Response

verses.text: But his people’s only response was to say, “Expel them from your land! They are a people who wish to remain chaste!” The Fate of His People
verses.translation: But his people’s only response was to say, “Expel them from your land! They are a people who wish to remain chaste!” The Fate of His People

verses.text: So We saved him and his family except his wife, who was one of the doomed.
verses.translation: So We saved him and his family except his wife, who was one of the doomed.

verses.text: We poured upon them a rain ˹of brimstone˺. See what was the end of the wicked! Prophet Shu’aib
verses.translation: We poured upon them a rain ˹of brimstone˺. See what was the end of the wicked! Prophet Shu’aib

verses.text: And to the people of Midian We sent their brother Shu’aib. He said, “O my people! Worship Allah—you have no other god except Him. A clear proof has already come to you from your Lord. So give just measure and weight, do not defraud people of their property, nor spread corruption in the land after it has been set in order. This is for your own good, if you are ˹truly˺ believers.
verses.translation: And to the people of Midian We sent their brother Shu’aib. He said, “O my people! Worship Allah—you have no other god except Him. A clear proof has already come to you from your Lord. So give just measure and weight, do not defraud people of their property, nor spread corruption in the land after it has been set in order. This is for your own good, if you are ˹truly˺ believers.

verses.text: And do not lie in ambush on every road—threatening and hindering those who believe in Allah from His Path and striving to make it ˹appear˺ crooked. Remember when you were few, then He increased you in number. And consider the fate of the corruptors!
verses.translation: And do not lie in ambush on every road—threatening and hindering those who believe in Allah from His Path and striving to make it ˹appear˺ crooked. Remember when you were few, then He increased you in number. And consider the fate of the corruptors!
