verses.translation: Or do they claim, “He[394] made it up!”? Tell them ˹O Prophet˺, “Produce one sûrah like it then, and seek help from whoever you can— other than Allah—if what you say is true!”

verses.text: In fact, they ˹hastily˺ rejected the Book without comprehending it and before the fulfilment of its warnings. Similarly, those before them were in denial. See then what was the end of the wrongdoers! It Is Allah Who Guides
verses.translation: In fact, they ˹hastily˺ rejected the Book without comprehending it and before the fulfilment of its warnings. Similarly, those before them were in denial. See then what was the end of the wrongdoers! It Is Allah Who Guides

verses.text: Some of them will ˹eventually˺ believe in it; others will not. And your Lord knows best the corruptors.
verses.translation: Some of them will ˹eventually˺ believe in it; others will not. And your Lord knows best the corruptors.

verses.text: If they deny you, then say, “My deeds are mine and your deeds are yours. You are free of what I do and I am free of what you do!”
verses.translation: If they deny you, then say, “My deeds are mine and your deeds are yours. You are free of what I do and I am free of what you do!”

verses.text: Some of them listen to what you say, but can you make the deaf hear even though they do not understand?
verses.translation: Some of them listen to what you say, but can you make the deaf hear even though they do not understand?

verses.text: And some of them look at you, but can you guide the blind even though they cannot see? [395]
verses.translation: And some of them look at you, but can you guide the blind even though they cannot see? [395]

verses.text: Indeed, Allah does not wrong people in the least, but it is people who wrong themselves. Short Life
verses.translation: Indeed, Allah does not wrong people in the least, but it is people who wrong themselves. Short Life

verses.text: On the Day He will gather them, it will be as if they had not stayed ˹in the world˺ except for an hour of a day,[396] ˹as though they were only˺ getting to know one another. Lost indeed will be those who denied the meeting with Allah, and were not ˹rightly˺ guided! Warning Before Judgment
verses.translation: On the Day He will gather them, it will be as if they had not stayed ˹in the world˺ except for an hour of a day,[396] ˹as though they were only˺ getting to know one another. Lost indeed will be those who denied the meeting with Allah, and were not ˹rightly˺ guided! Warning Before Judgment

verses.text: Whether We show you ˹O Prophet˺ some of what We threaten them with, or cause you to die ˹before that˺, to Us is their return and Allah is a Witness over what they do.
verses.translation: Whether We show you ˹O Prophet˺ some of what We threaten them with, or cause you to die ˹before that˺, to Us is their return and Allah is a Witness over what they do.

verses.text: And for every community there is a messenger. After their messenger has come,[397] judgment is passed on them in all fairness, and they are not wronged. When the Time Comes …
verses.translation: And for every community there is a messenger. After their messenger has come,[397] judgment is passed on them in all fairness, and they are not wronged. When the Time Comes …

verses.text: They ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass if what you say is true?”
verses.translation: They ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass if what you say is true?”

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I have no power to benefit or protect myself, except by the Will of Allah.” For each community there is an appointed term. When their time arrives, they cannot delay it for a moment, nor could they advance it. Allah’s Torment
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I have no power to benefit or protect myself, except by the Will of Allah.” For each community there is an appointed term. When their time arrives, they cannot delay it for a moment, nor could they advance it. Allah’s Torment

verses.text: Tell them ˹O Prophet˺, “Imagine if His torment were to overcome you by night or day—do the wicked realize what they are ˹really˺ asking Him to hasten?
verses.translation: Tell them ˹O Prophet˺, “Imagine if His torment were to overcome you by night or day—do the wicked realize what they are ˹really˺ asking Him to hasten?

verses.text: Will you believe in it only after it has overtaken you? Now? But you always wanted to hasten it!”
verses.translation: Will you believe in it only after it has overtaken you? Now? But you always wanted to hasten it!”

verses.text: Then the wrongdoers will be told, “Taste the torment of eternity! Are you not rewarded except for what you used to commit?” Allah’s Promise
verses.translation: Then the wrongdoers will be told, “Taste the torment of eternity! Are you not rewarded except for what you used to commit?” Allah’s Promise

verses.text: They ask you ˹O Prophet˺, “Is this true?” Say, “Yes, by my Lord! Most certainly it is true! And you will have no escape.”
verses.translation: They ask you ˹O Prophet˺, “Is this true?” Say, “Yes, by my Lord! Most certainly it is true! And you will have no escape.”

verses.text: If every wrongdoer were to possess everything in the world, they would surely ransom themselves with it. They will hide ˹their˺ remorse when they see the torment. And they will be judged in all fairness, and none will be wronged.
verses.translation: If every wrongdoer were to possess everything in the world, they would surely ransom themselves with it. They will hide ˹their˺ remorse when they see the torment. And they will be judged in all fairness, and none will be wronged.

verses.text: Surely to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Surely Allah’s promise is ˹always˺ true, but most of them do not know.
verses.translation: Surely to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Surely Allah’s promise is ˹always˺ true, but most of them do not know.

verses.text: He ˹is the One Who˺ gives life and causes death, and to Him you will ˹all˺ be returned. Excellence of the Quran
verses.translation: He ˹is the One Who˺ gives life and causes death, and to Him you will ˹all˺ be returned. Excellence of the Quran

verses.text: O humanity! Indeed, there has come to you a warning from your Lord, a cure for what is in the hearts, a guide, and a mercy for the believers.
verses.translation: O humanity! Indeed, there has come to you a warning from your Lord, a cure for what is in the hearts, a guide, and a mercy for the believers.

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “In Allah’s grace and mercy let them rejoice. That is far better than whatever ˹wealth˺ they amass.” Allah’s Provisions
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “In Allah’s grace and mercy let them rejoice. That is far better than whatever ˹wealth˺ they amass.” Allah’s Provisions

verses.text: Ask ˹the pagans, O Prophet˺, “Have you seen that which Allah has sent down for you as a provision, of which you have made some lawful and some unlawful?”[398] Say, “Has Allah given you authorization, or are you fabricating lies against Allah?”
verses.translation: Ask ˹the pagans, O Prophet˺, “Have you seen that which Allah has sent down for you as a provision, of which you have made some lawful and some unlawful?”[398] Say, “Has Allah given you authorization, or are you fabricating lies against Allah?”

verses.text: What do those who fabricate lies against Allah expect on Judgment Day? Surely Allah is ever Bountiful to humanity, [399] but most of them are ungrateful. Allah’s Knowledge
verses.translation: What do those who fabricate lies against Allah expect on Judgment Day? Surely Allah is ever Bountiful to humanity, [399] but most of them are ungrateful. Allah’s Knowledge

verses.text: There is no activity you may be engaged in ˹O Prophet˺ or portion of the Quran you may be reciting, nor any deed you ˹all˺ may be doing except that We are a Witness over you while doing it. Not ˹even˺ an atom’s weight is hidden from your Lord on earth or in heaven; nor anything smaller or larger than that, but is ˹written˺ in a perfect Record.[400] Allah’s Close Servants
verses.translation: There is no activity you may be engaged in ˹O Prophet˺ or portion of the Quran you may be reciting, nor any deed you ˹all˺ may be doing except that We are a Witness over you while doing it. Not ˹even˺ an atom’s weight is hidden from your Lord on earth or in heaven; nor anything smaller or larger than that, but is ˹written˺ in a perfect Record.[400] Allah’s Close Servants

verses.text: There will certainly be no fear for the close servants of Allah, nor will they grieve.
verses.translation: There will certainly be no fear for the close servants of Allah, nor will they grieve.

verses.text: ˹They are˺ those who are faithful and are mindful ˹of Him˺.
verses.translation: ˹They are˺ those who are faithful and are mindful ˹of Him˺.

verses.text: For them is good news in this worldly life and the Hereafter. There is no change in the promise of Allah. That is ˹truly˺ the ultimate triumph. The Almighty
verses.translation: For them is good news in this worldly life and the Hereafter. There is no change in the promise of Allah. That is ˹truly˺ the ultimate triumph. The Almighty

verses.text: Do not let their words grieve you ˹O Prophet˺. Surely all honour and power belongs to Allah. He is the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
verses.translation: Do not let their words grieve you ˹O Prophet˺. Surely all honour and power belongs to Allah. He is the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

verses.text: Certainly to Allah ˹alone˺ belong all those in the heavens and all those on the earth. And what do those who associate others with Allah really follow? They follow nothing but assumptions and do nothing but lie.
verses.translation: Certainly to Allah ˹alone˺ belong all those in the heavens and all those on the earth. And what do those who associate others with Allah really follow? They follow nothing but assumptions and do nothing but lie.

verses.text: He is the One Who has made the night for you to rest in and the day bright. Surely in this are signs for people who listen. Allah Has No Children
verses.translation: He is the One Who has made the night for you to rest in and the day bright. Surely in this are signs for people who listen. Allah Has No Children

verses.text: They[401] say, “Allah has offspring.”[402] Glory be to Him! He is the Self-Sufficient. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. You have no proof of this! Do you say about Allah what you do not know?
verses.translation: They[401] say, “Allah has offspring.”[402] Glory be to Him! He is the Self-Sufficient. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. You have no proof of this! Do you say about Allah what you do not know?

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Indeed, those who fabricate lies against Allah will never succeed.”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Indeed, those who fabricate lies against Allah will never succeed.”

verses.text: ˹It is only˺ a brief enjoyment in this world, then to Us is their return, then We will make them taste the severe punishment for their disbelief. Noah and His People
verses.translation: ˹It is only˺ a brief enjoyment in this world, then to Us is their return, then We will make them taste the severe punishment for their disbelief. Noah and His People

verses.text: Relate to them ˹O Prophet˺ the story of Noah when he said to his people, “O my People! If my presence and my reminders to you of Allah’s signs are unbearable to you, then ˹know that˺ I have put my trust in Allah. So devise a plot along with your associate-gods—and you do not have to be secretive about your plot—then carry it out against me without delay!
verses.translation: Relate to them ˹O Prophet˺ the story of Noah when he said to his people, “O my People! If my presence and my reminders to you of Allah’s signs are unbearable to you, then ˹know that˺ I have put my trust in Allah. So devise a plot along with your associate-gods—and you do not have to be secretive about your plot—then carry it out against me without delay!

verses.text: And if you turn away, ˹remember˺ I have never demanded a reward from you ˹for delivering the message˺. My reward is only from Allah. And I have been commanded to be one of those who submit ˹to Allah˺.”
verses.translation: And if you turn away, ˹remember˺ I have never demanded a reward from you ˹for delivering the message˺. My reward is only from Allah. And I have been commanded to be one of those who submit ˹to Allah˺.”

verses.text: But they still rejected him, so We saved him and those with him in the Ark and made them successors, and drowned those who rejected Our signs. See then what was the end of those who had been warned! Messengers After Noah
verses.translation: But they still rejected him, so We saved him and those with him in the Ark and made them successors, and drowned those who rejected Our signs. See then what was the end of those who had been warned! Messengers After Noah

verses.text: Then after him We sent ˹other˺ messengers to their ˹own˺ people and they came to them with clear proofs. But they would not believe in what they had rejected before. This is how We seal the hearts of the transgressors. Moses and Aaron
verses.translation: Then after him We sent ˹other˺ messengers to their ˹own˺ people and they came to them with clear proofs. But they would not believe in what they had rejected before. This is how We seal the hearts of the transgressors. Moses and Aaron

verses.text: Then after these ˹messengers˺ We sent Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his chiefs with Our signs. But they behaved arrogantly and were a wicked people.
verses.translation: Then after these ˹messengers˺ We sent Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his chiefs with Our signs. But they behaved arrogantly and were a wicked people.

verses.text: When the truth came to them from Us, they said, “This is certainly pure magic!”
verses.translation: When the truth came to them from Us, they said, “This is certainly pure magic!”

verses.text: Moses responded, “Is this what you say about the truth when it has come to you? Is this magic? Magicians will never succeed.”
verses.translation: Moses responded, “Is this what you say about the truth when it has come to you? Is this magic? Magicians will never succeed.”

verses.text: They argued, “Have you come to turn us away from the faith of our forefathers so that the two of you may become supreme in the land? We will never believe in you!”
verses.translation: They argued, “Have you come to turn us away from the faith of our forefathers so that the two of you may become supreme in the land? We will never believe in you!”

verses.text: Pharaoh demanded, “Bring me every skilled magician.”
verses.translation: Pharaoh demanded, “Bring me every skilled magician.”

verses.text: When the magicians came, Moses said to them, “Cast whatever you wish to cast!”
verses.translation: When the magicians came, Moses said to them, “Cast whatever you wish to cast!”

verses.text: When they did, Moses said, “What you have produced is mere magic, Allah will surely make it useless, for Allah certainly does not set right the work of the corruptors.
verses.translation: When they did, Moses said, “What you have produced is mere magic, Allah will surely make it useless, for Allah certainly does not set right the work of the corruptors.

verses.text: And Allah establishes the truth by His Words—even to the dismay of the wicked.” A Few Believers
verses.translation: And Allah establishes the truth by His Words—even to the dismay of the wicked.” A Few Believers

verses.text: But no one believed in Moses except a few youths of his people, while fearing that Pharaoh and their own chiefs might persecute them. And certainly Pharaoh was a tyrant in the land, and he was truly a transgressor.
verses.translation: But no one believed in Moses except a few youths of his people, while fearing that Pharaoh and their own chiefs might persecute them. And certainly Pharaoh was a tyrant in the land, and he was truly a transgressor.

verses.text: Moses said, “O my people! If you do believe in Allah and submit ˹to His Will˺, then put your trust in Him.”
verses.translation: Moses said, “O my people! If you do believe in Allah and submit ˹to His Will˺, then put your trust in Him.”

verses.text: They replied, “In Allah we trust. Our Lord! Do not subject us to the persecution of the oppressive people,
verses.translation: They replied, “In Allah we trust. Our Lord! Do not subject us to the persecution of the oppressive people,

verses.text: and deliver us by Your mercy from the disbelieving people.” Power of Prayer
verses.translation: and deliver us by Your mercy from the disbelieving people.” Power of Prayer

verses.text: We revealed to Moses and his brother, “Appoint houses for your people in Egypt. Turn these houses into places of worship, establish prayer, and give good news to the believers!”
verses.translation: We revealed to Moses and his brother, “Appoint houses for your people in Egypt. Turn these houses into places of worship, establish prayer, and give good news to the believers!”

verses.text: Moses prayed, “Our Lord! You have granted Pharaoh and his chiefs luxuries and riches in this worldly life, ˹which they abused˺ to lead people astray from Your Way! Our Lord, destroy their riches and harden their hearts so that they will not believe until they see the painful punishment.”
verses.translation: Moses prayed, “Our Lord! You have granted Pharaoh and his chiefs luxuries and riches in this worldly life, ˹which they abused˺ to lead people astray from Your Way! Our Lord, destroy their riches and harden their hearts so that they will not believe until they see the painful punishment.”

verses.text: Allah responded ˹to Moses and Aaron˺,[403] “Your prayer is answered! So be steadfast and do not follow the way of those who do not know.” End of Pharaoh
verses.translation: Allah responded ˹to Moses and Aaron˺,[403] “Your prayer is answered! So be steadfast and do not follow the way of those who do not know.” End of Pharaoh

verses.text: We brought the Children of Israel across the sea. Then Pharaoh and his soldiers pursued them unjustly and oppressively. But as Pharaoh was drowning, he cried out, “I believe that there is no god except that in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am ˹now˺ one of those who submit.”
verses.translation: We brought the Children of Israel across the sea. Then Pharaoh and his soldiers pursued them unjustly and oppressively. But as Pharaoh was drowning, he cried out, “I believe that there is no god except that in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am ˹now˺ one of those who submit.”

verses.text: ˹He was told,˺ “Now ˹you believe˺? But you always disobeyed and were one of the corruptors.
verses.translation: ˹He was told,˺ “Now ˹you believe˺? But you always disobeyed and were one of the corruptors.

verses.text: Today We will preserve your corpse so that you may become an example[404] for those who come after you. And surely most people are heedless of Our examples!” Allah’s Grace to the Israelites
verses.translation: Today We will preserve your corpse so that you may become an example[404] for those who come after you. And surely most people are heedless of Our examples!” Allah’s Grace to the Israelites

verses.text: Indeed, We settled the Children of Israel in a blessed land,[405] and granted them good, lawful provisions. They did not differ until knowledge came to them.[406] Surely your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Judgment regarding their differences. Confirming the Truth
verses.translation: Indeed, We settled the Children of Israel in a blessed land,[405] and granted them good, lawful provisions. They did not differ until knowledge came to them.[406] Surely your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Judgment regarding their differences. Confirming the Truth

verses.text: If you ˹O Prophet˺ are in doubt about ˹these stories˺ that We have revealed to you, then ask those who read the Scripture before you. The truth has certainly come to you from your Lord, so do not be one of those who doubt,
verses.translation: If you ˹O Prophet˺ are in doubt about ˹these stories˺ that We have revealed to you, then ask those who read the Scripture before you. The truth has certainly come to you from your Lord, so do not be one of those who doubt,

verses.text: and do not be one of those who deny Allah’s signs or you will be one of the losers.[407] Jonah’s People Spared from Torment
verses.translation: and do not be one of those who deny Allah’s signs or you will be one of the losers.[407] Jonah’s People Spared from Torment

verses.text: Indeed, those against whom Allah’s decree ˹of torment˺ is justified will not believe—
verses.translation: Indeed, those against whom Allah’s decree ˹of torment˺ is justified will not believe—

verses.text: even if every sign were to come to them—until they see the painful punishment.
verses.translation: even if every sign were to come to them—until they see the painful punishment.

verses.text: If only there had been a society which believed ˹before seeing the torment˺ and, therefore, benefited from its belief, like the people of Jonah.[408] When they believed, We lifted from them the torment of disgrace in this world and allowed them enjoyment for a while.[409] Conviction, Not Compulsion
verses.translation: If only there had been a society which believed ˹before seeing the torment˺ and, therefore, benefited from its belief, like the people of Jonah.[408] When they believed, We lifted from them the torment of disgrace in this world and allowed them enjoyment for a while.[409] Conviction, Not Compulsion

verses.text: Had your Lord so willed ˹O Prophet˺, all ˹people˺ on earth would have certainly believed, every single one of them! Would you then force people to become believers?
verses.translation: Had your Lord so willed ˹O Prophet˺, all ˹people˺ on earth would have certainly believed, every single one of them! Would you then force people to become believers?

verses.text: It is not for any soul to believe except by Allah’s leave, and He will bring His wrath upon those who are unmindful. Invitation to Think
verses.translation: It is not for any soul to believe except by Allah’s leave, and He will bring His wrath upon those who are unmindful. Invitation to Think

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Consider all that is in the heavens and the earth!” Yet neither signs nor warners are of any benefit to those who refuse to believe.
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Consider all that is in the heavens and the earth!” Yet neither signs nor warners are of any benefit to those who refuse to believe.

verses.text: Are they waiting for ˹anything˺ except the same torments that befell those before them? Say, “Keep waiting then! I too am waiting with you.”
verses.translation: Are they waiting for ˹anything˺ except the same torments that befell those before them? Say, “Keep waiting then! I too am waiting with you.”

verses.text: Then We saved Our messengers and those who believed. For it is Our duty to save the believers. True Faith
verses.translation: Then We saved Our messengers and those who believed. For it is Our duty to save the believers. True Faith

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “O humanity! If you are in doubt of my faith, then ˹know that˺ I do not worship those ˹idols˺ you worship instead of Allah. But I worship Allah, Who has the power to cause your death. And I have been commanded, ‘Be one of the believers,’
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “O humanity! If you are in doubt of my faith, then ˹know that˺ I do not worship those ˹idols˺ you worship instead of Allah. But I worship Allah, Who has the power to cause your death. And I have been commanded, ‘Be one of the believers,’

verses.text: and, ‘Be steadfast in faith in all uprightness, and do not be one of the polytheists,’
verses.translation: and, ‘Be steadfast in faith in all uprightness, and do not be one of the polytheists,’

verses.text: and ‘Do not invoke, instead of Allah, what can neither benefit nor harm you—for if you do, then you will certainly be one of the wrongdoers,’
verses.translation: and ‘Do not invoke, instead of Allah, what can neither benefit nor harm you—for if you do, then you will certainly be one of the wrongdoers,’

verses.text: and ‘If Allah touches you with harm, none can undo it except Him. And if He intends good for you, none can withhold His bounty. He grants it to whoever He wills of His servants. And He is the All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.’” Call to Humanity
verses.translation: and ‘If Allah touches you with harm, none can undo it except Him. And if He intends good for you, none can withhold His bounty. He grants it to whoever He wills of His servants. And He is the All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.’” Call to Humanity

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “O humanity! The truth has surely come to you from your Lord. So whoever chooses to be guided, it is only for their own good. And whoever chooses to stray, it is only to their own loss. And I am not a keeper over you.” Advice to the Prophet
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “O humanity! The truth has surely come to you from your Lord. So whoever chooses to be guided, it is only for their own good. And whoever chooses to stray, it is only to their own loss. And I am not a keeper over you.” Advice to the Prophet

verses.text: And follow what is revealed to you, and be patient until Allah passes His judgment. For He is the Best of Judges. *** -- 195 of 694 --
verses.translation: And follow what is revealed to you, and be patient until Allah passes His judgment. For He is the Best of Judges. *** -- 195 of 694 --

name: Hûd
intro: This Meccan sûrah is named after Prophet Hûd ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص), whose story is mentioned in verses 50-60. More details are given about Noah ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) in this sûrah than the previous sûrah and Sûrah 7. Just like the previous sûrah, the stories of destroyed disbelievers are meant to deter the Arab pagans and reassure the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) of his ultimate triumph, and a reference is made to the reward of the believers and the punishment of the disbelievers in the Hereafter. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Message of the Quran

verses.text: Alif-Lãm-Ra. ˹This is˺ a Book whose verses are well perfected and then fully explained. ˹It is˺ from the One ˹Who is˺ All-Wise, All-Aware.
verses.translation: Alif-Lãm-Ra. ˹This is˺ a Book whose verses are well perfected and then fully explained. ˹It is˺ from the One ˹Who is˺ All-Wise, All-Aware.

verses.text: ˹Tell them, O Prophet,˺ “Worship none but Allah. Surely I am a warner and deliverer of good news to you from Him.
verses.translation: ˹Tell them, O Prophet,˺ “Worship none but Allah. Surely I am a warner and deliverer of good news to you from Him.

verses.text: And seek your Lord’s forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance. He will grant you a good provision for an appointed term and graciously reward the doers of good. But if you turn away, then I truly fear for you the torment of a formidable Day.
verses.translation: And seek your Lord’s forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance. He will grant you a good provision for an appointed term and graciously reward the doers of good. But if you turn away, then I truly fear for you the torment of a formidable Day.

verses.text: To Allah is your return. And He is Most Capable of everything.” Hiding Disbelief
verses.translation: To Allah is your return. And He is Most Capable of everything.” Hiding Disbelief

verses.text: Indeed, they[410] enfold ˹what is in˺ their hearts, ˹trying˺ to hide it from Him! But even when they cover themselves with their clothes, He knows what they conceal and what they reveal. Surely He knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart. Allah’s Might
verses.translation: Indeed, they[410] enfold ˹what is in˺ their hearts, ˹trying˺ to hide it from Him! But even when they cover themselves with their clothes, He knows what they conceal and what they reveal. Surely He knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart. Allah’s Might

verses.text: There is no moving creature on earth whose provision is not guaranteed by Allah. And He knows where it lives and where it is laid to rest. All is ˹written˺ in a perfect Record.[411]
verses.translation: There is no moving creature on earth whose provision is not guaranteed by Allah. And He knows where it lives and where it is laid to rest. All is ˹written˺ in a perfect Record.[411]

verses.text: He is the One Who created the heavens and the earth in six Days[412]—and His Throne was upon the waters—in order to test which of you is best in deeds. And if you ˹O Prophet˺ say, “Surely you will ˹all˺ be raised up after death,” the disbelievers will certainly say, “That is nothing but pure magic!”
verses.translation: He is the One Who created the heavens and the earth in six Days[412]—and His Throne was upon the waters—in order to test which of you is best in deeds. And if you ˹O Prophet˺ say, “Surely you will ˹all˺ be raised up after death,” the disbelievers will certainly say, “That is nothing but pure magic!”

verses.text: And if We delay their punishment until an appointed time, they will definitely say, “What is holding it back?” Indeed, on the Day it overtakes them, it will not be averted from them, and they will be overwhelmed by what they used to ridicule. Adversity and Prosperity
verses.translation: And if We delay their punishment until an appointed time, they will definitely say, “What is holding it back?” Indeed, on the Day it overtakes them, it will not be averted from them, and they will be overwhelmed by what they used to ridicule. Adversity and Prosperity

verses.text: If We give people a taste of Our mercy then take it away from them, they become utterly desperate, ungrateful.
verses.translation: If We give people a taste of Our mercy then take it away from them, they become utterly desperate, ungrateful.

verses.text: But if We give them a taste of prosperity after being touched with adversity, they say, “My ills are gone,” and become totally prideful and boastful,
verses.translation: But if We give them a taste of prosperity after being touched with adversity, they say, “My ills are gone,” and become totally prideful and boastful,

verses.text: except those who patiently endure and do good. It is they who will have forgiveness and a mighty reward. Pagan Annoyances
verses.translation: except those who patiently endure and do good. It is they who will have forgiveness and a mighty reward. Pagan Annoyances

verses.text: Perhaps you ˹O Prophet˺ may wish to give up some of what is revealed to you and may be distressed by it because they say, “If only a treasure had been sent down to him, or an angel had come with him!” You are only a warner, and Allah is the Trustee of All Affairs. Challenging the Pagans
verses.translation: Perhaps you ˹O Prophet˺ may wish to give up some of what is revealed to you and may be distressed by it because they say, “If only a treasure had been sent down to him, or an angel had come with him!” You are only a warner, and Allah is the Trustee of All Affairs. Challenging the Pagans

verses.text: Or do they say, “He[413] has fabricated this ˹Quran˺!”? Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Produce ten fabricated sûrahs like it and seek help from whoever you can —other than Allah—if what you say is true!”
verses.translation: Or do they say, “He[413] has fabricated this ˹Quran˺!”? Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Produce ten fabricated sûrahs like it and seek help from whoever you can —other than Allah—if what you say is true!”

verses.text: But if your helpers fail you, then know that it has been revealed with the knowledge of Allah, and that there is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him! Will you ˹not˺ then submit ˹to Allah ˺? Fleeting Gain
verses.translation: But if your helpers fail you, then know that it has been revealed with the knowledge of Allah, and that there is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him! Will you ˹not˺ then submit ˹to Allah ˺? Fleeting Gain

verses.text: Whoever desires ˹only˺ this worldly life and its luxuries, We will pay them in full for their deeds in this life—nothing will be left out.
verses.translation: Whoever desires ˹only˺ this worldly life and its luxuries, We will pay them in full for their deeds in this life—nothing will be left out.

verses.text: It is they who will have nothing in the Hereafter except the Fire. Their efforts in this life will be fruitless and their deeds will be useless. Everlasting Gain
verses.translation: It is they who will have nothing in the Hereafter except the Fire. Their efforts in this life will be fruitless and their deeds will be useless. Everlasting Gain

verses.text: ˹Can these people be compared to˺ those ˹believers˺ who stand on clear proof from their Lord, backed by ˹the Quran as˺ a witness from Him, and preceded by the Book of Moses ˹which was revealed˺ as a guide and mercy? It is those ˹believers˺ who have faith in it. But whoever from the ˹disbelieving˺ groups rejects it, the Fire will be their destiny. So do not be in doubt of it. It is certainly the truth from your Lord, but most people do not believe. The Losers
verses.translation: ˹Can these people be compared to˺ those ˹believers˺ who stand on clear proof from their Lord, backed by ˹the Quran as˺ a witness from Him, and preceded by the Book of Moses ˹which was revealed˺ as a guide and mercy? It is those ˹believers˺ who have faith in it. But whoever from the ˹disbelieving˺ groups rejects it, the Fire will be their destiny. So do not be in doubt of it. It is certainly the truth from your Lord, but most people do not believe. The Losers

verses.text: Who does more wrong than those who fabricate lies against Allah? They will be brought before their Lord, and the witnesses[414] will say, “These are the ones who lied against their Lord.” Surely Allah’s condemnation is upon the wrongdoers,
verses.translation: Who does more wrong than those who fabricate lies against Allah? They will be brought before their Lord, and the witnesses[414] will say, “These are the ones who lied against their Lord.” Surely Allah’s condemnation is upon the wrongdoers,

verses.text: who hinder ˹others˺ from Allah’s Path, striving to make it ˹appear˺ crooked, and disbelieve in the Hereafter.
verses.translation: who hinder ˹others˺ from Allah’s Path, striving to make it ˹appear˺ crooked, and disbelieve in the Hereafter.

verses.text: They will never frustrate Allah on earth, and they will have no protector besides Allah. Their punishment will be multiplied, for they failed to hear or see ˹the truth˺.
verses.translation: They will never frustrate Allah on earth, and they will have no protector besides Allah. Their punishment will be multiplied, for they failed to hear or see ˹the truth˺.

verses.text: It is they who have ruined themselves, and whatever ˹gods˺ they fabricated will fail them.
verses.translation: It is they who have ruined themselves, and whatever ˹gods˺ they fabricated will fail them.

verses.text: Without a doubt, they will be the worst losers in the Hereafter. The Winners
verses.translation: Without a doubt, they will be the worst losers in the Hereafter. The Winners

verses.text: Surely those who believe, do good, and humble themselves before their Lord will be the residents of Paradise. They will be there forever. The Disbelievers and the Believers
verses.translation: Surely those who believe, do good, and humble themselves before their Lord will be the residents of Paradise. They will be there forever. The Disbelievers and the Believers

verses.text: The example of these two parties is that of the blind and the deaf, compared to the seeing and the hearing. Can the two be equal? Will you not then be mindful? Prophet Noah
verses.translation: The example of these two parties is that of the blind and the deaf, compared to the seeing and the hearing. Can the two be equal? Will you not then be mindful? Prophet Noah

verses.text: Surely We sent Noah to his people. ˹He said,˺ “Indeed, I am sent to you with a clear warning
verses.translation: Surely We sent Noah to his people. ˹He said,˺ “Indeed, I am sent to you with a clear warning

verses.text: that you should worship none but Allah. I truly fear for you the torment of a painful Day.”
verses.translation: that you should worship none but Allah. I truly fear for you the torment of a painful Day.”

verses.text: The disbelieving chiefs of his people said, “We see you only as a human being like ourselves, and we see that no one follows you except the lowliest among us, who do so ˹hastily˺ without thinking.[415] We do not see anything that makes ˹all of˺ you any better than us. In fact, we think you are liars.” Noah’s Argument
verses.translation: The disbelieving chiefs of his people said, “We see you only as a human being like ourselves, and we see that no one follows you except the lowliest among us, who do so ˹hastily˺ without thinking.[415] We do not see anything that makes ˹all of˺ you any better than us. In fact, we think you are liars.” Noah’s Argument

verses.text: He said, “O my people! Consider if I stand on a clear proof from my Lord and He has blessed me with a mercy from Himself,[416] which you fail to see. Should we ˹then˺ force it on you against your will?
verses.translation: He said, “O my people! Consider if I stand on a clear proof from my Lord and He has blessed me with a mercy from Himself,[416] which you fail to see. Should we ˹then˺ force it on you against your will?

verses.text: O my people! I do not ask you for a payment for this ˹message˺. My reward is only from Allah. And I will never dismiss the believers, for they will surely meet their Lord. But I can see that you are a people acting ignorantly.
verses.translation: O my people! I do not ask you for a payment for this ˹message˺. My reward is only from Allah. And I will never dismiss the believers, for they will surely meet their Lord. But I can see that you are a people acting ignorantly.

verses.text: O my people! Who would protect me from Allah if I were to dismiss them? Will you not then be mindful?
verses.translation: O my people! Who would protect me from Allah if I were to dismiss them? Will you not then be mindful?

verses.text: I do not say to you that I possess Allah’s treasuries or know the unseen, nor do I claim to be an angel, nor do I say that Allah will never grant goodness to those you look down upon. Allah knows best what is ˹hidden˺ within them. ˹If I did,˺ then I would truly be one of the wrongdoers.” His People’s Response
verses.translation: I do not say to you that I possess Allah’s treasuries or know the unseen, nor do I claim to be an angel, nor do I say that Allah will never grant goodness to those you look down upon. Allah knows best what is ˹hidden˺ within them. ˹If I did,˺ then I would truly be one of the wrongdoers.” His People’s Response

verses.text: They protested, “O Noah! You have argued with us far too much, so bring upon us what you threaten us with, if what you say is true.”
verses.translation: They protested, “O Noah! You have argued with us far too much, so bring upon us what you threaten us with, if what you say is true.”

verses.text: He responded, “It is Allah Who can bring it upon you if He wills, and then you will have no escape!
verses.translation: He responded, “It is Allah Who can bring it upon you if He wills, and then you will have no escape!

verses.text: My advice will not benefit you—no matter how hard I try—if Allah wills ˹for˺ you to stray. He is your Lord, and to Him you will ˹all˺ be returned.” The Pagans Discredit the Quran
verses.translation: My advice will not benefit you—no matter how hard I try—if Allah wills ˹for˺ you to stray. He is your Lord, and to Him you will ˹all˺ be returned.” The Pagans Discredit the Quran

verses.text: Or do they say, “He[417] has fabricated this ˹Quran˺!”? Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “If I have done so, then I bear the burden of that sin! But I am free from your sinful accusation.” The Ark
verses.translation: Or do they say, “He[417] has fabricated this ˹Quran˺!”? Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “If I have done so, then I bear the burden of that sin! But I am free from your sinful accusation.” The Ark

verses.text: And it was revealed to Noah, “None of your people will believe except those who already have. So do not be distressed by what they have been doing.
verses.translation: And it was revealed to Noah, “None of your people will believe except those who already have. So do not be distressed by what they have been doing.

verses.text: And build the Ark under Our ˹watchful˺ Eyes and directions, and do not plead with Me for those who have done wrong, for they will surely be drowned.”
verses.translation: And build the Ark under Our ˹watchful˺ Eyes and directions, and do not plead with Me for those who have done wrong, for they will surely be drowned.”

verses.text: So he began to build the Ark, and whenever some of the chiefs of his people passed by, they mocked him. He said, “If you laugh at us, we will ˹soon˺ laugh at you similarly.
verses.translation: So he began to build the Ark, and whenever some of the chiefs of his people passed by, they mocked him. He said, “If you laugh at us, we will ˹soon˺ laugh at you similarly.

verses.text: You will soon come to know who will be visited by a humiliating torment ˹in this life˺ and overwhelmed by an everlasting punishment ˹in the next˺.” The Flood
verses.translation: You will soon come to know who will be visited by a humiliating torment ˹in this life˺ and overwhelmed by an everlasting punishment ˹in the next˺.” The Flood

verses.text: And when Our command came and the oven burst ˹with water˺,[418] We said ˹to Noah˺, “Take into the Ark a pair from every species along with your family—except those against whom the decree ˹to drown˺ has already been passed—and those who believe.” But none believed with him except for a few.
verses.translation: And when Our command came and the oven burst ˹with water˺,[418] We said ˹to Noah˺, “Take into the Ark a pair from every species along with your family—except those against whom the decree ˹to drown˺ has already been passed—and those who believe.” But none believed with him except for a few.

verses.text: And he said, “Board it! In the Name of Allah it will sail and cast anchor. Surely my Lord is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.” Noah’s Son
verses.translation: And he said, “Board it! In the Name of Allah it will sail and cast anchor. Surely my Lord is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.” Noah’s Son

verses.text: And ˹so˺ the Ark sailed with them through waves like mountains. Noah called out to his son, who stood apart, “O my dear son! Come aboard with us and do not be with the disbelievers.”
verses.translation: And ˹so˺ the Ark sailed with them through waves like mountains. Noah called out to his son, who stood apart, “O my dear son! Come aboard with us and do not be with the disbelievers.”

verses.text: He replied, “I will take refuge on a mountain, which will protect me from the water.” Noah cried, “Today no one is protected from Allah’s decree except those to whom He shows mercy!” And the waves came between them, and his son was among the drowned.
verses.translation: He replied, “I will take refuge on a mountain, which will protect me from the water.” Noah cried, “Today no one is protected from Allah’s decree except those to whom He shows mercy!” And the waves came between them, and his son was among the drowned.

verses.text: And it was said, “O earth! Swallow up your water. And O sky! Withhold ˹your rain˺.” The floodwater receded and the decree was carried out. The Ark rested on Mount Judi, and it was said, “Away with the wrongdoing people!” Noah Pleading for His Son
verses.translation: And it was said, “O earth! Swallow up your water. And O sky! Withhold ˹your rain˺.” The floodwater receded and the decree was carried out. The Ark rested on Mount Judi, and it was said, “Away with the wrongdoing people!” Noah Pleading for His Son

verses.text: Noah called out to his Lord, saying, “My Lord! Certainly my son is ˹also˺ of my family, Your promise is surely true, and You are the most just of all judges!”
verses.translation: Noah called out to his Lord, saying, “My Lord! Certainly my son is ˹also˺ of my family, Your promise is surely true, and You are the most just of all judges!”

verses.text: Allah replied, “O Noah! He is certainly not of your family—he was entirely of unrighteous conduct. So do not ask Me about what you have no knowledge of! I warn you so you do not fall into ignorance.”
verses.translation: Allah replied, “O Noah! He is certainly not of your family—he was entirely of unrighteous conduct. So do not ask Me about what you have no knowledge of! I warn you so you do not fall into ignorance.”

verses.text: Noah pleaded, “My Lord, I seek refuge in You from asking You about what I have no knowledge of, and unless You forgive me and have mercy on me, I will be one of the losers.”
verses.translation: Noah pleaded, “My Lord, I seek refuge in You from asking You about what I have no knowledge of, and unless You forgive me and have mercy on me, I will be one of the losers.”

verses.text: It was said, “O Noah! Disembark with Our peace and blessings on you and some of the descendants of those with you. As for the others, We will allow them ˹a brief˺ enjoyment, then they will be touched with a painful punishment from Us.” Stories of the Past
verses.translation: It was said, “O Noah! Disembark with Our peace and blessings on you and some of the descendants of those with you. As for the others, We will allow them ˹a brief˺ enjoyment, then they will be touched with a painful punishment from Us.” Stories of the Past

verses.text: This is one of the stories of the unseen, which we reveal to you ˹O Prophet˺. Neither you nor your people knew it before this. So be patient! Surely the ultimate outcome belongs ˹only˺ to the righteous. Prophet Hûd
verses.translation: This is one of the stories of the unseen, which we reveal to you ˹O Prophet˺. Neither you nor your people knew it before this. So be patient! Surely the ultimate outcome belongs ˹only˺ to the righteous. Prophet Hûd

verses.text: And to the people of ’Âd We sent their brother Hûd. He said, “O my people! Worship Allah. You have no god other than Him. You do nothing but fabricate lies ˹against Allah˺.
verses.translation: And to the people of ’Âd We sent their brother Hûd. He said, “O my people! Worship Allah. You have no god other than Him. You do nothing but fabricate lies ˹against Allah˺.

verses.text: O my people! I do not ask you for any reward for this ˹message˺. My reward is only from the One Who created me. Will you not then understand?
verses.translation: O my people! I do not ask you for any reward for this ˹message˺. My reward is only from the One Who created me. Will you not then understand?

verses.text: And O my people! Seek your Lord’s forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance. He will shower you with rain in abundance, and add strength to your strength. So do not turn away, persisting in wickedness.” His People’s Response and His Argument
verses.translation: And O my people! Seek your Lord’s forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance. He will shower you with rain in abundance, and add strength to your strength. So do not turn away, persisting in wickedness.” His People’s Response and His Argument

verses.text: They argued, “O Hûd! You have not given us any clear proof, and we will never abandon our gods upon your word, nor will we believe in you.
verses.translation: They argued, “O Hûd! You have not given us any clear proof, and we will never abandon our gods upon your word, nor will we believe in you.

verses.text: All we can say is that some of our gods have possessed you with evil.” He said, “I call Allah to witness, and you too bear witness, that I ˹totally˺ reject whatever you associate
verses.translation: All we can say is that some of our gods have possessed you with evil.” He said, “I call Allah to witness, and you too bear witness, that I ˹totally˺ reject whatever you associate

verses.text: with Him ˹in worship˺. So let all of you plot against me without delay!
verses.translation: with Him ˹in worship˺. So let all of you plot against me without delay!

verses.text: I have put my trust in Allah—my Lord and your Lord. There is no living creature that is not completely under His control.[419] Surely my Lord’s Way is perfect justice.[420]
verses.translation: I have put my trust in Allah—my Lord and your Lord. There is no living creature that is not completely under His control.[419] Surely my Lord’s Way is perfect justice.[420]

verses.text: But if you turn away, I have already delivered to you what I have been sent with. My Lord will replace you with others. You are not harming Him in the least. Indeed, my Lord is a ˹vigilant˺ Keeper over all things.” The Torment
verses.translation: But if you turn away, I have already delivered to you what I have been sent with. My Lord will replace you with others. You are not harming Him in the least. Indeed, my Lord is a ˹vigilant˺ Keeper over all things.” The Torment

verses.text: When Our command came, We rescued Hûd and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us, saving them from a harsh torment.
verses.translation: When Our command came, We rescued Hûd and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us, saving them from a harsh torment.

verses.text: That was ’Âd. They denied the signs of their Lord, disobeyed His messengers, [421] and followed the command of every stubborn tyrant.
verses.translation: That was ’Âd. They denied the signs of their Lord, disobeyed His messengers, [421] and followed the command of every stubborn tyrant.

verses.text: They were followed by a curse in this world, as they will be on the Day of Judgment. Surely ’Âd denied their Lord. So away with ’Âd, the people of Hûd. Prophet Ṣâli ḥ
verses.translation: They were followed by a curse in this world, as they will be on the Day of Judgment. Surely ’Âd denied their Lord. So away with ’Âd, the people of Hûd. Prophet Ṣâli ḥ

verses.text: And to the people of Thamûd We sent their brother Ṣâliḥ. He said, “O my people! Worship Allah. You have no god other than Him. He ˹is the One Who˺ produced you from the earth and settled you on it. So seek His forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance. Surely my Lord is Ever Near, All-Responsive ˹to prayers˺.” His People’s Argument
verses.translation: And to the people of Thamûd We sent their brother Ṣâliḥ. He said, “O my people! Worship Allah. You have no god other than Him. He ˹is the One Who˺ produced you from the earth and settled you on it. So seek His forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance. Surely my Lord is Ever Near, All-Responsive ˹to prayers˺.” His People’s Argument

verses.text: They argued, “O Ṣâliḥ! We truly had high hopes in you before this.[422] How dare you forbid us to worship what our forefathers had worshipped? We are certainly in alarming doubt about what you are inviting us to.” His Response
verses.translation: They argued, “O Ṣâliḥ! We truly had high hopes in you before this.[422] How dare you forbid us to worship what our forefathers had worshipped? We are certainly in alarming doubt about what you are inviting us to.” His Response

verses.text: He responded, “O my people! Consider if I stand on a clear proof from my Lord and He has blessed me with a mercy from Him. Who could help me against Allah if I were to disobey Him? You would only contribute to my doom.
verses.translation: He responded, “O my people! Consider if I stand on a clear proof from my Lord and He has blessed me with a mercy from Him. Who could help me against Allah if I were to disobey Him? You would only contribute to my doom.

verses.text: And O my people! This she-camel of Allah is a sign for you. [423] So leave her to graze ˹freely˺ on Allah’s earth and do her no harm, or a swift punishment will overtake you!”
verses.translation: And O my people! This she-camel of Allah is a sign for you. [423] So leave her to graze ˹freely˺ on Allah’s earth and do her no harm, or a swift punishment will overtake you!”

verses.text: But they killed her, so he warned ˹them˺, “You have ˹only˺ three ˹more˺ days to enjoy life in your homes— this is an unfailing promise!” The Torment
verses.translation: But they killed her, so he warned ˹them˺, “You have ˹only˺ three ˹more˺ days to enjoy life in your homes— this is an unfailing promise!” The Torment

verses.text: When Our command came, We saved Ṣâliḥ and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us and spared them the disgrace of that Day. Surely your Lord ˹alone˺ is the All-Powerful, Almighty.
verses.translation: When Our command came, We saved Ṣâliḥ and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us and spared them the disgrace of that Day. Surely your Lord ˹alone˺ is the All-Powerful, Almighty.

verses.text: And the ˹mighty˺ blast overtook the wrongdoers, so they fell lifeless in their homes,
verses.translation: And the ˹mighty˺ blast overtook the wrongdoers, so they fell lifeless in their homes,

verses.text: as if they had never lived there. Surely Thamûd denied their Lord, so away with Thamûd! Abraham Visited by Angels
verses.translation: as if they had never lived there. Surely Thamûd denied their Lord, so away with Thamûd! Abraham Visited by Angels

verses.text: And surely Our messenger-angels came to Abraham with good news ˹of a son˺. They greeted ˹him with˺, “Peace!” And he replied, “Peace ˹be upon you˺!” Then it was not long before he brought ˹them˺ a ˹fat,˺ roasted calf.
verses.translation: And surely Our messenger-angels came to Abraham with good news ˹of a son˺. They greeted ˹him with˺, “Peace!” And he replied, “Peace ˹be upon you˺!” Then it was not long before he brought ˹them˺ a ˹fat,˺ roasted calf.

verses.text: And when he saw that their hands did not reach for the food, he became suspicious and fearful of them.[424] They reassured ˹him˺, “Do not be afraid! We are ˹angels˺ sent ˹only˺ against the people of Lot.” Good News to Sarah
verses.translation: And when he saw that their hands did not reach for the food, he became suspicious and fearful of them.[424] They reassured ˹him˺, “Do not be afraid! We are ˹angels˺ sent ˹only˺ against the people of Lot.” Good News to Sarah

verses.text: And his wife was standing by, so she laughed,[425] then We gave her good news of ˹the birth of˺ Isaac, and, after him, Jacob.
verses.translation: And his wife was standing by, so she laughed,[425] then We gave her good news of ˹the birth of˺ Isaac, and, after him, Jacob.

verses.text: She wondered, “Oh, my! How can I have a child in this old age, and my husband here is an old man? This is truly an astonishing thing!”
verses.translation: She wondered, “Oh, my! How can I have a child in this old age, and my husband here is an old man? This is truly an astonishing thing!”

verses.text: They responded, “Are you astonished by Allah’s decree? May Allah’s mercy and blessings be upon you, O people of this house. Indeed, He is Praiseworthy, All-Glorious.” Abraham Pleading for Lot’s People
verses.translation: They responded, “Are you astonished by Allah’s decree? May Allah’s mercy and blessings be upon you, O people of this house. Indeed, He is Praiseworthy, All-Glorious.” Abraham Pleading for Lot’s People

verses.text: Then after the fear had left Abraham, and the good news had reached him, he began to plead with Us for the people of Lot.
verses.translation: Then after the fear had left Abraham, and the good news had reached him, he began to plead with Us for the people of Lot.

verses.text: Truly, Abraham was forbearing, tender-hearted, and ever turning ˹to his Lord˺.
verses.translation: Truly, Abraham was forbearing, tender-hearted, and ever turning ˹to his Lord˺.

verses.text: ˹The angels said,˺ “O Abraham! Plead no more! Your Lord’s decree has already come, and they will certainly be afflicted with a punishment that cannot be averted!” Lot’s Handsome Guests
verses.translation: ˹The angels said,˺ “O Abraham! Plead no more! Your Lord’s decree has already come, and they will certainly be afflicted with a punishment that cannot be averted!” Lot’s Handsome Guests

verses.text: When Our messenger-angels came to Lot, he was distressed and worried by their arrival.[426] He said, “This is a terrible day.”
verses.translation: When Our messenger-angels came to Lot, he was distressed and worried by their arrival.[426] He said, “This is a terrible day.”

verses.text: And ˹the men of˺ his people—who were used to shameful deeds—came to him rushing. He pleaded, “O my people! Here are my daughters[427] ˹for marriage˺—they are pure for you. So fear Allah, and do not humiliate me by disrespecting my guests. Is there not ˹even˺ a single right-minded man among you?”
verses.translation: And ˹the men of˺ his people—who were used to shameful deeds—came to him rushing. He pleaded, “O my people! Here are my daughters[427] ˹for marriage˺—they are pure for you. So fear Allah, and do not humiliate me by disrespecting my guests. Is there not ˹even˺ a single right-minded man among you?”

verses.text: They argued, “You certainly know that we have no need for your daughters. You already know what we desire!”
verses.translation: They argued, “You certainly know that we have no need for your daughters. You already know what we desire!”

verses.text: He responded, “If only I had the strength ˹to resist you˺ or could rely on a strong supporter.” Reassuring Lot
verses.translation: He responded, “If only I had the strength ˹to resist you˺ or could rely on a strong supporter.” Reassuring Lot

verses.text: The angels said, “O Lot! We are the messengers of your Lord. They will never reach you. So travel with your family in the dark of night, and do not let any of you look back, except your wife. She will certainly suffer the fate of the others.[428] Their appointed time is the morning. Is the morning not near?” The Torment
verses.translation: The angels said, “O Lot! We are the messengers of your Lord. They will never reach you. So travel with your family in the dark of night, and do not let any of you look back, except your wife. She will certainly suffer the fate of the others.[428] Their appointed time is the morning. Is the morning not near?” The Torment

verses.text: When Our command came, We turned the cities upside down and rained down on them clustered stones of baked clay,
verses.translation: When Our command came, We turned the cities upside down and rained down on them clustered stones of baked clay,

verses.text: marked by your Lord ˹O Prophet˺. And these stones are not far from the ˹pagan˺ wrongdoers! Prophet Shu’aib
verses.translation: marked by your Lord ˹O Prophet˺. And these stones are not far from the ˹pagan˺ wrongdoers! Prophet Shu’aib

verses.text: And to the people of Midian We sent their brother Shu’aib. He said, “O my people! Worship Allah. You have no god other than Him. And do not give short measure and weight. I do see you in prosperity now, but I truly fear for you the torment of an overwhelming Day.
verses.translation: And to the people of Midian We sent their brother Shu’aib. He said, “O my people! Worship Allah. You have no god other than Him. And do not give short measure and weight. I do see you in prosperity now, but I truly fear for you the torment of an overwhelming Day.

verses.text: O my people! Give full measure and weigh with justice. Do not defraud people of their property, nor go about spreading corruption in the land.
verses.translation: O my people! Give full measure and weigh with justice. Do not defraud people of their property, nor go about spreading corruption in the land.

verses.text: What is left ˹as a lawful gain˺ by Allah is far better for you if you are ˹truly˺ believers. And I am not a keeper over you.” His People’s Response
verses.translation: What is left ˹as a lawful gain˺ by Allah is far better for you if you are ˹truly˺ believers. And I am not a keeper over you.” His People’s Response

verses.text: They asked ˹sarcastically˺, “O Shu’aib! Does your prayer command you that we should abandon what our forefathers worshipped or give up managing our wealth as we please? Indeed, you are such a tolerant, sensible man!” Shu’aib’s Argument
verses.translation: They asked ˹sarcastically˺, “O Shu’aib! Does your prayer command you that we should abandon what our forefathers worshipped or give up managing our wealth as we please? Indeed, you are such a tolerant, sensible man!” Shu’aib’s Argument

verses.text: He said, “O my people! Consider if I stand on a clear proof from my Lord and He has blessed me with a good provision from Him. I do not want to do what I am forbidding you from. I only intend reform to the best of my ability. My success comes only through Allah. In Him I trust and to Him I turn.
verses.translation: He said, “O my people! Consider if I stand on a clear proof from my Lord and He has blessed me with a good provision from Him. I do not want to do what I am forbidding you from. I only intend reform to the best of my ability. My success comes only through Allah. In Him I trust and to Him I turn.

verses.text: O my people! Do not let your opposition to me lead you to a fate similar to that of the people of Noah, or Hûd, or Ṣâliḥ. And the people of Lot are not far from you.[429]
verses.translation: O my people! Do not let your opposition to me lead you to a fate similar to that of the people of Noah, or Hûd, or Ṣâliḥ. And the people of Lot are not far from you.[429]

verses.text: So seek your Lord’s forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance. Surely my Lord is Most Merciful, All-Loving.” The Threat
verses.translation: So seek your Lord’s forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance. Surely my Lord is Most Merciful, All-Loving.” The Threat

verses.text: They threatened, “O Shu’aib! We do not comprehend much of what you say, and surely we see you powerless among us. Were it not for your clan, we would have certainly stoned you, for you are nothing to us.” Shu’aib’s Response
verses.translation: They threatened, “O Shu’aib! We do not comprehend much of what you say, and surely we see you powerless among us. Were it not for your clan, we would have certainly stoned you, for you are nothing to us.” Shu’aib’s Response

verses.text: He said, “O my people! Do you have more regard for my clan than for Allah, turning your back on Him entirely? Surely my Lord is Fully Aware of what you do.
verses.translation: He said, “O my people! Do you have more regard for my clan than for Allah, turning your back on Him entirely? Surely my Lord is Fully Aware of what you do.

verses.text: O my people! Persist in your ways, for I ˹too˺ will persist in mine. You will soon come to know who will be visited by a humiliating torment and is a liar! And watch! I too am watching with you!” The Torment
verses.translation: O my people! Persist in your ways, for I ˹too˺ will persist in mine. You will soon come to know who will be visited by a humiliating torment and is a liar! And watch! I too am watching with you!” The Torment

verses.text: When Our command came, We saved Shu’aib and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us. And the ˹mighty˺ blast overtook the wrongdoers, so they fell lifeless in their homes,
verses.translation: When Our command came, We saved Shu’aib and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us. And the ˹mighty˺ blast overtook the wrongdoers, so they fell lifeless in their homes,

verses.text: as if they had never lived there. So away with Midian as it was with Thamûd! Prophet Moses
verses.translation: as if they had never lived there. So away with Midian as it was with Thamûd! Prophet Moses

verses.text: Indeed, We sent Moses with Our signs and compelling proof
verses.translation: Indeed, We sent Moses with Our signs and compelling proof

verses.text: to Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they followed the command of Pharaoh, and Pharaoh’s command was not well guided.
verses.translation: to Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they followed the command of Pharaoh, and Pharaoh’s command was not well guided.

verses.text: He will be before his people on the Day of Judgment and will lead them into the Fire. What an evil place to be led into!
verses.translation: He will be before his people on the Day of Judgment and will lead them into the Fire. What an evil place to be led into!

verses.text: They were followed by a curse in this ˹life˺ and ˹will receive another˺ on the Day of Judgment. What an evil gift to receive! Reward of Wickedness
verses.translation: They were followed by a curse in this ˹life˺ and ˹will receive another˺ on the Day of Judgment. What an evil gift to receive! Reward of Wickedness

verses.text: These are accounts, We relate to you ˹O Prophet˺, of the ˹destroyed˺ cities. Some are still standing ˹barren˺, while others have been mowed down.
verses.translation: These are accounts, We relate to you ˹O Prophet˺, of the ˹destroyed˺ cities. Some are still standing ˹barren˺, while others have been mowed down.

verses.text: We did not wrong them, rather they wronged themselves. The gods they invoked beside Allah were of no help at all when the command of your Lord came, and only contributed to their ruin.
verses.translation: We did not wrong them, rather they wronged themselves. The gods they invoked beside Allah were of no help at all when the command of your Lord came, and only contributed to their ruin.

verses.text: Such is the ˹crushing˺ grip of your Lord when He seizes the societies entrenched in wrongdoing. Indeed, His grip is ˹terribly˺ painful and severe. Judgment Day
verses.translation: Such is the ˹crushing˺ grip of your Lord when He seizes the societies entrenched in wrongdoing. Indeed, His grip is ˹terribly˺ painful and severe. Judgment Day

verses.text: Surely in this is a sign for those who fear the torment of the Hereafter. That is a Day for which humanity will be gathered and a Day ˹that will be˺ witnessed ˹by all˺.
verses.translation: Surely in this is a sign for those who fear the torment of the Hereafter. That is a Day for which humanity will be gathered and a Day ˹that will be˺ witnessed ˹by all˺.

verses.text: We only delay it for a fixed term.
verses.translation: We only delay it for a fixed term.

verses.text: When that Day arrives, no one will dare speak except with His permission. Some of them will be miserable, others joyful. The Miserable
verses.translation: When that Day arrives, no one will dare speak except with His permission. Some of them will be miserable, others joyful. The Miserable

verses.text: As for those bound for misery, they will be in the Fire, where they will be sighing and gasping,
verses.translation: As for those bound for misery, they will be in the Fire, where they will be sighing and gasping,

verses.text: staying there forever, as long as the heavens and the earth will endure, except what your Lord wills.[430] Surely your Lord does what He intends. The Joyful
verses.translation: staying there forever, as long as the heavens and the earth will endure, except what your Lord wills.[430] Surely your Lord does what He intends. The Joyful

verses.text: And as for those destined to joy, they will be in Paradise, staying there forever, as long as the heavens and the earth will endure, except what your Lord wills[431]—a ˹generous˺ giving, without end. Blind Following
verses.translation: And as for those destined to joy, they will be in Paradise, staying there forever, as long as the heavens and the earth will endure, except what your Lord wills[431]—a ˹generous˺ giving, without end. Blind Following

verses.text: So do not be in doubt ˹O Prophet˺ about what those ˹pagans˺ worship. They worship nothing except what their forefathers worshipped before ˹them˺. And We will certainly give them their share ˹of punishment˺ in full, without any reduction. The Torah
verses.translation: So do not be in doubt ˹O Prophet˺ about what those ˹pagans˺ worship. They worship nothing except what their forefathers worshipped before ˹them˺. And We will certainly give them their share ˹of punishment˺ in full, without any reduction. The Torah

verses.text: Indeed, We had given Moses the Scripture, but differences arose regarding it. Had it not been for a prior decree from your Lord,[432] their differences would have been settled ˹at once˺. They are truly in alarming doubt about it.
verses.translation: Indeed, We had given Moses the Scripture, but differences arose regarding it. Had it not been for a prior decree from your Lord,[432] their differences would have been settled ˹at once˺. They are truly in alarming doubt about it.

verses.text: And surely your Lord will fully pay all for their deeds. He is certainly All-Aware of what they do. Advice to the Believers
verses.translation: And surely your Lord will fully pay all for their deeds. He is certainly All-Aware of what they do. Advice to the Believers

verses.text: So be steadfast as you are commanded ˹O Prophet˺, along with those who turn ˹in submission to Allah˺ with you. And do not transgress. Surely He is All-Seeing of what you ˹believers˺ do.
verses.translation: So be steadfast as you are commanded ˹O Prophet˺, along with those who turn ˹in submission to Allah˺ with you. And do not transgress. Surely He is All-Seeing of what you ˹believers˺ do.

verses.text: And do not be inclined to the wrongdoers or you will be touched by the Fire. For then you would have no protectors other than Allah, nor would you be helped.
verses.translation: And do not be inclined to the wrongdoers or you will be touched by the Fire. For then you would have no protectors other than Allah, nor would you be helped.

verses.text: Establish prayer ˹O Prophet˺ at both ends of the day and in the early part of the night. [433] Surely good deeds wipe out evil deeds. That is a reminder for the mindful.
verses.translation: Establish prayer ˹O Prophet˺ at both ends of the day and in the early part of the night. [433] Surely good deeds wipe out evil deeds. That is a reminder for the mindful.

verses.text: And be patient! Certainly Allah does not discount the reward of the good-doers. Speaking out Against Evil
verses.translation: And be patient! Certainly Allah does not discount the reward of the good-doers. Speaking out Against Evil

verses.text: If only there had been among the ˹destroyed˺ peoples before you, ˹O believers,˺ virtuous individuals who forbade corruption in the land—other than the few We had saved ˹from the torment˺. But the wrongdoers ˹only˺ pursued their ˹worldly˺ pleasures, becoming wicked.
verses.translation: If only there had been among the ˹destroyed˺ peoples before you, ˹O believers,˺ virtuous individuals who forbade corruption in the land—other than the few We had saved ˹from the torment˺. But the wrongdoers ˹only˺ pursued their ˹worldly˺ pleasures, becoming wicked.

verses.text: And your Lord ˹O Prophet˺ would never destroy a society unjustly while its people were acting rightly. Free Choice
verses.translation: And your Lord ˹O Prophet˺ would never destroy a society unjustly while its people were acting rightly. Free Choice

verses.text: Had your Lord so willed, He would have certainly made humanity one single community ˹of believers˺, but they will always ˹choose to˺ differ—
verses.translation: Had your Lord so willed, He would have certainly made humanity one single community ˹of believers˺, but they will always ˹choose to˺ differ—

verses.text: except those shown mercy by your Lord—and so He created them ˹to choose freely˺. And so the Word of your Lord will be fulfilled: “I will surely fill up Hell with jinn and humans all together.” Moral of the Stories
verses.translation: except those shown mercy by your Lord—and so He created them ˹to choose freely˺. And so the Word of your Lord will be fulfilled: “I will surely fill up Hell with jinn and humans all together.” Moral of the Stories

verses.text: And We relate to you ˹O Prophet˺ the stories of the messengers to reassure your heart. And there has come to you in this ˹sûrah˺ the truth, a warning ˹to the disbelievers˺, and a reminder to the believers.
verses.translation: And We relate to you ˹O Prophet˺ the stories of the messengers to reassure your heart. And there has come to you in this ˹sûrah˺ the truth, a warning ˹to the disbelievers˺, and a reminder to the believers.

verses.text: Say to those who disbelieve, “Persist in your ways; we will certainly persist in ours.
verses.translation: Say to those who disbelieve, “Persist in your ways; we will certainly persist in ours.

verses.text: And wait! Surely we ˹too˺ are waiting.” Allah Almighty
verses.translation: And wait! Surely we ˹too˺ are waiting.” Allah Almighty

verses.text: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs the knowledge of what is hidden in the heavens and the earth. And to Him all matters are returned. So worship Him and put your trust in Him. And your Lord is never unaware of what you do. *** -- 207 of 694 --

name: Joseph
intro: Rightfully called ‘the best of stories,’ this uplifting Meccan sûrah was revealed along with the two previous sûrahs at a critical time in the life of the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) following the death of his wife Khadîjah and his uncle Abu Ṭâlib, his two main supporters, shortly after a 3-year boycott by the Meccan pagans to suppress the believers. This is the story of Joseph ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) whose half-brothers were driven by jealousy, conspiring to distance him from his father Jacob ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص). Joseph was sold into slavery in Egypt, falsely accused, and imprisoned for several years, only to become Egypt’s Chief Minister. Just like Joseph ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص), the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) had to live away from his hometown, was faced with false allegations and abused by his own people, but ultimately became Arabia’s undisputed leader. When the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) triumphed over Mecca after many years of persecution, he treated the very people who abused him with grace, recalling the words of Joseph when his brothers begged for mercy in verse 92, “There is no blame on you today. May Allah forgive you! He is the Most Merciful of the merciful!” In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful The Best of Stories

verses.text: Alif-Lãm-Ra. These are the verses of the clear Book.
verses.translation: Alif-Lãm-Ra. These are the verses of the clear Book.

verses.text: Indeed, We have sent it down as an Arabic Quran[434] so that you may understand.[435]
verses.translation: Indeed, We have sent it down as an Arabic Quran[434] so that you may understand.[435]

verses.text: We relate to you ˹O Prophet˺ the best of stories through Our revelation of this Quran, though before this you were totally unaware ˹of them˺. Joseph’s Dream
verses.translation: We relate to you ˹O Prophet˺ the best of stories through Our revelation of this Quran, though before this you were totally unaware ˹of them˺. Joseph’s Dream

verses.text: ˹Remember˺ when Joseph said to his father, “O my dear father! Indeed I dreamt of eleven stars, and the sun, and the moon—I saw them prostrating to me!”[436]
verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when Joseph said to his father, “O my dear father! Indeed I dreamt of eleven stars, and the sun, and the moon—I saw them prostrating to me!”[436]

verses.text: He replied, “O my dear son! Do not relate your vision to your brothers, or they will devise a plot against you. Surely Satan is a sworn enemy to humankind.
verses.translation: He replied, “O my dear son! Do not relate your vision to your brothers, or they will devise a plot against you. Surely Satan is a sworn enemy to humankind.

verses.text: And so will your Lord choose you ˹O Joseph˺, and teach you the interpretation of dreams, and perfect His favour upon you and the descendants of Jacob—˹just˺ as He once perfected it upon your forefathers, Abraham and Isaac. Surely your Lord is All-Knowing, All- Wise.” Conspiracy by Joseph’s Brothers
verses.translation: And so will your Lord choose you ˹O Joseph˺, and teach you the interpretation of dreams, and perfect His favour upon you and the descendants of Jacob—˹just˺ as He once perfected it upon your forefathers, Abraham and Isaac. Surely your Lord is All-Knowing, All- Wise.” Conspiracy by Joseph’s Brothers

verses.text: Indeed, in the story of Joseph and his brothers there are lessons for all who ask.
verses.translation: Indeed, in the story of Joseph and his brothers there are lessons for all who ask.

verses.text: ˹Remember˺ when they said ˹to one another˺, “Surely Joseph and his brother ˹Benjamin˺ are more beloved to our father than we, even though we are a group of so many.[437] Indeed, our father is clearly mistaken.
verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when they said ˹to one another˺, “Surely Joseph and his brother ˹Benjamin˺ are more beloved to our father than we, even though we are a group of so many.[437] Indeed, our father is clearly mistaken.

verses.text: Kill Joseph or cast him out to some ˹distant˺ land so that our father’s attention will be only ours, then after that you may ˹repent and˺ become righteous people!”
verses.translation: Kill Joseph or cast him out to some ˹distant˺ land so that our father’s attention will be only ours, then after that you may ˹repent and˺ become righteous people!”

verses.text: One of them said, “Do not kill Joseph. But if you must do something, throw him into the bottom of a well so perhaps he may be picked up by some travellers.” Convincing Jacob
verses.translation: One of them said, “Do not kill Joseph. But if you must do something, throw him into the bottom of a well so perhaps he may be picked up by some travellers.” Convincing Jacob

verses.text: They said, “O our father! Why do you not trust us with Joseph, although we truly wish him well?
verses.translation: They said, “O our father! Why do you not trust us with Joseph, although we truly wish him well?

verses.text: Send him out with us tomorrow so that he may enjoy himself and play. And we will really watch over him.”
verses.translation: Send him out with us tomorrow so that he may enjoy himself and play. And we will really watch over him.”

verses.text: He responded, “It would truly sadden me if you took him away with you, and I fear that a wolf may devour him while you are negligent of him.”
verses.translation: He responded, “It would truly sadden me if you took him away with you, and I fear that a wolf may devour him while you are negligent of him.”

verses.text: They said, “If a wolf were to devour him, despite our strong group, then we would certainly be losers!”
verses.translation: They said, “If a wolf were to devour him, despite our strong group, then we would certainly be losers!”

verses.text: And so, when they took him away and decided to throw him into the bottom of the well, We inspired him: “˹One day˺ you will remind them of this deed of theirs while they are unaware ˹of who you are˺.” Faking Joseph’s Death
verses.translation: And so, when they took him away and decided to throw him into the bottom of the well, We inspired him: “˹One day˺ you will remind them of this deed of theirs while they are unaware ˹of who you are˺.” Faking Joseph’s Death

verses.text: Then they returned to their father in the evening, weeping.
verses.translation: Then they returned to their father in the evening, weeping.

verses.text: They cried, “Our father! We went racing and left Joseph with our belongings, and a wolf devoured him! But you will not believe us, no matter how truthful we are.”
verses.translation: They cried, “Our father! We went racing and left Joseph with our belongings, and a wolf devoured him! But you will not believe us, no matter how truthful we are.”
