verses.text: And they brought his shirt, stained with false blood.[438] He responded, “No! Your souls must have tempted you to do something ˹evil˺. So ˹I can only endure with˺ beautiful patience![439] It is Allah’s help that I seek to bear your claims.” Joseph Sold into Slavery
verses.translation: And they brought his shirt, stained with false blood.[438] He responded, “No! Your souls must have tempted you to do something ˹evil˺. So ˹I can only endure with˺ beautiful patience![439] It is Allah’s help that I seek to bear your claims.” Joseph Sold into Slavery

verses.text: And there came some travellers, and they sent their water-boy who let down his bucket into the well. He cried out, “Oh, what a great find! Here is a boy!” And they took him secretly ˹to be sold˺ as merchandise, but Allah is All-Knowing of what they did.
verses.translation: And there came some travellers, and they sent their water-boy who let down his bucket into the well. He cried out, “Oh, what a great find! Here is a boy!” And they took him secretly ˹to be sold˺ as merchandise, but Allah is All-Knowing of what they did.

verses.text: They ˹later˺ sold him for a cheap price, just a few silver coins—only wanting to get rid of him.[440] Joseph in Egypt
verses.translation: They ˹later˺ sold him for a cheap price, just a few silver coins—only wanting to get rid of him.[440] Joseph in Egypt

verses.text: The man from Egypt[441] who bought him said to his wife, “Take good care of him, perhaps he may be useful to us or we may adopt him as a son.” This is how We established Joseph in the land, so that We might teach him the interpretation of dreams. Allah’s Will always prevails, but most people do not know.
verses.translation: The man from Egypt[441] who bought him said to his wife, “Take good care of him, perhaps he may be useful to us or we may adopt him as a son.” This is how We established Joseph in the land, so that We might teach him the interpretation of dreams. Allah’s Will always prevails, but most people do not know.

verses.text: And when he reached maturity, We gave him wisdom and knowledge. This is how We reward the good-doers. The Temptation
verses.translation: And when he reached maturity, We gave him wisdom and knowledge. This is how We reward the good-doers. The Temptation

verses.text: And the lady, in whose house he lived, tried to seduce him. She locked the doors ˹firmly˺ and said, “Come to me!” He replied, “Allah is my refuge! It is ˹not right to betray˺ my master, who has taken good care of me. Indeed, the wrongdoers never succeed.”
verses.translation: And the lady, in whose house he lived, tried to seduce him. She locked the doors ˹firmly˺ and said, “Come to me!” He replied, “Allah is my refuge! It is ˹not right to betray˺ my master, who has taken good care of me. Indeed, the wrongdoers never succeed.”

verses.text: She advanced towards him, and he would have done likewise, had he not seen a sign from his Lord.[442] This is how We kept evil and indecency away from him, for he was truly one of Our chosen servants.
verses.translation: She advanced towards him, and he would have done likewise, had he not seen a sign from his Lord.[442] This is how We kept evil and indecency away from him, for he was truly one of Our chosen servants.

verses.text: They raced for the door and she tore his shirt from the back, only to find her husband at the door. She cried, “What is the penalty for someone who tried to violate your wife, except imprisonment or a painful punishment?” The Witness
verses.translation: They raced for the door and she tore his shirt from the back, only to find her husband at the door. She cried, “What is the penalty for someone who tried to violate your wife, except imprisonment or a painful punishment?” The Witness

verses.text: Joseph responded, “It was she who tried to seduce me.” And a witness from her own family testified: “If his shirt is torn from the front, then she has told the truth and he is a liar.
verses.translation: Joseph responded, “It was she who tried to seduce me.” And a witness from her own family testified: “If his shirt is torn from the front, then she has told the truth and he is a liar.

verses.text: But if it is torn from the back, then she has lied and he is truthful.”
verses.translation: But if it is torn from the back, then she has lied and he is truthful.”

verses.text: So when her husband saw that Joseph’s shirt was torn from the back, he said ˹to her˺, “This must be ˹an example˺ of the cunning of you ˹women˺! Indeed, your cunning is so shrewd!
verses.translation: So when her husband saw that Joseph’s shirt was torn from the back, he said ˹to her˺, “This must be ˹an example˺ of the cunning of you ˹women˺! Indeed, your cunning is so shrewd!

verses.text: O Joseph! Forget about this. And you ˹O wife˺! Seek forgiveness for your sin.[443] It certainly has been your fault.” The Women and Joseph’s Beauty
verses.translation: O Joseph! Forget about this. And you ˹O wife˺! Seek forgiveness for your sin.[443] It certainly has been your fault.” The Women and Joseph’s Beauty

verses.text: Some women of the city gossiped, “The Chief Minister’s wife is trying to seduce her slave-boy. Love for him has plagued her heart. Indeed, we see that she is clearly mistaken.”[444]
verses.translation: Some women of the city gossiped, “The Chief Minister’s wife is trying to seduce her slave-boy. Love for him has plagued her heart. Indeed, we see that she is clearly mistaken.”[444]

verses.text: When she heard about their gossip, [445] she invited them and set a banquet for them. She gave each one a knife, then said ˹to Joseph˺, “Come out before them.” When they saw him, they were so stunned ˹by his beauty˺ that they cut their hands,[446] and exclaimed, “Good God! This cannot be human; this must be a noble angel!”
verses.translation: When she heard about their gossip, [445] she invited them and set a banquet for them. She gave each one a knife, then said ˹to Joseph˺, “Come out before them.” When they saw him, they were so stunned ˹by his beauty˺ that they cut their hands,[446] and exclaimed, “Good God! This cannot be human; this must be a noble angel!”

verses.text: She said, “This is the one for whose love you criticized me! I did try to seduce him but he ˹firmly˺ refused. And if he does not do what I order him to, he will certainly be imprisoned and ˹fully˺ disgraced.”[447] The Lesser of Two Evils
verses.translation: She said, “This is the one for whose love you criticized me! I did try to seduce him but he ˹firmly˺ refused. And if he does not do what I order him to, he will certainly be imprisoned and ˹fully˺ disgraced.”[447] The Lesser of Two Evils

verses.text: Joseph prayed, “My Lord! I would rather be in jail than do what they invite me to. And if You do not turn their cunning away from me, I might yield to them and fall into ignorance.”
verses.translation: Joseph prayed, “My Lord! I would rather be in jail than do what they invite me to. And if You do not turn their cunning away from me, I might yield to them and fall into ignorance.”

verses.text: So his Lord responded to him, turning their cunning away from him. Surely He is the All-Hearing, All- Knowing.
verses.translation: So his Lord responded to him, turning their cunning away from him. Surely He is the All-Hearing, All- Knowing.

verses.text: And so it occurred to those in charge, despite seeing all the proofs ˹of his innocence˺, that he should be imprisoned for a while.[448] Dreams of the Two Inmates
verses.translation: And so it occurred to those in charge, despite seeing all the proofs ˹of his innocence˺, that he should be imprisoned for a while.[448] Dreams of the Two Inmates

verses.text: And two other servants went to jail with Joseph. One of them said, “I dreamt I was pressing wine.” The other said, “I dreamt I was carrying ˹some˺ bread on my head, from which birds were eating.” ˹Then both said,˺ “Tell us their interpretation, for we surely see you as one of the good- doers.” Invitation to the Truth
verses.translation: And two other servants went to jail with Joseph. One of them said, “I dreamt I was pressing wine.” The other said, “I dreamt I was carrying ˹some˺ bread on my head, from which birds were eating.” ˹Then both said,˺ “Tell us their interpretation, for we surely see you as one of the good- doers.” Invitation to the Truth

verses.text: Joseph replied, “I can even tell you what kind of meal you will be served before you receive it. This ˹knowledge˺ is from what my Lord has taught me. I have shunned the faith of a people who disbelieve in Allah and deny the Hereafter.
verses.translation: Joseph replied, “I can even tell you what kind of meal you will be served before you receive it. This ˹knowledge˺ is from what my Lord has taught me. I have shunned the faith of a people who disbelieve in Allah and deny the Hereafter.

verses.text: I follow the faith of my fathers: Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. It is not ˹right˺ for us to associate anything with Allah ˹in worship˺. This is part of Allah’s grace upon us and humanity, but most people are not grateful.
verses.translation: I follow the faith of my fathers: Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. It is not ˹right˺ for us to associate anything with Allah ˹in worship˺. This is part of Allah’s grace upon us and humanity, but most people are not grateful.

verses.text: O my fellow-prisoners! Which is far better: many different lords or Allah—the One, the Supreme?
verses.translation: O my fellow-prisoners! Which is far better: many different lords or Allah—the One, the Supreme?

verses.text: Whatever ˹idols˺ you worship instead of Him are mere names which you and your forefathers have made up[449]—a practice Allah has never authorized. It is only Allah Who decides. He has commanded that you worship none but Him. That is the upright faith, but most people do not know. Interpretation of the Dreams
verses.translation: Whatever ˹idols˺ you worship instead of Him are mere names which you and your forefathers have made up[449]—a practice Allah has never authorized. It is only Allah Who decides. He has commanded that you worship none but Him. That is the upright faith, but most people do not know. Interpretation of the Dreams

verses.text: “O my fellow-prisoners! ˹The first˺ one of you will serve wine to his master, and the other will be crucified and the birds will eat from his head. The matter about which you inquired has been decided.”
verses.translation: “O my fellow-prisoners! ˹The first˺ one of you will serve wine to his master, and the other will be crucified and the birds will eat from his head. The matter about which you inquired has been decided.”

verses.text: Then he said to the one he knew would survive, “Mention me in the presence of your master.[450]” But Satan made him forget to mention Joseph to his master, so he remained in prison for several years. The King’s Dream
verses.translation: Then he said to the one he knew would survive, “Mention me in the presence of your master.[450]” But Satan made him forget to mention Joseph to his master, so he remained in prison for several years. The King’s Dream

verses.text: And ˹one day˺ the King[451] said, “I dreamt of seven fat cows eaten up by seven skinny ones; and seven green ears of grain and ˹seven˺ others dry. O chiefs! Tell me the meaning of my dream if you can interpret dreams.”
verses.translation: And ˹one day˺ the King[451] said, “I dreamt of seven fat cows eaten up by seven skinny ones; and seven green ears of grain and ˹seven˺ others dry. O chiefs! Tell me the meaning of my dream if you can interpret dreams.”

verses.text: They replied, “These are confused visions and we do not know the interpretation of such dreams.”
verses.translation: They replied, “These are confused visions and we do not know the interpretation of such dreams.”

verses.text: ˹Finally,˺ the surviving ex-prisoner remembered ˹Joseph˺ after a long time and said, “I will tell you its interpretation, so send me forth ˹to Joseph˺.” Interpretation of the King’s Dream
verses.translation: ˹Finally,˺ the surviving ex-prisoner remembered ˹Joseph˺ after a long time and said, “I will tell you its interpretation, so send me forth ˹to Joseph˺.” Interpretation of the King’s Dream

verses.text: ˹He said,˺ “Joseph, O man of truth! Interpret for us ˹the dream of˺ seven fat cows eaten up by seven skinny ones; and seven green ears of grain and ˹seven˺ others dry, so that I may return to the people and let them know.”
verses.translation: ˹He said,˺ “Joseph, O man of truth! Interpret for us ˹the dream of˺ seven fat cows eaten up by seven skinny ones; and seven green ears of grain and ˹seven˺ others dry, so that I may return to the people and let them know.”

verses.text: Joseph replied, “You will plant ˹grain˺ for seven consecutive years, leaving in the ear whatever you will harvest, except for the little you will eat.
verses.translation: Joseph replied, “You will plant ˹grain˺ for seven consecutive years, leaving in the ear whatever you will harvest, except for the little you will eat.

verses.text: Then after that will come seven years of great hardship which will consume whatever you have saved, except the little you will store ˹for seed˺.
verses.translation: Then after that will come seven years of great hardship which will consume whatever you have saved, except the little you will store ˹for seed˺.

verses.text: Then after that will come a year in which people will receive abundant rain and they will press ˹oil and wine˺.” Joseph Declared Innocent
verses.translation: Then after that will come a year in which people will receive abundant rain and they will press ˹oil and wine˺.” Joseph Declared Innocent

verses.text: The King ˹then˺ said, “Bring him to me.” When the messenger came to him, Joseph said, “Go back to your master and ask him about the case of the women who cut their hands. Surely my Lord has ˹full˺ knowledge of their cunning.”
verses.translation: The King ˹then˺ said, “Bring him to me.” When the messenger came to him, Joseph said, “Go back to your master and ask him about the case of the women who cut their hands. Surely my Lord has ˹full˺ knowledge of their cunning.”

verses.text: The King asked ˹the women˺, “What did you get when you tried to seduce Joseph?” They replied, “Allah forbid! We know nothing indecent about him.” Then the Chief Minister’s wife admitted, “Now the truth has come to light. It was I who tried to seduce him, and he is surely truthful.
verses.translation: The King asked ˹the women˺, “What did you get when you tried to seduce Joseph?” They replied, “Allah forbid! We know nothing indecent about him.” Then the Chief Minister’s wife admitted, “Now the truth has come to light. It was I who tried to seduce him, and he is surely truthful.

verses.text: From this, Joseph should know that I did not speak dishonestly about him in his absence, for Allah certainly does not guide the scheming of the dishonest.
verses.translation: From this, Joseph should know that I did not speak dishonestly about him in his absence, for Allah certainly does not guide the scheming of the dishonest.

verses.text: And I do not seek to free myself from blame, for indeed the soul is ever inclined to evil, except those shown mercy by my Lord. Surely my Lord is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.” Joseph, the Chief Minister
verses.translation: And I do not seek to free myself from blame, for indeed the soul is ever inclined to evil, except those shown mercy by my Lord. Surely my Lord is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.” Joseph, the Chief Minister

verses.text: The King said, “Bring him to me. I will employ him exclusively in my service.” And when Joseph spoke to him, the King said, “Today you are highly esteemed and fully trusted by us.”
verses.translation: The King said, “Bring him to me. I will employ him exclusively in my service.” And when Joseph spoke to him, the King said, “Today you are highly esteemed and fully trusted by us.”

verses.text: Joseph proposed, “Put me in charge of the store-houses of the land, for I am truly reliable and adept.”
verses.translation: Joseph proposed, “Put me in charge of the store-houses of the land, for I am truly reliable and adept.”

verses.text: This is how We established Joseph in the land to settle wherever he pleased. We shower Our mercy on whoever We will, and We never discount the reward of the good-doers.
verses.translation: This is how We established Joseph in the land to settle wherever he pleased. We shower Our mercy on whoever We will, and We never discount the reward of the good-doers.

verses.text: And the reward of the Hereafter is far better for those who are faithful and are mindful ˹of Allah˺. Joseph’s Brothers Visit Egypt[452]
verses.translation: And the reward of the Hereafter is far better for those who are faithful and are mindful ˹of Allah˺. Joseph’s Brothers Visit Egypt[452]

verses.text: And Joseph’s brothers came and entered his presence. He recognized them but they were unaware of who he really was.
verses.translation: And Joseph’s brothers came and entered his presence. He recognized them but they were unaware of who he really was.

verses.text: When he had provided them with their supplies, he demanded, “Bring me your brother on your father’s side.[453] Do you not see that I give full measure and I am the best of hosts?
verses.translation: When he had provided them with their supplies, he demanded, “Bring me your brother on your father’s side.[453] Do you not see that I give full measure and I am the best of hosts?

verses.text: But if you do not bring him to me ˹next time˺, I will have no grain for you, nor will you ever come close to me again.”
verses.translation: But if you do not bring him to me ˹next time˺, I will have no grain for you, nor will you ever come close to me again.”

verses.text: They promised, “We will try to convince his father to let him come. We will certainly do ˹our best˺.”
verses.translation: They promised, “We will try to convince his father to let him come. We will certainly do ˹our best˺.”

verses.text: Joseph ordered his servants to put his brothers’ money back into their saddlebags so that they would find it when they returned to their family and perhaps they would come back. The Brothers Return Home
verses.translation: Joseph ordered his servants to put his brothers’ money back into their saddlebags so that they would find it when they returned to their family and perhaps they would come back. The Brothers Return Home

verses.text: When Joseph’s brothers returned to their father, they pleaded, “O our father! We have been denied ˹further˺ supplies. So send our brother with us so that we may receive our measure, and we will definitely watch over him.”
verses.translation: When Joseph’s brothers returned to their father, they pleaded, “O our father! We have been denied ˹further˺ supplies. So send our brother with us so that we may receive our measure, and we will definitely watch over him.”

verses.text: He responded, “Should I trust you with him as I once trusted you with his brother ˹Joseph˺? But ˹only˺ Allah is the best Protector, and He is the Most Merciful of the merciful.”
verses.translation: He responded, “Should I trust you with him as I once trusted you with his brother ˹Joseph˺? But ˹only˺ Allah is the best Protector, and He is the Most Merciful of the merciful.”

verses.text: When they opened their bags, they discovered that their money had been returned to them. They argued, “O our father! What more can we ask for? Here is our money, fully returned to us. Now we can buy more food for our family. We will watch over our brother, and obtain an extra camel-load of grain. That load can be easily secured.” Jacob’s Wisdom
verses.translation: When they opened their bags, they discovered that their money had been returned to them. They argued, “O our father! What more can we ask for? Here is our money, fully returned to us. Now we can buy more food for our family. We will watch over our brother, and obtain an extra camel-load of grain. That load can be easily secured.” Jacob’s Wisdom

verses.text: Jacob insisted, “I will not send him with you until you give me a solemn oath by Allah that you will certainly bring him back to me, unless you are totally overpowered.” Then after they had given him their oaths, he concluded, “Allah is a Witness to what we have said.”
verses.translation: Jacob insisted, “I will not send him with you until you give me a solemn oath by Allah that you will certainly bring him back to me, unless you are totally overpowered.” Then after they had given him their oaths, he concluded, “Allah is a Witness to what we have said.”

verses.text: He then instructed ˹them˺, “O my sons! Do not enter ˹the city˺ all through one gate, but through separate gates.[454] I cannot help you against ˹what is destined by˺ Allah in the least. It is only Allah Who decides. In Him I put my trust. And in Him let the faithful put their trust.”
verses.translation: He then instructed ˹them˺, “O my sons! Do not enter ˹the city˺ all through one gate, but through separate gates.[454] I cannot help you against ˹what is destined by˺ Allah in the least. It is only Allah Who decides. In Him I put my trust. And in Him let the faithful put their trust.”

verses.text: Then when they entered as their father had instructed them, this did not help them against ˹the Will of˺ Allah whatsoever. It was just a desire in Jacob’s heart which he satisfied. He was truly blessed with ˹great˺ knowledge because of what We had taught him, but most people have no knowledge. The Royal Cup[455]
verses.translation: Then when they entered as their father had instructed them, this did not help them against ˹the Will of˺ Allah whatsoever. It was just a desire in Jacob’s heart which he satisfied. He was truly blessed with ˹great˺ knowledge because of what We had taught him, but most people have no knowledge. The Royal Cup[455]

verses.text: When they entered Joseph’s presence, he called his brother ˹Benjamin˺ aside, and confided ˹to him˺, “I am indeed your brother ˹Joseph˺! So do not feel distressed about what they have been doing.”
verses.translation: When they entered Joseph’s presence, he called his brother ˹Benjamin˺ aside, and confided ˹to him˺, “I am indeed your brother ˹Joseph˺! So do not feel distressed about what they have been doing.”

verses.text: When Joseph had provided them with supplies, he slipped the royal cup into his brother’s bag. Then a herald cried, “O people of the caravan! You must be thieves!”
verses.translation: When Joseph had provided them with supplies, he slipped the royal cup into his brother’s bag. Then a herald cried, “O people of the caravan! You must be thieves!”

verses.text: They asked, turning back, “What have you lost?”
verses.translation: They asked, turning back, “What have you lost?”

verses.text: The herald ˹along with the guards˺ replied, “We have lost the King’s measuring cup. And whoever brings it will be awarded a camel-load ˹of grain˺. I guarantee it.”
verses.translation: The herald ˹along with the guards˺ replied, “We have lost the King’s measuring cup. And whoever brings it will be awarded a camel-load ˹of grain˺. I guarantee it.”

verses.text: Joseph’s brothers replied, “By Allah! You know well that we did not come to cause trouble in the land, nor are we thieves.”
verses.translation: Joseph’s brothers replied, “By Allah! You know well that we did not come to cause trouble in the land, nor are we thieves.”

verses.text: Joseph’s men asked, “What should be the price for theft, if you are lying?”
verses.translation: Joseph’s men asked, “What should be the price for theft, if you are lying?”

verses.text: Joseph’s brothers responded, “The price will be ˹the enslavement of˺ the one in whose bag the cup is found. That is how we punish the wrongdoers.” Joseph Takes Benjamin
verses.translation: Joseph’s brothers responded, “The price will be ˹the enslavement of˺ the one in whose bag the cup is found. That is how we punish the wrongdoers.” Joseph Takes Benjamin

verses.text: Joseph began searching their bags before that of his brother ˹Benjamin˺, then brought it out of Benjamin’s bag. This is how We inspired Joseph to plan. He could not have taken his brother under the King’s law, but Allah had so willed. We elevate in rank whoever We will. But above those ranking in knowledge is the One All-Knowing.
verses.translation: Joseph began searching their bags before that of his brother ˹Benjamin˺, then brought it out of Benjamin’s bag. This is how We inspired Joseph to plan. He could not have taken his brother under the King’s law, but Allah had so willed. We elevate in rank whoever We will. But above those ranking in knowledge is the One All-Knowing.

verses.text: ˹To distance themselves,˺ Joseph’s brothers argued, “If he has stolen, so did his ˹full˺ brother before.”[456] But Joseph suppressed his outrage—revealing nothing to them—and said ˹to himself˺, “You are in such an evil position,[457] and Allah knows best ˹the truth of˺ what you claim.”
verses.translation: ˹To distance themselves,˺ Joseph’s brothers argued, “If he has stolen, so did his ˹full˺ brother before.”[456] But Joseph suppressed his outrage—revealing nothing to them—and said ˹to himself˺, “You are in such an evil position,[457] and Allah knows best ˹the truth of˺ what you claim.”

verses.text: They appealed, “O Chief Minister! He has a very old father, so take one of us instead. We surely see you as one of the good-doers.”
verses.translation: They appealed, “O Chief Minister! He has a very old father, so take one of us instead. We surely see you as one of the good-doers.”

verses.text: Joseph responded, “Allah forbid that we should take other than the one with whom we found our property. Otherwise, we would surely be unjust.” Bad News for Jacob, Again
verses.translation: Joseph responded, “Allah forbid that we should take other than the one with whom we found our property. Otherwise, we would surely be unjust.” Bad News for Jacob, Again

verses.text: When they lost all hope in him, they spoke privately. The eldest of them said, “Do you not know that your father had taken a solemn oath by Allah from you, nor how you failed him regarding Joseph before? So I am not leaving this land until my father allows me to, or Allah decides for me. For He is the Best of Judges.
verses.translation: When they lost all hope in him, they spoke privately. The eldest of them said, “Do you not know that your father had taken a solemn oath by Allah from you, nor how you failed him regarding Joseph before? So I am not leaving this land until my father allows me to, or Allah decides for me. For He is the Best of Judges.

verses.text: Return to your father and say, ‘O our father! Your son committed theft. We testify only to what we know. We could not guard against the unforeseen.[458]
verses.translation: Return to your father and say, ‘O our father! Your son committed theft. We testify only to what we know. We could not guard against the unforeseen.[458]

verses.text: Ask ˹the people of˺ the land where we were and the caravan we travelled with. We are certainly telling the truth.’” Jacob’s Grief
verses.translation: Ask ˹the people of˺ the land where we were and the caravan we travelled with. We are certainly telling the truth.’” Jacob’s Grief

verses.text: He cried, “No! Your souls must have tempted you to do something ˹evil˺. So ˹I am left with nothing but˺ beautiful patience![459] I trust Allah will return them all to me. Surely He ˹alone˺ is the All-Knowing, All-Wise.”
verses.translation: He cried, “No! Your souls must have tempted you to do something ˹evil˺. So ˹I am left with nothing but˺ beautiful patience![459] I trust Allah will return them all to me. Surely He ˹alone˺ is the All-Knowing, All-Wise.”

verses.text: He turned away from them, lamenting, “Alas, poor Joseph!” And his eyes turned white out of the grief he suppressed.[460]
verses.translation: He turned away from them, lamenting, “Alas, poor Joseph!” And his eyes turned white out of the grief he suppressed.[460]

verses.text: They said, “By Allah! You will not cease to remember Joseph until you lose your health or ˹even˺ your life.”
verses.translation: They said, “By Allah! You will not cease to remember Joseph until you lose your health or ˹even˺ your life.”

verses.text: He replied, “I complain of my anguish and sorrow only to Allah, and I know from Allah what you do not know.
verses.translation: He replied, “I complain of my anguish and sorrow only to Allah, and I know from Allah what you do not know.

verses.text: O my sons! Go and search ˹diligently˺ for Joseph and his brother. And do not lose hope in the mercy of Allah, for no one loses hope in Allah’s mercy except those with no faith.” Joseph Reveals His Identity
verses.translation: O my sons! Go and search ˹diligently˺ for Joseph and his brother. And do not lose hope in the mercy of Allah, for no one loses hope in Allah’s mercy except those with no faith.” Joseph Reveals His Identity

verses.text: When they entered Joseph’s presence, they pleaded, “O Chief Minister! We and our family have been touched with hardship, and we have brought only a few worthless coins, but ˹please˺ give us our supplies in full and be charitable to us. Indeed, Allah rewards the charitable.”
verses.translation: When they entered Joseph’s presence, they pleaded, “O Chief Minister! We and our family have been touched with hardship, and we have brought only a few worthless coins, but ˹please˺ give us our supplies in full and be charitable to us. Indeed, Allah rewards the charitable.”

verses.text: He asked, “Do you remember what you did to Joseph and his brother in your ignorance?”
verses.translation: He asked, “Do you remember what you did to Joseph and his brother in your ignorance?”

verses.text: They replied ˹in shock˺, “Are you really Joseph?” He said, “I am Joseph, and here is my brother ˹Benjamin˺! Allah has truly been gracious to us. Surely whoever is mindful ˹of Allah˺ and patient, then certainly Allah never discounts the reward of the good-doers.” Brothers’ Apology Accepted
verses.translation: They replied ˹in shock˺, “Are you really Joseph?” He said, “I am Joseph, and here is my brother ˹Benjamin˺! Allah has truly been gracious to us. Surely whoever is mindful ˹of Allah˺ and patient, then certainly Allah never discounts the reward of the good-doers.” Brothers’ Apology Accepted

verses.text: They admitted, “By Allah! Allah has truly preferred you over us, and we have surely been sinful.”
verses.translation: They admitted, “By Allah! Allah has truly preferred you over us, and we have surely been sinful.”

verses.text: Joseph said, “There is no blame on you today. May Allah forgive you! He is the Most Merciful of the merciful!
verses.translation: Joseph said, “There is no blame on you today. May Allah forgive you! He is the Most Merciful of the merciful!

verses.text: Go with this shirt of mine and cast it over my father’s face, and he will regain his sight. Then come back to me with your whole family.” Jacob Regains His Sight
verses.translation: Go with this shirt of mine and cast it over my father’s face, and he will regain his sight. Then come back to me with your whole family.” Jacob Regains His Sight

verses.text: When the caravan departed ˹from Egypt˺, their father said ˹to those around him˺, “You may think I am senile, but I certainly sense the smell of Joseph.”
verses.translation: When the caravan departed ˹from Egypt˺, their father said ˹to those around him˺, “You may think I am senile, but I certainly sense the smell of Joseph.”

verses.text: They replied, “By Allah! You are definitely still in your old delusion.”
verses.translation: They replied, “By Allah! You are definitely still in your old delusion.”

verses.text: But when the bearer of the good news arrived, he cast the shirt over Jacob’s face, so he regained his sight. Jacob then said ˹to his children˺, “Did I not tell you that I truly know from Allah what you do not know?”
verses.translation: But when the bearer of the good news arrived, he cast the shirt over Jacob’s face, so he regained his sight. Jacob then said ˹to his children˺, “Did I not tell you that I truly know from Allah what you do not know?”

verses.text: They begged, “O our father! Pray for the forgiveness of our sins. We have certainly been sinful.”
verses.translation: They begged, “O our father! Pray for the forgiveness of our sins. We have certainly been sinful.”

verses.text: He said, “I will pray to my Lord for your forgiveness.[461] He ˹alone˺ is indeed the All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.” Joseph’s Dream Comes True
verses.translation: He said, “I will pray to my Lord for your forgiveness.[461] He ˹alone˺ is indeed the All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.” Joseph’s Dream Comes True

verses.text: When they entered Joseph’s presence, he received his parents ˹graciously˺ and said, “Enter Egypt, Allah willing, in security.”
verses.translation: When they entered Joseph’s presence, he received his parents ˹graciously˺ and said, “Enter Egypt, Allah willing, in security.”

verses.text: Then he raised his parents to the throne, and they all fell down in prostration to Joseph,[462] who then said, “O my dear father! This is the interpretation of my old dream. My Lord has made it come true. He was truly kind to me when He freed me from prison, and brought you all from the desert after Satan had ignited rivalry between me and my siblings.[463] Indeed my Lord is subtle in fulfilling what He wills. Surely He ˹alone˺ is the All-Knowing, All-Wise.” Joseph’s Prayer
verses.translation: Then he raised his parents to the throne, and they all fell down in prostration to Joseph,[462] who then said, “O my dear father! This is the interpretation of my old dream. My Lord has made it come true. He was truly kind to me when He freed me from prison, and brought you all from the desert after Satan had ignited rivalry between me and my siblings.[463] Indeed my Lord is subtle in fulfilling what He wills. Surely He ˹alone˺ is the All-Knowing, All-Wise.” Joseph’s Prayer

verses.text: “My Lord! You have surely granted me authority and taught me the interpretation of dreams. ˹O˺ Originator of the heavens and the earth! You are my Guardian in this world and the Hereafter. Allow me to die as one who submits[464] and join me with the righteous.” Reminders to Prophet Mu ḥammad
verses.translation: “My Lord! You have surely granted me authority and taught me the interpretation of dreams. ˹O˺ Originator of the heavens and the earth! You are my Guardian in this world and the Hereafter. Allow me to die as one who submits[464] and join me with the righteous.” Reminders to Prophet Mu ḥammad

verses.text: That is from the stories of the unseen which We reveal to you ˹O Prophet˺. You were not present when they ˹all˺[465] made up their minds, and when they plotted ˹against Joseph˺.
verses.translation: That is from the stories of the unseen which We reveal to you ˹O Prophet˺. You were not present when they ˹all˺[465] made up their minds, and when they plotted ˹against Joseph˺.

verses.text: And most people will not believe—no matter how keen you are—
verses.translation: And most people will not believe—no matter how keen you are—

verses.text: even though you are not asking them for a reward for this ˹Quran˺. It is only a reminder to the whole world.
verses.translation: even though you are not asking them for a reward for this ˹Quran˺. It is only a reminder to the whole world.

verses.text: How many signs in the heavens and the earth do they pass by with indifference!
verses.translation: How many signs in the heavens and the earth do they pass by with indifference!

verses.text: And most of them do not believe in Allah without associating others with Him ˹in worship˺.
verses.translation: And most of them do not believe in Allah without associating others with Him ˹in worship˺.

verses.text: Do they feel secure that an overwhelming torment from Allah will not overtake them, or that the Hour will not take them by surprise when they least expect ˹it˺? Invitation with Knowledge and Wisdom
verses.translation: Do they feel secure that an overwhelming torment from Allah will not overtake them, or that the Hour will not take them by surprise when they least expect ˹it˺? Invitation with Knowledge and Wisdom

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “This is my way. I invite to Allah with insight—I and those who follow me. Glory be to Allah, and I am not one of the polytheists.” Allah’s Messengers
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “This is my way. I invite to Allah with insight—I and those who follow me. Glory be to Allah, and I am not one of the polytheists.” Allah’s Messengers

verses.text: We only sent before you ˹O Prophet˺ men inspired by Us from among the people of each society. Have the deniers not travelled through the land to see what was the end of those ˹destroyed˺ before them? And surely the ˹eternal˺ Home of the Hereafter is far better for those mindful ˹of Allah˺. Will you not then understand?
verses.translation: We only sent before you ˹O Prophet˺ men inspired by Us from among the people of each society. Have the deniers not travelled through the land to see what was the end of those ˹destroyed˺ before them? And surely the ˹eternal˺ Home of the Hereafter is far better for those mindful ˹of Allah˺. Will you not then understand?

verses.text: And when the messengers despaired and their people thought the messengers had been denied help, Our help came to them ˹at last˺. We then saved whoever We willed, and Our punishment is never averted from the wicked people. Messengers’ Stories in the Quran
verses.translation: And when the messengers despaired and their people thought the messengers had been denied help, Our help came to them ˹at last˺. We then saved whoever We willed, and Our punishment is never averted from the wicked people. Messengers’ Stories in the Quran

verses.text: In their stories there is truly a lesson for people of reason. This message cannot be a fabrication, rather ˹it is˺ a confirmation of previous revelation, a detailed explanation of all things, a guide, and a mercy for people of faith. *** -- 218 of 694 --
verses.translation: In their stories there is truly a lesson for people of reason. This message cannot be a fabrication, rather ˹it is˺ a confirmation of previous revelation, a detailed explanation of all things, a guide, and a mercy for people of faith. *** -- 218 of 694 --

name: Thunder
intro: This sûrah, which takes its name from the thunder in verse 13, elaborates upon the last verses of the previous sûrah (starting with 105) relating to Allah’s magnificent signs in the heavens and earth which are met with neglect by the deniers; Allah’s knowledge, might, and unwavering support for His prophets; the authenticity of the Quran; and warnings to the disbelievers. The sûrah touches on the qualities of the believers and the disbelievers and the reward for each. All these themes are reiterated in the next two sûrahs. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful The Truth

verses.text: Alif-Lãm-Mĩm-Ra. These are the verses of the Book. What has been revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺ from your Lord is the truth, but most people do not believe. Allah’s Might
verses.translation: Alif-Lãm-Mĩm-Ra. These are the verses of the Book. What has been revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺ from your Lord is the truth, but most people do not believe. Allah’s Might

verses.text: It is Allah Who has raised the heavens without pillars—as you can see— then established Himself on the Throne. He has subjected the sun and the moon, each orbiting for an appointed term. He conducts the whole affair. He makes the signs clear so that you may be certain of the meeting with your Lord.
verses.translation: It is Allah Who has raised the heavens without pillars—as you can see— then established Himself on the Throne. He has subjected the sun and the moon, each orbiting for an appointed term. He conducts the whole affair. He makes the signs clear so that you may be certain of the meeting with your Lord.

verses.text: And He is the One Who spread out the earth and placed firm mountains and rivers upon it, and created fruits of every kind in pairs.[466] He covers the day with night. Surely in this are signs for those who reflect.
verses.translation: And He is the One Who spread out the earth and placed firm mountains and rivers upon it, and created fruits of every kind in pairs.[466] He covers the day with night. Surely in this are signs for those who reflect.

verses.text: And on the earth there are ˹different˺ neighbouring tracts, gardens of grapevines, ˹various˺ crops, palm trees—some stemming from the same root, others standing alone. They are all irrigated with the same water, yet We make some taste better than others. Surely in this are signs for those who understand. Denying Resurrection
verses.translation: And on the earth there are ˹different˺ neighbouring tracts, gardens of grapevines, ˹various˺ crops, palm trees—some stemming from the same root, others standing alone. They are all irrigated with the same water, yet We make some taste better than others. Surely in this are signs for those who understand. Denying Resurrection

verses.text: ˹Now,˺ if anything should amaze you ˹O Prophet˺, then it is their question: “When we are reduced to dust, will we really be raised as a new creation?” It is they who have disbelieved in their Lord. It is they who will have shackles around their necks. And it is they who will be the residents of the Fire. They will be there forever. Hastening the Torment
verses.translation: ˹Now,˺ if anything should amaze you ˹O Prophet˺, then it is their question: “When we are reduced to dust, will we really be raised as a new creation?” It is they who have disbelieved in their Lord. It is they who will have shackles around their necks. And it is they who will be the residents of the Fire. They will be there forever. Hastening the Torment

verses.text: They ask you ˹O Prophet˺ to hasten the torment rather than grace, though there have ˹already˺ been ˹many˺ torments before them. Surely your Lord is full of forgiveness for people, despite their wrongdoing, and your Lord is truly severe in punishment. Demanding a Sign from the Prophet[467]
verses.translation: They ask you ˹O Prophet˺ to hasten the torment rather than grace, though there have ˹already˺ been ˹many˺ torments before them. Surely your Lord is full of forgiveness for people, despite their wrongdoing, and your Lord is truly severe in punishment. Demanding a Sign from the Prophet[467]

verses.text: The disbelievers say, “If only a sign could be sent down to him from his Lord.” You ˹O Prophet˺ are only a warner. And every people had a guide. Allah’s Knowledge
verses.translation: The disbelievers say, “If only a sign could be sent down to him from his Lord.” You ˹O Prophet˺ are only a warner. And every people had a guide. Allah’s Knowledge

verses.text: Allah knows what every female bears and what increases and decreases in the wombs.[468] And with Him everything is determined with precision.
verses.translation: Allah knows what every female bears and what increases and decreases in the wombs.[468] And with Him everything is determined with precision.

verses.text: ˹He is the˺ Knower of the seen and the unseen—the All-Great, Most Exalted.
verses.translation: ˹He is the˺ Knower of the seen and the unseen—the All-Great, Most Exalted.

verses.text: It is the same ˹to Him˺ whether any of you speaks secretly or openly, whether one hides in the darkness of night or goes about in broad daylight. Allah’s Power
verses.translation: It is the same ˹to Him˺ whether any of you speaks secretly or openly, whether one hides in the darkness of night or goes about in broad daylight. Allah’s Power

verses.text: For each one there are successive angels before and behind, protecting them by Allah’s command. Indeed, Allah would never change a people’s state ˹of favour˺ until they change their own state ˹of faith˺. And if it is Allah’s Will to torment a people, it can never be averted, nor can they find a protector other than Him. Display of Divine Power
verses.translation: For each one there are successive angels before and behind, protecting them by Allah’s command. Indeed, Allah would never change a people’s state ˹of favour˺ until they change their own state ˹of faith˺. And if it is Allah’s Will to torment a people, it can never be averted, nor can they find a protector other than Him. Display of Divine Power

verses.text: He is the One Who shows you lightning, inspiring ˹you with˺ hope and fear,[469] and produces heavy clouds.
verses.translation: He is the One Who shows you lightning, inspiring ˹you with˺ hope and fear,[469] and produces heavy clouds.

verses.text: The thunder glorifies His praises, as do the angels in awe of Him. He sends thunderbolts, striking with them whoever He wills. Yet they dispute about Allah. And He is tremendous in might. Useless Idols
verses.translation: The thunder glorifies His praises, as do the angels in awe of Him. He sends thunderbolts, striking with them whoever He wills. Yet they dispute about Allah. And He is tremendous in might. Useless Idols

verses.text: Calling upon Him ˹alone˺ is the truth. But those ˹idols˺ the pagans invoke besides Him ˹can˺ never respond to them in any way. ˹It is˺ just like someone who stretches out their hands to water, ˹asking it˺ to reach their mouths, but it can never do so. The calls of the disbelievers are only in vain. The True Lord
verses.translation: Calling upon Him ˹alone˺ is the truth. But those ˹idols˺ the pagans invoke besides Him ˹can˺ never respond to them in any way. ˹It is˺ just like someone who stretches out their hands to water, ˹asking it˺ to reach their mouths, but it can never do so. The calls of the disbelievers are only in vain. The True Lord

verses.text: To Allah ˹alone˺ bow down ˹in submission˺[470] all those in the heavens and the earth—willingly or unwillingly—as do their shadows, morning and evening. Almighty Allah or Powerless Gods?
verses.translation: To Allah ˹alone˺ bow down ˹in submission˺[470] all those in the heavens and the earth—willingly or unwillingly—as do their shadows, morning and evening. Almighty Allah or Powerless Gods?

verses.text: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Who is the Lord of the heavens and the earth?” Say, “Allah!” Ask ˹them˺, “Why ˹then˺ have you taken besides Him lords who cannot even benefit or protect themselves?” Say, “Can the blind and the sighted be equal? Or can darkness and light be equal?”[471] Or have they associated with Allah partners who ˹supposedly˺ produced a creation like His, leaving them confused between the two creations? Say, “Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the One, the Supreme.” Parable of Truth and Falsehood
verses.translation: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Who is the Lord of the heavens and the earth?” Say, “Allah!” Ask ˹them˺, “Why ˹then˺ have you taken besides Him lords who cannot even benefit or protect themselves?” Say, “Can the blind and the sighted be equal? Or can darkness and light be equal?”[471] Or have they associated with Allah partners who ˹supposedly˺ produced a creation like His, leaving them confused between the two creations? Say, “Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the One, the Supreme.” Parable of Truth and Falsehood

verses.text: He sends down rain from the sky, causing the valleys to flow, each according to its capacity. The currents then carry along rising foam, similar to the slag produced from metal that people melt in the fire for ornaments or tools. This is how Allah compares truth to falsehood. The ˹worthless˺ residue is then cast away, but what benefits people remains on the earth. This is how Allah sets forth parables. Blindness to the Truth
verses.translation: He sends down rain from the sky, causing the valleys to flow, each according to its capacity. The currents then carry along rising foam, similar to the slag produced from metal that people melt in the fire for ornaments or tools. This is how Allah compares truth to falsehood. The ˹worthless˺ residue is then cast away, but what benefits people remains on the earth. This is how Allah sets forth parables. Blindness to the Truth

verses.text: Those who respond to ˹the call of˺ their Lord will have the finest reward. As for those who do not respond to Him, even if they were to possess everything in the world twice over, they would certainly offer it to ransom themselves. They will face strict judgment, and Hell will be their home. What an evil place to rest!
verses.translation: Those who respond to ˹the call of˺ their Lord will have the finest reward. As for those who do not respond to Him, even if they were to possess everything in the world twice over, they would certainly offer it to ransom themselves. They will face strict judgment, and Hell will be their home. What an evil place to rest!

verses.text: Can the one who knows that your Lord’s revelation to you ˹O Prophet˺ is the truth be like the one who is blind? None will be mindful ˹of this˺ except people of reason. People of Reason
verses.translation: Can the one who knows that your Lord’s revelation to you ˹O Prophet˺ is the truth be like the one who is blind? None will be mindful ˹of this˺ except people of reason. People of Reason

verses.text: ˹They are˺ those who honour Allah’s covenant, never breaking the pledge;
verses.translation: ˹They are˺ those who honour Allah’s covenant, never breaking the pledge;

verses.text: and those who maintain whatever ˹ties˺ Allah has ordered to be maintained, stand in awe of their Lord, and fear strict judgment.
verses.translation: and those who maintain whatever ˹ties˺ Allah has ordered to be maintained, stand in awe of their Lord, and fear strict judgment.

verses.text: And ˹they are˺ those who endure patiently, seeking their Lord’s pleasure,[472] establish prayer, donate from what We have provided for them—secretly and openly—and respond to evil with good. It is they who will have the ultimate abode:
verses.translation: And ˹they are˺ those who endure patiently, seeking their Lord’s pleasure,[472] establish prayer, donate from what We have provided for them—secretly and openly—and respond to evil with good. It is they who will have the ultimate abode:

verses.text: the Gardens of Eternity, which they will enter along with the righteous among their parents, spouses, and descendants. And the angels will enter upon them from every gate, ˹saying,˺
verses.translation: the Gardens of Eternity, which they will enter along with the righteous among their parents, spouses, and descendants. And the angels will enter upon them from every gate, ˹saying,˺

verses.text: “Peace be upon you for your perseverance. How excellent is the ultimate abode!” The Wicked
verses.translation: “Peace be upon you for your perseverance. How excellent is the ultimate abode!” The Wicked

verses.text: And those who violate Allah’s covenant after it has been affirmed, break whatever ˹ties˺ Allah has ordered to be maintained, and spread corruption in the land—it is they who will be condemned and will have the worst abode. [473] Worldly Delusions
verses.translation: And those who violate Allah’s covenant after it has been affirmed, break whatever ˹ties˺ Allah has ordered to be maintained, and spread corruption in the land—it is they who will be condemned and will have the worst abode. [473] Worldly Delusions

verses.text: Allah gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills. And the disbelievers become prideful of ˹the pleasures of˺ this worldly life. But the life of this world, compared to the Hereafter, is nothing but a fleeting enjoyment. Remembrance of Allah
verses.translation: Allah gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills. And the disbelievers become prideful of ˹the pleasures of˺ this worldly life. But the life of this world, compared to the Hereafter, is nothing but a fleeting enjoyment. Remembrance of Allah

verses.text: The disbelievers say, “If only a sign could be sent down to him from his Lord.”[474] Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Indeed, Allah leaves to stray whoever He wills, and guides to Himself whoever turns to Him—
verses.translation: The disbelievers say, “If only a sign could be sent down to him from his Lord.”[474] Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Indeed, Allah leaves to stray whoever He wills, and guides to Himself whoever turns to Him—

verses.text: those who believe and whose hearts find comfort in the remembrance of Allah. Surely in the remembrance of Allah do hearts find comfort.
verses.translation: those who believe and whose hearts find comfort in the remembrance of Allah. Surely in the remembrance of Allah do hearts find comfort.

verses.text: Those who believe and do good, for them will be bliss and an honourable destination.” Denying the Most Compassionate
verses.translation: Those who believe and do good, for them will be bliss and an honourable destination.” Denying the Most Compassionate

verses.text: And so We have sent you ˹O Prophet˺ to a community, like ˹We did with˺ earlier communities, so that you may recite to them what We have revealed to you. Yet they deny the Most Compassionate.[475] Say, “He is my Lord! There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. In Him I put my trust, and to Him I turn ˹in repentance˺.” Deniers Will Always Deny
verses.translation: And so We have sent you ˹O Prophet˺ to a community, like ˹We did with˺ earlier communities, so that you may recite to them what We have revealed to you. Yet they deny the Most Compassionate.[475] Say, “He is my Lord! There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. In Him I put my trust, and to Him I turn ˹in repentance˺.” Deniers Will Always Deny

verses.text: If there were a recitation that could cause mountains to move, or the earth to split, or the dead to speak, ˹it would have been this Quran˺. But all matters are by Allah’s Will. Have the believers not yet realized that had Allah willed, He could have guided all of humanity? And disasters will continue to afflict the disbelievers or strike close to their homes for their misdeeds, until Allah’s promise comes to pass. Surely Allah never fails in His promise.
verses.translation: If there were a recitation that could cause mountains to move, or the earth to split, or the dead to speak, ˹it would have been this Quran˺. But all matters are by Allah’s Will. Have the believers not yet realized that had Allah willed, He could have guided all of humanity? And disasters will continue to afflict the disbelievers or strike close to their homes for their misdeeds, until Allah’s promise comes to pass. Surely Allah never fails in His promise.

verses.text: Other messengers had already been ridiculed before you, but I delayed the disbelievers ˹for a while˺ then seized them. And how ˹horrible˺ was My punishment! Falsehood Made Appealing
verses.translation: Other messengers had already been ridiculed before you, but I delayed the disbelievers ˹for a while˺ then seized them. And how ˹horrible˺ was My punishment! Falsehood Made Appealing

verses.text: Is ˹there any equal to˺ the Vigilant One Who knows what every soul commits? Yet the pagans have associated others with Allah ˹in worship˺. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Name them! Or do you ˹mean to˺ inform Him of something He does not know on the earth? Or are these ˹gods˺ just empty words?” In fact, the disbelievers’ falsehood has been made so appealing to them that they have been turned away from the Path. And whoever Allah leaves to stray will be left with no guide.
verses.translation: Is ˹there any equal to˺ the Vigilant One Who knows what every soul commits? Yet the pagans have associated others with Allah ˹in worship˺. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Name them! Or do you ˹mean to˺ inform Him of something He does not know on the earth? Or are these ˹gods˺ just empty words?” In fact, the disbelievers’ falsehood has been made so appealing to them that they have been turned away from the Path. And whoever Allah leaves to stray will be left with no guide.

verses.text: For them is punishment in this worldly life, but the punishment of the Hereafter is truly far worse. And none can shield them from Allah. Paradise Described
verses.translation: For them is punishment in this worldly life, but the punishment of the Hereafter is truly far worse. And none can shield them from Allah. Paradise Described

verses.text: The description of the Paradise promised to the righteous is that under it rivers flow; eternal is its fruit as well as its shade. That is the ˹ultimate˺ outcome for the righteous. But the outcome for the disbelievers is the Fire! Embracing the Quran
verses.translation: The description of the Paradise promised to the righteous is that under it rivers flow; eternal is its fruit as well as its shade. That is the ˹ultimate˺ outcome for the righteous. But the outcome for the disbelievers is the Fire! Embracing the Quran

verses.text: ˹The believers among˺ those who were given the Scripture rejoice at what has been revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺, while some ˹disbelieving˺ factions deny a portion of it. Say, “I have only been commanded to worship Allah, associating none with Him ˹in worship˺. To Him I invite ˹all˺, and to Him is my return.”
verses.translation: ˹The believers among˺ those who were given the Scripture rejoice at what has been revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺, while some ˹disbelieving˺ factions deny a portion of it. Say, “I have only been commanded to worship Allah, associating none with Him ˹in worship˺. To Him I invite ˹all˺, and to Him is my return.”

verses.text: And so We have revealed it as an authority in Arabic. And if you were to follow their desires after ˹all˺ the knowledge that has come to you, there would be none to protect or shield you from Allah. The Last of Many
verses.translation: And so We have revealed it as an authority in Arabic. And if you were to follow their desires after ˹all˺ the knowledge that has come to you, there would be none to protect or shield you from Allah. The Last of Many

verses.text: We have certainly sent messengers before you ˹O Prophet˺ and blessed them with wives and offspring. It was not for any messenger to bring a sign without Allah’s permission. Every destined matter has a ˹set˺ time.
verses.translation: We have certainly sent messengers before you ˹O Prophet˺ and blessed them with wives and offspring. It was not for any messenger to bring a sign without Allah’s permission. Every destined matter has a ˹set˺ time.

verses.text: Allah eliminates and confirms what He wills, and with Him is the Master Record.[476] Deliver, Not Judge
verses.translation: Allah eliminates and confirms what He wills, and with Him is the Master Record.[476] Deliver, Not Judge

verses.text: Whether We show you ˹O Prophet˺ some of what We threaten them with, or cause you to die ˹before that˺, your duty is only to deliver ˹the message˺. Judgment is for Us. Warning to the Pagans
verses.translation: Whether We show you ˹O Prophet˺ some of what We threaten them with, or cause you to die ˹before that˺, your duty is only to deliver ˹the message˺. Judgment is for Us. Warning to the Pagans

verses.text: Do they not see that We gradually reduce their land from its borders? Allah decides—none can reverse His decision. And He is swift in reckoning.
verses.translation: Do they not see that We gradually reduce their land from its borders? Allah decides—none can reverse His decision. And He is swift in reckoning.

verses.text: Those ˹disbelievers˺ before them ˹secretly˺ planned, but Allah has the ultimate plan. He knows what every soul commits. And the disbelievers will soon know who will have the ultimate outcome.
verses.translation: Those ˹disbelievers˺ before them ˹secretly˺ planned, but Allah has the ultimate plan. He knows what every soul commits. And the disbelievers will soon know who will have the ultimate outcome.

verses.text: The disbelievers say, “You ˹Muḥammad˺ are no messenger.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Allah is sufficient as a Witness between me and you, as is whoever has knowledge of the Scripture.” *** -- 224 of 694 --
verses.translation: The disbelievers say, “You ˹Muḥammad˺ are no messenger.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Allah is sufficient as a Witness between me and you, as is whoever has knowledge of the Scripture.” *** -- 224 of 694 --

name: Abraham
intro: This Meccan sûrah is named after Prophet Abraham ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) who, upon settling his wife Hagar and his son Ishmael in what later became the city of Mecca, invokes Allah to protect his descendants from idol-worship, a practice that Meccans were entrenched in at the time of this revelation (verses 35-41). The sûrah also refers to some of Allah’s favours, which are met with ingratitude and denial. A sizable portion reveals how the disbelievers will be let down by Satan and tormented in Hell, wishing they had believed, according to the next sûrah (15:2). In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Warning to the Disbelievers

verses.text: Alif-Lãm-Ra. ˹This is˺ a Book which We have revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺ so that you may lead people out of darkness and into light, by the Will of their Lord, to the Path of the Almighty, the Praiseworthy—
verses.translation: Alif-Lãm-Ra. ˹This is˺ a Book which We have revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺ so that you may lead people out of darkness and into light, by the Will of their Lord, to the Path of the Almighty, the Praiseworthy—

verses.text: Allah, to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And woe to the disbelievers because of a severe torment!
verses.translation: Allah, to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And woe to the disbelievers because of a severe torment!

verses.text: ˹They are˺ the ones who favour the life of this world over the Hereafter and hinder ˹others˺ from the Way of Allah, striving to make it ˹appear˺ crooked. It is they who have gone far astray. Delivering the Message
verses.translation: ˹They are˺ the ones who favour the life of this world over the Hereafter and hinder ˹others˺ from the Way of Allah, striving to make it ˹appear˺ crooked. It is they who have gone far astray. Delivering the Message

verses.text: We have not sent a messenger except in the language of his people to clarify ˹the message˺ for them. Then Allah leaves whoever He wills to stray and guides whoever He wills. And He is the Almighty, All-Wise. Prophet Moses
verses.translation: We have not sent a messenger except in the language of his people to clarify ˹the message˺ for them. Then Allah leaves whoever He wills to stray and guides whoever He wills. And He is the Almighty, All-Wise. Prophet Moses

verses.text: Indeed, We sent Moses with Our signs, ˹ordering him,˺ “Lead your people out of darkness and into light, and remind them of Allah’s days ˹of favour˺.” Surely in this are signs for whoever is steadfast, grateful.
verses.translation: Indeed, We sent Moses with Our signs, ˹ordering him,˺ “Lead your people out of darkness and into light, and remind them of Allah’s days ˹of favour˺.” Surely in this are signs for whoever is steadfast, grateful.

verses.text: ˹Consider˺ when Moses said to his people, “Remember Allah’s favour upon you when He rescued you from the people of Pharaoh, who afflicted you with dreadful torment—slaughtering your sons and keeping your women. That was a severe test from your Lord.
verses.translation: ˹Consider˺ when Moses said to his people, “Remember Allah’s favour upon you when He rescued you from the people of Pharaoh, who afflicted you with dreadful torment—slaughtering your sons and keeping your women. That was a severe test from your Lord.

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when your Lord proclaimed, ‘If you are grateful, I will certainly give you more. But if you are ungrateful, surely My punishment is severe.’”
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when your Lord proclaimed, ‘If you are grateful, I will certainly give you more. But if you are ungrateful, surely My punishment is severe.’”

verses.text: Moses added, “If you along with everyone on earth were to be ungrateful, then ˹know that˺ Allah is indeed Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy.” Warning to the Pagans of Mecca
verses.translation: Moses added, “If you along with everyone on earth were to be ungrateful, then ˹know that˺ Allah is indeed Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy.” Warning to the Pagans of Mecca

verses.text: Have you not ˹already˺ received the stories of those who were before you: the people of Noah, ’Âd, Thamûd, and those after them? Only Allah knows how many they were. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs, but they put their hands over their mouths[477] and said, “We totally reject what you have been sent with, and we are certainly in alarming doubt about what you are inviting us to.” Disbelievers’ Arguments
verses.translation: Have you not ˹already˺ received the stories of those who were before you: the people of Noah, ’Âd, Thamûd, and those after them? Only Allah knows how many they were. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs, but they put their hands over their mouths[477] and said, “We totally reject what you have been sent with, and we are certainly in alarming doubt about what you are inviting us to.” Disbelievers’ Arguments

verses.text: Their messengers asked ˹them˺, “Is there any doubt about Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth? He is inviting you in order to forgive your sins, and delay your end until your appointed term.”[478] They argued, “You are no more than humans like us! You ˹only˺ wish to turn us away from what our forefathers worshipped. So bring us some compelling proof.”
verses.translation: Their messengers asked ˹them˺, “Is there any doubt about Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth? He is inviting you in order to forgive your sins, and delay your end until your appointed term.”[478] They argued, “You are no more than humans like us! You ˹only˺ wish to turn us away from what our forefathers worshipped. So bring us some compelling proof.”

verses.text: Their messengers said to them, “We are ˹indeed˺ only humans like you, but Allah favours whoever He chooses of His servants. It is not for us to bring you any proof without Allah’s permission. And in Allah let the believers put their trust.
verses.translation: Their messengers said to them, “We are ˹indeed˺ only humans like you, but Allah favours whoever He chooses of His servants. It is not for us to bring you any proof without Allah’s permission. And in Allah let the believers put their trust.

verses.text: Why should we not put our trust in Allah, when He has truly guided us to ˹the very best of˺ ways? Indeed, we will patiently endure whatever harm you may cause us. And in Allah let the faithful put their trust.” Disbelievers’ Fate
verses.translation: Why should we not put our trust in Allah, when He has truly guided us to ˹the very best of˺ ways? Indeed, we will patiently endure whatever harm you may cause us. And in Allah let the faithful put their trust.” Disbelievers’ Fate

verses.text: The disbelievers then threatened their messengers, “We will certainly expel you from our land, unless you return to our faith.” So their Lord revealed to them, “We will surely destroy the wrongdoers,
verses.translation: The disbelievers then threatened their messengers, “We will certainly expel you from our land, unless you return to our faith.” So their Lord revealed to them, “We will surely destroy the wrongdoers,

verses.text: and make you reside in the land after them. This is for whoever is in awe of standing before Me and fears My warning.”
verses.translation: and make you reside in the land after them. This is for whoever is in awe of standing before Me and fears My warning.”

verses.text: And both sides called for judgment, so every stubborn tyrant was doomed.
verses.translation: And both sides called for judgment, so every stubborn tyrant was doomed.

verses.text: Awaiting them is Hell, and they will be left to drink oozing pus,
verses.translation: Awaiting them is Hell, and they will be left to drink oozing pus,

verses.text: which they will sip with difficulty, and can hardly swallow. Death will overwhelm them from every side, yet they will not ˹be able to˺ die. Awaiting them still is harsher torment. Wasted Deeds
verses.translation: which they will sip with difficulty, and can hardly swallow. Death will overwhelm them from every side, yet they will not ˹be able to˺ die. Awaiting them still is harsher torment. Wasted Deeds

verses.text: The parable of the deeds of those who disbelieve in their Lord is that of ashes fiercely blown away by wind on a stormy day. They will gain nothing from what they have earned. That is ˹truly˺ the farthest one can stray. A Reminder to Humanity
verses.translation: The parable of the deeds of those who disbelieve in their Lord is that of ashes fiercely blown away by wind on a stormy day. They will gain nothing from what they have earned. That is ˹truly˺ the farthest one can stray. A Reminder to Humanity

verses.text: Have you not seen that Allah created the heavens and the earth for a reason? If He wills, He can eliminate you and produce a new creation.
verses.translation: Have you not seen that Allah created the heavens and the earth for a reason? If He wills, He can eliminate you and produce a new creation.

verses.text: And that is not difficult for Allah ˹at all˺. Disbelievers Disowning Each Other
verses.translation: And that is not difficult for Allah ˹at all˺. Disbelievers Disowning Each Other

verses.text: They will all appear before Allah, and the lowly ˹followers˺ will appeal to the arrogant ˹leaders˺, “We were your ˹dedicated˺ followers, so will you ˹then˺ protect us from Allah’s torment in any way?” They will reply, “Had Allah guided us, we would have guided you. ˹Now˺ it is all the same for us whether we suffer patiently or impatiently, there is no escape for us.” Satan’s Talk[479]
verses.translation: They will all appear before Allah, and the lowly ˹followers˺ will appeal to the arrogant ˹leaders˺, “We were your ˹dedicated˺ followers, so will you ˹then˺ protect us from Allah’s torment in any way?” They will reply, “Had Allah guided us, we would have guided you. ˹Now˺ it is all the same for us whether we suffer patiently or impatiently, there is no escape for us.” Satan’s Talk[479]

verses.text: And Satan will say ˹to his followers˺ after the judgment has been passed, “Indeed, Allah has made you a true promise. I too made you a promise, but I failed you. I did not have any authority over you. I only called you, and you responded to me. So do not blame me; blame yourselves. I cannot save you, nor can you save me. Indeed, I denounce your previous association of me with Allah ˹in loyalty˺. Surely the wrongdoers will suffer a painful punishment.” Reward of the Believers
verses.translation: And Satan will say ˹to his followers˺ after the judgment has been passed, “Indeed, Allah has made you a true promise. I too made you a promise, but I failed you. I did not have any authority over you. I only called you, and you responded to me. So do not blame me; blame yourselves. I cannot save you, nor can you save me. Indeed, I denounce your previous association of me with Allah ˹in loyalty˺. Surely the wrongdoers will suffer a painful punishment.” Reward of the Believers

verses.text: Those who believe and do good will be admitted into Gardens, under which rivers flow—to stay there forever by the Will of their Lord—where they will be greeted with “Peace!” Parable of Good and Evil Words
verses.translation: Those who believe and do good will be admitted into Gardens, under which rivers flow—to stay there forever by the Will of their Lord—where they will be greeted with “Peace!” Parable of Good and Evil Words

verses.text: Do you not see how Allah compares a good word to a good tree? Its root is firm and its branches reach the sky,
verses.translation: Do you not see how Allah compares a good word to a good tree? Its root is firm and its branches reach the sky,

verses.text: ˹always˺ yielding its fruit in every season by the Will of its Lord. This is how Allah sets forth parables for the people, so perhaps they will be mindful.
verses.translation: ˹always˺ yielding its fruit in every season by the Will of its Lord. This is how Allah sets forth parables for the people, so perhaps they will be mindful.

verses.text: And the parable of an evil word is that of an evil tree, uprooted from the earth, having no stability. The Firm Word
verses.translation: And the parable of an evil word is that of an evil tree, uprooted from the earth, having no stability. The Firm Word

verses.text: Allah makes the believers steadfast with the firm Word ˹of faith˺[480] in this worldly life and the Hereafter. And Allah leaves the wrongdoers to stray. For Allah does what He wills. Reward of the Ungrateful
verses.translation: Allah makes the believers steadfast with the firm Word ˹of faith˺[480] in this worldly life and the Hereafter. And Allah leaves the wrongdoers to stray. For Allah does what He wills. Reward of the Ungrateful

verses.text: Have you not seen those ˹disbelievers˺ who meet Allah’s favours with ingratitude and lead their own people to their doom?
verses.translation: Have you not seen those ˹disbelievers˺ who meet Allah’s favours with ingratitude and lead their own people to their doom?

verses.text: In Hell they will burn. What an evil place for settlement.
verses.translation: In Hell they will burn. What an evil place for settlement.

verses.text: They set up equals to Allah to mislead ˹others˺ from His Way. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Enjoy yourselves! Surely your destination is the Fire.” Order to the Prophet
verses.translation: They set up equals to Allah to mislead ˹others˺ from His Way. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Enjoy yourselves! Surely your destination is the Fire.” Order to the Prophet

verses.text: Tell My believing servants to establish prayer and donate from what We have provided for them—openly and secretly—before the arrival of a Day in which there will be no ransom or friendly connections. Allah’s Favours
verses.translation: Tell My believing servants to establish prayer and donate from what We have provided for them—openly and secretly—before the arrival of a Day in which there will be no ransom or friendly connections. Allah’s Favours

verses.text: It is Allah Who created the heavens and the earth and sends down rain from the sky, causing fruits to grow as a provision for you. He has subjected the ships for your service, sailing through the sea by His command, and has subjected the rivers for you.
verses.translation: It is Allah Who created the heavens and the earth and sends down rain from the sky, causing fruits to grow as a provision for you. He has subjected the ships for your service, sailing through the sea by His command, and has subjected the rivers for you.

verses.text: He has ˹also˺ subjected for you the sun and the moon, both constantly orbiting, and has subjected the day and night for you.
verses.translation: He has ˹also˺ subjected for you the sun and the moon, both constantly orbiting, and has subjected the day and night for you.

verses.text: And He has granted you all that you asked Him for. If you tried to count Allah’s blessings, you would never be able to number them. Indeed humankind is truly unfair, ˹totally˺ ungrateful.[481] Abraham’s Prayers
verses.translation: And He has granted you all that you asked Him for. If you tried to count Allah’s blessings, you would never be able to number them. Indeed humankind is truly unfair, ˹totally˺ ungrateful.[481] Abraham’s Prayers

verses.text: ˹Remember˺ when Abraham prayed, “My Lord! Make this city ˹of Mecca˺ secure, and keep me and my children away from the worship of idols.
verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when Abraham prayed, “My Lord! Make this city ˹of Mecca˺ secure, and keep me and my children away from the worship of idols.

verses.text: My Lord! They have caused many people to go astray. So whoever follows me is with me, and whoever disobeys me—then surely You are ˹still˺ All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
verses.translation: My Lord! They have caused many people to go astray. So whoever follows me is with me, and whoever disobeys me—then surely You are ˹still˺ All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

verses.text: Our Lord! I have settled some of my offspring in a barren valley, near Your Sacred House, our Lord, so that they may establish prayer. So make the hearts of ˹believing˺ people incline towards them and provide them with fruits, so perhaps they will be thankful.
verses.translation: Our Lord! I have settled some of my offspring in a barren valley, near Your Sacred House, our Lord, so that they may establish prayer. So make the hearts of ˹believing˺ people incline towards them and provide them with fruits, so perhaps they will be thankful.

verses.text: Our Lord! You certainly know what we conceal and what we reveal. Nothing on earth or in heaven is hidden from Allah.
verses.translation: Our Lord! You certainly know what we conceal and what we reveal. Nothing on earth or in heaven is hidden from Allah.

verses.text: All praise is for Allah who has blessed me with Ishmael and Isaac in my old age. My Lord is indeed the Hearer of ˹all˺ prayers.
verses.translation: All praise is for Allah who has blessed me with Ishmael and Isaac in my old age. My Lord is indeed the Hearer of ˹all˺ prayers.

verses.text: My Lord! Make me and those ˹believers˺ of my descendants keep up prayer. Our Lord! Accept my prayers.
verses.translation: My Lord! Make me and those ˹believers˺ of my descendants keep up prayer. Our Lord! Accept my prayers.

verses.text: Our Lord! Forgive me, my parents, and the believers on the Day when the judgment will come to pass.” Warning to the Wicked
verses.translation: Our Lord! Forgive me, my parents, and the believers on the Day when the judgment will come to pass.” Warning to the Wicked

verses.text: Do not think ˹O Prophet˺ that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them until a Day when ˹their˺ eyes will stare in horror—
verses.translation: Do not think ˹O Prophet˺ that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them until a Day when ˹their˺ eyes will stare in horror—

verses.text: rushing forth, heads raised, never blinking, hearts void.
verses.translation: rushing forth, heads raised, never blinking, hearts void.

verses.text: And warn the people of the Day when the punishment will overtake ˹the wicked among˺ them, and the wrongdoers will cry, “Our Lord! Delay us for a little while. We will respond to Your call and follow the messengers!” ˹It will be said,˺ “Did you not swear before that you would never be removed ˹to the next life˺?”
verses.translation: And warn the people of the Day when the punishment will overtake ˹the wicked among˺ them, and the wrongdoers will cry, “Our Lord! Delay us for a little while. We will respond to Your call and follow the messengers!” ˹It will be said,˺ “Did you not swear before that you would never be removed ˹to the next life˺?”

verses.text: You passed by the ruins of those ˹destroyed peoples˺ who had wronged themselves.[482] It was made clear to you how We dealt with them, and We gave you ˹many˺ examples.
verses.translation: You passed by the ruins of those ˹destroyed peoples˺ who had wronged themselves.[482] It was made clear to you how We dealt with them, and We gave you ˹many˺ examples.

verses.text: They devised every plot, which was fully known to Allah, but their plotting was not enough to ˹even˺ overpower mountains ˹let alone Allah˺. Reward of the Wicked
verses.translation: They devised every plot, which was fully known to Allah, but their plotting was not enough to ˹even˺ overpower mountains ˹let alone Allah˺. Reward of the Wicked

verses.text: So do not think ˹O Prophet˺ that Allah will fail to keep His promise to His messengers. Allah is indeed Almighty, capable of punishment.
