verses.translation: So do not think ˹O Prophet˺ that Allah will fail to keep His promise to His messengers. Allah is indeed Almighty, capable of punishment.

verses.text: ˹Watch for˺ the Day ˹when˺ the earth will be changed into a different earth and the heavens as well, and all will appear before Allah—the One, the Supreme.
verses.translation: ˹Watch for˺ the Day ˹when˺ the earth will be changed into a different earth and the heavens as well, and all will appear before Allah—the One, the Supreme.

verses.text: On that Day you will see the wicked bound together in chains,
verses.translation: On that Day you will see the wicked bound together in chains,

verses.text: with garments of tar, and their faces covered with flames.
verses.translation: with garments of tar, and their faces covered with flames.

verses.text: As such, Allah will reward every soul for what it has committed. Surely Allah is swift in reckoning. A Universal Message
verses.translation: As such, Allah will reward every soul for what it has committed. Surely Allah is swift in reckoning. A Universal Message

verses.text: This ˹Quran˺ is a ˹sufficient˺ message for humanity so that they may take it as a warning and know that there is only One God, and so that people of reason may be mindful. *** -- 229 of 694 --
verses.translation: This ˹Quran˺ is a ˹sufficient˺ message for humanity so that they may take it as a warning and know that there is only One God, and so that people of reason may be mindful. *** -- 229 of 694 --

name: The Stone Valley
intro: This Meccan sûrah takes its name from the place mentioned in 80-84, where the people of Ṣâli ḥ once lived. Other destroyed peoples are mentioned as a warning to the Arab deniers, who are also warned at the beginning of the next sûrah. Satan’s arrogance towards Allah and enmity towards humanity are emphasized. The Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is urged to exercise patience and seek comfort in worship. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Warning to the Disbelievers

verses.text: Alif-Lãm-Ra. These are the verses of the Book; the clear Quran.
verses.translation: Alif-Lãm-Ra. These are the verses of the Book; the clear Quran.

verses.text: ˹The day will come when˺ the disbelievers will certainly wish they had submitted ˹to Allah˺.[483]
verses.translation: ˹The day will come when˺ the disbelievers will certainly wish they had submitted ˹to Allah˺.[483]

verses.text: ˹So˺ let them eat and enjoy themselves and be diverted by ˹false˺ hope, for they will soon know.
verses.translation: ˹So˺ let them eat and enjoy themselves and be diverted by ˹false˺ hope, for they will soon know.

verses.text: We have never destroyed a society without a destined term.
verses.translation: We have never destroyed a society without a destined term.

verses.text: No people can advance their doom, nor can they delay it. The Pagans Mocking the Prophet
verses.translation: No people can advance their doom, nor can they delay it. The Pagans Mocking the Prophet

verses.text: They say, “O you to whom the Reminder[484] is revealed! You must be insane!
verses.translation: They say, “O you to whom the Reminder[484] is revealed! You must be insane!

verses.text: Why do you not bring us the angels, if what you say is true?”
verses.translation: Why do you not bring us the angels, if what you say is true?”

verses.text: We do not send the angels down except for a just cause, and then ˹the end of˺ the disbelievers will not be delayed.
verses.translation: We do not send the angels down except for a just cause, and then ˹the end of˺ the disbelievers will not be delayed.

verses.text: It is certainly We Who have revealed the Reminder, and it is certainly We Who will preserve it. Committed to Disbelief
verses.translation: It is certainly We Who have revealed the Reminder, and it is certainly We Who will preserve it. Committed to Disbelief

name: Bees
intro: This Meccan sûrah, also known as the Chapter of Blessings (Sûratu An- Ni’am), takes its name from the bees mentioned in verses 68-69, which are described as one of Allah’s numerous favours to humanity. Instead of showing gratitude to Allah for all these blessings, the pagans wilfully set up idols, associating them with Allah in worship. They are also condemned for burying their daughters alive (verses 58-59). References are made to grateful believers and ungrateful disbelievers along with the ultimate reward for each group. Abraham ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is cited close to the end of the sûrah as a grateful servant of Allah, whose example should be emulated by all believers. The sûrah concludes by instructing the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) to endure patiently and invite all to the Way of Allah with wisdom and grace. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Warning of Judgment

verses.translation: The command of Allah is at hand, so do not hasten it. Glorified and Exalted is He above what they associate ˹with Him in worship˺! Allah’s Favours: 1) Divine Guidance

verses.translation: ˹He also created˺ horses, mules, and donkeys for your transportation and adornment. And He creates what you do not know. Favour 5) The Way of Islam

verses.translation: Also by landmarks and stars do people find their way. Almighty Allah or Powerless Gods?

verses.translation: Can the One Who creates be equal to those who do not? Will you not then be mindful?

verses.translation: If you tried to count Allah’s blessings, you would never be able to number them. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

verses.translation: But those ˹idols˺ they invoke besides Allah cannot create anything—they themselves are created.

verses.translation: Are they only awaiting the coming of the angels or the command of your Lord ˹O Prophet˺? So were those before them. And Allah never wronged them, but it was they who wronged themselves.

verses.text: Then the evil ˹consequences˺ of their deeds overtook them, and they were overwhelmed by what they used to ridicule. False Argument
verses.translation: Then the evil ˹consequences˺ of their deeds overtook them, and they were overwhelmed by what they used to ridicule. False Argument

verses.text: The polytheists argue, “Had Allah willed, neither we nor our forefathers would have worshipped anything other than Him, nor prohibited anything without His command.” So did those before them. Is not the messengers’ duty only to deliver ˹the message˺ clearly? Same Fate
verses.translation: The polytheists argue, “Had Allah willed, neither we nor our forefathers would have worshipped anything other than Him, nor prohibited anything without His command.” So did those before them. Is not the messengers’ duty only to deliver ˹the message˺ clearly? Same Fate

verses.text: We surely sent a messenger to every community, saying, “Worship Allah and shun false gods.” But some of them were guided by Allah, while others were destined to stray. So travel throughout the land and see the fate of the deniers!
verses.translation: We surely sent a messenger to every community, saying, “Worship Allah and shun false gods.” But some of them were guided by Allah, while others were destined to stray. So travel throughout the land and see the fate of the deniers!

verses.text: Even though you ˹O Prophet˺ are keen on their guidance, Allah certainly does not guide those He leaves to stray, and they will have no helpers. The Resurrection
verses.translation: Even though you ˹O Prophet˺ are keen on their guidance, Allah certainly does not guide those He leaves to stray, and they will have no helpers. The Resurrection

verses.text: They swear by Allah their most solemn oaths that Allah will never raise the dead to life. Yes ˹He will˺! It is a true promise binding on Him, but most people do not know.
verses.translation: They swear by Allah their most solemn oaths that Allah will never raise the dead to life. Yes ˹He will˺! It is a true promise binding on Him, but most people do not know.

verses.text: ˹He will do that˺ to make clear to them what they disagreed on, and for the disbelievers to know that they were liars.
verses.translation: ˹He will do that˺ to make clear to them what they disagreed on, and for the disbelievers to know that they were liars.

verses.text: If We ever will something ˹to exist˺, all We say is: “Be!” And it is! Reward of the Steadfast
verses.translation: If We ever will something ˹to exist˺, all We say is: “Be!” And it is! Reward of the Steadfast

verses.text: As for those who emigrated in ˹the cause of˺ Allah after being persecuted, We will surely bless them with a good home in this world. But the reward of the Hereafter is far better, if only they knew.
verses.translation: As for those who emigrated in ˹the cause of˺ Allah after being persecuted, We will surely bless them with a good home in this world. But the reward of the Hereafter is far better, if only they knew.

verses.text: ˹It is˺ they who have patiently endured, and in their Lord they put their trust. Messengers Are Not Angels
verses.translation: ˹It is˺ they who have patiently endured, and in their Lord they put their trust. Messengers Are Not Angels

verses.text: We did not send ˹messengers˺ before you ˹O Prophet˺ except mere men inspired by Us. If you ˹polytheists˺ do not know ˹this already˺, then ask those who have knowledge ˹of the Scriptures˺.
verses.translation: We did not send ˹messengers˺ before you ˹O Prophet˺ except mere men inspired by Us. If you ˹polytheists˺ do not know ˹this already˺, then ask those who have knowledge ˹of the Scriptures˺.

verses.text: ˹We sent them˺ with clear proofs and divine Books. And We have sent down to you ˹O Prophet˺ the Reminder, so that you may explain to people what has been revealed for them, and perhaps they will reflect. Warning to the Wicked
verses.translation: ˹We sent them˺ with clear proofs and divine Books. And We have sent down to you ˹O Prophet˺ the Reminder, so that you may explain to people what has been revealed for them, and perhaps they will reflect. Warning to the Wicked

verses.text: Do those who devise evil plots feel secure that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them? Or that the torment will not come upon them in ways they cannot comprehend?
verses.translation: Do those who devise evil plots feel secure that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them? Or that the torment will not come upon them in ways they cannot comprehend?

verses.text: Or that He will not seize them while they go about ˹their day˺, for then they will have no escape?
verses.translation: Or that He will not seize them while they go about ˹their day˺, for then they will have no escape?

verses.text: Or that He will not destroy them gradually? But your Lord is truly Ever Gracious, Most Merciful. Everything Submits to Allah
verses.translation: Or that He will not destroy them gradually? But your Lord is truly Ever Gracious, Most Merciful. Everything Submits to Allah

verses.text: Have they not considered how the shadows of everything Allah has created incline to the right and the left ˹as the sun moves˺, totally submitting to Allah in all humility?
verses.translation: Have they not considered how the shadows of everything Allah has created incline to the right and the left ˹as the sun moves˺, totally submitting to Allah in all humility?

verses.text: And to Allah ˹alone˺ bows down ˹in submission˺[498] whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth of living creatures, as do the angels—who are not too proud ˹to do so˺.
verses.translation: And to Allah ˹alone˺ bows down ˹in submission˺[498] whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth of living creatures, as do the angels—who are not too proud ˹to do so˺.

verses.text: They[499] fear their Lord above them, and do whatever they are commanded. One God Alone
verses.translation: They[499] fear their Lord above them, and do whatever they are commanded. One God Alone

verses.text: And Allah has said, “Do not take two gods. There is only One God. So be in awe of Me ˹alone˺.”
verses.translation: And Allah has said, “Do not take two gods. There is only One God. So be in awe of Me ˹alone˺.”

verses.text: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and to Him ˹alone˺ is the everlasting devotion. Will you then fear any other than Allah? Ingratitude to Allah
verses.translation: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and to Him ˹alone˺ is the everlasting devotion. Will you then fear any other than Allah? Ingratitude to Allah

verses.text: Whatever blessings you have are from Allah. Then whenever hardship touches you, to Him ˹alone˺ you cry ˹for help˺.
verses.translation: Whatever blessings you have are from Allah. Then whenever hardship touches you, to Him ˹alone˺ you cry ˹for help˺.

verses.text: Then as soon as He removes the hardship from you, a group of you associates ˹others˺ with their Lord ˹in worship˺,
verses.translation: Then as soon as He removes the hardship from you, a group of you associates ˹others˺ with their Lord ˹in worship˺,

verses.text: only returning Our favours with ingratitude. So enjoy yourselves, for you will soon know. Offerings to Idols
verses.translation: only returning Our favours with ingratitude. So enjoy yourselves, for you will soon know. Offerings to Idols

verses.text: And they ˹even˺ assign to those ˹idols˺—who know nothing—a share of what We have provided for them. By Allah! You will certainly be questioned about whatever ˹lies˺ you used to fabricate ˹against Allah˺. Allah’s Daughters?
verses.translation: And they ˹even˺ assign to those ˹idols˺—who know nothing—a share of what We have provided for them. By Allah! You will certainly be questioned about whatever ˹lies˺ you used to fabricate ˹against Allah˺. Allah’s Daughters?

verses.text: And they attribute ˹angels as˺ daughters to Allah—glory be to Him!— the opposite of what they desire for themselves.
verses.translation: And they attribute ˹angels as˺ daughters to Allah—glory be to Him!— the opposite of what they desire for themselves.

verses.text: Whenever one of them is given the good news of a baby girl, his face grows gloomy, as he suppresses his rage.
verses.translation: Whenever one of them is given the good news of a baby girl, his face grows gloomy, as he suppresses his rage.

verses.text: He hides himself from the people because of the bad news he has received. Should he keep her in disgrace, or bury her ˹alive˺ in the ground? Evil indeed is their judgment![500]
verses.translation: He hides himself from the people because of the bad news he has received. Should he keep her in disgrace, or bury her ˹alive˺ in the ground? Evil indeed is their judgment![500]

verses.text: To those who disbelieve in the Hereafter belong all evil qualities, whereas to Allah belong the finest attributes. And He is the Almighty, All-Wise. Favour 11) Allowing Time for Repentance
verses.translation: To those who disbelieve in the Hereafter belong all evil qualities, whereas to Allah belong the finest attributes. And He is the Almighty, All-Wise. Favour 11) Allowing Time for Repentance

verses.text: If Allah were to punish people ˹immediately˺ for their wrongdoing, He would not have left a single living being on earth. But He delays them for an appointed term. And when their time arrives, they cannot delay it for a moment, nor could they advance it. Empty Hopes
verses.translation: If Allah were to punish people ˹immediately˺ for their wrongdoing, He would not have left a single living being on earth. But He delays them for an appointed term. And when their time arrives, they cannot delay it for a moment, nor could they advance it. Empty Hopes

verses.text: They attribute to Allah what they hate ˹for themselves˺,[501] and their tongues utter the lie that they will have the finest reward. Without a doubt, for them is the Fire, where they will be abandoned. Evil Communities
verses.translation: They attribute to Allah what they hate ˹for themselves˺,[501] and their tongues utter the lie that they will have the finest reward. Without a doubt, for them is the Fire, where they will be abandoned. Evil Communities

verses.text: By Allah! We have surely sent messengers to communities before you ˹O Prophet˺, but Satan made their misdeeds appealing to them. So he is their patron today, and they will suffer a painful punishment.
verses.translation: By Allah! We have surely sent messengers to communities before you ˹O Prophet˺, but Satan made their misdeeds appealing to them. So he is their patron today, and they will suffer a painful punishment.

verses.text: We have revealed to you the Book only to clarify for them what they differed about, and as a guide and mercy for those who believe. Favour 12) Rain
verses.translation: We have revealed to you the Book only to clarify for them what they differed about, and as a guide and mercy for those who believe. Favour 12) Rain

verses.text: And Allah sends down rain from the sky, giving life to the earth after its death. Surely in this is a sign for those who listen. Favour 13) Cattle and Milk
verses.translation: And Allah sends down rain from the sky, giving life to the earth after its death. Surely in this is a sign for those who listen. Favour 13) Cattle and Milk

verses.text: And there is certainly a lesson for you in cattle: We give you to drink of what is in their bellies, from between digested food and blood: pure milk, pleasant to drink.[502]
verses.translation: And there is certainly a lesson for you in cattle: We give you to drink of what is in their bellies, from between digested food and blood: pure milk, pleasant to drink.[502]

verses.text: And from the fruits of palm trees and grapevines you derive intoxicants[503] as well as wholesome provision. Surely in this is a sign for those who understand. Favour 14) Bees and Honey
verses.translation: And from the fruits of palm trees and grapevines you derive intoxicants[503] as well as wholesome provision. Surely in this is a sign for those who understand. Favour 14) Bees and Honey

verses.text: And your Lord inspired the bees: “Make ˹your˺ homes in the mountains, the trees, and in what people construct,
verses.translation: And your Lord inspired the bees: “Make ˹your˺ homes in the mountains, the trees, and in what people construct,

verses.text: and feed from ˹the flower of˺ any fruit ˹you please˺ and follow the ways your Lord has made easy for you.” From their bellies comes forth liquid of varying colours, in which there is healing for people. Surely in this is a sign for those who reflect. Allah’s Power over Humans
verses.translation: and feed from ˹the flower of˺ any fruit ˹you please˺ and follow the ways your Lord has made easy for you.” From their bellies comes forth liquid of varying colours, in which there is healing for people. Surely in this is a sign for those who reflect. Allah’s Power over Humans

verses.text: Allah has created you, and then causes you to die. And some of you are left to reach the most feeble stage of life so that they may know nothing after having known much. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, Most Capable. Favour 15) Provisions
verses.translation: Allah has created you, and then causes you to die. And some of you are left to reach the most feeble stage of life so that they may know nothing after having known much. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, Most Capable. Favour 15) Provisions

verses.text: And Allah has favoured some of you over others in provision. But those who have been much favoured would not share their wealth with those ˹bondspeople˺ in their possession, making them their equals.[504] Do they then deny Allah’s favours? Favour 16) Spouses and Offspring
verses.translation: And Allah has favoured some of you over others in provision. But those who have been much favoured would not share their wealth with those ˹bondspeople˺ in their possession, making them their equals.[504] Do they then deny Allah’s favours? Favour 16) Spouses and Offspring

verses.text: And Allah has made for you spouses of your own kind, and given you through your spouses children and grandchildren.[505] And He has granted you good, lawful provisions. Are they then faithful to falsehood and ungrateful for Allah’s favours? Parables for Powerless Gods and Almighty Allah
verses.translation: And Allah has made for you spouses of your own kind, and given you through your spouses children and grandchildren.[505] And He has granted you good, lawful provisions. Are they then faithful to falsehood and ungrateful for Allah’s favours? Parables for Powerless Gods and Almighty Allah

verses.text: Yet they worship besides Allah those ˹idols˺ who do not afford them any provision from the heavens and the earth, nor do they have the power to.
verses.translation: Yet they worship besides Allah those ˹idols˺ who do not afford them any provision from the heavens and the earth, nor do they have the power to.

verses.text: So do not set up equals to Allah, for Allah certainly knows and you do not know.
verses.translation: So do not set up equals to Allah, for Allah certainly knows and you do not know.

verses.text: Allah sets forth a parable: a slave who lacks all means, compared to a ˹free˺ man to whom We granted a good provision, of which he donates ˹freely,˺ openly and secretly. Are they equal? Praise be to Allah. In fact, most of them do not know.
verses.translation: Allah sets forth a parable: a slave who lacks all means, compared to a ˹free˺ man to whom We granted a good provision, of which he donates ˹freely,˺ openly and secretly. Are they equal? Praise be to Allah. In fact, most of them do not know.

verses.text: And Allah sets forth a parable of two men: one of them is dumb, incapable of anything. He is a burden on his master. Wherever he is sent, he brings no good. Can such a person be equal to the one who commands justice and is on the Straight Path?[506] Allah’s Knowledge and Might
verses.translation: And Allah sets forth a parable of two men: one of them is dumb, incapable of anything. He is a burden on his master. Wherever he is sent, he brings no good. Can such a person be equal to the one who commands justice and is on the Straight Path?[506] Allah’s Knowledge and Might

verses.text: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs ˹the knowledge of˺ the unseen in the heavens and the earth. Bringing about the Hour would only take the blink of an eye, or even less. Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything. Favour 17) Senses
verses.translation: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs ˹the knowledge of˺ the unseen in the heavens and the earth. Bringing about the Hour would only take the blink of an eye, or even less. Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything. Favour 17) Senses

verses.text: And Allah brought you out of the wombs of your mothers while you knew nothing, and gave you hearing, sight, and intellect so perhaps you would be thankful. Favour 18) Birds
verses.translation: And Allah brought you out of the wombs of your mothers while you knew nothing, and gave you hearing, sight, and intellect so perhaps you would be thankful. Favour 18) Birds

verses.text: Have they not seen the birds glide in the open sky? None holds them up except Allah. Surely in this are signs for those who believe. Favour 19) Homes
verses.translation: Have they not seen the birds glide in the open sky? None holds them up except Allah. Surely in this are signs for those who believe. Favour 19) Homes

verses.text: And Allah has made your homes a place to rest, and has given you tents from the hide of animals, light to handle when you travel and when you camp. And out of their wool, fur, and hair He has given you furnishings and goods for a while. Favour 20) Shelters
verses.translation: And Allah has made your homes a place to rest, and has given you tents from the hide of animals, light to handle when you travel and when you camp. And out of their wool, fur, and hair He has given you furnishings and goods for a while. Favour 20) Shelters

verses.text: And Allah has provided you shade out of what He created, and has given you shelter in the mountains. He has also provided you with clothes protecting you from the heat ˹and cold˺, and armour shielding you in battle. This is how He perfects His favour upon you, so perhaps you will ˹fully˺ submit ˹to Him˺. Denying Allah’s Favours
verses.translation: And Allah has provided you shade out of what He created, and has given you shelter in the mountains. He has also provided you with clothes protecting you from the heat ˹and cold˺, and armour shielding you in battle. This is how He perfects His favour upon you, so perhaps you will ˹fully˺ submit ˹to Him˺. Denying Allah’s Favours

verses.text: But if they turn away, then your duty ˹O Prophet˺ is only to deliver ˹the message˺ clearly.
verses.translation: But if they turn away, then your duty ˹O Prophet˺ is only to deliver ˹the message˺ clearly.

verses.text: They are aware of Allah’s favours, but still deny them. And most of them are ˹truly˺ ungrateful. Fate of the Disbelievers
verses.translation: They are aware of Allah’s favours, but still deny them. And most of them are ˹truly˺ ungrateful. Fate of the Disbelievers

verses.text: ˹Consider, O Prophet,˺ the Day We will call ˹a prophet as˺ a witness from every faith-community. Then the disbelievers will neither be allowed to plead nor appease ˹their Lord˺.
verses.translation: ˹Consider, O Prophet,˺ the Day We will call ˹a prophet as˺ a witness from every faith-community. Then the disbelievers will neither be allowed to plead nor appease ˹their Lord˺.

verses.text: And when the wrongdoers face the punishment, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be delayed ˹from it˺.
verses.translation: And when the wrongdoers face the punishment, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be delayed ˹from it˺.

verses.text: And when the polytheists see their associate-gods, they will say, “Our Lord! These are our associate-gods that we used to invoke besides You.” Their gods will throw a rebuttal at them, ˹saying,˺ “You are definitely liars.”
verses.translation: And when the polytheists see their associate-gods, they will say, “Our Lord! These are our associate-gods that we used to invoke besides You.” Their gods will throw a rebuttal at them, ˹saying,˺ “You are definitely liars.”

verses.text: They will offer ˹full˺ submission to Allah on that Day, and whatever ˹gods˺ they fabricated will fail them.
verses.translation: They will offer ˹full˺ submission to Allah on that Day, and whatever ˹gods˺ they fabricated will fail them.

verses.text: For those who disbelieve and hinder ˹others˺ from the Way of Allah, We will add more punishment to their punishment for all the corruption they spread. Prophets Witness Against Disbelievers
verses.translation: For those who disbelieve and hinder ˹others˺ from the Way of Allah, We will add more punishment to their punishment for all the corruption they spread. Prophets Witness Against Disbelievers

verses.text: ˹Consider, O Prophet,˺ the Day We will call against every faith- community a witness of their own. And We will call you to be a witness against these ˹people of yours˺. We have revealed to you the Book as an explanation of all things, a guide, a mercy, and good news for those who ˹fully˺ submit. Allah’s Commands and Prohibitions
verses.translation: ˹Consider, O Prophet,˺ the Day We will call against every faith- community a witness of their own. And We will call you to be a witness against these ˹people of yours˺. We have revealed to you the Book as an explanation of all things, a guide, a mercy, and good news for those who ˹fully˺ submit. Allah’s Commands and Prohibitions

verses.text: Indeed, Allah commands justice, grace, as well as courtesy to close relatives. He forbids indecency, wickedness, and aggression. He instructs you so perhaps you will be mindful. Honouring Pledges
verses.translation: Indeed, Allah commands justice, grace, as well as courtesy to close relatives. He forbids indecency, wickedness, and aggression. He instructs you so perhaps you will be mindful. Honouring Pledges

verses.text: Honour Allah’s covenant when you make a pledge, and do not break your oaths after confirming them, having made Allah your guarantor. Surely Allah knows all you do.
verses.translation: Honour Allah’s covenant when you make a pledge, and do not break your oaths after confirming them, having made Allah your guarantor. Surely Allah knows all you do.

verses.text: Do not be like the woman who ˹foolishly˺ unravels her yarn after it is firmly spun, by taking your oaths as a means of deceiving one another in favour of a stronger group. Surely Allah tests you through this. And on the Day of Judgment He will certainly make your differences clear to you. Favour 21) Free Choice
verses.translation: Do not be like the woman who ˹foolishly˺ unravels her yarn after it is firmly spun, by taking your oaths as a means of deceiving one another in favour of a stronger group. Surely Allah tests you through this. And on the Day of Judgment He will certainly make your differences clear to you. Favour 21) Free Choice

verses.text: Had Allah willed, He could have easily made you one community ˹of believers˺, but He leaves to stray whoever He wills and guides whoever He wills.[507] And you will certainly be questioned about what you used to do. Honouring Agreements
verses.translation: Had Allah willed, He could have easily made you one community ˹of believers˺, but He leaves to stray whoever He wills and guides whoever He wills.[507] And you will certainly be questioned about what you used to do. Honouring Agreements

verses.text: And do not take your oaths as a means of deceiving one another or your feet will slip after they have been firm. Then you will taste the evil ˹consequences˺ of hindering ˹others˺ from the Way of Allah, and you will suffer a tremendous punishment.
verses.translation: And do not take your oaths as a means of deceiving one another or your feet will slip after they have been firm. Then you will taste the evil ˹consequences˺ of hindering ˹others˺ from the Way of Allah, and you will suffer a tremendous punishment.

verses.text: And do not trade Allah’s covenant for a fleeting gain. What is with Allah is certainly far better for you, if only you knew.
verses.translation: And do not trade Allah’s covenant for a fleeting gain. What is with Allah is certainly far better for you, if only you knew.

verses.text: Whatever you have will end, but whatever Allah has is everlasting. And We will certainly reward the steadfast according to the best of their deeds. Reward of the Good-Doers
verses.translation: Whatever you have will end, but whatever Allah has is everlasting. And We will certainly reward the steadfast according to the best of their deeds. Reward of the Good-Doers

verses.text: Whoever does good, whether male or female, and is a believer, We will surely bless them with a good life, and We will certainly reward them according to the best of their deeds. Advice to the Believers
verses.translation: Whoever does good, whether male or female, and is a believer, We will surely bless them with a good life, and We will certainly reward them according to the best of their deeds. Advice to the Believers

verses.text: When you recite the Quran, seek refuge with Allah from Satan, the accursed.
verses.translation: When you recite the Quran, seek refuge with Allah from Satan, the accursed.

verses.text: He certainly has no authority over those who believe and put their trust in their Lord.
verses.translation: He certainly has no authority over those who believe and put their trust in their Lord.

verses.text: His authority is only over those who take him as a patron and who—under his influence—associate ˹others˺ with Allah ˹in worship˺. Who Is the Fabricator?
verses.translation: His authority is only over those who take him as a patron and who—under his influence—associate ˹others˺ with Allah ˹in worship˺. Who Is the Fabricator?

verses.text: When We replace a verse with another[508]—and Allah knows best what He reveals—they say, “You ˹Muḥammad˺ are just a fabricator.” In fact, most of them do not know.
verses.translation: When We replace a verse with another[508]—and Allah knows best what He reveals—they say, “You ˹Muḥammad˺ are just a fabricator.” In fact, most of them do not know.

verses.text: Say, “The holy spirit[509] has brought it down from your Lord with the truth to reassure the believers, and as a guide and good news for those who submit ˹to Allah˺.”
verses.translation: Say, “The holy spirit[509] has brought it down from your Lord with the truth to reassure the believers, and as a guide and good news for those who submit ˹to Allah˺.”

verses.text: And We surely know that they say, “No one is teaching him except a human.” But the man they refer to speaks a foreign tongue, whereas this ˹Quran˺ is ˹in˺ eloquent Arabic.[510]
verses.translation: And We surely know that they say, “No one is teaching him except a human.” But the man they refer to speaks a foreign tongue, whereas this ˹Quran˺ is ˹in˺ eloquent Arabic.[510]

verses.text: Surely those who do not believe in Allah’s revelations will never be guided by Allah, and they will suffer a painful punishment.
verses.translation: Surely those who do not believe in Allah’s revelations will never be guided by Allah, and they will suffer a painful punishment.

verses.text: No one fabricates lies except those who disbelieve in Allah’s revelations, and it is they who are the ˹true˺ liars. Abandoning Faith
verses.translation: No one fabricates lies except those who disbelieve in Allah’s revelations, and it is they who are the ˹true˺ liars. Abandoning Faith

verses.text: Whoever disbelieves in Allah after their belief—not those who are forced while their hearts are firm in faith,[511] but those who embrace disbelief wholeheartedly—they will be condemned by Allah and suffer a tremendous punishment.
verses.translation: Whoever disbelieves in Allah after their belief—not those who are forced while their hearts are firm in faith,[511] but those who embrace disbelief wholeheartedly—they will be condemned by Allah and suffer a tremendous punishment.

verses.text: This is because they prefer the life of this world over the Hereafter. Surely Allah never guides those who ˹choose to˺ disbelieve.
verses.translation: This is because they prefer the life of this world over the Hereafter. Surely Allah never guides those who ˹choose to˺ disbelieve.

verses.text: They are the ones whose hearts, ears, and eyes are sealed by Allah, and it is they who are ˹truly˺ heedless.
verses.translation: They are the ones whose hearts, ears, and eyes are sealed by Allah, and it is they who are ˹truly˺ heedless.

verses.text: Without a doubt, they will be the losers in the Hereafter.
verses.translation: Without a doubt, they will be the losers in the Hereafter.

verses.text: As for those who emigrated after being compelled ˹to renounce Islam˺, then struggled ˹in Allah’s cause˺, and persevered, your Lord ˹O Prophet˺ is truly All-Forgiving, Most Merciful after all. Pay Day
verses.translation: As for those who emigrated after being compelled ˹to renounce Islam˺, then struggled ˹in Allah’s cause˺, and persevered, your Lord ˹O Prophet˺ is truly All-Forgiving, Most Merciful after all. Pay Day

verses.text: ˹Consider˺ the Day ˹when˺ every soul will come pleading for itself, and each will be paid in full for what it did, and none will be wronged. The Ungrateful People
verses.translation: ˹Consider˺ the Day ˹when˺ every soul will come pleading for itself, and each will be paid in full for what it did, and none will be wronged. The Ungrateful People

verses.text: And Allah sets forth the example of a society which was safe and at ease, receiving its provision in abundance from all directions. But its people met Allah’s favours with ingratitude, so Allah made them taste the clutches of hunger and fear for their misdeeds.
verses.translation: And Allah sets forth the example of a society which was safe and at ease, receiving its provision in abundance from all directions. But its people met Allah’s favours with ingratitude, so Allah made them taste the clutches of hunger and fear for their misdeeds.

verses.text: A messenger of their own actually did come to them, but they denied him. So the torment overtook them while they persisted in wrongdoing. Lawful and Prohibited Foods
verses.translation: A messenger of their own actually did come to them, but they denied him. So the torment overtook them while they persisted in wrongdoing. Lawful and Prohibited Foods

verses.text: So eat from the good, lawful things which Allah has provided for you, and be grateful for Allah’s favours, if you ˹truly˺ worship Him ˹alone˺.
verses.translation: So eat from the good, lawful things which Allah has provided for you, and be grateful for Allah’s favours, if you ˹truly˺ worship Him ˹alone˺.

verses.text: He has only forbidden you ˹to eat˺ carrion, blood, swine,[512] and what is slaughtered in the name of any other than Allah. But if someone is compelled by necessity—neither driven by desire nor exceeding immediate need—then surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Warning to the Polytheists
verses.translation: He has only forbidden you ˹to eat˺ carrion, blood, swine,[512] and what is slaughtered in the name of any other than Allah. But if someone is compelled by necessity—neither driven by desire nor exceeding immediate need—then surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Warning to the Polytheists

verses.text: Do not falsely declare with your tongues, “This is lawful, and that is unlawful,” ˹only˺ fabricating lies against Allah. Indeed, those who fabricate lies against Allah will never succeed.
verses.translation: Do not falsely declare with your tongues, “This is lawful, and that is unlawful,” ˹only˺ fabricating lies against Allah. Indeed, those who fabricate lies against Allah will never succeed.

verses.text: ˹It is only˺ a brief enjoyment, then they will suffer a painful punishment. Prohibited Foods for Jews
verses.translation: ˹It is only˺ a brief enjoyment, then they will suffer a painful punishment. Prohibited Foods for Jews

verses.text: To the Jews, We have forbidden what We related to you before.[513] We did not wrong them, but it was they who wronged themselves. Allah Accepts Repentance
verses.translation: To the Jews, We have forbidden what We related to you before.[513] We did not wrong them, but it was they who wronged themselves. Allah Accepts Repentance

verses.text: As for those who commit evil ignorantly ˹or recklessly˺, then repent afterwards and mend their ways, then your Lord is surely All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Prophet Abraham
verses.translation: As for those who commit evil ignorantly ˹or recklessly˺, then repent afterwards and mend their ways, then your Lord is surely All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Prophet Abraham

verses.text: Indeed, Abraham was a model of excellence: devoted to Allah, ˹perfectly˺ upright—not a polytheist—
verses.translation: Indeed, Abraham was a model of excellence: devoted to Allah, ˹perfectly˺ upright—not a polytheist—

verses.text: ˹utterly˺ grateful for Allah’s favours. ˹So˺ He chose him and guided him to the Straight Path.
verses.translation: ˹utterly˺ grateful for Allah’s favours. ˹So˺ He chose him and guided him to the Straight Path.

verses.text: We blessed him with all goodness in this world,[514] and in the Hereafter he will certainly be among the righteous.
verses.translation: We blessed him with all goodness in this world,[514] and in the Hereafter he will certainly be among the righteous.

verses.text: Then We revealed to you ˹O Prophet, saying˺: “Follow the faith of Abraham, the upright, who was not one of the polytheists.”
verses.translation: Then We revealed to you ˹O Prophet, saying˺: “Follow the faith of Abraham, the upright, who was not one of the polytheists.”

verses.text: ˹Honouring˺ the Sabbath was ordained only for those who disputed about Abraham.[515] And surely your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Judgment regarding their disputes. Inviting to Islam
verses.translation: ˹Honouring˺ the Sabbath was ordained only for those who disputed about Abraham.[515] And surely your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Judgment regarding their disputes. Inviting to Islam

verses.text: Invite ˹all˺ to the Way of your Lord with wisdom and kind advice, and only debate with them in the best manner. Surely your Lord ˹alone˺ knows best who has strayed from His Way and who is ˹rightly˺ guided. Grace Is Best
verses.translation: Invite ˹all˺ to the Way of your Lord with wisdom and kind advice, and only debate with them in the best manner. Surely your Lord ˹alone˺ knows best who has strayed from His Way and who is ˹rightly˺ guided. Grace Is Best

verses.text: If you retaliate, then let it be equivalent to what you have suffered. But if you patiently endure, it is certainly best for those who are patient.
verses.translation: If you retaliate, then let it be equivalent to what you have suffered. But if you patiently endure, it is certainly best for those who are patient.

verses.text: Be patient ˹O Prophet˺, for your patience is only with Allah’s help. Do not grieve over those ˹who disbelieve˺, nor be distressed by their schemes.
verses.translation: Be patient ˹O Prophet˺, for your patience is only with Allah’s help. Do not grieve over those ˹who disbelieve˺, nor be distressed by their schemes.

verses.text: Surely Allah is with those who shun evil and who do good ˹deeds˺. *** -- 246 of 694 --
verses.translation: Surely Allah is with those who shun evil and who do good ˹deeds˺. *** -- 246 of 694 --

name: The Night Journey
intro: Since Abraham ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is praised in the last verses of the previous sûrah as a role model for the world, this Meccan sûrah speaks of how the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is honoured in this world through the Night Journey from Mecca to Jerusalem then to the heavens and back to Mecca—all in one night (verses 1 and 60). He ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) will also be honoured on the Day of Judgment through the station of praise where he will make intercession (verse 79). The children of Israel are referred to passingly at the end of the previous sûrah, but more insights are given about them both at the beginning and the end of this sûrah. The key to success in this life and salvation in the next is encapsulated in a set of divine commandments (verses 22-39), along with a warning against Satan and his whispers (verses 61-65). The sûrah is critical of the pagan arguments against resurrection and their ridiculous demands (verses 89-93). Criticism of attributing partners and children to Allah is carried over to the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Journey from Mecca to Jerusalem

verses.text: Glory be to the One Who took His servant ˹Muḥammad˺ by night from the Sacred Mosque to the Farthest Mosque whose surroundings We have blessed, so that We may show him some of Our signs.[516] Indeed, He[517] alone is the All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
verses.translation: Glory be to the One Who took His servant ˹Muḥammad˺ by night from the Sacred Mosque to the Farthest Mosque whose surroundings We have blessed, so that We may show him some of Our signs.[516] Indeed, He[517] alone is the All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

verses.text: And We gave Moses the Scripture and made it a guide for the Children of Israel, ˹stating:˺ “Do not take besides Me any other Trustee of Affairs,
verses.translation: And We gave Moses the Scripture and made it a guide for the Children of Israel, ˹stating:˺ “Do not take besides Me any other Trustee of Affairs,

verses.text: ˹O˺ descendants of those We carried with Noah ˹in the Ark˺! He was indeed a grateful servant.” Warning to the Israelites
verses.translation: ˹O˺ descendants of those We carried with Noah ˹in the Ark˺! He was indeed a grateful servant.” Warning to the Israelites

verses.text: And We warned the Children of Israel in the Scripture, “You will certainly cause corruption in the land twice, and you will become extremely arrogant. The Two Corruptions
verses.translation: And We warned the Children of Israel in the Scripture, “You will certainly cause corruption in the land twice, and you will become extremely arrogant. The Two Corruptions

verses.text: “When the first of the two warnings would come to pass, We would send against you some of Our servants of great might, who would ravage your homes. This would be a warning fulfilled.
verses.translation: “When the first of the two warnings would come to pass, We would send against you some of Our servants of great might, who would ravage your homes. This would be a warning fulfilled.

verses.text: Then ˹after your repentance˺ We would give you the upper hand over them and aid you with wealth and offspring, causing you to outnumber them.
verses.translation: Then ˹after your repentance˺ We would give you the upper hand over them and aid you with wealth and offspring, causing you to outnumber them.

verses.text: If you act rightly, it is for your own good, but if you do wrong, it is to your own loss. And when the second warning would come to pass, your enemies would ˹be left to˺ totally disgrace you and enter the Temple ˹of Jerusalem˺ as they entered it the first time, and utterly destroy whatever would fall into their hands.
verses.translation: If you act rightly, it is for your own good, but if you do wrong, it is to your own loss. And when the second warning would come to pass, your enemies would ˹be left to˺ totally disgrace you and enter the Temple ˹of Jerusalem˺ as they entered it the first time, and utterly destroy whatever would fall into their hands.

verses.text: Perhaps your Lord will have mercy on you ˹if you repent˺, but if you return ˹to sin˺, We will return ˹to punishment˺. And We have made Hell a ˹permanent˺ confinement for the disbelievers.” The Message of the Quran
verses.translation: Perhaps your Lord will have mercy on you ˹if you repent˺, but if you return ˹to sin˺, We will return ˹to punishment˺. And We have made Hell a ˹permanent˺ confinement for the disbelievers.” The Message of the Quran

verses.text: Surely this Quran guides to what is most upright, and gives good news to the believers—who do good—that they will have a mighty reward.
verses.translation: Surely this Quran guides to what is most upright, and gives good news to the believers—who do good—that they will have a mighty reward.

verses.text: And ˹it warns˺ those who do not believe in the Hereafter ˹that˺ We have prepared for them a painful punishment. Prayers in Anger
verses.translation: And ˹it warns˺ those who do not believe in the Hereafter ˹that˺ We have prepared for them a painful punishment. Prayers in Anger

verses.text: And humans ˹swiftly˺ pray for evil[518] as they pray for good. For humankind is ever hasty. The Day and Night
verses.translation: And humans ˹swiftly˺ pray for evil[518] as they pray for good. For humankind is ever hasty. The Day and Night

verses.text: We made the day and night as two signs. So We made the sign of the night devoid of light, and We made the sign of the day ˹perfectly˺ bright, so that you may seek the bounty of your Lord and know the number of years and calculation ˹of time˺. And We have explained everything in detail. The Record of Deeds
verses.translation: We made the day and night as two signs. So We made the sign of the night devoid of light, and We made the sign of the day ˹perfectly˺ bright, so that you may seek the bounty of your Lord and know the number of years and calculation ˹of time˺. And We have explained everything in detail. The Record of Deeds

verses.text: We have bound every human’s destiny to their neck.[519] And on the Day of Judgment We will bring forth to each ˹person˺ a record which they will find laid open.
verses.translation: We have bound every human’s destiny to their neck.[519] And on the Day of Judgment We will bring forth to each ˹person˺ a record which they will find laid open.

verses.text: ˹And it will be said,˺ “Read your record. You ˹alone˺ are sufficient this Day to take account of yourself.”
verses.translation: ˹And it will be said,˺ “Read your record. You ˹alone˺ are sufficient this Day to take account of yourself.”

verses.text: Whoever chooses to be guided, it is only for their own good. And whoever chooses to stray, it is only to their own loss. No soul burdened with sin will bear the burden of another. And We would never punish ˹a people˺ until We have sent a messenger ˹to warn them˺. Punishment of the Wicked
verses.translation: Whoever chooses to be guided, it is only for their own good. And whoever chooses to stray, it is only to their own loss. No soul burdened with sin will bear the burden of another. And We would never punish ˹a people˺ until We have sent a messenger ˹to warn them˺. Punishment of the Wicked

verses.text: Whenever We intend to destroy a society, We command its elite ˹to obey Allah˺ but they act rebelliously in it. So the decree ˹of punishment˺ is justified, and We destroy it utterly.
verses.translation: Whenever We intend to destroy a society, We command its elite ˹to obey Allah˺ but they act rebelliously in it. So the decree ˹of punishment˺ is justified, and We destroy it utterly.

verses.text: ˹Imagine˺ how many peoples We have destroyed after Noah! And sufficient is your Lord as All-Aware and All-Seeing of the sins of His servants. This Life or the Next?
verses.translation: ˹Imagine˺ how many peoples We have destroyed after Noah! And sufficient is your Lord as All-Aware and All-Seeing of the sins of His servants. This Life or the Next?

verses.text: Whoever desires this fleeting world ˹alone˺, We hasten in it whatever We please to whoever We will; then We destine them for Hell, where they will burn, condemned and rejected.
verses.translation: Whoever desires this fleeting world ˹alone˺, We hasten in it whatever We please to whoever We will; then We destine them for Hell, where they will burn, condemned and rejected.

verses.text: But whoever desires the Hereafter and strives for it accordingly, and is a ˹true˺ believer, it is they whose striving will be appreciated.
verses.translation: But whoever desires the Hereafter and strives for it accordingly, and is a ˹true˺ believer, it is they whose striving will be appreciated.

verses.text: We provide both the former and the latter from the bounty of your Lord. And the bounty of your Lord can never be withheld.
verses.translation: We provide both the former and the latter from the bounty of your Lord. And the bounty of your Lord can never be withheld.

verses.text: See how We have favoured some over others ˹in this life˺, but the Hereafter is certainly far greater in rank and in favour. Commandments: 1) Worship Allah Alone, 2) Honour Your Parents
verses.translation: See how We have favoured some over others ˹in this life˺, but the Hereafter is certainly far greater in rank and in favour. Commandments: 1) Worship Allah Alone, 2) Honour Your Parents

verses.text: Do not set up any other god with Allah, or you will end up condemned, abandoned.
verses.translation: Do not set up any other god with Allah, or you will end up condemned, abandoned.

verses.text: For your Lord has decreed that you worship none but Him. And honour your parents. If one or both of them reach old age in your care, never say to them ˹even˺ ‘ugh,’ nor yell at them. Rather, address them respectfully.
verses.translation: For your Lord has decreed that you worship none but Him. And honour your parents. If one or both of them reach old age in your care, never say to them ˹even˺ ‘ugh,’ nor yell at them. Rather, address them respectfully.

verses.text: And be humble with them out of mercy, and pray, “My Lord! Be merciful to them as they raised me when I was young.”
verses.translation: And be humble with them out of mercy, and pray, “My Lord! Be merciful to them as they raised me when I was young.”

verses.text: Your Lord knows best what is within yourselves. If you are righteous, He is certainly All-Forgiving to those who ˹constantly˺ turn to Him. 3) Give, 4) Do Not Waste
verses.translation: Your Lord knows best what is within yourselves. If you are righteous, He is certainly All-Forgiving to those who ˹constantly˺ turn to Him. 3) Give, 4) Do Not Waste

verses.text: Give to close relatives their due, as well as the poor and ˹needy˺ travellers. And do not spend wastefully.
verses.translation: Give to close relatives their due, as well as the poor and ˹needy˺ travellers. And do not spend wastefully.

verses.text: Surely the wasteful are ˹like˺ brothers to the devils. And the Devil is ever ungrateful to his Lord.
verses.translation: Surely the wasteful are ˹like˺ brothers to the devils. And the Devil is ever ungrateful to his Lord.

verses.text: But if you must turn them down ˹because you lack the means to give˺—while hoping to receive your Lord’s bounty—then ˹at least˺ give them a kind word. 5) Spend Moderately
verses.translation: But if you must turn them down ˹because you lack the means to give˺—while hoping to receive your Lord’s bounty—then ˹at least˺ give them a kind word. 5) Spend Moderately

verses.text: Do not be so tight-fisted, for you will be blameworthy; nor so open- handed, for you will end up in poverty.
verses.translation: Do not be so tight-fisted, for you will be blameworthy; nor so open- handed, for you will end up in poverty.

verses.text: Surely your Lord gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills. He is certainly All-Aware, All- Seeing of His servants. 6) Treasure Your Children
verses.translation: Surely your Lord gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills. He is certainly All-Aware, All- Seeing of His servants. 6) Treasure Your Children

verses.text: Do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them and for you. Surely killing them is a heinous sin. 7) Do Not Commit Adultery
verses.translation: Do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them and for you. Surely killing them is a heinous sin. 7) Do Not Commit Adultery

verses.text: Do not go near adultery. It is truly a shameful deed and an evil way. 8) Do Not Kill
verses.translation: Do not go near adultery. It is truly a shameful deed and an evil way. 8) Do Not Kill

verses.text: Do not take a ˹human˺ life—made sacred by Allah—except with ˹legal˺ right.[520] If anyone is killed unjustly, We have given their heirs[521] the authority, but do not let them exceed limits in retaliation,[522] for they are already supported ˹by law˺. 9) Protect Orphans’ Wealth, 10) Honour Pledges
verses.translation: Do not take a ˹human˺ life—made sacred by Allah—except with ˹legal˺ right.[520] If anyone is killed unjustly, We have given their heirs[521] the authority, but do not let them exceed limits in retaliation,[522] for they are already supported ˹by law˺. 9) Protect Orphans’ Wealth, 10) Honour Pledges

verses.text: Do not come near the wealth of the orphan—unless intending to enhance it—until they attain maturity. And honour ˹your˺ pledges, for you will surely be accountable for them. 11) Maintain Fairness
verses.translation: Do not come near the wealth of the orphan—unless intending to enhance it—until they attain maturity. And honour ˹your˺ pledges, for you will surely be accountable for them. 11) Maintain Fairness

verses.text: Give in full when you measure, and weigh with an even balance. That is fairest and best in the end. 12) Be Sure
verses.translation: Give in full when you measure, and weigh with an even balance. That is fairest and best in the end. 12) Be Sure

verses.text: Do not follow what you have no ˹sure˺ knowledge of. Indeed, all will be called to account for ˹their˺ hearing, sight, and intellect. 13) Be Humble
verses.translation: Do not follow what you have no ˹sure˺ knowledge of. Indeed, all will be called to account for ˹their˺ hearing, sight, and intellect. 13) Be Humble

verses.text: And do not walk on the earth arrogantly. Surely you can neither crack the earth nor stretch to the height of the mountains. Compliance with the Commandments
verses.translation: And do not walk on the earth arrogantly. Surely you can neither crack the earth nor stretch to the height of the mountains. Compliance with the Commandments

verses.text: The violation of any of these ˹commandments˺ is detestable to your Lord.
verses.translation: The violation of any of these ˹commandments˺ is detestable to your Lord.

verses.text: This is part of the wisdom which your Lord has revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺. And do not set up any other god with Allah ˹O humanity˺, or you will be cast into Hell, blameworthy, rejected. Rebuttal to a Pagan Claim
verses.translation: This is part of the wisdom which your Lord has revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺. And do not set up any other god with Allah ˹O humanity˺, or you will be cast into Hell, blameworthy, rejected. Rebuttal to a Pagan Claim

verses.text: Has your Lord favoured you ˹pagans˺ with sons and taken angels as ˹His˺ daughters?[523] You are truly making an outrageous claim.
verses.translation: Has your Lord favoured you ˹pagans˺ with sons and taken angels as ˹His˺ daughters?[523] You are truly making an outrageous claim.

verses.text: We have surely varied ˹the signs˺ in this Quran so perhaps they may be mindful, but it only drives them farther away. Other Gods?
verses.translation: We have surely varied ˹the signs˺ in this Quran so perhaps they may be mindful, but it only drives them farther away. Other Gods?

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Had there been other gods besides Him—as they claim—then they would have certainly sought a way to ˹challenge˺ the Lord of the Throne.”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Had there been other gods besides Him—as they claim—then they would have certainly sought a way to ˹challenge˺ the Lord of the Throne.”

verses.text: Glorified and Highly Exalted is He above what they claim!
verses.translation: Glorified and Highly Exalted is He above what they claim!

verses.text: The seven heavens, the earth, and all those in them glorify Him. There is not a single thing that does not glorify His praises—but you ˹simply˺ cannot comprehend their glorification. He is indeed Most Forbearing, All-Forgiving. The Pagans Mock the Quran
verses.translation: The seven heavens, the earth, and all those in them glorify Him. There is not a single thing that does not glorify His praises—but you ˹simply˺ cannot comprehend their glorification. He is indeed Most Forbearing, All-Forgiving. The Pagans Mock the Quran

verses.text: When you ˹O Prophet˺ recite the Quran, We put a hidden barrier between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter.
verses.translation: When you ˹O Prophet˺ recite the Quran, We put a hidden barrier between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter.

verses.text: We have cast veils over their hearts—leaving them unable to comprehend it—and deafness in their ears. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Quran, they turn their backs in aversion.
verses.translation: We have cast veils over their hearts—leaving them unable to comprehend it—and deafness in their ears. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Quran, they turn their backs in aversion.

verses.text: We know best how they listen to your recitation and what they say privately—when the wrongdoers say, “You would only be following a bewitched man.”
verses.translation: We know best how they listen to your recitation and what they say privately—when the wrongdoers say, “You would only be following a bewitched man.”

verses.text: See how they call you names ˹O Prophet˺![524] So they have gone so ˹far˺ astray that they cannot find the ˹Right˺ Way. The Resurrection
verses.translation: See how they call you names ˹O Prophet˺![524] So they have gone so ˹far˺ astray that they cannot find the ˹Right˺ Way. The Resurrection

verses.text: And they say ˹mockingly˺, “When we are reduced to bones and ashes, will we really be raised as a new creation?”
verses.translation: And they say ˹mockingly˺, “When we are reduced to bones and ashes, will we really be raised as a new creation?”

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “˹Yes, even if˺ you become stones, or iron,
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “˹Yes, even if˺ you become stones, or iron,

verses.text: or whatever you think is harder to bring to life!” Then they will ask ˹you˺, “Who will bring us back ˹to life˺?” Say, “The One Who created you the first time.” They will then shake their heads at you and ask, “When will that be?” Say, “Perhaps it is soon!”
verses.translation: or whatever you think is harder to bring to life!” Then they will ask ˹you˺, “Who will bring us back ˹to life˺?” Say, “The One Who created you the first time.” They will then shake their heads at you and ask, “When will that be?” Say, “Perhaps it is soon!”

verses.text: On the Day He will call you, you will ˹instantly˺ respond by praising Him, [525] thinking you had remained ˹in the world˺ only for a little while. Advice to the Prophet
verses.translation: On the Day He will call you, you will ˹instantly˺ respond by praising Him, [525] thinking you had remained ˹in the world˺ only for a little while. Advice to the Prophet

verses.text: Tell My ˹believing˺ servants to say only what is best. Satan certainly seeks to sow discord among them. Satan is indeed a sworn enemy to humankind. Invitation to the Disbelievers
verses.translation: Tell My ˹believing˺ servants to say only what is best. Satan certainly seeks to sow discord among them. Satan is indeed a sworn enemy to humankind. Invitation to the Disbelievers

verses.text: Your Lord knows you best. He may have mercy on you if He wills, or punish you if He wills. We have not sent you ˹O Prophet˺ as a keeper over them.
verses.translation: Your Lord knows you best. He may have mercy on you if He wills, or punish you if He wills. We have not sent you ˹O Prophet˺ as a keeper over them.

verses.text: Your Lord knows best all those in the heavens and the earth. And We have surely favoured some prophets above others, and to David We gave the Psalms.[526] Other Gods Besides Allah?
verses.translation: Your Lord knows best all those in the heavens and the earth. And We have surely favoured some prophets above others, and to David We gave the Psalms.[526] Other Gods Besides Allah?

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Invoke those you claim ˹to be divine˺[527] besides Him—they do not have the power to undo harm from you or transfer it ˹to someone else˺.”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Invoke those you claim ˹to be divine˺[527] besides Him—they do not have the power to undo harm from you or transfer it ˹to someone else˺.”

verses.text: ˹Even˺ the closest ˹to Allah˺ of those invoked would be seeking a way to their Lord, hoping for His mercy, and fearing His punishment. Indeed, your Lord’s torment is fearsome. Signs Always Denied
verses.translation: ˹Even˺ the closest ˹to Allah˺ of those invoked would be seeking a way to their Lord, hoping for His mercy, and fearing His punishment. Indeed, your Lord’s torment is fearsome. Signs Always Denied

verses.text: There is not a ˹wicked˺ society that We will not destroy or punish with a severe torment before the Day of Judgment. That is written in the Record.
verses.translation: There is not a ˹wicked˺ society that We will not destroy or punish with a severe torment before the Day of Judgment. That is written in the Record.

verses.text: Nothing keeps Us from sending the ˹demanded˺ signs except that they had ˹already˺ been denied by earlier peoples. And We gave Thamûd the she- camel as a clear sign, but they wrongfully rejected it.[528] We only send the signs as a warning. Signs as a Test
verses.translation: Nothing keeps Us from sending the ˹demanded˺ signs except that they had ˹already˺ been denied by earlier peoples. And We gave Thamûd the she- camel as a clear sign, but they wrongfully rejected it.[528] We only send the signs as a warning. Signs as a Test

verses.text: And ˹remember, O Prophet˺ when We told you, “Certainly your Lord encompasses the people.” And We have made what We brought you to see[529] as well as the cursed tree ˹mentioned˺ in the Quran[530] only as a test for the people. We keep warning them, but it only increases them greatly in defiance. Satan’s Defiance
verses.translation: And ˹remember, O Prophet˺ when We told you, “Certainly your Lord encompasses the people.” And We have made what We brought you to see[529] as well as the cursed tree ˹mentioned˺ in the Quran[530] only as a test for the people. We keep warning them, but it only increases them greatly in defiance. Satan’s Defiance

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when We said to the angels, “Prostrate before Adam,” so they all did—but not Iblîs,[531] who protested, “Should I prostrate to the one You have created from mud?”
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when We said to the angels, “Prostrate before Adam,” so they all did—but not Iblîs,[531] who protested, “Should I prostrate to the one You have created from mud?”

verses.text: Adding, “Do you see this one you honoured above me? If you delay my end until the Day of Judgment, I will certainly take hold of his descendants, except for a few.”
verses.translation: Adding, “Do you see this one you honoured above me? If you delay my end until the Day of Judgment, I will certainly take hold of his descendants, except for a few.”

verses.text: Allah responded, “Be gone! Whoever of them follows you, Hell will surely be the reward for all of you—an ample reward.
verses.translation: Allah responded, “Be gone! Whoever of them follows you, Hell will surely be the reward for all of you—an ample reward.

verses.text: And incite whoever you can of them with your voice, mobilize against them all your cavalry and infantry, manipulate them in their wealth and children, and make them promises.” But Satan promises them nothing but delusion.
verses.translation: And incite whoever you can of them with your voice, mobilize against them all your cavalry and infantry, manipulate them in their wealth and children, and make them promises.” But Satan promises them nothing but delusion.

verses.text: ˹Allah added,˺ “You will truly have no authority over My ˹faithful˺ servants.” And sufficient is your Lord as a Guardian. Human Ingratitude
verses.translation: ˹Allah added,˺ “You will truly have no authority over My ˹faithful˺ servants.” And sufficient is your Lord as a Guardian. Human Ingratitude

verses.text: It is your Lord Who steers the ships for you through the sea, so that you may seek His bounty. Surely He is ever Merciful to you.
verses.translation: It is your Lord Who steers the ships for you through the sea, so that you may seek His bounty. Surely He is ever Merciful to you.

verses.text: When you are touched with hardship at sea, you ˹totally˺ forget all ˹the gods˺ you ˹normally˺ invoke, except Him. But when He delivers you ˹safely˺ to shore, you turn away. Humankind is ever ungrateful. False Immunity
verses.translation: When you are touched with hardship at sea, you ˹totally˺ forget all ˹the gods˺ you ˹normally˺ invoke, except Him. But when He delivers you ˹safely˺ to shore, you turn away. Humankind is ever ungrateful. False Immunity

verses.text: Do you feel secure that He will not cause the land to swallow you up, or unleash upon you a storm of stones? Then you will find none to protect you.
verses.translation: Do you feel secure that He will not cause the land to swallow you up, or unleash upon you a storm of stones? Then you will find none to protect you.

verses.text: Or do you feel secure that He will not send you back to sea once again, and send upon you a violent storm, drowning you for your denial? Then you will find none to avenge you against Us. Allah’s Favours to Humanity
verses.translation: Or do you feel secure that He will not send you back to sea once again, and send upon you a violent storm, drowning you for your denial? Then you will find none to avenge you against Us. Allah’s Favours to Humanity

verses.text: Indeed, We have dignified the children of Adam, carried them on land and sea, granted them good and lawful provisions, and privileged them far above many of Our creatures. The Record of Deeds
verses.translation: Indeed, We have dignified the children of Adam, carried them on land and sea, granted them good and lawful provisions, and privileged them far above many of Our creatures. The Record of Deeds

verses.text: ˹Beware of˺ the Day We will summon every people with their leader. [532] So whoever will be given their record in their right hand will read it ˹happily˺ and will not be wronged ˹even by the width of˺ the thread of a date stone.
verses.translation: ˹Beware of˺ the Day We will summon every people with their leader. [532] So whoever will be given their record in their right hand will read it ˹happily˺ and will not be wronged ˹even by the width of˺ the thread of a date stone.

verses.text: But whoever is blind ˹to the truth˺ in this ˹world˺ will be blind in the Hereafter, and ˹even˺ far more astray from the ˹Right˺ Way. Temptation by Meccan Pagans
verses.translation: But whoever is blind ˹to the truth˺ in this ˹world˺ will be blind in the Hereafter, and ˹even˺ far more astray from the ˹Right˺ Way. Temptation by Meccan Pagans

verses.text: They definitely ˹thought they˺ were about to lure you away from what We have revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺, hoping that you would attribute something else to Us falsely—and then they would have certainly taken you as a close friend.[533]
verses.translation: They definitely ˹thought they˺ were about to lure you away from what We have revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺, hoping that you would attribute something else to Us falsely—and then they would have certainly taken you as a close friend.[533]

verses.text: Had We not made you steadfast, you probably would have inclined to them a little,
verses.translation: Had We not made you steadfast, you probably would have inclined to them a little,

verses.text: and then We truly would have made you taste double ˹punishment˺ both in this life and after death, and you would have found no helper against Us.
verses.translation: and then We truly would have made you taste double ˹punishment˺ both in this life and after death, and you would have found no helper against Us.

verses.text: They were about to intimidate you to drive you out of the land ˹of Mecca˺, but then they would not have survived after you ˹had left˺ except for a little while.
verses.translation: They were about to intimidate you to drive you out of the land ˹of Mecca˺, but then they would not have survived after you ˹had left˺ except for a little while.

verses.text: ˹This has been˺ Our way with the messengers We sent before you. And you will never find any change in Our way. Advice to the Prophet
verses.translation: ˹This has been˺ Our way with the messengers We sent before you. And you will never find any change in Our way. Advice to the Prophet

verses.text: Observe the prayer from the decline of the sun until the darkness of the night and the dawn prayer, for certainly the dawn prayer is witnessed ˹by angels˺.[534]
verses.translation: Observe the prayer from the decline of the sun until the darkness of the night and the dawn prayer, for certainly the dawn prayer is witnessed ˹by angels˺.[534]

verses.text: And rise at ˹the last˺ part of the night, offering additional prayers, so your Lord may raise you to a station of praise.[535]
verses.translation: And rise at ˹the last˺ part of the night, offering additional prayers, so your Lord may raise you to a station of praise.[535]

verses.text: And say, “My Lord! Grant me an honourable entrance and an honourable exit[536] and give me a supporting authority from Yourself.”
verses.translation: And say, “My Lord! Grant me an honourable entrance and an honourable exit[536] and give me a supporting authority from Yourself.”

verses.text: And declare, “The truth has come and falsehood has vanished. Indeed, falsehood is bound to vanish.” The Quran as a Healing
verses.translation: And declare, “The truth has come and falsehood has vanished. Indeed, falsehood is bound to vanish.” The Quran as a Healing

verses.text: We send down the Quran as a healing and mercy for the believers, but it only increases the wrongdoers in loss. Arrogance and Ingratitude
verses.translation: We send down the Quran as a healing and mercy for the believers, but it only increases the wrongdoers in loss. Arrogance and Ingratitude

verses.text: When We grant people Our favours, they turn away, acting arrogantly. But when touched with evil, they lose all hope.
verses.translation: When We grant people Our favours, they turn away, acting arrogantly. But when touched with evil, they lose all hope.

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Everyone acts in their own way. But your Lord knows best whose way is rightly guided.” Question by Pagans
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Everyone acts in their own way. But your Lord knows best whose way is rightly guided.” Question by Pagans

verses.text: They ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about the spirit. Say, “Its nature is known only to my Lord, and you ˹O humanity˺ have been given but little knowledge.” The Quran as a Favour
verses.translation: They ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about the spirit. Say, “Its nature is known only to my Lord, and you ˹O humanity˺ have been given but little knowledge.” The Quran as a Favour

verses.text: If We willed, We could have certainly taken away what We have revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺—then you would find none to guarantee its return from Us—
verses.translation: If We willed, We could have certainly taken away what We have revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺—then you would find none to guarantee its return from Us—

verses.text: had it not been for the mercy of your Lord. Indeed, His favour upon you is immense. The Quran Challenge
verses.translation: had it not been for the mercy of your Lord. Indeed, His favour upon you is immense. The Quran Challenge

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “If ˹all˺ humans and jinn were to come together to produce the equivalent of this Quran, they could not produce its equal, no matter how they supported each other.” Meaningless Demands
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “If ˹all˺ humans and jinn were to come together to produce the equivalent of this Quran, they could not produce its equal, no matter how they supported each other.” Meaningless Demands

verses.text: And We have truly set forth every ˹kind of˺ lesson for humanity in this Quran, yet most people persist in disbelief.
verses.translation: And We have truly set forth every ˹kind of˺ lesson for humanity in this Quran, yet most people persist in disbelief.

verses.text: They challenge ˹the Prophet˺, “We will never believe in you until you cause a spring to gush forth from the earth for us,
verses.translation: They challenge ˹the Prophet˺, “We will never believe in you until you cause a spring to gush forth from the earth for us,

verses.text: or until you have a garden of palm trees and vineyards, and cause rivers to flow abundantly in it,
verses.translation: or until you have a garden of palm trees and vineyards, and cause rivers to flow abundantly in it,

verses.text: or cause the sky to fall upon us in pieces, as you have claimed, or bring Allah and the angels before us, face to face,
verses.translation: or cause the sky to fall upon us in pieces, as you have claimed, or bring Allah and the angels before us, face to face,

verses.text: or until you have a house of gold, or you ascend into heaven—and even then we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a book that we can read.” Say, “Glory be to my Lord! Am I not only a human messenger?” An Angelic Messenger?
verses.translation: or until you have a house of gold, or you ascend into heaven—and even then we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a book that we can read.” Say, “Glory be to my Lord! Am I not only a human messenger?” An Angelic Messenger?

verses.text: And nothing has prevented people from believing when guidance comes to them except their protest: “Has Allah sent a human as a messenger?”
verses.translation: And nothing has prevented people from believing when guidance comes to them except their protest: “Has Allah sent a human as a messenger?”

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Had there been angels walking the earth, well settled, We would have surely sent down for them an angel from heaven as a messenger.”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Had there been angels walking the earth, well settled, We would have surely sent down for them an angel from heaven as a messenger.”

verses.text: Say, “Sufficient is Allah as a Witness between me and you. He is certainly All-Knowing, All-Seeing of His servants.” Reward of the Wicked
verses.translation: Say, “Sufficient is Allah as a Witness between me and you. He is certainly All-Knowing, All-Seeing of His servants.” Reward of the Wicked

verses.text: Whoever Allah guides is truly guided. And whoever He leaves to stray, you will find no guardians for them besides Him. And We will drag them on their faces on the Day of Judgment—deaf, dumb, and blind. Hell will be their home. Whenever it dies down, We will flare it up for them.
verses.translation: Whoever Allah guides is truly guided. And whoever He leaves to stray, you will find no guardians for them besides Him. And We will drag them on their faces on the Day of Judgment—deaf, dumb, and blind. Hell will be their home. Whenever it dies down, We will flare it up for them.

verses.text: That is their reward for rejecting Our signs and asking ˹mockingly˺, “When we are reduced to bones and ashes, will we really be raised as a new creation?”
verses.translation: That is their reward for rejecting Our signs and asking ˹mockingly˺, “When we are reduced to bones and ashes, will we really be raised as a new creation?”

verses.text: Have they not realized that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth, can ˹easily˺ re-create them? He has ˹already˺ set for them a time, about which there is no doubt. But the wrongdoers persist in denial.
verses.translation: Have they not realized that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth, can ˹easily˺ re-create them? He has ˹already˺ set for them a time, about which there is no doubt. But the wrongdoers persist in denial.

verses.text: Say ˹to them, O Prophet˺, “Even if you were to possess the ˹infinite˺ treasuries of my Lord’s mercy, then you would certainly withhold ˹them˺, fearing they would run out—for humankind is ever stingy!” Pharaoh Challenges Moses
verses.translation: Say ˹to them, O Prophet˺, “Even if you were to possess the ˹infinite˺ treasuries of my Lord’s mercy, then you would certainly withhold ˹them˺, fearing they would run out—for humankind is ever stingy!” Pharaoh Challenges Moses

verses.text: We surely gave Moses nine clear signs.[537] ˹You, O Prophet, can˺ ask the Children of Israel. When Moses came to them, Pharaoh said to him, “I really think that you, O Moses, are bewitched.”
verses.translation: We surely gave Moses nine clear signs.[537] ˹You, O Prophet, can˺ ask the Children of Israel. When Moses came to them, Pharaoh said to him, “I really think that you, O Moses, are bewitched.”

verses.text: Moses replied, “You know well that none has sent these ˹signs˺ down except the Lord of the heavens and the earth as insights. And I really think that you, O Pharaoh, are doomed.”
verses.translation: Moses replied, “You know well that none has sent these ˹signs˺ down except the Lord of the heavens and the earth as insights. And I really think that you, O Pharaoh, are doomed.”

verses.text: So Pharaoh wanted to scare the Israelites out of the land ˹of Egypt˺, but We drowned him and all of those with him.
verses.translation: So Pharaoh wanted to scare the Israelites out of the land ˹of Egypt˺, but We drowned him and all of those with him.
