verses.text: And We said to the Children of Israel after Pharaoh, “Reside in the land, but when the promise of the Hereafter comes to pass,[538] We will bring you all together.” The Noble Quran
verses.translation: And We said to the Children of Israel after Pharaoh, “Reside in the land, but when the promise of the Hereafter comes to pass,[538] We will bring you all together.” The Noble Quran

verses.text: We have sent down the Quran in truth, and with the truth it has come down. We have sent you ˹O Prophet˺ only as a deliverer of good news and a warner.
verses.translation: We have sent down the Quran in truth, and with the truth it has come down. We have sent you ˹O Prophet˺ only as a deliverer of good news and a warner.

verses.text: ˹It is˺ a Quran We have revealed in stages so that you may recite it to people at a deliberate pace. And We have sent it down in successive revelations.
verses.translation: ˹It is˺ a Quran We have revealed in stages so that you may recite it to people at a deliberate pace. And We have sent it down in successive revelations.

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Believe in this ˹Quran˺, or do not. Indeed, when it is recited to those who were gifted with knowledge[539] before it ˹was revealed˺, they fall upon their faces in prostration,
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Believe in this ˹Quran˺, or do not. Indeed, when it is recited to those who were gifted with knowledge[539] before it ˹was revealed˺, they fall upon their faces in prostration,

verses.text: and say, ‘Glory be to our Lord! Surely the promise of our Lord has been fulfilled.’
verses.translation: and say, ‘Glory be to our Lord! Surely the promise of our Lord has been fulfilled.’

verses.text: And they fall down upon their faces weeping, and it increases them in humility.” Advice to the Prophet
verses.translation: And they fall down upon their faces weeping, and it increases them in humility.” Advice to the Prophet

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Call upon Allah or call upon the Most Compassionate—whichever you call, He has the Most Beautiful Names.” Do not recite your prayers too loudly or silently, but seek a way between.
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Call upon Allah or call upon the Most Compassionate—whichever you call, He has the Most Beautiful Names.” Do not recite your prayers too loudly or silently, but seek a way between.

verses.text: And say, “All praise is for Allah, Who has never had ˹any˺ offspring; [540] nor does He have a partner in ˹governing˺ the kingdom;[541] nor is He pathetic, needing a protector.[542] And revere Him immensely.” *** -- 256 of 694 --
verses.translation: And say, “All praise is for Allah, Who has never had ˹any˺ offspring; [540] nor does He have a partner in ˹governing˺ the kingdom;[541] nor is He pathetic, needing a protector.[542] And revere Him immensely.” *** -- 256 of 694 --

name: The Cave
intro: This Meccan sûrah takes its name from the story of the people of the cave in verses 9-26. According to Ibn ’Abbâs, the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) was asked about the youths who hid in a cave, a king who dominated large parts of the world, and about the spirit, so 18:9-26, 18:83-99, and 17:85 were revealed. The Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) says in an authentic narration collected by At- Tirmi ⱬi, “No one’s feet will move on Judgment Day until they are asked about four things: 1) What they did in their youth. 2) How they earned and spent their wealth. 3) What they did with their knowledge. 4) And how they spent their lives.” Interestingly, these four questions correspond to the four stories mentioned in this sûrah: 1) The story of the youths and the cave. 2) The story of the wealthy man with two gardens. 3) The story of Moses and the man of knowledge. 4) And finally the story of Ⱬul-Qarnain and his life and travels in the service of Allah. The four stories are interjected by warnings to the disbelievers and good news to the believers. Like the story of the people of the cave, some miraculous stories appear in the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Message of the Quran

verses.text: All praise is for Allah Who has revealed the Book to His servant,[543] allowing no crookedness in it,
verses.translation: All praise is for Allah Who has revealed the Book to His servant,[543] allowing no crookedness in it,

verses.text: ˹making it˺ perfectly upright, to warn ˹the disbelievers˺ of a severe torment from Him; to give good news to the believers—who do good—that they will have a fine reward,
verses.translation: ˹making it˺ perfectly upright, to warn ˹the disbelievers˺ of a severe torment from Him; to give good news to the believers—who do good—that they will have a fine reward,

verses.text: in which they will remain forever;
verses.translation: in which they will remain forever;

verses.text: and to warn those who claim, “Allah has offspring.”[544]
verses.translation: and to warn those who claim, “Allah has offspring.”[544]

verses.text: They have no knowledge of this, nor did their forefathers. What a terrible claim that comes out of their mouths! They say nothing but lies. Be Steadfast
verses.translation: They have no knowledge of this, nor did their forefathers. What a terrible claim that comes out of their mouths! They say nothing but lies. Be Steadfast

verses.text: Now, perhaps you ˹O Prophet˺ will grieve yourself to death over their denial, if they ˹continue to˺ disbelieve in this message.
verses.translation: Now, perhaps you ˹O Prophet˺ will grieve yourself to death over their denial, if they ˹continue to˺ disbelieve in this message.

verses.text: We have indeed made whatever is on earth as an adornment for it, in order to test which of them is best in deeds.
verses.translation: We have indeed made whatever is on earth as an adornment for it, in order to test which of them is best in deeds.

verses.text: And We will certainly reduce whatever is on it to barren ground. Story 1) The People of the Cave
verses.translation: And We will certainly reduce whatever is on it to barren ground. Story 1) The People of the Cave

verses.text: Have you ˹O Prophet˺ thought that the people of the cave and the plaque[545] were ˹the only˺ wonders of Our signs?
verses.translation: Have you ˹O Prophet˺ thought that the people of the cave and the plaque[545] were ˹the only˺ wonders of Our signs?

verses.text: ˹Remember˺ when those youths took refuge in the cave, and said, “Our Lord! Grant us mercy from Yourself and guide us rightly through our ordeal.”
verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when those youths took refuge in the cave, and said, “Our Lord! Grant us mercy from Yourself and guide us rightly through our ordeal.”

verses.text: So We caused them to fall into a dead sleep[546] in the cave for many years,
verses.translation: So We caused them to fall into a dead sleep[546] in the cave for many years,

verses.text: then We raised them so We may show which of the two groups would make a better estimation of the length of their stay.[547] Standing up for the Truth
verses.translation: then We raised them so We may show which of the two groups would make a better estimation of the length of their stay.[547] Standing up for the Truth

verses.text: We relate to you ˹O Prophet˺ their story in truth. They were youths who truly believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.
verses.translation: We relate to you ˹O Prophet˺ their story in truth. They were youths who truly believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.

verses.text: And We strengthened their hearts when they stood up and declared, “Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. We will never call upon any god besides Him, or we would truly be uttering an outrageous lie.”
verses.translation: And We strengthened their hearts when they stood up and declared, “Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. We will never call upon any god besides Him, or we would truly be uttering an outrageous lie.”

verses.text: ˹Then they said to one another,˺ “These people of ours have taken gods besides Him. Why do they not produce a clear proof of them? Who then does more wrong than those who fabricate lies against Allah?
verses.translation: ˹Then they said to one another,˺ “These people of ours have taken gods besides Him. Why do they not produce a clear proof of them? Who then does more wrong than those who fabricate lies against Allah?

verses.text: Since you have distanced yourselves from them and what they worship besides Allah, take refuge in the cave. Your Lord will extend His mercy to you and accommodate you in your ordeal.” In the Cave
verses.translation: Since you have distanced yourselves from them and what they worship besides Allah, take refuge in the cave. Your Lord will extend His mercy to you and accommodate you in your ordeal.” In the Cave

verses.text: And you would have seen the sun, as it rose, inclining away from their cave to the right, and as it set, declining away from them to the left, while they lay in its open space.[548] That is one of the signs of Allah. Whoever Allah guides is truly guided. But whoever He leaves to stray, you will never find for them a guiding mentor.
verses.translation: And you would have seen the sun, as it rose, inclining away from their cave to the right, and as it set, declining away from them to the left, while they lay in its open space.[548] That is one of the signs of Allah. Whoever Allah guides is truly guided. But whoever He leaves to stray, you will never find for them a guiding mentor.

verses.text: And you would have thought they were awake,[549] though they were asleep. We turned them over, to the right and left, while their dog stretched his forelegs at the entrance. Had you looked at them, you would have certainly fled away from them, filled with horror. The Youths Are Awakened
verses.translation: And you would have thought they were awake,[549] though they were asleep. We turned them over, to the right and left, while their dog stretched his forelegs at the entrance. Had you looked at them, you would have certainly fled away from them, filled with horror. The Youths Are Awakened

verses.text: And so We awakened them so that they might question one another. One of them exclaimed, “How long have you remained ˹asleep˺?” Some replied, “Perhaps a day, or part of a day.” They said ˹to one another˺, “Your Lord knows best how long you have remained. So send one of you with these silver coins of yours to the city, and let him find which food is the purest, and then bring you provisions from it. Let him be ˹exceptionally˺ cautious, and do not let him give you away.
verses.translation: And so We awakened them so that they might question one another. One of them exclaimed, “How long have you remained ˹asleep˺?” Some replied, “Perhaps a day, or part of a day.” They said ˹to one another˺, “Your Lord knows best how long you have remained. So send one of you with these silver coins of yours to the city, and let him find which food is the purest, and then bring you provisions from it. Let him be ˹exceptionally˺ cautious, and do not let him give you away.

verses.text: For, indeed, if they find out about you, they will stone you ˹to death˺, or force you back into their faith, and then you will never succeed.” The Hideout Is Found
verses.translation: For, indeed, if they find out about you, they will stone you ˹to death˺, or force you back into their faith, and then you will never succeed.” The Hideout Is Found

verses.text: That is how We caused them to be discovered so that their people might know that Allah’s promise ˹of resurrection˺ is true and that there is no doubt about the Hour.[550] When the people disputed with each other about the case of the youth ˹after their death˺,[551] some proposed, “Build a structure around them. Their Lord knows best about them.” Those who prevailed in the matter said, “We will surely build a place of worship over them.” How Many Were They?
verses.translation: That is how We caused them to be discovered so that their people might know that Allah’s promise ˹of resurrection˺ is true and that there is no doubt about the Hour.[550] When the people disputed with each other about the case of the youth ˹after their death˺,[551] some proposed, “Build a structure around them. Their Lord knows best about them.” Those who prevailed in the matter said, “We will surely build a place of worship over them.” How Many Were They?

verses.text: Some will say, “They were three, their dog was the fourth,” while others will say, “They were five, their dog was the sixth,” ˹only˺ guessing blindly. And others will say, “They were seven and their dog was the eighth.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “My Lord knows best their ˹exact˺ number. Only a few people know as well.” So do not argue about them except with sure knowledge, [552] nor consult any of those ˹who debate˺ about them. Say, “Allah Willing”
verses.translation: Some will say, “They were three, their dog was the fourth,” while others will say, “They were five, their dog was the sixth,” ˹only˺ guessing blindly. And others will say, “They were seven and their dog was the eighth.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “My Lord knows best their ˹exact˺ number. Only a few people know as well.” So do not argue about them except with sure knowledge, [552] nor consult any of those ˹who debate˺ about them. Say, “Allah Willing”

verses.text: And never say of anything, “I will definitely do this tomorrow,”
verses.translation: And never say of anything, “I will definitely do this tomorrow,”

verses.text: without adding, “if Allah so wills!” But if you forget, then remember your Lord, and say, “I trust my Lord will guide me to what is more right than this.” Time Spent in the Cave
verses.translation: without adding, “if Allah so wills!” But if you forget, then remember your Lord, and say, “I trust my Lord will guide me to what is more right than this.” Time Spent in the Cave

verses.text: They had remained in their cave for three hundred years, adding nine. [553]
verses.translation: They had remained in their cave for three hundred years, adding nine. [553]

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Allah knows best how long they stayed. With Him ˹alone˺ is ˹the knowledge of˺ the unseen of the heavens and the earth. How perfectly He hears and sees! They have no guardian besides Him, and He shares His command with none.” Advice to the Prophet
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Allah knows best how long they stayed. With Him ˹alone˺ is ˹the knowledge of˺ the unseen of the heavens and the earth. How perfectly He hears and sees! They have no guardian besides Him, and He shares His command with none.” Advice to the Prophet

verses.text: Recite what has been revealed to you from the Book of your Lord. None can change His Words, nor can you find any refuge besides Him.
verses.translation: Recite what has been revealed to you from the Book of your Lord. None can change His Words, nor can you find any refuge besides Him.

verses.text: And patiently stick with those who call upon their Lord morning and evening, seeking His pleasure.[554] Do not let your eyes look beyond them, desiring the luxuries of this worldly life. And do not obey those whose hearts We have made heedless of Our remembrance, who follow ˹only˺ their desires and whose state is ˹total˺ loss. Warning to the Disbelievers
verses.translation: And patiently stick with those who call upon their Lord morning and evening, seeking His pleasure.[554] Do not let your eyes look beyond them, desiring the luxuries of this worldly life. And do not obey those whose hearts We have made heedless of Our remembrance, who follow ˹only˺ their desires and whose state is ˹total˺ loss. Warning to the Disbelievers

verses.text: And say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “˹This is˺ the truth from your Lord. Whoever wills let them believe, and whoever wills let them disbelieve.” Surely We have prepared for the wrongdoers a Fire whose walls will ˹completely˺ surround them. When they cry for aid, they will be aided with water like molten metal, which will burn ˹their˺ faces. What a horrible drink! And what a terrible place to rest! Reward of the Believers
verses.translation: And say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “˹This is˺ the truth from your Lord. Whoever wills let them believe, and whoever wills let them disbelieve.” Surely We have prepared for the wrongdoers a Fire whose walls will ˹completely˺ surround them. When they cry for aid, they will be aided with water like molten metal, which will burn ˹their˺ faces. What a horrible drink! And what a terrible place to rest! Reward of the Believers

verses.text: As for those who believe and do good, We certainly never deny the reward of those who are best in deeds.
verses.translation: As for those who believe and do good, We certainly never deny the reward of those who are best in deeds.

verses.text: It is they who will have the Gardens of Eternity, with rivers flowing under their feet. There they will be adorned with bracelets of gold, and wear green garments of fine silk and rich brocade, reclining there on ˹canopied˺ couches. What a marvellous reward! And what a fabulous place to rest! Story 2) The Owner of the Two Gardens
verses.translation: It is they who will have the Gardens of Eternity, with rivers flowing under their feet. There they will be adorned with bracelets of gold, and wear green garments of fine silk and rich brocade, reclining there on ˹canopied˺ couches. What a marvellous reward! And what a fabulous place to rest! Story 2) The Owner of the Two Gardens

verses.text: Give them ˹O Prophet˺ an example of two men. To ˹the disbelieving˺ one We gave two gardens of grapevines, which We surrounded with palm trees and placed ˹various˺ crops in between.
verses.translation: Give them ˹O Prophet˺ an example of two men. To ˹the disbelieving˺ one We gave two gardens of grapevines, which We surrounded with palm trees and placed ˹various˺ crops in between.

verses.text: Each garden yielded ˹all˺ its produce, never falling short. And We caused a river to flow between them.
verses.translation: Each garden yielded ˹all˺ its produce, never falling short. And We caused a river to flow between them.

verses.text: And he had other resources[555] ˹as well˺. So he boasted to a ˹poor˺ companion of his, while conversing with him, “I am greater than you in wealth and superior in manpower.”
verses.translation: And he had other resources[555] ˹as well˺. So he boasted to a ˹poor˺ companion of his, while conversing with him, “I am greater than you in wealth and superior in manpower.”

verses.text: And he entered his property, while wronging his soul, saying, “I do not think this will ever perish,
verses.translation: And he entered his property, while wronging his soul, saying, “I do not think this will ever perish,

verses.text: nor do I think the Hour will ˹ever˺ come. And if in fact I am returned to my Lord, I will definitely get a far better outcome than ˹all˺ this.” The Rebuttal
verses.translation: nor do I think the Hour will ˹ever˺ come. And if in fact I am returned to my Lord, I will definitely get a far better outcome than ˹all˺ this.” The Rebuttal

verses.text: His ˹believing˺ companion replied, while conversing with him, “Do you disbelieve in the One Who created you from dust,[556] then ˹developed you˺ from a sperm-drop, then formed you into a man?
verses.translation: His ˹believing˺ companion replied, while conversing with him, “Do you disbelieve in the One Who created you from dust,[556] then ˹developed you˺ from a sperm-drop, then formed you into a man?

verses.text: But as for me: He is Allah, my Lord, and I will never associate anyone with my Lord ˹in worship˺.
verses.translation: But as for me: He is Allah, my Lord, and I will never associate anyone with my Lord ˹in worship˺.

verses.text: If only you had said, upon entering your property, ‘This is what Allah has willed! There is no power except with Allah!’ Even though you see me inferior to you in wealth and offspring,
verses.translation: If only you had said, upon entering your property, ‘This is what Allah has willed! There is no power except with Allah!’ Even though you see me inferior to you in wealth and offspring,

verses.text: perhaps my Lord will grant me ˹something˺ better than your garden, and send down upon your garden a thunderbolt from the sky, turning it into a barren waste.
verses.translation: perhaps my Lord will grant me ˹something˺ better than your garden, and send down upon your garden a thunderbolt from the sky, turning it into a barren waste.

verses.text: Or its water may sink ˹into the earth˺, and then you will never be able to seek it out.” The Punishment
verses.translation: Or its water may sink ˹into the earth˺, and then you will never be able to seek it out.” The Punishment

verses.text: And so all his produce was ˹totally˺ ruined, so he started to wring his hands for all he had spent on it, while it had collapsed on its trellises. He cried, “Alas! I wish I had never associated anyone with my Lord ˹in worship˺!”
verses.translation: And so all his produce was ˹totally˺ ruined, so he started to wring his hands for all he had spent on it, while it had collapsed on its trellises. He cried, “Alas! I wish I had never associated anyone with my Lord ˹in worship˺!”

verses.text: And he had no manpower to help him against Allah, nor could he ˹even˺ help himself.
verses.translation: And he had no manpower to help him against Allah, nor could he ˹even˺ help himself.

verses.text: At this time, support comes ˹only˺ from Allah—the True ˹Lord˺. He is best in reward and best in outcome. Fleeting and Everlasting Gains
verses.translation: At this time, support comes ˹only˺ from Allah—the True ˹Lord˺. He is best in reward and best in outcome. Fleeting and Everlasting Gains

verses.text: And give them a parable of this worldly life. ˹It is˺ like the plants of the earth, thriving when sustained by the rain We send down from the sky. Then they ˹soon˺ turn into chaff scattered by the wind. And Allah is fully capable of ˹doing˺ all things.
verses.translation: And give them a parable of this worldly life. ˹It is˺ like the plants of the earth, thriving when sustained by the rain We send down from the sky. Then they ˹soon˺ turn into chaff scattered by the wind. And Allah is fully capable of ˹doing˺ all things.

verses.text: Wealth and children are the adornment of this worldly life, but the everlasting good deeds are far better with your Lord in reward and in hope.[557] Judgment Day
verses.translation: Wealth and children are the adornment of this worldly life, but the everlasting good deeds are far better with your Lord in reward and in hope.[557] Judgment Day

verses.text: ˹Beware of˺ the Day We will blow the mountains away, and you will see the earth laid bare. And We will gather all ˹humankind˺, leaving none behind.
verses.translation: ˹Beware of˺ the Day We will blow the mountains away, and you will see the earth laid bare. And We will gather all ˹humankind˺, leaving none behind.

verses.text: They will be presented before your Lord in rows, ˹and the deniers will be told,˺ “You have surely returned to Us ˹all alone˺ as We created you the first time, although you ˹always˺ claimed that We would never appoint a time for your return.”
verses.translation: They will be presented before your Lord in rows, ˹and the deniers will be told,˺ “You have surely returned to Us ˹all alone˺ as We created you the first time, although you ˹always˺ claimed that We would never appoint a time for your return.”

verses.text: And the record ˹of deeds˺ will be laid ˹open˺, and you will see the wicked in fear of what is ˹written˺ in it. They will cry, “Woe to us! What kind of record is this that does not leave any sin, small or large, unlisted?” They will find whatever they did present ˹before them˺. And your Lord will never wrong anyone. Satan and His Followers
verses.translation: And the record ˹of deeds˺ will be laid ˹open˺, and you will see the wicked in fear of what is ˹written˺ in it. They will cry, “Woe to us! What kind of record is this that does not leave any sin, small or large, unlisted?” They will find whatever they did present ˹before them˺. And your Lord will never wrong anyone. Satan and His Followers

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when We said to the angels, “Prostrate before Adam,” so they all did—but not Iblîs,[558] who was one of the jinn, but he rebelled against the command of his Lord. Would you then take him and his descendants as patrons instead of Me, although they are your enemy? What an evil alternative for the wrongdoers ˹to choose˺!
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when We said to the angels, “Prostrate before Adam,” so they all did—but not Iblîs,[558] who was one of the jinn, but he rebelled against the command of his Lord. Would you then take him and his descendants as patrons instead of Me, although they are your enemy? What an evil alternative for the wrongdoers ˹to choose˺!

verses.text: I never called them to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth or ˹even˺ their own creation, nor would I take the misleaders as helpers.
verses.translation: I never called them to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth or ˹even˺ their own creation, nor would I take the misleaders as helpers.

verses.text: And ˹beware of˺ the Day He will say, “Call upon those you claimed were My associate-gods.” So they will call them, but will receive no response. And We will make them ˹all˺ share in the same doom.
verses.translation: And ˹beware of˺ the Day He will say, “Call upon those you claimed were My associate-gods.” So they will call them, but will receive no response. And We will make them ˹all˺ share in the same doom.

verses.text: The wicked will see the Fire and realize that they are bound to fall into it, and will find no way to avoid it. Denying the Quran
verses.translation: The wicked will see the Fire and realize that they are bound to fall into it, and will find no way to avoid it. Denying the Quran

verses.text: We have surely set forth in this Quran every ˹kind of˺ lesson for people, but humankind is the most argumentative of all beings.
verses.translation: We have surely set forth in this Quran every ˹kind of˺ lesson for people, but humankind is the most argumentative of all beings.

verses.text: And nothing prevents people from believing when guidance comes to them and from seeking their Lord’s forgiveness except ˹their demand˺ to meet the same fate of earlier deniers or that the torment would confront them face to face.
verses.translation: And nothing prevents people from believing when guidance comes to them and from seeking their Lord’s forgiveness except ˹their demand˺ to meet the same fate of earlier deniers or that the torment would confront them face to face.

verses.text: We do not send the messengers except as deliverers of good news and warners. But the disbelievers argue in falsehood, ˹hoping˺ to discredit the truth with it, and make a mockery of My revelations and warnings.
verses.translation: We do not send the messengers except as deliverers of good news and warners. But the disbelievers argue in falsehood, ˹hoping˺ to discredit the truth with it, and make a mockery of My revelations and warnings.

verses.text: And who does more wrong than those who, when reminded of their Lord’s revelations, turn away from them and forget what their own hands have done? We have certainly cast veils over their hearts—leaving them unable to comprehend this ˹Quran˺—and deafness in their ears. And if you ˹O Prophet˺ invite them to ˹true˺ guidance, they will never be ˹rightly˺ guided. Allah’s Forbearance
verses.translation: And who does more wrong than those who, when reminded of their Lord’s revelations, turn away from them and forget what their own hands have done? We have certainly cast veils over their hearts—leaving them unable to comprehend this ˹Quran˺—and deafness in their ears. And if you ˹O Prophet˺ invite them to ˹true˺ guidance, they will never be ˹rightly˺ guided. Allah’s Forbearance

verses.text: Your Lord is the All-Forgiving, Full of Mercy. If He were to seize them ˹immediately˺ for what they commit, He would have certainly hastened their punishment. But they have an appointed time, from which they will find no refuge.
verses.translation: Your Lord is the All-Forgiving, Full of Mercy. If He were to seize them ˹immediately˺ for what they commit, He would have certainly hastened their punishment. But they have an appointed time, from which they will find no refuge.

verses.text: Those ˹are the˺ societies We destroyed when they persisted in wrong,[559] and We had set a time for their destruction. Story 3) Moses and Al-Kha ḍir
verses.translation: Those ˹are the˺ societies We destroyed when they persisted in wrong,[559] and We had set a time for their destruction. Story 3) Moses and Al-Kha ḍir

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when Moses said to his young assistant, “I will never give up until I reach the junction of the two seas, even if I travel for ages.”[560]
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when Moses said to his young assistant, “I will never give up until I reach the junction of the two seas, even if I travel for ages.”[560]

verses.text: But when they ˹finally˺ reached the point where the seas met, they forgot their ˹salted˺ fish, and it made its way into the sea, slipping away ˹wondrously˺.
verses.translation: But when they ˹finally˺ reached the point where the seas met, they forgot their ˹salted˺ fish, and it made its way into the sea, slipping away ˹wondrously˺.

verses.text: When they had passed further, he said to his assistant, “Bring us our meal! We have certainly been exhausted by today’s journey.”
verses.translation: When they had passed further, he said to his assistant, “Bring us our meal! We have certainly been exhausted by today’s journey.”

verses.text: He replied, “Do you remember when we rested by the rock? ˹That is when˺ I forgot the fish. None made me forget to mention this except Satan. And the fish made its way into the sea miraculously.”[561]
verses.translation: He replied, “Do you remember when we rested by the rock? ˹That is when˺ I forgot the fish. None made me forget to mention this except Satan. And the fish made its way into the sea miraculously.”[561]

verses.text: Moses responded, “That is ˹exactly˺ what we were looking for.”[562] So they returned, retracing their footsteps. The Encounter
verses.translation: Moses responded, “That is ˹exactly˺ what we were looking for.”[562] So they returned, retracing their footsteps. The Encounter

verses.text: There they found a servant of Ours, to whom We had granted mercy from Us and enlightened with knowledge of Our Own.
verses.translation: There they found a servant of Ours, to whom We had granted mercy from Us and enlightened with knowledge of Our Own.

verses.text: Moses said to him, “May I follow you, provided that you teach me some of the right guidance you have been taught?”
verses.translation: Moses said to him, “May I follow you, provided that you teach me some of the right guidance you have been taught?”

verses.text: He said, “You certainly cannot be patient ˹enough˺ with me.
verses.translation: He said, “You certainly cannot be patient ˹enough˺ with me.

verses.text: And how can you be patient with what is beyond your ˹realm of˺ knowledge?”
verses.translation: And how can you be patient with what is beyond your ˹realm of˺ knowledge?”

verses.text: Moses assured ˹him˺, “You will find me patient, Allah willing, and I will not disobey any of your orders.”
verses.translation: Moses assured ˹him˺, “You will find me patient, Allah willing, and I will not disobey any of your orders.”

verses.text: He responded, “Then if you follow me, do not question me about anything until I ˹myself˺ clarify it for you.” The Ship Incident
verses.translation: He responded, “Then if you follow me, do not question me about anything until I ˹myself˺ clarify it for you.” The Ship Incident

verses.text: So they set out, but after they had boarded a ship, the man made a hole in it. Moses protested, “Have you done this to drown its people? You have certainly done a terrible thing!”
verses.translation: So they set out, but after they had boarded a ship, the man made a hole in it. Moses protested, “Have you done this to drown its people? You have certainly done a terrible thing!”

verses.text: He replied, “Did I not say that you cannot have patience with me?”
verses.translation: He replied, “Did I not say that you cannot have patience with me?”

verses.text: Moses pleaded, “Excuse me for forgetting, and do not be hard on me.” The Boy Incident
verses.translation: Moses pleaded, “Excuse me for forgetting, and do not be hard on me.” The Boy Incident

verses.text: So they proceeded until they came across a boy, and the man killed him. Moses protested, “Have you killed an innocent soul, who killed no one? You have certainly done a horrible thing.”
verses.translation: So they proceeded until they came across a boy, and the man killed him. Moses protested, “Have you killed an innocent soul, who killed no one? You have certainly done a horrible thing.”

verses.text: He answered, “Did I not tell you that you cannot have patience with me?”
verses.translation: He answered, “Did I not tell you that you cannot have patience with me?”

verses.text: Moses replied, “If I ever question you about anything after this, then do not keep me in your company, for by then I would have given you enough of an excuse.” The Wall Incident
verses.translation: Moses replied, “If I ever question you about anything after this, then do not keep me in your company, for by then I would have given you enough of an excuse.” The Wall Incident

verses.text: So they moved on until they came to the people of a town. They asked them for food, but the people refused to give them hospitality. There they found a wall ready to collapse, so the man set it right. Moses protested, “If you wanted, you could have demanded a fee for this.”
verses.translation: So they moved on until they came to the people of a town. They asked them for food, but the people refused to give them hospitality. There they found a wall ready to collapse, so the man set it right. Moses protested, “If you wanted, you could have demanded a fee for this.”

verses.text: He replied, “This is the parting of our ways. I will explain to you what you could not bear patiently. The Ship
verses.translation: He replied, “This is the parting of our ways. I will explain to you what you could not bear patiently. The Ship

verses.text: “As for the ship, it belonged to some poor people, working at sea. So I intended to damage it, for there was a ˹tyrant˺ king ahead of them who seizes every ˹good˺ ship by force. The Boy
verses.translation: “As for the ship, it belonged to some poor people, working at sea. So I intended to damage it, for there was a ˹tyrant˺ king ahead of them who seizes every ˹good˺ ship by force. The Boy

verses.text: “And as for the boy, his parents were ˹true˺ believers, and we[563] feared that he would pressure them into defiance and disbelief.
verses.translation: “And as for the boy, his parents were ˹true˺ believers, and we[563] feared that he would pressure them into defiance and disbelief.

verses.text: So we hoped that their Lord would give them another, more virtuous and caring in his place. The Wall
verses.translation: So we hoped that their Lord would give them another, more virtuous and caring in his place. The Wall

verses.text: “And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and under the wall was a treasure that belonged to them, and their father had been a righteous man. So your Lord willed that these children should come of age and retrieve their treasure, as a mercy from your Lord. I did not do it ˹all˺ on my own. This is the explanation of what you could not bear patiently.”[564] Story 4) Ⱬul-Qarnain
verses.translation: “And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and under the wall was a treasure that belonged to them, and their father had been a righteous man. So your Lord willed that these children should come of age and retrieve their treasure, as a mercy from your Lord. I did not do it ˹all˺ on my own. This is the explanation of what you could not bear patiently.”[564] Story 4) Ⱬul-Qarnain

verses.text: They ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about Ⱬul-Qarnain. Say, “I will relate to you something of his narrative.”[ 5 6 5 ]
verses.translation: They ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about Ⱬul-Qarnain. Say, “I will relate to you something of his narrative.”[ 5 6 5 ]

verses.text: Surely We established him in the land, and gave him the means to all things. Journey to the West
verses.translation: Surely We established him in the land, and gave him the means to all things. Journey to the West

verses.text: So he travelled a course,
verses.translation: So he travelled a course,

verses.text: until he reached the setting ˹point˺ of the sun, which appeared to him to be setting in a spring of murky water, where he found some people. We said, “O Ⱬul-Qarnain! Either punish them or treat them kindly.”
verses.translation: until he reached the setting ˹point˺ of the sun, which appeared to him to be setting in a spring of murky water, where he found some people. We said, “O Ⱬul-Qarnain! Either punish them or treat them kindly.”

verses.text: He responded, “Whoever does wrong will be punished by us, then will be returned to their Lord, Who will punish them with a horrible torment.
verses.translation: He responded, “Whoever does wrong will be punished by us, then will be returned to their Lord, Who will punish them with a horrible torment.

verses.text: As for those who believe and do good, they will have the finest reward, and we will assign them easy commands.” Journey to the East
verses.translation: As for those who believe and do good, they will have the finest reward, and we will assign them easy commands.” Journey to the East

verses.text: Then he travelled a ˹different˺ course
verses.translation: Then he travelled a ˹different˺ course

verses.text: until he reached the rising ˹point˺ of the sun. He found it rising on a people for whom We had provided no shelter from it.[566]
verses.translation: until he reached the rising ˹point˺ of the sun. He found it rising on a people for whom We had provided no shelter from it.[566]

verses.text: So it was. And We truly had full knowledge of him. Another Journey
verses.translation: So it was. And We truly had full knowledge of him. Another Journey

verses.text: Then he travelled a ˹third˺ course
verses.translation: Then he travelled a ˹third˺ course

verses.text: until he reached ˹a pass˺ between two mountains. He found in front of them a people who could hardly understand ˹his˺ language.
verses.translation: until he reached ˹a pass˺ between two mountains. He found in front of them a people who could hardly understand ˹his˺ language.

verses.text: They pleaded, “O Ⱬul-Qarnain! Surely Gog and Magog[567] are spreading corruption throughout the land. Should we pay you tribute, provided that you build a wall between us and them?”
verses.translation: They pleaded, “O Ⱬul-Qarnain! Surely Gog and Magog[567] are spreading corruption throughout the land. Should we pay you tribute, provided that you build a wall between us and them?”

verses.text: He responded, “What my Lord has provided for me is far better. But assist me with resources, and I will build a barrier between you and them.
verses.translation: He responded, “What my Lord has provided for me is far better. But assist me with resources, and I will build a barrier between you and them.

verses.text: Bring me blocks of iron!” Then, when he had filled up ˹the gap˺ between the two mountains, he ordered, “Blow!” When the iron became red hot, he said, “Bring me molten copper to pour over it.”
verses.translation: Bring me blocks of iron!” Then, when he had filled up ˹the gap˺ between the two mountains, he ordered, “Blow!” When the iron became red hot, he said, “Bring me molten copper to pour over it.”

verses.text: And so the enemies could neither scale nor tunnel through it.
verses.translation: And so the enemies could neither scale nor tunnel through it.

verses.text: He declared, “This is a mercy from my Lord. But when the promise of my Lord comes to pass, He will level it to the ground. And my Lord’s promise is ever true.”
verses.translation: He declared, “This is a mercy from my Lord. But when the promise of my Lord comes to pass, He will level it to the ground. And my Lord’s promise is ever true.”

verses.text: On that Day, We will let them[568] surge ˹like waves˺ over one another. Later, the Trumpet will be blown,[569] and We will gather all ˹people˺ together. The Wicked on Judgment Day
verses.translation: On that Day, We will let them[568] surge ˹like waves˺ over one another. Later, the Trumpet will be blown,[569] and We will gather all ˹people˺ together. The Wicked on Judgment Day

verses.text: On that Day We will display Hell clearly for the disbelievers,
verses.translation: On that Day We will display Hell clearly for the disbelievers,

verses.text: those who turned a blind eye to My Reminder[570] and could not stand listening ˹to it˺.
verses.translation: those who turned a blind eye to My Reminder[570] and could not stand listening ˹to it˺.

verses.text: Do the disbelievers think they can ˹simply˺ take My servants[571] as lords instead of Me? We have surely prepared Hell as an accommodation for the disbelievers. The Losers
verses.translation: Do the disbelievers think they can ˹simply˺ take My servants[571] as lords instead of Me? We have surely prepared Hell as an accommodation for the disbelievers. The Losers

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Shall we inform you of who will lose the most deeds?
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Shall we inform you of who will lose the most deeds?

verses.text: ˹They are˺ those whose efforts are in vain in this worldly life, while they think they are doing good!”
verses.translation: ˹They are˺ those whose efforts are in vain in this worldly life, while they think they are doing good!”

verses.text: It is they who reject the signs of their Lord and their meeting with Him, rendering their deeds void, so We will not give their deeds any weight on Judgment Day.
verses.translation: It is they who reject the signs of their Lord and their meeting with Him, rendering their deeds void, so We will not give their deeds any weight on Judgment Day.

verses.text: That is their reward: Hell, for their disbelief and mockery of My signs and messengers. The Winners
verses.translation: That is their reward: Hell, for their disbelief and mockery of My signs and messengers. The Winners

verses.text: Indeed, those who believe and do good will have the Gardens of Paradise[572] as an accommodation,
verses.translation: Indeed, those who believe and do good will have the Gardens of Paradise[572] as an accommodation,

verses.text: where they will be forever, never desiring anywhere else. Recording Allah’s Knowledge
verses.translation: where they will be forever, never desiring anywhere else. Recording Allah’s Knowledge

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “If the ocean were ink for ˹writing˺ the Words of my Lord, it would certainly run out before the Words of my Lord were finished, even if We refilled it with its equal.” Have Faith and Do Good
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “If the ocean were ink for ˹writing˺ the Words of my Lord, it would certainly run out before the Words of my Lord were finished, even if We refilled it with its equal.” Have Faith and Do Good

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I am only a man like you, ˹but˺ it has been revealed to me that your God is only One God. So whoever hopes for the meeting with their Lord, let them do good deeds and associate none in the worship of their Lord.” *** -- 266 of 694 --
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I am only a man like you, ˹but˺ it has been revealed to me that your God is only One God. So whoever hopes for the meeting with their Lord, let them do good deeds and associate none in the worship of their Lord.” *** -- 266 of 694 --

name: Mary
intro: This Meccan sûrah recounts the miraculous stories of the birth of Jesus by the virgin Mary (after whom the sûrah is named) and the birth of John the Baptist to old Zachariah and his elderly, barren wife. Other prophets are cited as recipients of Allah’s favour and grace. Attributing children to Allah (verses 88-95) and denial of resurrection (verses 66-70) are rejected as outrageous and blasphemous. Both the end of this sûrah and the beginning of the next one talk about the purpose of revealing the Quran. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Zachariah’s Prayer

verses.text: Kãf-Ha-Ya-’Aĩn- Ṣãd.
verses.translation: Kãf-Ha-Ya-’Aĩn- Ṣãd.

verses.text: ˹This is˺ a reminder of your Lord’s mercy to His servant Zachariah,
verses.translation: ˹This is˺ a reminder of your Lord’s mercy to His servant Zachariah,

verses.text: when he cried out to his Lord privately,
verses.translation: when he cried out to his Lord privately,

verses.text: saying, “My Lord! Surely my bones have become brittle, and grey hair has spread across my head, but I have never been disappointed in my prayer to You, my Lord!
verses.translation: saying, “My Lord! Surely my bones have become brittle, and grey hair has spread across my head, but I have never been disappointed in my prayer to You, my Lord!

verses.text: And I am concerned about ˹the faith of˺ my relatives after me, since my wife is barren. So grant me, by Your grace, an heir,
verses.translation: And I am concerned about ˹the faith of˺ my relatives after me, since my wife is barren. So grant me, by Your grace, an heir,

verses.text: who will inherit ˹prophethood˺ from me and the family of Jacob, and make him, O Lord, pleasing ˹to You˺!” Prayer Answered
verses.translation: who will inherit ˹prophethood˺ from me and the family of Jacob, and make him, O Lord, pleasing ˹to You˺!” Prayer Answered

verses.text: ˹The angels announced,˺ “O Zachariah! Indeed, We give you the good news of ˹the birth of˺ a son, whose name will be John—a name We have not given to anyone before.”
verses.translation: ˹The angels announced,˺ “O Zachariah! Indeed, We give you the good news of ˹the birth of˺ a son, whose name will be John—a name We have not given to anyone before.”

verses.text: He wondered, “My Lord! How can I have a son when my wife is barren, and I have become extremely old?”
verses.translation: He wondered, “My Lord! How can I have a son when my wife is barren, and I have become extremely old?”

verses.text: An angel replied, “So will it be! Your Lord says, ‘It is easy for Me, just as I created you before, when you were nothing!’”
verses.translation: An angel replied, “So will it be! Your Lord says, ‘It is easy for Me, just as I created you before, when you were nothing!’”

verses.text: Zachariah said, “My Lord! Grant me a sign.” He responded, “Your sign is that you will not ˹be able to˺ speak to people for three nights, despite being healthy.”
verses.translation: Zachariah said, “My Lord! Grant me a sign.” He responded, “Your sign is that you will not ˹be able to˺ speak to people for three nights, despite being healthy.”

verses.text: So he came out to his people from the sanctuary, signalling to them to glorify ˹Allah˺ morning and evening. John’s Noble Qualities
verses.translation: So he came out to his people from the sanctuary, signalling to them to glorify ˹Allah˺ morning and evening. John’s Noble Qualities

verses.text: ˹It was later said,˺ “O John! Hold firmly to the Scriptures.” And We granted him wisdom while ˹he was still˺ a child,
verses.translation: ˹It was later said,˺ “O John! Hold firmly to the Scriptures.” And We granted him wisdom while ˹he was still˺ a child,

verses.text: as well as purity and compassion from Us. And he was God-fearing,
verses.translation: as well as purity and compassion from Us. And he was God-fearing,

verses.text: and kind to his parents. He was neither arrogant nor disobedient.
verses.translation: and kind to his parents. He was neither arrogant nor disobedient.

verses.text: Peace be upon him the day he was born, and the day of his death, and the day he will be raised back to life! Gabriel Visits Mary
verses.translation: Peace be upon him the day he was born, and the day of his death, and the day he will be raised back to life! Gabriel Visits Mary

verses.text: And mention in the Book ˹O Prophet, the story of˺ Mary when she withdrew from her family to a place in the east,
verses.translation: And mention in the Book ˹O Prophet, the story of˺ Mary when she withdrew from her family to a place in the east,

verses.text: screening herself off from them. Then We sent to her Our angel, ˹Gabriel,˺ appearing before her as a man, perfectly formed.
verses.translation: screening herself off from them. Then We sent to her Our angel, ˹Gabriel,˺ appearing before her as a man, perfectly formed.

verses.text: She appealed, “I truly seek refuge in the Most Compassionate from you! ˹So leave me alone˺ if you are God- fearing.”
verses.translation: She appealed, “I truly seek refuge in the Most Compassionate from you! ˹So leave me alone˺ if you are God- fearing.”

verses.text: He responded, “I am only a messenger from your Lord, ˹sent˺ to bless you with a pure son.”
verses.translation: He responded, “I am only a messenger from your Lord, ˹sent˺ to bless you with a pure son.”

verses.text: She wondered, “How can I have a son when no man has ever touched me, nor am I unchaste?”
verses.translation: She wondered, “How can I have a son when no man has ever touched me, nor am I unchaste?”

verses.text: He replied, “So will it be! Your Lord says, ‘It is easy for Me. And so will We make him a sign for humanity and a mercy from Us.’ It is a matter ˹already˺ decreed.” Jesus’ Virgin Birth
verses.translation: He replied, “So will it be! Your Lord says, ‘It is easy for Me. And so will We make him a sign for humanity and a mercy from Us.’ It is a matter ˹already˺ decreed.” Jesus’ Virgin Birth

verses.text: So she conceived him and withdrew with him to a remote place.
verses.translation: So she conceived him and withdrew with him to a remote place.

verses.text: Then the pains of labour drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She cried, “Alas! I wish I had died before this, and was a thing long forgotten!”
verses.translation: Then the pains of labour drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She cried, “Alas! I wish I had died before this, and was a thing long forgotten!”

verses.text: So a voice[573] reassured her from below her, “Do not grieve! Your Lord has provided a stream at your feet.
verses.translation: So a voice[573] reassured her from below her, “Do not grieve! Your Lord has provided a stream at your feet.

verses.text: And shake the trunk of this palm tree towards you, it will drop fresh, ripe dates upon you.
verses.translation: And shake the trunk of this palm tree towards you, it will drop fresh, ripe dates upon you.

verses.text: So eat and drink, and put your heart at ease. But if you see any of the people, say, ‘I have vowed silence[574] to the Most Compassionate, so I am not talking to anyone today.’” Reaction to Baby Jesus
verses.translation: So eat and drink, and put your heart at ease. But if you see any of the people, say, ‘I have vowed silence[574] to the Most Compassionate, so I am not talking to anyone today.’” Reaction to Baby Jesus

verses.text: Then she returned to her people, carrying him. They said ˹in shock˺, “O Mary! You have certainly done a horrible thing!
verses.translation: Then she returned to her people, carrying him. They said ˹in shock˺, “O Mary! You have certainly done a horrible thing!

verses.text: O sister of Aaron![575] Your father was not an indecent man, nor was your mother unchaste.”
verses.translation: O sister of Aaron![575] Your father was not an indecent man, nor was your mother unchaste.”

verses.text: So she pointed to the baby. They exclaimed, “How can we talk to someone who is an infant in the cradle?” Baby Jesus Talks
verses.translation: So she pointed to the baby. They exclaimed, “How can we talk to someone who is an infant in the cradle?” Baby Jesus Talks

verses.text: Jesus declared, “I am truly a servant of Allah. He has destined me to be given the Scripture and to be a prophet.
verses.translation: Jesus declared, “I am truly a servant of Allah. He has destined me to be given the Scripture and to be a prophet.

verses.text: He has made me a blessing wherever I go, and bid me to establish prayer and give alms-tax as long as I live,
verses.translation: He has made me a blessing wherever I go, and bid me to establish prayer and give alms-tax as long as I live,

verses.text: and to be kind to my mother. He has not made me arrogant or defiant.
verses.translation: and to be kind to my mother. He has not made me arrogant or defiant.

verses.text: Peace be upon me the day I was born, the day I die, and the day I will be raised back to life!” Christians and Jews Differ on Jesus
verses.translation: Peace be upon me the day I was born, the day I die, and the day I will be raised back to life!” Christians and Jews Differ on Jesus

verses.text: That is Jesus, son of Mary. ˹And this is˺ a word of truth, about which they dispute.
verses.translation: That is Jesus, son of Mary. ˹And this is˺ a word of truth, about which they dispute.

verses.text: It is not for Allah to take a son! Glory be to Him. When He decrees a matter, He simply tells it, “Be!” And it is!
verses.translation: It is not for Allah to take a son! Glory be to Him. When He decrees a matter, He simply tells it, “Be!” And it is!

verses.text: ˹Jesus also declared,˺ “Surely Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him ˹alone˺. This is the Straight Path.”
verses.translation: ˹Jesus also declared,˺ “Surely Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him ˹alone˺. This is the Straight Path.”

verses.text: Yet their ˹various˺ groups have differed among themselves ˹about him˺, so woe to the disbelievers when they face a tremendous Day!
verses.translation: Yet their ˹various˺ groups have differed among themselves ˹about him˺, so woe to the disbelievers when they face a tremendous Day!

verses.text: How clearly will they hear and see on the Day they will come to Us! But today the wrongdoers are clearly astray. Warning to the Disbelievers
verses.translation: How clearly will they hear and see on the Day they will come to Us! But today the wrongdoers are clearly astray. Warning to the Disbelievers

verses.text: And warn them ˹O Prophet˺ of the Day of Regret, when all matters will be settled, while they are ˹engrossed˺ in heedlessness and disbelief.
verses.translation: And warn them ˹O Prophet˺ of the Day of Regret, when all matters will be settled, while they are ˹engrossed˺ in heedlessness and disbelief.

verses.text: Indeed, it is We Who will succeed the earth and whoever is on it. And to Us they will ˹all˺ be returned. Abraham and His Father, Ȃzar
verses.translation: Indeed, it is We Who will succeed the earth and whoever is on it. And to Us they will ˹all˺ be returned. Abraham and His Father, Ȃzar

verses.text: And mention in the Book ˹O Prophet, the story of˺ Abraham. He was surely a man of truth and a prophet.
verses.translation: And mention in the Book ˹O Prophet, the story of˺ Abraham. He was surely a man of truth and a prophet.

verses.text: ˹Remember˺ when he said to his father, “O dear father! Why do you worship what can neither hear nor see, nor benefit you at all?
verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when he said to his father, “O dear father! Why do you worship what can neither hear nor see, nor benefit you at all?

verses.text: O dear father! I have certainly received some knowledge which you have not received, so follow me and I will guide you to the Straight Path.
verses.translation: O dear father! I have certainly received some knowledge which you have not received, so follow me and I will guide you to the Straight Path.

verses.text: O dear father! Do not worship Satan. Surely Satan is ever rebellious against the Most Compassionate.
verses.translation: O dear father! Do not worship Satan. Surely Satan is ever rebellious against the Most Compassionate.

verses.text: O dear father! I truly fear that you will be touched by a torment from the Most Compassionate, and become Satan’s companion ˹in Hell˺.” Ȃzar’s Angry Response
verses.translation: O dear father! I truly fear that you will be touched by a torment from the Most Compassionate, and become Satan’s companion ˹in Hell˺.” Ȃzar’s Angry Response

verses.text: He threatened, “How dare you reject my idols, O Abraham! If you do not desist, I will certainly stone you ˹to death˺. So be gone from me for a long time!”
verses.translation: He threatened, “How dare you reject my idols, O Abraham! If you do not desist, I will certainly stone you ˹to death˺. So be gone from me for a long time!”

verses.text: Abraham responded, “Peace be upon you! I will pray to my Lord for your forgiveness. He has truly been Most Gracious to me.
verses.translation: Abraham responded, “Peace be upon you! I will pray to my Lord for your forgiveness. He has truly been Most Gracious to me.

verses.text: As I distance myself from ˹all of˺ you and from whatever you invoke besides Allah, I will ˹continue to˺ call upon my Lord ˹alone˺, trusting that I will never be disappointed in invoking my Lord.”
verses.translation: As I distance myself from ˹all of˺ you and from whatever you invoke besides Allah, I will ˹continue to˺ call upon my Lord ˹alone˺, trusting that I will never be disappointed in invoking my Lord.”

verses.text: So after he had left them and what they worshipped besides Allah, We granted him Isaac and Jacob, and made each of them a prophet.
verses.translation: So after he had left them and what they worshipped besides Allah, We granted him Isaac and Jacob, and made each of them a prophet.

verses.text: We showered them with Our mercy, and blessed them with honourable mention.[576] Prophet Moses
verses.translation: We showered them with Our mercy, and blessed them with honourable mention.[576] Prophet Moses

verses.text: And mention in the Book ˹O Prophet, the story of˺ Moses. He was truly a chosen man, and was a messenger and a prophet.
verses.translation: And mention in the Book ˹O Prophet, the story of˺ Moses. He was truly a chosen man, and was a messenger and a prophet.

verses.text: We called him from the right side of Mount Ṭûr, and drew him near, speaking ˹with him˺ directly.
verses.translation: We called him from the right side of Mount Ṭûr, and drew him near, speaking ˹with him˺ directly.

verses.text: And We appointed for him—out of Our grace—his brother, Aaron, as a prophet. Prophet Ishmael
verses.translation: And We appointed for him—out of Our grace—his brother, Aaron, as a prophet. Prophet Ishmael

verses.text: And mention in the Book ˹O Prophet, the story of˺ Ishmael. He was truly a man of his word, and was a messenger and a prophet.
verses.translation: And mention in the Book ˹O Prophet, the story of˺ Ishmael. He was truly a man of his word, and was a messenger and a prophet.

verses.text: He used to urge his people to pray and give alms-tax. And his Lord was well pleased with him. Prophet Enoch
verses.translation: He used to urge his people to pray and give alms-tax. And his Lord was well pleased with him. Prophet Enoch

verses.text: And mention in the Book ˹O Prophet, the story of˺ Enoch. He was surely a man of truth and a prophet.
verses.translation: And mention in the Book ˹O Prophet, the story of˺ Enoch. He was surely a man of truth and a prophet.

verses.text: And We elevated him to an honourable status.[577] Noble Prophets
verses.translation: And We elevated him to an honourable status.[577] Noble Prophets

verses.text: Those were ˹some of˺ the prophets who Allah has blessed from among the descendants of Adam, and of those We carried with Noah ˹in the Ark˺, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel,[578] and of those We ˹rightly˺ guided and chose. Whenever the revelations of the Most Compassionate were recited to them, they fell down, prostrating and weeping. Evil Successors
verses.translation: Those were ˹some of˺ the prophets who Allah has blessed from among the descendants of Adam, and of those We carried with Noah ˹in the Ark˺, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel,[578] and of those We ˹rightly˺ guided and chose. Whenever the revelations of the Most Compassionate were recited to them, they fell down, prostrating and weeping. Evil Successors

verses.text: But they were succeeded by generations who neglected prayer and followed their lusts and so will soon face the evil consequences.[579]
verses.translation: But they were succeeded by generations who neglected prayer and followed their lusts and so will soon face the evil consequences.[579]

verses.text: As for those who repent, believe, and do good, it is they who will be admitted into Paradise, never being denied any reward.
verses.translation: As for those who repent, believe, and do good, it is they who will be admitted into Paradise, never being denied any reward.

verses.text: ˹They will be in˺ the Gardens of Eternity, promised in trust by the Most Compassionate to His servants. Surely His promise will be fulfilled.
verses.translation: ˹They will be in˺ the Gardens of Eternity, promised in trust by the Most Compassionate to His servants. Surely His promise will be fulfilled.

verses.text: There they will never hear any idle talk—only ˹greetings of˺ peace. And there they will have their provisions morning and evening.[580]
verses.translation: There they will never hear any idle talk—only ˹greetings of˺ peace. And there they will have their provisions morning and evening.[580]

verses.text: That is Paradise, which We will grant to whoever is devout among Our servants. Gabriel’s Response to the Prophet [581]
verses.translation: That is Paradise, which We will grant to whoever is devout among Our servants. Gabriel’s Response to the Prophet [581]

verses.text: “We only descend by the command of your Lord. To Him belongs whatever is before us, and whatever is behind us, and everything in between. And your Lord is never forgetful.
verses.translation: “We only descend by the command of your Lord. To Him belongs whatever is before us, and whatever is behind us, and everything in between. And your Lord is never forgetful.

verses.text: ˹He is the˺ Lord of the heavens, and the earth, and everything in between. So worship Him ˹alone˺, and be steadfast in His worship. Do you know of anyone equal to Him ˹in His attributes˺?” The Deniers of Resurrection
verses.translation: ˹He is the˺ Lord of the heavens, and the earth, and everything in between. So worship Him ˹alone˺, and be steadfast in His worship. Do you know of anyone equal to Him ˹in His attributes˺?” The Deniers of Resurrection

verses.text: Yet ˹some˺ people ask ˹mockingly˺, “After I die, will I really be raised to life again?”
verses.translation: Yet ˹some˺ people ask ˹mockingly˺, “After I die, will I really be raised to life again?”

verses.text: Do ˹such˺ people not remember that We created them before, when they were nothing?
verses.translation: Do ˹such˺ people not remember that We created them before, when they were nothing?

verses.text: By your Lord ˹O Prophet˺! We will surely gather them along with the devils, and then set them around Hell on their knees.
verses.translation: By your Lord ˹O Prophet˺! We will surely gather them along with the devils, and then set them around Hell on their knees.

verses.text: Then We will certainly begin by dragging out of every group the ones most defiant to the Most Compassionate.
verses.translation: Then We will certainly begin by dragging out of every group the ones most defiant to the Most Compassionate.

verses.text: And We truly know best who is most deserving of burning in it.
verses.translation: And We truly know best who is most deserving of burning in it.

verses.text: There is none of you who will not pass over it.[582] ˹This is˺ a decree your Lord must fulfil.
verses.translation: There is none of you who will not pass over it.[582] ˹This is˺ a decree your Lord must fulfil.

verses.text: Then We will deliver those who were devout, leaving the wrongdoers there on their knees. Arrogant Disbelievers
verses.translation: Then We will deliver those who were devout, leaving the wrongdoers there on their knees. Arrogant Disbelievers

verses.text: When Our clear revelations are recited to them, the disbelievers ask the believers ˹mockingly˺, “Which of the two of us is better in status and superior in assembly?”
verses.translation: When Our clear revelations are recited to them, the disbelievers ask the believers ˹mockingly˺, “Which of the two of us is better in status and superior in assembly?”

verses.text: ˹Imagine, O Prophet˺ how many peoples We have destroyed before them, who were far better in luxury and splendour!
verses.translation: ˹Imagine, O Prophet˺ how many peoples We have destroyed before them, who were far better in luxury and splendour!

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Whoever is ˹entrenched˺ in misguidance, the Most Compassionate will allow them plenty of time, until—behold!—they face what they are threatened with: either the torment or the Hour. Only then will they realize who is worse in position and inferior in manpower.” Reward of the Devout
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Whoever is ˹entrenched˺ in misguidance, the Most Compassionate will allow them plenty of time, until—behold!—they face what they are threatened with: either the torment or the Hour. Only then will they realize who is worse in position and inferior in manpower.” Reward of the Devout

verses.text: And Allah increases in guidance those who are ˹rightly˺ guided. And the everlasting good deeds are far better with your Lord in reward and in outcome.[583] A Denier of Resurrection
verses.translation: And Allah increases in guidance those who are ˹rightly˺ guided. And the everlasting good deeds are far better with your Lord in reward and in outcome.[583] A Denier of Resurrection

verses.text: Have you seen ˹O Prophet˺ the one[584] who rejects Our revelations yet boasts, “I will definitely be granted ˹plenty of˺ wealth and children ˹if there is an afterlife˺.”?
verses.translation: Have you seen ˹O Prophet˺ the one[584] who rejects Our revelations yet boasts, “I will definitely be granted ˹plenty of˺ wealth and children ˹if there is an afterlife˺.”?

verses.text: Has he looked into the unseen or taken a pledge from the Most Compassionate?
verses.translation: Has he looked into the unseen or taken a pledge from the Most Compassionate?

verses.text: Not at all! We certainly record whatever he claims and will increase his punishment extensively.
verses.translation: Not at all! We certainly record whatever he claims and will increase his punishment extensively.

verses.text: And We will inherit what he boasts of, and he will come before Us all by himself. Believers and Disbelievers on Judgment Day
verses.translation: And We will inherit what he boasts of, and he will come before Us all by himself. Believers and Disbelievers on Judgment Day

verses.text: They have taken other gods, instead of Allah, seeking strength ˹and protection˺ through them.
verses.translation: They have taken other gods, instead of Allah, seeking strength ˹and protection˺ through them.

verses.text: But no! Those ˹gods˺ will deny their worship and turn against them.
verses.translation: But no! Those ˹gods˺ will deny their worship and turn against them.

verses.text: Do you ˹O Prophet˺ not see that We have sent the devils against the disbelievers, constantly inciting them?
verses.translation: Do you ˹O Prophet˺ not see that We have sent the devils against the disbelievers, constantly inciting them?

verses.text: So do not be in haste against them, for indeed We are ˹closely˺ counting down their days.
verses.translation: So do not be in haste against them, for indeed We are ˹closely˺ counting down their days.

verses.text: ˹Watch for˺ the Day We will gather the righteous before the Most Compassionate as an honoured delegation,
verses.translation: ˹Watch for˺ the Day We will gather the righteous before the Most Compassionate as an honoured delegation,

verses.text: and drive the wicked to Hell like a thirsty herd.
verses.translation: and drive the wicked to Hell like a thirsty herd.

verses.text: None will have the right to intercede, except those who have taken a covenant from the Most Compassionate.[585] Allah’s Children?
verses.translation: None will have the right to intercede, except those who have taken a covenant from the Most Compassionate.[585] Allah’s Children?

verses.text: They[586] say, “The Most Compassionate has offspring.”
verses.translation: They[586] say, “The Most Compassionate has offspring.”

verses.text: You have certainly made an outrageous claim,
verses.translation: You have certainly made an outrageous claim,

verses.text: by which the heavens are about to burst, the earth to split apart, and the mountains to crumble to pieces
verses.translation: by which the heavens are about to burst, the earth to split apart, and the mountains to crumble to pieces

verses.text: in protest of attributing children to the Most Compassionate.
verses.translation: in protest of attributing children to the Most Compassionate.

verses.text: It does not befit ˹the majesty of˺ the Most Compassionate to have children.
verses.translation: It does not befit ˹the majesty of˺ the Most Compassionate to have children.

verses.text: There is none in the heavens or the earth who will not return to the Most Compassionate in full submission.
verses.translation: There is none in the heavens or the earth who will not return to the Most Compassionate in full submission.

verses.text: Indeed, He fully knows them and has counted them precisely.
verses.translation: Indeed, He fully knows them and has counted them precisely.

verses.text: And each of them will return to Him on the Day of Judgment all alone. Believers’ Love for One Another
verses.translation: And each of them will return to Him on the Day of Judgment all alone. Believers’ Love for One Another

verses.text: As for those who believe and do good, the Most Compassionate will ˹certainly˺ bless them with ˹genuine˺ love. The Message of the Quran
verses.translation: As for those who believe and do good, the Most Compassionate will ˹certainly˺ bless them with ˹genuine˺ love. The Message of the Quran

verses.text: Indeed, We have made this ˹Quran˺ easy in your own language ˹O Prophet˺ so with it you may give good news to the righteous and warn those who are contentious.
verses.translation: Indeed, We have made this ˹Quran˺ easy in your own language ˹O Prophet˺ so with it you may give good news to the righteous and warn those who are contentious.

verses.text: ˹Imagine˺ how many peoples We have destroyed before them! Do you ˹still˺ see any of them, or ˹even˺ hear from them the slightest sound? *** -- 273 of 694 --
verses.translation: ˹Imagine˺ how many peoples We have destroyed before them! Do you ˹still˺ see any of them, or ˹even˺ hear from them the slightest sound? *** -- 273 of 694 --

name: Ṭâ-Hâ
intro: Since Moses ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) and Adam ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) are mentioned passingly in the previous sûrah, their stories are recounted here in great detail. This Meccan sûrah reassures the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) that the truth always prevails even against the most tyrannical opposition (in the form of Pharaoh) and that Allah is able to open even the hardest of hearts (in the form of Pharaoh’s magicians). Both the beginning and the end of the sûrah emphasize the divine nature of the Quran as a source of guidance and eternal bliss. Those who turn away from the Quranic reminder are warned of misery in this world and horrifying punishment on the Day of Judgment. The Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is advised to seek comfort in patience and prayer against pagan denial, which is detailed at the beginning of the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Almighty Allah’s Revelation

verses.text: Ṭâ-Hâ.
verses.translation: Ṭâ-Hâ.

verses.text: We have not revealed the Quran to you ˹O Prophet˺ to cause you distress,
verses.translation: We have not revealed the Quran to you ˹O Prophet˺ to cause you distress,

verses.text: but as a reminder to those in awe ˹of Allah˺.
verses.translation: but as a reminder to those in awe ˹of Allah˺.

verses.text: ˹It is˺ a revelation from the One Who created the earth and the high heavens—
verses.translation: ˹It is˺ a revelation from the One Who created the earth and the high heavens—

verses.text: the Most Compassionate, ˹Who is˺ established on the Throne.
verses.translation: the Most Compassionate, ˹Who is˺ established on the Throne.

verses.text: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth and whatever is in between and whatever is underground.
verses.translation: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth and whatever is in between and whatever is underground.

verses.text: Whether you speak openly ˹or not˺, He certainly knows what is secret and what is even more hidden.
verses.translation: Whether you speak openly ˹or not˺, He certainly knows what is secret and what is even more hidden.

verses.text: Allah—there is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. He has the Most Beautiful Names. Moses’ Great Encounter
verses.translation: Allah—there is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. He has the Most Beautiful Names. Moses’ Great Encounter

verses.text: Has the story of Moses reached you ˹O Prophet˺?
verses.translation: Has the story of Moses reached you ˹O Prophet˺?

verses.text: When he saw a fire, he said to his family, “Wait here, ˹for˺ I have spotted a fire. Perhaps I can bring you a torch from it, or find some guidance at the fire.”[587]
verses.translation: When he saw a fire, he said to his family, “Wait here, ˹for˺ I have spotted a fire. Perhaps I can bring you a torch from it, or find some guidance at the fire.”[587]

verses.text: But when he approached it, he was called, “O Moses!
verses.translation: But when he approached it, he was called, “O Moses!

verses.text: It is truly I. I am your Lord! So take off your sandals, for you are in the sacred valley of Ṭuwa.
verses.translation: It is truly I. I am your Lord! So take off your sandals, for you are in the sacred valley of Ṭuwa.

verses.text: I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed:
verses.translation: I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed:

verses.text: ‘It is truly I. I am Allah! There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Me. So worship Me ˹alone˺, and establish prayer for My remembrance.
verses.translation: ‘It is truly I. I am Allah! There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Me. So worship Me ˹alone˺, and establish prayer for My remembrance.

verses.text: The Hour is sure to come. My Will is to keep it hidden, so that every soul may be rewarded according to their efforts.
verses.translation: The Hour is sure to come. My Will is to keep it hidden, so that every soul may be rewarded according to their efforts.

verses.text: So do not let those who disbelieve in it and follow their desires distract you from it, or you will be doomed.’” Two Signs for Moses
verses.translation: So do not let those who disbelieve in it and follow their desires distract you from it, or you will be doomed.’” Two Signs for Moses

verses.text: ˹Allah added,˺ “And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?”
verses.translation: ˹Allah added,˺ “And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?”

verses.text: He replied, “It is my staff! I lean on it, and with it I beat down ˹branches˺ for my sheep, and have other uses for it.”[588]
verses.translation: He replied, “It is my staff! I lean on it, and with it I beat down ˹branches˺ for my sheep, and have other uses for it.”[588]

verses.text: Allah said, “Throw it down, O Moses!”
verses.translation: Allah said, “Throw it down, O Moses!”

verses.text: So he did, then—behold!—it became a serpent, slithering.
verses.translation: So he did, then—behold!—it became a serpent, slithering.

verses.text: Allah said, “Take it, and have no fear. We will return it to its former state.
verses.translation: Allah said, “Take it, and have no fear. We will return it to its former state.

verses.text: And put your hand under your armpit, it will come out ˹shining˺ white, unblemished,[589] as another sign,
verses.translation: And put your hand under your armpit, it will come out ˹shining˺ white, unblemished,[589] as another sign,

verses.text: so that We may show you some of Our greatest signs.
verses.translation: so that We may show you some of Our greatest signs.

verses.text: Go to Pharaoh, for he has truly transgressed ˹all bounds˺.” Moses Prays for Help
verses.translation: Go to Pharaoh, for he has truly transgressed ˹all bounds˺.” Moses Prays for Help

verses.text: Moses prayed, “My Lord! Uplift my heart for me,
verses.translation: Moses prayed, “My Lord! Uplift my heart for me,

verses.text: and make my task easy,
verses.translation: and make my task easy,

verses.text: and remove the impediment from my tongue
verses.translation: and remove the impediment from my tongue

verses.text: so people may understand my speech,[590]
verses.translation: so people may understand my speech,[590]

verses.text: and grant me a helper from my family,
verses.translation: and grant me a helper from my family,

verses.text: Aaron, my brother.
verses.translation: Aaron, my brother.

verses.text: Strengthen me through him,
verses.translation: Strengthen me through him,

verses.text: and let him share my task,
verses.translation: and let him share my task,

verses.text: so that we may glorify You much
verses.translation: so that we may glorify You much

verses.text: and remember You much,
verses.translation: and remember You much,

verses.text: for truly You have ˹always˺ been overseeing us.”
verses.translation: for truly You have ˹always˺ been overseeing us.”

verses.text: Allah responded, “All that you requested has been granted, O Moses! Allah’s Favours to Young Moses
verses.translation: Allah responded, “All that you requested has been granted, O Moses! Allah’s Favours to Young Moses

verses.text: “And surely We had shown You favour before,
verses.translation: “And surely We had shown You favour before,

verses.text: when We inspired your mother with this:
verses.translation: when We inspired your mother with this:

verses.text: ‘Put him into a chest, then put it into the river. The river will wash it ashore, and he will be taken by ˹Pharaoh,˺ an enemy of Mine and his.’ And I blessed you with lovability from Me[591] ˹O Moses˺ so that you would be brought up under My ˹watchful˺ Eye.
verses.translation: ‘Put him into a chest, then put it into the river. The river will wash it ashore, and he will be taken by ˹Pharaoh,˺ an enemy of Mine and his.’ And I blessed you with lovability from Me[591] ˹O Moses˺ so that you would be brought up under My ˹watchful˺ Eye.

verses.text: ˹Remember˺ when your sister came along and proposed, ‘Shall I direct you to someone who will nurse him?’[592] So We reunited you with your mother so that her heart would be put at ease, and she would not grieve. ˹Later˺ you killed a man ˹by mistake˺, but We saved you from sorrow, as well as other tests We put you through. Then you stayed for a number of years among the people of Midian. Then you came here as pre-destined, O Moses!
