verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when your sister came along and proposed, ‘Shall I direct you to someone who will nurse him?’[592] So We reunited you with your mother so that her heart would be put at ease, and she would not grieve. ˹Later˺ you killed a man ˹by mistake˺, but We saved you from sorrow, as well as other tests We put you through. Then you stayed for a number of years among the people of Midian. Then you came here as pre-destined, O Moses!

verses.text: And I have selected you for My service. Orders to Moses and Aaron
verses.translation: And I have selected you for My service. Orders to Moses and Aaron

verses.text: “Go forth, you and your brother, with My signs and never falter in remembering Me.
verses.translation: “Go forth, you and your brother, with My signs and never falter in remembering Me.

verses.text: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh, for he has truly transgressed ˹all bounds˺.
verses.translation: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh, for he has truly transgressed ˹all bounds˺.

verses.text: Speak to him gently, so perhaps he may be mindful ˹of Me˺ or fearful ˹of My punishment˺.”
verses.translation: Speak to him gently, so perhaps he may be mindful ˹of Me˺ or fearful ˹of My punishment˺.”

verses.text: They both pleaded, “Our Lord! We fear that he may be quick to harm us or act tyrannically.”
verses.translation: They both pleaded, “Our Lord! We fear that he may be quick to harm us or act tyrannically.”

verses.text: Allah reassured ˹them˺, “Have no fear! I am with you, hearing and seeing.
verses.translation: Allah reassured ˹them˺, “Have no fear! I am with you, hearing and seeing.

verses.text: So go to him and say, ‘Indeed we are both messengers from your Lord, so let the Children of Israel go with us, and do not oppress them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord. And salvation will be for whoever follows the ˹right˺ guidance.
verses.translation: So go to him and say, ‘Indeed we are both messengers from your Lord, so let the Children of Israel go with us, and do not oppress them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord. And salvation will be for whoever follows the ˹right˺ guidance.

verses.text: It has indeed been revealed to us that the punishment will be upon whoever denies ˹the truth˺ and turns away.’” Pharaoh’s Arrogance
verses.translation: It has indeed been revealed to us that the punishment will be upon whoever denies ˹the truth˺ and turns away.’” Pharaoh’s Arrogance

verses.text: Pharaoh asked, “Who then is the Lord of you two, O Moses?”
verses.translation: Pharaoh asked, “Who then is the Lord of you two, O Moses?”

verses.text: He answered, “Our Lord is the One Who has given everything its ˹distinctive˺ form, then guided ˹it˺.”
verses.translation: He answered, “Our Lord is the One Who has given everything its ˹distinctive˺ form, then guided ˹it˺.”

verses.text: Pharaoh asked, “And what about previous peoples?”
verses.translation: Pharaoh asked, “And what about previous peoples?”

verses.text: He replied, “That knowledge is with my Lord in a Record. My Lord neither falters nor forgets ˹anything˺.”
verses.translation: He replied, “That knowledge is with my Lord in a Record. My Lord neither falters nor forgets ˹anything˺.”

verses.text: ˹He is the One˺ Who has laid out the earth for ˹all of˺ you, and set in it pathways for you, and sends down rain from the sky, causing various types of plants to grow,
verses.translation: ˹He is the One˺ Who has laid out the earth for ˹all of˺ you, and set in it pathways for you, and sends down rain from the sky, causing various types of plants to grow,

verses.text: ˹so˺ eat and graze your cattle. Surely in this are signs for people of sound judgment.
verses.translation: ˹so˺ eat and graze your cattle. Surely in this are signs for people of sound judgment.

verses.text: From the earth We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will bring you back again. The Challenge
verses.translation: From the earth We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will bring you back again. The Challenge

verses.text: And We certainly showed Pharaoh all of Our signs,[593] but he denied them and refused ˹to believe˺.
verses.translation: And We certainly showed Pharaoh all of Our signs,[593] but he denied them and refused ˹to believe˺.

verses.text: He said, “Have you come to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moses?
verses.translation: He said, “Have you come to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moses?

verses.text: We can surely meet you with similar magic. So set for us an appointment that neither of us will fail to keep, in a central place.”
verses.translation: We can surely meet you with similar magic. So set for us an appointment that neither of us will fail to keep, in a central place.”

verses.text: Moses said, “Your appointment is on the Day of the Festival, and let the people be gathered mid-morning.” Moses’ Warning
verses.translation: Moses said, “Your appointment is on the Day of the Festival, and let the people be gathered mid-morning.” Moses’ Warning

verses.text: Pharaoh then withdrew, orchestrated his scheme, then returned.
verses.translation: Pharaoh then withdrew, orchestrated his scheme, then returned.

verses.text: Moses warned the magicians, “Woe to you! Do not fabricate a lie against Allah,[594] or He will wipe you out with a torment. Whoever fabricates ˹lies˺ is bound to fail.”
verses.translation: Moses warned the magicians, “Woe to you! Do not fabricate a lie against Allah,[594] or He will wipe you out with a torment. Whoever fabricates ˹lies˺ is bound to fail.”

verses.text: So the magicians disputed the matter among themselves, conversing privately.
verses.translation: So the magicians disputed the matter among themselves, conversing privately.

verses.text: They concluded, “These two are only magicians who want to drive you out of your land with their magic, and do away with your most cherished traditions.
verses.translation: They concluded, “These two are only magicians who want to drive you out of your land with their magic, and do away with your most cherished traditions.

verses.text: So orchestrate your plan, then come forward in ˹perfect˺ ranks. And whoever prevails today will certainly be successful.” Moses Prevails
verses.translation: So orchestrate your plan, then come forward in ˹perfect˺ ranks. And whoever prevails today will certainly be successful.” Moses Prevails

verses.text: They said, “O Moses! Either you cast, or let us be the first to cast.”
verses.translation: They said, “O Moses! Either you cast, or let us be the first to cast.”

verses.text: Moses responded, “No, you go first.” And suddenly their ropes and staffs appeared to him—by their magic—to be slithering.
verses.translation: Moses responded, “No, you go first.” And suddenly their ropes and staffs appeared to him—by their magic—to be slithering.

verses.text: So Moses concealed fear within himself.
verses.translation: So Moses concealed fear within himself.

verses.text: We reassured ˹him˺, “Do not fear! It is certainly you who will prevail.
verses.translation: We reassured ˹him˺, “Do not fear! It is certainly you who will prevail.

verses.text: Cast what is in your right hand, and it will swallow up what they have made, for what they have made is no more than a magic trick. And magicians can never succeed wherever they go.” Magicians Become Believers
verses.translation: Cast what is in your right hand, and it will swallow up what they have made, for what they have made is no more than a magic trick. And magicians can never succeed wherever they go.” Magicians Become Believers

verses.text: So the magicians fell down in prostration, declaring, “We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.”
verses.translation: So the magicians fell down in prostration, declaring, “We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.”

verses.text: Pharaoh threatened, “How dare you believe in him before I give you permission? He must be your master who taught you magic. I will certainly cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and crucify you on the trunks of palm trees. You will really see whose punishment is more severe and more lasting.”
verses.translation: Pharaoh threatened, “How dare you believe in him before I give you permission? He must be your master who taught you magic. I will certainly cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and crucify you on the trunks of palm trees. You will really see whose punishment is more severe and more lasting.”

verses.text: They responded, “By the One Who created us! We will never prefer you over the clear proofs that have come to us. So do whatever you want! Your authority only covers the ˹fleeting˺ life of this world.
verses.translation: They responded, “By the One Who created us! We will never prefer you over the clear proofs that have come to us. So do whatever you want! Your authority only covers the ˹fleeting˺ life of this world.

verses.text: Indeed, we have believed in our Lord so He may forgive our sins and that magic you have forced us to practice. And Allah is far superior ˹in reward˺ and more lasting ˹in punishment˺.” Reward of Disbelievers and Believers
verses.translation: Indeed, we have believed in our Lord so He may forgive our sins and that magic you have forced us to practice. And Allah is far superior ˹in reward˺ and more lasting ˹in punishment˺.” Reward of Disbelievers and Believers

verses.text: Whoever comes to their Lord as an evildoer will certainly have Hell, where they can neither live nor die.
verses.translation: Whoever comes to their Lord as an evildoer will certainly have Hell, where they can neither live nor die.

verses.text: But whoever comes to Him as a believer, having done good, they will have the highest ranks:
verses.translation: But whoever comes to Him as a believer, having done good, they will have the highest ranks:

verses.text: the Gardens of Eternity, under which rivers flow, where they will stay forever. That is the reward of those who purify themselves. Pharaoh’s Doom
verses.translation: the Gardens of Eternity, under which rivers flow, where they will stay forever. That is the reward of those who purify themselves. Pharaoh’s Doom

verses.text: And We surely inspired Moses, ˹saying,˺ “Leave with My servants ˹at night˺ and strike a dry passage for them across the sea. Have no fear of being overtaken, nor be concerned ˹of drowning˺.”
verses.translation: And We surely inspired Moses, ˹saying,˺ “Leave with My servants ˹at night˺ and strike a dry passage for them across the sea. Have no fear of being overtaken, nor be concerned ˹of drowning˺.”

verses.text: Then Pharaoh pursued them with his soldiers—but how overwhelming were the waters that submerged them!
verses.translation: Then Pharaoh pursued them with his soldiers—but how overwhelming were the waters that submerged them!

verses.text: And ˹so˺ Pharaoh led his people astray, and did not guide ˹them rightly˺. Allah’s Favours to the Israelites
verses.translation: And ˹so˺ Pharaoh led his people astray, and did not guide ˹them rightly˺. Allah’s Favours to the Israelites

verses.text: O Children of Israel! We saved you from your enemy, and made an appointment with you[595] on the right side of Mount Ṭûr, and sent down to you manna and quails,[596]
verses.translation: O Children of Israel! We saved you from your enemy, and made an appointment with you[595] on the right side of Mount Ṭûr, and sent down to you manna and quails,[596]

verses.text: ˹saying,˺ “Eat from the good things We have provided for you, but do not transgress in them, or My wrath will befall you. And whoever My wrath befalls is certainly doomed.
verses.translation: ˹saying,˺ “Eat from the good things We have provided for you, but do not transgress in them, or My wrath will befall you. And whoever My wrath befalls is certainly doomed.

verses.text: But I am truly Most Forgiving to whoever repents, believes, and does good, then persists on ˹true˺ guidance.” The Golden Calf
verses.translation: But I am truly Most Forgiving to whoever repents, believes, and does good, then persists on ˹true˺ guidance.” The Golden Calf

verses.text: ˹Allah asked,˺ “Why have you come with such haste ahead of your people, O Moses?”[597]
verses.translation: ˹Allah asked,˺ “Why have you come with such haste ahead of your people, O Moses?”[597]

verses.text: He replied, “They are close on my tracks. And I have hastened to You, my Lord, so You will be pleased.”
verses.translation: He replied, “They are close on my tracks. And I have hastened to You, my Lord, so You will be pleased.”

verses.text: Allah responded, “We have indeed tested your people in your absence, and the Sâmiri[598] has led them astray.”
verses.translation: Allah responded, “We have indeed tested your people in your absence, and the Sâmiri[598] has led them astray.”

verses.text: So Moses returned to his people, furious and sorrowful. He said, “O my people! Had your Lord not made you a good promise?[599] Has my absence been too long for you? Or have you wished for wrath from your Lord to befall you, so you broke your promise to me?”[600] The Calf Worshippers
verses.translation: So Moses returned to his people, furious and sorrowful. He said, “O my people! Had your Lord not made you a good promise?[599] Has my absence been too long for you? Or have you wished for wrath from your Lord to befall you, so you broke your promise to me?”[600] The Calf Worshippers

verses.text: They argued, “We did not break our promise to you of our own free will, but we were made to carry the burden of the people’s ˹golden˺ jewellery,[601] then we threw it ˹into the fire˺, and so did the Sâmiri.”
verses.translation: They argued, “We did not break our promise to you of our own free will, but we were made to carry the burden of the people’s ˹golden˺ jewellery,[601] then we threw it ˹into the fire˺, and so did the Sâmiri.”

verses.text: Then he moulded for them an idol of a calf that made a lowing sound. They said, “This is your god and the god of Moses, but Moses forgot ˹where it was˺!”
verses.translation: Then he moulded for them an idol of a calf that made a lowing sound. They said, “This is your god and the god of Moses, but Moses forgot ˹where it was˺!”

verses.text: Did they not see that it did not respond to them, nor could it protect or benefit them? Aaron’s Stance
verses.translation: Did they not see that it did not respond to them, nor could it protect or benefit them? Aaron’s Stance

verses.text: Aaron had already warned them beforehand, “O my people! You are only being tested by this, for indeed your ˹one true˺ Lord is the Most Compassionate. So follow me and obey my orders.”
verses.translation: Aaron had already warned them beforehand, “O my people! You are only being tested by this, for indeed your ˹one true˺ Lord is the Most Compassionate. So follow me and obey my orders.”

verses.text: They replied, “We will not cease to worship it until Moses returns to us.”
verses.translation: They replied, “We will not cease to worship it until Moses returns to us.”

verses.text: Moses scolded ˹his brother˺, “O Aaron! What prevented you, when you saw them going astray,
verses.translation: Moses scolded ˹his brother˺, “O Aaron! What prevented you, when you saw them going astray,

verses.text: from following after me? How could you disobey my orders?”[602]
verses.translation: from following after me? How could you disobey my orders?”[602]

verses.text: Aaron pleaded, “O son of my mother! Do not seize me by my beard or ˹the hair of˺ my head. I really feared that you would say, ‘You have caused division among the Children of Israel, and did not observe my word.’” The Sâmiri’s Punishment
verses.translation: Aaron pleaded, “O son of my mother! Do not seize me by my beard or ˹the hair of˺ my head. I really feared that you would say, ‘You have caused division among the Children of Israel, and did not observe my word.’” The Sâmiri’s Punishment

verses.text: Moses then asked, “What did you think you were doing, O Sâmiri?”
verses.translation: Moses then asked, “What did you think you were doing, O Sâmiri?”

verses.text: He said, “I saw what they did not see, so I took a handful ˹of dust˺ from the hoof-prints of ˹the horse of˺ the messenger-angel ˹Gabriel˺ then cast it ˹on the moulded calf˺. This is what my lower-self tempted me into.”[603]
verses.translation: He said, “I saw what they did not see, so I took a handful ˹of dust˺ from the hoof-prints of ˹the horse of˺ the messenger-angel ˹Gabriel˺ then cast it ˹on the moulded calf˺. This is what my lower-self tempted me into.”[603]

verses.text: Moses said, “Go away then! And for ˹the rest of your˺ life you will surely be crying, ‘Do not touch ˹me˺!’[604] Then you will certainly have a fate[605] that you cannot escape. Now look at your god to which you have been devoted: we will burn it up, then scatter it in the sea completely.”
verses.translation: Moses said, “Go away then! And for ˹the rest of your˺ life you will surely be crying, ‘Do not touch ˹me˺!’[604] Then you will certainly have a fate[605] that you cannot escape. Now look at your god to which you have been devoted: we will burn it up, then scatter it in the sea completely.”

verses.text: ˹Then Moses addressed his people,˺ “Your only god is Allah, there is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. He encompasses everything in ˹His˺ knowledge.” The Deniers of the Quran
verses.translation: ˹Then Moses addressed his people,˺ “Your only god is Allah, there is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. He encompasses everything in ˹His˺ knowledge.” The Deniers of the Quran

verses.text: This is how We relate to you ˹O Prophet˺ some of the stories of the past. And We have certainly granted you a Reminder[606] from Us.
verses.translation: This is how We relate to you ˹O Prophet˺ some of the stories of the past. And We have certainly granted you a Reminder[606] from Us.

verses.text: Whoever turns away from it will surely bear the burden ˹of sin˺ on the Day of Judgment,
verses.translation: Whoever turns away from it will surely bear the burden ˹of sin˺ on the Day of Judgment,

verses.text: suffering its consequences forever. What an evil burden they will carry on Judgment Day!
verses.translation: suffering its consequences forever. What an evil burden they will carry on Judgment Day!

verses.text: ˹Beware of˺ the Day the Trumpet will be blown,[607] and We will gather the wicked on that Day blue-faced ˹from horror and thirst˺.[608]
verses.translation: ˹Beware of˺ the Day the Trumpet will be blown,[607] and We will gather the wicked on that Day blue-faced ˹from horror and thirst˺.[608]

verses.text: They will whisper among themselves, “You stayed no more than ten days ˹on the earth˺.”
verses.translation: They will whisper among themselves, “You stayed no more than ten days ˹on the earth˺.”

verses.text: We know best what they will say—the most reasonable of them will say, “You stayed no more than a day.” Mountains on Judgment Day
verses.translation: We know best what they will say—the most reasonable of them will say, “You stayed no more than a day.” Mountains on Judgment Day

verses.text: And ˹if˺ they ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about the mountains, ˹then˺ say, “My Lord will wipe them out completely,
verses.translation: And ˹if˺ they ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about the mountains, ˹then˺ say, “My Lord will wipe them out completely,

verses.text: leaving the earth level and bare,
verses.translation: leaving the earth level and bare,

verses.text: with neither depressions nor elevations to be seen.” People on Judgment Day
verses.translation: with neither depressions nor elevations to be seen.” People on Judgment Day

verses.text: On that Day all will follow the caller ˹for assembly˺, ˹and˺ none will dare to deviate. All voices will be hushed before the Most Compassionate. Only whispers[609] will be heard.
verses.translation: On that Day all will follow the caller ˹for assembly˺, ˹and˺ none will dare to deviate. All voices will be hushed before the Most Compassionate. Only whispers[609] will be heard.

verses.text: On that Day no intercession will be of any benefit, except by those granted permission by the Most Compassionate and whose words are agreeable to Him.
verses.translation: On that Day no intercession will be of any benefit, except by those granted permission by the Most Compassionate and whose words are agreeable to Him.

verses.text: He ˹fully˺ knows what is ahead of them and what is behind them,[610] but they cannot encompass Him in ˹their˺ knowledge.[611]
verses.translation: He ˹fully˺ knows what is ahead of them and what is behind them,[610] but they cannot encompass Him in ˹their˺ knowledge.[611]

verses.text: And all faces will be humbled before the Ever-Living, All-Sustaining. And those burdened with wrongdoing will be in loss.
verses.translation: And all faces will be humbled before the Ever-Living, All-Sustaining. And those burdened with wrongdoing will be in loss.

verses.text: But whoever does good and is a believer will have no fear of being wronged or denied ˹their reward˺. The Quran
verses.translation: But whoever does good and is a believer will have no fear of being wronged or denied ˹their reward˺. The Quran

verses.text: And so We have sent it down as an Arabic Quran and varied the warnings in it, so perhaps they will shun evil or it may cause them to be mindful.
verses.translation: And so We have sent it down as an Arabic Quran and varied the warnings in it, so perhaps they will shun evil or it may cause them to be mindful.

verses.text: Exalted is Allah, the True King! Do not rush to recite ˹a revelation of˺ the Quran ˹O Prophet˺ before it is ˹properly˺ conveyed to you, [612] and pray, “My Lord! Increase me in knowledge.” Satan vs. Adam
verses.translation: Exalted is Allah, the True King! Do not rush to recite ˹a revelation of˺ the Quran ˹O Prophet˺ before it is ˹properly˺ conveyed to you, [612] and pray, “My Lord! Increase me in knowledge.” Satan vs. Adam

verses.text: And indeed, We once made a covenant with Adam, but he forgot, and ˹so˺ We did not find determination in him.
verses.translation: And indeed, We once made a covenant with Adam, but he forgot, and ˹so˺ We did not find determination in him.

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when We said to the angels, “Prostrate before Adam,” so they all did—but not Iblîs, [613] who refused ˹arrogantly˺.
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when We said to the angels, “Prostrate before Adam,” so they all did—but not Iblîs, [613] who refused ˹arrogantly˺.

verses.text: So We cautioned, “O Adam! This is surely an enemy to you and to your wife. So do not let him drive you both out of Paradise, for you ˹O Adam˺ would then suffer ˹hardship˺.
verses.translation: So We cautioned, “O Adam! This is surely an enemy to you and to your wife. So do not let him drive you both out of Paradise, for you ˹O Adam˺ would then suffer ˹hardship˺.

verses.text: Here it is guaranteed that you will never go hungry or unclothed,
verses.translation: Here it is guaranteed that you will never go hungry or unclothed,

verses.text: nor will you ˹ever˺ suffer from thirst or ˹the sun’s˺ heat.”[614] The Temptation
verses.translation: nor will you ˹ever˺ suffer from thirst or ˹the sun’s˺ heat.”[614] The Temptation

verses.text: But Satan whispered to him, saying, “O Adam! Shall I show you the Tree of Immortality and a kingdom that does not fade away?”
verses.translation: But Satan whispered to him, saying, “O Adam! Shall I show you the Tree of Immortality and a kingdom that does not fade away?”

verses.text: So they both ate from the tree and then their nakedness was exposed to them, prompting them to cover themselves with leaves from Paradise. So Adam disobeyed his Lord, and ˹so˺ lost his way.[615]
verses.translation: So they both ate from the tree and then their nakedness was exposed to them, prompting them to cover themselves with leaves from Paradise. So Adam disobeyed his Lord, and ˹so˺ lost his way.[615]

verses.text: Then his Lord chose him ˹for His grace˺, accepted his repentance, and guided him ˹rightly˺. The Fall
verses.translation: Then his Lord chose him ˹for His grace˺, accepted his repentance, and guided him ˹rightly˺. The Fall

verses.text: Allah said, “Descend, both of you, from here together ˹with Satan˺ as enemies to each other. Then when guidance comes to you from Me, whoever follows My guidance will neither go astray ˹in this life˺ nor suffer ˹in the next˺.
verses.translation: Allah said, “Descend, both of you, from here together ˹with Satan˺ as enemies to each other. Then when guidance comes to you from Me, whoever follows My guidance will neither go astray ˹in this life˺ nor suffer ˹in the next˺.

verses.text: But whoever turns away from My Reminder will certainly have a miserable life,[616] then We will raise them up blind on the Day of Judgment.”
verses.translation: But whoever turns away from My Reminder will certainly have a miserable life,[616] then We will raise them up blind on the Day of Judgment.”

verses.text: They will cry, “My Lord! Why have you raised me up blind, although I used to see?”
verses.translation: They will cry, “My Lord! Why have you raised me up blind, although I used to see?”

verses.text: Allah will respond, “It is so, just as Our revelations came to you and you neglected them, so Today you are neglected.”
verses.translation: Allah will respond, “It is so, just as Our revelations came to you and you neglected them, so Today you are neglected.”

verses.text: This is how We reward whoever transgresses and does not believe in the revelations of their Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is far more severe and more lasting. Warning to Meccan Pagans
verses.translation: This is how We reward whoever transgresses and does not believe in the revelations of their Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is far more severe and more lasting. Warning to Meccan Pagans

verses.text: Is it not yet clear to them how many peoples We destroyed before them, whose ruins they still pass by? Surely in this are signs for people of sound judgment.
verses.translation: Is it not yet clear to them how many peoples We destroyed before them, whose ruins they still pass by? Surely in this are signs for people of sound judgment.

verses.text: Had it not been for a prior decree from your Lord[617] ˹O Prophet˺ and a term already set, their ˹instant˺ doom would have been inevitable. Advice to the Prophet
verses.translation: Had it not been for a prior decree from your Lord[617] ˹O Prophet˺ and a term already set, their ˹instant˺ doom would have been inevitable. Advice to the Prophet

verses.text: So be patient ˹O Prophet˺ with what they say. And glorify the praises of your Lord before sunrise and before sunset, and glorify Him in the hours of the night and at both ends of the day,[618] so that you may be pleased ˹with the reward˺.
verses.translation: So be patient ˹O Prophet˺ with what they say. And glorify the praises of your Lord before sunrise and before sunset, and glorify Him in the hours of the night and at both ends of the day,[618] so that you may be pleased ˹with the reward˺.

verses.text: Do not let your eyes crave what We have allowed some of the disbelievers to enjoy; the ˹fleeting˺ splendour of this worldly life, which We test them with. But your Lord’s provision ˹in the Hereafter˺ is far better and more lasting.
verses.translation: Do not let your eyes crave what We have allowed some of the disbelievers to enjoy; the ˹fleeting˺ splendour of this worldly life, which We test them with. But your Lord’s provision ˹in the Hereafter˺ is far better and more lasting.

verses.text: Bid your people to pray, and be diligent in ˹observing˺ it. We do not ask you to provide. It is We Who provide for you. And the ultimate outcome is ˹only˺ for ˹the people of˺ righteousness. Warning to the Pagans
verses.translation: Bid your people to pray, and be diligent in ˹observing˺ it. We do not ask you to provide. It is We Who provide for you. And the ultimate outcome is ˹only˺ for ˹the people of˺ righteousness. Warning to the Pagans

verses.text: They demand, “If only he could bring us a sign from his Lord!”[619] Have they not ˹already˺ received a confirmation of what is in earlier Scriptures?[620]
verses.translation: They demand, “If only he could bring us a sign from his Lord!”[619] Have they not ˹already˺ received a confirmation of what is in earlier Scriptures?[620]

verses.text: Had We destroyed them with a torment before this ˹Prophet came˺, they would have surely argued, “Our Lord! If only You had sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your revelations before being humiliated and put to shame.”
verses.translation: Had We destroyed them with a torment before this ˹Prophet came˺, they would have surely argued, “Our Lord! If only You had sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your revelations before being humiliated and put to shame.”

verses.text: Say ˹to them, O Prophet˺, “Each ˹of us˺ is waiting, so keep waiting! You will soon know who is on the Straight Path and is ˹rightly˺ guided.” *** -- 282 of 694 --
verses.translation: Say ˹to them, O Prophet˺, “Each ˹of us˺ is waiting, so keep waiting! You will soon know who is on the Straight Path and is ˹rightly˺ guided.” *** -- 282 of 694 --

name: The Prophets
intro: Like the previous sûrah, this is another Meccan sûrah that aims at reassuring the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) by reminding him of Allah’s grace and support to His prophets, including Abraham, Job, Jonah, Zachariah, and Jesus. The Prophet (ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is said to be sent as a mercy to the whole world (verse 107). Warnings of the horrors of Judgment Day are dispersed throughout the sûrah and are carried over to the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Indifference to the Truth

verses.text: ˹The time of˺ people’s judgment has drawn near, yet they are heedlessly turning away.
verses.translation: ˹The time of˺ people’s judgment has drawn near, yet they are heedlessly turning away.

verses.text: Whatever new reminder comes to them from their Lord, they only listen to it jokingly,
verses.translation: Whatever new reminder comes to them from their Lord, they only listen to it jokingly,

verses.text: with their hearts ˹totally˺ distracted. The evildoers would converse secretly, ˹saying,˺ “Is this ˹one˺ not human like yourselves? Would you fall for ˹this˺ witchcraft, even though you can ˹clearly˺ see?”
verses.translation: with their hearts ˹totally˺ distracted. The evildoers would converse secretly, ˹saying,˺ “Is this ˹one˺ not human like yourselves? Would you fall for ˹this˺ witchcraft, even though you can ˹clearly˺ see?”

verses.text: The Prophet responded, “My Lord ˹fully˺ knows every word spoken in the heavens and the earth. For He is the All-Hearing, All- Knowing.”
verses.translation: The Prophet responded, “My Lord ˹fully˺ knows every word spoken in the heavens and the earth. For He is the All-Hearing, All- Knowing.”

verses.text: Yet they say, “This ˹Quran˺ is a set of confused dreams! No, he has fabricated it! No, he must be a poet! So let him bring us a ˹tangible˺ sign like those ˹prophets˺ sent before.”
verses.translation: Yet they say, “This ˹Quran˺ is a set of confused dreams! No, he has fabricated it! No, he must be a poet! So let him bring us a ˹tangible˺ sign like those ˹prophets˺ sent before.”

verses.text: Not a ˹single˺ society We destroyed before them ever believed ˹after receiving the signs˺. Will these ˹pagans˺ then believe? Human, Not Angelic Messengers
verses.translation: Not a ˹single˺ society We destroyed before them ever believed ˹after receiving the signs˺. Will these ˹pagans˺ then believe? Human, Not Angelic Messengers

verses.text: We did not send ˹messengers˺ before you ˹O Prophet˺ except mere men inspired by Us. If you ˹polytheists˺ do not know ˹this already˺, then ask those who have knowledge ˹of the Scriptures˺.
verses.translation: We did not send ˹messengers˺ before you ˹O Prophet˺ except mere men inspired by Us. If you ˹polytheists˺ do not know ˹this already˺, then ask those who have knowledge ˹of the Scriptures˺.

verses.text: We did not give those messengers ˹supernatural˺ bodies that did not need food, nor were they immortal.
verses.translation: We did not give those messengers ˹supernatural˺ bodies that did not need food, nor were they immortal.

verses.text: Then We fulfilled Our promise to them, saving them along with whoever We willed and destroying the transgressors. Reasoning with Meccan Pagans
verses.translation: Then We fulfilled Our promise to them, saving them along with whoever We willed and destroying the transgressors. Reasoning with Meccan Pagans

verses.text: We have surely revealed to you a Book, in which there is glory for you. Will you not then understand?
verses.translation: We have surely revealed to you a Book, in which there is glory for you. Will you not then understand?

verses.text: ˹Imagine˺ how many societies of wrongdoers We have destroyed, raising up other people after them!
verses.translation: ˹Imagine˺ how many societies of wrongdoers We have destroyed, raising up other people after them!

verses.text: When the wrongdoers sensed ˹the arrival of˺ Our torment, they started to run away from their cities.
verses.translation: When the wrongdoers sensed ˹the arrival of˺ Our torment, they started to run away from their cities.

verses.text: ˹They were told,˺ “Do not run away! Return to your luxuries and your homes, so you may be questioned ˹about your fate˺.”
verses.translation: ˹They were told,˺ “Do not run away! Return to your luxuries and your homes, so you may be questioned ˹about your fate˺.”

verses.text: They cried, “Woe to us! We have surely been wrongdoers.”
verses.translation: They cried, “Woe to us! We have surely been wrongdoers.”

verses.text: They kept repeating their cry until We mowed them down, ˹leaving them˺ lifeless.[621] Divine Amusement?
verses.translation: They kept repeating their cry until We mowed them down, ˹leaving them˺ lifeless.[621] Divine Amusement?

verses.text: We did not create the heavens and the earth and everything in between for sport.
verses.translation: We did not create the heavens and the earth and everything in between for sport.

verses.text: Had We intended to take ˹some˺ amusement, We could have found it in Our presence, if that had been Our Will.
verses.translation: Had We intended to take ˹some˺ amusement, We could have found it in Our presence, if that had been Our Will.

verses.text: In fact, We hurl the truth against falsehood, leaving it crushed, and it quickly vanishes. And woe be to you for what you claim![622]
verses.translation: In fact, We hurl the truth against falsehood, leaving it crushed, and it quickly vanishes. And woe be to you for what you claim![622]

verses.text: To Him belong all those in the heavens and the earth. And those nearest to Him are not too proud to worship Him, nor do they tire.
verses.translation: To Him belong all those in the heavens and the earth. And those nearest to Him are not too proud to worship Him, nor do they tire.

verses.text: They glorify ˹Him˺ day and night, never wavering. False Gods
verses.translation: They glorify ˹Him˺ day and night, never wavering. False Gods

verses.text: Or have they taken gods from the earth, who can raise the dead?
verses.translation: Or have they taken gods from the earth, who can raise the dead?

verses.text: Had there been other gods besides Allah in the heavens or the earth, both ˹realms˺ would have surely been corrupted. So Glorified is Allah, Lord of the Throne, far above what they claim.
verses.translation: Had there been other gods besides Allah in the heavens or the earth, both ˹realms˺ would have surely been corrupted. So Glorified is Allah, Lord of the Throne, far above what they claim.

verses.text: He cannot be questioned about what He does, but they will ˹all˺ be questioned.
verses.translation: He cannot be questioned about what He does, but they will ˹all˺ be questioned.

verses.text: Or have they taken other gods besides Him? Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Show ˹me˺ your proof. Here is ˹the Quran,˺ the Reminder for those with me; along with ˹earlier Scriptures,˺ the Reminder for those before me.”[623] But most of them do not know the truth, so they turn away.
verses.translation: Or have they taken other gods besides Him? Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Show ˹me˺ your proof. Here is ˹the Quran,˺ the Reminder for those with me; along with ˹earlier Scriptures,˺ the Reminder for those before me.”[623] But most of them do not know the truth, so they turn away.

verses.text: We never sent a messenger before you ˹O Prophet˺ without revealing to him: “There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Me, so worship Me ˹alone˺.” A Pagan Claim
verses.translation: We never sent a messenger before you ˹O Prophet˺ without revealing to him: “There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Me, so worship Me ˹alone˺.” A Pagan Claim

verses.text: And they say, “The Most Compassionate has offspring!”[624] Glory be to Him! In fact, those ˹angels˺ are only ˹His˺ honoured servants,
verses.translation: And they say, “The Most Compassionate has offspring!”[624] Glory be to Him! In fact, those ˹angels˺ are only ˹His˺ honoured servants,

verses.text: who do not speak until He has spoken, ˹only˺ acting at His command.
verses.translation: who do not speak until He has spoken, ˹only˺ acting at His command.

verses.text: He ˹fully˺ knows what is ahead of them and what is behind them. They do not intercede except for whom He approves, and they tremble in awe of Him.
verses.translation: He ˹fully˺ knows what is ahead of them and what is behind them. They do not intercede except for whom He approves, and they tremble in awe of Him.

verses.text: Whoever of them were to say, “I am a god besides Him,” they would be rewarded with Hell by Us. This is how We reward the wrongdoers. Miracles in the Universe
verses.translation: Whoever of them were to say, “I am a god besides Him,” they would be rewarded with Hell by Us. This is how We reward the wrongdoers. Miracles in the Universe

verses.text: Do the disbelievers not realize that the heavens and earth were ˹once˺ one mass then We split them apart?[625] And We created from water every living thing. Will they not then believe?
verses.translation: Do the disbelievers not realize that the heavens and earth were ˹once˺ one mass then We split them apart?[625] And We created from water every living thing. Will they not then believe?

verses.text: And We have placed firm mountains upon the earth so it does not shake with them, and made in it broad pathways so they may find their way.
verses.translation: And We have placed firm mountains upon the earth so it does not shake with them, and made in it broad pathways so they may find their way.

verses.text: And We have made the sky a well-protected canopy, still they turn away from its signs.[626]
verses.translation: And We have made the sky a well-protected canopy, still they turn away from its signs.[626]

verses.text: And He is the One Who created the day and the night, the sun and the moon—each travelling in an orbit. Fleeting World
verses.translation: And He is the One Who created the day and the night, the sun and the moon—each travelling in an orbit. Fleeting World

verses.text: We have not granted immortality to any human before you ˹O Prophet˺: so if you die, will they live forever?
verses.translation: We have not granted immortality to any human before you ˹O Prophet˺: so if you die, will they live forever?

verses.text: Every soul will taste death. And We test you ˹O humanity˺ with good and evil as a trial, then to Us you will ˹all˺ be returned. Warning to the Polytheists
verses.translation: Every soul will taste death. And We test you ˹O humanity˺ with good and evil as a trial, then to Us you will ˹all˺ be returned. Warning to the Polytheists

verses.text: When the disbelievers see you ˹O Prophet˺, they only make fun of you, ˹saying,˺ “Is this the one who speaks ˹ill˺ of your gods?” while they disbelieve at the mention of the Most Compassionate.
verses.translation: When the disbelievers see you ˹O Prophet˺, they only make fun of you, ˹saying,˺ “Is this the one who speaks ˹ill˺ of your gods?” while they disbelieve at the mention of the Most Compassionate.

verses.text: Humankind is made of haste. I will soon show you My signs, so do not ask Me to hasten them.
verses.translation: Humankind is made of haste. I will soon show you My signs, so do not ask Me to hasten them.

verses.text: They ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass if what you say is true?”
verses.translation: They ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass if what you say is true?”

verses.text: If only the disbelievers knew that a time will come when they will not be able to keep the Fire off their faces or backs, nor will they be helped.
verses.translation: If only the disbelievers knew that a time will come when they will not be able to keep the Fire off their faces or backs, nor will they be helped.

verses.text: In fact, the Hour will take them by surprise, leaving them stunned. So they will not be able to avert it, nor will it be delayed from them.
verses.translation: In fact, the Hour will take them by surprise, leaving them stunned. So they will not be able to avert it, nor will it be delayed from them.

verses.text: ˹Other˺ messengers had already been ridiculed before you ˹O Prophet˺, but those who mocked them were overtaken by what they used to ridicule. Questions to the Pagans
verses.translation: ˹Other˺ messengers had already been ridiculed before you ˹O Prophet˺, but those who mocked them were overtaken by what they used to ridicule. Questions to the Pagans

verses.text: Ask ˹them, O Prophet,˺ “Who can defend you by day or by night against the Most Compassionate?” Still they turn away from the remembrance of their Lord.
verses.translation: Ask ˹them, O Prophet,˺ “Who can defend you by day or by night against the Most Compassionate?” Still they turn away from the remembrance of their Lord.

verses.text: Or do they have gods—other than Us—that can protect them? They cannot ˹even˺ protect themselves, nor will they be aided against Us.
verses.translation: Or do they have gods—other than Us—that can protect them? They cannot ˹even˺ protect themselves, nor will they be aided against Us.

verses.text: In fact, We have allowed enjoyment for these ˹Meccans˺ and their forefathers for such a long time ˹that they took it for granted˺. Do they not see that We gradually reduce ˹their˺ land from its borders? Is it they who will then prevail? Warning of Torment
verses.translation: In fact, We have allowed enjoyment for these ˹Meccans˺ and their forefathers for such a long time ˹that they took it for granted˺. Do they not see that We gradually reduce ˹their˺ land from its borders? Is it they who will then prevail? Warning of Torment

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I warn you only by revelation.” But the deaf cannot hear the call when they are warned!
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I warn you only by revelation.” But the deaf cannot hear the call when they are warned!

verses.text: If they were touched by even a breath of your Lord’s torment, they would certainly cry, “Woe to us! We have really been wrongdoers.” Divine Justice
verses.translation: If they were touched by even a breath of your Lord’s torment, they would certainly cry, “Woe to us! We have really been wrongdoers.” Divine Justice

verses.text: We will set up the scales of justice on the Day of Judgment, so no soul will be wronged in the least. And ˹even˺ if a deed is the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as a ˹vigilant˺ Reckoner. The Torah
verses.translation: We will set up the scales of justice on the Day of Judgment, so no soul will be wronged in the least. And ˹even˺ if a deed is the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as a ˹vigilant˺ Reckoner. The Torah

verses.text: Indeed, We granted Moses and Aaron the standard ˹to distinguish between right and wrong˺—a light and a reminder for the righteous,
verses.translation: Indeed, We granted Moses and Aaron the standard ˹to distinguish between right and wrong˺—a light and a reminder for the righteous,

verses.text: who are in awe of their Lord without seeing Him,[627] and are fearful of the Hour. The Quran
verses.translation: who are in awe of their Lord without seeing Him,[627] and are fearful of the Hour. The Quran

verses.text: And this ˹Quran˺ is a blessed reminder which We have revealed. Will you ˹pagans˺ then deny it? Prophet Abraham
verses.translation: And this ˹Quran˺ is a blessed reminder which We have revealed. Will you ˹pagans˺ then deny it? Prophet Abraham

verses.text: And indeed, We had granted Abraham sound judgment early on, for We knew him well ˹to be worthy of it˺.
verses.translation: And indeed, We had granted Abraham sound judgment early on, for We knew him well ˹to be worthy of it˺.

verses.text: ˹Remember˺ when he questioned his father and his people, “What are these statues to which you are so devoted?”
verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when he questioned his father and his people, “What are these statues to which you are so devoted?”

verses.text: They replied, “We found our forefathers worshipping them.”
verses.translation: They replied, “We found our forefathers worshipping them.”

verses.text: He responded, “Indeed, you and your forefathers have been clearly astray.”
verses.translation: He responded, “Indeed, you and your forefathers have been clearly astray.”

verses.text: They asked, “Have you come to us with the truth, or is this a joke?”
verses.translation: They asked, “Have you come to us with the truth, or is this a joke?”

verses.text: He replied, “In fact, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them ˹both˺. And to that I bear witness.”
verses.translation: He replied, “In fact, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them ˹both˺. And to that I bear witness.”

verses.text: ˹Then he said to himself,˺ “By Allah! I will surely plot against your idols after you have turned your backs and gone away.”
verses.translation: ˹Then he said to himself,˺ “By Allah! I will surely plot against your idols after you have turned your backs and gone away.”

verses.text: So he smashed them into pieces, except the biggest of them, so they might turn to it ˹for answers˺. His People’s Reaction
verses.translation: So he smashed them into pieces, except the biggest of them, so they might turn to it ˹for answers˺. His People’s Reaction

verses.text: They protested, “Who dared do this to our gods? It must be an evildoer!”
verses.translation: They protested, “Who dared do this to our gods? It must be an evildoer!”

verses.text: Some said, “We heard a young man, called Abraham, speaking ˹ill˺ of them.”
verses.translation: Some said, “We heard a young man, called Abraham, speaking ˹ill˺ of them.”

verses.text: They demanded, “Bring him before the eyes of the people, so that they may witness ˹his trial˺.”
verses.translation: They demanded, “Bring him before the eyes of the people, so that they may witness ˹his trial˺.”

verses.text: They asked, “Was it you who did this to our gods, O Abraham?”
verses.translation: They asked, “Was it you who did this to our gods, O Abraham?”

verses.text: He replied ˹sarcastically˺, “No, this one—the biggest of them—did it! So ask them, if they can talk!”
verses.translation: He replied ˹sarcastically˺, “No, this one—the biggest of them—did it! So ask them, if they can talk!”

verses.text: So they came back to their senses, saying ˹to one another˺, “You yourselves are truly the wrongdoers!”
verses.translation: So they came back to their senses, saying ˹to one another˺, “You yourselves are truly the wrongdoers!”

verses.text: Then they ˹quickly˺ regressed to their ˹original˺ mind-set, ˹arguing,˺ “You already know that those ˹idols˺ cannot talk.”
verses.translation: Then they ˹quickly˺ regressed to their ˹original˺ mind-set, ˹arguing,˺ “You already know that those ˹idols˺ cannot talk.”

verses.text: He rebuked ˹them˺, “Do you then worship—instead of Allah—what can neither benefit nor harm you in any way?
verses.translation: He rebuked ˹them˺, “Do you then worship—instead of Allah—what can neither benefit nor harm you in any way?

verses.text: Shame on you and whatever you worship instead of Allah! Do you not have any sense?”
verses.translation: Shame on you and whatever you worship instead of Allah! Do you not have any sense?”

verses.text: They concluded, “Burn him up to avenge your gods, if you must act.” Abraham Prevails
verses.translation: They concluded, “Burn him up to avenge your gods, if you must act.” Abraham Prevails

verses.text: We ordered, “O fire! Be cool and safe for Abraham!”[628]
verses.translation: We ordered, “O fire! Be cool and safe for Abraham!”[628]

verses.text: They had sought to harm him, but We made them the worst losers.
verses.translation: They had sought to harm him, but We made them the worst losers.

verses.text: Then We delivered him, along with Lot, to the land We had showered with blessings for all people.[629]
verses.translation: Then We delivered him, along with Lot, to the land We had showered with blessings for all people.[629]

verses.text: And We blessed him with Isaac ˹as a son˺ and Jacob ˹as a grandson˺, as an additional favour—making all of them righteous.
verses.translation: And We blessed him with Isaac ˹as a son˺ and Jacob ˹as a grandson˺, as an additional favour—making all of them righteous.

verses.text: We ˹also˺ made them leaders, guiding by Our command, and inspired them to do good deeds, establish prayer, and pay alms-tax. And they were devoted to Our worship. Prophet Lot
verses.translation: We ˹also˺ made them leaders, guiding by Our command, and inspired them to do good deeds, establish prayer, and pay alms-tax. And they were devoted to Our worship. Prophet Lot

verses.text: And to Lot We gave wisdom and knowledge, and delivered him from the society engrossed in shameful practices. They were certainly an evil, rebellious people.
verses.translation: And to Lot We gave wisdom and knowledge, and delivered him from the society engrossed in shameful practices. They were certainly an evil, rebellious people.

verses.text: And We admitted him into Our mercy, ˹for˺ he was truly one of the righteous. Prophet Noah
verses.translation: And We admitted him into Our mercy, ˹for˺ he was truly one of the righteous. Prophet Noah

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when Noah had cried out to Us earlier, so We responded to him and delivered him and his family[630] from the great distress.
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when Noah had cried out to Us earlier, so We responded to him and delivered him and his family[630] from the great distress.

verses.text: And We made him prevail over those who had rejected Our signs. They were truly an evil people, so We drowned them all. Prophet David and Prophet Solomon
verses.translation: And We made him prevail over those who had rejected Our signs. They were truly an evil people, so We drowned them all. Prophet David and Prophet Solomon

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when David and Solomon passed judgment regarding the crops ruined ˹at night˺ by someone’s sheep, and We were witness to their judgments.
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when David and Solomon passed judgment regarding the crops ruined ˹at night˺ by someone’s sheep, and We were witness to their judgments.

verses.text: We guided ˹young˺ Solomon to a fairer settlement,[631] and granted each of them wisdom and knowledge. We subjected the mountains as well as the birds to hymn ˹Our praises˺ along with David. It is We Who did ˹it all˺.
verses.translation: We guided ˹young˺ Solomon to a fairer settlement,[631] and granted each of them wisdom and knowledge. We subjected the mountains as well as the birds to hymn ˹Our praises˺ along with David. It is We Who did ˹it all˺.

verses.text: We taught him the art of making body armour to protect you in battle. Will you then be grateful?
verses.translation: We taught him the art of making body armour to protect you in battle. Will you then be grateful?

verses.text: And to Solomon We subjected the raging winds, blowing by his command to the land We had showered with blessings. It is We Who know everything.
verses.translation: And to Solomon We subjected the raging winds, blowing by his command to the land We had showered with blessings. It is We Who know everything.

verses.text: And ˹We subjected˺ some jinn[632] that dived for him,[633] and performed other duties. It is We Who kept them in check. Prophet Job
verses.translation: And ˹We subjected˺ some jinn[632] that dived for him,[633] and performed other duties. It is We Who kept them in check. Prophet Job

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when Job cried out to his Lord, “I have been touched with adversity,[634] and You are the Most Merciful of the merciful.”
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when Job cried out to his Lord, “I have been touched with adversity,[634] and You are the Most Merciful of the merciful.”

verses.text: So We answered his prayer and removed his adversity, and gave him back his family, twice as many, as a mercy from Us and a lesson for the ˹devoted˺ worshippers. More Prophets
verses.translation: So We answered his prayer and removed his adversity, and gave him back his family, twice as many, as a mercy from Us and a lesson for the ˹devoted˺ worshippers. More Prophets

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ Ishmael, Enoch, and Ⱬul-Kifl.[635] They were all steadfast.
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ Ishmael, Enoch, and Ⱬul-Kifl.[635] They were all steadfast.

verses.text: We admitted them into Our mercy, for they were truly of the righteous. Prophet Jonah
verses.translation: We admitted them into Our mercy, for they were truly of the righteous. Prophet Jonah

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when the Man of the Whale stormed off ˹from his city˺ in a rage, thinking We would not restrain him.[636] Then in the ˹veils of˺ darkness[637] he cried out, “There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except You. Glory be to You! I have certainly done wrong.”
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when the Man of the Whale stormed off ˹from his city˺ in a rage, thinking We would not restrain him.[636] Then in the ˹veils of˺ darkness[637] he cried out, “There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except You. Glory be to You! I have certainly done wrong.”

verses.text: So We answered his prayer and rescued him from anguish. And so do We save the ˹true˺ believers. Prophet Zachariah
verses.translation: So We answered his prayer and rescued him from anguish. And so do We save the ˹true˺ believers. Prophet Zachariah

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when Zachariah cried out to his Lord, “My Lord! Do not leave me childless, though You are the Best of Successors.”[638]
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when Zachariah cried out to his Lord, “My Lord! Do not leave me childless, though You are the Best of Successors.”[638]

verses.text: So We answered his prayer, granted him John, and made his wife fertile. Indeed, they used to race in doing good, and call upon Us with hope and fear, totally humbling themselves before Us. Prophet Jesus and His Mother
verses.translation: So We answered his prayer, granted him John, and made his wife fertile. Indeed, they used to race in doing good, and call upon Us with hope and fear, totally humbling themselves before Us. Prophet Jesus and His Mother

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ the one who guarded her chastity, so We breathed into her through Our angel, ˹Gabriel,˺[639] making her and her son a sign for all peoples. One Way
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ the one who guarded her chastity, so We breathed into her through Our angel, ˹Gabriel,˺[639] making her and her son a sign for all peoples. One Way

verses.text: ˹O prophets!˺ Indeed, this religion of yours is ˹only˺ one, and I am your Lord, so worship Me ˹alone˺.
verses.translation: ˹O prophets!˺ Indeed, this religion of yours is ˹only˺ one, and I am your Lord, so worship Me ˹alone˺.

verses.text: Yet the people have divided it into sects. But to Us they will all return.
verses.translation: Yet the people have divided it into sects. But to Us they will all return.

verses.text: So whoever does good and is a believer will never be denied ˹the reward for˺ their striving, for We are recording it all. The People of Hell
verses.translation: So whoever does good and is a believer will never be denied ˹the reward for˺ their striving, for We are recording it all. The People of Hell

verses.text: It is impossible for a society which We have destroyed to ever rise again,
verses.translation: It is impossible for a society which We have destroyed to ever rise again,

verses.text: until ˹after˺ Gog and Magog have broken loose ˹from the barrier˺, [640] swarming down from every hill,
verses.translation: until ˹after˺ Gog and Magog have broken loose ˹from the barrier˺, [640] swarming down from every hill,

verses.text: ushering in the True Promise.[641] Then—behold!—the disbelievers will stare ˹in horror, crying,˺ “Oh, woe to us! We have truly been heedless of this. In fact, we have been wrongdoers.”
verses.translation: ushering in the True Promise.[641] Then—behold!—the disbelievers will stare ˹in horror, crying,˺ “Oh, woe to us! We have truly been heedless of this. In fact, we have been wrongdoers.”

verses.text: Certainly you ˹disbelievers˺ and whatever you worship instead of Allah will be the fuel of Hell.[642] You are ˹all˺ bound to enter it.
verses.translation: Certainly you ˹disbelievers˺ and whatever you worship instead of Allah will be the fuel of Hell.[642] You are ˹all˺ bound to enter it.

verses.text: Had those idols been ˹true˺ gods, they would not have entered it. And they will be there forever.
verses.translation: Had those idols been ˹true˺ gods, they would not have entered it. And they will be there forever.

verses.text: In it they will groan, and will not be able to hear. The People of Paradise
verses.translation: In it they will groan, and will not be able to hear. The People of Paradise

verses.text: Surely those for whom We have destined the finest reward will be kept far away from Hell,
verses.translation: Surely those for whom We have destined the finest reward will be kept far away from Hell,

verses.text: not even hearing the slightest hissing from it. And they will delight forever in what their souls desire.
verses.translation: not even hearing the slightest hissing from it. And they will delight forever in what their souls desire.

verses.text: The Supreme Horror ˹of that Day˺ will not disturb them, and the angels will greet them, ˹saying,˺ “This is your Day, which you have been promised.”
verses.translation: The Supreme Horror ˹of that Day˺ will not disturb them, and the angels will greet them, ˹saying,˺ “This is your Day, which you have been promised.”

verses.text: On that Day We will roll up the heavens like a scroll of writings. Just as We produced the first creation, ˹so˺ shall We reproduce it. That is a promise binding on Us. We truly uphold ˹Our promises˺!
verses.translation: On that Day We will roll up the heavens like a scroll of writings. Just as We produced the first creation, ˹so˺ shall We reproduce it. That is a promise binding on Us. We truly uphold ˹Our promises˺!

verses.text: Surely, following the ˹heavenly˺ Record, We decreed in the Scriptures: “My righteous servants shall inherit the land.”[643] Advice for the Prophet
verses.translation: Surely, following the ˹heavenly˺ Record, We decreed in the Scriptures: “My righteous servants shall inherit the land.”[643] Advice for the Prophet

verses.text: Surely this ˹Quran˺ is sufficient ˹as a reminder˺ for those devoted to worship.
verses.translation: Surely this ˹Quran˺ is sufficient ˹as a reminder˺ for those devoted to worship.

verses.text: We have sent you ˹O Prophet˺ only as a mercy for the whole world.
verses.translation: We have sent you ˹O Prophet˺ only as a mercy for the whole world.

verses.text: Say, “What has been revealed to me is this: ‘Your God is only One God.’ Will you then submit?”
verses.translation: Say, “What has been revealed to me is this: ‘Your God is only One God.’ Will you then submit?”

verses.text: If they turn away, then say, “I have warned you all equally. I do not know if what you are threatened with is near or far.
verses.translation: If they turn away, then say, “I have warned you all equally. I do not know if what you are threatened with is near or far.

verses.text: Allah surely knows what you say openly and whatever you hide.
verses.translation: Allah surely knows what you say openly and whatever you hide.

verses.text: I do not know if this ˹delay˺ is possibly a test for you and an enjoyment for a while.”
verses.translation: I do not know if this ˹delay˺ is possibly a test for you and an enjoyment for a while.”

verses.text: ˹In the end,˺ the Prophet said, “My Lord! Judge ˹between us˺ in truth. And our Lord is the Most Compassionate, Whose help is sought against what you claim.”[644] *** -- 290 of 694 --
verses.translation: ˹In the end,˺ the Prophet said, “My Lord! Judge ˹between us˺ in truth. And our Lord is the Most Compassionate, Whose help is sought against what you claim.”[644] *** -- 290 of 694 --

name: The Pilgrimage
intro: This Medinian sûrah takes its name from the passage that talks about pilgrimage rituals (verses 25-37), along with condemnations to the pagans for hindering the believers from reaching the Sacred House in Mecca. After fifteen years of persecution, here the believers receive the permission to fight back in self-defence (verse 39). Idolatry is condemned and the idols are rejected as pathetic, incapable of even creating a fly. In conclusion, the believers are told that they can achieve success through prayer and good deeds—a theme which extends to the beginning of the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful The Horror of Judgment Day

verses.text: O humanity! Fear your Lord, for the ˹violent˺ quaking at the Hour is surely a dreadful thing.
verses.translation: O humanity! Fear your Lord, for the ˹violent˺ quaking at the Hour is surely a dreadful thing.

verses.text: The Day you see it, every nursing mother will abandon what she is nursing, and every pregnant woman will deliver her burden ˹prematurely˺. And you will see people ˹as if they were˺ drunk, though they will not be drunk; but the torment of Allah is ˹terribly˺ severe. Denying Allah’s Might
verses.translation: The Day you see it, every nursing mother will abandon what she is nursing, and every pregnant woman will deliver her burden ˹prematurely˺. And you will see people ˹as if they were˺ drunk, though they will not be drunk; but the torment of Allah is ˹terribly˺ severe. Denying Allah’s Might

verses.text: ˹Still˺ there are some who dispute about Allah without knowledge, and follow every rebellious devil.
verses.translation: ˹Still˺ there are some who dispute about Allah without knowledge, and follow every rebellious devil.

verses.text: It has been decreed for such devils that whoever takes them as a guide will be misguided and led by them into the torment of the Blaze. Allah’s Power to Create
verses.translation: It has been decreed for such devils that whoever takes them as a guide will be misguided and led by them into the torment of the Blaze. Allah’s Power to Create

verses.text: O humanity! If you are in doubt about the Resurrection, then ˹know that˺ We did create you[645] from dust, then from a sperm-drop,[646] then ˹developed you into˺ a clinging clot ˹of blood˺,[647] then a lump of flesh[648] —fully formed or unformed[649]—in order to demonstrate ˹Our power˺ to you. ˹Then˺ We settle whatever ˹embryo˺ We will in the womb for an appointed term, then bring you forth as infants, so that you may reach your prime. Some of you ˹may˺ die ˹young˺, while others are left to reach the most feeble stage of life so that they may know nothing after having known much. And you see the earth lifeless, but as soon as We send down rain upon it, it begins to stir ˹to life˺ and swell, producing every type of pleasant plant.
verses.translation: O humanity! If you are in doubt about the Resurrection, then ˹know that˺ We did create you[645] from dust, then from a sperm-drop,[646] then ˹developed you into˺ a clinging clot ˹of blood˺,[647] then a lump of flesh[648] —fully formed or unformed[649]—in order to demonstrate ˹Our power˺ to you. ˹Then˺ We settle whatever ˹embryo˺ We will in the womb for an appointed term, then bring you forth as infants, so that you may reach your prime. Some of you ˹may˺ die ˹young˺, while others are left to reach the most feeble stage of life so that they may know nothing after having known much. And you see the earth lifeless, but as soon as We send down rain upon it, it begins to stir ˹to life˺ and swell, producing every type of pleasant plant.

verses.text: That is because Allah ˹alone˺ is the Truth, He ˹alone˺ gives life to the dead, and He ˹alone˺ is Most Capable of everything.
verses.translation: That is because Allah ˹alone˺ is the Truth, He ˹alone˺ gives life to the dead, and He ˹alone˺ is Most Capable of everything.

verses.text: And certainly the Hour is coming, there is no doubt about it. And Allah will surely resurrect those in the graves. Punishment of the Wicked
verses.translation: And certainly the Hour is coming, there is no doubt about it. And Allah will surely resurrect those in the graves. Punishment of the Wicked

verses.text: ˹Still˺ there are some who dispute about Allah without knowledge, guidance, or an enlightening scripture,
verses.translation: ˹Still˺ there are some who dispute about Allah without knowledge, guidance, or an enlightening scripture,

verses.text: turning away ˹in pride˺ to lead ˹others˺ astray from Allah’s Way. They will suffer disgrace in this world, and on the Day of Judgment We will make them taste the torment of burning.
verses.translation: turning away ˹in pride˺ to lead ˹others˺ astray from Allah’s Way. They will suffer disgrace in this world, and on the Day of Judgment We will make them taste the torment of burning.

verses.text: ˹They will be told,˺ “This is ˹the reward˺ for what your hands have done. And Allah is never unjust to ˹His˺ creation.” Half-Hearted Worship
verses.translation: ˹They will be told,˺ “This is ˹the reward˺ for what your hands have done. And Allah is never unjust to ˹His˺ creation.” Half-Hearted Worship

verses.text: And there are some who worship Allah on the verge ˹of faith˺: if they are blessed with something good, they are content with it; but if they are afflicted with a trial, they relapse ˹into disbelief˺,[650] losing this world and the Hereafter. That is ˹truly˺ the clearest loss.
verses.translation: And there are some who worship Allah on the verge ˹of faith˺: if they are blessed with something good, they are content with it; but if they are afflicted with a trial, they relapse ˹into disbelief˺,[650] losing this world and the Hereafter. That is ˹truly˺ the clearest loss.

verses.text: They call besides Allah what can neither harm nor benefit them. That is ˹truly˺ the farthest one can stray.
verses.translation: They call besides Allah what can neither harm nor benefit them. That is ˹truly˺ the farthest one can stray.

verses.text: They invoke those whose worship leads to harm, not benefit. What an evil patron and what an evil associate! Reward of True Believers
verses.translation: They invoke those whose worship leads to harm, not benefit. What an evil patron and what an evil associate! Reward of True Believers

verses.text: Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do good into Gardens, under which rivers flow. Surely Allah does what He wills. A Challenge to the Cynics
verses.translation: Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do good into Gardens, under which rivers flow. Surely Allah does what He wills. A Challenge to the Cynics

verses.text: Whoever thinks that Allah will not help His Prophet in this world and the Hereafter, let them stretch out a rope to the ceiling and strangle themselves, then let them see if this plan will do away with ˹the cause of˺ their rage.[651] The Sole Guide and Judge
verses.translation: Whoever thinks that Allah will not help His Prophet in this world and the Hereafter, let them stretch out a rope to the ceiling and strangle themselves, then let them see if this plan will do away with ˹the cause of˺ their rage.[651] The Sole Guide and Judge

verses.text: And so We revealed this ˹Quran˺ as clear verses. And Allah certainly guides whoever He wills.
verses.translation: And so We revealed this ˹Quran˺ as clear verses. And Allah certainly guides whoever He wills.

verses.text: Indeed, the believers, Jews, Sabians,[652] Christians, Magi,[653] and the polytheists—Allah will judge between them ˹all˺ on Judgment Day. Surely Allah is a Witness over all things. Submission to the Almighty
verses.translation: Indeed, the believers, Jews, Sabians,[652] Christians, Magi,[653] and the polytheists—Allah will judge between them ˹all˺ on Judgment Day. Surely Allah is a Witness over all things. Submission to the Almighty

verses.text: Do you not see that to Allah bow down ˹in submission˺[654] all those in the heavens and all those on the earth, as well as the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, and ˹all˺ living beings, as well as many humans, while many are deserving of punishment. And whoever Allah disgraces, none can honour. Surely Allah does what He wills. The Believers and Disbelievers
verses.translation: Do you not see that to Allah bow down ˹in submission˺[654] all those in the heavens and all those on the earth, as well as the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, and ˹all˺ living beings, as well as many humans, while many are deserving of punishment. And whoever Allah disgraces, none can honour. Surely Allah does what He wills. The Believers and Disbelievers

verses.text: These are two opposing groups that disagree about their Lord: as for the disbelievers, garments of Fire will be cut out for them and boiling water will be poured over their heads,
verses.translation: These are two opposing groups that disagree about their Lord: as for the disbelievers, garments of Fire will be cut out for them and boiling water will be poured over their heads,

verses.text: melting whatever is in their bellies, along with their skin.
verses.translation: melting whatever is in their bellies, along with their skin.

verses.text: And awaiting them are maces of iron.
verses.translation: And awaiting them are maces of iron.

verses.text: Whenever they try to escape from Hell—out of anguish—they will be forced back into it, ˹and will be told,˺ “Taste the torment of burning!”
verses.translation: Whenever they try to escape from Hell—out of anguish—they will be forced back into it, ˹and will be told,˺ “Taste the torment of burning!”

verses.text: ˹But˺ Allah will surely admit those who believe and do good into Gardens, under which rivers flow, where they will be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their clothing will be silk,
verses.translation: ˹But˺ Allah will surely admit those who believe and do good into Gardens, under which rivers flow, where they will be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their clothing will be silk,

verses.text: for they have been guided to the best of speech, and they have been guided to the Commendable Path. [655] Violating the Sacred Mosque[656]
verses.translation: for they have been guided to the best of speech, and they have been guided to the Commendable Path. [655] Violating the Sacred Mosque[656]

verses.text: Indeed, those who persist in disbelief and hinder ˹others˺ from the Way of Allah and from the Sacred Mosque[657]—which We have appointed for all people, residents and visitors alike—along with whoever intends to deviate by doing wrong in it,[658] We will cause them to taste a painful punishment. The Pilgrimage
verses.translation: Indeed, those who persist in disbelief and hinder ˹others˺ from the Way of Allah and from the Sacred Mosque[657]—which We have appointed for all people, residents and visitors alike—along with whoever intends to deviate by doing wrong in it,[658] We will cause them to taste a painful punishment. The Pilgrimage

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when We assigned to Abraham the site of the House, ˹saying,˺ “Do not associate anything with Me ˹in worship˺ and purify My House for those who circle ˹the Ka’bah˺, stand ˹in prayer˺, and bow and prostrate themselves.
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when We assigned to Abraham the site of the House, ˹saying,˺ “Do not associate anything with Me ˹in worship˺ and purify My House for those who circle ˹the Ka’bah˺, stand ˹in prayer˺, and bow and prostrate themselves.

verses.text: Call ˹all˺ people to the pilgrimage.[659] They will come to you on foot and on every lean camel from every distant path,
verses.translation: Call ˹all˺ people to the pilgrimage.[659] They will come to you on foot and on every lean camel from every distant path,

verses.text: so they may obtain the benefits ˹in store˺ for them,[660] and pronounce the Name of Allah on appointed days over the sacrificial animals He has provided for them. So eat from their meat and feed the desperately poor.
verses.translation: so they may obtain the benefits ˹in store˺ for them,[660] and pronounce the Name of Allah on appointed days over the sacrificial animals He has provided for them. So eat from their meat and feed the desperately poor.

verses.text: Then let them groom themselves,[661] fulfil their vows, and circle the Ancient House.” Total Devotion to Allah
verses.translation: Then let them groom themselves,[661] fulfil their vows, and circle the Ancient House.” Total Devotion to Allah

verses.text: That is so. And whoever honours the rituals of Allah, it is best for them in the sight of their Lord. The ˹meat of˺ cattle has been made lawful for you, except what has ˹already˺ been recited to you.[662] So shun the impurity of idolatry, and shun words of falsehood.
verses.translation: That is so. And whoever honours the rituals of Allah, it is best for them in the sight of their Lord. The ˹meat of˺ cattle has been made lawful for you, except what has ˹already˺ been recited to you.[662] So shun the impurity of idolatry, and shun words of falsehood.

verses.text: Be upright ˹in devotion˺ to Allah, associating none with Him ˹in worship˺. For whoever associates ˹others˺ with Allah is like someone who has fallen from the sky and is either snatched away by birds or swept by the wind to a remote place.
verses.translation: Be upright ˹in devotion˺ to Allah, associating none with Him ˹in worship˺. For whoever associates ˹others˺ with Allah is like someone who has fallen from the sky and is either snatched away by birds or swept by the wind to a remote place.

verses.text: That is so. And whoever honours the symbols of Allah, it is certainly out of the piety of the heart.
verses.translation: That is so. And whoever honours the symbols of Allah, it is certainly out of the piety of the heart.

verses.text: You may benefit from sacrificial animals for an appointed term,[663] then their place of sacrifice is at the Ancient House. Good News for the Humble
verses.translation: You may benefit from sacrificial animals for an appointed term,[663] then their place of sacrifice is at the Ancient House. Good News for the Humble

verses.text: For every community We appointed a rite of sacrifice so that they may pronounce the Name of Allah over the sacrificial animals He has provided for them. For your God is only One God, so submit yourselves to Him ˹alone˺. And give good news ˹O Prophet˺ to the humble:
verses.translation: For every community We appointed a rite of sacrifice so that they may pronounce the Name of Allah over the sacrificial animals He has provided for them. For your God is only One God, so submit yourselves to Him ˹alone˺. And give good news ˹O Prophet˺ to the humble:

verses.text: those whose hearts tremble at the remembrance of Allah, who patiently endure whatever may befall them, and who establish prayer and donate from what We have provided for them. Purpose of Sacrificial Animals
verses.translation: those whose hearts tremble at the remembrance of Allah, who patiently endure whatever may befall them, and who establish prayer and donate from what We have provided for them. Purpose of Sacrificial Animals

verses.text: We have made sacrificial camels ˹and cattle˺ among the symbols of Allah, in which there is ˹much˺ good for you. So pronounce the Name of Allah over them when they are lined up ˹for sacrifice˺. Once they have fallen ˹lifeless˺ on their sides, you may eat from their meat, and feed the needy—those who do not beg, and those who do. In this way We have subjected these ˹animals˺ to you so that you may be grateful.
verses.translation: We have made sacrificial camels ˹and cattle˺ among the symbols of Allah, in which there is ˹much˺ good for you. So pronounce the Name of Allah over them when they are lined up ˹for sacrifice˺. Once they have fallen ˹lifeless˺ on their sides, you may eat from their meat, and feed the needy—those who do not beg, and those who do. In this way We have subjected these ˹animals˺ to you so that you may be grateful.

verses.text: Neither their meat nor blood reaches Allah. Rather, it is your piety that reaches Him. This is how He has subjected them to you so that you may proclaim the greatness of Allah for what He has guided you to, and give good news to the good-doers. Permission to Fight in Self-Defence
verses.translation: Neither their meat nor blood reaches Allah. Rather, it is your piety that reaches Him. This is how He has subjected them to you so that you may proclaim the greatness of Allah for what He has guided you to, and give good news to the good-doers. Permission to Fight in Self-Defence

verses.text: Indeed, Allah defends those who believe. Surely Allah does not like whoever is deceitful, ungrateful.
verses.translation: Indeed, Allah defends those who believe. Surely Allah does not like whoever is deceitful, ungrateful.

verses.text: Permission ˹to fight back˺ is ˹hereby˺ granted to those being fought, for they have been wronged.[664] And Allah is truly Most Capable of helping them ˹prevail˺.
verses.translation: Permission ˹to fight back˺ is ˹hereby˺ granted to those being fought, for they have been wronged.[664] And Allah is truly Most Capable of helping them ˹prevail˺.

verses.text: ˹They are˺ those who have been expelled from their homes for no reason other than proclaiming: “Our Lord is Allah.” Had Allah not repelled ˹the aggression of˺ some people by means of others, destruction would have surely claimed monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques in which Allah’s Name is often mentioned. Allah will certainly help those who stand up for Him. Allah is truly All-Powerful, Almighty.
verses.translation: ˹They are˺ those who have been expelled from their homes for no reason other than proclaiming: “Our Lord is Allah.” Had Allah not repelled ˹the aggression of˺ some people by means of others, destruction would have surely claimed monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques in which Allah’s Name is often mentioned. Allah will certainly help those who stand up for Him. Allah is truly All-Powerful, Almighty.

verses.text: ˹They are˺ those who, if established in the land by Us, would perform prayer, pay alms-tax, encourage what is good, and forbid what is evil. And with Allah rests the outcome of all affairs. Warning to Meccan Pagans
