verses.translation: ˹They are˺ those who, if established in the land by Us, would perform prayer, pay alms-tax, encourage what is good, and forbid what is evil. And with Allah rests the outcome of all affairs. Warning to Meccan Pagans

verses.text: If they deny you ˹O Prophet˺, so did the people of Noah before them, as well as ˹the tribes of˺ ’Ȃd and Thamûd,
verses.translation: If they deny you ˹O Prophet˺, so did the people of Noah before them, as well as ˹the tribes of˺ ’Ȃd and Thamûd,

verses.text: the people of Abraham, the people of Lot,
verses.translation: the people of Abraham, the people of Lot,

verses.text: and the residents of Midian. And Moses was denied ˹too˺. But I delayed ˹the fate of˺ the disbelievers ˹until their appointed time˺ then seized them. And how severe was My response!
verses.translation: and the residents of Midian. And Moses was denied ˹too˺. But I delayed ˹the fate of˺ the disbelievers ˹until their appointed time˺ then seized them. And how severe was My response!

verses.text: Many are the societies We have destroyed for persisting in wrongdoing, leaving them in total ruin. ˹Many are˺ also the abandoned wells and lofty palaces!
verses.translation: Many are the societies We have destroyed for persisting in wrongdoing, leaving them in total ruin. ˹Many are˺ also the abandoned wells and lofty palaces!

verses.text: Have they not travelled throughout the land so their hearts may reason, and their ears may listen? Indeed, it is not the eyes that are blind, but it is the hearts in the chests that grow blind.
verses.translation: Have they not travelled throughout the land so their hearts may reason, and their ears may listen? Indeed, it is not the eyes that are blind, but it is the hearts in the chests that grow blind.

verses.text: They challenge you ˹O Prophet˺ to hasten the torment. And Allah will never fail in His promise. But a day with your Lord is indeed like a thousand years by your counting.
verses.translation: They challenge you ˹O Prophet˺ to hasten the torment. And Allah will never fail in His promise. But a day with your Lord is indeed like a thousand years by your counting.

verses.text: Many are the societies whose end We delayed while they did wrong, then seized them. And to Me is the final return. The Prophet’s Duty
verses.translation: Many are the societies whose end We delayed while they did wrong, then seized them. And to Me is the final return. The Prophet’s Duty

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “O humanity! I am only sent to you with a clear warning.
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “O humanity! I am only sent to you with a clear warning.

verses.text: So those who believe and do good will have forgiveness and an honourable provision.
verses.translation: So those who believe and do good will have forgiveness and an honourable provision.

verses.text: But those who strive to discredit Our revelations, they will be the residents of the Hellfire.” Satan’s Influence
verses.translation: But those who strive to discredit Our revelations, they will be the residents of the Hellfire.” Satan’s Influence

verses.text: Whenever We sent a messenger or a prophet before you ˹O Prophet˺ and he recited ˹Our revelations˺, Satan would influence ˹people’s understanding of˺ his recitation. But ˹eventually˺ Allah would eliminate Satan’s influence. Then Allah would ˹firmly˺ establish His revelations. And Allah is All- Knowing, All-Wise.
verses.translation: Whenever We sent a messenger or a prophet before you ˹O Prophet˺ and he recited ˹Our revelations˺, Satan would influence ˹people’s understanding of˺ his recitation. But ˹eventually˺ Allah would eliminate Satan’s influence. Then Allah would ˹firmly˺ establish His revelations. And Allah is All- Knowing, All-Wise.

verses.text: All that so He may make Satan’s influence a trial for those ˹hypocrites˺ whose hearts are sick and those ˹disbelievers˺ whose hearts are hardened. Surely the wrongdoers are totally engrossed in opposition.
verses.translation: All that so He may make Satan’s influence a trial for those ˹hypocrites˺ whose hearts are sick and those ˹disbelievers˺ whose hearts are hardened. Surely the wrongdoers are totally engrossed in opposition.

verses.text: ˹This is˺ also so that those gifted with knowledge would know that this ˹revelation˺ is the truth from your Lord, so they have faith in it, and so their hearts would submit humbly to it. And Allah surely guides the believers to the Straight Path.
verses.translation: ˹This is˺ also so that those gifted with knowledge would know that this ˹revelation˺ is the truth from your Lord, so they have faith in it, and so their hearts would submit humbly to it. And Allah surely guides the believers to the Straight Path.

verses.text: Yet the disbelievers will persist in doubt about this ˹revelation˺ until the Hour takes them by surprise, or the torment of a terminating[665] Day comes to them. Justice on Judgment Day
verses.translation: Yet the disbelievers will persist in doubt about this ˹revelation˺ until the Hour takes them by surprise, or the torment of a terminating[665] Day comes to them. Justice on Judgment Day

verses.text: All authority on that Day is for Allah ˹alone˺.[666] He will judge between them. So those who believe and do good will be in the Gardens of Bliss.
verses.translation: All authority on that Day is for Allah ˹alone˺.[666] He will judge between them. So those who believe and do good will be in the Gardens of Bliss.

verses.text: But those who disbelieve and deny Our revelations, it is they who will suffer a humiliating punishment.
verses.translation: But those who disbelieve and deny Our revelations, it is they who will suffer a humiliating punishment.

verses.text: As for those who emigrate in the cause of Allah and then are martyred or die, Allah will indeed grant them a good provision. Surely Allah is the Best Provider.
verses.translation: As for those who emigrate in the cause of Allah and then are martyred or die, Allah will indeed grant them a good provision. Surely Allah is the Best Provider.

verses.text: He will certainly admit them into a place they will be pleased with. For Allah is truly All-Knowing, Most Forbearing. Divine Justice
verses.translation: He will certainly admit them into a place they will be pleased with. For Allah is truly All-Knowing, Most Forbearing. Divine Justice

verses.text: That is so. And whoever retaliates in equivalence to the injury they have received, and then are wronged ˹again˺, Allah will certainly help them. Surely Allah is Ever-Pardoning, All-Forgiving. Allah’s Power
verses.translation: That is so. And whoever retaliates in equivalence to the injury they have received, and then are wronged ˹again˺, Allah will certainly help them. Surely Allah is Ever-Pardoning, All-Forgiving. Allah’s Power

verses.text: That is because Allah causes the night to merge into the day, and the day into the night. Indeed, Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
verses.translation: That is because Allah causes the night to merge into the day, and the day into the night. Indeed, Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

verses.text: That is because Allah ˹alone˺ is the Truth and what they invoke besides Him is falsehood, and Allah ˹alone˺ is truly the Most High, All-Great.
verses.translation: That is because Allah ˹alone˺ is the Truth and what they invoke besides Him is falsehood, and Allah ˹alone˺ is truly the Most High, All-Great.

verses.text: Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky, then the earth becomes green? Surely Allah is Most Subtle, All-Aware.
verses.translation: Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky, then the earth becomes green? Surely Allah is Most Subtle, All-Aware.

verses.text: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Allah ˹alone˺ is truly the Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy. Allah’s Grace
verses.translation: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Allah ˹alone˺ is truly the Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy. Allah’s Grace

verses.text: Do you not see that Allah has subjected to you[667] whatever is in the earth as well as the ships ˹that˺ sail through the sea by His command? He keeps the sky from falling down on the earth except by His permission. Surely Allah is Ever Gracious and Most Merciful to humanity.
verses.translation: Do you not see that Allah has subjected to you[667] whatever is in the earth as well as the ships ˹that˺ sail through the sea by His command? He keeps the sky from falling down on the earth except by His permission. Surely Allah is Ever Gracious and Most Merciful to humanity.

verses.text: And He is the One Who gave you life, then will cause you to die, and then will bring you back to life. ˹But˺ surely humankind is ever ungrateful. One Message, Different Laws
verses.translation: And He is the One Who gave you life, then will cause you to die, and then will bring you back to life. ˹But˺ surely humankind is ever ungrateful. One Message, Different Laws

verses.text: For every community We appointed a code[668] of life to follow.[669] So do not let them dispute with you ˹O Prophet˺ in this matter. And invite ˹all˺ to your Lord, for you are truly on the Right Guidance.
verses.translation: For every community We appointed a code[668] of life to follow.[669] So do not let them dispute with you ˹O Prophet˺ in this matter. And invite ˹all˺ to your Lord, for you are truly on the Right Guidance.

verses.text: But if they argue with you, then say, “Allah knows best what you do.”
verses.translation: But if they argue with you, then say, “Allah knows best what you do.”

verses.text: Allah will judge between you ˹all˺ on Judgment Day regarding your differences.
verses.translation: Allah will judge between you ˹all˺ on Judgment Day regarding your differences.

verses.text: Do you not know that Allah ˹fully˺ knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth? Surely it is all ˹written˺ in a Record. That is certainly easy for Allah. Almighty Allah or False Gods?
verses.translation: Do you not know that Allah ˹fully˺ knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth? Surely it is all ˹written˺ in a Record. That is certainly easy for Allah. Almighty Allah or False Gods?

verses.text: Yet they worship besides Allah that for which He has sent down no authority, and of which they have no knowledge. The wrongdoers will have no helper.
verses.translation: Yet they worship besides Allah that for which He has sent down no authority, and of which they have no knowledge. The wrongdoers will have no helper.

verses.text: Whenever Our clear revelations are recited to them, you ˹O Prophet˺ recognize rage on the faces of the disbelievers, as if they are going to snap at those who recite Our revelations to them. Say, “Shall I inform you of something far more enraging than that? ˹It is˺ the Fire with which Allah has threatened those who disbelieve. What an evil destination!” The Fly Challenge
verses.translation: Whenever Our clear revelations are recited to them, you ˹O Prophet˺ recognize rage on the faces of the disbelievers, as if they are going to snap at those who recite Our revelations to them. Say, “Shall I inform you of something far more enraging than that? ˹It is˺ the Fire with which Allah has threatened those who disbelieve. What an evil destination!” The Fly Challenge

verses.text: O humanity! A lesson is set forth, so listen to it ˹carefully˺: those ˹idols˺ you invoke besides Allah can never create ˹so much as˺ a fly, even if they ˹all˺ were to come together for that. And if a fly were to snatch anything away from them, they cannot ˹even˺ retrieve it from the fly. How powerless are those who invoke and those invoked![670]
verses.translation: O humanity! A lesson is set forth, so listen to it ˹carefully˺: those ˹idols˺ you invoke besides Allah can never create ˹so much as˺ a fly, even if they ˹all˺ were to come together for that. And if a fly were to snatch anything away from them, they cannot ˹even˺ retrieve it from the fly. How powerless are those who invoke and those invoked![670]

verses.text: They have not shown Allah the reverence He deserves. Surely Allah is All-Powerful, Almighty. Divine Choice
verses.translation: They have not shown Allah the reverence He deserves. Surely Allah is All-Powerful, Almighty. Divine Choice

verses.text: Allah selects messengers from both angels and people, for Allah is truly All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
verses.translation: Allah selects messengers from both angels and people, for Allah is truly All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

verses.text: He knows what is ahead of them and what is behind them. And to Allah ˹all˺ matters will be returned ˹for judgment˺. Advice to the Believers
verses.translation: He knows what is ahead of them and what is behind them. And to Allah ˹all˺ matters will be returned ˹for judgment˺. Advice to the Believers

verses.text: O believers! Bow down, prostrate yourselves, worship your Lord, and do ˹what is˺ good so that you may be successful.
verses.translation: O believers! Bow down, prostrate yourselves, worship your Lord, and do ˹what is˺ good so that you may be successful.

verses.text: Strive for ˹the cause of˺ Allah in the way He deserves, for ˹it is˺ He ˹Who˺ has chosen you, and laid upon you no hardship in the religion—the way of your forefather Abraham. ˹It is Allah˺ Who named you ‘the ones who submit’[671] ˹in the˺ earlier ˹Scriptures˺ and in this ˹Quran˺, so that the Messenger may be a witness over you, and that you may be witnesses over humanity. So establish prayer, pay alms-tax, and hold fast to Allah. He ˹alone˺ is your Guardian. What an excellent Guardian, and what an excellent Helper! *** -- 298 of 694 --
verses.translation: Strive for ˹the cause of˺ Allah in the way He deserves, for ˹it is˺ He ˹Who˺ has chosen you, and laid upon you no hardship in the religion—the way of your forefather Abraham. ˹It is Allah˺ Who named you ‘the ones who submit’[671] ˹in the˺ earlier ˹Scriptures˺ and in this ˹Quran˺, so that the Messenger may be a witness over you, and that you may be witnesses over humanity. So establish prayer, pay alms-tax, and hold fast to Allah. He ˹alone˺ is your Guardian. What an excellent Guardian, and what an excellent Helper! *** -- 298 of 694 --

name: The Believers
intro: This Meccan sûrah emphasizes that the believers are guaranteed success (verse 1), whereas the disbelievers are bound to fail (verse 117). Like the previous sûrah, it makes the case for Allah’s oneness as well as His power to create and resurrect. The last part is dedicated to the judgment of the believers and the disbelievers, focusing on the fate of the wicked who abuse the believers. This theme extends to the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful The True Believers

verses.text: Successful indeed are the believers:
verses.translation: Successful indeed are the believers:

verses.text: those who humble themselves in prayer;
verses.translation: those who humble themselves in prayer;

verses.text: those who avoid idle talk;
verses.translation: those who avoid idle talk;

verses.text: those who pay alms-tax;[672]
verses.translation: those who pay alms-tax;[672]

verses.text: those who guard their chastity[673]
verses.translation: those who guard their chastity[673]

verses.text: except with their wives or those ˹bondwomen˺ in their possession,[674] for then they are free from blame,
verses.translation: except with their wives or those ˹bondwomen˺ in their possession,[674] for then they are free from blame,

verses.text: but whoever seeks beyond that are the transgressors;
verses.translation: but whoever seeks beyond that are the transgressors;

verses.text: ˹the believers are also˺ those who are true to their trusts and covenants;
verses.translation: ˹the believers are also˺ those who are true to their trusts and covenants;

verses.text: and those who are ˹properly˺ observant of their prayers.
verses.translation: and those who are ˹properly˺ observant of their prayers.

verses.text: These are the ones who will be awarded
verses.translation: These are the ones who will be awarded

verses.text: Paradise as their own.[675] They will be there forever. The Creation of Humans
verses.translation: Paradise as their own.[675] They will be there forever. The Creation of Humans

verses.text: And indeed, We created humankind[676] from an extract of clay,
verses.translation: And indeed, We created humankind[676] from an extract of clay,

verses.text: then placed each ˹human˺ as a sperm-drop[677] in a secure place,
verses.translation: then placed each ˹human˺ as a sperm-drop[677] in a secure place,

verses.text: then We developed the drop into a clinging clot ˹of blood˺, then developed the clot into a lump ˹of flesh˺, then developed the lump into bones, then clothed the bones with flesh, then We brought it into being as a new creation.[678] So Blessed is Allah, the Best of Creators.
verses.translation: then We developed the drop into a clinging clot ˹of blood˺, then developed the clot into a lump ˹of flesh˺, then developed the lump into bones, then clothed the bones with flesh, then We brought it into being as a new creation.[678] So Blessed is Allah, the Best of Creators.

verses.text: After that you will surely die,
verses.translation: After that you will surely die,

verses.text: then on the Day of Judgment you will be resurrected. Allah’s Power
verses.translation: then on the Day of Judgment you will be resurrected. Allah’s Power

verses.text: And indeed, We created above you seven levels ˹of heaven˺. We are never unmindful of ˹Our˺ creation.
verses.translation: And indeed, We created above you seven levels ˹of heaven˺. We are never unmindful of ˹Our˺ creation.

verses.text: We send down rain from the sky in perfect measure, causing it to soak into the earth. And We are surely able to take it away.
verses.translation: We send down rain from the sky in perfect measure, causing it to soak into the earth. And We are surely able to take it away.

verses.text: With it We produce for you gardens of palm trees and grapevines, in which there are abundant fruits, and from which you may eat,
verses.translation: With it We produce for you gardens of palm trees and grapevines, in which there are abundant fruits, and from which you may eat,

verses.text: as well as ˹olive˺ trees which grow at Mount Sinai, providing oil and a condiment to eat.
verses.translation: as well as ˹olive˺ trees which grow at Mount Sinai, providing oil and a condiment to eat.

verses.text: And there is certainly a lesson for you in cattle, from whose bellies We give you ˹milk˺ to drink, and in them are many other benefits for you, and from them you may eat.
verses.translation: And there is certainly a lesson for you in cattle, from whose bellies We give you ˹milk˺ to drink, and in them are many other benefits for you, and from them you may eat.

verses.text: And you are carried upon ˹some of˺ them and upon ships. Prophet Noah
verses.translation: And you are carried upon ˹some of˺ them and upon ships. Prophet Noah

verses.text: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people. He declared, “O my people! Worship Allah ˹alone˺. You have no god other than Him. Will you not then fear ˹Him˺?”
verses.translation: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people. He declared, “O my people! Worship Allah ˹alone˺. You have no god other than Him. Will you not then fear ˹Him˺?”

verses.text: But the disbelieving chiefs of his people said ˹to the masses˺, “This is only a human like you, who wants to be superior to you. Had Allah willed, He could have easily sent down angels ˹instead˺. We have never heard of this in ˹the history of˺ our forefathers.
verses.translation: But the disbelieving chiefs of his people said ˹to the masses˺, “This is only a human like you, who wants to be superior to you. Had Allah willed, He could have easily sent down angels ˹instead˺. We have never heard of this in ˹the history of˺ our forefathers.

verses.text: He is simply insane, so bear with him for a while.”[679] The Flood
verses.translation: He is simply insane, so bear with him for a while.”[679] The Flood

verses.text: Noah prayed, “My Lord! Help me, because they have denied ˹me˺.”
verses.translation: Noah prayed, “My Lord! Help me, because they have denied ˹me˺.”

verses.text: So We inspired him: “Build the Ark under Our ˹watchful˺ Eyes and directions. Then when Our command comes and the oven bursts ˹with water˺,[680] take on board a pair from every species along with your family —except those against whom the decree ˹to drown˺ has already been passed. And do not plead with Me for those who have done wrong, for they will surely be drowned.”
verses.translation: So We inspired him: “Build the Ark under Our ˹watchful˺ Eyes and directions. Then when Our command comes and the oven bursts ˹with water˺,[680] take on board a pair from every species along with your family —except those against whom the decree ˹to drown˺ has already been passed. And do not plead with Me for those who have done wrong, for they will surely be drowned.”

verses.text: Then when you and those with you have settled in the Ark, say, “All praise is for Allah, Who saved us from the wrongdoing people.”
verses.translation: Then when you and those with you have settled in the Ark, say, “All praise is for Allah, Who saved us from the wrongdoing people.”

verses.text: And pray, “My Lord! Allow me a blessed landing, for You are the best accommodator.”
verses.translation: And pray, “My Lord! Allow me a blessed landing, for You are the best accommodator.”

verses.text: Surely in this are lessons.[681] And We ˹always˺ put ˹people˺ to the test. Prophet Hûd[682]
verses.translation: Surely in this are lessons.[681] And We ˹always˺ put ˹people˺ to the test. Prophet Hûd[682]

verses.text: Then We raised another generation after them,
verses.translation: Then We raised another generation after them,

verses.text: and sent to them a messenger from among themselves, ˹declaring,˺ “Worship Allah ˹alone˺. You have no god other than Him. Will you not then fear ˹Him˺?”
verses.translation: and sent to them a messenger from among themselves, ˹declaring,˺ “Worship Allah ˹alone˺. You have no god other than Him. Will you not then fear ˹Him˺?”

verses.text: But the chiefs of his people—who disbelieved, denied the meeting ˹with Allah˺ in the Hereafter, and were spoiled by the worldly luxuries We had provided for them—said ˹to the masses˺, “This is only a human like you. He eats what you eat, and drinks what you drink.
verses.translation: But the chiefs of his people—who disbelieved, denied the meeting ˹with Allah˺ in the Hereafter, and were spoiled by the worldly luxuries We had provided for them—said ˹to the masses˺, “This is only a human like you. He eats what you eat, and drinks what you drink.

verses.text: And if you ˹ever˺ obey a human like yourselves, then you would certainly be losers.
verses.translation: And if you ˹ever˺ obey a human like yourselves, then you would certainly be losers.

verses.text: Does he promise you that once you are dead and reduced to dust and bones, you will be brought forth ˹alive˺?
verses.translation: Does he promise you that once you are dead and reduced to dust and bones, you will be brought forth ˹alive˺?

verses.text: Impossible, simply impossible is what you are promised!
verses.translation: Impossible, simply impossible is what you are promised!

verses.text: There is nothing beyond our worldly life. We die, others are born, and none will be resurrected.
verses.translation: There is nothing beyond our worldly life. We die, others are born, and none will be resurrected.

verses.text: He is no more than a man who has fabricated a lie about Allah, and we will never believe in him.” The Blast
verses.translation: He is no more than a man who has fabricated a lie about Allah, and we will never believe in him.” The Blast

verses.text: The messenger prayed, “My Lord! Help me, because they have denied ˹me˺.”
verses.translation: The messenger prayed, “My Lord! Help me, because they have denied ˹me˺.”

verses.text: Allah responded, “Soon they will be truly regretful.”
verses.translation: Allah responded, “Soon they will be truly regretful.”

verses.text: Then the ˹mighty˺ blast overtook them with justice, and We reduced them to rubble. So away with the wrongdoing people! More Prophets
verses.translation: Then the ˹mighty˺ blast overtook them with justice, and We reduced them to rubble. So away with the wrongdoing people! More Prophets

verses.text: Then We raised other generations after them.
verses.translation: Then We raised other generations after them.

verses.text: No people can advance their doom, nor can they delay it.
verses.translation: No people can advance their doom, nor can they delay it.

verses.text: Then We sent Our messengers in succession: whenever a messenger came to his people, they denied him. So We destroyed them, one after the other, reducing them to ˹cautionary˺ tales. So away with the people who refuse to believe! Prophet Moses and Prophet Aaron
verses.translation: Then We sent Our messengers in succession: whenever a messenger came to his people, they denied him. So We destroyed them, one after the other, reducing them to ˹cautionary˺ tales. So away with the people who refuse to believe! Prophet Moses and Prophet Aaron

verses.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs[683] and compelling proof
verses.translation: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs[683] and compelling proof

verses.text: to Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they behaved arrogantly and were a tyrannical people.
verses.translation: to Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they behaved arrogantly and were a tyrannical people.

verses.text: They argued, “Will we believe in two humans, like ourselves, whose people are slaves to us?”
verses.translation: They argued, “Will we believe in two humans, like ourselves, whose people are slaves to us?”

verses.text: So they rejected them both, and ˹so˺ were among those destroyed.
verses.translation: So they rejected them both, and ˹so˺ were among those destroyed.

verses.text: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture, so perhaps his people would be ˹rightly˺ guided. Prophet Jesus and His Mother
verses.translation: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture, so perhaps his people would be ˹rightly˺ guided. Prophet Jesus and His Mother

verses.text: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign, and gave them refuge on high ground—a ˹suitable˺ place for rest with flowing water. One Way
verses.translation: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign, and gave them refuge on high ground—a ˹suitable˺ place for rest with flowing water. One Way

verses.text: O messengers! Eat from what is good and lawful, and act righteously. Indeed, I fully know what you do.
verses.translation: O messengers! Eat from what is good and lawful, and act righteously. Indeed, I fully know what you do.

verses.text: Surely this religion of yours is ˹only˺ one, and I am your Lord, so fear Me ˹alone˺.
verses.translation: Surely this religion of yours is ˹only˺ one, and I am your Lord, so fear Me ˹alone˺.

verses.text: Yet the people have divided it into different sects, each rejoicing in what they have.
verses.translation: Yet the people have divided it into different sects, each rejoicing in what they have.

verses.text: So leave them ˹O Prophet˺ in their heedlessness for a while.
verses.translation: So leave them ˹O Prophet˺ in their heedlessness for a while.

verses.text: Do they think, since We provide them with wealth and children,
verses.translation: Do they think, since We provide them with wealth and children,

verses.text: that We hasten to ˹honour˺ them ˹with˺ all kinds of good? No! They are not aware. The True Believers
verses.translation: that We hasten to ˹honour˺ them ˹with˺ all kinds of good? No! They are not aware. The True Believers

verses.text: Surely those who tremble in awe of their Lord,
verses.translation: Surely those who tremble in awe of their Lord,

verses.text: and who believe in the revelations of their Lord,
verses.translation: and who believe in the revelations of their Lord,

verses.text: and who associate none with their Lord,
verses.translation: and who associate none with their Lord,

verses.text: and who do whatever ˹good˺ they do with their hearts fearful, ˹knowing˺ that they will return to their Lord[684]—
verses.translation: and who do whatever ˹good˺ they do with their hearts fearful, ˹knowing˺ that they will return to their Lord[684]—

verses.text: it is they who race to do good deeds, always taking the lead.
verses.translation: it is they who race to do good deeds, always taking the lead.

verses.text: We never require of any soul more than what it can afford. And with Us is a record which speaks the truth. None will be wronged. The Disbelievers
verses.translation: We never require of any soul more than what it can afford. And with Us is a record which speaks the truth. None will be wronged. The Disbelievers

verses.text: But the hearts of those ˹who disbelieve˺ are oblivious to ˹all of˺ this,[685] and they have other ˹evil˺ deeds, opposite to this, in which they are engrossed.
verses.translation: But the hearts of those ˹who disbelieve˺ are oblivious to ˹all of˺ this,[685] and they have other ˹evil˺ deeds, opposite to this, in which they are engrossed.

verses.text: But as soon as We seize their elite with torment, they start to cry for help.
verses.translation: But as soon as We seize their elite with torment, they start to cry for help.

verses.text: ˹They will be told,˺ “Do not cry for help today. Surely you will never be saved from Us.
verses.translation: ˹They will be told,˺ “Do not cry for help today. Surely you will never be saved from Us.

verses.text: Indeed, My revelations were recited to you, but you used to back away ˹in disgust˺,
verses.translation: Indeed, My revelations were recited to you, but you used to back away ˹in disgust˺,

verses.text: boasting of the Sacred House, and babbling ˹nonsense about the Quran˺ by night.” Why the Denial?
verses.translation: boasting of the Sacred House, and babbling ˹nonsense about the Quran˺ by night.” Why the Denial?

verses.text: Is it because they have never contemplated the Word ˹of Allah˺? Or ˹because˺ there has come to them something that did not come to their forefathers?
verses.translation: Is it because they have never contemplated the Word ˹of Allah˺? Or ˹because˺ there has come to them something that did not come to their forefathers?

verses.text: Or ˹because˺ they failed to recognize their Messenger, and so they denied him?
verses.translation: Or ˹because˺ they failed to recognize their Messenger, and so they denied him?

verses.text: Or ˹because˺ they say, “He is insane?” In fact, he has come to them with the truth, but most of them are resentful of the truth.
verses.translation: Or ˹because˺ they say, “He is insane?” In fact, he has come to them with the truth, but most of them are resentful of the truth.

verses.text: Had the truth followed their desires,[686] the heavens, the earth, and all those in them would have certainly been corrupted. In fact, We have brought them ˹the means to˺ their glory, but they turn away from it.
verses.translation: Had the truth followed their desires,[686] the heavens, the earth, and all those in them would have certainly been corrupted. In fact, We have brought them ˹the means to˺ their glory, but they turn away from it.

verses.text: Or ˹is it because˺ you ˹O Prophet˺ are asking them for tribute? But the reward of your Lord is best, for He is the Best Provider.
verses.translation: Or ˹is it because˺ you ˹O Prophet˺ are asking them for tribute? But the reward of your Lord is best, for He is the Best Provider.

verses.text: And surely you are calling them to the Straight Path,
verses.translation: And surely you are calling them to the Straight Path,

verses.text: but those who disbelieve in the Hereafter are certainly deviating from that Path. Those Persisting in Denial
verses.translation: but those who disbelieve in the Hereafter are certainly deviating from that Path. Those Persisting in Denial

verses.text: ˹Even˺ if We had mercy on them and removed their affliction,[687] they would still persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.
verses.translation: ˹Even˺ if We had mercy on them and removed their affliction,[687] they would still persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.

verses.text: And We have already seized them with torment, but they never humbled themselves to their Lord, nor did they ˹submissively˺ appeal ˹to Him˺.
verses.translation: And We have already seized them with torment, but they never humbled themselves to their Lord, nor did they ˹submissively˺ appeal ˹to Him˺.

verses.text: But as soon as We open for them a gate of severe punishment, they will be utterly desperate. Ingratitude to the Almighty
verses.translation: But as soon as We open for them a gate of severe punishment, they will be utterly desperate. Ingratitude to the Almighty

verses.text: He is the One Who created for you hearing, sight, and intellect. ˹Yet˺ you hardly give any thanks.
verses.translation: He is the One Who created for you hearing, sight, and intellect. ˹Yet˺ you hardly give any thanks.

verses.text: And He is the One Who has dispersed you ˹all˺ over the earth, and to Him you will ˹all˺ be gathered.
verses.translation: And He is the One Who has dispersed you ˹all˺ over the earth, and to Him you will ˹all˺ be gathered.

verses.text: And He is the One Who gives life and causes death, and to Him belongs the alternation of the day and night. Will you not then understand?
verses.translation: And He is the One Who gives life and causes death, and to Him belongs the alternation of the day and night. Will you not then understand?

verses.text: But they ˹just˺ say what their predecessors said.
verses.translation: But they ˹just˺ say what their predecessors said.

verses.text: They said, “Once we are dead and reduced to dust and bones, will we really be resurrected?
verses.translation: They said, “Once we are dead and reduced to dust and bones, will we really be resurrected?

verses.text: We have already been promised this, as well as our forefathers earlier. This is nothing but ancient fables!” Almighty Allah
verses.translation: We have already been promised this, as well as our forefathers earlier. This is nothing but ancient fables!” Almighty Allah

verses.text: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “To whom belong the earth and all those on it, if you ˹really˺ know?”
verses.translation: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “To whom belong the earth and all those on it, if you ˹really˺ know?”

verses.text: They will reply, “To Allah!” Say, “Why are you not then mindful?”
verses.translation: They will reply, “To Allah!” Say, “Why are you not then mindful?”

verses.text: ˹And˺ ask ˹them˺, “Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the Mighty Throne?”
verses.translation: ˹And˺ ask ˹them˺, “Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the Mighty Throne?”

verses.text: They will reply, “Allah.” Say, “Will you not then fear ˹Him˺?”
verses.translation: They will reply, “Allah.” Say, “Will you not then fear ˹Him˺?”

verses.text: Ask ˹them also,˺ “In Whose Hands is the authority over all things, protecting ˹all˺ while none can protect against Him, if you ˹really˺ know?”
verses.translation: Ask ˹them also,˺ “In Whose Hands is the authority over all things, protecting ˹all˺ while none can protect against Him, if you ˹really˺ know?”

verses.text: They will reply, “Allah.” Say, “How are you then so deluded?”
verses.translation: They will reply, “Allah.” Say, “How are you then so deluded?”

verses.text: In fact, We have brought them the truth, and they are certainly liars. One True God
verses.translation: In fact, We have brought them the truth, and they are certainly liars. One True God

verses.text: Allah has never had ˹any˺ offspring, nor is there any god besides Him. Otherwise, each god would have taken away what he created, and they would have tried to dominate one another. Glorified is Allah above what they claim!
verses.translation: Allah has never had ˹any˺ offspring, nor is there any god besides Him. Otherwise, each god would have taken away what he created, and they would have tried to dominate one another. Glorified is Allah above what they claim!

verses.text: ˹He is the˺ Knower of the seen and unseen. Exalted is He above what they associate ˹with Him˺. Advice to the Prophet
verses.translation: ˹He is the˺ Knower of the seen and unseen. Exalted is He above what they associate ˹with Him˺. Advice to the Prophet

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “My Lord! Should You show me what they[688] are threatened with,
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “My Lord! Should You show me what they[688] are threatened with,

verses.text: then, my Lord, do not count me among the wrongdoing people.”
verses.translation: then, my Lord, do not count me among the wrongdoing people.”

verses.text: We are indeed able to show you what We have threatened them with.
verses.translation: We are indeed able to show you what We have threatened them with.

verses.text: Respond to evil with what is best. We know well what they claim. [689]
verses.translation: Respond to evil with what is best. We know well what they claim. [689]

verses.text: And say, “My Lord! I seek refuge in You from the temptations of the devils.
verses.translation: And say, “My Lord! I seek refuge in You from the temptations of the devils.

verses.text: And I seek refuge in You, my Lord, that they ˹even˺ come near me.” Too Late for the Wicked
verses.translation: And I seek refuge in You, my Lord, that they ˹even˺ come near me.” Too Late for the Wicked

verses.text: When death approaches any of them, they cry, “My Lord! Let me go back,
verses.translation: When death approaches any of them, they cry, “My Lord! Let me go back,

verses.text: so I may do good in what I left behind.” Never! It is only a ˹useless˺ appeal they make. And there is a barrier behind them until the Day they are resurrected.[690] Judgment Day
verses.translation: so I may do good in what I left behind.” Never! It is only a ˹useless˺ appeal they make. And there is a barrier behind them until the Day they are resurrected.[690] Judgment Day

verses.text: Then, when the Trumpet will be blown,[691] there will be no kinship between them on that Day, nor will they ˹even care to˺ ask about one another.[692] The Successful Ones
verses.translation: Then, when the Trumpet will be blown,[691] there will be no kinship between them on that Day, nor will they ˹even care to˺ ask about one another.[692] The Successful Ones

verses.text: As for those whose scale is heavy ˹with good deeds˺, it is they who will be successful. The Losers
verses.translation: As for those whose scale is heavy ˹with good deeds˺, it is they who will be successful. The Losers

verses.text: But those whose scale is light, they will have doomed themselves, staying in Hell forever.
verses.translation: But those whose scale is light, they will have doomed themselves, staying in Hell forever.

verses.text: The Fire will burn their faces, leaving them deformed.
verses.translation: The Fire will burn their faces, leaving them deformed.

verses.text: ˹It will be said,˺ “Were My revelations not recited to you, but you used to deny them?”
verses.translation: ˹It will be said,˺ “Were My revelations not recited to you, but you used to deny them?”

verses.text: They will cry, “Our Lord! Our ill-fate took hold of us, so we became a misguided people.
verses.translation: They will cry, “Our Lord! Our ill-fate took hold of us, so we became a misguided people.

verses.text: Our Lord! Take us out of this ˹Fire˺. Then if we ever return ˹to denial˺, we will truly be wrongdoers.”
verses.translation: Our Lord! Take us out of this ˹Fire˺. Then if we ever return ˹to denial˺, we will truly be wrongdoers.”

verses.text: Allah will respond, “Be despised in there! Do not ˹ever˺ plead with Me ˹again˺!
verses.translation: Allah will respond, “Be despised in there! Do not ˹ever˺ plead with Me ˹again˺!

verses.text: Indeed, there was a group of My servants who used to pray, ‘Our Lord! We have believed, so forgive us and have mercy on us, for You are the best of those who show mercy,’
verses.translation: Indeed, there was a group of My servants who used to pray, ‘Our Lord! We have believed, so forgive us and have mercy on us, for You are the best of those who show mercy,’

verses.text: but you were ˹so busy˺ making fun of them that it made you forget My remembrance. And you used to laugh at them.
verses.translation: but you were ˹so busy˺ making fun of them that it made you forget My remembrance. And you used to laugh at them.

verses.text: Today I have indeed rewarded them for their perseverance: they are certainly the triumphant.” Fleeting World
verses.translation: Today I have indeed rewarded them for their perseverance: they are certainly the triumphant.” Fleeting World

verses.text: He will ask ˹them˺, “How many years did you remain on earth?”
verses.translation: He will ask ˹them˺, “How many years did you remain on earth?”

verses.text: They will reply, “We remained ˹only˺ a day or part of a day.[693] But ask those who kept count.”
verses.translation: They will reply, “We remained ˹only˺ a day or part of a day.[693] But ask those who kept count.”

verses.text: He will say, “You only remained for a little while, if only you knew.
verses.translation: He will say, “You only remained for a little while, if only you knew.

verses.text: Did you then think that We had created you without purpose, and that you would never be returned to Us?” One God Only
verses.translation: Did you then think that We had created you without purpose, and that you would never be returned to Us?” One God Only

verses.text: Exalted is Allah, the True King! There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him, the Lord of the Honourable Throne.
verses.translation: Exalted is Allah, the True King! There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him, the Lord of the Honourable Throne.

verses.text: Whoever invokes, besides Allah, another god—for which they can have no proof—they will surely find their penalty with their Lord. Indeed, the disbelievers will never succeed. Advice to the Prophet
verses.translation: Whoever invokes, besides Allah, another god—for which they can have no proof—they will surely find their penalty with their Lord. Indeed, the disbelievers will never succeed. Advice to the Prophet

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “My Lord! Forgive and have mercy, for You are the best of those who show mercy.” *** -- 305 of 694 --
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “My Lord! Forgive and have mercy, for You are the best of those who show mercy.” *** -- 305 of 694 --

name: The Light
intro: This Medinian sûrah takes its name from the divine light mentioned in verses 35-36. A large portion of this sûrah deals with the issue of sexual misconduct hinted at in the previous sûrah (23:7). The sûrah also offers some guidelines to the believers on how they should have reacted to false rumours against ’ Ȃishah, the Prophet’s wife. Other issues are discussed, including modesty, entering people’s homes, forced prostitution, hypocrisy, and false accusations of adultery. Allah’s power, compliance with His judgment, and obedience to the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) are highly emphasized. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful The Introduction

verses.text: ˹This is˺ a sûrah which We have revealed and made ˹its rulings˺ obligatory, and revealed in it clear commandments so that you may be mindful. Punishment for Fornication
verses.translation: ˹This is˺ a sûrah which We have revealed and made ˹its rulings˺ obligatory, and revealed in it clear commandments so that you may be mindful. Punishment for Fornication

verses.text: As for female and male fornicators, give each of them one hundred lashes,[694] and do not let pity for them make you lenient in ˹enforcing˺ the law of Allah, if you ˹truly˺ believe in Allah and the Last Day. And let a number of believers witness their punishment. Like for Like
verses.translation: As for female and male fornicators, give each of them one hundred lashes,[694] and do not let pity for them make you lenient in ˹enforcing˺ the law of Allah, if you ˹truly˺ believe in Allah and the Last Day. And let a number of believers witness their punishment. Like for Like

verses.text: A male fornicator would only marry a female fornicator or idolatress. And a female fornicator would only be married to a fornicator or idolater. This is ˹all˺ forbidden to the believers.[695] Unsupported Accusations
verses.translation: A male fornicator would only marry a female fornicator or idolatress. And a female fornicator would only be married to a fornicator or idolater. This is ˹all˺ forbidden to the believers.[695] Unsupported Accusations

verses.text: Those who accuse chaste women ˹of adultery˺ and fail to produce four witnesses, give them eighty lashes ˹each˺. And do not ever accept any testimony from them—for they are indeed the rebellious—
verses.translation: Those who accuse chaste women ˹of adultery˺ and fail to produce four witnesses, give them eighty lashes ˹each˺. And do not ever accept any testimony from them—for they are indeed the rebellious—

verses.text: except those who repent afterwards and mend their ways, then surely Allah is All- Forgiving, Most Merciful. Accusation to One’s Wife
verses.translation: except those who repent afterwards and mend their ways, then surely Allah is All- Forgiving, Most Merciful. Accusation to One’s Wife

verses.text: And those who accuse their wives ˹of adultery˺ but have no witness except themselves, the accuser must testify,[696] swearing four times by Allah that he is telling the truth,
verses.translation: And those who accuse their wives ˹of adultery˺ but have no witness except themselves, the accuser must testify,[696] swearing four times by Allah that he is telling the truth,

verses.text: and a fifth oath that Allah may condemn him if he is lying.
verses.translation: and a fifth oath that Allah may condemn him if he is lying.

verses.text: For her to be spared the punishment, she must swear four times by Allah that he is telling a lie,
verses.translation: For her to be spared the punishment, she must swear four times by Allah that he is telling a lie,

verses.text: and a fifth oath that Allah may be displeased with her if he is telling the truth.[697]
verses.translation: and a fifth oath that Allah may be displeased with her if he is telling the truth.[697]

verses.text: ˹You would have suffered,˺ had it not been for Allah’s grace and mercy upon you, and had Allah not been Accepting of Repentance, All-Wise. Those Who Slandered the Prophet’s Wife[698]
verses.translation: ˹You would have suffered,˺ had it not been for Allah’s grace and mercy upon you, and had Allah not been Accepting of Repentance, All-Wise. Those Who Slandered the Prophet’s Wife[698]

verses.text: Indeed, those who came up with that ˹outrageous˺ slander are a group of you. Do not think this is bad for you. Rather, it is good for you.[699] They will be punished, each according to their share of the sin. As for their mastermind,[700] he will suffer a tremendous punishment. How the Believers Should Have Reacted
verses.translation: Indeed, those who came up with that ˹outrageous˺ slander are a group of you. Do not think this is bad for you. Rather, it is good for you.[699] They will be punished, each according to their share of the sin. As for their mastermind,[700] he will suffer a tremendous punishment. How the Believers Should Have Reacted

verses.text: If only the believing men and women had thought well of one another, when you heard this ˹rumour˺, and said, “This is clearly ˹an outrageous˺ slander!”
verses.translation: If only the believing men and women had thought well of one another, when you heard this ˹rumour˺, and said, “This is clearly ˹an outrageous˺ slander!”

verses.text: Why did they not produce four witnesses? Now, since they have failed to produce witnesses, they are ˹truly˺ liars in the sight of Allah.
verses.translation: Why did they not produce four witnesses? Now, since they have failed to produce witnesses, they are ˹truly˺ liars in the sight of Allah.

verses.text: Had it not been for Allah’s grace and mercy upon you in this world and the Hereafter, you would have certainly been touched with a tremendous punishment for what you plunged into—
verses.translation: Had it not been for Allah’s grace and mercy upon you in this world and the Hereafter, you would have certainly been touched with a tremendous punishment for what you plunged into—

verses.text: when you passed it from one tongue to the other, and said with your mouths what you had no knowledge of, taking it lightly while it is ˹extremely˺ serious in the sight of Allah.
verses.translation: when you passed it from one tongue to the other, and said with your mouths what you had no knowledge of, taking it lightly while it is ˹extremely˺ serious in the sight of Allah.

verses.text: If only you had said upon hearing it, “How can we speak about such a thing! Glory be to You ˹O Lord˺! This is a heinous slander!”
verses.translation: If only you had said upon hearing it, “How can we speak about such a thing! Glory be to You ˹O Lord˺! This is a heinous slander!”

verses.text: Allah forbids you from ever doing something like this again, if you are ˹true˺ believers.
verses.translation: Allah forbids you from ever doing something like this again, if you are ˹true˺ believers.

verses.text: And Allah makes ˹His˺ commandments clear to you, for Allah is All- Knowing, All-Wise. Warning to Slanderers
verses.translation: And Allah makes ˹His˺ commandments clear to you, for Allah is All- Knowing, All-Wise. Warning to Slanderers

verses.text: Indeed, those who love to see indecency spread among the believers will suffer a painful punishment in this life and the Hereafter. Allah knows and you do not know.
verses.translation: Indeed, those who love to see indecency spread among the believers will suffer a painful punishment in this life and the Hereafter. Allah knows and you do not know.

verses.text: ˹You would have suffered,˺ had it not been for Allah’s grace and mercy upon you, and had Allah not been Ever Gracious, Most Merciful. Warning Against Satan
verses.translation: ˹You would have suffered,˺ had it not been for Allah’s grace and mercy upon you, and had Allah not been Ever Gracious, Most Merciful. Warning Against Satan

verses.text: O believers! Do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Whoever follows Satan’s footsteps, then ˹let them know that˺ he surely bids ˹all to˺ immorality and wickedness. Had it not been for Allah’s grace and mercy upon you, none of you would have ever been purified. But Allah purifies whoever He wills. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing. Uninterrupted Kindness
verses.translation: O believers! Do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Whoever follows Satan’s footsteps, then ˹let them know that˺ he surely bids ˹all to˺ immorality and wickedness. Had it not been for Allah’s grace and mercy upon you, none of you would have ever been purified. But Allah purifies whoever He wills. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing. Uninterrupted Kindness

verses.text: Do not let the people of virtue and affluence among you swear to suspend donations to their relatives, the needy, and the emigrants in the cause of Allah. Let them pardon and forgive. Do you not love to be forgiven by Allah? And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.[701] Punishment of the Slanderers
verses.translation: Do not let the people of virtue and affluence among you swear to suspend donations to their relatives, the needy, and the emigrants in the cause of Allah. Let them pardon and forgive. Do you not love to be forgiven by Allah? And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.[701] Punishment of the Slanderers

verses.text: Surely those who accuse chaste, unsuspecting,[702] believing women are cursed in this life and the Hereafter. And they will suffer a tremendous punishment
verses.translation: Surely those who accuse chaste, unsuspecting,[702] believing women are cursed in this life and the Hereafter. And they will suffer a tremendous punishment

verses.text: on the Day their tongues, hands, and feet will testify against them for what they used to do.
verses.translation: on the Day their tongues, hands, and feet will testify against them for what they used to do.

verses.text: On that Day, Allah will give them their just penalty in full, and they will ˹come to˺ know that Allah ˹alone˺ is the Ultimate Truth. Birds of a Feather …
verses.translation: On that Day, Allah will give them their just penalty in full, and they will ˹come to˺ know that Allah ˹alone˺ is the Ultimate Truth. Birds of a Feather …

verses.text: Wicked women are for wicked men, and wicked men are for wicked women. And virtuous women are for virtuous men, and virtuous men are for virtuous women. The virtuous are innocent of what the wicked say. They will have forgiveness and an honourable provision.[703] Entering People’s Homes
verses.translation: Wicked women are for wicked men, and wicked men are for wicked women. And virtuous women are for virtuous men, and virtuous men are for virtuous women. The virtuous are innocent of what the wicked say. They will have forgiveness and an honourable provision.[703] Entering People’s Homes

verses.text: O believers! Do not enter any house other than your own until you have asked for permission and greeted its occupants. This is best for you, so perhaps you will be mindful.
verses.translation: O believers! Do not enter any house other than your own until you have asked for permission and greeted its occupants. This is best for you, so perhaps you will be mindful.

verses.text: If you find no one at home, do not enter it until you have been given permission. And if you are asked to leave, then leave. That is purer for you. And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of what you do. Entering Public Places
verses.translation: If you find no one at home, do not enter it until you have been given permission. And if you are asked to leave, then leave. That is purer for you. And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of what you do. Entering Public Places

verses.text: There is no blame on you if you enter public places[704] where there is something of benefit for you. And Allah knows what you reveal and what you conceal. Advice to Muslim Men
verses.translation: There is no blame on you if you enter public places[704] where there is something of benefit for you. And Allah knows what you reveal and what you conceal. Advice to Muslim Men

verses.text: ˹O Prophet!˺ Tell the believing men to lower their gaze and guard their chastity. That is purer for them. Surely Allah is All-Aware of what they do. Advice to Muslim Women
verses.translation: ˹O Prophet!˺ Tell the believing men to lower their gaze and guard their chastity. That is purer for them. Surely Allah is All-Aware of what they do. Advice to Muslim Women

verses.text: And tell the believing women to lower their gaze and guard their chastity, and not to reveal their adornments[705] except what normally appears.[706] Let them draw their veils over their chests, and not reveal their ˹hidden˺ adornments[707] except to their husbands, their fathers, their fathers-in-law, their sons, their stepsons, their brothers, their brothers’ sons or sisters’ sons, their fellow women, those ˹bondwomen˺ in their possession, male attendants with no desire, or children who are still unaware of women’s nakedness. Let them not stomp their feet, drawing attention to their hidden adornments. Turn to Allah in repentance all together, O believers, so that you may be successful. Advice to Guardians
verses.translation: And tell the believing women to lower their gaze and guard their chastity, and not to reveal their adornments[705] except what normally appears.[706] Let them draw their veils over their chests, and not reveal their ˹hidden˺ adornments[707] except to their husbands, their fathers, their fathers-in-law, their sons, their stepsons, their brothers, their brothers’ sons or sisters’ sons, their fellow women, those ˹bondwomen˺ in their possession, male attendants with no desire, or children who are still unaware of women’s nakedness. Let them not stomp their feet, drawing attention to their hidden adornments. Turn to Allah in repentance all together, O believers, so that you may be successful. Advice to Guardians

verses.text: Marry off the ˹free˺ singles among you, as well as the righteous of your bondmen and bondwomen. If they are poor, Allah will enrich them out of His bounty. For Allah is All-Bountiful, All-Knowing.
verses.translation: Marry off the ˹free˺ singles among you, as well as the righteous of your bondmen and bondwomen. If they are poor, Allah will enrich them out of His bounty. For Allah is All-Bountiful, All-Knowing.

verses.text: And let those who do not have the means to marry keep themselves chaste until Allah enriches them out of His bounty. And if any of those ˹bondspeople˺ in your possession desires a deed of emancipation,[708] make it possible for them, if you find goodness in them. And give them some of Allah’s wealth which He has granted you. Do not force your ˹slave˺ girls into prostitution for your own worldly gains while they wish to remain chaste.[709] And if someone coerces them, then after such a coercion Allah is certainly All-Forgiving, Most Merciful ˹to them˺. Examples and Lessons
verses.translation: And let those who do not have the means to marry keep themselves chaste until Allah enriches them out of His bounty. And if any of those ˹bondspeople˺ in your possession desires a deed of emancipation,[708] make it possible for them, if you find goodness in them. And give them some of Allah’s wealth which He has granted you. Do not force your ˹slave˺ girls into prostitution for your own worldly gains while they wish to remain chaste.[709] And if someone coerces them, then after such a coercion Allah is certainly All-Forgiving, Most Merciful ˹to them˺. Examples and Lessons

verses.text: Indeed, We have sent down to you clear revelations, along with examples of those who had gone before you,[710] and a lesson to the God- fearing. Parable for the Believer’s Heart
verses.translation: Indeed, We have sent down to you clear revelations, along with examples of those who had gone before you,[710] and a lesson to the God- fearing. Parable for the Believer’s Heart

verses.text: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. His light[711] is like a niche in which there is a lamp, the lamp is in a crystal, the crystal is like a shining star, lit from ˹the oil of˺ a blessed olive tree, ˹located˺ neither to the east nor the west,[712] whose oil would almost glow, even without being touched by fire. Light upon light! Allah guides whoever He wills to His light. And Allah sets forth parables for humanity. For Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things. True Believers
verses.translation: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. His light[711] is like a niche in which there is a lamp, the lamp is in a crystal, the crystal is like a shining star, lit from ˹the oil of˺ a blessed olive tree, ˹located˺ neither to the east nor the west,[712] whose oil would almost glow, even without being touched by fire. Light upon light! Allah guides whoever He wills to His light. And Allah sets forth parables for humanity. For Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things. True Believers

verses.text: ˹That light shines˺ through houses ˹of worship˺ which Allah has ordered to be raised, and where His Name is mentioned. He is glorified there morning and evening
verses.translation: ˹That light shines˺ through houses ˹of worship˺ which Allah has ordered to be raised, and where His Name is mentioned. He is glorified there morning and evening

verses.text: by men[713] who are not distracted—either by buying or selling—from Allah’s remembrance, or performing prayer, or paying alms-tax. They fear a Day when hearts and eyes will tremble,
verses.translation: by men[713] who are not distracted—either by buying or selling—from Allah’s remembrance, or performing prayer, or paying alms-tax. They fear a Day when hearts and eyes will tremble,

verses.text: ˹hoping˺ that Allah may reward them according to the best of their deeds, and increase them out of His grace. And Allah provides for whoever He wills without limit. Parable for the Disbelievers
verses.translation: ˹hoping˺ that Allah may reward them according to the best of their deeds, and increase them out of His grace. And Allah provides for whoever He wills without limit. Parable for the Disbelievers

verses.text: As for the disbelievers, their deeds are like a mirage in a desert, which the thirsty perceive as water, but when they approach it, they find it to be nothing. Instead, they find Allah there ˹in the Hereafter, ready˺ to settle their account. And Allah is swift in reckoning. Another Parable
verses.translation: As for the disbelievers, their deeds are like a mirage in a desert, which the thirsty perceive as water, but when they approach it, they find it to be nothing. Instead, they find Allah there ˹in the Hereafter, ready˺ to settle their account. And Allah is swift in reckoning. Another Parable

verses.text: Or ˹their deeds are˺ like the darkness in a deep sea, covered by waves upon waves,[714] topped by ˹dark˺ clouds. Darkness upon darkness! If one stretches out their hand, they can hardly see it. And whoever Allah does not bless with light will have no light! Submission to Allah
verses.translation: Or ˹their deeds are˺ like the darkness in a deep sea, covered by waves upon waves,[714] topped by ˹dark˺ clouds. Darkness upon darkness! If one stretches out their hand, they can hardly see it. And whoever Allah does not bless with light will have no light! Submission to Allah

verses.text: Do you not see that Allah is glorified by all those in the heavens and the earth, even the birds as they soar? Each ˹instinctively˺ knows their manner of prayer and glorification. And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all they do.
verses.translation: Do you not see that Allah is glorified by all those in the heavens and the earth, even the birds as they soar? Each ˹instinctively˺ knows their manner of prayer and glorification. And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all they do.

verses.text: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. And to Allah is the final return. The Miracle of Rain
verses.translation: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. And to Allah is the final return. The Miracle of Rain

verses.text: Do you not see that Allah gently drives the clouds, then joins them together, piling them up into masses, from which you see raindrops come forth? And He sends down from the sky mountains ˹of clouds˺ loaded with hail, pouring it on whoever He wills and averting it from whoever He wills. The flash of the clouds’ lightning nearly takes away eyesight.
verses.translation: Do you not see that Allah gently drives the clouds, then joins them together, piling them up into masses, from which you see raindrops come forth? And He sends down from the sky mountains ˹of clouds˺ loaded with hail, pouring it on whoever He wills and averting it from whoever He wills. The flash of the clouds’ lightning nearly takes away eyesight.

verses.text: Allah alternates the day and night. Surely in this is a lesson for people of insight. The Miracle of Creation
verses.translation: Allah alternates the day and night. Surely in this is a lesson for people of insight. The Miracle of Creation

verses.text: And Allah has created from water every living creature. Some of them crawl on their bellies, some walk on two legs, and some walk on four. Allah creates whatever He wills. Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything. The Hypocrites and Judgment
verses.translation: And Allah has created from water every living creature. Some of them crawl on their bellies, some walk on two legs, and some walk on four. Allah creates whatever He wills. Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything. The Hypocrites and Judgment

verses.text: We have indeed sent down revelations clarifying ˹the truth˺. But Allah ˹only˺ guides whoever He wills to the Straight Path.
verses.translation: We have indeed sent down revelations clarifying ˹the truth˺. But Allah ˹only˺ guides whoever He wills to the Straight Path.

verses.text: And the hypocrites say, “We believe in Allah and the Messenger, and we obey.” Then a group of them turns away soon after that. These are not ˹true˺ believers.
verses.translation: And the hypocrites say, “We believe in Allah and the Messenger, and we obey.” Then a group of them turns away soon after that. These are not ˹true˺ believers.

verses.text: And as soon as they are called to Allah and His Messenger so he may judge between them, a group of them[715] turns away.
verses.translation: And as soon as they are called to Allah and His Messenger so he may judge between them, a group of them[715] turns away.

verses.text: But if the truth is in their favour, they come to him, fully submitting.
verses.translation: But if the truth is in their favour, they come to him, fully submitting.

verses.text: Is there a sickness in their hearts? Or are they in doubt? Or do they fear that Allah and His Messenger will be unjust to them? In fact, it is they who are the ˹true˺ wrongdoers. The Believers and Judgment
verses.translation: Is there a sickness in their hearts? Or are they in doubt? Or do they fear that Allah and His Messenger will be unjust to them? In fact, it is they who are the ˹true˺ wrongdoers. The Believers and Judgment

verses.text: The only response of the ˹true˺ believers, when they are called to Allah and His Messenger so he may judge between them, is to say, “We hear and obey.” It is they who will ˹truly˺ succeed.
verses.translation: The only response of the ˹true˺ believers, when they are called to Allah and His Messenger so he may judge between them, is to say, “We hear and obey.” It is they who will ˹truly˺ succeed.

verses.text: For whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, and fears Allah and is mindful of Him, then it is they who will ˹truly˺ triumph. Hypocrites’ Lip Service
verses.translation: For whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, and fears Allah and is mindful of Him, then it is they who will ˹truly˺ triumph. Hypocrites’ Lip Service

verses.text: They swear by Allah their most solemn oaths that if you ˹O Prophet˺ were to command them, they would certainly march forth ˹in Allah’s cause˺. Say, “˹You˺ do not ˹have to˺ swear; your obedience is well known!”[716] Surely Allah is All-Aware of what you do.”
verses.translation: They swear by Allah their most solemn oaths that if you ˹O Prophet˺ were to command them, they would certainly march forth ˹in Allah’s cause˺. Say, “˹You˺ do not ˹have to˺ swear; your obedience is well known!”[716] Surely Allah is All-Aware of what you do.”

verses.text: Say, “Obey Allah and obey the Messenger. But if you turn away, then he is only responsible for his duty[717] and you are responsible for yours.[718] And if you obey him, you will be ˹rightly˺ guided. The Messenger’s duty is only to deliver ˹the message˺ clearly.” Allah’s Promise to the Believers
verses.translation: Say, “Obey Allah and obey the Messenger. But if you turn away, then he is only responsible for his duty[717] and you are responsible for yours.[718] And if you obey him, you will be ˹rightly˺ guided. The Messenger’s duty is only to deliver ˹the message˺ clearly.” Allah’s Promise to the Believers

verses.text: Allah has promised those of you who believe and do good that He will certainly make them successors in the land, as He did with those before them; and will surely establish for them their faith which He has chosen for them; and will indeed change their fear into security—˹provided that˺ they worship Me, associating nothing with Me. But whoever disbelieves after this ˹promise˺, it is they who will be the rebellious.
verses.translation: Allah has promised those of you who believe and do good that He will certainly make them successors in the land, as He did with those before them; and will surely establish for them their faith which He has chosen for them; and will indeed change their fear into security—˹provided that˺ they worship Me, associating nothing with Me. But whoever disbelieves after this ˹promise˺, it is they who will be the rebellious.

verses.text: Moreover, establish prayer, pay alms-tax, and obey the Messenger, so you may be shown mercy.
verses.translation: Moreover, establish prayer, pay alms-tax, and obey the Messenger, so you may be shown mercy.

verses.text: Do not think ˹O Prophet˺ that the disbelievers can escape in the land. The Fire will be their home. Indeed, what an evil destination! Permission at Three Times
verses.translation: Do not think ˹O Prophet˺ that the disbelievers can escape in the land. The Fire will be their home. Indeed, what an evil destination! Permission at Three Times

verses.text: O believers! Let those ˹bondspeople˺ in your possession and those of you who are still under age ask for your permission ˹to come in˺ at three times: before dawn prayer, when you take off your ˹outer˺ clothes at noon, and after the late evening prayer. ˹These are˺ three times of privacy for you. Other than these times, there is no blame on you or them to move freely, attending to one another. This is how Allah makes the revelations clear to you, for Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. Permission at All Times
verses.translation: O believers! Let those ˹bondspeople˺ in your possession and those of you who are still under age ask for your permission ˹to come in˺ at three times: before dawn prayer, when you take off your ˹outer˺ clothes at noon, and after the late evening prayer. ˹These are˺ three times of privacy for you. Other than these times, there is no blame on you or them to move freely, attending to one another. This is how Allah makes the revelations clear to you, for Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. Permission at All Times

verses.text: And when your children reach the age of puberty, let them seek permission ˹to come in˺, as their seniors do. This is how Allah makes His revelations clear to you, for Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. Modesty for Elderly Women
verses.translation: And when your children reach the age of puberty, let them seek permission ˹to come in˺, as their seniors do. This is how Allah makes His revelations clear to you, for Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. Modesty for Elderly Women

verses.text: As for elderly women past the age of marriage, there is no blame on them if they take off their ˹outer˺ garments, without revealing their adornments. But it is better for them if they avoid this ˹altogether˺. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing. No Restrictions
verses.translation: As for elderly women past the age of marriage, there is no blame on them if they take off their ˹outer˺ garments, without revealing their adornments. But it is better for them if they avoid this ˹altogether˺. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing. No Restrictions

verses.text: There is no restriction on the blind, or the disabled, or the sick.[719] Nor on yourselves if you eat from your homes,[720] or the homes of your fathers, or your mothers, or your brothers, or your sisters, or your paternal uncles, or your paternal aunts, or your maternal uncles, or your maternal aunts, or from the homes in your trust, or ˹the homes of˺ your friends. There is no blame on you eating together or separately. However, when you enter houses, greet one another with a greeting ˹of peace˺ from Allah, blessed and good.[721] This is how Allah makes His revelations clear to you, so perhaps you will understand. Sticking with the Prophet
verses.translation: There is no restriction on the blind, or the disabled, or the sick.[719] Nor on yourselves if you eat from your homes,[720] or the homes of your fathers, or your mothers, or your brothers, or your sisters, or your paternal uncles, or your paternal aunts, or your maternal uncles, or your maternal aunts, or from the homes in your trust, or ˹the homes of˺ your friends. There is no blame on you eating together or separately. However, when you enter houses, greet one another with a greeting ˹of peace˺ from Allah, blessed and good.[721] This is how Allah makes His revelations clear to you, so perhaps you will understand. Sticking with the Prophet

verses.text: The ˹true˺ believers are only those who believe in Allah and His Messenger, and when they are with him on a public matter, they do not leave without his permission. Indeed, those who ask your permission ˹O Prophet˺ are the ones who ˹truly˺ believe in Allah and His Messenger. So when they ask your permission for a private matter, grant permission to whoever you wish and ask Allah’s forgiveness for them. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
verses.translation: The ˹true˺ believers are only those who believe in Allah and His Messenger, and when they are with him on a public matter, they do not leave without his permission. Indeed, those who ask your permission ˹O Prophet˺ are the ones who ˹truly˺ believe in Allah and His Messenger. So when they ask your permission for a private matter, grant permission to whoever you wish and ask Allah’s forgiveness for them. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

verses.text: Do not treat the Messenger’s summons to you ˹as lightly˺ as your summons to one another.[722] Allah certainly knows those of you who slip away, hiding behind others.[723] So let those who disobey his orders beware, for an affliction may befall them, or a painful torment may overtake them. Allah Knows Everything
verses.translation: Do not treat the Messenger’s summons to you ˹as lightly˺ as your summons to one another.[722] Allah certainly knows those of you who slip away, hiding behind others.[723] So let those who disobey his orders beware, for an affliction may befall them, or a painful torment may overtake them. Allah Knows Everything

verses.text: Surely to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. He knows well what you stand for. And ˹on˺ the Day all will be returned to Him, He will inform them of what they did. For Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things. *** -- 313 of 694 --
verses.translation: Surely to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. He knows well what you stand for. And ˹on˺ the Day all will be returned to Him, He will inform them of what they did. For Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things. *** -- 313 of 694 --

name: The Standard
intro: This Meccan sûrah takes its name from verses 1-6, which refute the pagan claims that the Quran was fabricated and plagiarized from earlier scriptures. Other passages condemn polytheism, denial of resurrection, and mocking the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص). Allah’s power, manifested in the marvels of creation and rain, is emphasized in this sûrah and the previous one. The qualities of the righteous servants of Allah are beautifully laid out in verses 63-76. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Kingdom of Almighty Allah

verses.text: Blessed is the One Who sent down the Standard[724] to His servant,[725] so that he may be a warner to the whole world.[726]
verses.translation: Blessed is the One Who sent down the Standard[724] to His servant,[725] so that he may be a warner to the whole world.[726]

verses.text: ˹Allah is˺ the One to Whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, Who has never had ˹any˺ offspring, nor does He have a partner in ˹governing˺ the kingdom. He has created everything, ordaining it precisely. The Polytheists
verses.translation: ˹Allah is˺ the One to Whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, Who has never had ˹any˺ offspring, nor does He have a partner in ˹governing˺ the kingdom. He has created everything, ordaining it precisely. The Polytheists

verses.text: Yet they have taken besides Him gods who cannot create anything but are themselves created. Nor can they protect or benefit themselves. Nor can they control life, death, or resurrection. Denying the Quran
verses.translation: Yet they have taken besides Him gods who cannot create anything but are themselves created. Nor can they protect or benefit themselves. Nor can they control life, death, or resurrection. Denying the Quran

verses.text: The disbelievers say, “This ˹Quran˺ is nothing but a fabrication which he[727] made up with the help of others.” Their claim is totally unjustified and untrue!
verses.translation: The disbelievers say, “This ˹Quran˺ is nothing but a fabrication which he[727] made up with the help of others.” Their claim is totally unjustified and untrue!

verses.text: And they say, “˹These revelations are only˺ ancient fables which he has had written down, and they are rehearsed to him morning and evening.”[728]
verses.translation: And they say, “˹These revelations are only˺ ancient fables which he has had written down, and they are rehearsed to him morning and evening.”[728]

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “This ˹Quran˺ has been revealed by the One Who knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth. Surely He is All- Forgiving, Most Merciful.”[729] Denying the Prophet
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “This ˹Quran˺ has been revealed by the One Who knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth. Surely He is All- Forgiving, Most Merciful.”[729] Denying the Prophet

verses.text: And they say ˹mockingly˺, “What kind of messenger is this who eats food and goes about in market-places ˹for a living˺? If only an angel had been sent down with him to be his co-warner,
verses.translation: And they say ˹mockingly˺, “What kind of messenger is this who eats food and goes about in market-places ˹for a living˺? If only an angel had been sent down with him to be his co-warner,

verses.text: or a treasure had been cast down to him, or he had had a garden from which he may eat!” And the wrongdoers say ˹to the believers˺, “You are only following a bewitched man.”
verses.translation: or a treasure had been cast down to him, or he had had a garden from which he may eat!” And the wrongdoers say ˹to the believers˺, “You are only following a bewitched man.”

verses.text: See ˹O Prophet˺ how they call you names![730] So they have gone so ˹far˺ astray that they cannot find the ˹Right˺ Way.
verses.translation: See ˹O Prophet˺ how they call you names![730] So they have gone so ˹far˺ astray that they cannot find the ˹Right˺ Way.

verses.text: Blessed is the One Who—if He wills—can give you far better than ˹all˺ that: gardens under which rivers flow, and palaces as well. Torment for the Deniers
verses.translation: Blessed is the One Who—if He wills—can give you far better than ˹all˺ that: gardens under which rivers flow, and palaces as well. Torment for the Deniers

verses.text: In fact, they deny the Hour.[731] And for the deniers of the Hour, We have prepared a blazing Fire.
verses.translation: In fact, they deny the Hour.[731] And for the deniers of the Hour, We have prepared a blazing Fire.

verses.text: Once it sees them from a distance, they will hear it fuming and growling.
verses.translation: Once it sees them from a distance, they will hear it fuming and growling.

verses.text: And when they are tossed into a narrow place inside ˹Hell˺, chained together, then and there they will cry out for ˹instant˺ destruction.
verses.translation: And when they are tossed into a narrow place inside ˹Hell˺, chained together, then and there they will cry out for ˹instant˺ destruction.

verses.text: ˹They will be told,˺ “Do not cry only once for destruction, but cry many times over!” Reward of the Righteous
