verses.translation: ˹They will be told,˺ “Do not cry only once for destruction, but cry many times over!” Reward of the Righteous

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Is this better or the Garden of Eternity which the righteous have been promised, as a reward and ˹an ultimate˺ destination?
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Is this better or the Garden of Eternity which the righteous have been promised, as a reward and ˹an ultimate˺ destination?

verses.text: There they will have whatever they wish for, forever. That is a promise ˹to be sought after˺, binding on your Lord.” The Disavowal
verses.translation: There they will have whatever they wish for, forever. That is a promise ˹to be sought after˺, binding on your Lord.” The Disavowal

verses.text: ˹Watch for˺ the Day He will gather them along with what they used to worship besides Allah, and ask ˹the objects of worship˺,[732] “Was it you who misled these servants of Mine, or did they stray from the Way ˹on their own˺?”
verses.translation: ˹Watch for˺ the Day He will gather them along with what they used to worship besides Allah, and ask ˹the objects of worship˺,[732] “Was it you who misled these servants of Mine, or did they stray from the Way ˹on their own˺?”

verses.text: They will say, “Glory be to You! It was not right for ˹others like˺ us to take any lords besides You,[733] but You allowed enjoyment for them and their forefathers ˹for so long˺ that they forgot ˹Your˺ remembrance and became a doomed people.”
verses.translation: They will say, “Glory be to You! It was not right for ˹others like˺ us to take any lords besides You,[733] but You allowed enjoyment for them and their forefathers ˹for so long˺ that they forgot ˹Your˺ remembrance and became a doomed people.”

verses.text: ˹The doomed will be told˺, “Your gods have clearly denied your claims. So now you can neither ward off ˹the punishment˺ nor get any help.” And whoever of you does wrong, We will make them taste a horrible punishment. Messengers Are Human
verses.translation: ˹The doomed will be told˺, “Your gods have clearly denied your claims. So now you can neither ward off ˹the punishment˺ nor get any help.” And whoever of you does wrong, We will make them taste a horrible punishment. Messengers Are Human

verses.text: We never sent any messenger before you ˹O Prophet˺, who did not eat food and go about in market-places. We have made some of you a trial for others. Will you ˹not then˺ be patient? And your Lord is All-Seeing. Desperate to Meet the Angels
verses.translation: We never sent any messenger before you ˹O Prophet˺, who did not eat food and go about in market-places. We have made some of you a trial for others. Will you ˹not then˺ be patient? And your Lord is All-Seeing. Desperate to Meet the Angels

verses.text: Those who do not expect to meet Us say, “If only the angels were sent down to us, or we could see our Lord!” They have certainly been carried away by their arrogance and have entirely exceeded all limits.
verses.translation: Those who do not expect to meet Us say, “If only the angels were sent down to us, or we could see our Lord!” They have certainly been carried away by their arrogance and have entirely exceeded all limits.

verses.text: ˹But˺ on the Day they will see the angels, there will be no good news for the wicked, who will cry, “Keep away! Away ˹from us˺!”[734]
verses.translation: ˹But˺ on the Day they will see the angels, there will be no good news for the wicked, who will cry, “Keep away! Away ˹from us˺!”[734]

verses.text: Then We will turn to whatever ˹good˺ deeds they did, reducing them to scattered dust.[735]
verses.translation: Then We will turn to whatever ˹good˺ deeds they did, reducing them to scattered dust.[735]

verses.text: ˹But˺ on that Day the residents of Paradise will have the best settlement and the finest place to rest. Judgment Day
verses.translation: ˹But˺ on that Day the residents of Paradise will have the best settlement and the finest place to rest. Judgment Day

verses.text: ˹Watch for˺ the Day the heavens will burst with clouds, and the angels will be sent down in successive ranks.
verses.translation: ˹Watch for˺ the Day the heavens will burst with clouds, and the angels will be sent down in successive ranks.

verses.text: True authority on that Day will belong ˹only˺ to the Most Compassionate.[736] And it will be a hard day for the disbelievers. Useless Remorse[737]
verses.translation: True authority on that Day will belong ˹only˺ to the Most Compassionate.[736] And it will be a hard day for the disbelievers. Useless Remorse[737]

verses.text: And ˹beware of˺ the Day the wrongdoer will bite his nails ˹in regret˺ and say, “Oh! I wish I had followed the Way along with the Messenger!
verses.translation: And ˹beware of˺ the Day the wrongdoer will bite his nails ˹in regret˺ and say, “Oh! I wish I had followed the Way along with the Messenger!

verses.text: Woe to me! I wish I had never taken so-and-so as a close friend.
verses.translation: Woe to me! I wish I had never taken so-and-so as a close friend.

verses.text: It was he who truly made me stray from the Reminder after it had reached me.” And Satan has always betrayed humanity. Pagans’ Neglect of the Quran
verses.translation: It was he who truly made me stray from the Reminder after it had reached me.” And Satan has always betrayed humanity. Pagans’ Neglect of the Quran

verses.text: The Messenger has cried, “O my Lord! My people have indeed received this Quran with neglect.”
verses.translation: The Messenger has cried, “O my Lord! My people have indeed received this Quran with neglect.”

verses.text: Similarly, We made enemies for every prophet from among the wicked, but sufficient is your Lord as a Guide and Helper.
verses.translation: Similarly, We made enemies for every prophet from among the wicked, but sufficient is your Lord as a Guide and Helper.

verses.text: The disbelievers say, “If only the Quran had been sent down to him all at once!” ˹We have sent it˺ as such ˹in stages˺ so We may reassure your heart with it. And We have revealed it at a deliberate pace.
verses.translation: The disbelievers say, “If only the Quran had been sent down to him all at once!” ˹We have sent it˺ as such ˹in stages˺ so We may reassure your heart with it. And We have revealed it at a deliberate pace.

verses.text: Whenever they bring you an argument, We come to you with the right refutation and the best explanation.
verses.translation: Whenever they bring you an argument, We come to you with the right refutation and the best explanation.

verses.text: Those who will be dragged into Hell on their faces will be in the worst place, and are ˹now˺ farthest from the ˹Right˺ Way. Destruction of Pharaoh’s People
verses.translation: Those who will be dragged into Hell on their faces will be in the worst place, and are ˹now˺ farthest from the ˹Right˺ Way. Destruction of Pharaoh’s People

verses.text: We certainly gave Moses the Book and appointed his brother Aaron as his helper.
verses.translation: We certainly gave Moses the Book and appointed his brother Aaron as his helper.

verses.text: We had ordered ˹them˺, “Go to the people who would deny Our signs.” Then We annihilated the deniers entirely. Destruction of Noah’s People
verses.translation: We had ordered ˹them˺, “Go to the people who would deny Our signs.” Then We annihilated the deniers entirely. Destruction of Noah’s People

verses.text: And when the people of Noah rejected the messengers,[738] We drowned them, making them an example to humanity. And We have prepared a painful punishment for the wrongdoers. Destruction of Other Peoples
verses.translation: And when the people of Noah rejected the messengers,[738] We drowned them, making them an example to humanity. And We have prepared a painful punishment for the wrongdoers. Destruction of Other Peoples

verses.text: Also ˹We destroyed˺ ’Ȃd, Thamûd, and the people of the Water-pit,[739] as well as many peoples in between.
verses.translation: Also ˹We destroyed˺ ’Ȃd, Thamûd, and the people of the Water-pit,[739] as well as many peoples in between.

verses.text: For each We set forth ˹various˺ lessons, and We ultimately destroyed each. Warning to Meccan Pagans
verses.translation: For each We set forth ˹various˺ lessons, and We ultimately destroyed each. Warning to Meccan Pagans

verses.text: They have certainly passed by the city ˹of Sodom˺, which had been showered with a dreadful rain ˹of stones˺. Have they not seen its ruins? But they do not expect to be resurrected.
verses.translation: They have certainly passed by the city ˹of Sodom˺, which had been showered with a dreadful rain ˹of stones˺. Have they not seen its ruins? But they do not expect to be resurrected.

verses.text: When they see you ˹O Prophet˺, they only make fun of you, ˹saying,˺ “Is this the one that Allah has sent as a messenger?
verses.translation: When they see you ˹O Prophet˺, they only make fun of you, ˹saying,˺ “Is this the one that Allah has sent as a messenger?

verses.text: He would have almost tricked us away from our gods, had we not been so devoted to them.” ˹But˺ soon they will know, when they face the punishment, who is far astray from the ˹Right˺ Way.
verses.translation: He would have almost tricked us away from our gods, had we not been so devoted to them.” ˹But˺ soon they will know, when they face the punishment, who is far astray from the ˹Right˺ Way.

verses.text: Have you seen ˹O Prophet˺ the one who has taken their own desires as their god? Will you then be a keeper over them?
verses.translation: Have you seen ˹O Prophet˺ the one who has taken their own desires as their god? Will you then be a keeper over them?

verses.text: Or do you think that most of them listen or understand?[740] They are only like cattle—no, more than that, they are astray from the ˹Right˺ Way![741] Allah’s Power: 1) The Sun and Shade
verses.translation: Or do you think that most of them listen or understand?[740] They are only like cattle—no, more than that, they are astray from the ˹Right˺ Way![741] Allah’s Power: 1) The Sun and Shade

verses.text: Have you not seen how your Lord extends the shade—He could have simply made it ˹remain˺ still if He so willed—then We make the sun its guide,
verses.translation: Have you not seen how your Lord extends the shade—He could have simply made it ˹remain˺ still if He so willed—then We make the sun its guide,

verses.text: causing the shade to retreat gradually?[742] 2) The Day and Night
verses.translation: causing the shade to retreat gradually?[742] 2) The Day and Night

verses.text: He is the One Who has made the night for you as a cover, and ˹made˺ sleep for resting, and the day for rising. 3) The Rain
verses.translation: He is the One Who has made the night for you as a cover, and ˹made˺ sleep for resting, and the day for rising. 3) The Rain

verses.text: And He is the One Who sends the winds ushering in His mercy, and We send down pure rain from the sky,
verses.translation: And He is the One Who sends the winds ushering in His mercy, and We send down pure rain from the sky,

verses.text: giving life to a lifeless land, and providing water for countless animals and humans of Our Own creation.
verses.translation: giving life to a lifeless land, and providing water for countless animals and humans of Our Own creation.

verses.text: We certainly disperse it among them so they may be mindful, but most people persist in ungratefulness. One Universal Messenger
verses.translation: We certainly disperse it among them so they may be mindful, but most people persist in ungratefulness. One Universal Messenger

verses.text: Had We willed, We could have easily sent a warner to every society.
verses.translation: Had We willed, We could have easily sent a warner to every society.

verses.text: So do not yield to the disbelievers, but strive diligently against them with this ˹Quran˺. 4) Fresh and Salt Water
verses.translation: So do not yield to the disbelievers, but strive diligently against them with this ˹Quran˺. 4) Fresh and Salt Water

verses.text: And He is the One Who merges the two bodies of water: one fresh and palatable and the other salty and bitter, placing between them a barrier they cannot cross.[743] 5) Creation of Humans
verses.translation: And He is the One Who merges the two bodies of water: one fresh and palatable and the other salty and bitter, placing between them a barrier they cannot cross.[743] 5) Creation of Humans

verses.translation: And He is the One Who creates human beings from a ˹humble˺ liquid, [744] then establishes for them bonds of kinship and marriage. For your Lord is Most Capable. Powerless Gods

verses.text: Yet they worship besides Allah what can neither benefit nor harm them. And the disbeliever always collaborates against their Lord. Advice to the Prophet: Trust in Allah
verses.translation: Yet they worship besides Allah what can neither benefit nor harm them. And the disbeliever always collaborates against their Lord. Advice to the Prophet: Trust in Allah

verses.translation: And We have sent you ˹O Prophet˺ only as a deliverer of good news and a warner.

verses.text: Say, “I do not ask you for any reward for this ˹message˺, but whoever wishes, let them pursue the Way to their Lord.”
verses.translation: Say, “I do not ask you for any reward for this ˹message˺, but whoever wishes, let them pursue the Way to their Lord.”

verses.text: Put your trust in the Ever-Living, Who never dies, and glorify His praises. Sufficient is He as All-Aware of the sins of His servants.
verses.translation: Put your trust in the Ever-Living, Who never dies, and glorify His praises. Sufficient is He as All-Aware of the sins of His servants.

verses.text: ˹He is˺ the One Who created the heavens and the earth and everything in between in six Days,[745] then established Himself on the Throne. ˹He is˺ the Most Compassionate! Ask ˹none other than˺ the All-Knowledgeable about Himself. Denying Allah
verses.translation: ˹He is˺ the One Who created the heavens and the earth and everything in between in six Days,[745] then established Himself on the Throne. ˹He is˺ the Most Compassionate! Ask ˹none other than˺ the All-Knowledgeable about Himself. Denying Allah

verses.translation: When it is said to them, “Prostrate to the Most Compassionate,” they ask ˹in disgust˺, “What is ‘the Most Compassionate’? Will we prostrate to whatever you order us to?” And it only drives them farther away. Allah Almighty

verses.text: Blessed is the One Who has placed constellations in the sky, as well as a ˹radiant˺ lamp[746] and a luminous moon.
verses.translation: Blessed is the One Who has placed constellations in the sky, as well as a ˹radiant˺ lamp[746] and a luminous moon.

verses.text: And He is the One Who causes the day and the night to alternate, ˹as a sign˺ for whoever desires to be mindful or to be grateful. Qualities of the Righteous: 1) Humility
verses.translation: And He is the One Who causes the day and the night to alternate, ˹as a sign˺ for whoever desires to be mindful or to be grateful. Qualities of the Righteous: 1) Humility

verses.text: The ˹true˺ servants of the Most Compassionate are those who walk on the earth humbly, and when the foolish address them ˹improperly˺, they only respond with peace. 2) Sincere Devotion
verses.translation: The ˹true˺ servants of the Most Compassionate are those who walk on the earth humbly, and when the foolish address them ˹improperly˺, they only respond with peace. 2) Sincere Devotion

verses.text: ˹They are˺ those who spend ˹a good portion of˺ the night, prostrating themselves and standing before their Lord. 3) ˹Hope and ˺ Fear
verses.translation: ˹They are˺ those who spend ˹a good portion of˺ the night, prostrating themselves and standing before their Lord. 3) ˹Hope and ˺ Fear

verses.text: ˹They are˺ those who pray, “Our Lord! Keep the punishment of Hell away from us, for its punishment is indeed unrelenting.
verses.translation: ˹They are˺ those who pray, “Our Lord! Keep the punishment of Hell away from us, for its punishment is indeed unrelenting.

verses.text: It is certainly an evil place to settle and reside.” 4) Moderate Spending
verses.translation: It is certainly an evil place to settle and reside.” 4) Moderate Spending

verses.text: ˹They are˺ those who spend neither wastefully nor stingily, but moderately in between. 5) Avoiding Major Sins
verses.translation: ˹They are˺ those who spend neither wastefully nor stingily, but moderately in between. 5) Avoiding Major Sins

verses.text: ˹They are˺ those who do not invoke any other god besides Allah, nor take a ˹human˺ life—made sacred by Allah—except with ˹legal˺ right,[747] nor commit fornication. And whoever does ˹any of˺ this will face the penalty.
verses.translation: ˹They are˺ those who do not invoke any other god besides Allah, nor take a ˹human˺ life—made sacred by Allah—except with ˹legal˺ right,[747] nor commit fornication. And whoever does ˹any of˺ this will face the penalty.

verses.text: Their punishment will be multiplied on the Day of Judgment, and they will remain in it forever, in disgrace.
verses.translation: Their punishment will be multiplied on the Day of Judgment, and they will remain in it forever, in disgrace.

verses.text: As for those who repent, believe, and do good deeds, they are the ones whose evil deeds Allah will change into good deeds. For Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
verses.translation: As for those who repent, believe, and do good deeds, they are the ones whose evil deeds Allah will change into good deeds. For Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

verses.text: And whoever repents and does good has truly turned to Allah properly. 6) Avoiding Falsehood
verses.translation: And whoever repents and does good has truly turned to Allah properly. 6) Avoiding Falsehood

verses.text: ˹They are˺ those who do not bear false witness, and when they come across falsehood, they pass ˹it˺ by with dignity. 7) Full Submission
verses.translation: ˹They are˺ those who do not bear false witness, and when they come across falsehood, they pass ˹it˺ by with dignity. 7) Full Submission

verses.text: ˹They are˺ those who, when reminded of the revelation of their Lord, do not turn a blind eye or a deaf ear to it. 8) Righteous Company
verses.translation: ˹They are˺ those who, when reminded of the revelation of their Lord, do not turn a blind eye or a deaf ear to it. 8) Righteous Company

verses.text: ˹They are˺ those who pray, “Our Lord! Bless us with ˹pious˺ spouses and offspring who will be the joy of our hearts, and make us models for the righteous.” Reward of the Righteous
verses.translation: ˹They are˺ those who pray, “Our Lord! Bless us with ˹pious˺ spouses and offspring who will be the joy of our hearts, and make us models for the righteous.” Reward of the Righteous

verses.text: It is they who will be rewarded with ˹elevated˺ mansions ˹in Paradise˺ for their perseverance, and will be received with salutations and ˹greetings of˺ peace,
verses.translation: It is they who will be rewarded with ˹elevated˺ mansions ˹in Paradise˺ for their perseverance, and will be received with salutations and ˹greetings of˺ peace,

verses.text: staying there forever. What an excellent place to settle and reside! Call to Humanity
verses.translation: staying there forever. What an excellent place to settle and reside! Call to Humanity

name: The Poets
intro: This Meccan sûrah takes its name from the reference to poets in verses 224- 226. Since the previous sûrah ends with a warning to the deniers of the truth, this sûrah recounts several cautionary tales of destroyed deniers such as Pharaoh and the peoples of Noah, Shu’aib, Lot, and Ṣâli ḥ. The divine origin of the Quran is emphasized at both ends of the sûrah. The qualities of the believers mentioned in the last verse (227) are elaborated upon at the beginning of the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Warning to the Disbelievers

verses.text: Ṭâ-Sĩn-Mĩm.
verses.translation: Ṭâ-Sĩn-Mĩm.

verses.text: These are the verses of the clear Book.
verses.translation: These are the verses of the clear Book.

verses.text: Perhaps you ˹O Prophet˺ will grieve yourself to death over their disbelief.
verses.translation: Perhaps you ˹O Prophet˺ will grieve yourself to death over their disbelief.

verses.text: If We willed, We could send down upon them a ˹compelling˺ sign from the heavens, leaving their necks bent in ˹utter˺ submission to it.
verses.translation: If We willed, We could send down upon them a ˹compelling˺ sign from the heavens, leaving their necks bent in ˹utter˺ submission to it.

verses.text: Whatever new reminder comes to them from the Most Compassionate, they always turn away from it.
verses.translation: Whatever new reminder comes to them from the Most Compassionate, they always turn away from it.

verses.translation: They have certainly denied ˹the truth˺, so they will soon face the consequences of their ridicule.

verses.translation: Have they failed to look at the earth, ˹to see˺ how many types of fine plants We have caused to grow in it?

verses.text: Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe.
verses.translation: Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe.

verses.text: And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful. Prophet Moses
verses.translation: And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful. Prophet Moses

verses.text: ˹Remember˺ when your Lord called out to Moses, “Go to the wrongdoing people—
verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when your Lord called out to Moses, “Go to the wrongdoing people—

verses.text: the people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear ˹Allah˺?”
verses.translation: the people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear ˹Allah˺?”

verses.text: He replied, “My Lord! I fear that they will reject me.
verses.translation: He replied, “My Lord! I fear that they will reject me.

verses.text: And ˹so˺ my heart will be broken and my tongue will be tied. So send Aaron along ˹as a messenger˺.
verses.translation: And ˹so˺ my heart will be broken and my tongue will be tied. So send Aaron along ˹as a messenger˺.

verses.text: Also, they have a charge against me,[748] so I fear they may kill me.”
verses.translation: Also, they have a charge against me,[748] so I fear they may kill me.”

verses.text: Allah responded, “Certainly not! So go, both of you, with Our signs. We will be with you, listening.
verses.translation: Allah responded, “Certainly not! So go, both of you, with Our signs. We will be with you, listening.

verses.text: Go to Pharaoh and say, ‘We are messengers from the Lord of all worlds,
verses.translation: Go to Pharaoh and say, ‘We are messengers from the Lord of all worlds,

verses.text: ˹commanded to say:˺ ‘Let the Children of Israel go with us.’’” Moses vs. Pharaoh
verses.translation: ˹commanded to say:˺ ‘Let the Children of Israel go with us.’’” Moses vs. Pharaoh

verses.text: Pharaoh protested, “Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you stayed several years of your life in our care?
verses.translation: Pharaoh protested, “Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you stayed several years of your life in our care?

verses.text: Then you did what you did, [749] being ˹utterly˺ ungrateful!”
verses.translation: Then you did what you did, [749] being ˹utterly˺ ungrateful!”

verses.text: Moses replied, “I did it then, lacking guidance.
verses.translation: Moses replied, “I did it then, lacking guidance.

verses.text: So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Lord granted me wisdom and made me one of the messengers.
verses.translation: So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Lord granted me wisdom and made me one of the messengers.

verses.text: How can that be a ‘favour,’ of which you remind me, when ˹it was only because˺ you ˹have˺ enslaved the Children of Israel?”
verses.translation: How can that be a ‘favour,’ of which you remind me, when ˹it was only because˺ you ˹have˺ enslaved the Children of Israel?”

verses.text: Pharaoh asked, “And what is ‘the Lord of all worlds’?”
verses.translation: Pharaoh asked, “And what is ‘the Lord of all worlds’?”

verses.text: Moses replied, “˹He is˺ the Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything in between, if only you had sure faith.”
verses.translation: Moses replied, “˹He is˺ the Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything in between, if only you had sure faith.”

verses.text: Pharaoh said to those around him, “Did you hear ˹what he said˺?”
verses.translation: Pharaoh said to those around him, “Did you hear ˹what he said˺?”

verses.text: Moses added, “˹He is˺ your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.”
verses.translation: Moses added, “˹He is˺ your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.”

verses.text: Pharaoh said ˹mockingly˺, “Your messenger, who has been sent to you, must be insane.”
verses.translation: Pharaoh said ˹mockingly˺, “Your messenger, who has been sent to you, must be insane.”

verses.text: Moses responded: “˹He is˺ the Lord of the east and west, and everything in between, if only you had any sense.” The Challenge
verses.translation: Moses responded: “˹He is˺ the Lord of the east and west, and everything in between, if only you had any sense.” The Challenge

verses.text: Pharaoh threatened, “If you take any other god besides me, I will certainly have you imprisoned.”
verses.translation: Pharaoh threatened, “If you take any other god besides me, I will certainly have you imprisoned.”

verses.text: Moses responded, “Even if I bring you a clear proof?”
verses.translation: Moses responded, “Even if I bring you a clear proof?”

verses.text: Pharaoh demanded, “Bring it then, if what you say is true.”
verses.translation: Pharaoh demanded, “Bring it then, if what you say is true.”

verses.text: So he threw down his staff and—behold!—it became a real snake.
verses.translation: So he threw down his staff and—behold!—it became a real snake.

verses.text: Then he drew his hand ˹out of his collar˺ and it was ˹shining˺ white for all to see.
verses.translation: Then he drew his hand ˹out of his collar˺ and it was ˹shining˺ white for all to see.

verses.text: Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him, “He is indeed a skilled magician,
verses.translation: Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him, “He is indeed a skilled magician,

verses.text: who seeks to drive you from your land by his magic. So what do you propose?”
verses.translation: who seeks to drive you from your land by his magic. So what do you propose?”

verses.text: They replied, “Let him and his brother wait and dispatch mobilizers to all cities
verses.translation: They replied, “Let him and his brother wait and dispatch mobilizers to all cities

verses.text: to bring you every skilled magician.”
verses.translation: to bring you every skilled magician.”

verses.text: So the magicians were assembled at the set time on the appointed day.
verses.translation: So the magicians were assembled at the set time on the appointed day.

verses.text: And the people were asked, “Will you join the gathering,
verses.translation: And the people were asked, “Will you join the gathering,

verses.text: so that we may follow the magicians if they prevail?” Moses and the Magicians Face off
verses.translation: so that we may follow the magicians if they prevail?” Moses and the Magicians Face off

verses.text: When the magicians came, they asked Pharaoh, “Shall we have a ˹suitable˺ reward if we prevail?”
verses.translation: When the magicians came, they asked Pharaoh, “Shall we have a ˹suitable˺ reward if we prevail?”

verses.text: He replied, “Yes, and you will then certainly be among those closest to me.”
verses.translation: He replied, “Yes, and you will then certainly be among those closest to me.”

verses.text: Moses said to them, “Cast whatever you wish to cast.”
verses.translation: Moses said to them, “Cast whatever you wish to cast.”

verses.text: So they cast down their ropes and staffs, saying, “By Pharaoh’s might, it is we who will surely prevail.”
verses.translation: So they cast down their ropes and staffs, saying, “By Pharaoh’s might, it is we who will surely prevail.”

verses.text: Then Moses threw down his staff, and—behold!—it devoured the objects of their illusion! Magicians Become Believers
verses.translation: Then Moses threw down his staff, and—behold!—it devoured the objects of their illusion! Magicians Become Believers

verses.text: So the magicians fell down, prostrating.
verses.translation: So the magicians fell down, prostrating.

verses.text: They declared, “We ˹now˺ believe in the Lord of all worlds—
verses.translation: They declared, “We ˹now˺ believe in the Lord of all worlds—

verses.text: the Lord of Moses and Aaron.”
verses.translation: the Lord of Moses and Aaron.”

verses.text: Pharaoh threatened, “How dare you believe in him before I give you permission? He must be your master who taught you magic, but soon you will see. I will certainly cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, then crucify you all.”
verses.translation: Pharaoh threatened, “How dare you believe in him before I give you permission? He must be your master who taught you magic, but soon you will see. I will certainly cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, then crucify you all.”

verses.text: They responded, “˹That would be˺ no harm! Surely to our Lord we will ˹all˺ return.
verses.translation: They responded, “˹That would be˺ no harm! Surely to our Lord we will ˹all˺ return.

verses.text: We really hope that our Lord will forgive our sins, as we are the first to believe.” Pharaoh Chases the Israelites
verses.translation: We really hope that our Lord will forgive our sins, as we are the first to believe.” Pharaoh Chases the Israelites

verses.text: And We inspired Moses, ˹saying,˺ “Leave with My servants at night, for you will surely be pursued.”
verses.translation: And We inspired Moses, ˹saying,˺ “Leave with My servants at night, for you will surely be pursued.”

verses.text: Then Pharaoh sent mobilizers to all cities,
verses.translation: Then Pharaoh sent mobilizers to all cities,

verses.text: ˹and said,˺ “These ˹outcasts˺ are just a handful of people,
verses.translation: ˹and said,˺ “These ˹outcasts˺ are just a handful of people,

verses.text: who have really enraged us,
verses.translation: who have really enraged us,

verses.text: but we are all on the alert.”
verses.translation: but we are all on the alert.”

verses.text: So We lured the tyrants[750] out of ˹their˺ gardens, springs,
verses.translation: So We lured the tyrants[750] out of ˹their˺ gardens, springs,

verses.translation: treasures, and splendid residences.

verses.translation: So it was. And We awarded it ˹all˺ to the Children of Israel. The End of Pharaoh

verses.translation: And so they pursued them at sunrise.

verses.translation: When the two groups came face to face, the companions of Moses cried out, “We are overtaken for sure.”

verses.translation: Moses reassured ˹them˺, “Absolutely not! My Lord is certainly with me—He will guide me.”

verses.translation: So We inspired Moses: “Strike the sea with your staff,” and the sea was split, each part was like a huge mountain.

verses.text: We drew the pursuers to that place,
verses.translation: We drew the pursuers to that place,

verses.text: and delivered Moses and those with him all together.
verses.translation: and delivered Moses and those with him all together.

verses.text: Then We drowned the others.
verses.translation: Then We drowned the others.

verses.text: Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe.
verses.translation: Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe.

verses.text: And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful. Prophet Abraham
verses.translation: And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful. Prophet Abraham

verses.translation: Relate to them ˹O Prophet˺ the story of Abraham,

verses.translation: when he questioned his father and his people, “What is that you worship ˹besides Allah˺?”

verses.text: They replied, “We worship idols, to which we are fully devoted.”
verses.translation: They replied, “We worship idols, to which we are fully devoted.”

verses.translation: Abraham asked, “Can they hear you when you call upon them?

name: The Ants
intro: This Meccan sûrah narrates the encounters of Solomon ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) with ants (hence the sûrah’s name), a hoopoe, and the Queen of Sheba—which do not appear in any other sûrah. Allah’s power to create and provide is contrasted with the powerlessness of the idols. Some deterring examples are given to the pagans, along with a warning of the horrors of the apocalypse. The Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is reassured of the truth of the Quran and told that his duty is only to deliver the message. Judgment rests with Allah alone. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Qualities of the Believers

verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when Moses said to his family, “I have spotted a fire. I will either bring you some directions[765] from there, or a burning torch so you may warm yourselves.”

verses.text: But when he came to it, he was called ˹by Allah˺, “Blessed is the one at the fire, and whoever is around it![766] Glory be to Allah, the Lord of all worlds.
verses.translation: But when he came to it, he was called ˹by Allah˺, “Blessed is the one at the fire, and whoever is around it![766] Glory be to Allah, the Lord of all worlds.

verses.text: O Moses! It is truly I. I am Allah—the Almighty, All-Wise.
verses.translation: O Moses! It is truly I. I am Allah—the Almighty, All-Wise.

verses.text: Now, throw down your staff!” But when he saw it slithering like a snake, he ran away without looking back. ˹Allah reassured him,˺ “O Moses! Do not be afraid! Messengers should have no fear in My presence.
verses.translation: Now, throw down your staff!” But when he saw it slithering like a snake, he ran away without looking back. ˹Allah reassured him,˺ “O Moses! Do not be afraid! Messengers should have no fear in My presence.

verses.text: ˹Fear is˺ only for those who do wrong. But if they later mend ˹their˺ evil ˹ways˺ with good, then I am certainly All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
verses.translation: ˹Fear is˺ only for those who do wrong. But if they later mend ˹their˺ evil ˹ways˺ with good, then I am certainly All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

verses.text: Now put your hand through ˹the opening of˺ your collar, it will come out ˹shining˺ white, unblemished.[767] ˹These are two˺ of nine signs for Pharaoh and his people.[768] They have truly been a rebellious people.”
verses.translation: Now put your hand through ˹the opening of˺ your collar, it will come out ˹shining˺ white, unblemished.[767] ˹These are two˺ of nine signs for Pharaoh and his people.[768] They have truly been a rebellious people.”

verses.text: But when Our enlightening signs came to them, they said, “This is pure magic.”
verses.translation: But when Our enlightening signs came to them, they said, “This is pure magic.”

verses.text: And, although their hearts were convinced the signs were true, they still denied them wrongfully and arrogantly. See then what was the end of the corruptors! David and Solomon
verses.translation: And, although their hearts were convinced the signs were true, they still denied them wrongfully and arrogantly. See then what was the end of the corruptors! David and Solomon

verses.text: Indeed, We granted knowledge to David and Solomon. And they said ˹in acknowledgment˺, “All praise is for Allah Who has privileged us over many of His faithful servants.”[769]
verses.translation: Indeed, We granted knowledge to David and Solomon. And they said ˹in acknowledgment˺, “All praise is for Allah Who has privileged us over many of His faithful servants.”[769]

verses.text: And David was succeeded by Solomon, who said, “O people! We have been taught the language of birds, and been given everything ˹we need˺. This is indeed a great privilege.” Solomon and the Ant
verses.translation: And David was succeeded by Solomon, who said, “O people! We have been taught the language of birds, and been given everything ˹we need˺. This is indeed a great privilege.” Solomon and the Ant

verses.text: Solomon’s forces of jinn, humans, and birds were rallied for him, perfectly organized.
verses.translation: Solomon’s forces of jinn, humans, and birds were rallied for him, perfectly organized.

verses.text: And when they came across a valley of ants, an ant warned, “O ants! Go quickly into your homes so Solomon and his armies do not crush you, unknowingly.”
verses.translation: And when they came across a valley of ants, an ant warned, “O ants! Go quickly into your homes so Solomon and his armies do not crush you, unknowingly.”

verses.text: So Solomon smiled in amusement at her words, and prayed, “My Lord! Inspire me to ˹always˺ be thankful for Your favours which You have blessed me and my parents with, and to do good deeds that please you. Admit me, by Your mercy, into ˹the company of˺ Your righteous servants.” Solomon and the Hoopoe
verses.translation: So Solomon smiled in amusement at her words, and prayed, “My Lord! Inspire me to ˹always˺ be thankful for Your favours which You have blessed me and my parents with, and to do good deeds that please you. Admit me, by Your mercy, into ˹the company of˺ Your righteous servants.” Solomon and the Hoopoe

verses.text: ˹One day˺ he inspected the birds, and wondered, “Why is it that I cannot see the hoopoe? Or could he be absent?
verses.translation: ˹One day˺ he inspected the birds, and wondered, “Why is it that I cannot see the hoopoe? Or could he be absent?

verses.text: I will surely subject him to a severe punishment, or ˹even˺ slaughter him, unless he brings me a compelling excuse.”
verses.translation: I will surely subject him to a severe punishment, or ˹even˺ slaughter him, unless he brings me a compelling excuse.”

verses.text: It was not long before the bird came and said, “I have found out something you do not know. I have just come to you from Sheba with sure news.
verses.translation: It was not long before the bird came and said, “I have found out something you do not know. I have just come to you from Sheba with sure news.

verses.text: Indeed, I found a woman ruling over them,[770] who has been given everything ˹she needs˺, and who has a magnificent throne.
verses.translation: Indeed, I found a woman ruling over them,[770] who has been given everything ˹she needs˺, and who has a magnificent throne.

verses.text: I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of Allah. For Satan has made their deeds appealing to them—hindering them from the ˹Right˺ Way and leaving them unguided—
verses.translation: I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of Allah. For Satan has made their deeds appealing to them—hindering them from the ˹Right˺ Way and leaving them unguided—

verses.text: so they do not prostrate to Allah, Who brings forth what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and knows what you ˹all˺ conceal and what you reveal.
verses.translation: so they do not prostrate to Allah, Who brings forth what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and knows what you ˹all˺ conceal and what you reveal.

verses.text: ˹He is˺ Allah! There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him, the Lord of the Mighty Throne.” Solomon’s Letter
verses.translation: ˹He is˺ Allah! There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him, the Lord of the Mighty Throne.” Solomon’s Letter

verses.text: Solomon said, “We will see whether you are telling the truth or lying.
verses.translation: Solomon said, “We will see whether you are telling the truth or lying.

verses.text: Go with this letter of mine and deliver it to them, then stand aside and see how they will respond.”
verses.translation: Go with this letter of mine and deliver it to them, then stand aside and see how they will respond.”

verses.text: The Queen ˹later˺ announced, “O chiefs! Indeed, a noble letter has been delivered to me.
verses.translation: The Queen ˹later˺ announced, “O chiefs! Indeed, a noble letter has been delivered to me.

verses.text: It is from Solomon, and it reads: ‘In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
verses.translation: It is from Solomon, and it reads: ‘In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.

verses.text: Do not be arrogant with me, but come to me, fully submitting ˹to Allah˺.’” The Queen’s Response
verses.translation: Do not be arrogant with me, but come to me, fully submitting ˹to Allah˺.’” The Queen’s Response

verses.text: She said, “O chiefs! Advise me in this matter of mine, for I would never make any decision without you.”
verses.translation: She said, “O chiefs! Advise me in this matter of mine, for I would never make any decision without you.”

verses.text: They responded, “We are a people of strength and great ˹military˺ might, but the decision is yours, so decide what you will command.”
verses.translation: They responded, “We are a people of strength and great ˹military˺ might, but the decision is yours, so decide what you will command.”

verses.text: She reasoned, “Indeed, when kings invade a land, they ruin it and debase its nobles. They really do so!
verses.translation: She reasoned, “Indeed, when kings invade a land, they ruin it and debase its nobles. They really do so!

verses.text: But I will certainly send him a gift, and see what ˹response˺ my envoys will return with.”[771] Solomon’s Response
verses.translation: But I will certainly send him a gift, and see what ˹response˺ my envoys will return with.”[771] Solomon’s Response

verses.text: When the chief-envoy came to him, Solomon said, “Do you offer me wealth? What Allah has granted me is far greater than what He has granted you. No! It is you who rejoice in ˹receiving˺ gifts.
verses.translation: When the chief-envoy came to him, Solomon said, “Do you offer me wealth? What Allah has granted me is far greater than what He has granted you. No! It is you who rejoice in ˹receiving˺ gifts.

verses.text: Go back to them, for we will certainly mobilize against them forces which they can never resist, and we will drive them out from there in disgrace, fully humbled.”[772] The Queen’s Throne
verses.translation: Go back to them, for we will certainly mobilize against them forces which they can never resist, and we will drive them out from there in disgrace, fully humbled.”[772] The Queen’s Throne

verses.text: Solomon asked, “O chiefs! Which of you can bring me her throne before they come to me in ˹full˺ submission?”[773]
verses.translation: Solomon asked, “O chiefs! Which of you can bring me her throne before they come to me in ˹full˺ submission?”[773]

verses.text: One mighty jinn responded, “I can bring it to you before you rise from this council of yours. And I am quite strong and trustworthy for this ˹task˺.”
verses.translation: One mighty jinn responded, “I can bring it to you before you rise from this council of yours. And I am quite strong and trustworthy for this ˹task˺.”

verses.text: But the one who had knowledge of the Scripture said,[774] “I can bring it to you in the blink of an eye.” So when Solomon saw it placed before him, he exclaimed, “This is by the grace of my Lord to test me whether I am grateful or ungrateful. And whoever is grateful, it is only for their own good. But whoever is ungrateful, surely my Lord is Self-Sufficient, Most Generous.”
verses.translation: But the one who had knowledge of the Scripture said,[774] “I can bring it to you in the blink of an eye.” So when Solomon saw it placed before him, he exclaimed, “This is by the grace of my Lord to test me whether I am grateful or ungrateful. And whoever is grateful, it is only for their own good. But whoever is ungrateful, surely my Lord is Self-Sufficient, Most Generous.”

verses.text: ˹Then˺ Solomon said, “Disguise her throne for her so we may see whether she will recognize ˹it˺ or she will not be able to.”
verses.translation: ˹Then˺ Solomon said, “Disguise her throne for her so we may see whether she will recognize ˹it˺ or she will not be able to.”

verses.text: So when she arrived, it was said ˹to her˺, “Is your throne like this?” She replied, “It looks to be the same. We have ˹already˺ received knowledge ˹of Solomon’s prophethood˺[775] before this ˹miracle˺,[776] and have submitted ˹to Allah˺.”
verses.translation: So when she arrived, it was said ˹to her˺, “Is your throne like this?” She replied, “It looks to be the same. We have ˹already˺ received knowledge ˹of Solomon’s prophethood˺[775] before this ˹miracle˺,[776] and have submitted ˹to Allah˺.”

verses.text: But she had been hindered by what she used to worship instead of Allah, for she was indeed from a disbelieving people. Solomon’s Palace
verses.translation: But she had been hindered by what she used to worship instead of Allah, for she was indeed from a disbelieving people. Solomon’s Palace

verses.text: Then she was told, “Enter the palace.” But when she saw the hall, she thought it was a body of water, so she bared her legs. Solomon said. “It is just a palace paved with crystal.” ˹At last˺ she declared, “My Lord! I have certainly wronged my soul. Now I ˹fully˺ submit myself along with Solomon to Allah, the Lord of all worlds.” Prophet Ṣâli ḥ and His People
verses.translation: Then she was told, “Enter the palace.” But when she saw the hall, she thought it was a body of water, so she bared her legs. Solomon said. “It is just a palace paved with crystal.” ˹At last˺ she declared, “My Lord! I have certainly wronged my soul. Now I ˹fully˺ submit myself along with Solomon to Allah, the Lord of all worlds.” Prophet Ṣâli ḥ and His People

verses.text: And We certainly sent to the people of Thamûd their brother Ṣâliḥ, proclaiming, “Worship Allah,” but they suddenly split into two opposing groups.[777]
verses.translation: And We certainly sent to the people of Thamûd their brother Ṣâliḥ, proclaiming, “Worship Allah,” but they suddenly split into two opposing groups.[777]

verses.text: He urged ˹the disbelieving group˺, “O my people! Why do you ˹seek to˺ hasten the torment[778] rather than grace?[779] If only you sought Allah’s forgiveness so you may be shown mercy!”
verses.translation: He urged ˹the disbelieving group˺, “O my people! Why do you ˹seek to˺ hasten the torment[778] rather than grace?[779] If only you sought Allah’s forgiveness so you may be shown mercy!”

verses.text: They replied, “You and your followers are a bad omen for us.”[780] He responded, “Your omens are destined by Allah. In fact, you are ˹only˺ a people being tested.” An Attempt on Ṣâli ḥ’s Life
verses.translation: They replied, “You and your followers are a bad omen for us.”[780] He responded, “Your omens are destined by Allah. In fact, you are ˹only˺ a people being tested.” An Attempt on Ṣâli ḥ’s Life

verses.text: And there were in the city nine ˹elite˺ men who spread corruption in the land, never doing what is right.
verses.translation: And there were in the city nine ˹elite˺ men who spread corruption in the land, never doing what is right.

verses.text: They vowed, “Let us swear by Allah that we will take him and his family down by night. Then we will certainly say to his ˹closest˺ heirs, ‘We did not witness the murder of his family. We are definitely telling the truth.’”
verses.translation: They vowed, “Let us swear by Allah that we will take him and his family down by night. Then we will certainly say to his ˹closest˺ heirs, ‘We did not witness the murder of his family. We are definitely telling the truth.’”

verses.text: And ˹so˺ they made a plan, but We too made a plan, while they were unaware.
verses.translation: And ˹so˺ they made a plan, but We too made a plan, while they were unaware.

verses.text: See then what the consequences of their plan were: We ˹utterly˺ destroyed them and their people all together.
verses.translation: See then what the consequences of their plan were: We ˹utterly˺ destroyed them and their people all together.

verses.text: So their homes are there, ˹but completely˺ ruined because of their wrongdoing. Surely in this is a lesson for people of knowledge.
verses.translation: So their homes are there, ˹but completely˺ ruined because of their wrongdoing. Surely in this is a lesson for people of knowledge.

verses.text: And We delivered those who were faithful and were mindful ˹of Allah˺. Prophet Lot and His People
verses.translation: And We delivered those who were faithful and were mindful ˹of Allah˺. Prophet Lot and His People

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ Lot, when he rebuked ˹the men of˺ his people, “Do you commit that shameful deed while you can see ˹one another˺?
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ Lot, when he rebuked ˹the men of˺ his people, “Do you commit that shameful deed while you can see ˹one another˺?

verses.text: Do you really lust after men instead of women? In fact, you are ˹only˺ a people acting ignorantly.”
verses.translation: Do you really lust after men instead of women? In fact, you are ˹only˺ a people acting ignorantly.”

verses.text: But his people’s only response was to say, “Expel Lot’s followers from your land! They are a people who wish to remain chaste!”
verses.translation: But his people’s only response was to say, “Expel Lot’s followers from your land! They are a people who wish to remain chaste!”

verses.text: So We delivered him and his family, except his wife. We had destined her to be one of the doomed.
verses.translation: So We delivered him and his family, except his wife. We had destined her to be one of the doomed.

verses.text: And We poured upon them a rain ˹of brimstone˺. How evil was the rain of those who had been warned! Questions to the Pagans:1) Who Is the Creator?
verses.translation: And We poured upon them a rain ˹of brimstone˺. How evil was the rain of those who had been warned! Questions to the Pagans:1) Who Is the Creator?

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Praise be to Allah, and peace be upon the servants He has chosen.” ˹Ask the disbelievers,˺ “Which is better: Allah or whatever ˹gods˺ they associate ˹with Him˺?”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Praise be to Allah, and peace be upon the servants He has chosen.” ˹Ask the disbelievers,˺ “Which is better: Allah or whatever ˹gods˺ they associate ˹with Him˺?”

verses.text: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who created the heavens and the earth, and sends down rain for you from the sky, by which We cause delightful gardens to grow? You could never cause their trees to grow. Was it another god besides Allah?” Absolutely not! But they are a people who set up equals ˹to Allah˺!
verses.translation: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who created the heavens and the earth, and sends down rain for you from the sky, by which We cause delightful gardens to grow? You could never cause their trees to grow. Was it another god besides Allah?” Absolutely not! But they are a people who set up equals ˹to Allah˺!

verses.text: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who made the earth a place of settlement, caused rivers to flow through it, placed firm mountains upon it, and set a barrier between ˹fresh and salt˺ bodies of water?[781] Was it another god besides Allah?” Absolutely not! But most of them do not know. 2) Who Is the Most Gracious?
verses.translation: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who made the earth a place of settlement, caused rivers to flow through it, placed firm mountains upon it, and set a barrier between ˹fresh and salt˺ bodies of water?[781] Was it another god besides Allah?” Absolutely not! But most of them do not know. 2) Who Is the Most Gracious?

verses.text: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who responds to the distressed when they cry to Him, relieving ˹their˺ affliction, and ˹Who˺ makes you successors in the earth? Is it another god besides Allah? Yet you are hardly mindful!”
verses.translation: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who responds to the distressed when they cry to Him, relieving ˹their˺ affliction, and ˹Who˺ makes you successors in the earth? Is it another god besides Allah? Yet you are hardly mindful!”

verses.text: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who guides you in the darkness of the land and sea,[782] and sends the winds ushering in His mercy?[783] Is it another god besides Allah? Exalted is Allah above what they associate ˹with Him˺!
verses.translation: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who guides you in the darkness of the land and sea,[782] and sends the winds ushering in His mercy?[783] Is it another god besides Allah? Exalted is Allah above what they associate ˹with Him˺!

verses.text: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who originates the creation then resurrects it, and gives you provisions from the heavens and the earth? Is it another god besides Allah?” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Show ˹me˺ your proof, if what you say is true.” Only Allah Knows the Unseen[784]
verses.translation: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who originates the creation then resurrects it, and gives you provisions from the heavens and the earth? Is it another god besides Allah?” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Show ˹me˺ your proof, if what you say is true.” Only Allah Knows the Unseen[784]

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “None in the heavens and the earth has knowledge of the unseen except Allah. Nor do they know when they will be resurrected.”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “None in the heavens and the earth has knowledge of the unseen except Allah. Nor do they know when they will be resurrected.”

verses.text: No! Their knowledge of the Hereafter amounts to ignorance. In fact, they are in doubt about it. In truth, they are ˹totally˺ blind to it. Denying Resurrection
verses.translation: No! Their knowledge of the Hereafter amounts to ignorance. In fact, they are in doubt about it. In truth, they are ˹totally˺ blind to it. Denying Resurrection

verses.text: The disbelievers ask, “When we and our fathers are reduced to dust, will we really be brought forth ˹alive˺?
verses.translation: The disbelievers ask, “When we and our fathers are reduced to dust, will we really be brought forth ˹alive˺?

verses.text: We have already been promised this, as well as our forefathers earlier. This is nothing but ancient fables!”
verses.translation: We have already been promised this, as well as our forefathers earlier. This is nothing but ancient fables!”

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Travel throughout the land and see the fate of the wicked.”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Travel throughout the land and see the fate of the wicked.”

verses.text: Do not grieve for them, nor be distressed by their schemes. Ridiculing Punishment
verses.translation: Do not grieve for them, nor be distressed by their schemes. Ridiculing Punishment

verses.text: They ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass, if what you say is true?”
verses.translation: They ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass, if what you say is true?”

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Perhaps some of what you seek to hasten is close at hand.”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Perhaps some of what you seek to hasten is close at hand.”

verses.text: Surely your Lord is ever Bountiful to humanity, [785] but most of them are ungrateful.
verses.translation: Surely your Lord is ever Bountiful to humanity, [785] but most of them are ungrateful.

verses.text: And surely your Lord knows what their hearts conceal and what they reveal.[786]
verses.translation: And surely your Lord knows what their hearts conceal and what they reveal.[786]

verses.text: For there is nothing hidden in the heavens or the earth without being ˹written˺ in a perfect Record.[787] Advice to the Prophet
verses.translation: For there is nothing hidden in the heavens or the earth without being ˹written˺ in a perfect Record.[787] Advice to the Prophet

verses.text: Indeed, this Quran clarifies for the Children of Israel most of what they differ over.
verses.translation: Indeed, this Quran clarifies for the Children of Israel most of what they differ over.

verses.text: And it is truly a guide and mercy for the believers.
verses.translation: And it is truly a guide and mercy for the believers.

verses.text: Your Lord will certainly judge between them by His justice, for He is the Almighty, All-Knowing.
verses.translation: Your Lord will certainly judge between them by His justice, for He is the Almighty, All-Knowing.

verses.text: So put your trust in Allah, for you are surely upon the ˹Path of˺ clear truth.
verses.translation: So put your trust in Allah, for you are surely upon the ˹Path of˺ clear truth.

verses.text: You certainly cannot make the dead hear ˹the truth˺. Nor can you make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs and walk away.
verses.translation: You certainly cannot make the dead hear ˹the truth˺. Nor can you make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs and walk away.

verses.text: Nor can you lead the blind out of their misguidance. You can make none hear ˹the truth˺ except those who believe in Our revelations, ˹fully˺ submitting ˹to Allah˺. The Apocalypse
verses.translation: Nor can you lead the blind out of their misguidance. You can make none hear ˹the truth˺ except those who believe in Our revelations, ˹fully˺ submitting ˹to Allah˺. The Apocalypse

verses.text: And when the decree ˹of the Hour˺ comes to pass against them, We will bring forth for them a beast from the earth,[788] telling them that the people had no sure faith in Our revelations.
verses.translation: And when the decree ˹of the Hour˺ comes to pass against them, We will bring forth for them a beast from the earth,[788] telling them that the people had no sure faith in Our revelations.

verses.text: ˹Watch for˺ the Day We will gather from every faith-community a group of those who denied Our revelations, and they will be driven in ranks.
verses.translation: ˹Watch for˺ the Day We will gather from every faith-community a group of those who denied Our revelations, and they will be driven in ranks.

verses.text: When they ˹finally˺ come before their Lord, He will ask ˹them˺, “Did you deny My revelations without ˹even˺ comprehending them? Or what ˹exactly˺ did you do?”
verses.translation: When they ˹finally˺ come before their Lord, He will ask ˹them˺, “Did you deny My revelations without ˹even˺ comprehending them? Or what ˹exactly˺ did you do?”

verses.text: And the decree ˹of torment˺ will be justified against them for their wrongdoing, leaving them speechless. Allah’s Power 1) The Day and Night
verses.translation: And the decree ˹of torment˺ will be justified against them for their wrongdoing, leaving them speechless. Allah’s Power 1) The Day and Night

verses.text: Do they not see that We made the night for them to rest in and the day bright?[ 7 8 9 ] Surely in this are signs for those who believe. The Apocalypse
verses.translation: Do they not see that We made the night for them to rest in and the day bright?[ 7 8 9 ] Surely in this are signs for those who believe. The Apocalypse

verses.text: And ˹beware of˺ the Day the Trumpet will be blown, and all those in the heavens and all those on the earth will be horrified ˹to the point of death˺, [790] except those Allah wills ˹to spare˺. And all will come before Him, fully humbled. Allah’s Power 2) Earth’s Rotation
verses.translation: And ˹beware of˺ the Day the Trumpet will be blown, and all those in the heavens and all those on the earth will be horrified ˹to the point of death˺, [790] except those Allah wills ˹to spare˺. And all will come before Him, fully humbled. Allah’s Power 2) Earth’s Rotation

verses.text: Now you see the mountains, thinking they are firmly fixed, but they are travelling ˹just˺ like clouds. ˹That is˺ the design of Allah, Who has perfected everything. Surely He is All-Aware of what you do. Judgment Day
verses.translation: Now you see the mountains, thinking they are firmly fixed, but they are travelling ˹just˺ like clouds. ˹That is˺ the design of Allah, Who has perfected everything. Surely He is All-Aware of what you do. Judgment Day

verses.text: Whoever comes with a good deed will be rewarded with what is better, and they will be secure from the horror on that Day.
verses.translation: Whoever comes with a good deed will be rewarded with what is better, and they will be secure from the horror on that Day.

verses.text: And whoever comes with an evil deed will be hurled face-first into the Fire. Are you rewarded except for what you used to do? Advice to the Prophet
verses.translation: And whoever comes with an evil deed will be hurled face-first into the Fire. Are you rewarded except for what you used to do? Advice to the Prophet

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I have only been commanded to worship the Lord of this city ˹of Mecca˺, Who has made it sacred, and to Him belongs everything. And I am commanded to be one of those who ˹fully˺ submit ˹to Him˺,
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I have only been commanded to worship the Lord of this city ˹of Mecca˺, Who has made it sacred, and to Him belongs everything. And I am commanded to be one of those who ˹fully˺ submit ˹to Him˺,

verses.text: and to recite the Quran.” Then whoever chooses to be guided, it is only for their own good. But whoever chooses to stray, say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I am only a warner.”
verses.translation: and to recite the Quran.” Then whoever chooses to be guided, it is only for their own good. But whoever chooses to stray, say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I am only a warner.”

verses.text: And say, “All praise is for Allah! He will show you His signs, and you will recognize them. And your Lord is never unaware of what you do.” *** -- 335 of 694 --
verses.translation: And say, “All praise is for Allah! He will show you His signs, and you will recognize them. And your Lord is never unaware of what you do.” *** -- 335 of 694 --

name: The Whole Story
intro: In 26:18-19, Pharaoh reminds Moses ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) of his up-bringing in the care of Pharaoh and how Moses ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) killed an Egyptian (accidentally). Unlike the previous sûrah, this Meccan sûrah focuses on these two aspects of Moses’ life in Egypt, along with his escape to Midian where he met his future wife. Another aspect is the story of Korah, one of the people of Moses, who behaved arrogantly, leading to his own destruction. Just like the previous sûrah, it reaffirms Allah’s power and the authenticity of the Quran. Again, the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is reminded that his duty is not to convert, but to convey. After criticizing the polytheists (verses 45-75), the sûrah concludes by bidding the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) to be steadfast. The next sûrah starts off by talking about steadfastness. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Pharaoh’s Tyranny

verses.text: Ṭâ-Sĩn-Mĩm.
verses.translation: Ṭâ-Sĩn-Mĩm.

verses.text: These are the verses of the clear Book.
verses.translation: These are the verses of the clear Book.

verses.text: We narrate to you ˹O Prophet˺ part of the story of Moses and Pharaoh in truth for people who believe.
verses.translation: We narrate to you ˹O Prophet˺ part of the story of Moses and Pharaoh in truth for people who believe.

verses.text: Indeed, Pharaoh ˹arrogantly˺ elevated himself in the land and divided its people into ˹subservient˺ groups, one of which he persecuted, slaughtering their sons and keeping their women. He was truly one of the corruptors.
verses.translation: Indeed, Pharaoh ˹arrogantly˺ elevated himself in the land and divided its people into ˹subservient˺ groups, one of which he persecuted, slaughtering their sons and keeping their women. He was truly one of the corruptors.

verses.text: But it was Our Will to favour those who were oppressed in the land, making them models ˹of faith˺ as well as successors;
verses.translation: But it was Our Will to favour those who were oppressed in the land, making them models ˹of faith˺ as well as successors;

verses.text: and to establish them in the land; and through them show Pharaoh, Hamân,[791] and their soldiers ˹the fulfilment of˺ what they feared.[792] Baby Moses in the Nile
verses.translation: and to establish them in the land; and through them show Pharaoh, Hamân,[791] and their soldiers ˹the fulfilment of˺ what they feared.[792] Baby Moses in the Nile

verses.text: We inspired the mother of Moses: “Nurse him, but when you fear for him, put him then into the river, and do not fear or grieve. We will certainly return him to you, and make him one of the messengers.”
verses.translation: We inspired the mother of Moses: “Nurse him, but when you fear for him, put him then into the river, and do not fear or grieve. We will certainly return him to you, and make him one of the messengers.”

verses.text: And ˹it so happened that˺ Pharaoh’s people picked him up, only to become their enemy and source of grief. Surely Pharaoh, Hamân, and their soldiers were sinful. Moses in the Palace
verses.translation: And ˹it so happened that˺ Pharaoh’s people picked him up, only to become their enemy and source of grief. Surely Pharaoh, Hamân, and their soldiers were sinful. Moses in the Palace

verses.text: Pharaoh’s wife said ˹to him˺, “˹This baby is˺ a source of joy for me and you. Do not kill him. Perhaps he may be useful to us or we may adopt him as a son.” They were unaware ˹of what was to come˺.
verses.translation: Pharaoh’s wife said ˹to him˺, “˹This baby is˺ a source of joy for me and you. Do not kill him. Perhaps he may be useful to us or we may adopt him as a son.” They were unaware ˹of what was to come˺.

verses.text: And the heart of Moses’ mother ached so much that she almost gave away his identity, had We not reassured her heart in order for her to have faith ˹in Allah’s promise˺.
verses.translation: And the heart of Moses’ mother ached so much that she almost gave away his identity, had We not reassured her heart in order for her to have faith ˹in Allah’s promise˺.

verses.text: And she said to his sister, “Keep track of him!” So she watched him from a distance, while they were unaware.
verses.translation: And she said to his sister, “Keep track of him!” So she watched him from a distance, while they were unaware.

verses.text: And We had caused him to refuse all wet-nurses at first, so his sister suggested, “Shall I direct you to a family who will bring him up for you and take good care of him?”
verses.translation: And We had caused him to refuse all wet-nurses at first, so his sister suggested, “Shall I direct you to a family who will bring him up for you and take good care of him?”

verses.text: This is how We returned him to his mother so that her heart would be put at ease, and not grieve, and that she would know that Allah’s promise is ˹always˺ true. But most people do not know.
verses.translation: This is how We returned him to his mother so that her heart would be put at ease, and not grieve, and that she would know that Allah’s promise is ˹always˺ true. But most people do not know.

verses.text: And when he reached full strength and maturity, We gave him wisdom and knowledge. This is how We reward the good-doers. Unintentional Killing
verses.translation: And when he reached full strength and maturity, We gave him wisdom and knowledge. This is how We reward the good-doers. Unintentional Killing

verses.text: ˹One day˺ he entered the city unnoticed by its people.[793] There he found two men fighting: one of his own people, and the other of his enemies. The man from his people called to him for help against his foe. So Moses punched him, causing his death. Moses cried, “This is from Satan’s handiwork. He is certainly a sworn, misleading enemy.”
verses.translation: ˹One day˺ he entered the city unnoticed by its people.[793] There he found two men fighting: one of his own people, and the other of his enemies. The man from his people called to him for help against his foe. So Moses punched him, causing his death. Moses cried, “This is from Satan’s handiwork. He is certainly a sworn, misleading enemy.”

verses.text: He pleaded, “My Lord! I have definitely wronged my soul, so forgive me.” So He forgave him, ˹for˺ He is indeed the All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
verses.translation: He pleaded, “My Lord! I have definitely wronged my soul, so forgive me.” So He forgave him, ˹for˺ He is indeed the All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

verses.text: Moses pledged, “My Lord! For all Your favours upon me, I will never side with the wicked.” The Incident Comes to Light
verses.translation: Moses pledged, “My Lord! For all Your favours upon me, I will never side with the wicked.” The Incident Comes to Light

verses.text: And so Moses became fearful, watching out in the city, when suddenly the one who sought his help the day before cried out to him again for help. Moses rebuked him, “Indeed, you are clearly a trouble-maker.”
verses.translation: And so Moses became fearful, watching out in the city, when suddenly the one who sought his help the day before cried out to him again for help. Moses rebuked him, “Indeed, you are clearly a trouble-maker.”

verses.text: Then when Moses was about to lay his hands on their foe,[794] the enemy said, “O Moses! Do you intend to kill me as you killed a man yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant in the land. You do not intend to make peace!” Moses Escapes to Midian
verses.translation: Then when Moses was about to lay his hands on their foe,[794] the enemy said, “O Moses! Do you intend to kill me as you killed a man yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant in the land. You do not intend to make peace!” Moses Escapes to Midian

verses.text: And there came a man, rushing from the farthest end of the city. He said, “O Moses! The chiefs are actually conspiring against you to put you to death, so leave ˹the city˺. I really advise you ˹to do so˺.”
verses.translation: And there came a man, rushing from the farthest end of the city. He said, “O Moses! The chiefs are actually conspiring against you to put you to death, so leave ˹the city˺. I really advise you ˹to do so˺.”

verses.text: So Moses left the city in a state of fear and caution, praying, “My Lord! Deliver me from the wrongdoing people.”
verses.translation: So Moses left the city in a state of fear and caution, praying, “My Lord! Deliver me from the wrongdoing people.”

verses.text: And as he made his way towards Midian, he said, “I trust my Lord will guide me to the right way.” Moses Helps Two Women
verses.translation: And as he made his way towards Midian, he said, “I trust my Lord will guide me to the right way.” Moses Helps Two Women

verses.text: When he arrived at the well of Midian, he found a group of people watering ˹their herds˺. Apart from them, he noticed two women holding back ˹their herd˺. He asked ˹them˺, “What is the problem?” They replied, “We cannot water ˹our animals˺ until the ˹other˺ shepherds are done, for our father is a very old man.”
verses.translation: When he arrived at the well of Midian, he found a group of people watering ˹their herds˺. Apart from them, he noticed two women holding back ˹their herd˺. He asked ˹them˺, “What is the problem?” They replied, “We cannot water ˹our animals˺ until the ˹other˺ shepherds are done, for our father is a very old man.”

verses.text: So he watered ˹their herd˺ for them, then withdrew to the shade and prayed, “My Lord! I am truly in ˹desperate˺ need of whatever provision You may have in store for me.”[795] Moses Gets Married
verses.translation: So he watered ˹their herd˺ for them, then withdrew to the shade and prayed, “My Lord! I am truly in ˹desperate˺ need of whatever provision You may have in store for me.”[795] Moses Gets Married

verses.text: Then one of the two women came to him, walking bashfully. She said, “My father is inviting you so he may reward you for watering ˹our animals˺ for us.” When Moses came to him and told him his whole story, the old man said, “Have no fear! You are ˹now˺ safe from the wrongdoing people.”
verses.translation: Then one of the two women came to him, walking bashfully. She said, “My father is inviting you so he may reward you for watering ˹our animals˺ for us.” When Moses came to him and told him his whole story, the old man said, “Have no fear! You are ˹now˺ safe from the wrongdoing people.”

verses.text: One of the two daughters suggested, “O my dear father! Hire him. The best man for employment is definitely the strong and trustworthy ˹one˺.”
verses.translation: One of the two daughters suggested, “O my dear father! Hire him. The best man for employment is definitely the strong and trustworthy ˹one˺.”

verses.text: The old man proposed, “I wish to marry one of these two daughters of mine to you, provided that you stay in my service for eight years. If you complete ten, it will be ˹a favour˺ from you, but I do not wish to make it difficult for you. Allah willing, you will find me an agreeable man.”
verses.translation: The old man proposed, “I wish to marry one of these two daughters of mine to you, provided that you stay in my service for eight years. If you complete ten, it will be ˹a favour˺ from you, but I do not wish to make it difficult for you. Allah willing, you will find me an agreeable man.”

verses.text: Moses responded, “˹Then˺ it is ˹settled˺ between you and I. Whichever term I fulfill, there will be no ˹further˺ obligation on me. And Allah is a Witness to what we say.” The Fateful Encounter
verses.translation: Moses responded, “˹Then˺ it is ˹settled˺ between you and I. Whichever term I fulfill, there will be no ˹further˺ obligation on me. And Allah is a Witness to what we say.” The Fateful Encounter

verses.text: When Moses had completed the term and was travelling with his family, he spotted a fire on the side of Mount Ṭûr. He said to his family, “Stay here, ˹for˺ I have spotted a fire. Perhaps from there I can bring you some directions[796] or a torch from the fire so you may warm yourselves.”
verses.translation: When Moses had completed the term and was travelling with his family, he spotted a fire on the side of Mount Ṭûr. He said to his family, “Stay here, ˹for˺ I have spotted a fire. Perhaps from there I can bring you some directions[796] or a torch from the fire so you may warm yourselves.”

verses.text: But when he came to it, he was called from the bush in the sacred ground to the right side of the valley: “O Moses! It is truly I. I am Allah—the Lord of all worlds.
verses.translation: But when he came to it, he was called from the bush in the sacred ground to the right side of the valley: “O Moses! It is truly I. I am Allah—the Lord of all worlds.

verses.text: Now, throw down your staff!” But when he saw it slithering like a snake, he ran away without looking back. ˹Allah reassured him,˺ “O Moses! Draw near, and have no fear. You are perfectly secure.
verses.translation: Now, throw down your staff!” But when he saw it slithering like a snake, he ran away without looking back. ˹Allah reassured him,˺ “O Moses! Draw near, and have no fear. You are perfectly secure.

verses.text: Now put your hand through ˹the opening of˺ your collar, it will come out ˹shining˺ white, unblemished.[797] And cross your arms tightly to calm your fears.[798] These are two proofs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his chiefs. They have truly been a rebellious people.” Moses Asks Allah for Help
verses.translation: Now put your hand through ˹the opening of˺ your collar, it will come out ˹shining˺ white, unblemished.[797] And cross your arms tightly to calm your fears.[798] These are two proofs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his chiefs. They have truly been a rebellious people.” Moses Asks Allah for Help

verses.text: Moses appealed, “My Lord! I have indeed killed a man from them, so I fear they may kill me.
verses.translation: Moses appealed, “My Lord! I have indeed killed a man from them, so I fear they may kill me.

verses.text: And my brother Aaron is more eloquent than I, so send him with me as a helper to support what I say, for I truly fear they may reject me.”
verses.translation: And my brother Aaron is more eloquent than I, so send him with me as a helper to support what I say, for I truly fear they may reject me.”

verses.text: Allah responded, “We will assist you with your brother and grant you both authority, so they cannot harm you. With Our signs, you and those who follow you will ˹certainly˺ prevail.” Pharaoh’s Response
verses.translation: Allah responded, “We will assist you with your brother and grant you both authority, so they cannot harm you. With Our signs, you and those who follow you will ˹certainly˺ prevail.” Pharaoh’s Response

verses.text: But when Moses came to them with Our clear signs, they said ˹arrogantly˺, “This is nothing but conjured magic ˹tricks˺. We have never heard of this in ˹the history of˺ our forefathers.”
verses.translation: But when Moses came to them with Our clear signs, they said ˹arrogantly˺, “This is nothing but conjured magic ˹tricks˺. We have never heard of this in ˹the history of˺ our forefathers.”

verses.text: Moses responded, “My Lord knows best who has come with ˹true˺ guidance from Him and will fare best in the end. Indeed, the wrongdoers will never succeed.”
verses.translation: Moses responded, “My Lord knows best who has come with ˹true˺ guidance from Him and will fare best in the end. Indeed, the wrongdoers will never succeed.”

verses.text: Pharaoh declared, “O chiefs! I know of no other god for you but myself. So bake bricks out of clay for me, O Hamân, and build a high tower so I may look at the God of Moses, although I am sure he is a liar.” End of Pharaoh
verses.translation: Pharaoh declared, “O chiefs! I know of no other god for you but myself. So bake bricks out of clay for me, O Hamân, and build a high tower so I may look at the God of Moses, although I am sure he is a liar.” End of Pharaoh

verses.text: And so he and his soldiers behaved arrogantly in the land with no right, thinking they would never be returned to Us.
verses.translation: And so he and his soldiers behaved arrogantly in the land with no right, thinking they would never be returned to Us.

verses.text: So We seized him and his soldiers, casting them into the sea. See then what was the end of the wrongdoers!
verses.translation: So We seized him and his soldiers, casting them into the sea. See then what was the end of the wrongdoers!

verses.text: We made them leaders inviting ˹others˺ to the Fire. And on the Day of Judgment they will not be helped.
verses.translation: We made them leaders inviting ˹others˺ to the Fire. And on the Day of Judgment they will not be helped.

verses.text: We caused a curse to follow them in this world. And on the Day of Judgment they will be among the outcasts. Excellence of the Torah
verses.translation: We caused a curse to follow them in this world. And on the Day of Judgment they will be among the outcasts. Excellence of the Torah

verses.text: Indeed, We gave Moses the Scripture—after destroying earlier nations —as an insight for the people, a guide, and mercy so perhaps they would be mindful. Revealed Stories
verses.translation: Indeed, We gave Moses the Scripture—after destroying earlier nations —as an insight for the people, a guide, and mercy so perhaps they would be mindful. Revealed Stories

verses.text: You were not there ˹O Prophet˺ on the western side of the mountain when We entrusted the Commandments to Moses, nor were you present ˹in his time˺.[799]
verses.translation: You were not there ˹O Prophet˺ on the western side of the mountain when We entrusted the Commandments to Moses, nor were you present ˹in his time˺.[799]

verses.text: But We ˹later˺ raised ˹several˺ generations, and the ages took their toll on them.[800] Nor were you living among the people of Midian, rehearsing Our revelations with them. But it is We Who have sent ˹this revelation to you˺.
verses.translation: But We ˹later˺ raised ˹several˺ generations, and the ages took their toll on them.[800] Nor were you living among the people of Midian, rehearsing Our revelations with them. But it is We Who have sent ˹this revelation to you˺.
