verses.text: And you were not at the side of Mount Ṭûr when We called out ˹to Moses˺. But ˹you have been sent˺ as a mercy from your Lord to warn a people to whom no warner has come before you, so perhaps they may be mindful.
verses.translation: And you were not at the side of Mount Ṭûr when We called out ˹to Moses˺. But ˹you have been sent˺ as a mercy from your Lord to warn a people to whom no warner has come before you, so perhaps they may be mindful.

verses.text: Also so they would not say, if struck by an affliction for what their hands have done: “Our Lord! If only You had sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your revelations and become believers.” Pagan Response to the Quran
verses.translation: Also so they would not say, if struck by an affliction for what their hands have done: “Our Lord! If only You had sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your revelations and become believers.” Pagan Response to the Quran

verses.text: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, “If only he was given the like of what Moses had been given.”[801] Did they not deny what had been given to Moses earlier? They claimed, “Both ˹Scriptures˺ are works of magic, supporting each other!”[802] Adding, “We truly deny both.”
verses.translation: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, “If only he was given the like of what Moses had been given.”[801] Did they not deny what had been given to Moses earlier? They claimed, “Both ˹Scriptures˺ are works of magic, supporting each other!”[802] Adding, “We truly deny both.”

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Bring then a scripture from Allah which is a better guide than these two so I may follow it, if your claim is true.”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Bring then a scripture from Allah which is a better guide than these two so I may follow it, if your claim is true.”

verses.text: So if they fail to respond to you, then know that they only follow their desires. And who could be more astray than those who follow their desires with no guidance from Allah? Surely Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people. The Doubly Rewarded
verses.translation: So if they fail to respond to you, then know that they only follow their desires. And who could be more astray than those who follow their desires with no guidance from Allah? Surely Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people. The Doubly Rewarded

verses.text: Indeed, We have steadily delivered the Word ˹of Allah˺ to the people so they may be mindful.
verses.translation: Indeed, We have steadily delivered the Word ˹of Allah˺ to the people so they may be mindful.

verses.text: ˹As for˺ those ˹faithful˺ to whom We had given the Scripture before this ˹Quran˺, they do believe in it.
verses.translation: ˹As for˺ those ˹faithful˺ to whom We had given the Scripture before this ˹Quran˺, they do believe in it.

verses.text: When it is recited to them, they declare, “We believe in it. This is definitely the truth from our Lord. We had already submitted[803] ˹even˺ before this.”
verses.translation: When it is recited to them, they declare, “We believe in it. This is definitely the truth from our Lord. We had already submitted[803] ˹even˺ before this.”

verses.text: These ˹believers˺ will be given a double reward for their perseverance, responding to evil with good, and for donating from what We have provided for them.
verses.translation: These ˹believers˺ will be given a double reward for their perseverance, responding to evil with good, and for donating from what We have provided for them.

verses.text: When they hear slanderous talk, they turn away from it, saying, “We are accountable for our deeds and you for yours. Peace ˹is our only response˺ to you! We want nothing to do with those who act ignorantly.” Guidance Is from Allah Alone
verses.translation: When they hear slanderous talk, they turn away from it, saying, “We are accountable for our deeds and you for yours. Peace ˹is our only response˺ to you! We want nothing to do with those who act ignorantly.” Guidance Is from Allah Alone

verses.text: You surely cannot guide whoever you like ˹O Prophet˺, but it is Allah Who guides whoever He wills, and He knows best who are ˹fit to be˺ guided. Pagan Excuses
verses.translation: You surely cannot guide whoever you like ˹O Prophet˺, but it is Allah Who guides whoever He wills, and He knows best who are ˹fit to be˺ guided. Pagan Excuses

verses.text: They say ˹to the Prophet˺, “If we were to follow ˹true˺ guidance with you, we would certainly be snatched away from our land.” Have We not established for them a safe haven ˹in Mecca˺ to which fruits of all kinds are brought as a provision from Us? But most of them do not know ˹this favour˺.
verses.translation: They say ˹to the Prophet˺, “If we were to follow ˹true˺ guidance with you, we would certainly be snatched away from our land.” Have We not established for them a safe haven ˹in Mecca˺ to which fruits of all kinds are brought as a provision from Us? But most of them do not know ˹this favour˺.

verses.text: ˹Imagine˺ how many societies We have destroyed that had been spoiled by their ˹comfortable˺ living! Those are their residences, never inhabited after them except passingly.[804] And We ˹alone˺ were the Successor.
verses.translation: ˹Imagine˺ how many societies We have destroyed that had been spoiled by their ˹comfortable˺ living! Those are their residences, never inhabited after them except passingly.[804] And We ˹alone˺ were the Successor.

verses.text: Your Lord would never destroy a society until He had sent to its capital a messenger, reciting Our revelations to them. Nor would We ever destroy a society unless its people persisted in wrongdoing. This World or the Hereafter?
verses.translation: Your Lord would never destroy a society until He had sent to its capital a messenger, reciting Our revelations to them. Nor would We ever destroy a society unless its people persisted in wrongdoing. This World or the Hereafter?

verses.text: Whatever ˹pleasure˺ you have been given is no more than ˹a fleeting˺ enjoyment and adornment of this worldly life. But what is with Allah is far better and more lasting. Will you not then understand?
verses.translation: Whatever ˹pleasure˺ you have been given is no more than ˹a fleeting˺ enjoyment and adornment of this worldly life. But what is with Allah is far better and more lasting. Will you not then understand?

verses.text: Can those to whom We have made a fine promise—which they will see fulfilled—be like those who We have allowed to enjoy the pleasures of this worldly life, but on the Day of Judgment will be brought ˹for punishment˺? The Misleaders and the Misled
verses.translation: Can those to whom We have made a fine promise—which they will see fulfilled—be like those who We have allowed to enjoy the pleasures of this worldly life, but on the Day of Judgment will be brought ˹for punishment˺? The Misleaders and the Misled

verses.text: ˹Watch for˺ the Day He will call to them, “Where are those you claimed were My associate-gods?”
verses.translation: ˹Watch for˺ the Day He will call to them, “Where are those you claimed were My associate-gods?”

verses.text: Those ˹misleaders˺ against whom the decree ˹of torment˺ is justified will cry, “Our Lord! These ˹followers˺ are the ones we caused to deviate. We led them into deviance, for we ourselves were deviant. We disassociate ourselves ˹from them˺ before You. It was not us that they used to worship.”
verses.translation: Those ˹misleaders˺ against whom the decree ˹of torment˺ is justified will cry, “Our Lord! These ˹followers˺ are the ones we caused to deviate. We led them into deviance, for we ourselves were deviant. We disassociate ourselves ˹from them˺ before You. It was not us that they used to worship.”

verses.text: It will be said ˹to the disbelievers˺, “Call upon your associate-gods ˹for help˺.” So they will call them, but will receive no response. And they will face the punishment, wishing they had been ˹rightly˺ guided! A Question to the Disbelievers
verses.translation: It will be said ˹to the disbelievers˺, “Call upon your associate-gods ˹for help˺.” So they will call them, but will receive no response. And they will face the punishment, wishing they had been ˹rightly˺ guided! A Question to the Disbelievers

verses.text: And ˹watch for˺ the Day He will call to them, asking, “What response did you give to the messengers?”
verses.translation: And ˹watch for˺ the Day He will call to them, asking, “What response did you give to the messengers?”

verses.text: They will be too dumbstruck on that Day to ask one another ˹for answers˺. The True Believers
verses.translation: They will be too dumbstruck on that Day to ask one another ˹for answers˺. The True Believers

verses.text: As for those who repent, believe, and do good ˹in this world˺, it is right to hope that they will be among the successful. Allah Almighty
verses.translation: As for those who repent, believe, and do good ˹in this world˺, it is right to hope that they will be among the successful. Allah Almighty

verses.text: Your Lord creates and chooses whatever He wills—the choice is not theirs. Glorified and Exalted is Allah above what they associate ˹with Him˺!
verses.translation: Your Lord creates and chooses whatever He wills—the choice is not theirs. Glorified and Exalted is Allah above what they associate ˹with Him˺!

verses.text: And your Lord knows what their hearts conceal and what they reveal.
verses.translation: And your Lord knows what their hearts conceal and what they reveal.

verses.text: He is Allah. There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. All praise belongs to Him in this life and the next. All authority is His. And to Him you will ˹all˺ be returned. Allah’s Might and Grace
verses.translation: He is Allah. There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. All praise belongs to Him in this life and the next. All authority is His. And to Him you will ˹all˺ be returned. Allah’s Might and Grace

verses.text: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Imagine if Allah were to make the night perpetual for you until the Day of Judgment, which god other than Allah could bring you sunlight? Will you not then listen?”
verses.translation: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Imagine if Allah were to make the night perpetual for you until the Day of Judgment, which god other than Allah could bring you sunlight? Will you not then listen?”

verses.text: Ask ˹them also˺, “Imagine if Allah were to make the day perpetual for you until the Day of Judgment, which god other than Allah could bring you night to rest in? Will you not then see?”
verses.translation: Ask ˹them also˺, “Imagine if Allah were to make the day perpetual for you until the Day of Judgment, which god other than Allah could bring you night to rest in? Will you not then see?”

verses.text: It is out of His mercy that He has made for you the day and night so that you may rest ˹in the latter˺ and seek His bounty ˹in the former˺, and perhaps you will be grateful. Polytheists Rebuked Again
verses.translation: It is out of His mercy that He has made for you the day and night so that you may rest ˹in the latter˺ and seek His bounty ˹in the former˺, and perhaps you will be grateful. Polytheists Rebuked Again

verses.text: And ˹watch for˺ the Day He will call to them, “Where are those you claimed were My associate-gods?”
verses.translation: And ˹watch for˺ the Day He will call to them, “Where are those you claimed were My associate-gods?”

verses.text: And We will bring forth a witness[805] from every faith-community and ask ˹the polytheists˺, “Show ˹Us˺ your proof.” Then they will ˹come to˺ know that the truth is with Allah ˹alone˺. And whatever ˹gods˺ they fabricated will fail them. Korah’s Arrogance
verses.translation: And We will bring forth a witness[805] from every faith-community and ask ˹the polytheists˺, “Show ˹Us˺ your proof.” Then they will ˹come to˺ know that the truth is with Allah ˹alone˺. And whatever ˹gods˺ they fabricated will fail them. Korah’s Arrogance

verses.text: Indeed, Korah[806] was from the people of Moses, but he behaved arrogantly towards them. We had granted him such treasures that even their keys would burden a group of strong men. ˹Some of˺ his people advised him, “Do not be prideful! Surely Allah does not like the prideful.
verses.translation: Indeed, Korah[806] was from the people of Moses, but he behaved arrogantly towards them. We had granted him such treasures that even their keys would burden a group of strong men. ˹Some of˺ his people advised him, “Do not be prideful! Surely Allah does not like the prideful.

verses.text: Rather, seek the ˹reward˺ of the Hereafter by means of what Allah has granted you, without forgetting your share of this world. And be good ˹to others˺ as Allah has been good to you. Do not seek to spread corruption in the land, for Allah certainly does not like the corruptors.” Korah’s Response
verses.translation: Rather, seek the ˹reward˺ of the Hereafter by means of what Allah has granted you, without forgetting your share of this world. And be good ˹to others˺ as Allah has been good to you. Do not seek to spread corruption in the land, for Allah certainly does not like the corruptors.” Korah’s Response

verses.text: He replied, “I have been granted all this because of some knowledge I have.”[807] Did he not know that Allah had already destroyed some from the generations before him who were far superior to him in power and greater in accumulating ˹wealth˺? There will be no need for the wicked to be asked about their sins.[808] Debate on Korah
verses.translation: He replied, “I have been granted all this because of some knowledge I have.”[807] Did he not know that Allah had already destroyed some from the generations before him who were far superior to him in power and greater in accumulating ˹wealth˺? There will be no need for the wicked to be asked about their sins.[808] Debate on Korah

verses.text: Then he came out before his people in all his glamour. Those who desired the life of this world wished, “If only we could have something like what Korah has been given. He is truly a man of great fortune!”
verses.translation: Then he came out before his people in all his glamour. Those who desired the life of this world wished, “If only we could have something like what Korah has been given. He is truly a man of great fortune!”

verses.text: But those gifted with knowledge said, “Shame on you! Allah’s reward is far better for those who believe and do good. But none will attain this except the steadfast.” Korah’s End
verses.translation: But those gifted with knowledge said, “Shame on you! Allah’s reward is far better for those who believe and do good. But none will attain this except the steadfast.” Korah’s End

verses.text: Then We caused the earth to swallow him up, along with his home. There was no one to help him against Allah, nor could he even help himself.
verses.translation: Then We caused the earth to swallow him up, along with his home. There was no one to help him against Allah, nor could he even help himself.

verses.text: And those who had craved his position the previous day began to say, “Ah! It is certainly Allah Who gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills of His servants. Had it not been for the grace of Allah, He could have surely caused the earth to swallow us up! Oh, indeed! The disbelievers will never succeed.” Pay Day
verses.translation: And those who had craved his position the previous day began to say, “Ah! It is certainly Allah Who gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills of His servants. Had it not been for the grace of Allah, He could have surely caused the earth to swallow us up! Oh, indeed! The disbelievers will never succeed.” Pay Day

verses.text: That ˹eternal˺ Home in the Hereafter We reserve ˹only˺ for those who seek neither tyranny nor corruption on the earth. The ultimate outcome belongs ˹only˺ to the righteous.
verses.translation: That ˹eternal˺ Home in the Hereafter We reserve ˹only˺ for those who seek neither tyranny nor corruption on the earth. The ultimate outcome belongs ˹only˺ to the righteous.

verses.text: Whoever comes with a good deed will be rewarded with what is better. And whoever comes with an evil deed, then the evildoers will only be rewarded for what they used to do. Advice to the Prophet
verses.translation: Whoever comes with a good deed will be rewarded with what is better. And whoever comes with an evil deed, then the evildoers will only be rewarded for what they used to do. Advice to the Prophet

verses.text: Most certainly, the One Who has ordained the Quran for you will ˹ultimately˺ bring you back home ˹to Mecca˺.[809] Say, “My Lord knows best who has come with ˹true˺ guidance and who is clearly astray.”
verses.translation: Most certainly, the One Who has ordained the Quran for you will ˹ultimately˺ bring you back home ˹to Mecca˺.[809] Say, “My Lord knows best who has come with ˹true˺ guidance and who is clearly astray.”

verses.text: You never expected this Book to be revealed to you, but ˹it came˺ only ˹as˺ a mercy from your Lord. So never side with the disbelievers ˹in their disbelief˺.
verses.translation: You never expected this Book to be revealed to you, but ˹it came˺ only ˹as˺ a mercy from your Lord. So never side with the disbelievers ˹in their disbelief˺.

verses.text: Do not let them turn you away from the revelations of Allah after they have been sent down to you. Rather, invite ˹all˺ to ˹the Way of˺ your Lord, and never be one of the polytheists.
verses.translation: Do not let them turn you away from the revelations of Allah after they have been sent down to you. Rather, invite ˹all˺ to ˹the Way of˺ your Lord, and never be one of the polytheists.

verses.text: And do not invoke any other god with Allah. There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. Everything is bound to perish except He Himself.[810] All authority belongs to Him. And to Him you will ˹all˺ be returned. *** -- 344 of 694 --
verses.translation: And do not invoke any other god with Allah. There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. Everything is bound to perish except He Himself.[810] All authority belongs to Him. And to Him you will ˹all˺ be returned. *** -- 344 of 694 --

name: The Spider
intro: This Meccan sûrah takes its name from the parable of the spider in verse 41. The beginning of the sûrah emphasizes the role of trials and tribulations in revealing those who are truly steadfast and those who are not. Noah, Abraham, Lot, and Shu’aib are noted for their perseverance. References are made to various peoples and the different ways they were destroyed for their denial of the truth (verse 40). The pagan arguments against the Prophet and the Quran are thoroughly refuted. The sûrah concludes by commending those who put their trust in Allah and strive in His cause. This conclusion paves the way for the opening of the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful The Test

verses.text: Alif-Lãm-Mĩm.
verses.translation: Alif-Lãm-Mĩm.

verses.text: Do people think once they say, “We believe,” that they will be left without being put to the test?
verses.translation: Do people think once they say, “We believe,” that they will be left without being put to the test?

verses.text: We certainly tested those before them. And ˹in this way˺ Allah will clearly distinguish between those who are truthful and those who are liars.
verses.translation: We certainly tested those before them. And ˹in this way˺ Allah will clearly distinguish between those who are truthful and those who are liars.

verses.text: Or do the evildoers ˹simply˺ think that they will escape Us? How wrong is their judgment! The True Believers
verses.translation: Or do the evildoers ˹simply˺ think that they will escape Us? How wrong is their judgment! The True Believers

verses.text: Whoever hopes for the meeting with Allah, ˹let them know that˺ Allah’s appointed time is sure to come. He is the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
verses.translation: Whoever hopes for the meeting with Allah, ˹let them know that˺ Allah’s appointed time is sure to come. He is the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

verses.text: And whoever strives ˹in Allah’s cause˺, only does so for their own good. Surely Allah is not in need of ˹any of˺ His creation.
verses.translation: And whoever strives ˹in Allah’s cause˺, only does so for their own good. Surely Allah is not in need of ˹any of˺ His creation.

verses.text: As for those who believe and do good, We will certainly absolve them of their sins, and reward them according to the best of what they used to do.
verses.translation: As for those who believe and do good, We will certainly absolve them of their sins, and reward them according to the best of what they used to do.

verses.text: We have commanded people to honour their parents. But if they urge you to associate with Me what you have no knowledge of,[811] then do not obey them. To Me you will ˹all˺ return, and then I will inform you of what you used to do.
verses.translation: We have commanded people to honour their parents. But if they urge you to associate with Me what you have no knowledge of,[811] then do not obey them. To Me you will ˹all˺ return, and then I will inform you of what you used to do.

verses.text: Those who believe and do good will surely be admitted by Us into ˹the company of˺ the righteous. The Hypocrites
verses.translation: Those who believe and do good will surely be admitted by Us into ˹the company of˺ the righteous. The Hypocrites

verses.text: There are some who say, “We believe in Allah,” but when they suffer in the cause of Allah, they mistake ˹this˺ persecution at the hands of people for the punishment of Allah. But when victory comes from your Lord, they surely say ˹to the believers˺, “We have always been with you.” Does Allah not know best what is in the hearts of all beings?
verses.translation: There are some who say, “We believe in Allah,” but when they suffer in the cause of Allah, they mistake ˹this˺ persecution at the hands of people for the punishment of Allah. But when victory comes from your Lord, they surely say ˹to the believers˺, “We have always been with you.” Does Allah not know best what is in the hearts of all beings?

verses.text: Allah will certainly distinguish between those who have ˹sure˺ faith and the hypocrites. False Promise
verses.translation: Allah will certainly distinguish between those who have ˹sure˺ faith and the hypocrites. False Promise

verses.text: The disbelievers say to the believers, “˹Just˺ follow our way, and we will bear ˹the burden of˺ your sins.” But they would never ˹want to˺ bear any of the believers’ sins. They are simply lying.
verses.translation: The disbelievers say to the believers, “˹Just˺ follow our way, and we will bear ˹the burden of˺ your sins.” But they would never ˹want to˺ bear any of the believers’ sins. They are simply lying.

verses.text: Yet they will certainly ˹be made to˺ carry their own burdens, as well as other burdens along with their own.[812] And they will surely be questioned on Judgment Day about what they used to fabricate. Noah's People Destroyed
verses.translation: Yet they will certainly ˹be made to˺ carry their own burdens, as well as other burdens along with their own.[812] And they will surely be questioned on Judgment Day about what they used to fabricate. Noah's People Destroyed

verses.text: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, and he remained among them for a thousand years, less fifty. Then the Flood overtook them, while they persisted in wrongdoing.
verses.translation: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, and he remained among them for a thousand years, less fifty. Then the Flood overtook them, while they persisted in wrongdoing.

verses.text: But We delivered him and those in the Ark, making it a sign for all people. The People of Abraham
verses.translation: But We delivered him and those in the Ark, making it a sign for all people. The People of Abraham

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when Abraham said to his people, “Worship Allah, and fear Him. This is better for you, if only you knew.
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when Abraham said to his people, “Worship Allah, and fear Him. This is better for you, if only you knew.

verses.text: You worship besides Allah nothing but idols, simply creating lies ˹about them˺. Those you worship besides Allah certainly cannot give you any provision. So seek provision from Allah ˹alone˺, worship Him, and be grateful to Him. To Him you will ˹all˺ be returned.” Warning to Meccan Pagans
verses.translation: You worship besides Allah nothing but idols, simply creating lies ˹about them˺. Those you worship besides Allah certainly cannot give you any provision. So seek provision from Allah ˹alone˺, worship Him, and be grateful to Him. To Him you will ˹all˺ be returned.” Warning to Meccan Pagans

verses.text: If you persist in denial, so did ˹many˺ communities before you. The Messenger’s duty is only to deliver ˹the message˺ clearly.
verses.translation: If you persist in denial, so did ˹many˺ communities before you. The Messenger’s duty is only to deliver ˹the message˺ clearly.

verses.text: Have they not seen how Allah originates the creation then resurrects it? That is certainly easy for Allah.
verses.translation: Have they not seen how Allah originates the creation then resurrects it? That is certainly easy for Allah.

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Travel throughout the land and see how He originated the creation, then Allah will bring it into being one more time. Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything.
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Travel throughout the land and see how He originated the creation, then Allah will bring it into being one more time. Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything.

verses.text: He punishes whoever He wills, and shows mercy to whoever He wills. And you will ˹all˺ be returned to Him.
verses.translation: He punishes whoever He wills, and shows mercy to whoever He wills. And you will ˹all˺ be returned to Him.

verses.text: And you cannot escape Him on earth or in heaven. Nor have you any protector or helper besides Allah.”
verses.translation: And you cannot escape Him on earth or in heaven. Nor have you any protector or helper besides Allah.”

verses.text: As for those who disbelieve in Allah’s signs and the meeting with Him, it is they who will have no hope in His mercy.[813] And it is they who will suffer a painful punishment. Abraham Prevails
verses.translation: As for those who disbelieve in Allah’s signs and the meeting with Him, it is they who will have no hope in His mercy.[813] And it is they who will suffer a painful punishment. Abraham Prevails

verses.text: But the only response of Abraham’s people was to say: “Kill him or burn him!” But Allah saved him from the fire.[814] Surely in this are signs for people who believe.
verses.translation: But the only response of Abraham’s people was to say: “Kill him or burn him!” But Allah saved him from the fire.[814] Surely in this are signs for people who believe.

verses.text: He said ˹to his people˺, “You have taken idols ˹for worship˺ instead of Allah, only to keep ˹the bond of˺ harmony among yourselves in this worldly life. But on the Day of Judgment you will disown and curse one another. Your home will be the Fire, and you will have no helper!”
verses.translation: He said ˹to his people˺, “You have taken idols ˹for worship˺ instead of Allah, only to keep ˹the bond of˺ harmony among yourselves in this worldly life. But on the Day of Judgment you will disown and curse one another. Your home will be the Fire, and you will have no helper!”

verses.text: So Lot believed in him. And Abraham said, “I am emigrating ˹in obedience˺ to my Lord. He ˹alone˺ is indeed the Almighty, All-Wise.”
verses.translation: So Lot believed in him. And Abraham said, “I am emigrating ˹in obedience˺ to my Lord. He ˹alone˺ is indeed the Almighty, All-Wise.”

verses.text: We blessed him with Isaac and ˹later˺ Jacob, and reserved prophethood and revelation for his descendants. We gave him his reward in this life,[815] and in the Hereafter he will certainly be among the righteous. The People of Lot
verses.translation: We blessed him with Isaac and ˹later˺ Jacob, and reserved prophethood and revelation for his descendants. We gave him his reward in this life,[815] and in the Hereafter he will certainly be among the righteous. The People of Lot

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when Lot rebuked ˹the men of˺ his people: “You certainly commit a shameful deed that no man has ever done before you.
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when Lot rebuked ˹the men of˺ his people: “You certainly commit a shameful deed that no man has ever done before you.

verses.text: Do you really lust after ˹other˺ men, abuse the travellers, and practice immorality ˹openly˺ in your gatherings?” His people’s only response was to say ˹mockingly˺: “Bring Allah’s punishment upon us, if what you say is true.”
verses.translation: Do you really lust after ˹other˺ men, abuse the travellers, and practice immorality ˹openly˺ in your gatherings?” His people’s only response was to say ˹mockingly˺: “Bring Allah’s punishment upon us, if what you say is true.”

verses.text: Lot prayed, “My Lord! Help me against the people of corruption.” Abraham Visited by Angels
verses.translation: Lot prayed, “My Lord! Help me against the people of corruption.” Abraham Visited by Angels

verses.text: When Our messenger-angels came to Abraham with the good news ˹of the birth of Isaac˺, they said, “We are going to destroy the people of this city ˹of Sodom˺, for its people have persisted in wrongdoing.”
verses.translation: When Our messenger-angels came to Abraham with the good news ˹of the birth of Isaac˺, they said, “We are going to destroy the people of this city ˹of Sodom˺, for its people have persisted in wrongdoing.”

verses.text: He said, “But Lot is there!” They responded, “We know best who is there. We will certainly save him and his family—except his wife, who is one of the doomed.” The People of Lot Destroyed
verses.translation: He said, “But Lot is there!” They responded, “We know best who is there. We will certainly save him and his family—except his wife, who is one of the doomed.” The People of Lot Destroyed

verses.text: And when Our messenger-angels came to Lot, he was distressed and worried by their arrival.[816] They reassured ˹him˺, “Do not fear, nor grieve. We will surely deliver you and your family—except your wife, who is one of the doomed.
verses.translation: And when Our messenger-angels came to Lot, he was distressed and worried by their arrival.[816] They reassured ˹him˺, “Do not fear, nor grieve. We will surely deliver you and your family—except your wife, who is one of the doomed.

verses.text: We are certainly bringing down a punishment from heaven upon the people of this city for their rebelliousness.”
verses.translation: We are certainly bringing down a punishment from heaven upon the people of this city for their rebelliousness.”

verses.text: And We did leave ˹some of˺ its ruins as a clear lesson for people of understanding. Shu'aib's People Destroyed
verses.translation: And We did leave ˹some of˺ its ruins as a clear lesson for people of understanding. Shu'aib's People Destroyed

verses.text: And to the people of Midian ˹We sent˺ their brother Shu’aib. He said, “O my people! Worship Allah, and hope for ˹the reward of˺ the Last Day. And do not go about spreading corruption in the land.”
verses.translation: And to the people of Midian ˹We sent˺ their brother Shu’aib. He said, “O my people! Worship Allah, and hope for ˹the reward of˺ the Last Day. And do not go about spreading corruption in the land.”

verses.text: But they rejected him, so an ˹overwhelming˺ earthquake struck them and they fell lifeless in their homes. Previously Destroyed Nations
verses.translation: But they rejected him, so an ˹overwhelming˺ earthquake struck them and they fell lifeless in their homes. Previously Destroyed Nations

verses.text: And the people of ’Ȃd and Thamûd ˹met a similar fate˺, which must be clear to you ˹Meccans˺ from their ruins.[817] Satan made their ˹evil˺ deeds appealing to them, hindering them from the ˹Right˺ Way, although they were capable of reasoning.
verses.translation: And the people of ’Ȃd and Thamûd ˹met a similar fate˺, which must be clear to you ˹Meccans˺ from their ruins.[817] Satan made their ˹evil˺ deeds appealing to them, hindering them from the ˹Right˺ Way, although they were capable of reasoning.

verses.text: ˹We˺ also ˹destroyed˺ Korah, Pharaoh, and Hamân. Indeed, Moses had come to them with clear proofs, but they behaved arrogantly in the land. Yet they could not escape ˹Us˺.
verses.translation: ˹We˺ also ˹destroyed˺ Korah, Pharaoh, and Hamân. Indeed, Moses had come to them with clear proofs, but they behaved arrogantly in the land. Yet they could not escape ˹Us˺.

verses.text: So We seized each ˹people˺ for their sin: against some of them We sent a storm of stones, some were overtaken by a ˹mighty˺ blast, some We caused the earth to swallow, and some We drowned. Allah would not have wronged them, but it was they who wronged themselves. Allah Is the Mighty Protector
verses.translation: So We seized each ˹people˺ for their sin: against some of them We sent a storm of stones, some were overtaken by a ˹mighty˺ blast, some We caused the earth to swallow, and some We drowned. Allah would not have wronged them, but it was they who wronged themselves. Allah Is the Mighty Protector

verses.text: The parable of those who take protectors other than Allah is that of a spider spinning a shelter. And the flimsiest of all shelters is certainly that of a spider, if only they knew.[818]
verses.translation: The parable of those who take protectors other than Allah is that of a spider spinning a shelter. And the flimsiest of all shelters is certainly that of a spider, if only they knew.[818]

verses.text: Allah surely knows that whatever ˹gods˺ they invoke besides Him are ˹simply˺ nothing. For He is the Almighty, All- Wise.
verses.translation: Allah surely knows that whatever ˹gods˺ they invoke besides Him are ˹simply˺ nothing. For He is the Almighty, All- Wise.

verses.text: These are the parables We set forth for humanity, but none will understand them except the people of knowledge.
verses.translation: These are the parables We set forth for humanity, but none will understand them except the people of knowledge.

verses.text: Allah created the heavens and the earth for a purpose. Surely in this is a sign for the people of faith. Advice to the Prophet
verses.translation: Allah created the heavens and the earth for a purpose. Surely in this is a sign for the people of faith. Advice to the Prophet

verses.text: Recite what has been revealed to you of the Book and establish prayer. Indeed, ˹genuine˺ prayer should deter ˹one˺ from indecency and wickedness. The remembrance of Allah is ˹an˺ even greater ˹deterrent˺. And Allah ˹fully˺ knows what you ˹all˺ do. Arguing with the People of the Book
verses.translation: Recite what has been revealed to you of the Book and establish prayer. Indeed, ˹genuine˺ prayer should deter ˹one˺ from indecency and wickedness. The remembrance of Allah is ˹an˺ even greater ˹deterrent˺. And Allah ˹fully˺ knows what you ˹all˺ do. Arguing with the People of the Book

verses.text: Do not argue with the People of the Book unless gracefully, except with those of them who act wrongfully. And say, “We believe in what has been revealed to us and what was revealed to you. Our God and your God is ˹only˺ One. And to Him we ˹fully˺ submit.” One Last Revelation
verses.translation: Do not argue with the People of the Book unless gracefully, except with those of them who act wrongfully. And say, “We believe in what has been revealed to us and what was revealed to you. Our God and your God is ˹only˺ One. And to Him we ˹fully˺ submit.” One Last Revelation

verses.text: Similarly ˹to earlier messengers˺, We have revealed to you a Book ˹O Prophet˺. ˹The faithful of˺ those to whom We gave the Scriptures believe in it, as do some of these ˹pagan Arabs˺. And none denies Our revelations except the ˹stubborn˺ disbelievers.
verses.translation: Similarly ˹to earlier messengers˺, We have revealed to you a Book ˹O Prophet˺. ˹The faithful of˺ those to whom We gave the Scriptures believe in it, as do some of these ˹pagan Arabs˺. And none denies Our revelations except the ˹stubborn˺ disbelievers.

verses.text: You ˹O Prophet˺ could not read any writing ˹even˺ before this ˹revelation˺, nor could you write at all. Otherwise, the people of falsehood would have been suspicious.
verses.translation: You ˹O Prophet˺ could not read any writing ˹even˺ before this ˹revelation˺, nor could you write at all. Otherwise, the people of falsehood would have been suspicious.

verses.text: But this ˹Quran˺ is ˹a set of˺ clear revelations ˹preserved˺ in the hearts of those gifted with knowledge. And none denies Our revelations except the ˹stubborn˺ wrongdoers. The Pagans Demand Signs[819]
verses.translation: But this ˹Quran˺ is ˹a set of˺ clear revelations ˹preserved˺ in the hearts of those gifted with knowledge. And none denies Our revelations except the ˹stubborn˺ wrongdoers. The Pagans Demand Signs[819]

verses.text: They say, “If only ˹some˺ signs had been sent down to him from his Lord!” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Signs are only with Allah. And I am only sent with a clear warning.”
verses.translation: They say, “If only ˹some˺ signs had been sent down to him from his Lord!” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Signs are only with Allah. And I am only sent with a clear warning.”

verses.text: Is it not enough for them that We have sent down to you the Book, ˹which is˺ recited to them. Surely in this ˹Quran˺ is a mercy and reminder for people who believe.
verses.translation: Is it not enough for them that We have sent down to you the Book, ˹which is˺ recited to them. Surely in this ˹Quran˺ is a mercy and reminder for people who believe.

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Sufficient is Allah as a Witness between me and you. He ˹fully˺ knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth. And those who believe in falsehood and disbelieve in Allah, it is they who are the ˹true˺ losers.” Hastening the Punishment
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Sufficient is Allah as a Witness between me and you. He ˹fully˺ knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth. And those who believe in falsehood and disbelieve in Allah, it is they who are the ˹true˺ losers.” Hastening the Punishment

verses.text: They challenge you ˹O Prophet˺ to hasten the punishment. Had it not been for a time already set, the punishment would have certainly come to them ˹at once˺. But it will definitely take them by surprise when they least expect it.
verses.translation: They challenge you ˹O Prophet˺ to hasten the punishment. Had it not been for a time already set, the punishment would have certainly come to them ˹at once˺. But it will definitely take them by surprise when they least expect it.

verses.text: They urge you to hasten the punishment. And Hell will certainly encompass the disbelievers

name: The Romans
intro: This Meccan sûrah takes its name from the reference to the Romans in verse 2. The world’s superpowers in the early 7th century were the Roman Byzantine and Persian Empires. When they went to war in 614 C.E., the Romans suffered a devastating defeat. The Meccan pagans rejoiced at the defeat of the Roman Christians at the hands of the Persian pagans. Soon verses 30:1-5 were revealed, stating that the Romans would be victorious in three to nine years. Eight years later, the Romans won a decisive battle against the Persians, reportedly on the same day the Muslims vanquished the Meccan army at the Battle of Badr. As the sûrah progresses, several blessings and natural signs are cited to prove Allah’s infinite mercy and power, coupled with condemnations to the pagans for their ingratitude and for associating powerless idols with Allah in worship. The sûrah closes by bidding the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) not to be disheartened by what the deniers say. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful From Defeat to Victory

name: Luqmân
intro: This Meccan sûrah is named after Luqmân, a wise African man who is quoted giving pieces of advice to his son (verses 12–19) on one’s relationship with Allah and the people. While the believers are praised, the pagans are condemned for their ingratitude, distracting others from the Way of Allah, and for setting up idols as His equals. Similar to the previous sûrah, references are made to Allah’s natural marvels, challenging the deniers to point out anything their gods have created. The sûrah concludes by warning humanity of the Day of Judgment, ushering in the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Qualities of True Believers

verses.text: But there are some who employ theatrics,[832] only to lead others away from Allah’s Way—without any knowledge—and to make a mockery of it. They will suffer a humiliating punishment.
verses.translation: But there are some who employ theatrics,[832] only to lead others away from Allah’s Way—without any knowledge—and to make a mockery of it. They will suffer a humiliating punishment.

verses.text: Whenever Our revelations are recited to them, they turn away in arrogance as if they did not hear them, as if there is deafness in their ears. So give them good news ˹O Prophet˺ of a painful punishment. Reward of the Believers
verses.translation: Whenever Our revelations are recited to them, they turn away in arrogance as if they did not hear them, as if there is deafness in their ears. So give them good news ˹O Prophet˺ of a painful punishment. Reward of the Believers

verses.text: Surely those who believe and do good will have the Gardens of Bliss,
verses.translation: Surely those who believe and do good will have the Gardens of Bliss,

verses.text: staying there forever. Allah’s promise is true. And He is the Almighty, All- Wise. Allah’s Creation
verses.translation: staying there forever. Allah’s promise is true. And He is the Almighty, All- Wise. Allah’s Creation

verses.text: He created the heavens without pillars—as you can see—and placed firm mountains upon the earth so it does not shake with you, and scattered throughout it all types of creatures. And We send down rain from the sky, causing every type of fine plant to grow on earth.
verses.translation: He created the heavens without pillars—as you can see—and placed firm mountains upon the earth so it does not shake with you, and scattered throughout it all types of creatures. And We send down rain from the sky, causing every type of fine plant to grow on earth.

verses.text: This is Allah’s creation. Now show Me what those ˹gods˺ other than Him have created. In fact, the wrongdoers are clearly astray. Luqmân’s Advice: 1) Worship Allah Alone
verses.translation: This is Allah’s creation. Now show Me what those ˹gods˺ other than Him have created. In fact, the wrongdoers are clearly astray. Luqmân’s Advice: 1) Worship Allah Alone

verses.text: Indeed, We blessed Luqmân with wisdom, ˹saying˺, “Be grateful to Allah, for whoever is grateful, it is only for their own good. And whoever is ungrateful, then surely Allah is Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy.”[ 8 3 3 ]
verses.translation: Indeed, We blessed Luqmân with wisdom, ˹saying˺, “Be grateful to Allah, for whoever is grateful, it is only for their own good. And whoever is ungrateful, then surely Allah is Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy.”[ 8 3 3 ]

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when Luqmân said to his son, while advising him, “O my dear son! Never associate ˹anything˺ with Allah ˹in worship˺, for associating ˹others with Him˺ is truly the worst of all wrongs.” 2) Honour Your Parents[ 8 3 4 ]
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when Luqmân said to his son, while advising him, “O my dear son! Never associate ˹anything˺ with Allah ˹in worship˺, for associating ˹others with Him˺ is truly the worst of all wrongs.” 2) Honour Your Parents[ 8 3 4 ]

verses.text: And We have commanded people to ˹honour˺ their parents. Their mothers bore them through hardship upon hardship, and their weaning takes two years. So be grateful to Me and your parents. To Me is the final return.
verses.translation: And We have commanded people to ˹honour˺ their parents. Their mothers bore them through hardship upon hardship, and their weaning takes two years. So be grateful to Me and your parents. To Me is the final return.

verses.text: But if they pressure you to associate with Me what you have no knowledge of,[835] do not obey them. Still keep their company in this world courteously, and follow the way of those who turn to Me ˹in devotion˺. Then to Me you will ˹all˺ return, and then I will inform you of what you used to do. 3) Know That Allah Will Judge All Deeds
verses.translation: But if they pressure you to associate with Me what you have no knowledge of,[835] do not obey them. Still keep their company in this world courteously, and follow the way of those who turn to Me ˹in devotion˺. Then to Me you will ˹all˺ return, and then I will inform you of what you used to do. 3) Know That Allah Will Judge All Deeds

verses.text: ˹Luqmân added,˺ “O my dear son! ˹Even˺ if a deed were the weight of a mustard seed—be it ˹hidden˺ in a rock or in the heavens or the earth—Allah will bring it forth. Surely Allah is Most Subtle, All-Aware. 4) Fulfil Your Duty to Allah
verses.translation: ˹Luqmân added,˺ “O my dear son! ˹Even˺ if a deed were the weight of a mustard seed—be it ˹hidden˺ in a rock or in the heavens or the earth—Allah will bring it forth. Surely Allah is Most Subtle, All-Aware. 4) Fulfil Your Duty to Allah

verses.text: “O my dear son! Establish prayer, encourage what is good and forbid what is evil, and endure patiently whatever befalls you. Surely this is a resolve to aspire to. 5) Be Humble
verses.translation: “O my dear son! Establish prayer, encourage what is good and forbid what is evil, and endure patiently whatever befalls you. Surely this is a resolve to aspire to. 5) Be Humble

verses.text: “And do not turn your nose up to people, nor walk pridefully upon the earth. Surely Allah does not like whoever is arrogant, boastful.
verses.translation: “And do not turn your nose up to people, nor walk pridefully upon the earth. Surely Allah does not like whoever is arrogant, boastful.

verses.text: Be moderate in your pace. And lower your voice, for the ugliest of all voices is certainly the braying of donkeys.” Allah’s Favours
verses.translation: Be moderate in your pace. And lower your voice, for the ugliest of all voices is certainly the braying of donkeys.” Allah’s Favours

verses.text: Have you not seen that Allah has subjected for you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and has lavished His favours upon you, both seen and unseen? ˹Still˺ there are some who dispute about Allah without knowledge, or guidance, or an enlightening scripture.
verses.translation: Have you not seen that Allah has subjected for you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and has lavished His favours upon you, both seen and unseen? ˹Still˺ there are some who dispute about Allah without knowledge, or guidance, or an enlightening scripture.

verses.text: When it is said to them, “Follow what Allah has revealed,” they reply, “No! We ˹only˺ follow what we found our forefathers practicing.” ˹Would they still do so˺ even if Satan is inviting them to the torment of the Blaze? The Believers and the Disbelievers
verses.translation: When it is said to them, “Follow what Allah has revealed,” they reply, “No! We ˹only˺ follow what we found our forefathers practicing.” ˹Would they still do so˺ even if Satan is inviting them to the torment of the Blaze? The Believers and the Disbelievers

verses.text: Whoever fully submits themselves to Allah and is a good-doer, they have certainly grasped the firmest hand-hold. And with Allah rests the outcome of ˹all˺ affairs.
verses.translation: Whoever fully submits themselves to Allah and is a good-doer, they have certainly grasped the firmest hand-hold. And with Allah rests the outcome of ˹all˺ affairs.

verses.text: But whoever disbelieves, do not let their disbelief grieve you ˹O Prophet˺. To Us is their return, and We will inform them of all they did. Surely Allah knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart.
verses.translation: But whoever disbelieves, do not let their disbelief grieve you ˹O Prophet˺. To Us is their return, and We will inform them of all they did. Surely Allah knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart.

verses.text: We allow them enjoyment for a little while, then ˹in time˺ We will force them into a harsh torment.
verses.translation: We allow them enjoyment for a little while, then ˹in time˺ We will force them into a harsh torment.

verses.text: And if you ask them who created the heavens and the earth, they will definitely say, “Allah!” Say, “Praise be to Allah!” In fact, most of them do not know. Allah’s Infinite Knowledge
verses.translation: And if you ask them who created the heavens and the earth, they will definitely say, “Allah!” Say, “Praise be to Allah!” In fact, most of them do not know. Allah’s Infinite Knowledge

verses.text: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Allah is truly the Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy.
verses.translation: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Allah is truly the Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy.

verses.text: If all the trees on earth were pens and the ocean ˹were ink˺, refilled by seven other oceans, the Words of Allah would not be exhausted. Surely Allah is Almighty, All-Wise. Allah’s Infinite Power
verses.translation: If all the trees on earth were pens and the ocean ˹were ink˺, refilled by seven other oceans, the Words of Allah would not be exhausted. Surely Allah is Almighty, All-Wise. Allah’s Infinite Power

verses.text: The creation and resurrection of you ˹all˺ is as simple ˹for Him˺ as that of a single soul. Surely Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
verses.translation: The creation and resurrection of you ˹all˺ is as simple ˹for Him˺ as that of a single soul. Surely Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

verses.text: Do you not see that Allah causes the night to merge into the day and the day into the night, and has subjected the sun and the moon, each orbiting for an appointed term, and that Allah is All-Aware of what you do?
verses.translation: Do you not see that Allah causes the night to merge into the day and the day into the night, and has subjected the sun and the moon, each orbiting for an appointed term, and that Allah is All-Aware of what you do?

verses.text: That is because Allah ˹alone˺ is the Truth and what they invoke besides Him is falsehood, and ˹because˺ Allah ˹alone˺ is the Most High, All-Great. Human Ingratitude
verses.translation: That is because Allah ˹alone˺ is the Truth and what they invoke besides Him is falsehood, and ˹because˺ Allah ˹alone˺ is the Most High, All-Great. Human Ingratitude

verses.text: Do you not see that the ships sail ˹smoothly˺ through the sea by the grace of Allah so that He may show you some of His signs? Surely in this are signs for whoever is steadfast, grateful.
verses.translation: Do you not see that the ships sail ˹smoothly˺ through the sea by the grace of Allah so that He may show you some of His signs? Surely in this are signs for whoever is steadfast, grateful.

verses.text: And as soon as they are overwhelmed by waves like mountains, they cry out to Allah ˹alone˺ in sincere devotion. But when He delivers them ˹safely˺ to shore, only some become relatively grateful. And none rejects Our signs except whoever is deceitful, ungrateful. Warning of Judgment Day
verses.translation: And as soon as they are overwhelmed by waves like mountains, they cry out to Allah ˹alone˺ in sincere devotion. But when He delivers them ˹safely˺ to shore, only some become relatively grateful. And none rejects Our signs except whoever is deceitful, ungrateful. Warning of Judgment Day

verses.text: O humanity! Be mindful of your Lord, and beware of a Day when no parent will be of any benefit to their child, nor will a child be of any benefit to their parent. Surely Allah’s promise is true. So do not let the life of this world deceive you, nor let the Chief Deceiver[836] deceive you about Allah. The Five Keys of the Unseen[837]
verses.translation: O humanity! Be mindful of your Lord, and beware of a Day when no parent will be of any benefit to their child, nor will a child be of any benefit to their parent. Surely Allah’s promise is true. So do not let the life of this world deceive you, nor let the Chief Deceiver[836] deceive you about Allah. The Five Keys of the Unseen[837]

verses.text: Indeed, Allah ˹alone˺ has the knowledge of the Hour. He sends down the rain,[838] and knows what is in the wombs.[839] No soul knows what it will earn for tomorrow, and no soul knows in what land it will die. Surely Allah is All-Knowing, All-Aware. *** -- 361 of 694 --
verses.translation: Indeed, Allah ˹alone˺ has the knowledge of the Hour. He sends down the rain,[838] and knows what is in the wombs.[839] No soul knows what it will earn for tomorrow, and no soul knows in what land it will die. Surely Allah is All-Knowing, All-Aware. *** -- 361 of 694 --

name: The Prostration
intro: This Meccan sûrah, which takes its name from the prostrations of the believers in worship mentioned in verse 15, makes it clear that the Quran is a divine revelation and that Almighty Allah is the sole Creator, most capable of resurrection. Similar to the previous sûrah, a reference is made to the qualities of the believers and the disbelievers and the reward awaiting each. Both the end of this sûrah and the beginning of the next urge the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) to turn away from the deniers and not yield to them. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Reassuring the Prophet

verses.text: Alif-Lãm-Mĩm.
verses.translation: Alif-Lãm-Mĩm.

verses.text: The revelation of this Book is—beyond doubt—from the Lord of all worlds.
verses.translation: The revelation of this Book is—beyond doubt—from the Lord of all worlds.

verses.text: Or do they say, “He has fabricated it!”? No! It is the truth from your Lord in order for you to warn a people to whom no warner has come before you, so they may be ˹rightly˺ guided. Allah’s Power of Creation
verses.translation: Or do they say, “He has fabricated it!”? No! It is the truth from your Lord in order for you to warn a people to whom no warner has come before you, so they may be ˹rightly˺ guided. Allah’s Power of Creation

verses.text: It is Allah Who has created the heavens and the earth and everything in between in six Days,[840] then established Himself on the Throne. You have no protector or intercessor besides Him. Will you not then be mindful?
verses.translation: It is Allah Who has created the heavens and the earth and everything in between in six Days,[840] then established Himself on the Throne. You have no protector or intercessor besides Him. Will you not then be mindful?

verses.text: He conducts every affair from the heavens to the earth, then it all ascends to Him on a Day whose length is a thousand years by your counting.
verses.translation: He conducts every affair from the heavens to the earth, then it all ascends to Him on a Day whose length is a thousand years by your counting.

verses.text: That is the Knower of the seen and unseen—the Almighty, Most Merciful,
verses.translation: That is the Knower of the seen and unseen—the Almighty, Most Merciful,

verses.text: Who has perfected everything He created. And He originated the creation of humankind from clay.[841]
verses.translation: Who has perfected everything He created. And He originated the creation of humankind from clay.[841]

verses.text: Then He made his descendants from an extract of a humble fluid,
verses.translation: Then He made his descendants from an extract of a humble fluid,

verses.text: then He fashioned them and had a spirit of His Own ˹creation˺ breathed into them. And He gave you hearing, sight, and intellect. ˹Yet˺ you hardly give any thanks. The Deniers of Resurrection
verses.translation: then He fashioned them and had a spirit of His Own ˹creation˺ breathed into them. And He gave you hearing, sight, and intellect. ˹Yet˺ you hardly give any thanks. The Deniers of Resurrection

verses.text: ˹Still˺ they ask ˹mockingly˺, “When we are disintegrated into the earth, will we really be raised as a new creation?” In fact, they are in denial of the meeting with their Lord.
verses.translation: ˹Still˺ they ask ˹mockingly˺, “When we are disintegrated into the earth, will we really be raised as a new creation?” In fact, they are in denial of the meeting with their Lord.

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Your soul will be taken by the Angel of Death, who is in charge of you. Then to your Lord you will ˹all˺ be returned.”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Your soul will be taken by the Angel of Death, who is in charge of you. Then to your Lord you will ˹all˺ be returned.”

verses.text: If only you could see the wicked hanging their heads ˹in shame˺ before their Lord, ˹crying:˺ “Our Lord! We have now seen and heard, so send us back and we will do good. We truly have sure faith ˹now˺!”
verses.translation: If only you could see the wicked hanging their heads ˹in shame˺ before their Lord, ˹crying:˺ “Our Lord! We have now seen and heard, so send us back and we will do good. We truly have sure faith ˹now˺!”

verses.text: Had We willed, We could have easily imposed guidance on every soul. But My Word will come to pass: I will surely fill up Hell with jinn and humans all together.
verses.translation: Had We willed, We could have easily imposed guidance on every soul. But My Word will come to pass: I will surely fill up Hell with jinn and humans all together.

verses.text: So taste ˹the punishment˺ for neglecting the meeting of this Day of yours. We ˹too˺ will certainly neglect you. And taste the torment of eternity for what you used to do! Qualities of the Believers
verses.translation: So taste ˹the punishment˺ for neglecting the meeting of this Day of yours. We ˹too˺ will certainly neglect you. And taste the torment of eternity for what you used to do! Qualities of the Believers

verses.text: The only ˹true˺ believers in Our revelation are those who—when it is recited to them—fall into prostration and glorify the praises of their Lord and are not too proud.
verses.translation: The only ˹true˺ believers in Our revelation are those who—when it is recited to them—fall into prostration and glorify the praises of their Lord and are not too proud.

verses.text: They abandon their beds, invoking their Lord with hope and fear, and donate from what We have provided for them.
verses.translation: They abandon their beds, invoking their Lord with hope and fear, and donate from what We have provided for them.

verses.text: No soul can imagine what delights are kept in store for them as a reward for what they used to do. The Faithful and the Rebellious
verses.translation: No soul can imagine what delights are kept in store for them as a reward for what they used to do. The Faithful and the Rebellious

verses.text: Is the one who is a believer equal ˹before Allah˺ to the one who is rebellious? They are not equal!
verses.translation: Is the one who is a believer equal ˹before Allah˺ to the one who is rebellious? They are not equal!

verses.text: As for those who believe and do good, they will have the Gardens of ˹Eternal˺ Residence—as an accommodation for what they used to do.
verses.translation: As for those who believe and do good, they will have the Gardens of ˹Eternal˺ Residence—as an accommodation for what they used to do.

verses.text: But as for those who are rebellious, the Fire will be their home. Whenever they try to escape from it, they will be forced back into it, and will be told, “Taste the Fire’s torment, which you used to deny.”
verses.translation: But as for those who are rebellious, the Fire will be their home. Whenever they try to escape from it, they will be forced back into it, and will be told, “Taste the Fire’s torment, which you used to deny.”

verses.text: We will certainly make them taste some of the minor torment ˹in this life˺ before the major torment ˹of the Hereafter˺, so perhaps they will return ˹to the Right Path˺.
verses.translation: We will certainly make them taste some of the minor torment ˹in this life˺ before the major torment ˹of the Hereafter˺, so perhaps they will return ˹to the Right Path˺.

verses.text: And who does more wrong than the one who is reminded of Allah’s revelations then turns away from them? We will surely inflict punishment upon the wicked. Divine Revelations
verses.translation: And who does more wrong than the one who is reminded of Allah’s revelations then turns away from them? We will surely inflict punishment upon the wicked. Divine Revelations

verses.text: Indeed, We gave the Scripture to Moses—so let there be no doubt ˹O Prophet˺ that you ˹too˺ are receiving revelations—[842]and We made it a guide for the Children of Israel.
verses.translation: Indeed, We gave the Scripture to Moses—so let there be no doubt ˹O Prophet˺ that you ˹too˺ are receiving revelations—[842]and We made it a guide for the Children of Israel.

verses.text: We raised from among them leaders, [843] guiding by Our command, when they patiently endured and firmly believed in Our signs.
verses.translation: We raised from among them leaders, [843] guiding by Our command, when they patiently endured and firmly believed in Our signs.

verses.text: Indeed, your Lord will decide between them on the Day of Judgment regarding their differences. Warning to the Disbelievers
verses.translation: Indeed, your Lord will decide between them on the Day of Judgment regarding their differences. Warning to the Disbelievers

verses.text: Is it not yet clear to them how many peoples We destroyed before them, whose ruins they still pass by? Surely in this are signs. Will they not then listen?
verses.translation: Is it not yet clear to them how many peoples We destroyed before them, whose ruins they still pass by? Surely in this are signs. Will they not then listen?

verses.text: Do they not see how We drive rain to parched land, producing ˹various˺ crops from which they and their cattle eat? Will they not then see? The Deniers of Judgment
verses.translation: Do they not see how We drive rain to parched land, producing ˹various˺ crops from which they and their cattle eat? Will they not then see? The Deniers of Judgment

verses.text: They ask ˹mockingly˺, “When is this ˹Day of final˺ Decision, if what you say is true?”
verses.translation: They ask ˹mockingly˺, “When is this ˹Day of final˺ Decision, if what you say is true?”

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “On the Day of Decision it will not benefit the disbelievers to believe then, nor will they be delayed ˹from punishment˺.”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “On the Day of Decision it will not benefit the disbelievers to believe then, nor will they be delayed ˹from punishment˺.”

verses.text: So turn away from them, and wait! They too are waiting. *** -- 364 of 694 --
verses.translation: So turn away from them, and wait! They too are waiting. *** -- 364 of 694 --

name: The Enemy Alliance
intro: This Medinian sûrah takes its name from the enemy alliance (mentioned in verses 9–27) which laid a siege around Medina during the Battle of the Trench in 5 A.H./627 C.E. While the believers are reminded of Allah’s aid against the enemy alliance, the hypocrites are condemned repeatedly. The sûrah provides social guidelines regarding adoption, divorce, modesty, and the etiquette of dealing with the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) and his wives. In view of Allah’s favours to the believers (including His forgiveness and generous reward at the end of the sûrah), the next sûrah starts off with praises to Allah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Orders to the Prophet

verses.text: O Prophet! ˹Always˺ be mindful of Allah, and do not yield to the disbelievers and the hypocrites. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
verses.translation: O Prophet! ˹Always˺ be mindful of Allah, and do not yield to the disbelievers and the hypocrites. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

verses.text: Follow what is revealed to you from your Lord. Surely Allah is All-Aware of what you ˹all˺ do.
verses.translation: Follow what is revealed to you from your Lord. Surely Allah is All-Aware of what you ˹all˺ do.

verses.text: And put your trust in Allah, for Allah is sufficient as a Trustee of Affairs. Rules on Divorce and Adoption[844]
verses.translation: And put your trust in Allah, for Allah is sufficient as a Trustee of Affairs. Rules on Divorce and Adoption[844]

verses.text: Allah does not place two hearts in any person’s chest. Nor does He regard your wives as ˹unlawful for you like˺ your real mothers, ˹even˺ if you say they are.[845] Nor does He regard your adopted children as your real children.[846] These are only your baseless assertions. But Allah declares the truth, and He ˹alone˺ guides to the ˹Right˺ Way.
verses.translation: Allah does not place two hearts in any person’s chest. Nor does He regard your wives as ˹unlawful for you like˺ your real mothers, ˹even˺ if you say they are.[845] Nor does He regard your adopted children as your real children.[846] These are only your baseless assertions. But Allah declares the truth, and He ˹alone˺ guides to the ˹Right˺ Way.

verses.text: Let your adopted children keep their family names. That is more just in the sight of Allah. But if you do not know their fathers, then they are ˹simply˺ your fellow believers and close associates. There is no blame on you for what you do by mistake, but ˹only˺ for what you do intentionally. And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Guidelines for the Believers
verses.translation: Let your adopted children keep their family names. That is more just in the sight of Allah. But if you do not know their fathers, then they are ˹simply˺ your fellow believers and close associates. There is no blame on you for what you do by mistake, but ˹only˺ for what you do intentionally. And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Guidelines for the Believers

verses.text: The Prophet has a stronger affinity to the believers than they do themselves. And his wives are their mothers. As ordained by Allah, blood relatives are more entitled ˹to inheritance˺ than ˹other˺ believers and immigrants, unless you ˹want to˺ show kindness to your ˹close˺ associates ˹through bequest˺.[847] This is decreed in the Record.[848] Covenant to Deliver the Truth
verses.translation: The Prophet has a stronger affinity to the believers than they do themselves. And his wives are their mothers. As ordained by Allah, blood relatives are more entitled ˹to inheritance˺ than ˹other˺ believers and immigrants, unless you ˹want to˺ show kindness to your ˹close˺ associates ˹through bequest˺.[847] This is decreed in the Record.[848] Covenant to Deliver the Truth

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when We took a covenant from the prophets, as well as from you ˹O Prophet˺, and from Noah, Abraham, Moses, and Jesus, son of Mary. We did take a solemn covenant from ˹all of˺ them
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when We took a covenant from the prophets, as well as from you ˹O Prophet˺, and from Noah, Abraham, Moses, and Jesus, son of Mary. We did take a solemn covenant from ˹all of˺ them

verses.text: so that He may question these men of truth about their ˹delivery of the˺ truth. And He has prepared a painful punishment for the disbelievers. The Battle of the Trench
verses.translation: so that He may question these men of truth about their ˹delivery of the˺ truth. And He has prepared a painful punishment for the disbelievers. The Battle of the Trench

verses.text: O believers! Remember Allah’s favour upon you when ˹enemy˺ forces came to ˹besiege˺ you ˹in Medina˺,[849] so We sent against them a ˹bitter˺ wind and forces you could not see.[850] And Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.
verses.translation: O believers! Remember Allah’s favour upon you when ˹enemy˺ forces came to ˹besiege˺ you ˹in Medina˺,[849] so We sent against them a ˹bitter˺ wind and forces you could not see.[850] And Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.

verses.text: ˹Remember˺ when they came at you from east and west,[851] when your eyes grew wild ˹in horror˺ and your hearts jumped into your throats, and you entertained ˹conflicting˺ thoughts about Allah.[852]
verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when they came at you from east and west,[851] when your eyes grew wild ˹in horror˺ and your hearts jumped into your throats, and you entertained ˹conflicting˺ thoughts about Allah.[852]

verses.text: Then and there the believers were put to the test, and were violently shaken. Stance of the Hypocrites
verses.translation: Then and there the believers were put to the test, and were violently shaken. Stance of the Hypocrites

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when the hypocrites and those with sickness in their hearts said, “Allah and His Messenger have promised us nothing but delusion!”
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when the hypocrites and those with sickness in their hearts said, “Allah and His Messenger have promised us nothing but delusion!”

verses.text: And ˹remember˺ when a group of them said, “O people of Yathrib![853] There is no point in you staying ˹here˺, so retreat!” Another group of them asked the Prophet’s permission ˹to leave˺, saying, “Our homes are vulnerable,” while ˹in fact˺ they were not vulnerable. They only wished to flee.
verses.translation: And ˹remember˺ when a group of them said, “O people of Yathrib![853] There is no point in you staying ˹here˺, so retreat!” Another group of them asked the Prophet’s permission ˹to leave˺, saying, “Our homes are vulnerable,” while ˹in fact˺ they were not vulnerable. They only wished to flee.

verses.text: Had their city been sacked from all sides and they had been asked to abandon faith, they would have done so with little hesitation. Warning to the Hypocrites
verses.translation: Had their city been sacked from all sides and they had been asked to abandon faith, they would have done so with little hesitation. Warning to the Hypocrites

verses.text: They had already pledged to Allah earlier never to turn their backs ˹in retreat˺. And a pledge to Allah must be answered for.
verses.translation: They had already pledged to Allah earlier never to turn their backs ˹in retreat˺. And a pledge to Allah must be answered for.

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Fleeing will not benefit you if you ˹try to˺ escape a natural or violent death. ˹If it is not your time,˺ you will only be allowed enjoyment for a little while.”[854]
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Fleeing will not benefit you if you ˹try to˺ escape a natural or violent death. ˹If it is not your time,˺ you will only be allowed enjoyment for a little while.”[854]

verses.text: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Who can put you out of Allah’s reach if He intends to harm you or show you mercy?” They can never find any protector or helper besides Allah. Hypocritical Tactics
verses.translation: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Who can put you out of Allah’s reach if He intends to harm you or show you mercy?” They can never find any protector or helper besides Allah. Hypocritical Tactics

verses.text: Allah knows well those among you who discourage ˹others from fighting˺, saying ˹secretly˺ to their brothers, “Stay with us,” and who themselves hardly take part in fighting.
verses.translation: Allah knows well those among you who discourage ˹others from fighting˺, saying ˹secretly˺ to their brothers, “Stay with us,” and who themselves hardly take part in fighting.

verses.text: ˹They are˺ totally unwilling to assist you. When danger comes, you see them staring at you with their eyes rolling like someone in the throes of death. But once the danger is over, they slash you with razor-sharp tongues, ravenous for ˹worldly˺ gains. Such people have not ˹truly˺ believed, so Allah has rendered their deeds void. And that is easy for Allah. Hypocrites Paranoid
verses.translation: ˹They are˺ totally unwilling to assist you. When danger comes, you see them staring at you with their eyes rolling like someone in the throes of death. But once the danger is over, they slash you with razor-sharp tongues, ravenous for ˹worldly˺ gains. Such people have not ˹truly˺ believed, so Allah has rendered their deeds void. And that is easy for Allah. Hypocrites Paranoid

verses.text: They ˹still˺ think that the enemy alliance has not ˹yet˺ withdrawn. And if the allies were to come ˹again˺, the hypocrites would wish to be away in the desert among nomadic Arabs, ˹only˺ asking for news about you ˹believers˺. And if the hypocrites were in your midst, they would hardly take part in the fight. The Prophet as a Role Model
verses.translation: They ˹still˺ think that the enemy alliance has not ˹yet˺ withdrawn. And if the allies were to come ˹again˺, the hypocrites would wish to be away in the desert among nomadic Arabs, ˹only˺ asking for news about you ˹believers˺. And if the hypocrites were in your midst, they would hardly take part in the fight. The Prophet as a Role Model

verses.text: Indeed, in the Messenger of Allah you have an excellent example for whoever has hope in Allah and the Last Day, and remembers Allah often. Stance of the Believers
verses.translation: Indeed, in the Messenger of Allah you have an excellent example for whoever has hope in Allah and the Last Day, and remembers Allah often. Stance of the Believers

verses.text: When the believers saw the enemy alliance, they said, “This is what Allah and His Messenger had promised us. The promise of Allah and His Messenger has come true.” And this only increased them in faith and submission.
verses.translation: When the believers saw the enemy alliance, they said, “This is what Allah and His Messenger had promised us. The promise of Allah and His Messenger has come true.” And this only increased them in faith and submission.

verses.text: Among the believers are men who have proven true to what they pledged to Allah.[855] Some of them have fulfilled their pledge ˹with their lives˺, others are waiting ˹their turn˺. They have never changed ˹their commitment˺ in the least.
verses.translation: Among the believers are men who have proven true to what they pledged to Allah.[855] Some of them have fulfilled their pledge ˹with their lives˺, others are waiting ˹their turn˺. They have never changed ˹their commitment˺ in the least.

verses.text: ˹It all happened˺ so Allah may reward the faithful for their faithfulness, and punish the hypocrites if He wills or turn to them ˹in mercy˺. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Defeat of the Enemy Alliance
verses.translation: ˹It all happened˺ so Allah may reward the faithful for their faithfulness, and punish the hypocrites if He wills or turn to them ˹in mercy˺. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Defeat of the Enemy Alliance

verses.text: And Allah drove back the disbelievers in their rage, totally empty- handed. And Allah spared the believers from fighting. For Allah is All- Powerful, Almighty.
verses.translation: And Allah drove back the disbelievers in their rage, totally empty- handed. And Allah spared the believers from fighting. For Allah is All- Powerful, Almighty.

verses.text: And He brought down those from the People of the Book[856] who supported the enemy alliance from their own strongholds, and cast horror into their hearts. You ˹believers˺ killed some, and took others captive.
verses.translation: And He brought down those from the People of the Book[856] who supported the enemy alliance from their own strongholds, and cast horror into their hearts. You ˹believers˺ killed some, and took others captive.

verses.text: He has also caused you to take over their lands, homes, and wealth, as well as lands you have not yet set foot on. And Allah is Most Capable of everything. Advice to the Prophet’s Wives: Your Choice
verses.translation: He has also caused you to take over their lands, homes, and wealth, as well as lands you have not yet set foot on. And Allah is Most Capable of everything. Advice to the Prophet’s Wives: Your Choice

verses.text: O Prophet! Say to your wives, “If you desire the life of this world and its luxury, then come, I will give you a ˹suitable˺ compensation ˹for divorce˺ and let you go graciously.
verses.translation: O Prophet! Say to your wives, “If you desire the life of this world and its luxury, then come, I will give you a ˹suitable˺ compensation ˹for divorce˺ and let you go graciously.

verses.text: But if you desire Allah and His Messenger and the ˹everlasting˺ Home of the Hereafter, then Surely Allah has prepared a great reward for those of you who do good.” More Advice: Your Reward
verses.translation: But if you desire Allah and His Messenger and the ˹everlasting˺ Home of the Hereafter, then Surely Allah has prepared a great reward for those of you who do good.” More Advice: Your Reward

verses.text: O wives of the Prophet! If any of you were to commit a blatant misconduct, the punishment would be doubled for her. And that is easy for Allah.
verses.translation: O wives of the Prophet! If any of you were to commit a blatant misconduct, the punishment would be doubled for her. And that is easy for Allah.

verses.text: And whoever of you devoutly obeys Allah and His Messenger and does good, We will grant her double the reward, and We have prepared for her an honourable provision. More Advice: Your Modesty
verses.translation: And whoever of you devoutly obeys Allah and His Messenger and does good, We will grant her double the reward, and We have prepared for her an honourable provision. More Advice: Your Modesty

verses.text: O wives of the Prophet! You are not like any other women: if you are mindful ˹of Allah˺, then do not be overly effeminate in speech ˹with men˺ or those with sickness in their hearts may be tempted, but speak in a moderate tone.
verses.translation: O wives of the Prophet! You are not like any other women: if you are mindful ˹of Allah˺, then do not be overly effeminate in speech ˹with men˺ or those with sickness in their hearts may be tempted, but speak in a moderate tone.

verses.text: Settle in your homes, and do not display yourselves as women did in the days of ˹pre-Islamic˺ ignorance. Establish prayer, pay alms-tax, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah only intends to keep ˹the causes of˺ evil away from you and purify you completely, O members of the ˹Prophet’s˺ family!
verses.translation: Settle in your homes, and do not display yourselves as women did in the days of ˹pre-Islamic˺ ignorance. Establish prayer, pay alms-tax, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah only intends to keep ˹the causes of˺ evil away from you and purify you completely, O members of the ˹Prophet’s˺ family!

verses.text: ˹Always˺ remember what is recited in your homes of Allah’s revelations and ˹prophetic˺ wisdom.[857] Surely Allah is Most Subtle, All-Aware. Reward of the Righteous
verses.translation: ˹Always˺ remember what is recited in your homes of Allah’s revelations and ˹prophetic˺ wisdom.[857] Surely Allah is Most Subtle, All-Aware. Reward of the Righteous

verses.text: Surely ˹for˺ Muslim men and women, believing men and women,[858] devout men and women, truthful men and women, patient men and women, humble men and women, charitable men and women, fasting men and women, men and women who guard their chastity, and men and women who remember Allah often—for ˹all of˺ them Allah has prepared forgiveness and a great reward.
