Unconditional Obedience
verses.translation: Surely ˹for˺ Muslim men and women, believing men and women,[858] devout men and women, truthful men and women, patient men and women, humble men and women, charitable men and women, fasting men and women, men and women who guard their chastity, and men and women who remember Allah often—for ˹all of˺ them Allah has prepared forgiveness and a great reward. Unconditional Obedience

verses.text: It is not for a believing man or woman—when Allah and His Messenger decree a matter—to have any other choice in that matter.[859] Indeed, whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger has clearly gone ˹far˺ astray. The Case of Zaid
verses.translation: It is not for a believing man or woman—when Allah and His Messenger decree a matter—to have any other choice in that matter.[859] Indeed, whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger has clearly gone ˹far˺ astray. The Case of Zaid

verses.text: And ˹remember, O Prophet,˺ when you said to the one[860] for whom Allah has done a favour and you ˹too˺ have done a favour,[861] “Keep your wife and fear Allah,” while concealing within yourself what Allah was going to reveal. And ˹so˺ you were considering the people, whereas Allah was more worthy of your consideration. So when Zaid totally lost interest in ˹keeping˺ his wife, We gave her to you in marriage, so that there would be no blame on the believers for marrying the ex-wives of their adopted sons after their divorce. And Allah’s command is totally binding.
verses.translation: And ˹remember, O Prophet,˺ when you said to the one[860] for whom Allah has done a favour and you ˹too˺ have done a favour,[861] “Keep your wife and fear Allah,” while concealing within yourself what Allah was going to reveal. And ˹so˺ you were considering the people, whereas Allah was more worthy of your consideration. So when Zaid totally lost interest in ˹keeping˺ his wife, We gave her to you in marriage, so that there would be no blame on the believers for marrying the ex-wives of their adopted sons after their divorce. And Allah’s command is totally binding.

verses.text: There is no blame on the Prophet for doing what Allah has ordained for him. That has been the way of Allah with those ˹prophets˺ who had gone before. And Allah’s command has been firmly decreed.
verses.translation: There is no blame on the Prophet for doing what Allah has ordained for him. That has been the way of Allah with those ˹prophets˺ who had gone before. And Allah’s command has been firmly decreed.

verses.text: ˹That is His way with˺ those ˹prophets˺ who deliver the messages of Allah, and consider Him, and none but Allah. And sufficient is Allah as a ˹vigilant˺ Reckoner.
verses.translation: ˹That is His way with˺ those ˹prophets˺ who deliver the messages of Allah, and consider Him, and none but Allah. And sufficient is Allah as a ˹vigilant˺ Reckoner.

verses.text: Muḥammad is not the father of any of your men,[862] but is the Messenger of Allah and the seal of the prophets. And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things. Reward of the Believers
verses.translation: Muḥammad is not the father of any of your men,[862] but is the Messenger of Allah and the seal of the prophets. And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things. Reward of the Believers

verses.text: O believers! Always remember Allah often,
verses.translation: O believers! Always remember Allah often,

verses.text: and glorify Him morning and evening.
verses.translation: and glorify Him morning and evening.

verses.text: He is the One Who showers His blessings upon you—and His angels pray for you—so that He may bring you out of darkness and into light. For He is ever Merciful to the believers.
verses.translation: He is the One Who showers His blessings upon you—and His angels pray for you—so that He may bring you out of darkness and into light. For He is ever Merciful to the believers.

verses.text: Their greeting on the Day they meet Him will be, “Peace!” And He has prepared for them an honourable reward. Excellence of the Prophet
verses.translation: Their greeting on the Day they meet Him will be, “Peace!” And He has prepared for them an honourable reward. Excellence of the Prophet

verses.text: O Prophet! We have sent you as a witness, and a deliverer of good news, and a warner,
verses.translation: O Prophet! We have sent you as a witness, and a deliverer of good news, and a warner,

verses.text: and a caller to ˹the Way of˺ Allah by His command, and a beacon of light.
verses.translation: and a caller to ˹the Way of˺ Allah by His command, and a beacon of light.

verses.text: Give good news to the believers that they will have a great bounty from Allah.
verses.translation: Give good news to the believers that they will have a great bounty from Allah.

verses.text: Do not yield to the disbelievers and the hypocrites. Overlook their annoyances, and put your trust in Allah. For Allah is sufficient as a Trustee of Affairs. Divorce Before Consummation
verses.translation: Do not yield to the disbelievers and the hypocrites. Overlook their annoyances, and put your trust in Allah. For Allah is sufficient as a Trustee of Affairs. Divorce Before Consummation

verses.text: O believers! If you marry believing women and then divorce them before you touch them,[863] they will have no waiting period for you to count,[864] so give them a ˹suitable˺ compensation, and let them go graciously. Women Lawful to the Prophet
verses.translation: O believers! If you marry believing women and then divorce them before you touch them,[863] they will have no waiting period for you to count,[864] so give them a ˹suitable˺ compensation, and let them go graciously. Women Lawful to the Prophet

verses.text: O Prophet! We have made lawful for you your wives to whom you have paid their ˹full˺ dowries as well as those ˹bondwomen˺ in your possession, whom Allah has granted you.[865] And ˹you are allowed to marry˺ the daughters of your paternal uncles and aunts, and the daughters of your maternal uncles and aunts, who have emigrated like you. Also ˹allowed for marriage is˺ a believing woman who offers herself to the Prophet ˹without dowry˺ if he is interested in marrying her—˹this is˺ exclusively for you, not for the rest of the believers.[866] We know well what ˹rulings˺ We have ordained for the believers in relation to their wives and those ˹bondwomen˺ in their possession. As such, there would be no blame on you. And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Prophet’s Visitation to His Wives
verses.translation: O Prophet! We have made lawful for you your wives to whom you have paid their ˹full˺ dowries as well as those ˹bondwomen˺ in your possession, whom Allah has granted you.[865] And ˹you are allowed to marry˺ the daughters of your paternal uncles and aunts, and the daughters of your maternal uncles and aunts, who have emigrated like you. Also ˹allowed for marriage is˺ a believing woman who offers herself to the Prophet ˹without dowry˺ if he is interested in marrying her—˹this is˺ exclusively for you, not for the rest of the believers.[866] We know well what ˹rulings˺ We have ordained for the believers in relation to their wives and those ˹bondwomen˺ in their possession. As such, there would be no blame on you. And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Prophet’s Visitation to His Wives

verses.text: It is up to you ˹O Prophet˺ to delay or receive whoever you please of your wives. There is no blame on you if you call back any of those you have set aside.[867] That is more likely that they will be content, not grieved, and satisfied with what you offer them all. Allah ˹fully˺ knows what is in your hearts. And Allah is All-Knowing, Most Forbearing. No Future Marriages
verses.translation: It is up to you ˹O Prophet˺ to delay or receive whoever you please of your wives. There is no blame on you if you call back any of those you have set aside.[867] That is more likely that they will be content, not grieved, and satisfied with what you offer them all. Allah ˹fully˺ knows what is in your hearts. And Allah is All-Knowing, Most Forbearing. No Future Marriages

verses.text: It is not lawful for you ˹O Prophet˺ to marry more women after this, nor can you replace any of your present wives with another, even if her beauty may attract you—except those ˹bondwomen˺ in your possession. And Allah is ever Watchful over all things. On Visiting the Prophet
verses.translation: It is not lawful for you ˹O Prophet˺ to marry more women after this, nor can you replace any of your present wives with another, even if her beauty may attract you—except those ˹bondwomen˺ in your possession. And Allah is ever Watchful over all things. On Visiting the Prophet

verses.text: O believers! Do not enter the homes of the Prophet without permission ˹and if invited˺ for a meal, do not ˹come too early and˺ linger until the meal is ready. But if you are invited, then enter ˹on time˺. Once you have eaten, then go on your way, and do not stay for casual talk. Such behaviour is truly annoying to the Prophet, yet he is too shy to ask you to leave. But Allah is never shy of the truth. And when you ˹believers˺ ask his wives for something, ask them from behind a barrier. This is purer for your hearts and theirs. And it is not right for you to annoy the Messenger of Allah, nor ever marry his wives after him. This would certainly be a major offence in the sight of Allah.
verses.translation: O believers! Do not enter the homes of the Prophet without permission ˹and if invited˺ for a meal, do not ˹come too early and˺ linger until the meal is ready. But if you are invited, then enter ˹on time˺. Once you have eaten, then go on your way, and do not stay for casual talk. Such behaviour is truly annoying to the Prophet, yet he is too shy to ask you to leave. But Allah is never shy of the truth. And when you ˹believers˺ ask his wives for something, ask them from behind a barrier. This is purer for your hearts and theirs. And it is not right for you to annoy the Messenger of Allah, nor ever marry his wives after him. This would certainly be a major offence in the sight of Allah.

verses.text: Whether you reveal something or conceal it, surely Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things.
verses.translation: Whether you reveal something or conceal it, surely Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things.

verses.text: There is no blame on the Prophet’s wives ˹if they appear unveiled˺ before their fathers,[868] their sons, their brothers, their brothers’ sons, their sisters’ sons, their fellow ˹Muslim˺ women, and those ˹bondspeople˺ in their possession. And be mindful of Allah ˹O wives of the Prophet!˺ Surely Allah is a Witness over all things. Blessings on the Prophet
verses.translation: There is no blame on the Prophet’s wives ˹if they appear unveiled˺ before their fathers,[868] their sons, their brothers, their brothers’ sons, their sisters’ sons, their fellow ˹Muslim˺ women, and those ˹bondspeople˺ in their possession. And be mindful of Allah ˹O wives of the Prophet!˺ Surely Allah is a Witness over all things. Blessings on the Prophet

verses.text: Indeed, Allah showers His blessings upon the Prophet, and His angels pray for him. O believers! Invoke Allah’s blessings upon him, and salute him with worthy greetings of peace. Offending Allah, His Messenger, and the Believers
verses.translation: Indeed, Allah showers His blessings upon the Prophet, and His angels pray for him. O believers! Invoke Allah’s blessings upon him, and salute him with worthy greetings of peace. Offending Allah, His Messenger, and the Believers

verses.text: Surely those who offend Allah[869] and His Messenger[870] are condemned by Allah in this world and the Hereafter. And He has prepared for them a humiliating punishment.
verses.translation: Surely those who offend Allah[869] and His Messenger[870] are condemned by Allah in this world and the Hereafter. And He has prepared for them a humiliating punishment.

verses.text: As for those who abuse believing men and women[871] unjustifiably, they will definitely bear the guilt of slander and blatant sin. The Veil
verses.translation: As for those who abuse believing men and women[871] unjustifiably, they will definitely bear the guilt of slander and blatant sin. The Veil

verses.text: O Prophet! Ask your wives, daughters, and believing women to draw their cloaks over their bodies. In this way it is more likely that they will be recognized ˹as virtuous˺ and not be harassed. And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.[872] Reward of the Wicked
verses.translation: O Prophet! Ask your wives, daughters, and believing women to draw their cloaks over their bodies. In this way it is more likely that they will be recognized ˹as virtuous˺ and not be harassed. And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.[872] Reward of the Wicked

verses.text: If the hypocrites, and those with sickness in their hearts, and rumour- mongers in Medina do not desist, We will certainly incite you ˹O Prophet˺ against them, and then they will not be your neighbours there any longer.
verses.translation: If the hypocrites, and those with sickness in their hearts, and rumour- mongers in Medina do not desist, We will certainly incite you ˹O Prophet˺ against them, and then they will not be your neighbours there any longer.

verses.text: ˹They deserve to be˺ condemned. ˹If they were to persist,˺ they would get themselves seized and killed relentlessly wherever they are found![873]
verses.translation: ˹They deserve to be˺ condemned. ˹If they were to persist,˺ they would get themselves seized and killed relentlessly wherever they are found![873]

verses.text: That was Allah’s way with those ˹hypocrites˺ who have gone before. And you will find no change in Allah’s way. When Is the Hour?
verses.translation: That was Allah’s way with those ˹hypocrites˺ who have gone before. And you will find no change in Allah’s way. When Is the Hour?

verses.text: People ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about the Hour. Say, “That knowledge is only with Allah. You never know, perhaps the Hour is near.” The Doomed
verses.translation: People ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about the Hour. Say, “That knowledge is only with Allah. You never know, perhaps the Hour is near.” The Doomed

verses.text: Surely Allah condemns the disbelievers, and has prepared for them a blazing Fire,
verses.translation: Surely Allah condemns the disbelievers, and has prepared for them a blazing Fire,

verses.text: to stay there for ever and ever—never will they find any protector or helper.
verses.translation: to stay there for ever and ever—never will they find any protector or helper.

verses.text: On the Day their faces are ˹constantly˺ flipped in the Fire, they will cry, “Oh! If only we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger!”
verses.translation: On the Day their faces are ˹constantly˺ flipped in the Fire, they will cry, “Oh! If only we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger!”

verses.text: And they will say, “Our Lord! We obeyed our leaders and elite, but they led us astray from the ˹Right˺ Way.
verses.translation: And they will say, “Our Lord! We obeyed our leaders and elite, but they led us astray from the ˹Right˺ Way.

verses.text: Our Lord! Give them double ˹our˺ punishment, and condemn them tremendously.” Advice to the Believers
verses.translation: Our Lord! Give them double ˹our˺ punishment, and condemn them tremendously.” Advice to the Believers

verses.text: O believers! Do not be like those who slandered Moses, but Allah cleared him of what they said. And he was honourable in the sight of Allah. [874]
verses.translation: O believers! Do not be like those who slandered Moses, but Allah cleared him of what they said. And he was honourable in the sight of Allah. [874]

verses.text: O believers! Be mindful of Allah, and say what is right.
verses.translation: O believers! Be mindful of Allah, and say what is right.

verses.text: He will bless your deeds for you, and forgive your sins. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, has truly achieved a great triumph. The Trust[875]
verses.translation: He will bless your deeds for you, and forgive your sins. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, has truly achieved a great triumph. The Trust[875]

verses.text: Indeed, We offered the trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, but they ˹all˺ declined to bear it, being fearful of it. But humanity assumed it, ˹for˺ they are truly wrongful ˹to themselves˺ and ignorant ˹of the consequences˺,
verses.translation: Indeed, We offered the trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, but they ˹all˺ declined to bear it, being fearful of it. But humanity assumed it, ˹for˺ they are truly wrongful ˹to themselves˺ and ignorant ˹of the consequences˺,

verses.text: so that Allah will punish hypocrite men and women and polytheistic men and women, and Allah will turn in mercy to believing men and women. For Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. [876] *** -- 372 of 694 --
verses.translation: so that Allah will punish hypocrite men and women and polytheistic men and women, and Allah will turn in mercy to believing men and women. For Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. [876] *** -- 372 of 694 --

name: Sheba
intro: This Meccan sûrah takes its name from the reference to the people of Sheba (verses 15-20) who were punished for meeting Allah’s favours with ingratitude. Both David ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) and Solomon ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) are cited as grateful servants of Allah. The Meccan pagans are reminded that only faith can bring them closer to Allah, not their wealth. They are criticized for calling the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) ‘insane’ and are warned of punishment in this life and the next. Both the last part of this sûrah (verses 40-41) and the beginning of the next (verse 1) reaffirm the angels as Allah’s faithful servants. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Praises to the Almighty

verses.text: All praise is for Allah, to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And praise be to Him in the Hereafter. He is the All-Wise, All-Aware.
verses.translation: All praise is for Allah, to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And praise be to Him in the Hereafter. He is the All-Wise, All-Aware.

verses.text: He knows whatever goes into the earth and whatever comes out of it, and whatever descends from the sky and whatever ascends into it. And He is the Most Merciful, All-Forgiving. Denying the Hour
verses.translation: He knows whatever goes into the earth and whatever comes out of it, and whatever descends from the sky and whatever ascends into it. And He is the Most Merciful, All-Forgiving. Denying the Hour

verses.text: The disbelievers say, “The Hour will never come to us.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Yes—by my Lord, the Knower of the unseen—it will certainly come to you!” Not ˹even˺ an atom’s weight is hidden from Him in the heavens or the earth; nor anything smaller or larger than that, but is ˹written˺ in a perfect Record.[877]
verses.translation: The disbelievers say, “The Hour will never come to us.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Yes—by my Lord, the Knower of the unseen—it will certainly come to you!” Not ˹even˺ an atom’s weight is hidden from Him in the heavens or the earth; nor anything smaller or larger than that, but is ˹written˺ in a perfect Record.[877]

verses.text: So He may reward those who believe and do good. It is they who will have forgiveness and an honourable provision.
verses.translation: So He may reward those who believe and do good. It is they who will have forgiveness and an honourable provision.

verses.text: As for those who strive to discredit Our revelations, it is they who will suffer the ˹worst˺ torment of agonizing pain.
verses.translation: As for those who strive to discredit Our revelations, it is they who will suffer the ˹worst˺ torment of agonizing pain.

verses.text: Those gifted with knowledge ˹clearly˺ see that what has been revealed to you from your Lord ˹O Prophet˺ is the truth, and that it guides to the Path of the Almighty, the Praiseworthy. Warning to the Deniers
verses.translation: Those gifted with knowledge ˹clearly˺ see that what has been revealed to you from your Lord ˹O Prophet˺ is the truth, and that it guides to the Path of the Almighty, the Praiseworthy. Warning to the Deniers

verses.text: The disbelievers say ˹mockingly to one another˺, “Shall we show you a man who claims that when you have been utterly disintegrated you will be raised as a new creation?
verses.translation: The disbelievers say ˹mockingly to one another˺, “Shall we show you a man who claims that when you have been utterly disintegrated you will be raised as a new creation?

verses.text: Has he fabricated a lie against Allah or is he insane?” In fact, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are bound for torment and have strayed farthest ˹from the truth˺.
verses.translation: Has he fabricated a lie against Allah or is he insane?” In fact, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are bound for torment and have strayed farthest ˹from the truth˺.

verses.text: Have they not then seen all that surrounds them of the heavens and the earth? If We willed, We could cause the earth to swallow them up, or cause ˹deadly˺ pieces of the sky to fall upon them. Surely in this is a sign for every servant who turns ˹to Allah˺. Allah’s Favours to David
verses.translation: Have they not then seen all that surrounds them of the heavens and the earth? If We willed, We could cause the earth to swallow them up, or cause ˹deadly˺ pieces of the sky to fall upon them. Surely in this is a sign for every servant who turns ˹to Allah˺. Allah’s Favours to David

verses.text: Indeed, We granted David a ˹great˺ privilege from Us, ˹commanding:˺ “O mountains! Echo his hymns! And the birds as well.” We made iron mouldable for him,
verses.translation: Indeed, We granted David a ˹great˺ privilege from Us, ˹commanding:˺ “O mountains! Echo his hymns! And the birds as well.” We made iron mouldable for him,

verses.text: instructing: “Make full-length armour, ˹perfectly˺ balancing the links. And work righteousness ˹O family of David!˺. Indeed, I am All-Seeing of what you do.” Allah’s Favours to Solomon
verses.translation: instructing: “Make full-length armour, ˹perfectly˺ balancing the links. And work righteousness ˹O family of David!˺. Indeed, I am All-Seeing of what you do.” Allah’s Favours to Solomon

verses.text: And to Solomon ˹We subjected˺ the wind: its morning stride was a month’s journey and so was its evening stride. And We caused a stream of molten copper to flow for him, and ˹We subjected˺ some of the jinn to work under him by his Lord’s Will. And whoever of them deviated from Our command, We made them taste the torment of the blaze.
verses.translation: And to Solomon ˹We subjected˺ the wind: its morning stride was a month’s journey and so was its evening stride. And We caused a stream of molten copper to flow for him, and ˹We subjected˺ some of the jinn to work under him by his Lord’s Will. And whoever of them deviated from Our command, We made them taste the torment of the blaze.

verses.text: They made for him whatever he desired of sanctuaries, statues,[878] basins as large as reservoirs, and cooking pots fixed ˹into the ground˺. ˹We ordered:˺ “Work gratefully, O family of David!” ˹Only˺ a few of My servants are ˹truly˺ grateful.
verses.translation: They made for him whatever he desired of sanctuaries, statues,[878] basins as large as reservoirs, and cooking pots fixed ˹into the ground˺. ˹We ordered:˺ “Work gratefully, O family of David!” ˹Only˺ a few of My servants are ˹truly˺ grateful.

verses.text: When We decreed Solomon’s death, nothing indicated to the ˹subjected˺ jinn that he was dead except the termites eating away his staff. [879] So when he collapsed, the jinn realized that if they had ˹really˺ known the unseen, they would not have remained in ˹such˺ humiliating servitude. Allah’s Favours to Sheba 1) Provision
verses.translation: When We decreed Solomon’s death, nothing indicated to the ˹subjected˺ jinn that he was dead except the termites eating away his staff. [879] So when he collapsed, the jinn realized that if they had ˹really˺ known the unseen, they would not have remained in ˹such˺ humiliating servitude. Allah’s Favours to Sheba 1) Provision

verses.text: Indeed, there was a sign for ˹the tribe of˺ Sheba in their homeland: two orchards—one to the right and the other to the left. ˹They were told:˺ “Eat from the provision of your Lord, and be grateful to Him. ˹Yours is˺ a good land and a forgiving Lord.”
verses.translation: Indeed, there was a sign for ˹the tribe of˺ Sheba in their homeland: two orchards—one to the right and the other to the left. ˹They were told:˺ “Eat from the provision of your Lord, and be grateful to Him. ˹Yours is˺ a good land and a forgiving Lord.”

verses.text: But they turned away. So We sent against them a devastating flood, and replaced their orchards with two others producing bitter fruit, fruitless bushes,[880] and a few ˹sparse˺ thorny trees. [881]
verses.translation: But they turned away. So We sent against them a devastating flood, and replaced their orchards with two others producing bitter fruit, fruitless bushes,[880] and a few ˹sparse˺ thorny trees. [881]

verses.text: This is how We rewarded them for their ingratitude. Would We ever punish ˹anyone in such a way˺ except the ungrateful? Allah’s Favours to Sheba 2) Safe Travel
verses.translation: This is how We rewarded them for their ingratitude. Would We ever punish ˹anyone in such a way˺ except the ungrateful? Allah’s Favours to Sheba 2) Safe Travel

verses.text: We had also placed between them and the cities[882] We showered with blessings ˹many small˺ towns within sight of one another. And We set moderate travel distances in between, ˹saying,˺ “Travel between them by day and night safely.”
verses.translation: We had also placed between them and the cities[882] We showered with blessings ˹many small˺ towns within sight of one another. And We set moderate travel distances in between, ˹saying,˺ “Travel between them by day and night safely.”

verses.text: But they said, “Our Lord! Make ˹the distances of˺ our journeys longer,” wronging themselves.[883] So We reduced them to ˹cautionary˺ tales, and scattered them utterly. Surely in this are lessons for whoever is steadfast, grateful. Satan’s Vow Regarding Humans
verses.translation: But they said, “Our Lord! Make ˹the distances of˺ our journeys longer,” wronging themselves.[883] So We reduced them to ˹cautionary˺ tales, and scattered them utterly. Surely in this are lessons for whoever is steadfast, grateful. Satan’s Vow Regarding Humans

verses.text: Indeed, Iblîs’ assumption about them has come true,[884] so they ˹all˺ follow him, except a group of ˹true˺ believers.
verses.translation: Indeed, Iblîs’ assumption about them has come true,[884] so they ˹all˺ follow him, except a group of ˹true˺ believers.

verses.text: He does not have any authority over them, but ˹Our Will is˺ only to distinguish those who believe in the Hereafter from those who are in doubt about it. And your Lord is a ˹vigilant˺ Keeper over all things.” Helpless Idols
verses.translation: He does not have any authority over them, but ˹Our Will is˺ only to distinguish those who believe in the Hereafter from those who are in doubt about it. And your Lord is a ˹vigilant˺ Keeper over all things.” Helpless Idols

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Call upon those you claim ˹to be divine˺ besides Allah. They do not possess ˹even˺ an atom’s weight either in the heavens or the earth, nor do they have any share in ˹governing˺ them. Nor is any of them a helper to Him.”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Call upon those you claim ˹to be divine˺ besides Allah. They do not possess ˹even˺ an atom’s weight either in the heavens or the earth, nor do they have any share in ˹governing˺ them. Nor is any of them a helper to Him.”

verses.text: No intercession will be of any benefit with Him, except by those granted permission by Him. ˹At last,˺ when the dread ˹of Judgment Day˺ is relieved from their hearts ˹because they are permitted to intercede˺, they will ˹excitedly˺ ask ˹the angels˺, “What has your Lord ˹just˺ said?” The angels will reply, “The truth! And He is the Most High, All- Great.” Message to the Polytheists
verses.translation: No intercession will be of any benefit with Him, except by those granted permission by Him. ˹At last,˺ when the dread ˹of Judgment Day˺ is relieved from their hearts ˹because they are permitted to intercede˺, they will ˹excitedly˺ ask ˹the angels˺, “What has your Lord ˹just˺ said?” The angels will reply, “The truth! And He is the Most High, All- Great.” Message to the Polytheists

verses.text: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Who provides for you from the heavens and the earth?” Say, “Allah! Now, certainly one of our two groups[885] is ˹rightly˺ guided; the other is clearly astray.”
verses.translation: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Who provides for you from the heavens and the earth?” Say, “Allah! Now, certainly one of our two groups[885] is ˹rightly˺ guided; the other is clearly astray.”

verses.text: Say, “You will not be accountable for our misdeeds, nor will we be accountable for your deeds.”
verses.translation: Say, “You will not be accountable for our misdeeds, nor will we be accountable for your deeds.”

verses.text: Say, “Our Lord will gather us together, then He will judge between us with the truth. For He is the All-Knowing Judge.”
verses.translation: Say, “Our Lord will gather us together, then He will judge between us with the truth. For He is the All-Knowing Judge.”

verses.text: Say, “Show me those ˹idols˺ you have joined with Him as partners. No! In fact, He ˹alone˺ is Allah—the Almighty, All-Wise.” Warning of the Hour
verses.translation: Say, “Show me those ˹idols˺ you have joined with Him as partners. No! In fact, He ˹alone˺ is Allah—the Almighty, All-Wise.” Warning of the Hour

verses.text: We have sent you ˹O Prophet˺ only as a deliverer of good news and a warner to all of humanity, but most people do not know.
verses.translation: We have sent you ˹O Prophet˺ only as a deliverer of good news and a warner to all of humanity, but most people do not know.

verses.text: And they ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass, if what you say is true?”
verses.translation: And they ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass, if what you say is true?”

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “A Day has ˹already˺ been appointed for you, which you can neither delay nor advance by a ˹single˺ moment.” The Misleaders and the Misled
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “A Day has ˹already˺ been appointed for you, which you can neither delay nor advance by a ˹single˺ moment.” The Misleaders and the Misled

verses.text: The disbelievers vow, “We will never believe in this Quran, nor in those ˹Scriptures˺ before it.” If only you could see when the wrongdoers will be detained before their Lord, throwing blame at each other! The lowly ˹followers˺ will say to the arrogant ˹leaders˺, “Had it not been for you, we would certainly have been believers.”
verses.translation: The disbelievers vow, “We will never believe in this Quran, nor in those ˹Scriptures˺ before it.” If only you could see when the wrongdoers will be detained before their Lord, throwing blame at each other! The lowly ˹followers˺ will say to the arrogant ˹leaders˺, “Had it not been for you, we would certainly have been believers.”

verses.text: The arrogant will respond to the lowly, “Did we ever hinder you from guidance after it came to you? In fact, you were wicked ˹on your own˺.”
verses.translation: The arrogant will respond to the lowly, “Did we ever hinder you from guidance after it came to you? In fact, you were wicked ˹on your own˺.”

verses.text: The lowly will say to the arrogant, “No! It was your plotting by day and night—when you ordered us to disbelieve in Allah and to set up equals with Him.” They will ˹all˺ hide ˹their˺ remorse when they see the torment. And We will put shackles around the necks of the disbelievers. Will they be rewarded except for what they used to do? Spoiled Elite
verses.translation: The lowly will say to the arrogant, “No! It was your plotting by day and night—when you ordered us to disbelieve in Allah and to set up equals with Him.” They will ˹all˺ hide ˹their˺ remorse when they see the torment. And We will put shackles around the necks of the disbelievers. Will they be rewarded except for what they used to do? Spoiled Elite

verses.text: Whenever We sent a warner to a society, its elite would say, “We truly reject what you have been sent with.”
verses.translation: Whenever We sent a warner to a society, its elite would say, “We truly reject what you have been sent with.”

verses.text: Adding, “We are far superior ˹to the believers˺ in wealth and children, and we will never be punished.”
verses.translation: Adding, “We are far superior ˹to the believers˺ in wealth and children, and we will never be punished.”

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Surely ˹it is˺ my Lord ˹Who˺ gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills. But most people do not know.”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Surely ˹it is˺ my Lord ˹Who˺ gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills. But most people do not know.”

verses.text: It is not your wealth or children that bring you closer to Us. But those who believe and do good—it is they who will have a multiplied reward for what they did, and they will be secure in ˹elevated˺ mansions.
verses.translation: It is not your wealth or children that bring you closer to Us. But those who believe and do good—it is they who will have a multiplied reward for what they did, and they will be secure in ˹elevated˺ mansions.

verses.text: As for those who strive to discredit Our revelations, it is they who will be confined in punishment.
verses.translation: As for those who strive to discredit Our revelations, it is they who will be confined in punishment.

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Surely ˹it is˺ my Lord ˹Who˺ gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills of His servants. And whatever you spend in charity, He will compensate ˹you˺ for it. For He is the Best Provider.” The Worshippers and the Worshipped
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Surely ˹it is˺ my Lord ˹Who˺ gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills of His servants. And whatever you spend in charity, He will compensate ˹you˺ for it. For He is the Best Provider.” The Worshippers and the Worshipped

verses.text: And ˹consider˺ the Day He will gather them all together, and then ask the angels, “Was it you that these ˹polytheists˺ used to worship?”
verses.translation: And ˹consider˺ the Day He will gather them all together, and then ask the angels, “Was it you that these ˹polytheists˺ used to worship?”

verses.text: They will say, “Glory be to You! Our loyalty is to You, not them. In fact, they ˹only˺ followed the ˹temptations of evil˺ jinn,[886] in whom most of them had faith.”
verses.translation: They will say, “Glory be to You! Our loyalty is to You, not them. In fact, they ˹only˺ followed the ˹temptations of evil˺ jinn,[886] in whom most of them had faith.”

verses.text: So Today neither of you can benefit or protect each other. And We will say to the wrongdoers, “Taste the torment of the Fire, which you used to deny.” Response of the Polytheists
verses.translation: So Today neither of you can benefit or protect each other. And We will say to the wrongdoers, “Taste the torment of the Fire, which you used to deny.” Response of the Polytheists

verses.text: When Our clear revelations are recited to them, they say, “This is only a man who wishes to hinder you from what your forefathers used to worship.” They also say, “This ˹Quran˺ is no more than a fabricated lie.” And the disbelievers say of the truth when it has come to them, “This is nothing but pure magic.”
verses.translation: When Our clear revelations are recited to them, they say, “This is only a man who wishes to hinder you from what your forefathers used to worship.” They also say, “This ˹Quran˺ is no more than a fabricated lie.” And the disbelievers say of the truth when it has come to them, “This is nothing but pure magic.”

verses.text: ˹They say so even though˺ We had never given them any scriptures to study, nor did We ever send them a warner before you ˹O Prophet˺.
verses.translation: ˹They say so even though˺ We had never given them any scriptures to study, nor did We ever send them a warner before you ˹O Prophet˺.

verses.text: Those ˹destroyed˺ before them denied as well—and these ˹Meccans˺ have not attained even one-tenth of what We had given their predecessors.[887] Yet ˹when˺ they denied My messengers, how severe was My response! Advice to Meccan Pagans
verses.translation: Those ˹destroyed˺ before them denied as well—and these ˹Meccans˺ have not attained even one-tenth of what We had given their predecessors.[887] Yet ˹when˺ they denied My messengers, how severe was My response! Advice to Meccan Pagans

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I advise you to do ˹only˺ one thing: stand up for ˹the sake of˺ Allah—individually or in pairs—then reflect. Your fellow man[888] is not insane. He is only a warner to you before ˹the coming of˺ a severe punishment.”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I advise you to do ˹only˺ one thing: stand up for ˹the sake of˺ Allah—individually or in pairs—then reflect. Your fellow man[888] is not insane. He is only a warner to you before ˹the coming of˺ a severe punishment.”

verses.text: Say, “If I had ever asked you for a reward, you could keep it. My reward is only from Allah. And He is a Witness over all things.”
verses.translation: Say, “If I had ever asked you for a reward, you could keep it. My reward is only from Allah. And He is a Witness over all things.”

verses.text: Say, “Surely my Lord hurls the truth ˹against falsehood˺. ˹He is˺ the Knower of all unseen.”
verses.translation: Say, “Surely my Lord hurls the truth ˹against falsehood˺. ˹He is˺ the Knower of all unseen.”

verses.text: Say, “The truth has come, and falsehood will vanish, never to return.”
verses.translation: Say, “The truth has come, and falsehood will vanish, never to return.”

verses.text: Say, “If I am astray, the loss is only mine. And if I am guided, it is ˹only˺ because of what my Lord reveals to me. He is indeed All-Hearing, Ever Near.” Too Late for the Deniers
verses.translation: Say, “If I am astray, the loss is only mine. And if I am guided, it is ˹only˺ because of what my Lord reveals to me. He is indeed All-Hearing, Ever Near.” Too Late for the Deniers

verses.text: If only you could see when they will be horrified with no escape ˹on Judgment Day˺! And they will be seized from a nearby place.[889]
verses.translation: If only you could see when they will be horrified with no escape ˹on Judgment Day˺! And they will be seized from a nearby place.[889]

verses.text: They will ˹then˺ cry, “We do ˹now˺ believe in it ˹all˺.” But how could they ˹possibly˺ attain faith from a place so far-off ˹from the world˺,[890]
verses.translation: They will ˹then˺ cry, “We do ˹now˺ believe in it ˹all˺.” But how could they ˹possibly˺ attain faith from a place so far-off ˹from the world˺,[890]

verses.text: while they had already rejected it before, guessing blindly from a place ˹equally˺ far-away ˹from the Hereafter˺?
verses.translation: while they had already rejected it before, guessing blindly from a place ˹equally˺ far-away ˹from the Hereafter˺?

verses.text: They will be sealed off from whatever they desire, as was done to their counterparts before. Indeed, they were ˹all˺ in alarming doubt. *** -- 378 of 694 --
verses.translation: They will be sealed off from whatever they desire, as was done to their counterparts before. Indeed, they were ˹all˺ in alarming doubt. *** -- 378 of 694 --

name: The Originator
intro: This Meccan sûrah demonstrates Allah’s infinite power through the marvels of His creation, in contrast with the powerlessness of the pagan idols. The Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is consoled by the fact that many prophets were denied before him. The believers are promised of a great reward in Paradise (verses 31-35), while the disbelievers are warned of a scathing punishment in Hell (verses 36-39). All these themes are echoed in the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Allah’s Power 1) Creation and Mercy

verses.text: All praise is for Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, Who made angels ˹as His˺ messengers with wings—two, three, or four. He increases in creation whatever He wills. Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything.
verses.translation: All praise is for Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, Who made angels ˹as His˺ messengers with wings—two, three, or four. He increases in creation whatever He wills. Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything.

verses.text: Whatever mercy Allah opens up for people, none can withhold it. And whatever He withholds, none but Him can release it. For He is the Almighty, All-Wise. One God Only
verses.translation: Whatever mercy Allah opens up for people, none can withhold it. And whatever He withholds, none but Him can release it. For He is the Almighty, All-Wise. One God Only

verses.text: O humanity! Remember Allah’s favours upon you. Is there any creator other than Allah who provides for you from the heavens and the earth? There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. How can you then be deluded ˹from the truth˺? Reassuring the Prophet
verses.translation: O humanity! Remember Allah’s favours upon you. Is there any creator other than Allah who provides for you from the heavens and the earth? There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. How can you then be deluded ˹from the truth˺? Reassuring the Prophet

verses.text: If you are rejected by them, so too were messengers before you. And to Allah ˹all˺ matters will be returned ˹for judgment˺. Warning Against Satan
verses.translation: If you are rejected by them, so too were messengers before you. And to Allah ˹all˺ matters will be returned ˹for judgment˺. Warning Against Satan

verses.text: O humanity! Indeed, Allah’s promise is true. So do not let the life of this world deceive you, nor let the Chief Deceiver[891] deceive you about Allah.
verses.translation: O humanity! Indeed, Allah’s promise is true. So do not let the life of this world deceive you, nor let the Chief Deceiver[891] deceive you about Allah.

verses.text: Surely Satan is an enemy to you, so take him as an enemy. He only invites his followers to become inmates of the Blaze. The Evildoers and the Good-Doers
verses.translation: Surely Satan is an enemy to you, so take him as an enemy. He only invites his followers to become inmates of the Blaze. The Evildoers and the Good-Doers

verses.text: Those who disbelieve will have a severe punishment. But those who believe and do good will have forgiveness and a great reward.
verses.translation: Those who disbelieve will have a severe punishment. But those who believe and do good will have forgiveness and a great reward.

verses.text: Are those whose evil-doing is made so appealing to them that they deem it good ˹like those who are rightly guided˺? ˹It is˺ certainly Allah ˹Who˺ leaves to stray whoever He wills, and guides whoever He wills. So do not grieve yourself to death over them ˹O Prophet˺. Surely Allah is All-Knowing of what they do. Allah’s Power 2) The Wind
verses.translation: Are those whose evil-doing is made so appealing to them that they deem it good ˹like those who are rightly guided˺? ˹It is˺ certainly Allah ˹Who˺ leaves to stray whoever He wills, and guides whoever He wills. So do not grieve yourself to death over them ˹O Prophet˺. Surely Allah is All-Knowing of what they do. Allah’s Power 2) The Wind

verses.text: And it is Allah Who sends the winds, which then stir up ˹vapour, forming˺ clouds, and then We drive them to a lifeless land, giving life to the earth after its death. Similar is the Resurrection. All Honour and Power Belongs to Allah
verses.translation: And it is Allah Who sends the winds, which then stir up ˹vapour, forming˺ clouds, and then We drive them to a lifeless land, giving life to the earth after its death. Similar is the Resurrection. All Honour and Power Belongs to Allah

verses.text: Whoever seeks honour and power, then ˹let them know that˺ all honour and power belongs to Allah. To Him ˹alone˺ good words ascend, and righteous deeds are raised up by Him. As for those who plot evil, they will suffer a severe punishment. And the plotting of such ˹people˺ is doomed ˹to fail˺. Allah’s Power 3) Creation of Humans
verses.translation: Whoever seeks honour and power, then ˹let them know that˺ all honour and power belongs to Allah. To Him ˹alone˺ good words ascend, and righteous deeds are raised up by Him. As for those who plot evil, they will suffer a severe punishment. And the plotting of such ˹people˺ is doomed ˹to fail˺. Allah’s Power 3) Creation of Humans

verses.text: And ˹it is˺ Allah ˹Who˺ created you from dust,[892] then ˹developed you˺ from a sperm-drop, then made you into pairs.[893] No female ever conceives or delivers without His knowledge. And no one’s life is made long or cut short but is ˹written˺ in a Record.[894] That is certainly easy for Allah. Allah’s Power 4) Fresh and Salt Water
verses.translation: And ˹it is˺ Allah ˹Who˺ created you from dust,[892] then ˹developed you˺ from a sperm-drop, then made you into pairs.[893] No female ever conceives or delivers without His knowledge. And no one’s life is made long or cut short but is ˹written˺ in a Record.[894] That is certainly easy for Allah. Allah’s Power 4) Fresh and Salt Water

verses.text: The two bodies of water are not alike: one is fresh, palatable, and pleasant to drink and the other is salty and bitter. Yet from them both you eat tender seafood and extract ornaments to wear. And you see the ships ploughing their way through both, so you may seek His bounty and give thanks ˹to Him˺. Allah’s Power 5) Alternation of Day and Night
verses.translation: The two bodies of water are not alike: one is fresh, palatable, and pleasant to drink and the other is salty and bitter. Yet from them both you eat tender seafood and extract ornaments to wear. And you see the ships ploughing their way through both, so you may seek His bounty and give thanks ˹to Him˺. Allah’s Power 5) Alternation of Day and Night

verses.text: He merges the night into the day and the day into the night, and has subjected the sun and the moon, each orbiting for an appointed term. That is Allah—your Lord! All authority belongs to Him. But those ˹idols˺ you ˹pagans˺ invoke besides Him do not possess even the skin of a date stone.
verses.translation: He merges the night into the day and the day into the night, and has subjected the sun and the moon, each orbiting for an appointed term. That is Allah—your Lord! All authority belongs to Him. But those ˹idols˺ you ˹pagans˺ invoke besides Him do not possess even the skin of a date stone.

verses.text: If you call upon them, they cannot hear your calls. And if they were to hear, they could not respond to you. On the Day of Judgment they will disown your worship ˹of them˺. And no one can inform you ˹O Prophet˺ like the All-Knowledgeable. Allah’s Power 6) Sustenance
verses.translation: If you call upon them, they cannot hear your calls. And if they were to hear, they could not respond to you. On the Day of Judgment they will disown your worship ˹of them˺. And no one can inform you ˹O Prophet˺ like the All-Knowledgeable. Allah’s Power 6) Sustenance

verses.text: O humanity! It is you who stand in need of Allah, but Allah ˹alone˺ is the Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy.
verses.translation: O humanity! It is you who stand in need of Allah, but Allah ˹alone˺ is the Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy.

verses.text: If He willed, He could eliminate you and produce a new creation.
verses.translation: If He willed, He could eliminate you and produce a new creation.

verses.text: And that is not difficult for Allah ˹at all˺. Everyone Is Accountable for Themselves
verses.translation: And that is not difficult for Allah ˹at all˺. Everyone Is Accountable for Themselves

verses.text: No soul burdened with sin will bear the burden of another. And if a sin- burdened soul cries for help with its burden, none of it will be carried— even by a close relative. You ˹O Prophet˺ can only warn those who stand in awe of their Lord without seeing Him[895] and establish prayer. Whoever purifies themselves, they only do so for their own good. And to Allah is the final return. Guidance vs. Misguidance
verses.translation: No soul burdened with sin will bear the burden of another. And if a sin- burdened soul cries for help with its burden, none of it will be carried— even by a close relative. You ˹O Prophet˺ can only warn those who stand in awe of their Lord without seeing Him[895] and establish prayer. Whoever purifies themselves, they only do so for their own good. And to Allah is the final return. Guidance vs. Misguidance

verses.text: Those blind ˹to the truth˺ and those who can see are not equal,
verses.translation: Those blind ˹to the truth˺ and those who can see are not equal,

verses.text: nor are the darkness and the light,
verses.translation: nor are the darkness and the light,

verses.text: nor the ˹scorching˺ heat and the ˹cool˺ shade.[896]
verses.translation: nor the ˹scorching˺ heat and the ˹cool˺ shade.[896]

verses.text: Nor are the dead and the living equal. Indeed, Allah ˹alone˺ makes whoever He wills hear, but you ˹O Prophet˺ can never make those in the graves hear ˹your call˺. Reassuring the Prophet
verses.translation: Nor are the dead and the living equal. Indeed, Allah ˹alone˺ makes whoever He wills hear, but you ˹O Prophet˺ can never make those in the graves hear ˹your call˺. Reassuring the Prophet

verses.text: You are only a warner.
verses.translation: You are only a warner.

verses.text: We have surely sent you with the truth as a deliverer of good news and a warner. There is no community that has not had a warner.[897]
verses.translation: We have surely sent you with the truth as a deliverer of good news and a warner. There is no community that has not had a warner.[897]

verses.text: If they deny you, so did those before them. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs, divine Books, and enlightening Scriptures.[898]
verses.translation: If they deny you, so did those before them. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs, divine Books, and enlightening Scriptures.[898]

verses.text: Then I seized those who persisted in disbelief. How severe was My response! Allah’s Power 7) Diversity
verses.translation: Then I seized those who persisted in disbelief. How severe was My response! Allah’s Power 7) Diversity

verses.text: Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky with which We bring forth fruits of different colours? And in the mountains are streaks of varying shades of white, red, and raven black;
verses.translation: Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky with which We bring forth fruits of different colours? And in the mountains are streaks of varying shades of white, red, and raven black;

verses.text: just as people, living beings, and cattle are of various colours as well. Of all of Allah’s servants, only the knowledgeable ˹of His might˺ are ˹truly˺ in awe of Him. Allah is indeed Almighty, All-Forgiving. The Everlasting Reward
verses.translation: just as people, living beings, and cattle are of various colours as well. Of all of Allah’s servants, only the knowledgeable ˹of His might˺ are ˹truly˺ in awe of Him. Allah is indeed Almighty, All-Forgiving. The Everlasting Reward

verses.text: Surely those who recite the Book of Allah, establish prayer, and donate from what We have provided for them—secretly and openly—˹can˺ hope for an exchange that will never fail,
verses.translation: Surely those who recite the Book of Allah, establish prayer, and donate from what We have provided for them—secretly and openly—˹can˺ hope for an exchange that will never fail,

verses.text: so that He will reward them in full and increase them out of His grace. He is truly All-Forgiving, Most Appreciative. Three Types of Believers
verses.translation: so that He will reward them in full and increase them out of His grace. He is truly All-Forgiving, Most Appreciative. Three Types of Believers

verses.text: The Book We have revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺ is the truth, confirming what came before it.[899] Surely Allah is All-Aware, All-Seeing of His servants.
verses.translation: The Book We have revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺ is the truth, confirming what came before it.[899] Surely Allah is All-Aware, All-Seeing of His servants.

verses.text: Then We granted the Book to those We have chosen from Our servants. Some of them wrong themselves, some follow a middle course, and some are foremost in good deeds by Allah’s Will. That is ˹truly˺ the greatest bounty. Reward of the Believers
verses.translation: Then We granted the Book to those We have chosen from Our servants. Some of them wrong themselves, some follow a middle course, and some are foremost in good deeds by Allah’s Will. That is ˹truly˺ the greatest bounty. Reward of the Believers

verses.text: They will enter the Gardens of Eternity, where they will be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their clothing will be silk.
verses.translation: They will enter the Gardens of Eternity, where they will be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their clothing will be silk.

verses.text: And they will say, “Praise be to Allah, Who has kept away from us all ˹causes of˺ sorrow. Our Lord is indeed All-Forgiving, Most Appreciative.
verses.translation: And they will say, “Praise be to Allah, Who has kept away from us all ˹causes of˺ sorrow. Our Lord is indeed All-Forgiving, Most Appreciative.

verses.text: ˹He is the One˺ Who—out of His grace—has settled us in the Home of Everlasting Stay, where we will be touched by neither fatigue nor weariness.” Punishment of the Disbelievers
verses.translation: ˹He is the One˺ Who—out of His grace—has settled us in the Home of Everlasting Stay, where we will be touched by neither fatigue nor weariness.” Punishment of the Disbelievers

verses.text: As for the disbelievers, they will have the Fire of Hell, where they will not be ˹allowed to be˺ finished by death, nor will its torment be lightened for them. This is how We reward every ˹stubborn˺ disbeliever.
verses.translation: As for the disbelievers, they will have the Fire of Hell, where they will not be ˹allowed to be˺ finished by death, nor will its torment be lightened for them. This is how We reward every ˹stubborn˺ disbeliever.

verses.text: There they will be ˹fervently˺ screaming, “Our Lord! Take us out ˹and send us back˺. We will do good, unlike what we used to do.” ˹They will be told,˺ “Did We not give you lives long enough so that whoever wanted to be mindful could have done so? And the warner came to you. So taste ˹the punishment˺, for the wrongdoers have no helper.” Denying the Almighty
verses.translation: There they will be ˹fervently˺ screaming, “Our Lord! Take us out ˹and send us back˺. We will do good, unlike what we used to do.” ˹They will be told,˺ “Did We not give you lives long enough so that whoever wanted to be mindful could have done so? And the warner came to you. So taste ˹the punishment˺, for the wrongdoers have no helper.” Denying the Almighty

verses.text: Indeed, Allah is the Knower of the unseen of the heavens and the earth. He surely knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart.
verses.translation: Indeed, Allah is the Knower of the unseen of the heavens and the earth. He surely knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart.

verses.text: He is the One Who has placed you as successors on earth. So whoever disbelieves will bear ˹the burden of˺ their own disbelief. The disbelievers’ denial only increases them in contempt in the sight of their Lord, and it will only contribute to their loss. Useless Idols
verses.translation: He is the One Who has placed you as successors on earth. So whoever disbelieves will bear ˹the burden of˺ their own disbelief. The disbelievers’ denial only increases them in contempt in the sight of their Lord, and it will only contribute to their loss. Useless Idols

verses.text: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Have you considered your associate-gods which you invoke besides Allah? Show me what they have created on earth! Or do they have a share in ˹the creation of˺ the heavens? Or have We given the polytheists a Book, which serves as a clear proof for them? In fact, the wrongdoers promise each other nothing but delusion.” Allah’s Power 8) Maintaining the Universe
verses.translation: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Have you considered your associate-gods which you invoke besides Allah? Show me what they have created on earth! Or do they have a share in ˹the creation of˺ the heavens? Or have We given the polytheists a Book, which serves as a clear proof for them? In fact, the wrongdoers promise each other nothing but delusion.” Allah’s Power 8) Maintaining the Universe

verses.text: Indeed, Allah ˹alone˺ keeps the heavens and the earth from falling apart. If they were to fall apart, none but Him could hold them up. He is truly Most Forbearing, All-Forgiving. Warning to the Disbelievers
verses.translation: Indeed, Allah ˹alone˺ keeps the heavens and the earth from falling apart. If they were to fall apart, none but Him could hold them up. He is truly Most Forbearing, All-Forgiving. Warning to the Disbelievers

verses.text: They swore by Allah their most solemn oaths that if a warner were to come to them, they would certainly be better guided than any other community. Yet when a warner did come to them, it only drove them farther away—
verses.translation: They swore by Allah their most solemn oaths that if a warner were to come to them, they would certainly be better guided than any other community. Yet when a warner did come to them, it only drove them farther away—

verses.text: behaving arrogantly in the land and plotting evil. But evil plotting only backfires on those who plot. Are they awaiting anything but the fate of those ˹destroyed˺ before? You will find no change in the way of Allah, nor will you find it diverted ˹to someone else˺.
verses.translation: behaving arrogantly in the land and plotting evil. But evil plotting only backfires on those who plot. Are they awaiting anything but the fate of those ˹destroyed˺ before? You will find no change in the way of Allah, nor will you find it diverted ˹to someone else˺.

verses.text: Have they not travelled throughout the land to see what was the end of those ˹destroyed˺ before them? They were far superior in might. But there is nothing that can escape Allah in the heavens or the earth. He is certainly All-Knowing, Most Capable. Allowing Time for Repentance
verses.translation: Have they not travelled throughout the land to see what was the end of those ˹destroyed˺ before them? They were far superior in might. But there is nothing that can escape Allah in the heavens or the earth. He is certainly All-Knowing, Most Capable. Allowing Time for Repentance

verses.text: If Allah were to punish people ˹immediately˺ for what they have committed, He would not have left a single living being on earth. But He delays them for an appointed term. And when their time arrives, then surely Allah is All-Seeing of His servants. *** -- 383 of 694 --
verses.translation: If Allah were to punish people ˹immediately˺ for what they have committed, He would not have left a single living being on earth. But He delays them for an appointed term. And when their time arrives, then surely Allah is All-Seeing of His servants. *** -- 383 of 694 --

name: Yâ-Sĩn
intro: This Meccan sûrah emphasizes the divine nature and purpose of the Quran. The Arab pagans are reminded of the fate of earlier disbelievers and condemned for following Satan, denying the Resurrection, discrediting the Quran, and rejecting the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) as ‘a poet.’ Similar to the next sûrah, some examples of Allah’s wonders of creation are cited to prove His ability to bring the dead back to life. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Wake-up Call

verses.text: Yâ-Sĩn.
verses.translation: Yâ-Sĩn.

verses.text: By the Quran, rich in wisdom!
verses.translation: By the Quran, rich in wisdom!

verses.text: You ˹O Prophet˺ are truly one of the messengers
verses.translation: You ˹O Prophet˺ are truly one of the messengers

verses.text: upon the Straight Path.
verses.translation: upon the Straight Path.

verses.text: ˹This is˺ a revelation from the Almighty, Most Merciful,
verses.translation: ˹This is˺ a revelation from the Almighty, Most Merciful,

verses.text: so that you may warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, and so are heedless.
verses.translation: so that you may warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, and so are heedless.

verses.text: The decree ˹of torment˺ has already been justified against most of them, for they will never believe.
verses.translation: The decree ˹of torment˺ has already been justified against most of them, for they will never believe.

verses.text: ˹It is as if˺ We have put shackles around their necks up to their chins, so their heads are forced up,
verses.translation: ˹It is as if˺ We have put shackles around their necks up to their chins, so their heads are forced up,

verses.text: and have placed a barrier before them and a barrier behind them and covered them ˹all˺ up, so they fail to see ˹the truth˺. Who Benefits from Reminders
verses.translation: and have placed a barrier before them and a barrier behind them and covered them ˹all˺ up, so they fail to see ˹the truth˺. Who Benefits from Reminders

verses.text: It is the same whether you warn them or not—they will never believe.
verses.translation: It is the same whether you warn them or not—they will never believe.

verses.text: You can only warn those who follow the Reminder[900] and are in awe of the Most Compassionate without seeing Him.[901] So give them good news of forgiveness and an honourable reward.
verses.translation: You can only warn those who follow the Reminder[900] and are in awe of the Most Compassionate without seeing Him.[901] So give them good news of forgiveness and an honourable reward.

verses.text: It is certainly We Who resurrect the dead, and write what they send forth and what they leave behind. Everything is listed by Us in a perfect Record.[902] The Three Messengers
verses.translation: It is certainly We Who resurrect the dead, and write what they send forth and what they leave behind. Everything is listed by Us in a perfect Record.[902] The Three Messengers

verses.text: Give them an example ˹O Prophet˺ of the residents of a town, when the messengers came to them.
verses.translation: Give them an example ˹O Prophet˺ of the residents of a town, when the messengers came to them.

verses.text: We sent them two messengers, but they rejected both. So We reinforced ˹the two˺ with a third, and they declared, “We have indeed been sent to you ˹as messengers˺.”
verses.translation: We sent them two messengers, but they rejected both. So We reinforced ˹the two˺ with a third, and they declared, “We have indeed been sent to you ˹as messengers˺.”

verses.text: The people replied, “You are only humans like us, and the Most Compassionate has not revealed anything. You are simply lying!”
verses.translation: The people replied, “You are only humans like us, and the Most Compassionate has not revealed anything. You are simply lying!”

verses.text: The messengers responded, “Our Lord knows that we have truly been sent to you.
verses.translation: The messengers responded, “Our Lord knows that we have truly been sent to you.

verses.text: And our duty is only to deliver ˹the message˺ clearly.”
verses.translation: And our duty is only to deliver ˹the message˺ clearly.”

verses.text: The people replied, “We definitely see you as a bad omen for us. If you do not desist, we will certainly stone you ˹to death˺ and you will be touched with a painful punishment from us.”
verses.translation: The people replied, “We definitely see you as a bad omen for us. If you do not desist, we will certainly stone you ˹to death˺ and you will be touched with a painful punishment from us.”

verses.text: The messengers said, “Your bad omen lies within yourselves. Are you saying this because you are reminded ˹of the truth˺? In fact, you are a transgressing people.” An Advocate of the Truth
verses.translation: The messengers said, “Your bad omen lies within yourselves. Are you saying this because you are reminded ˹of the truth˺? In fact, you are a transgressing people.” An Advocate of the Truth

verses.text: Then from the farthest end of the city a man came, rushing. He advised, “O my people! Follow the messengers.
verses.translation: Then from the farthest end of the city a man came, rushing. He advised, “O my people! Follow the messengers.

verses.text: Follow those who ask no reward of you, and are ˹rightly˺ guided.
verses.translation: Follow those who ask no reward of you, and are ˹rightly˺ guided.

verses.text: And why should I not worship the One Who has originated me, and to Whom you will be returned.
verses.translation: And why should I not worship the One Who has originated me, and to Whom you will be returned.

verses.text: How could I take besides Him other gods whose intercession would not be of any benefit to me, nor could they save me if the Most Compassionate intended to harm me?
verses.translation: How could I take besides Him other gods whose intercession would not be of any benefit to me, nor could they save me if the Most Compassionate intended to harm me?

verses.text: Indeed, I would then be clearly astray.
verses.translation: Indeed, I would then be clearly astray.

verses.text: I do believe in your Lord, so listen to me.”
verses.translation: I do believe in your Lord, so listen to me.”

verses.text: ˹But they killed him, then˺ he was told ˹by the angels˺, “Enter Paradise!” He said, “If only my people knew
verses.translation: ˹But they killed him, then˺ he was told ˹by the angels˺, “Enter Paradise!” He said, “If only my people knew

verses.text: of how my Lord has forgiven me, and made me one of the honourable.” The Wicked Destroyed
verses.translation: of how my Lord has forgiven me, and made me one of the honourable.” The Wicked Destroyed

verses.text: We did not send any soldiers from the heavens against his people after his death, nor did We need to.
verses.translation: We did not send any soldiers from the heavens against his people after his death, nor did We need to.

verses.text: All it took was one ˹mighty˺ blast, and they were extinguished at once.
verses.translation: All it took was one ˹mighty˺ blast, and they were extinguished at once.

verses.text: Oh pity, such beings! No messenger ever came to them without being mocked.
verses.translation: Oh pity, such beings! No messenger ever came to them without being mocked.

verses.text: Have the deniers not considered how many peoples We destroyed before them who never came back to life again?
verses.translation: Have the deniers not considered how many peoples We destroyed before them who never came back to life again?

verses.text: Yet they will all be brought before Us. Allah’s Signs 1) the Earth
verses.translation: Yet they will all be brought before Us. Allah’s Signs 1) the Earth

verses.text: There is a sign for them in the dead earth: We give it life, producing grain from it for them to eat.
verses.translation: There is a sign for them in the dead earth: We give it life, producing grain from it for them to eat.

verses.text: And We have placed in it gardens of palm trees and grapevines, and caused springs to gush forth in it,
verses.translation: And We have placed in it gardens of palm trees and grapevines, and caused springs to gush forth in it,

verses.text: so that they may eat from its fruit, which they had no hand in making. Will they not then give thanks?
verses.translation: so that they may eat from its fruit, which they had no hand in making. Will they not then give thanks?

verses.text: Glory be to the One Who created all ˹things in˺ pairs —˹be it˺ what the earth produces, their genders, or what they do not know! Allah’s Signs 2) Night
verses.translation: Glory be to the One Who created all ˹things in˺ pairs —˹be it˺ what the earth produces, their genders, or what they do not know! Allah’s Signs 2) Night

verses.text: There is also a sign for them in the night: We strip from it daylight, then —behold!—they are in darkness. Allah’s Signs 3) the Sun and the Moon
verses.translation: There is also a sign for them in the night: We strip from it daylight, then —behold!—they are in darkness. Allah’s Signs 3) the Sun and the Moon

verses.text: The sun travels for its fixed term. That is the design of the Almighty, All-Knowing.
verses.translation: The sun travels for its fixed term. That is the design of the Almighty, All-Knowing.

verses.text: As for the moon, We have ordained ˹precise˺ phases for it, until it ends up like an old, curved palm stalk.
verses.translation: As for the moon, We have ordained ˹precise˺ phases for it, until it ends up like an old, curved palm stalk.

verses.text: It is not for the sun to catch up with the moon,[903] nor does the night outrun the day. Each is travelling in an orbit of their own. Allah’s Signs 4) Mercy at Sea
verses.translation: It is not for the sun to catch up with the moon,[903] nor does the night outrun the day. Each is travelling in an orbit of their own. Allah’s Signs 4) Mercy at Sea

verses.text: Another sign for them is that We carried their ancestors ˹with Noah˺ in the fully loaded Ark,
verses.translation: Another sign for them is that We carried their ancestors ˹with Noah˺ in the fully loaded Ark,

verses.text: and created for them similar things to ride in.
verses.translation: and created for them similar things to ride in.

verses.text: If We willed, We could drown them: then no one would respond to their cries, nor would they be rescued—
verses.translation: If We willed, We could drown them: then no one would respond to their cries, nor would they be rescued—

verses.text: except by mercy from Us, allowing them enjoyment for a ˹little˺ while. Stance of the Polytheists
verses.translation: except by mercy from Us, allowing them enjoyment for a ˹little˺ while. Stance of the Polytheists

verses.text: ˹Still they turn away˺ when it is said to them, “Beware of what is ahead of you ˹in the Hereafter˺ and what is behind you ˹of destroyed nations˺ so you may be shown mercy.”
verses.translation: ˹Still they turn away˺ when it is said to them, “Beware of what is ahead of you ˹in the Hereafter˺ and what is behind you ˹of destroyed nations˺ so you may be shown mercy.”

verses.text: Whenever a sign comes to them from their Lord, they turn away from it.
verses.translation: Whenever a sign comes to them from their Lord, they turn away from it.

verses.text: And when it is said to them, “Donate from what Allah has provided for you,” the disbelievers say to the believers, “Why should we feed those whom Allah could have fed if He wanted to? You are clearly astray!” Too Late for the Deniers
verses.translation: And when it is said to them, “Donate from what Allah has provided for you,” the disbelievers say to the believers, “Why should we feed those whom Allah could have fed if He wanted to? You are clearly astray!” Too Late for the Deniers

verses.text: And they ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass, if what you say is true?”
verses.translation: And they ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass, if what you say is true?”

verses.text: They must be awaiting a single Blast,[904] which will seize them while they are ˹entrenched˺ in ˹worldly˺ disputes.
verses.translation: They must be awaiting a single Blast,[904] which will seize them while they are ˹entrenched˺ in ˹worldly˺ disputes.

verses.text: Then they will not be able to make a ˹last˺ will, nor can they return to their own people.
verses.translation: Then they will not be able to make a ˹last˺ will, nor can they return to their own people.

verses.text: The Trumpet will be blown ˹a second time˺, then—behold!— they will rush from the graves to their Lord.
verses.translation: The Trumpet will be blown ˹a second time˺, then—behold!— they will rush from the graves to their Lord.

verses.text: They will cry, “Woe to us! Who has raised us up from our place of rest? This must be what the Most Compassionate warned us of; the messengers told the truth!”
verses.translation: They will cry, “Woe to us! Who has raised us up from our place of rest? This must be what the Most Compassionate warned us of; the messengers told the truth!”

verses.text: It will only take one Blast, then at once they will all be brought before Us.
verses.translation: It will only take one Blast, then at once they will all be brought before Us.

verses.text: On that Day no soul will be wronged in the least, nor will you be rewarded except for what you used to do. Reward of the Believers
verses.translation: On that Day no soul will be wronged in the least, nor will you be rewarded except for what you used to do. Reward of the Believers

verses.text: Indeed, on that Day the residents of Paradise will be busy enjoying themselves.
verses.translation: Indeed, on that Day the residents of Paradise will be busy enjoying themselves.

verses.text: They and their spouses will be in ˹cool˺ shade, reclining on ˹canopied˺ couches.
verses.translation: They and their spouses will be in ˹cool˺ shade, reclining on ˹canopied˺ couches.

verses.text: There they will have fruits and whatever they desire.
verses.translation: There they will have fruits and whatever they desire.

verses.text: And “Peace!” will be ˹their˺ greeting from the Merciful Lord. Reward of the Disbelievers
verses.translation: And “Peace!” will be ˹their˺ greeting from the Merciful Lord. Reward of the Disbelievers

verses.text: ˹Then the disbelievers will be told,˺ “Step away ˹from the believers˺ this Day, O wicked ones!
verses.translation: ˹Then the disbelievers will be told,˺ “Step away ˹from the believers˺ this Day, O wicked ones!

verses.text: Did I not command you, O Children of Adam, not to follow Satan, for he is truly your sworn enemy,
verses.translation: Did I not command you, O Children of Adam, not to follow Satan, for he is truly your sworn enemy,

verses.text: but to worship Me ˹alone˺? This is the Straight Path.
verses.translation: but to worship Me ˹alone˺? This is the Straight Path.

verses.text: Yet he already misled great multitudes of you. Did you not have any sense?
verses.translation: Yet he already misled great multitudes of you. Did you not have any sense?

verses.text: This is the Hell you were warned of.
verses.translation: This is the Hell you were warned of.

verses.text: Burn in it Today for your disbelief.”
verses.translation: Burn in it Today for your disbelief.”

verses.text: On this Day We will seal their mouths, their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify to what they used to commit. Allah’s Power over the Deniers
verses.translation: On this Day We will seal their mouths, their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify to what they used to commit. Allah’s Power over the Deniers

verses.text: Had We willed, We could have easily blinded their eyes, so they would struggle to find their way. How then could they see?
verses.translation: Had We willed, We could have easily blinded their eyes, so they would struggle to find their way. How then could they see?

verses.text: And had We willed, We could have transfigured them on the spot,[905] so they could neither progress forward nor turn back.
verses.translation: And had We willed, We could have transfigured them on the spot,[905] so they could neither progress forward nor turn back.

name: Those ˹Angels˺ Lined up in Ranks
intro: For the most part, this Meccan sûrah explains verse 31 from the previous sûrah: “Have the deniers not considered how many peoples We destroyed before them …?”. Hence, several examples of destroyed disbelievers are cited here, including the peoples of Noah, Lot, and Elias. Some basic truths are emphasized, including the oneness of Allah, the Resurrection, and the prophethood of Mu ḥammad ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص). The pagans are criticized for calling the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) ‘a mad poet’ and for claiming that the angels are Allah’s daughters. This sûrah provides more details on the punishment of the disbelievers and the reward of the believers in the Hereafter (verses 19- 68). In conclusion, the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is reassured that Allah’s messengers always prevail. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful One God Only

verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when he fled to the overloaded ship.

verses.text: Then ˹to save it from sinking,˺ he drew straws ˹with other passengers˺. He lost ˹and was thrown overboard˺.
verses.translation: Then ˹to save it from sinking,˺ he drew straws ˹with other passengers˺. He lost ˹and was thrown overboard˺.

verses.text: Then the whale engulfed him while he was blameworthy.[927]
verses.translation: Then the whale engulfed him while he was blameworthy.[927]

verses.text: Had he not ˹constantly˺ glorified ˹Allah˺,[928]
verses.translation: Had he not ˹constantly˺ glorified ˹Allah˺,[928]
