verses.translation: he would have certainly remained in its belly until the Day of Resurrection.[929]

verses.text: But We cast him onto the open ˹shore˺, ˹totally˺ worn out,
verses.translation: But We cast him onto the open ˹shore˺, ˹totally˺ worn out,

verses.text: and caused a squash plant to grow over him.[930]
verses.translation: and caused a squash plant to grow over him.[930]

verses.text: We ˹later˺ sent him ˹back˺ to ˹his city of˺ at least one hundred thousand people,
verses.translation: We ˹later˺ sent him ˹back˺ to ˹his city of˺ at least one hundred thousand people,

verses.text: who then believed ˹in him˺, so We allowed them enjoyment for a while. Questions to Arab Pagans
verses.translation: who then believed ˹in him˺, so We allowed them enjoyment for a while. Questions to Arab Pagans

verses.text: Ask them ˹O Prophet˺ if your Lord has daughters,[931] while the pagans ˹prefer to˺ have sons.
verses.translation: Ask them ˹O Prophet˺ if your Lord has daughters,[931] while the pagans ˹prefer to˺ have sons.

verses.text: Or ˹ask them˺ if We created the angels as females right before their eyes.
verses.translation: Or ˹ask them˺ if We created the angels as females right before their eyes.

verses.text: Indeed, it is one of their ˹outrageous˺ fabrications to say,
verses.translation: Indeed, it is one of their ˹outrageous˺ fabrications to say,

verses.text: “Allah has children.” They are simply liars.
verses.translation: “Allah has children.” They are simply liars.

verses.text: Has He chosen daughters over sons?[932]
verses.translation: Has He chosen daughters over sons?[932]

verses.text: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?
verses.translation: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?

verses.text: Will you not then be mindful?
verses.translation: Will you not then be mindful?

verses.text: Or do you have ˹any˺ compelling proof?
verses.translation: Or do you have ˹any˺ compelling proof?

verses.text: Then bring ˹us˺ your scripture, if what you say is true!
verses.translation: Then bring ˹us˺ your scripture, if what you say is true!

verses.text: They have also established a ˹marital˺ relationship between Him and the jinn. Yet the jinn ˹themselves˺ know well that such people will certainly be brought ˹for punishment˺.[933]
verses.translation: They have also established a ˹marital˺ relationship between Him and the jinn. Yet the jinn ˹themselves˺ know well that such people will certainly be brought ˹for punishment˺.[933]

verses.text: Glorified is Allah far above what they claim!
verses.translation: Glorified is Allah far above what they claim!

verses.text: But not the chosen servants of Allah.
verses.translation: But not the chosen servants of Allah.

verses.text: Surely you ˹pagans˺ and whatever ˹idols˺ you worship
verses.translation: Surely you ˹pagans˺ and whatever ˹idols˺ you worship

verses.text: can never lure ˹anyone˺ away from Him
verses.translation: can never lure ˹anyone˺ away from Him

verses.text: except those ˹destined˺ to burn in Hell. Angels’ Response
verses.translation: except those ˹destined˺ to burn in Hell. Angels’ Response

verses.text: ˹The angels respond,˺ “There is not one of us without an assigned station ˹of worship˺.
verses.translation: ˹The angels respond,˺ “There is not one of us without an assigned station ˹of worship˺.

verses.text: We are indeed the ones lined up in ranks ˹for Allah˺.
verses.translation: We are indeed the ones lined up in ranks ˹for Allah˺.

verses.text: And we are indeed the ones ˹constantly˺ glorifying ˹His praise˺.” The Pagans Before the Quran
verses.translation: And we are indeed the ones ˹constantly˺ glorifying ˹His praise˺.” The Pagans Before the Quran

verses.text: They certainly used to say,
verses.translation: They certainly used to say,

verses.text: “If only we had a Reminder like ˹those of˺ earlier peoples,[934]
verses.translation: “If only we had a Reminder like ˹those of˺ earlier peoples,[934]

verses.text: we would have truly been Allah’s devoted servants.”
verses.translation: we would have truly been Allah’s devoted servants.”

verses.text: But ˹now˺ they reject it, so they will soon know. Reassuring the Prophet
verses.translation: But ˹now˺ they reject it, so they will soon know. Reassuring the Prophet

verses.text: Our Word has already gone forth to Our servants, the messengers,
verses.translation: Our Word has already gone forth to Our servants, the messengers,

verses.text: that they would surely be helped,
verses.translation: that they would surely be helped,

verses.text: and that Our forces will certainly prevail.
verses.translation: and that Our forces will certainly prevail.

verses.text: So turn away from the deniers for a while ˹O Prophet˺.
verses.translation: So turn away from the deniers for a while ˹O Prophet˺.

verses.text: You will see ˹what will happen to˺ them, and they too will see!
verses.translation: You will see ˹what will happen to˺ them, and they too will see!

verses.text: Do they ˹really˺ wish to hasten Our punishment?
verses.translation: Do they ˹really˺ wish to hasten Our punishment?

verses.text: Yet when it descends upon them:[935] how evil will that morning be for those who had been warned!
verses.translation: Yet when it descends upon them:[935] how evil will that morning be for those who had been warned!

verses.text: And turn away from them for a while.
verses.translation: And turn away from them for a while.

verses.text: You will see, and they too will see! The Conclusion
verses.translation: You will see, and they too will see! The Conclusion

verses.text: Glorified is your Lord—the Lord of Honour and Power—above what they claim!
verses.translation: Glorified is your Lord—the Lord of Honour and Power—above what they claim!

verses.text: Peace be upon the messengers.
verses.translation: Peace be upon the messengers.

verses.text: And praise be to Allah —Lord of all worlds. *** -- 395 of 694 --
verses.translation: And praise be to Allah —Lord of all worlds. *** -- 395 of 694 --

name: Ṣãd
intro: This sûrah is perceived as a continuation of the previous sûrah since it mentions some prophets that are not mentioned there—such as David, Solomon, and Job. Again, the pagans are condemned for denying the oneness of Allah, rejecting the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) as ‘a magician, a total liar,’ and for claiming that the world was created without purpose. Reference is made to the creation of Adam ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) and the enmity Satan has for him and his descendants (verses 71-85), and the punishment awaiting the misleaders and their followers (verses 55-64), contrasted with the bliss in store for the righteous (verses 49-54). The end of this sûrah emphasizes the universality of the Quran whereas the beginning of the next speaks of its divine nature. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Arab Deniers

verses.text: Ṣãd. By the Quran, full of reminders!
verses.translation: Ṣãd. By the Quran, full of reminders!

verses.text: ˹This is the truth,˺ yet the disbelievers are ˹entrenched˺ in arrogance and opposition.
verses.translation: ˹This is the truth,˺ yet the disbelievers are ˹entrenched˺ in arrogance and opposition.

verses.text: ˹Imagine˺ how many peoples We destroyed before them, and they cried out when it was too late to escape.
verses.translation: ˹Imagine˺ how many peoples We destroyed before them, and they cried out when it was too late to escape.

verses.text: Now, the pagans are astonished that a warner has come to them from among themselves.[936] And the disbelievers say, “This is a magician, a total liar!
verses.translation: Now, the pagans are astonished that a warner has come to them from among themselves.[936] And the disbelievers say, “This is a magician, a total liar!

verses.text: Has he reduced ˹all˺ the gods to One God? Indeed, this is something totally astonishing.” Chief Deniers
verses.translation: Has he reduced ˹all˺ the gods to One God? Indeed, this is something totally astonishing.” Chief Deniers

verses.text: The chiefs among them went forth saying, “Carry on, and stand firm in devotion to your gods. Certainly this is just a scheme ˹for power˺.[937]
verses.translation: The chiefs among them went forth saying, “Carry on, and stand firm in devotion to your gods. Certainly this is just a scheme ˹for power˺.[937]

verses.text: We have never heard of this in the previous faith.[938] This is nothing but a fabrication.
verses.translation: We have never heard of this in the previous faith.[938] This is nothing but a fabrication.

verses.text: Has the Reminder been revealed ˹only˺ to him out of ˹all of˺ us?” In fact, they are ˹only˺ in doubt of My ˹revealed˺ Reminder.[939] In fact, ˹they do so because˺ they have not yet tasted My punishment.
verses.translation: Has the Reminder been revealed ˹only˺ to him out of ˹all of˺ us?” In fact, they are ˹only˺ in doubt of My ˹revealed˺ Reminder.[939] In fact, ˹they do so because˺ they have not yet tasted My punishment.

verses.text: Or ˹is it because˺ they possess the treasuries of the mercy of your Lord—the Almighty, the Giver ˹of all bounties˺.
verses.translation: Or ˹is it because˺ they possess the treasuries of the mercy of your Lord—the Almighty, the Giver ˹of all bounties˺.

verses.text: Or ˹is it because˺ the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and everything in between belongs to them? Let them then climb their way ˹to heaven, if their claim is true˺. Warning to the Deniers
verses.translation: Or ˹is it because˺ the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and everything in between belongs to them? Let them then climb their way ˹to heaven, if their claim is true˺. Warning to the Deniers

verses.text: This is just another ˹enemy˺ force bound for defeat out there.[940]
verses.translation: This is just another ˹enemy˺ force bound for defeat out there.[940]

verses.text: Before them, the people of Noah denied ˹the truth˺, as did ’Âd, Pharaoh of the mighty structures,[941]
verses.translation: Before them, the people of Noah denied ˹the truth˺, as did ’Âd, Pharaoh of the mighty structures,[941]

verses.text: Thamûd, the people of Lot, and the residents of the Forest.[942] These were ˹all˺ enemy forces.
verses.translation: Thamûd, the people of Lot, and the residents of the Forest.[942] These were ˹all˺ enemy forces.

verses.text: Each rejected their messenger, so My punishment was justified.
verses.translation: Each rejected their messenger, so My punishment was justified.

verses.text: These ˹pagans˺ are awaiting nothing but a single Blast that cannot be stopped.
verses.translation: These ˹pagans˺ are awaiting nothing but a single Blast that cannot be stopped.

verses.text: They say ˹mockingly˺, “Our Lord! Hasten for us our share ˹of the punishment˺ before the Day of Reckoning.” Prophet David
verses.translation: They say ˹mockingly˺, “Our Lord! Hasten for us our share ˹of the punishment˺ before the Day of Reckoning.” Prophet David

verses.text: Be patient ˹O Prophet˺ with what they say. And remember Our servant, David, the man of strength. Indeed, he ˹constantly˺ turned ˹to Allah˺.
verses.translation: Be patient ˹O Prophet˺ with what they say. And remember Our servant, David, the man of strength. Indeed, he ˹constantly˺ turned ˹to Allah˺.

verses.text: We truly subjected the mountains to hymn ˹Our praises˺ along with him in the evening and after sunrise.
verses.translation: We truly subjected the mountains to hymn ˹Our praises˺ along with him in the evening and after sunrise.

verses.text: And ˹We subjected˺ the birds, flocking together. All turned to him ˹echoing his hymns˺.
verses.translation: And ˹We subjected˺ the birds, flocking together. All turned to him ˹echoing his hymns˺.

verses.text: We strengthened his kingship, and gave him wisdom and sound judgment. David and the Disputing Partners
verses.translation: We strengthened his kingship, and gave him wisdom and sound judgment. David and the Disputing Partners

verses.text: Has the story of the two plaintiffs, who scaled the ˹wall of David’s˺ sanctuary, reached you ˹O Prophet˺?
verses.translation: Has the story of the two plaintiffs, who scaled the ˹wall of David’s˺ sanctuary, reached you ˹O Prophet˺?

verses.text: When they came into David’s presence, he was startled by them. They said, “Have no fear. ˹We are merely˺ two in a dispute: one of us has wronged the other. So judge between us with truth—do not go beyond ˹it˺—and guide us to the right way.
verses.translation: When they came into David’s presence, he was startled by them. They said, “Have no fear. ˹We are merely˺ two in a dispute: one of us has wronged the other. So judge between us with truth—do not go beyond ˹it˺—and guide us to the right way.

verses.text: This is my brother.[943] He has ninety-nine sheep while I have ˹only˺ one. ˹Still˺ he asked me to give it up to him, overwhelming me with ˹his˺ argument.”
verses.translation: This is my brother.[943] He has ninety-nine sheep while I have ˹only˺ one. ˹Still˺ he asked me to give it up to him, overwhelming me with ˹his˺ argument.”

verses.text: David ˹eventually˺ ruled, “He has definitely wronged you in demanding ˹to add˺ your sheep to his. And certainly many partners wrong each other, except those who believe and do good—but how few are they!” Then David realized that We had tested him so he asked for his Lord’s forgiveness, fell down in prostration, and turned ˹to Him in repentance˺.[944]
verses.translation: David ˹eventually˺ ruled, “He has definitely wronged you in demanding ˹to add˺ your sheep to his. And certainly many partners wrong each other, except those who believe and do good—but how few are they!” Then David realized that We had tested him so he asked for his Lord’s forgiveness, fell down in prostration, and turned ˹to Him in repentance˺.[944]

verses.text: So We forgave that for him. And he will indeed have ˹a status of˺ closeness to Us and an honourable destination!
verses.translation: So We forgave that for him. And he will indeed have ˹a status of˺ closeness to Us and an honourable destination!

verses.text: ˹We instructed him:˺ “O David! We have surely made you an authority in the land, so judge between people with truth. And do not follow ˹your˺ desires or they will lead you astray from Allah’s Way. Surely those who go astray from Allah’s Way will suffer a severe punishment for neglecting the Day of Reckoning.” Allah Is Just
verses.translation: ˹We instructed him:˺ “O David! We have surely made you an authority in the land, so judge between people with truth. And do not follow ˹your˺ desires or they will lead you astray from Allah’s Way. Surely those who go astray from Allah’s Way will suffer a severe punishment for neglecting the Day of Reckoning.” Allah Is Just

verses.text: We have not created the heavens and earth and everything in between without purpose—as the disbelievers think. So woe to the disbelievers because of the Fire!
verses.translation: We have not created the heavens and earth and everything in between without purpose—as the disbelievers think. So woe to the disbelievers because of the Fire!

verses.text: Or should We treat those who believe and do good like those who make mischief throughout the land? Or should We treat the righteous like the wicked? The Purpose of the Quran
verses.translation: Or should We treat those who believe and do good like those who make mischief throughout the land? Or should We treat the righteous like the wicked? The Purpose of the Quran

verses.text: ˹This is˺ a blessed Book which We have revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺ so that they may contemplate its verses, and people of reason may be mindful. Solomon’s Love for Fine Horses
verses.translation: ˹This is˺ a blessed Book which We have revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺ so that they may contemplate its verses, and people of reason may be mindful. Solomon’s Love for Fine Horses

verses.text: And We blessed David with Solomon—what an excellent servant ˹he was˺! Indeed, he ˹constantly˺ turned ˹to Allah˺.
verses.translation: And We blessed David with Solomon—what an excellent servant ˹he was˺! Indeed, he ˹constantly˺ turned ˹to Allah˺.

verses.text: ˹Remember˺ when the well-trained, swift horses were paraded before him in the evening.
verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when the well-trained, swift horses were paraded before him in the evening.

verses.text: He then proclaimed, “I am truly in love with ˹these˺ fine things out of remembrance for Allah,” until they went out of sight.
verses.translation: He then proclaimed, “I am truly in love with ˹these˺ fine things out of remembrance for Allah,” until they went out of sight.

verses.text: ˹He ordered,˺ “Bring them back to me!” Then he began to rub down their legs and necks. [945] Solomon’s Authority
verses.translation: ˹He ordered,˺ “Bring them back to me!” Then he began to rub down their legs and necks. [945] Solomon’s Authority

verses.text: And indeed, We tested Solomon, placing a ˹deformed˺ body on his throne,[946] then he turned ˹to Allah in repentance˺.
verses.translation: And indeed, We tested Solomon, placing a ˹deformed˺ body on his throne,[946] then he turned ˹to Allah in repentance˺.

verses.text: He prayed, “My Lord! Forgive me, and grant me an authority that will never be matched by anyone after me. You are indeed the Giver ˹of all bounties˺.”
verses.translation: He prayed, “My Lord! Forgive me, and grant me an authority that will never be matched by anyone after me. You are indeed the Giver ˹of all bounties˺.”

verses.text: So We subjected to him the wind, blowing gently at his command to wherever he pleased.
verses.translation: So We subjected to him the wind, blowing gently at his command to wherever he pleased.

verses.text: And ˹We subjected to him˺ every builder and diver[947] of the jinn,
verses.translation: And ˹We subjected to him˺ every builder and diver[947] of the jinn,

verses.text: and others bound together in chains.
verses.translation: and others bound together in chains.

verses.text: ˹Allah said,˺ “This is Our gift, so give or withhold ˹as you wish˺, never to be called to account.”
verses.translation: ˹Allah said,˺ “This is Our gift, so give or withhold ˹as you wish˺, never to be called to account.”

verses.text: And he will indeed have ˹a status of˺ closeness to Us and an honourable destination! Prophet Job
verses.translation: And he will indeed have ˹a status of˺ closeness to Us and an honourable destination! Prophet Job

verses.text: And remember Our servant Job, when he cried out to his Lord, “Satan has afflicted me with distress and suffering.”
verses.translation: And remember Our servant Job, when he cried out to his Lord, “Satan has afflicted me with distress and suffering.”

verses.text: ˹We responded,˺ “Stomp your foot: ˹now˺ here is a cool ˹and refreshing˺ spring for washing and drinking.”
verses.translation: ˹We responded,˺ “Stomp your foot: ˹now˺ here is a cool ˹and refreshing˺ spring for washing and drinking.”

verses.text: And We gave him back his family, twice as many, as a mercy from Us and a lesson for people of reason.
verses.translation: And We gave him back his family, twice as many, as a mercy from Us and a lesson for people of reason.

verses.text: ˹And We said to him,˺ “Take in your hand a bundle of grass, and strike ˹your wife˺ with it, and do not break your oath.”[948] We truly found him patient. What an excellent servant ˹he was˺! Indeed, he ˹constantly˺ turned ˹to Allah˺. Other Mighty Prophets
verses.translation: ˹And We said to him,˺ “Take in your hand a bundle of grass, and strike ˹your wife˺ with it, and do not break your oath.”[948] We truly found him patient. What an excellent servant ˹he was˺! Indeed, he ˹constantly˺ turned ˹to Allah˺. Other Mighty Prophets

verses.text: And remember Our servants: Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob—the men of strength and insight.
verses.translation: And remember Our servants: Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob—the men of strength and insight.

verses.text: We truly chose them for the honour of proclaiming the Hereafter.
verses.translation: We truly chose them for the honour of proclaiming the Hereafter.

verses.text: And in Our sight they are truly among the chosen and the finest.
verses.translation: And in Our sight they are truly among the chosen and the finest.

verses.text: Also remember Ishmael, Elisha, and Ⱬul-Kifl.[949] All are among the best. Reward of the Righteous
verses.translation: Also remember Ishmael, Elisha, and Ⱬul-Kifl.[949] All are among the best. Reward of the Righteous

verses.text: This is ˹all˺ a reminder. And the righteous will certainly have an honourable destination:
verses.translation: This is ˹all˺ a reminder. And the righteous will certainly have an honourable destination:

verses.text: the Gardens of Eternity, whose gates will be open for them.
verses.translation: the Gardens of Eternity, whose gates will be open for them.

verses.text: There they will recline, calling for abundant fruit and drink.
verses.translation: There they will recline, calling for abundant fruit and drink.

verses.text: And with them will be maidens of modest gaze and equal age.
verses.translation: And with them will be maidens of modest gaze and equal age.

verses.text: This is what you are promised for the Day of Reckoning.
verses.translation: This is what you are promised for the Day of Reckoning.

verses.text: This is indeed Our provision that will never end. Reward of the Wicked
verses.translation: This is indeed Our provision that will never end. Reward of the Wicked

verses.text: That is that. And the transgressors will certainly have the worst destination:
verses.translation: That is that. And the transgressors will certainly have the worst destination:

verses.text: Hell, where they will burn. What an evil place to rest!
verses.translation: Hell, where they will burn. What an evil place to rest!

verses.text: Let them then taste this: boiling water and ˹oozing˺ pus,
verses.translation: Let them then taste this: boiling water and ˹oozing˺ pus,

verses.text: and other torments of the same sort! Disputes of the Wicked
verses.translation: and other torments of the same sort! Disputes of the Wicked

verses.text: ˹The misleaders will say to one another,˺ “Here is a crowd ˹of followers˺ being thrown in with us. They are not welcome, ˹for˺ they ˹too˺ will burn in the Fire.”[950]
verses.translation: ˹The misleaders will say to one another,˺ “Here is a crowd ˹of followers˺ being thrown in with us. They are not welcome, ˹for˺ they ˹too˺ will burn in the Fire.”[950]

verses.text: The followers will respond, “No! You are not welcome! You brought this upon us. What an evil place for settlement!”
verses.translation: The followers will respond, “No! You are not welcome! You brought this upon us. What an evil place for settlement!”

verses.text: Adding, “Our Lord! Whoever brought this upon us, double their punishment in the Fire.”
verses.translation: Adding, “Our Lord! Whoever brought this upon us, double their punishment in the Fire.”

verses.text: The tyrants will ask ˹one another˺, “But why do we not see those we considered to be lowly?
verses.translation: The tyrants will ask ˹one another˺, “But why do we not see those we considered to be lowly?

verses.text: Were we wrong in mocking them ˹in the world˺?[951] Or do our eyes ˹just˺ fail to see them ˹in the Fire˺?”
verses.translation: Were we wrong in mocking them ˹in the world˺?[951] Or do our eyes ˹just˺ fail to see them ˹in the Fire˺?”

verses.text: This dispute between the residents of the Fire will certainly come to pass. The Messenger and His Message
verses.translation: This dispute between the residents of the Fire will certainly come to pass. The Messenger and His Message

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I am only a warner. And there is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Allah—the One, the Supreme.
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I am only a warner. And there is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Allah—the One, the Supreme.

verses.text: ˹He is the˺ Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything in between—the Almighty, Most Forgiving.”
verses.translation: ˹He is the˺ Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything in between—the Almighty, Most Forgiving.”

verses.text: Say, “This ˹Quran˺ is momentous news,
verses.translation: Say, “This ˹Quran˺ is momentous news,

verses.text: from which you ˹pagans˺ are turning away.”
verses.translation: from which you ˹pagans˺ are turning away.”

verses.text: ˹And say,˺ “I had no knowledge of the highest assembly ˹in heaven˺ when they differed ˹concerning Adam˺.[952]
verses.translation: ˹And say,˺ “I had no knowledge of the highest assembly ˹in heaven˺ when they differed ˹concerning Adam˺.[952]

verses.text: What is revealed to me is that I am only sent with a clear warning.” Satan’s Arrogance
verses.translation: What is revealed to me is that I am only sent with a clear warning.” Satan’s Arrogance

verses.text: ˹Remember, O Prophet˺ when your Lord said to the angels, “I am going to create a human being from clay.
verses.translation: ˹Remember, O Prophet˺ when your Lord said to the angels, “I am going to create a human being from clay.

verses.text: So when I have fashioned him and had a spirit of My Own ˹creation˺ breathed into him, fall down in prostration to him.”
verses.translation: So when I have fashioned him and had a spirit of My Own ˹creation˺ breathed into him, fall down in prostration to him.”

verses.text: So the angels prostrated all together—
verses.translation: So the angels prostrated all together—

verses.text: but not Iblîs,[953] who acted arrogantly,[954] becoming unfaithful.
verses.translation: but not Iblîs,[953] who acted arrogantly,[954] becoming unfaithful.

verses.text: Allah asked, “O Iblîs! What prevented you from prostrating to what I created with My Own Hands? Did you ˹just˺ become proud? Or have you always been arrogant?”
verses.translation: Allah asked, “O Iblîs! What prevented you from prostrating to what I created with My Own Hands? Did you ˹just˺ become proud? Or have you always been arrogant?”

verses.text: He replied, “I am better than he is: You created me from fire and him from clay.”

verses.translation: And surely upon you is My condemnation until the Day of Judgment.”

name: The ˹Successive˺ Groups
intro: This Meccan sûrah builds on the story of the creation of Adam in the previous sûrah by referring to the creation of Adam’s spouse, and how their descendants were created in the womb, developing in successive stages. Some of those descendants choose to be faithful and grateful to their Creator, while others choose not to. Eventually, following a fair judgment, the former will be led to their places in Paradise and the latter to their places in Hell—each in successive groups (hence the sûrah’s name). Allah’s willingness to forgive sins is highly emphasized in the last part of this sûrah and the beginning of the next. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Worship Allah Alone

verses.text: The revelation of this Book is from Allah—the Almighty, All-Wise.
verses.translation: The revelation of this Book is from Allah—the Almighty, All-Wise.

verses.text: Indeed, We have sent down the Book to you ˹O Prophet˺ in truth, so worship Allah ˹alone˺, being sincerely devoted to Him.
verses.translation: Indeed, We have sent down the Book to you ˹O Prophet˺ in truth, so worship Allah ˹alone˺, being sincerely devoted to Him.

verses.text: Indeed, sincere devotion is due ˹only˺ to Allah. As for those who take other lords besides Him, ˹saying,˺ “We worship them only so they may bring us closer to Allah,” surely Allah will judge between all[955] regarding what they differed about. Allah certainly does not guide whoever persists in lying and disbelief. Allah’s Power of Creation

verses.text: Had it been Allah’s Will to have offspring, He could have chosen whatever He willed of His creation. Glory be to Him! He is Allah—the One, the Supreme.
verses.translation: Had it been Allah’s Will to have offspring, He could have chosen whatever He willed of His creation. Glory be to Him! He is Allah—the One, the Supreme.

verses.text: He created the heavens and the earth for a purpose. He wraps the night around the day, and wraps the day around the night. And He has subjected the sun and the moon, each orbiting for an appointed term. He is truly the Almighty, Most Forgiving.
verses.translation: He created the heavens and the earth for a purpose. He wraps the night around the day, and wraps the day around the night. And He has subjected the sun and the moon, each orbiting for an appointed term. He is truly the Almighty, Most Forgiving.

verses.text: He created you ˹all˺ from a single soul,[956] then from it He made its mate.[957] And He produced for you four pairs of cattle.[958] He creates you in the wombs of your mothers ˹in stages˺, one development after another, in three layers of darkness.[959] That is Allah—your Lord! All authority belongs to Him. There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. How can you then be turned away? Belief and Disbelief
verses.translation: He created you ˹all˺ from a single soul,[956] then from it He made its mate.[957] And He produced for you four pairs of cattle.[958] He creates you in the wombs of your mothers ˹in stages˺, one development after another, in three layers of darkness.[959] That is Allah—your Lord! verses.text: If you disbelieve, then ˹know that˺ Allah is truly not in need of you, nor does He approve of disbelief from His servants. But if you become grateful ˹through faith˺, He will appreciate that from you. No soul burdened with sin will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you of what you used to do. He certainly knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart. Disbelievers’ Ingratitude
verses.translation: If you disbelieve, then ˹know that˺ Allah is truly not in need of you, nor does He approve of disbelief from His servants. But if you become grateful ˹through faith˺, He will appreciate that from you. No soul burdened with sin will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you of what you used to do. He certainly knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart. Disbelievers’ Ingratitude

verses.text: When one is touched with hardship, they cry out to their Lord, turning to Him ˹alone˺. But as soon as He showers them with blessings from Him, they ˹totally˺ forget the One they had cried to earlier, and set up equals to Allah to mislead ˹others˺ from His Way. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Enjoy your disbelief for a little while! You will certainly be one of the inmates of the Fire.”
verses.translation: When one is touched with hardship, they cry out to their Lord, turning to Him ˹alone˺. But as soon as He showers them with blessings from Him, they ˹totally˺ forget the One they had cried to earlier, and set up equals to Allah to mislead ˹others˺ from His Way. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Enjoy your disbelief for a little while! You will certainly be one of the inmates of the Fire.”

verses.text: ˹Are they better˺ or those who worship ˹their Lord˺ devoutly in the hours of the night, prostrating and standing, fearing the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of their Lord? Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Are those who know equal to those who do not know?” None will be mindful ˹of this˺ except people of reason. Orders to the Prophet
verses.translation: ˹Are they better˺ or those who worship ˹their Lord˺ devoutly in the hours of the night, prostrating and standing, fearing the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of their Lord? verses.text: Say ˹O Prophet, that Allah says˺, “O My servants who believe! Be mindful of your Lord. Those who do good in this world will have a good reward. And Allah’s earth is spacious. Only those who endure patiently will be given their reward without limit.”
verses.translation: Say ˹O Prophet, that Allah says˺, “O My servants who believe! Be mindful of your Lord. Those who do good in this world will have a good reward. And Allah’s earth is spacious. Only those who endure patiently will be given their reward without limit.”

verses.text: Say, “I am commanded to worship Allah, being sincerely devoted to Him ˹alone˺.
verses.translation: Say, “I am commanded to worship Allah, being sincerely devoted to Him ˹alone˺.

verses.text: And I am commanded to be the first of those who submit ˹to His Will˺.”
verses.translation: And I am commanded to be the first of those who submit ˹to His Will˺.”

verses.text: Say, “I truly fear—if I were to disobey my Lord—the torment of a tremendous Day.”
verses.translation: Say, “I truly fear—if I were to disobey my Lord—the torment of a tremendous Day.”

verses.text: Say, “It is ˹only˺ Allah that I worship, being sincere in my devotion to Him.
verses.translation: Say, “It is ˹only˺ Allah that I worship, being sincere in my devotion to Him.

verses.text: Worship then whatever ˹gods˺ you want instead of Him.” Say, “The ˹true˺ losers are those who will lose themselves and their families on Judgment Day. That is indeed the clearest loss.”
verses.translation: Worship then whatever ˹gods˺ you want instead of Him.” Say, “The ˹true˺ losers are those who will lose themselves and their families on Judgment Day. That is indeed the clearest loss.”

verses.text: They will have layers of fire above and below them. That is what Allah warns His servants with. So fear Me, O My servants! The Faithful and the Unfaithful
verses.translation: They will have layers of fire above and below them. That is what Allah warns His servants with. So fear Me, O My servants! The Faithful and the Unfaithful

verses.text: And those who shun the worship of false gods, turning to Allah ˹alone˺, will have good news. So give good news to My servants ˹O Prophet˺—
verses.translation: And those who shun the worship of false gods, turning to Allah ˹alone˺, will have good news. So give good news to My servants ˹O Prophet˺—

verses.text: those who listen to what is said and follow the best of it.[960] These are the ones ˹rightly˺ guided by Allah, and these are ˹truly˺ the people of reason.
verses.translation: those who listen to what is said and follow the best of it.[960] These are the ones ˹rightly˺ guided by Allah, and these are ˹truly˺ the people of reason.

verses.text: What about those against whom the decree of torment has been justified? Is it you ˹O Prophet˺ who will then save those bound for the Fire?
verses.translation: What about those against whom the decree of torment has been justified? Is it you ˹O Prophet˺ who will then save those bound for the Fire?

verses.text: But those mindful of their Lord will have ˹elevated˺ mansions, built one above the other, under which rivers flow. ˹That is˺ the promise of Allah. ˹And˺ Allah never fails in ˹His˺ promise. Parable for This Fleeting Life

verses.text: Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky—channelling it through streams in the earth—then produces with it crops of various colours, then they dry up and you see them wither, and then He reduces them to chaff? Surely in this is a reminder for people of reason. The Believers and the Disbelievers

verses.text: Can ˹the misguided be like˺ those whose hearts Allah has opened to Islam, so they are enlightened by their Lord? So woe to those whose hearts are hardened at the remembrance of Allah! It is they who are clearly astray. Excellence of the Quran
verses.translation: Can ˹the misguided be like˺ those whose hearts Allah has opened to Islam, so they are enlightened by their Lord? So woe to those whose hearts are hardened at the remembrance of Allah! It is they who are clearly astray. Excellence of the Quran

That is the guidance of Allah, through which He guides whoever He wills. But whoever Allah leaves to stray will be left with no guide.

verses.text: So Allah made them taste humiliation in this worldly life, but far worse is the punishment of the Hereafter, if only they knew. Perfection of the Quran
verses.translation: So Allah made them taste humiliation in this worldly life, but far worse is the punishment of the Hereafter, if only they knew. Perfection of the Quran

verses.text: We have certainly set forth every ˹kind of˺ lesson for people in this Quran, so perhaps they will be mindful.
verses.translation: We have certainly set forth every ˹kind of˺ lesson for people in this Quran, so perhaps they will be mindful.

verses.translation: ˹It is˺ a Quran ˹revealed˺ in Arabic without any crookedness, so perhaps they will be conscious ˹of Allah˺. Parable for a Polytheist and a Monotheist

verses.text: Allah sets forth the parable of a slave owned by several quarrelsome masters, and a slave owned by only one master. Are they equal in condition?[961] Praise be to Allah! In fact, most of them do not know. All Will Die
verses.translation: Allah sets forth the parable of a slave owned by several quarrelsome masters, and a slave owned by only one master. Are they equal in condition?[961] Praise be to Allah! In fact, most of them do not know. All Will Die

verses.translation: You ˹O Prophet˺ will certainly die, and they will die too.

verses.text: Then on the Day of Judgment you will ˹all settle your˺ dispute before your Lord. Reward of the Believers and Disbelievers
verses.translation: Then on the Day of Judgment you will ˹all settle your˺ dispute before your Lord. Reward of the Believers and Disbelievers

verses.text: Who then does more wrong than those who lie about Allah and reject the truth after it has reached them? Is Hell not a ˹fitting˺ home for the disbelievers?
verses.translation: Who then does more wrong than those who lie about Allah and reject the truth after it has reached them? Is Hell not a ˹fitting˺ home for the disbelievers?

verses.text: And the one who has brought the truth and those who embrace it—it is they who are the righteous.
verses.translation: And the one who has brought the truth and those who embrace it—it is they who are the righteous.

verses.text: They will have whatever they desire with their Lord. That is the reward of the good-doers.
verses.translation: They will have whatever they desire with their Lord. That is the reward of the good-doers.

verses.text: As such, Allah will absolve them of ˹even˺ the worst of what they did and reward them according to the best of what they used to do. Allah Protects His Messenger
verses.translation: As such, Allah will absolve them of ˹even˺ the worst of what they did and reward them according to the best of what they used to do. Allah Protects His Messenger

verses.text: Is Allah not sufficient for His servant? Yet they threaten you with other ˹powerless˺ gods besides Him! Whoever Allah leaves to stray will be left with no guide.
verses.translation: Is Allah not sufficient for His servant? Yet they threaten you with other ˹powerless˺ gods besides Him! Whoever Allah leaves to stray will be left with no guide.

verses.text: And whoever Allah guides, none can lead astray. Is Allah not Almighty, capable of punishment? Almighty Allah or Powerless Gods
verses.translation: And whoever Allah guides, none can lead astray. Is Allah not Almighty, capable of punishment? Almighty Allah or Powerless Gods

verses.text: If you ask them ˹O Prophet˺ who created the heavens and the earth, they will certainly say, “Allah!” Ask ˹them˺, “Consider then whatever ˹idols˺ you invoke besides Allah: if it was Allah’s Will to harm me, could they undo that harm? Or if He willed ˹some˺ mercy for me, could they withhold His mercy?” Say, “Allah is sufficient for me. In Him ˹alone˺ the faithful put their trust.” Warning to the Pagans

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “O my people! Persist in your ways, for I ˹too˺ will persist in mine. You will soon come to know
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “O my people! Persist in your ways, for I ˹too˺ will persist in mine. You will soon come to know

verses.text: who will be visited by a humiliating torment ˹in this life˺ and overwhelmed by an everlasting punishment ˹in the next˺.” Free Choice
verses.translation: who will be visited by a humiliating torment ˹in this life˺ and overwhelmed by an everlasting punishment ˹in the next˺.” Free Choice

verses.text: Surely We have revealed to you the Book ˹O Prophet˺ with the truth for humanity. So whoever chooses to be guided, it is for their own good. And whoever chooses to stray, it is only to their own loss. You are not a keeper over them. Sleep: The Twin Brother of Death
verses.translation: Surely We have revealed to you the Book ˹O Prophet˺ with the truth for humanity. So whoever chooses to be guided, it is for their own good. And whoever chooses to stray, it is only to their own loss. You are not a keeper over them. Sleep: The Twin Brother of Death

verses.text: ˹It is˺ Allah ˹Who˺ calls back the souls ˹of people˺ upon their death as well as ˹the souls˺ of the living during their sleep. Then He keeps those for whom He has ordained death, and releases the others until ˹their˺ appointed time. Surely in this are signs for people who reflect. Allah or the Idols
verses.translation: ˹It is˺ Allah ˹Who˺ calls back the souls ˹of people˺ upon their death as well as ˹the souls˺ of the living during their sleep. verses.text: Or have they taken others besides Allah as intercessors? Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “˹Would they do so,˺ even though those ˹idols˺ have neither authority nor intelligence?”
verses.translation: Or have they taken others besides Allah as intercessors? Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “˹Would they do so,˺ even though those ˹idols˺ have neither authority nor intelligence?”

verses.translation: Say, “All intercession belongs to Allah ˹alone˺. To Him belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. Then to Him you will ˹all˺ be returned.”

verses.text: Yet when Allah alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who disbelieve in the Hereafter are filled with disgust. But as soon as those ˹gods˺ other than Him are mentioned, they are filled with joy. Allah Is the Judge
verses.translation: Yet when Allah alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who disbelieve in the Hereafter are filled with disgust. But as soon as those ˹gods˺ other than Him are mentioned, they are filled with joy. Allah Is the Judge

verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “O Allah—Originator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of the seen and unseen! You will judge between Your servants regarding their differences.”

verses.text: Even if the wrongdoers were to possess everything in the world twice over, they would certainly offer it to ransom themselves from the horrible punishment on Judgment Day, for they will see from Allah what they had never expected.
verses.translation: Even if the wrongdoers were to possess everything in the world twice over, they would certainly offer it to ransom themselves from the horrible punishment on Judgment Day, for they will see from Allah what they had never expected.

verses.text: And the evil ˹consequences˺ of their deeds will unfold before them, and they will be overwhelmed by what they used to ridicule. Human Ingratitude
verses.translation: And the evil ˹consequences˺ of their deeds will unfold before them, and they will be overwhelmed by what they used to ridicule. Human Ingratitude

verses.text: When one is touched with hardship, they cry out to Us ˹alone˺. Then when We shower Our blessings upon them, they say, “I have been granted all this only because of ˹my˺ knowledge.” Not at all! It is ˹no more than˺ a test. But most of them do not know.

verses.text: The same had already been said by those ˹destroyed˺ before them,[962] but their ˹worldly˺ gains were of no benefit to them.
verses.translation: The same had already been said by those ˹destroyed˺ before them,[962] but their ˹worldly˺ gains were of no benefit to them.

verses.text: So the evil ˹consequences˺ of their deeds overtook them. And the wrongdoers among these ˹pagans˺ will be overtaken by the evil ˹consequences˺ of their deeds. And they will have no escape.
verses.translation: So the evil ˹consequences˺ of their deeds overtook them. And the wrongdoers among these ˹pagans˺ will be overtaken by the evil ˹consequences˺ of their deeds. And they will have no escape.

verses.text: Do they not know that Allah gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills? Surely in this are signs for people who believe. Allah Forgives All Sins
verses.translation: Do they not know that Allah gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills? Surely in this are signs for people who believe. Allah Forgives All Sins

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet, that Allah says,˺ “O My servants who have exceeded the limits against their souls! Do not lose hope in Allah’s mercy, for Allah certainly forgives all sins.[963] He is indeed the All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet, that Allah says,˺ “O My servants who have exceeded the limits against their souls! Do not lose hope in Allah’s mercy, for Allah certainly forgives all sins.[963] He is indeed the All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

verses.text: Turn to your Lord ˹in repentance˺, and ˹fully˺ submit to Him before the punishment reaches you, ˹for˺ then you will not be helped.
verses.translation: Turn to your Lord ˹in repentance˺, and ˹fully˺ submit to Him before the punishment reaches you, ˹for˺ then you will not be helped.

verses.text: Follow ˹the Quran,˺ the best of what has been revealed to you from your Lord, before the punishment takes you by surprise while you are unaware,
verses.translation: Follow ˹the Quran,˺ the best of what has been revealed to you from your Lord, before the punishment takes you by surprise while you are unaware,

verses.text: so that no ˹sinful˺ soul will say ˹on Judgment Day˺, ‘Woe to me for neglecting ˹my duties towards˺ Allah, while ridiculing ˹the truth˺.’
verses.translation: so that no ˹sinful˺ soul will say ˹on Judgment Day˺, ‘Woe to me for neglecting ˹my duties towards˺ Allah, while ridiculing ˹the truth˺.’

verses.translation: Or ˹a soul will˺ say, ‘If only Allah had guided me, I would have certainly been one of the righteous.’

verses.text: Or say, upon seeing the torment, ‘If only I had a second chance, I would have been one of the good-doers.’
verses.translation: Or say, upon seeing the torment, ‘If only I had a second chance, I would have been one of the good-doers.’

verses.text: Not at all! My revelations had already come to you, but you rejected them, acted arrogantly, and were one of the disbelievers.” Judgment Day
verses.translation: Not at all! My revelations had already come to you, but you rejected them, acted arrogantly, and were one of the disbelievers.” Judgment Day

verses.text: On the Day of Judgment you will see those who lied about Allah with their faces gloomy. Is Hell not a ˹fitting˺ home for the arrogant?
verses.translation: On the Day of Judgment you will see those who lied about Allah with their faces gloomy. Is Hell not a ˹fitting˺ home for the arrogant?

verses.text: And Allah will deliver those who were mindful ˹of Him˺ to their place of ˹ultimate˺ triumph. No evil will touch them, nor will they grieve.
verses.translation: And Allah will deliver those who were mindful ˹of Him˺ to their place of ˹ultimate˺ triumph. No evil will touch them, nor will they grieve.

verses.text: Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the Maintainer of everything.
verses.translation: Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the Maintainer of everything.

verses.text: To Him belong the keys ˹of the treasuries˺ of the heavens and the earth. As for those who rejected the signs of Allah, it is they who will be the ˹true˺ losers. One God Alone
verses.translation: To Him belong the keys ˹of the treasuries˺ of the heavens and the earth. As for those who rejected the signs of Allah, it is they who will be the ˹true˺ losers. One God Alone

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Are you urging me to worship ˹anyone˺ other than Allah, O ignorant ones?”
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Are you urging me to worship ˹anyone˺ other than Allah, O ignorant ones?”

verses.text: It has already been revealed to you—and to those ˹prophets˺ before you—that if you associate others ˹with Allah˺, your deeds will certainly be void and you will truly be one of the losers.
verses.translation: It has already been revealed to you—and to those ˹prophets˺ before you—that if you associate others ˹with Allah˺, your deeds will certainly be void and you will truly be one of the losers.

name: The Forgiver
intro: In essence, this Meccan sûrah emphasizes the main concepts highlighted both in the previous and following sûrahs—namely Allah being infinite in mercy and severe in punishment, and humanity being either grateful or ungrateful to their Lord along with the reward that ensues. All this is embodied in the story of Moses (verses 23-54)—with Pharaoh as the ungrateful disbeliever and an unidentified man from Pharaoh’s people as the grateful believer. The Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is repeatedly advised to be patient, keeping in mind that Allah never lets His prophets down (verses 51 and 77). In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful The Quran Is from the Almighty

name: ˹Verses˺ Perfectly Explained
intro: This Meccan sûrah, which takes its name from the description of the Quran in verse 3, rebukes the pagans for turning away from the truth; abusing the Quran; and for denying Allah, the sole Creator of the heavens and the earth. The deniers are warned that their own bodily organs will testify against them on Judgment Day, landing them in Hell forever. Reference to the destruction of the arrogant, ungrateful peoples of ’ Ȃd and Thamûd is made because the pagan Arabs used to pass by their ruins on their journeys to Syria and Yemen, respectively. A profound description of the righteous is given in verses 30-36. The truth of the Quran is emphasized at the end of this sûrah and the beginning of the next. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful The Deniers of the Truth

verses.text: Ḥâ-Mĩm.
verses.translation: Ḥâ-Mĩm.

verses.text: ˹This is˺ a revelation from the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
verses.translation: ˹This is˺ a revelation from the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.

verses.translation: ˹It is˺ a Book whose verses are perfectly explained—a Quran in Arabic for people who know,

verses.translation: delivering good news and warning. Yet most of them turn away, so they do not hear.

verses.translation: ˹But˺ those who believe and do good will certainly have a never-ending reward. A Question to the Deniers

verses.translation: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “How can you disbelieve in the One Who created the earth in two Days? And how can you set up equals with Him? That is the Lord of all worlds.

verses.translation: He placed on the earth firm mountains, standing high, showered His blessings upon it, and ordained ˹all˺ its means of sustenance—totaling four Days exactly[981]—for all who ask.

verses.translation: Then He turned towards the heaven when it was ˹still like˺ smoke, saying to it and to the earth, ‘Submit, willingly or unwillingly.’ They both responded, ‘We submit willingly.’

verses.text: So He formed the heaven into seven heavens in two Days, assigning to each its mandate. And We adorned the lowest heaven with ˹stars like˺ lamps ˹for beauty˺ and for protection. That is the design of the Almighty, All-Knowing.”[982] The Fate of ’ Ȃd and Thamûd

verses.translation: If they turn away, then say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I warn you of a ˹mighty˺ blast, like the one that befell ’Ȃd and Thamûd.”

verses.translation: The messengers had come to them from all angles, ˹proclaiming,˺ “Worship none but Allah.” They responded, “Had our Lord willed, He could have easily sent down angels ˹instead˺. So we totally reject what you have been sent with.”

verses.text: As for ’Ȃd, they acted arrogantly throughout the land with no right, boasting, “Who is superior to us in might?” Did they not see that Allah ˹Himself˺, Who created them, was far superior to them in might? Still they persisted in denying Our signs.

verses.translation: So We sent against them a furious wind,[983] for ˹several˺ miserable days, to make them taste a humiliating punishment in this worldly life. But far more humiliating will be the punishment of the Hereafter. And they will not be helped.

verses.text: As for Thamûd, We showed them guidance, but they preferred blindness over guidance. So the blast of a disgracing punishment overtook them for what they used to commit.
