name: Consultation
intro: This Meccan sûrah takes its name from verse 38 which talks about conducting affairs by mutual consultation as one of the qualities of the true believers. The sûrah emphasizes that Allah has decreed for Muslims the same religion ordained for all the previous prophets. The believers are commanded to resort to Allah’s judgment if disagreement arises. Allah’s oneness, power, and wisdom are emphasized as the pagans’ faith in powerless idols is condemned. Both the end of this sûrah and the beginning of the next stress the fact that the Quran has been revealed by Allah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Allah Almighty

verses.text: Ḥâ-Mĩm.
verses.translation: Ḥâ-Mĩm.

verses.text: ’Aĩn-Sĩn-Qãf.
verses.translation: ’Aĩn-Sĩn-Qãf.

verses.text: And so you ˹O Prophet˺ are sent revelation, just like those before you, by Allah—the Almighty, All-Wise.
verses.translation: And so you ˹O Prophet˺ are sent revelation, just like those before you, by Allah—the Almighty, All-Wise.

verses.text: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And He is the Most High, the Greatest.
verses.translation: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And He is the Most High, the Greatest.

verses.text: The heavens nearly burst, one above the other, ˹in awe of Him˺. And the angels glorify the praises of their Lord, and seek forgiveness for those on earth. Surely Allah alone is the All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Allah Is the Protector
verses.translation: The heavens nearly burst, one above the other, ˹in awe of Him˺. And the angels glorify the praises of their Lord, and seek forgiveness for those on earth. Surely Allah alone is the All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Allah Is the Protector

verses.text: As for those who take other protectors besides Him, Allah is Watchful over them. And you ˹O Prophet˺ are not a keeper over them.
verses.translation: As for those who take other protectors besides Him, Allah is Watchful over them. And you ˹O Prophet˺ are not a keeper over them.

verses.text: And so We have revealed to you a Quran in Arabic, so you may warn the Mother of Cities[992] and everyone around it, and warn of the Day of Gathering— about which there is no doubt—˹when˺ a group will be in Paradise and another in the Blaze.
verses.translation: And so We have revealed to you a Quran in Arabic, so you may warn the Mother of Cities[992] and everyone around it, and warn of the Day of Gathering— about which there is no doubt—˹when˺ a group will be in Paradise and another in the Blaze.

verses.text: Had Allah willed, He could have easily made all ˹humanity˺ into a single community ˹of believers˺. But He admits into His mercy whoever He wills. And the wrongdoers will have no protector or helper.
verses.translation: Had Allah willed, He could have easily made all ˹humanity˺ into a single community ˹of believers˺. But He admits into His mercy whoever He wills. And the wrongdoers will have no protector or helper.

verses.text: How can they take protectors besides Him? Allah alone is the Protector. He ˹alone˺ gives life to the dead. And He ˹alone˺ is Most Capable of everything. Advice to the Believers
verses.translation: How can they take protectors besides Him? Allah alone is the Protector. He ˹alone˺ gives life to the dead. And He ˹alone˺ is Most Capable of everything. Advice to the Believers

verses.text: ˹Say to the believers, O Prophet,˺ “Whatever you may differ about, its judgment rests with Allah. That is Allah—my Lord. In Him I put my trust, and to Him I ˹always˺ turn.” Allah Is the Creator and Provider
verses.translation: ˹Say to the believers, O Prophet,˺ “Whatever you may differ about, its judgment rests with Allah. That is Allah—my Lord. In Him I put my trust, and to Him I ˹always˺ turn.” Allah Is the Creator and Provider

verses.text: ˹He is˺ the Originator of the heavens and the earth. He has made for you spouses from among yourselves, and ˹made˺ mates for cattle ˹as well˺— multiplying you ˹both˺. There is nothing like Him, for He ˹alone˺ is the All- Hearing, All-Seeing.
verses.translation: ˹He is˺ the Originator of the heavens and the earth. He has made for you spouses from among yourselves, and ˹made˺ mates for cattle ˹as well˺— multiplying you ˹both˺. There is nothing like Him, for He ˹alone˺ is the All- Hearing, All-Seeing.

verses.text: To Him belong the keys ˹of the treasuries˺ of the heavens and the earth. He gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills. Indeed, He has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things. One Message, Different Laws[993]
verses.translation: To Him belong the keys ˹of the treasuries˺ of the heavens and the earth. He gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills. Indeed, He has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things. One Message, Different Laws[993]

verses.text: He has ordained for you ˹believers˺ the Way which He decreed for Noah, and what We have revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺ and what We decreed for Abraham, Moses, and Jesus,[994] ˹commanding:˺ “Uphold the faith, and make no divisions in it.” What you call the polytheists to is unbearable for them. Allah chooses for Himself whoever He wills, and guides to Himself whoever turns ˹to Him˺.
verses.translation: He has ordained for you ˹believers˺ the Way which He decreed for Noah, and what We have revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺ and what We decreed for Abraham, Moses, and Jesus,[994] ˹commanding:˺ “Uphold the faith, and make no divisions in it.” What you call the polytheists to is unbearable for them. Allah chooses for Himself whoever He wills, and guides to Himself whoever turns ˹to Him˺.

verses.text: They did not split ˹into sects˺ out of mutual envy until knowledge came to them.[995] Had it not been for a prior decree from your Lord for an appointed term,[996] the matter would have certainly been settled between them ˹at once˺. And surely those who were made to inherit the Scripture[997] after them are truly in alarming doubt about this ˹Quran˺. Call to the People of the Book
verses.translation: They did not split ˹into sects˺ out of mutual envy until knowledge came to them.[995] Had it not been for a prior decree from your Lord for an appointed term,[996] the matter would have certainly been settled between them ˹at once˺. And surely those who were made to inherit the Scripture[997] after them are truly in alarming doubt about this ˹Quran˺. Call to the People of the Book

verses.text: Because of that, you ˹O Prophet˺ will invite ˹all˺. Be steadfast as you are commanded, and do not follow their desires. And say, “I believe in every Scripture Allah has revealed. And I am commanded to judge fairly among you. Allah is our Lord and your Lord. We will be accountable for our deeds and you for yours. There is no ˹need for˺ contention between us. Allah will gather us together ˹for judgment˺. And to Him is the final return.”
verses.translation: Because of that, you ˹O Prophet˺ will invite ˹all˺. Be steadfast as you are commanded, and do not follow their desires. And say, “I believe in every Scripture Allah has revealed. And I am commanded to judge fairly among you. Allah is our Lord and your Lord. We will be accountable for our deeds and you for yours. There is no ˹need for˺ contention between us. Allah will gather us together ˹for judgment˺. And to Him is the final return.”

verses.text: As for those who dispute about Allah after He is ˹already˺ acknowledged ˹by many˺, their argument is futile in the sight of their Lord. Upon them is wrath, and they will suffer a severe punishment. A Reminder of the Hour
verses.translation: As for those who dispute about Allah after He is ˹already˺ acknowledged ˹by many˺, their argument is futile in the sight of their Lord. Upon them is wrath, and they will suffer a severe punishment. A Reminder of the Hour

verses.text: It is Allah Who has revealed the Book with the truth and the balance ˹of justice˺. You never know, perhaps the Hour is near.
verses.translation: It is Allah Who has revealed the Book with the truth and the balance ˹of justice˺. You never know, perhaps the Hour is near.

verses.text: Those who disbelieve in it ˹ask to˺ hasten it ˹mockingly˺. But the believers are fearful of it, knowing that it is the truth. Surely those who dispute about the Hour have gone far astray. Allah’s Graciousness
verses.translation: Those who disbelieve in it ˹ask to˺ hasten it ˹mockingly˺. But the believers are fearful of it, knowing that it is the truth. Surely those who dispute about the Hour have gone far astray. Allah’s Graciousness

verses.text: Allah is Ever Kind to His servants. He provides ˹abundantly˺ to whoever He wills. And He is the All-Powerful, Almighty. Worldly Gains and Heavenly Rewards
verses.translation: Allah is Ever Kind to His servants. He provides ˹abundantly˺ to whoever He wills. And He is the All-Powerful, Almighty. Worldly Gains and Heavenly Rewards

verses.text: Whoever desires the harvest of the Hereafter, We will increase their harvest. And whoever desires ˹only˺ the harvest of this world, We will give them some of it, but they will have no share in the Hereafter. Reward of the Believers and Polytheists
verses.translation: Whoever desires the harvest of the Hereafter, We will increase their harvest. And whoever desires ˹only˺ the harvest of this world, We will give them some of it, but they will have no share in the Hereafter. Reward of the Believers and Polytheists

verses.text: Or do they have associate-gods who have ordained for them some ˹polytheistic˺ beliefs, which Allah has not authorized? Had it not been for ˹prior˺ decree on Judgment, the matter would have certainly been settled between them ˹at once˺. And surely the wrongdoers will suffer a painful punishment.
verses.translation: Or do they have associate-gods who have ordained for them some ˹polytheistic˺ beliefs, which Allah has not authorized? Had it not been for ˹prior˺ decree on Judgment, the matter would have certainly been settled between them ˹at once˺. And surely the wrongdoers will suffer a painful punishment.

verses.text: You will see the wrongdoers fearful ˹of the punishment˺ for what they committed but it will be inevitable for them, whereas those who believe and do good will be in the lush Gardens of Paradise. They will have whatever they desire from their Lord. That is ˹truly˺ the greatest bounty.
verses.translation: You will see the wrongdoers fearful ˹of the punishment˺ for what they committed but it will be inevitable for them, whereas those who believe and do good will be in the lush Gardens of Paradise. They will have whatever they desire from their Lord. That is ˹truly˺ the greatest bounty.

verses.text: That ˹reward˺ is the good news which Allah gives to His servants who believe and do good. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I do not ask you ˹Meccans˺ for a reward for this ˹message˺—only honour for ˹our˺ kinship.”[998] Whoever earns a good deed, We will increase it in goodness for them. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Appreciative. The Quran Fabricated?
verses.translation: That ˹reward˺ is the good news which Allah gives to His servants who believe and do good. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I do not ask you ˹Meccans˺ for a reward for this ˹message˺—only honour for ˹our˺ kinship.”[998] Whoever earns a good deed, We will increase it in goodness for them. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Appreciative. The Quran Fabricated?

verses.text: Or do they say, “He has fabricated a lie about Allah!”? ˹If you had,˺ Allah would have sealed your heart, if He willed. And Allah wipes out falsehood and establishes the truth by His Words. He certainly knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart. Allah’s Grace and Might
verses.translation: Or do they say, “He has fabricated a lie about Allah!”? ˹If you had,˺ Allah would have sealed your heart, if He willed. And Allah wipes out falsehood and establishes the truth by His Words. He certainly knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart. Allah’s Grace and Might

verses.text: He is the One Who accepts repentance from His servants and pardons ˹their˺ sins. And He knows whatever you do.
verses.translation: He is the One Who accepts repentance from His servants and pardons ˹their˺ sins. And He knows whatever you do.

verses.text: He responds to those who believe and do good, and increases their reward out of His grace. As for the disbelievers, they will suffer a severe punishment. Allah’s Mercy: Provisions and Rain
verses.translation: He responds to those who believe and do good, and increases their reward out of His grace. As for the disbelievers, they will suffer a severe punishment. Allah’s Mercy: Provisions and Rain

verses.text: Had Allah given abundant provisions to ˹all˺ His servants, they would have certainly transgressed throughout the land. But He sends down whatever He wills in perfect measure. He is truly All-Aware, All-Seeing of His servants.
verses.translation: Had Allah given abundant provisions to ˹all˺ His servants, they would have certainly transgressed throughout the land. But He sends down whatever He wills in perfect measure. He is truly All-Aware, All-Seeing of His servants.

verses.text: He is the One Who sends down rain after people have given up hope, spreading out His mercy. He is the Guardian, the Praiseworthy. Allah’s Mercy: The Universe
verses.translation: He is the One Who sends down rain after people have given up hope, spreading out His mercy. He is the Guardian, the Praiseworthy. Allah’s Mercy: The Universe

verses.text: And among His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and all living beings He dispersed throughout both. And He is Most Capable of bringing all together whenever He wills.
verses.translation: And among His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and all living beings He dispersed throughout both. And He is Most Capable of bringing all together whenever He wills.

verses.text: Whatever affliction befalls you is because of what your own hands have committed. And He pardons much.
verses.translation: Whatever affliction befalls you is because of what your own hands have committed. And He pardons much.

verses.text: You can never escape ˹Him˺ on earth, nor do you have any protector or helper besides Allah. Allah’s Mercy: Sailing Ships
verses.translation: You can never escape ˹Him˺ on earth, nor do you have any protector or helper besides Allah. Allah’s Mercy: Sailing Ships

verses.text: And among His signs are the ships like mountains ˹sailing˺ in the sea.
verses.translation: And among His signs are the ships like mountains ˹sailing˺ in the sea.

verses.text: If He wills, He can calm the wind, leaving the ships motionless on the water. Surely in this are signs for whoever is steadfast, grateful.
verses.translation: If He wills, He can calm the wind, leaving the ships motionless on the water. Surely in this are signs for whoever is steadfast, grateful.

verses.text: Or He can wreck the ships for what the people have committed—though He forgives much—
verses.translation: Or He can wreck the ships for what the people have committed—though He forgives much—

verses.text: so those who dispute about Our signs may know that they have no refuge. Qualities of the Devout
verses.translation: so those who dispute about Our signs may know that they have no refuge. Qualities of the Devout

verses.text: Whatever ˹pleasure˺ you have been given is ˹no more than a fleeting˺ enjoyment of this worldly life. But what is with Allah is far better and more lasting for those who believe and put their trust in their Lord;
verses.translation: Whatever ˹pleasure˺ you have been given is ˹no more than a fleeting˺ enjoyment of this worldly life. But what is with Allah is far better and more lasting for those who believe and put their trust in their Lord;

verses.text: who avoid major sins and shameful deeds, and forgive when angered;
verses.translation: who avoid major sins and shameful deeds, and forgive when angered;

verses.text: who respond to their Lord, establish prayer, conduct their affairs by mutual consultation, and donate from what We have provided for them;
verses.translation: who respond to their Lord, establish prayer, conduct their affairs by mutual consultation, and donate from what We have provided for them;

verses.text: and who enforce justice when wronged.
verses.translation: and who enforce justice when wronged.

verses.text: The reward of an evil deed is its equivalent. But whoever pardons and seeks reconciliation, then their reward is with Allah. He certainly does not like the wrongdoers.
verses.translation: The reward of an evil deed is its equivalent. But whoever pardons and seeks reconciliation, then their reward is with Allah. He certainly does not like the wrongdoers.

verses.text: There is no blame on those who enforce justice after being wronged.
verses.translation: There is no blame on those who enforce justice after being wronged.

verses.text: Blame is only on those who wrong people and transgress in the land unjustly. It is they who will suffer a painful punishment.
verses.translation: Blame is only on those who wrong people and transgress in the land unjustly. It is they who will suffer a painful punishment.

verses.text: And whoever endures patiently and forgives— surely this is a resolve to aspire to. The Wicked on Judgment Day
verses.translation: And whoever endures patiently and forgives— surely this is a resolve to aspire to. The Wicked on Judgment Day

verses.text: And whoever Allah leaves to stray will have no guide after Him. You will see the wrongdoers, when they face the torment, pleading, “Is there any way back ˹to the world˺?”
verses.translation: And whoever Allah leaves to stray will have no guide after Him. You will see the wrongdoers, when they face the torment, pleading, “Is there any way back ˹to the world˺?”

verses.text: And you will see them exposed to the Fire, fully humbled out of disgrace, stealing glances ˹at it˺. And the believers will say, “The ˹true˺ losers are those who have lost themselves and their families on Judgment Day.” The wrongdoers will certainly be in everlasting torment.
verses.translation: And you will see them exposed to the Fire, fully humbled out of disgrace, stealing glances ˹at it˺. And the believers will say, “The ˹true˺ losers are those who have lost themselves and their families on Judgment Day.” The wrongdoers will certainly be in everlasting torment.

verses.text: They will have no protectors to help them against Allah. And whoever Allah leaves to stray, for them there is no way. Warning to Ungrateful Disbelievers
verses.translation: They will have no protectors to help them against Allah. And whoever Allah leaves to stray, for them there is no way. Warning to Ungrateful Disbelievers

verses.text: Respond to your Lord before the coming of a Day from Allah that cannot be averted. There will be no refuge for you then, nor ˹grounds for˺ denial ˹of sins˺.[999]
verses.translation: Respond to your Lord before the coming of a Day from Allah that cannot be averted. There will be no refuge for you then, nor ˹grounds for˺ denial ˹of sins˺.[999]

verses.text: But if they turn away, We have not sent you ˹O Prophet˺ as a keeper over them. Your duty is only to deliver ˹the message˺. And indeed, when We let someone taste a mercy from Us, they become prideful ˹because˺ of it. But when afflicted with evil because of what their hands have done, then one becomes totally ungrateful.[1000] Allah’s Gift of Children
verses.translation: But if they turn away, We have not sent you ˹O Prophet˺ as a keeper over them. Your duty is only to deliver ˹the message˺. And indeed, when We let someone taste a mercy from Us, they become prideful ˹because˺ of it. But when afflicted with evil because of what their hands have done, then one becomes totally ungrateful.[1000] Allah’s Gift of Children

verses.text: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He creates whatever He wills. He blesses whoever He wills with daughters, and blesses whoever He wills with sons,
verses.translation: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He creates whatever He wills. He blesses whoever He wills with daughters, and blesses whoever He wills with sons,

verses.text: or grants both, sons and daughters, ˹to whoever He wills˺, and leaves whoever He wills infertile. He is indeed All-Knowing, Most Capable. Forms of Divine Communication
verses.translation: or grants both, sons and daughters, ˹to whoever He wills˺, and leaves whoever He wills infertile. He is indeed All-Knowing, Most Capable. Forms of Divine Communication

verses.text: It is not ˹possible˺ for a human being to have Allah communicate with them, except through inspiration, or from behind a veil, or by sending a messenger-angel to reveal whatever He wills by His permission. He is surely Most High, All-Wise. The Light of the Quran
verses.translation: It is not ˹possible˺ for a human being to have Allah communicate with them, except through inspiration, or from behind a veil, or by sending a messenger-angel to reveal whatever He wills by His permission. He is surely Most High, All-Wise. The Light of the Quran

verses.text: And so We have sent to you ˹O Prophet˺ a revelation by Our command. You did not know of ˹this˺ Book and faith ˹before˺. But We have made it a light, by which We guide whoever We will of Our servants. And you are truly leading ˹all˺ to the Straight Path—
verses.translation: And so We have sent to you ˹O Prophet˺ a revelation by Our command. You did not know of ˹this˺ Book and faith ˹before˺. But We have made it a light, by which We guide whoever We will of Our servants. And you are truly leading ˹all˺ to the Straight Path—

verses.text: the Path of Allah, to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Surely to Allah all matters will return ˹for judgment˺. *** -- 427 of 694 --
verses.translation: the Path of Allah, to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Surely to Allah all matters will return ˹for judgment˺. *** -- 427 of 694 --

name: Ornaments
intro: This Meccan sûrah takes its name from the ornaments mentioned in verse 35. The pagans are scorned for following their forefathers blindly, labelling the angels as Allah’s daughters, claiming that Mu ḥammad ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is not worthy to receive revelations because he is not rich, and for associating idols with Allah in worship, although they admit that He is the sole Creator of the heavens and the earth. Similar to the next sûrah, the pagans are warned of a horrifying punishment in Hell and the believers are promised a great reward in Paradise. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Excellence of the Quran

verses.text: Ḥâ-Mĩm.
verses.translation: Ḥâ-Mĩm.

verses.text: By the clear Book!
verses.translation: By the clear Book!

verses.text: Certainly, We have made it a Quran in Arabic so perhaps you will understand.
verses.translation: Certainly, We have made it a Quran in Arabic so perhaps you will understand.

verses.text: And indeed, it is—in the Master Record[1001] with Us—highly esteemed, rich in wisdom. Warning to the Deniers
verses.translation: And indeed, it is—in the Master Record[1001] with Us—highly esteemed, rich in wisdom. Warning to the Deniers

verses.text: Should We then turn the ˹Quranic˺ Reminder away from you ˹simply˺ because you have been a transgressing people?
verses.translation: Should We then turn the ˹Quranic˺ Reminder away from you ˹simply˺ because you have been a transgressing people?

verses.text: ˹Imagine˺ how many prophets We sent to those ˹destroyed˺ before!
verses.translation: ˹Imagine˺ how many prophets We sent to those ˹destroyed˺ before!

verses.text: But no prophet ever came to them without being mocked.
verses.translation: But no prophet ever came to them without being mocked.

verses.text: So We destroyed those who were far mightier than these ˹Meccans˺. The examples of ˹their˺ predecessors have ˹already˺ been related.[1002] Allah Is the Creator
verses.translation: So We destroyed those who were far mightier than these ˹Meccans˺. The examples of ˹their˺ predecessors have ˹already˺ been related.[1002] Allah Is the Creator

verses.text: If you ask them ˹O Prophet˺ who created the heavens and the earth, they will certainly say, “The Almighty, All-Knowing did.”
verses.translation: If you ask them ˹O Prophet˺ who created the heavens and the earth, they will certainly say, “The Almighty, All-Knowing did.”

verses.text: ˹He is the One˺ Who has laid out the earth for you, and set in it pathways for you so that you may find your way.
verses.translation: ˹He is the One˺ Who has laid out the earth for you, and set in it pathways for you so that you may find your way.

verses.text: And ˹He is the One˺ Who sends down rain from the sky in perfect measure, with which We give life to a lifeless land. And so will you be brought forth ˹from the grave˺.
verses.translation: And ˹He is the One˺ Who sends down rain from the sky in perfect measure, with which We give life to a lifeless land. And so will you be brought forth ˹from the grave˺.

verses.text: And ˹He is the One˺ Who created all ˹things in˺ pairs,[1003] and made for you ships and animals to ride
verses.translation: And ˹He is the One˺ Who created all ˹things in˺ pairs,[1003] and made for you ships and animals to ride

verses.text: so that you may sit firmly on their backs, and remember your Lord’s blessings once you are settled on them, saying, “Glory be to the One Who has subjected these for us, for we could have never done so ˹on our own˺.
verses.translation: so that you may sit firmly on their backs, and remember your Lord’s blessings once you are settled on them, saying, “Glory be to the One Who has subjected these for us, for we could have never done so ˹on our own˺.

verses.text: And surely to our Lord we will ˹all˺ return.” Allah’s Daughters?
verses.translation: And surely to our Lord we will ˹all˺ return.” Allah’s Daughters?

verses.text: Still the pagans have made some of His creation out to be a part of Him. [1004] Indeed, humankind is clearly ungrateful.
verses.translation: Still the pagans have made some of His creation out to be a part of Him. [1004] Indeed, humankind is clearly ungrateful.

verses.text: Has He taken ˹angels as His˺ daughters from what He created, and favoured you ˹O pagans˺ with sons?
verses.translation: Has He taken ˹angels as His˺ daughters from what He created, and favoured you ˹O pagans˺ with sons?

verses.text: Whenever one of them is given the good news of what they attribute to the Most Compassionate,[1005] his face grows gloomy, as he suppresses his rage.
verses.translation: Whenever one of them is given the good news of what they attribute to the Most Compassionate,[1005] his face grows gloomy, as he suppresses his rage.

verses.text: ˹Do they attribute to Him˺ those who are brought up in fineries and are not commanding in disputes?
verses.translation: ˹Do they attribute to Him˺ those who are brought up in fineries and are not commanding in disputes?

verses.text: Still they have labelled the angels, who are servants of the Most Compassionate, as female. Did they witness their creation? Their statement will be recorded, and they will be questioned! Blind Following
verses.translation: Still they have labelled the angels, who are servants of the Most Compassionate, as female. Did they witness their creation? Their statement will be recorded, and they will be questioned! Blind Following

verses.text: And they argue, “Had the Most Compassionate willed, we would have never worshipped them.” They have no knowledge ˹in support˺ of this ˹claim˺. They do nothing but lie.
verses.translation: And they argue, “Had the Most Compassionate willed, we would have never worshipped them.” They have no knowledge ˹in support˺ of this ˹claim˺. They do nothing but lie.

verses.text: Or have We given them a Book ˹for proof˺, before this ˹Quran˺, to which they are holding firm?
verses.translation: Or have We given them a Book ˹for proof˺, before this ˹Quran˺, to which they are holding firm?

verses.text: In fact, they say, “We found our forefathers following a ˹particular˺ way, and we are following in their footsteps.”
verses.translation: In fact, they say, “We found our forefathers following a ˹particular˺ way, and we are following in their footsteps.”

verses.text: Similarly, whenever We sent a warner to a society before you ˹O Prophet˺, its ˹spoiled˺ elite would say, “We found our forefathers following a ˹particular˺ way, and we are walking in their footsteps.”
verses.translation: Similarly, whenever We sent a warner to a society before you ˹O Prophet˺, its ˹spoiled˺ elite would say, “We found our forefathers following a ˹particular˺ way, and we are walking in their footsteps.”

verses.text: Each ˹warner˺ asked, “Even if what I brought you is better guidance than what you found your forefathers practicing?” They replied, “We totally reject whatever you have been sent with.”
verses.translation: Each ˹warner˺ asked, “Even if what I brought you is better guidance than what you found your forefathers practicing?” They replied, “We totally reject whatever you have been sent with.”

verses.text: So We inflicted punishment upon them. See then what was the fate of the deniers! The Case of Abraham’s People
verses.translation: So We inflicted punishment upon them. See then what was the fate of the deniers! The Case of Abraham’s People

name: The Haze
intro: This Meccan sûrah takes its name from the haze (caused by drought), which is mentioned in verse 10. Similar to the previous sûrah, the Meccan pagans are equated with Pharaoh’s people for going back on their promise of full submission to Allah once the plague is removed from them. The Quran is said to have been revealed on a blessed night for the guidance of humanity. Those who embrace its guidance will be honoured in Paradise and those who reject it will be debased in Hell. This fate is the underlying theme in the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful The Quran as a Mercy

verses.translation: as ˹an act of˺ grace from your Lord. That is ˹truly˺ the ultimate triumph. The Quran Is Easy

verses.text: Indeed, We have made this ˹Quran˺ easy in your own language ˹O Prophet˺ so perhaps they will be mindful.
verses.translation: Indeed, We have made this ˹Quran˺ easy in your own language ˹O Prophet˺ so perhaps they will be mindful.

verses.text: Wait then! They too are certainly waiting. *** -- 436 of 694 --
verses.translation: Wait then! They too are certainly waiting. *** -- 436 of 694 --

name: The Kneeling
intro: This Meccan sûrah, which takes its name from the kneeling of every faith- community on Judgment Day mentioned in verse 28, is critical of those who turn away from Allah’s revelations, deny the Resurrection, ridicule the truth, and fail to appreciate Allah’s countless favours and marvels of creation. The dreadful judgment of these deniers is featured in the last part of the sûrah. All these themes are emphasized in the next sûrah as well. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Allah’s Signs

verses.text: Ḥâ-Mĩm.
verses.translation: Ḥâ-Mĩm.

verses.text: The revelation of this Book is from Allah—the Almighty, All-Wise.
verses.translation: The revelation of this Book is from Allah—the Almighty, All-Wise.

verses.text: Surely in ˹the creation of˺ the heavens and the earth are signs for the believers.
verses.translation: Surely in ˹the creation of˺ the heavens and the earth are signs for the believers.

verses.text: And in your own creation, and whatever living beings He dispersed, are signs for people of sure faith.
verses.translation: And in your own creation, and whatever living beings He dispersed, are signs for people of sure faith.

verses.text: And ˹in˺ the alternation of the day and the night, the provision[1027] sent down from the skies by Allah —reviving the earth after its death—and the shifting of the winds, are signs for people of understanding.
verses.translation: And ˹in˺ the alternation of the day and the night, the provision[1027] sent down from the skies by Allah —reviving the earth after its death—and the shifting of the winds, are signs for people of understanding.

verses.text: These are Allah’s revelations which We recite to you ˹O Prophet˺ in truth. So what message will they believe in after ˹denying˺ Allah and His revelations? Warning to the Deniers
verses.translation: These are Allah’s revelations which We recite to you ˹O Prophet˺ in truth. So what message will they believe in after ˹denying˺ Allah and His revelations? Warning to the Deniers

verses.text: Woe to every sinful liar.
verses.translation: Woe to every sinful liar.

verses.text: They hear Allah’s revelations recited to them, then persist ˹in denial˺ arrogantly as if they did not hear them. So give them good news of a painful punishment.
verses.translation: They hear Allah’s revelations recited to them, then persist ˹in denial˺ arrogantly as if they did not hear them. So give them good news of a painful punishment.

verses.text: And whenever they learn anything of Our revelations, they make a mockery of it. It is they who will suffer a humiliating punishment.
verses.translation: And whenever they learn anything of Our revelations, they make a mockery of it. It is they who will suffer a humiliating punishment.

verses.text: Awaiting them is Hell. Their ˹worldly˺ gains will not be of any benefit to them whatsoever, nor will those protectors they have taken besides Allah. And they will suffer a tremendous punishment.
verses.translation: Awaiting them is Hell. Their ˹worldly˺ gains will not be of any benefit to them whatsoever, nor will those protectors they have taken besides Allah. And they will suffer a tremendous punishment.

verses.text: This ˹Quran˺ is ˹true˺ guidance. And those who deny their Lord’s revelations will suffer the ˹worst˺ torment of agonizing pain. Allah’s Favours to Humanity
verses.translation: This ˹Quran˺ is ˹true˺ guidance. And those who deny their Lord’s revelations will suffer the ˹worst˺ torment of agonizing pain. Allah’s Favours to Humanity

verses.text: Allah is the One Who has subjected the sea for you so that ships may sail upon it by His command, and that you may seek His bounty, and that perhaps you will be grateful.
verses.translation: Allah is the One Who has subjected the sea for you so that ships may sail upon it by His command, and that you may seek His bounty, and that perhaps you will be grateful.

verses.text: He ˹also˺ subjected for you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth—all by His grace. Surely in this are signs for people who reflect. Advice to the Believers
verses.translation: He ˹also˺ subjected for you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth—all by His grace. Surely in this are signs for people who reflect. Advice to the Believers

verses.text: ˹O Prophet!˺ Tell the believers to forgive those who do not fear Allah’s days ˹of torment˺, so that He will reward each group for what they used to commit.
verses.translation: ˹O Prophet!˺ Tell the believers to forgive those who do not fear Allah’s days ˹of torment˺, so that He will reward each group for what they used to commit.

verses.text: Whoever does good, it is to their own benefit. And whoever does evil, it is to their own loss. Then to your Lord you will ˹all˺ be returned. Differences Among the Israelites
verses.translation: Whoever does good, it is to their own benefit. And whoever does evil, it is to their own loss. Then to your Lord you will ˹all˺ be returned. Differences Among the Israelites

verses.text: Indeed, We gave the Children of Israel the Scripture, wisdom, and prophethood; granted them good, lawful provisions; and favoured them above the others.[1028]
verses.translation: Indeed, We gave the Children of Israel the Scripture, wisdom, and prophethood; granted them good, lawful provisions; and favoured them above the others.[1028]

verses.text: We ˹also˺ gave them clear commandments regarding ˹their˺ faith. But it was not until knowledge came to them that they differed out of mutual envy.[1029] Surely your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Judgment regarding their differences. Advice to the Prophet
verses.translation: We ˹also˺ gave them clear commandments regarding ˹their˺ faith. But it was not until knowledge came to them that they differed out of mutual envy.[1029] Surely your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Judgment regarding their differences. Advice to the Prophet

verses.text: Now We have set you ˹O Prophet˺ on the ˹clear˺ Way of faith. So follow it, and do not follow the desires of those who do not know ˹the truth˺.
verses.translation: Now We have set you ˹O Prophet˺ on the ˹clear˺ Way of faith. So follow it, and do not follow the desires of those who do not know ˹the truth˺.

verses.text: They certainly can be of no benefit to you against Allah whatsoever. Surely the wrongdoers are patrons of each other, whereas Allah is the Patron of the righteous.
verses.translation: They certainly can be of no benefit to you against Allah whatsoever. Surely the wrongdoers are patrons of each other, whereas Allah is the Patron of the righteous.

verses.text: This ˹Quran˺ is an insight for humanity—a guide and mercy for people of sure faith. Good and Evil Are Not Equal
verses.translation: This ˹Quran˺ is an insight for humanity—a guide and mercy for people of sure faith. Good and Evil Are Not Equal

verses.text: Or do those who commit evil deeds ˹simply˺ think that We will make them equal—in their life and after their death—to those who believe and do good? How wrong is their judgment!
verses.translation: Or do those who commit evil deeds ˹simply˺ think that We will make them equal—in their life and after their death—to those who believe and do good? How wrong is their judgment!

verses.text: For Allah created the heavens and the earth for a purpose, so that every soul may be paid back for what it has committed. And none will be wronged. Those Led by Desire
verses.translation: For Allah created the heavens and the earth for a purpose, so that every soul may be paid back for what it has committed. And none will be wronged. Those Led by Desire

verses.text: Have you seen ˹O Prophet˺ those who have taken their own desires as their god? ˹And so˺ Allah left them to stray knowingly, sealed their hearing and hearts, and placed a cover on their sight. Who then can guide them after Allah? Will you ˹all˺ not then be mindful? Arguments of the Deniers of Resurrection
verses.translation: Have you seen ˹O Prophet˺ those who have taken their own desires as their god? ˹And so˺ Allah left them to stray knowingly, sealed their hearing and hearts, and placed a cover on their sight. Who then can guide them after Allah? Will you ˹all˺ not then be mindful? Arguments of the Deniers of Resurrection

verses.text: And they argue, “There is nothing beyond our worldly life. We die; others are born. And nothing destroys us but ˹the passage of˺ time.” Yet they have no knowledge ˹in support˺ of this ˹claim˺. They only speculate.
verses.translation: And they argue, “There is nothing beyond our worldly life. We die; others are born. And nothing destroys us but ˹the passage of˺ time.” Yet they have no knowledge ˹in support˺ of this ˹claim˺. They only speculate.

verses.text: And whenever Our clear revelations are recited to them, their only argument is to say: “Bring our forefathers back, if what you say is true!”
verses.translation: And whenever Our clear revelations are recited to them, their only argument is to say: “Bring our forefathers back, if what you say is true!”

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “˹It is˺ Allah ˹Who˺ gives you life, then causes you to die, then will gather you ˹all˺ on the Day of Judgment, about which there is no doubt. But most people do not know.” The Judgment
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “˹It is˺ Allah ˹Who˺ gives you life, then causes you to die, then will gather you ˹all˺ on the Day of Judgment, about which there is no doubt. But most people do not know.” The Judgment

verses.text: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. On the Day the Hour will be established, the people of falsehood will then be in ˹total˺ loss.
verses.translation: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. On the Day the Hour will be established, the people of falsehood will then be in ˹total˺ loss.

verses.text: And you will see every faith-community on its knees. Every community will be summoned to its record ˹of deeds˺. ˹They all will be told,˺ “This Day you will be rewarded for what you used to do.
verses.translation: And you will see every faith-community on its knees. Every community will be summoned to its record ˹of deeds˺. ˹They all will be told,˺ “This Day you will be rewarded for what you used to do.

verses.text: This record of Ours speaks the truth about you. Indeed, We always had your deeds recorded ˹by the angels˺.” Reward of the Believers
verses.translation: This record of Ours speaks the truth about you. Indeed, We always had your deeds recorded ˹by the angels˺.” Reward of the Believers

verses.text: As for those who believed and did good, their Lord will admit them into His mercy. That is ˹truly˺ the absolute triumph. Punishment of the Disbelievers
verses.translation: As for those who believed and did good, their Lord will admit them into His mercy. That is ˹truly˺ the absolute triumph. Punishment of the Disbelievers

verses.text: And as for those who disbelieved, ˹they will be told,˺ “Were My revelations not recited to you, yet you acted arrogantly and were a wicked people?
verses.translation: And as for those who disbelieved, ˹they will be told,˺ “Were My revelations not recited to you, yet you acted arrogantly and were a wicked people?

verses.text: And whenever it was said ˹to you˺, ‘Surely Allah’s promise ˹of judgment˺ is true and there is no doubt about the Hour,’ you said ˹mockingly˺, ‘We do not know what the Hour is! We think it is no more than speculation, and we are not convinced ˹that it will ever come˺.’”
verses.translation: And whenever it was said ˹to you˺, ‘Surely Allah’s promise ˹of judgment˺ is true and there is no doubt about the Hour,’ you said ˹mockingly˺, ‘We do not know what the Hour is! We think it is no more than speculation, and we are not convinced ˹that it will ever come˺.’”

verses.text: And the evil ˹consequences˺ of their deeds will unfold before them, and they will be overwhelmed by what they used to ridicule.
verses.translation: And the evil ˹consequences˺ of their deeds will unfold before them, and they will be overwhelmed by what they used to ridicule.

verses.text: It will be said, “This Day We will neglect you as you neglected the meeting of this Day of yours! Your home will be the Fire, and you will have no helpers.
verses.translation: It will be said, “This Day We will neglect you as you neglected the meeting of this Day of yours! Your home will be the Fire, and you will have no helpers.

verses.text: This is because you made a mockery of Allah’s revelations, and were deluded by ˹your˺ worldly life.” So ˹from˺ that Day ˹on˺ they will not be taken out of the Fire, nor will they be allowed to appease ˹their Lord˺. Praises to the Almighty
verses.translation: This is because you made a mockery of Allah’s revelations, and were deluded by ˹your˺ worldly life.” So ˹from˺ that Day ˹on˺ they will not be taken out of the Fire, nor will they be allowed to appease ˹their Lord˺. Praises to the Almighty

verses.text: So all praise is for Allah—Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, Lord of all worlds.
verses.translation: So all praise is for Allah—Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, Lord of all worlds.

verses.text: To Him belongs ˹all˺ Majesty in the heavens and the earth. And He is the Almighty, All-Wise. *** -- 440 of 694 --
verses.translation: To Him belongs ˹all˺ Majesty in the heavens and the earth. And He is the Almighty, All-Wise. *** -- 440 of 694 --

name: The Sand-Hills
intro: This Meccan sûrah takes its name from the sand-hills mentioned in verse 21 in the story of the people of Hûd ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) who were destroyed for their disbelief, even though they were far superior to the Arab pagans (verses 21- 28). Again, Allah’s infinite power is contrasted with the powerlessness of the idols. The pagan arguments against the Quran and the Resurrection are refuted, and reference is made to a group of jinn who readily embraced the truth once they heard the Prophet’s recitation of the Quran. The Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is urged to be patient, and reminded of the fate awaiting those who challenge the truth at the end of this sûrah and the beginning of the next. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful A Message to Idolaters

verses.text: Ḥâ-Mĩm.
verses.translation: Ḥâ-Mĩm.

verses.text: The revelation of this Book is from Allah—the Almighty, All-Wise.
verses.translation: The revelation of this Book is from Allah—the Almighty, All-Wise.

verses.text: We only created the heavens and the earth and everything in between for a purpose and an appointed term. Yet the disbelievers are turning away from what they have been warned about.
verses.translation: We only created the heavens and the earth and everything in between for a purpose and an appointed term. Yet the disbelievers are turning away from what they have been warned about.

verses.text: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Have you considered whatever ˹idols˺ you invoke besides Allah? Show me what they have created on earth! Or do they have a share in ˹the creation of˺ the heavens? Bring me a scripture ˹revealed˺ before this ˹Quran˺ or a shred of knowledge, if what you say is true.”
verses.translation: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Have you considered whatever ˹idols˺ you invoke besides Allah? Show me what they have created on earth! Or do they have a share in ˹the creation of˺ the heavens? Bring me a scripture ˹revealed˺ before this ˹Quran˺ or a shred of knowledge, if what you say is true.”

verses.text: And who could be more astray than those who call upon others besides Allah—˹others˺ that cannot respond to them until the Day of Judgment, and are ˹even˺ unaware of their calls?
verses.translation: And who could be more astray than those who call upon others besides Allah—˹others˺ that cannot respond to them until the Day of Judgment, and are ˹even˺ unaware of their calls?

verses.text: And when ˹such˺ people will be gathered together, those ˹gods˺ will be their enemies and will disown their worship. Pagan Denial of the Quran
verses.translation: And when ˹such˺ people will be gathered together, those ˹gods˺ will be their enemies and will disown their worship. Pagan Denial of the Quran

verses.text: Whenever Our clear revelations are recited to them, the disbelievers say of the truth when it has come to them, “This is pure magic.”
verses.translation: Whenever Our clear revelations are recited to them, the disbelievers say of the truth when it has come to them, “This is pure magic.”

verses.text: Or do they say, “He[1030] has fabricated this ˹Quran˺!”? Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “If I have done so, then there is nothing whatsoever you can do to save me from Allah. He knows best what ˹slurs˺ you indulge about it. Sufficient is He as a Witness between you and me. And He is the All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.”
verses.translation: Or do they say, “He[1030] has fabricated this ˹Quran˺!”? Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “If I have done so, then there is nothing whatsoever you can do to save me from Allah. He knows best what ˹slurs˺ you indulge about it. Sufficient is He as a Witness between you and me. And He is the All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.”

verses.text: Say, “I am not the first messenger ever sent, nor do I know what will happen to me or you. I only follow what is revealed to me. And I am only sent with a clear warning.” Pagan Arrogance Towards Allah
verses.translation: Say, “I am not the first messenger ever sent, nor do I know what will happen to me or you. I only follow what is revealed to me. And I am only sent with a clear warning.” Pagan Arrogance Towards Allah

verses.text: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Consider if this ˹Quran˺ is ˹truly˺ from Allah and you deny it, and a witness from the Children of Israel attests to it and then believes,[1031] whereas you act arrogantly. Surely Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.” Belittling the Quran
verses.translation: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “Consider if this ˹Quran˺ is ˹truly˺ from Allah and you deny it, and a witness from the Children of Israel attests to it and then believes,[1031] whereas you act arrogantly. Surely Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.” Belittling the Quran

verses.text: The disbelievers say of the believers, “Had it been ˹something˺ good, they[1032] would not have beaten us to it.” Now since they reject its guidance, they will say, “˹This is˺ an ancient fabrication!”
verses.translation: The disbelievers say of the believers, “Had it been ˹something˺ good, they[1032] would not have beaten us to it.” Now since they reject its guidance, they will say, “˹This is˺ an ancient fabrication!”

verses.text: And before this ˹Quran˺ the Book of Moses was ˹revealed as˺ a guide and mercy. And this Book is a confirmation, in the Arabic tongue, to warn those who do wrong, and as good news to those who do good. Reward of the Devout
verses.translation: And before this ˹Quran˺ the Book of Moses was ˹revealed as˺ a guide and mercy. And this Book is a confirmation, in the Arabic tongue, to warn those who do wrong, and as good news to those who do good. Reward of the Devout

verses.text: Surely those who say, “Our Lord is Allah,” and then remain steadfast— there will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve.
verses.translation: Surely those who say, “Our Lord is Allah,” and then remain steadfast— there will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve.

verses.text: It is they who will be the residents of Paradise, staying there forever, as a reward for what they used to do. Stance of the Faithful
verses.translation: It is they who will be the residents of Paradise, staying there forever, as a reward for what they used to do. Stance of the Faithful

verses.text: We have commanded people to honour their parents. Their mothers bore them in hardship and delivered them in hardship. Their ˹period of˺ bearing and weaning is thirty months. In time, when the child reaches their prime at the age of forty, they pray, “My Lord! Inspire me to ˹always˺ be thankful for Your favours which You blessed me and my parents with, and to do good deeds that please You. And instil righteousness in my offspring. I truly repent to You, and I truly submit ˹to Your Will˺.”
verses.translation: We have commanded people to honour their parents. Their mothers bore them in hardship and delivered them in hardship. Their ˹period of˺ bearing and weaning is thirty months. In time, when the child reaches their prime at the age of forty, they pray, “My Lord! Inspire me to ˹always˺ be thankful for Your favours which You blessed me and my parents with, and to do good deeds that please You. And instil righteousness in my offspring. I truly repent to You, and I truly submit ˹to Your Will˺.”

verses.text: It is from these ˹people˺ that We will accept the good they did, and overlook their misdeeds —along with the residents of Paradise, ˹in fulfilment of˺ the true promise they have been given. Stance of the Deniers
verses.translation: It is from these ˹people˺ that We will accept the good they did, and overlook their misdeeds —along with the residents of Paradise, ˹in fulfilment of˺ the true promise they have been given. Stance of the Deniers

verses.text: But some scold their parents, “Enough with you! Are you warning me that I will be brought forth ˹from the grave˺, while many generations had already perished before me ˹for good˺?” The parents cry to Allah for help, ˹and warn their child,˺ “Pity you. Have faith! Surely Allah’s promise is true.” But the deniers insist, “This is nothing but ancient fables.”
verses.translation: But some scold their parents, “Enough with you! Are you warning me that I will be brought forth ˹from the grave˺, while many generations had already perished before me ˹for good˺?” The parents cry to Allah for help, ˹and warn their child,˺ “Pity you. Have faith! Surely Allah’s promise is true.” But the deniers insist, “This is nothing but ancient fables.”

verses.text: These are the ones against whom the fate of earlier communities of jinn and humans has been justified, ˹for˺ they were truly losers. Reward of the Faithful and the Deniers
verses.translation: These are the ones against whom the fate of earlier communities of jinn and humans has been justified, ˹for˺ they were truly losers. Reward of the Faithful and the Deniers

verses.text: Each ˹of the two groups˺ will be ranked according to what they have done so He may fully reward all. And none will be wronged.
verses.translation: Each ˹of the two groups˺ will be ranked according to what they have done so He may fully reward all. And none will be wronged.

verses.text: ˹Watch for˺ the Day ˹when˺ the disbelievers will be exposed to the Fire. ˹They will be told,˺ “You ˹already˺ exhausted your ˹share of˺ pleasures during your worldly life, and ˹fully˺ enjoyed them. So Today you will be rewarded with the torment of disgrace for your arrogance throughout the land with no right, and for your rebelliousness.” Prophet Hûd
verses.translation: ˹Watch for˺ the Day ˹when˺ the disbelievers will be exposed to the Fire. ˹They will be told,˺ “You ˹already˺ exhausted your ˹share of˺ pleasures during your worldly life, and ˹fully˺ enjoyed them. So Today you will be rewarded with the torment of disgrace for your arrogance throughout the land with no right, and for your rebelliousness.” Prophet Hûd

verses.text: And remember the brother of ’Ȃd, when he warned his people, who inhabited the sand-hills[1033]—there were certainly warners before and after him—˹saying,˺ “Worship none but Allah. I truly fear for you the torment of a tremendous day.”
verses.translation: And remember the brother of ’Ȃd, when he warned his people, who inhabited the sand-hills[1033]—there were certainly warners before and after him—˹saying,˺ “Worship none but Allah. I truly fear for you the torment of a tremendous day.”

verses.text: They argued, “Have you come to turn us away from our gods? Bring us then whatever you threaten us with, if what you say is true.”
verses.translation: They argued, “Have you come to turn us away from our gods? Bring us then whatever you threaten us with, if what you say is true.”

verses.text: He responded, “The knowledge ˹of its time˺ is only with Allah. I only convey to you what I have been sent with. But I can see that you are a people acting ignorantly.”
verses.translation: He responded, “The knowledge ˹of its time˺ is only with Allah. I only convey to you what I have been sent with. But I can see that you are a people acting ignorantly.”

verses.text: Then when they saw the torment as a ˹dense˺ cloud approaching their valleys, they said ˹happily˺, “This is a cloud bringing us rain.” ˹But Hûd replied,˺ “No, it is what you sought to hasten: a ˹fierce˺ wind carrying a painful punishment!”
verses.translation: Then when they saw the torment as a ˹dense˺ cloud approaching their valleys, they said ˹happily˺, “This is a cloud bringing us rain.” ˹But Hûd replied,˺ “No, it is what you sought to hasten: a ˹fierce˺ wind carrying a painful punishment!”

verses.text: It destroyed everything by the command of its Lord, leaving nothing visible except their ruins. This is how We reward the wicked people. Warning to Meccan Pagans
verses.translation: It destroyed everything by the command of its Lord, leaving nothing visible except their ruins. This is how We reward the wicked people. Warning to Meccan Pagans

verses.text: Indeed, We had established them[1034] in a way We have not established you ˹Meccans˺. And We gave them hearing, sight, and intellect. But neither their hearing, sight, nor intellect were of any benefit to them whatsoever, since they persisted in denying Allah’s signs. And ˹so˺ they were overwhelmed by what they used to ridicule.
verses.translation: Indeed, We had established them[1034] in a way We have not established you ˹Meccans˺. And We gave them hearing, sight, and intellect. But neither their hearing, sight, nor intellect were of any benefit to them whatsoever, since they persisted in denying Allah’s signs. And ˹so˺ they were overwhelmed by what they used to ridicule.

verses.text: We certainly destroyed the societies around you after having varied the signs so perhaps they would return ˹to the Right Path˺.
verses.translation: We certainly destroyed the societies around you after having varied the signs so perhaps they would return ˹to the Right Path˺.

verses.text: Why then did those ˹idols˺ they took as gods —hoping to get closer ˹to Him˺—not come to their aid? Instead, they failed them. That is ˹the result of˺ their lies and their fabrications. The Jinn Listen to the Quran
verses.translation: Why then did those ˹idols˺ they took as gods —hoping to get closer ˹to Him˺—not come to their aid? Instead, they failed them. That is ˹the result of˺ their lies and their fabrications. The Jinn Listen to the Quran

verses.text: ˹Remember, O Prophet,˺ when We sent a group of jinn your way to listen to the Quran. Then, upon hearing it, they said ˹to one another˺, “Listen quietly!” Then when it was over, they returned to their fellow jinn as warners.
verses.translation: ˹Remember, O Prophet,˺ when We sent a group of jinn your way to listen to the Quran. Then, upon hearing it, they said ˹to one another˺, “Listen quietly!” Then when it was over, they returned to their fellow jinn as warners.

verses.text: They declared, “O our fellow jinn! We have truly heard a scripture revealed after Moses, confirming what came before it. It guides to the truth and the Straight Way.
verses.translation: They declared, “O our fellow jinn! We have truly heard a scripture revealed after Moses, confirming what came before it. It guides to the truth and the Straight Way.

verses.text: O our fellow jinn! Respond to the caller of Allah and believe in him, He will forgive your sins and protect you from a painful punishment.
verses.translation: O our fellow jinn! Respond to the caller of Allah and believe in him, He will forgive your sins and protect you from a painful punishment.

verses.text: And whoever does not respond to the caller of Allah will have no escape on earth, nor will they have any protectors against Him. It is they who are clearly astray.” Warning to Deniers of Resurrection
verses.translation: And whoever does not respond to the caller of Allah will have no escape on earth, nor will they have any protectors against Him. It is they who are clearly astray.” Warning to Deniers of Resurrection

verses.text: Do they not realize that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth and did not tire in creating them,[1035] is able to give life to the dead? Yes ˹indeed˺! He is certainly Most Capable of everything.

name: Muḥammad
intro: This Medinian sûrah, which takes its title from the Prophet’s name in verse 2, discusses the etiquette of fighting in the battlefield. The faithful believers are promised different types of rivers and delicacies in Paradise, whereas the disbelievers and the hypocrites are warned of an evil fate. To preserve the reward of their good deeds, the believers are urged to strive in the Way of Allah and donate in His cause, culminating in the clear triumph in the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Reward of the Believers and Disbelievers

verses.text: Those who disbelieve and hinder ˹others˺ from the Way of Allah, He will render their deeds void.
verses.translation: Those who disbelieve and hinder ˹others˺ from the Way of Allah, He will render their deeds void.

verses.text: As for those who believe, do good, and have faith in what has been revealed to Muḥammad—which is the truth from their Lord—He will absolve them of their sins and improve their condition.
verses.translation: As for those who believe, do good, and have faith in what has been revealed to Muḥammad—which is the truth from their Lord—He will absolve them of their sins and improve their condition.

verses.text: This is because the disbelievers follow falsehood, while the believers follow the truth from their Lord. This is how Allah shows people their true state ˹of faith˺. Rules of Engagement[1038]
verses.translation: This is because the disbelievers follow falsehood, while the believers follow the truth from their Lord. This is how Allah shows people their true state ˹of faith˺. Rules of Engagement[1038]

verses.text: So when you meet the disbelievers ˹in battle˺, strike ˹their˺ necks until you have thoroughly subdued them, then bind them firmly. Later ˹free them either as˺ an act of grace or by ransom until the war comes to an end. So will it be. Had Allah willed, He ˹Himself˺ could have inflicted punishment on them. But He does ˹this only to˺ test some of you by means of others. And those who are martyred in the cause of Allah,[1039] He will never render their deeds void.

verses.translation: and admit them into Paradise, having made it known to them.[1040] Warning to the Deniers

verses.translation: O believers! If you stand up for Allah, He will help you and make your steps firm.

verses.text: As for the disbelievers, may they be doomed and may He render their deeds void.
verses.translation: As for the disbelievers, may they be doomed and may He render their deeds void.

verses.translation: That is because they detest what Allah has revealed, so He has rendered their deeds void.

verses.translation: Have they not travelled throughout the land to see what was the end of those before them? Allah annihilated them, and a similar fate awaits the disbelievers.

verses.translation: This is because Allah is the Patron of the believers while the disbelievers have no patron. The Final Destination

verses.translation: ˹Imagine, O Prophet,˺ how many societies We destroyed that were far superior in might than your society—which drove you out—and there was none to help them!

verses.translation: O believers! Obey Allah and obey the Messenger, and do not let your deeds be in vain.

verses.translation: Surely those who disbelieve, hinder ˹others˺ from the Way of Allah, and then die as disbelievers; Allah will never forgive them.

verses.text: So do not falter or cry for peace, for you will have the upper hand and Allah is with you. And He will never let your deeds go to waste. Test of Faith
verses.translation: So do not falter or cry for peace, for you will have the upper hand and Allah is with you. And He will never let your deeds go to waste. Test of Faith

verses.text: This worldly life is no more than play and amusement. But if you are faithful and mindful ˹of Allah˺, He will grant you your ˹full˺ reward, and will not ask you ˹to donate all˺ your wealth.
verses.translation: This worldly life is no more than play and amusement. But if you are faithful and mindful ˹of Allah˺, He will grant you your ˹full˺ reward, and will not ask you ˹to donate all˺ your wealth.

verses.translation: If He were to do so and pressure you, you would withhold and He would bring out your resentment.

name: The Triumph
intro: This Medinian sûrah takes its name from the clear triumph (i.e., Treaty of Ḥudaibiyah) in verse

verses.text: The Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) and 1400 of his companions travelled to Mecca to perform the minor pilgrimage (’umrah) in 6 A.H./628 C.E. He ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) sent ’Uthmân ibn ’Affân to let the Meccans know that the Muslims had come in peace, only to visit the Sacred House. When the Meccans delayed ’Uthmân, the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) thought they might have killed his envoy. So he ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) called upon the faithful to pledge allegiance to him under a tree at Ḥudaibiyah in the outskirts of Mecca. Shortly after, ’Uthmân returned safely and a peace agreement was signed by the Muslims and Meccan pagans, stating in part that the Muslims would have to return to Medina and come back next year for ’umrah. The Treaty of Ḥudaibiyah is described as a clear triumph since it established peace, temporarily diffused the tension between the Muslims and the Meccan pagans, and gave the Muslims plenty of time to spread awareness and understanding of their faith. Thousands from different tribes accepted Islam during that truce. The sûrah commends the believers for proving true to Allah and His Messenger, criticizes the hypocrites for not marching forth with the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص), and condemns the pagans for denying the believers access to the Sacred House. The description of the true believers both in the Torah and the Gospel is given at the end of the sûrah, followed by instructions on proper conduct with the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) and other believers in the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Treaty of Ḥudaibiyah

verses.text: Indeed, We have granted you a clear triumph ˹O Prophet˺
verses.translation: Indeed, We have granted you a clear triumph ˹O Prophet˺

verses.text: so that Allah may forgive you for your past and future shortcomings,[1046] perfect His favour upon you, guide you along the Straight Path,
verses.translation: so that Allah may forgive you for your past and future shortcomings,[1046] perfect His favour upon you, guide you along the Straight Path,

verses.text: and so that Allah will help you tremendously.
verses.translation: and so that Allah will help you tremendously.

verses.text: He is the One Who sent down serenity upon the hearts of the believers so that they may increase even more in their faith. To Allah ˹alone˺ belong the forces of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
verses.translation: He is the One Who sent down serenity upon the hearts of the believers so that they may increase even more in their faith. To Allah ˹alone˺ belong the forces of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

verses.text: So He may admit believing men and women into Gardens under which rivers flow—to stay there forever—and absolve them of their sins. And that is a supreme achievement in the sight of Allah.
verses.translation: So He may admit believing men and women into Gardens under which rivers flow—to stay there forever—and absolve them of their sins. And that is a supreme achievement in the sight of Allah.

verses.text: Also ˹so that˺ He may punish hypocrite men and women and polytheistic men and women, who harbour evil thoughts of Allah.[1047] May ill-fate befall them! Allah is displeased with them. He has condemned them and prepared for them Hell. What an evil destination!
verses.translation: Also ˹so that˺ He may punish hypocrite men and women and polytheistic men and women, who harbour evil thoughts of Allah.[1047] May ill-fate befall them! Allah is displeased with them. He has condemned them and prepared for them Hell. What an evil destination!

verses.text: To Allah ˹alone˺ belong the forces of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is Almighty, All-Wise. The Prophet’s Duty
verses.translation: To Allah ˹alone˺ belong the forces of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is Almighty, All-Wise. The Prophet’s Duty

verses.text: Indeed, ˹O Prophet,˺ We have sent you as a witness, a deliverer of good news, and a warner,
verses.translation: Indeed, ˹O Prophet,˺ We have sent you as a witness, a deliverer of good news, and a warner,

verses.text: so that you ˹believers˺ may have faith in Allah and His Messenger, support and honour him, and glorify Allah morning and evening.[1048] Allegiance Under the Tree[1049]
verses.translation: so that you ˹believers˺ may have faith in Allah and His Messenger, support and honour him, and glorify Allah morning and evening.[1048] Allegiance Under the Tree[1049]

verses.text: Surely those who pledge allegiance to you ˹O Prophet˺ are actually pledging allegiance to Allah. Allah’s Hand is over theirs. Whoever breaks their pledge, it will only be to their own loss. And whoever fulfils their pledge to Allah, He will grant them a great reward. Fake Excuses for Not Travelling to Mecca
verses.translation: Surely those who pledge allegiance to you ˹O Prophet˺ are actually pledging allegiance to Allah. Allah’s Hand is over theirs. Whoever breaks their pledge, it will only be to their own loss. And whoever fulfils their pledge to Allah, He will grant them a great reward. Fake Excuses for Not Travelling to Mecca

verses.text: The nomadic Arabs, who stayed behind, will say to you ˹O Prophet˺, “We were preoccupied with our wealth and families, so ask for forgiveness for us.” They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say, “Who then can stand between you and Allah in any way, if He intends harm or benefit for you? In fact, Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
verses.translation: The nomadic Arabs, who stayed behind, will say to you ˹O Prophet˺, “We were preoccupied with our wealth and families, so ask for forgiveness for us.” They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say, “Who then can stand between you and Allah in any way, if He intends harm or benefit for you? In fact, Allah is All-Aware of what you do.

verses.text: The truth is: you thought that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families again. And that was made appealing in your hearts. You harboured evil thoughts ˹about Allah˺, and ˹so˺ became a doomed people.”
verses.translation: The truth is: you thought that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families again. And that was made appealing in your hearts. You harboured evil thoughts ˹about Allah˺, and ˹so˺ became a doomed people.”

verses.text: And whoever does not believe in Allah and His Messenger, then We surely have prepared for the disbelievers a blazing Fire.
verses.translation: And whoever does not believe in Allah and His Messenger, then We surely have prepared for the disbelievers a blazing Fire.

verses.text: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whoever He wills, and punishes whoever He wills. And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Shares in the Spoils of War
verses.translation: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whoever He wills, and punishes whoever He wills. And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. Shares in the Spoils of War

verses.text: Those who stayed behind will say, when you ˹believers˺ set out to take the spoils of war, “Let us accompany you.” They wish to change Allah’s promise.[1050] Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “You will not accompany us. This is what Allah has said before.” They will then say, “In fact, you are driven by jealousy against us!”[1051] The truth is: they can hardly comprehend. A Second Chance

Allegiance of the Faithful

verses.text: Indeed, Allah was pleased with the believers when they pledged allegiance to you ˹O Prophet˺ under the tree. He knew what was in their hearts, so He sent down serenity upon them and rewarded them with a victory at hand,[1053]
verses.translation: Indeed, Allah was pleased with the believers when they pledged allegiance to you ˹O Prophet˺ under the tree. He knew what was in their hearts, so He sent down serenity upon them and rewarded them with a victory at hand,[1053]

verses.text: and many spoils of war they will gain. For Allah is Almighty, All-Wise.
verses.translation: and many spoils of war they will gain. For Allah is Almighty, All-Wise.

verses.text: Allah has promised you ˹believers˺ abundant spoils, which you will gain, so He hastened this ˹truce˺[1054] for you. And He has held people’s hands back from ˹harming˺ you, so it may be a sign for the believers, and so He may guide you along the Straight Path.

verses.translation: And ˹there are˺ other gains which are beyond your reach that Allah is keeping in store ˹for you˺. For Allah is Most Capable of everything. The Believers Will Prevail

verses.text: If the disbelievers were to fight you, they would certainly flee.[1055] Then they would never find any protector or helper.
verses.translation: If the disbelievers were to fight you, they would certainly flee.[1055] Then they would never find any protector or helper.

verses.text: ˹This is˺ Allah’s way, already long established ˹in the past˺. And you will find no change in Allah’s way. Wisdom Behind the Truce
verses.translation: ˹This is˺ Allah’s way, already long established ˹in the past˺. And you will find no change in Allah’s way. Wisdom Behind the Truce

verses.text: He is the One Who held back their hands from you and your hands from them in the valley of ˹Ḥudaibiyah, near˺ Mecca, after giving you the upper hand over ˹a group of˺ them.[1056] And Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.
verses.translation: He is the One Who held back their hands from you and your hands from them in the valley of ˹Ḥudaibiyah, near˺ Mecca, after giving you the upper hand over ˹a group of˺ them.[1056] And Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.

verses.text: They are the ones who persisted in disbelief and hindered you from the Sacred Mosque, preventing the sacrificial animals from reaching their destination.[1057] ˹We would have let you march through Mecca,˺ had there not been believing men and women, unknown to you. You might have trampled them underfoot, incurring guilt for ˹what you did to˺ them unknowingly. That was so Allah may admit into His mercy whoever He wills.[1058] Had those ˹unknown˺ believers stood apart, We would have certainly inflicted a painful punishment on the disbelievers. Meccan Arrogance
verses.translation: They are the ones who persisted in disbelief and hindered you from the Sacred Mosque, preventing the sacrificial animals from reaching their destination.[1057] ˹We would have let you march through Mecca,˺ had there not been believing men and women, unknown to you. You might have trampled them underfoot, incurring guilt for ˹what you did to˺ them unknowingly. Meccan Arrogance

verses.text: ˹Remember˺ when the disbelievers had filled their hearts with pride— the pride of ˹pre-Islamic˺ ignorance[1059]—then Allah sent down His serenity upon His Messenger and the believers, inspiring them to uphold the declaration of faith,[1060] for they were better entitled and more worthy of it. And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things. The Prophet’s Vision[1061]
verses.translation: ˹Remember˺ when the disbelievers had filled their hearts with pride— the pride of ˹pre-Islamic˺ ignorance[1059]—then Allah sent down His serenity upon His Messenger and the believers, inspiring them to uphold the declaration of faith,[1060] for they were better entitled and more worthy of it. And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things. The Prophet’s Vision[1061]

verses.text: Indeed, Allah will fulfil His Messenger’s vision in all truth: Allah willing, you will surely enter the Sacred Mosque, in security—˹some with˺ heads shaved and ˹others with˺ hair shortened—without fear.[1062] He knew what you did not know, so He first granted you the triumph at hand.[1063]
verses.translation: Indeed, Allah will fulfil His Messenger’s vision in all truth: Allah willing, you will surely enter the Sacred Mosque, in security—˹some with˺ heads shaved and ˹others with˺ hair shortened—without fear.[1062] He knew what you did not know, so He first granted you the triumph at hand.[1063]

verses.text: He is the One Who has sent His Messenger with ˹right˺ guidance and the religion of truth, making it prevail over all others. And sufficient is Allah as a Witness. Believers’ Description in the Torah and the Gospel
verses.translation: He is the One Who has sent His Messenger with ˹right˺ guidance and the religion of truth, making it prevail over all others. And sufficient is Allah as a Witness. Believers’ Description in the Torah and the Gospel

verses.text: Muḥammad is the Messenger of Allah. And those with him are firm with the disbelievers[1064] and compassionate with one another. You see them bowing and prostrating[1065] ˹in prayer˺, seeking Allah’s bounty and pleasure. The sign ˹of brightness can be seen˺ on their faces from the trace of prostrating ˹in prayer˺. This is their description in the Torah.[1066] And their parable in the Gospel is that of a seed that sprouts its ˹tiny˺ branches, making it strong. Then it becomes thick, standing firmly on its stem, to the delight of the planters[1067]—in this way Allah makes the believers a source of dismay for the disbelievers.[1068] To those of them who believe and do good, Allah has promised forgiveness and a great reward. *** -- 452 of 694 --
