name: Pathways of ˹Heavenly˺ Ascent
intro: This Meccan sûrah, which takes its name from verse 3, condemns the pagans for ridiculing the Day of Judgment (verses 1-2) and the Prophet (verses 36-37). The truth of the Hour is reaffirmed, along with the horrors that will ensue. The qualities of the people of Hell and the people of Paradise are described (verses 16-35). The Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is reassured, while the pagans are warned—both themes are embedded in the story of Noah (ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) in the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful A Mocker Asks for Judgment Day

verses.translation: But no! Indeed, they ˹already˺ know what We created them from.[1235]

name: Noah
intro: This Meccan sûrah describes how Noah ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) strived to deliver the message to his people for 950 years (corresponding to the total number of Arabic letters in this sûrah). He called them to the truth secretly and publically, using logical arguments to prove the mercy and oneness of Allah. But his people persisted in denial, only to perish in the Flood. The stubbornness of the Arab pagans in the previous sûrah and the long denial of the people of Noah in this sûrah are contrasted with how some jinn instantly believed once they heard the truth in the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Noah’s Appeal to His People

verses.text: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people ˹saying to him˺, “Warn your people before a painful punishment comes to them.”
verses.translation: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people ˹saying to him˺, “Warn your people before a painful punishment comes to them.”

verses.text: Noah proclaimed, “O my people! I am truly sent to you with a clear warning:
verses.translation: Noah proclaimed, “O my people! I am truly sent to you with a clear warning:

verses.text: worship Allah ˹alone˺, fear Him, and obey me.
verses.translation: worship Allah ˹alone˺, fear Him, and obey me.

verses.text: He will forgive your sins, and delay your end until the appointed time.[1238] Indeed, when the time set by Allah comes, it cannot be delayed, if only you knew!” 950 Years of Preaching
verses.translation: He will forgive your sins, and delay your end until the appointed time.[1238] Indeed, when the time set by Allah comes, it cannot be delayed, if only you knew!” 950 Years of Preaching

verses.translation: He cried, “My Lord! I have surely called my people day and night,

verses.translation: but my calls only made them run farther away.

verses.translation: And whenever I invite them to be forgiven by You, they press their fingers into their ears, cover themselves with their clothes, persist ˹in denial˺, and act very arrogantly.

verses.translation: Then I certainly called them openly,

verses.translation: then I surely preached to them publicly and privately,

verses.translation: saying, ‘Seek your Lord’s forgiveness, ˹for˺ He is truly Most Forgiving.

verses.translation: He will shower you with abundant rain,

verses.text: supply you with wealth and children, and give you gardens as well as rivers.
verses.translation: supply you with wealth and children, and give you gardens as well as rivers.

verses.text: What is the matter with you that you are not in awe of the Majesty of Allah,
verses.translation: What is the matter with you that you are not in awe of the Majesty of Allah,

verses.text: when He truly created you in stages ˹of development˺?[1239]
verses.translation: when He truly created you in stages ˹of development˺?[1239]

verses.text: Do you not see how Allah created seven heavens, one above the other,
verses.translation: Do you not see how Allah created seven heavens, one above the other,

verses.text: placing the moon within them as a ˹reflected˺ light, and the sun as a ˹radiant˺ lamp?
verses.translation: placing the moon within them as a ˹reflected˺ light, and the sun as a ˹radiant˺ lamp?

verses.translation: Allah ˹alone˺ caused you[1240] to grow from the earth like a plant.

verses.text: Then He will return you to it, and then simply bring you forth ˹again˺.
verses.translation: Then He will return you to it, and then simply bring you forth ˹again˺.

verses.text: And Allah ˹alone˺ spread out the earth for you
verses.translation: And Allah ˹alone˺ spread out the earth for you

verses.translation: to walk along its spacious pathways.’” The Flood

verses.translation: ˹Eventually,˺ Noah cried, “My Lord! They have certainly persisted in disobeying me, and followed ˹instead˺ those ˹elite˺ whose ˹abundant˺ wealth and children only increase them in loss,

verses.translation: urging ˹their followers˺, ‘Do not abandon your idols— especially Wadd, Suwâ’, Yaghûth, Ya’ûq, and Nasr.’[1241]

verses.translation: Noah had prayed, “My Lord! Do not leave a single disbeliever on earth.

verses.translation: My Lord! Forgive me, my parents, and whoever enters my house in faith, and ˹all˺ believing men and women. And increase the wrongdoers only in destruction.” *** -- 516 of 694 --

name: The Jinn
intro: This Meccan sûrah gives an account of a group of jinn who fully submitted to the One True God as soon as they heard the Prophet’s recitation of the Quran. In comparison, the Arab pagans are criticized for their polytheistic beliefs. The pagans are told that the Prophet’s duty is only to deliver the message. Bringing about the punishment, which the pagans demanded, is only within the power of Allah. The next sûrah provides more warning to the pagans and reassurance to the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص). In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Some Jinn Embrace Islam

verses.text: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “It has been revealed to me that a group of jinn listened ˹to the Quran,˺ and said ˹to their fellow jinn˺: ‘Indeed, we have heard a wondrous recitation.
verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “It has been revealed to me that a group of jinn listened ˹to the Quran,˺ and said ˹to their fellow jinn˺: ‘Indeed, we have heard a wondrous recitation.

verses.translation: It leads to Right Guidance so we believed in it, and we will never associate anyone with our Lord ˹in worship˺.

verses.text: ˹Now, we believe that˺ our Lord—Exalted is His Majesty—has neither taken a mate nor offspring,

verses.translation: and that the foolish of us used to utter ˹outrageous˺ falsehoods about Allah.[1243]

verses.translation: We certainly thought that humans and jinn would never speak lies about Allah.

verses.translation: And some men used to seek refuge with some jinn—so they increased each other in wickedness.[1244]

verses.translation: And those ˹humans˺ thought, just like you ˹jinn˺, that Allah would not resurrect anyone ˹for judgment˺. No More Eavesdropping on Heaven

verses.translation: We used to take up positions there for eavesdropping, but whoever dares eavesdrop now will find a flare lying in wait for them.

verses.translation: Now, we have no clue whether evil is intended for those on earth, or their Lord intends for them what is right. Righteous and Deviant Jinn

verses.translation: ˹Now,˺ we truly know that we cannot frustrate Allah on earth, nor can we escape from Him ˹into heaven˺.

verses.translation: When we heard the guidance ˹of the Quran˺, we ˹readily˺ believed in it. For whoever believes in their Lord will have no fear of being denied ˹a reward˺ or wronged.

verses.text: And among us are those who have submitted ˹to Allah˺ and those who are deviant. So ˹as for˺ those who submitted, it is they who have attained Right Guidance.
verses.translation: And among us are those who have submitted ˹to Allah˺ and those who are deviant. So ˹as for˺ those who submitted, it is they who have attained Right Guidance.

verses.translation: Had the deniers followed the Right Way, We would have certainly granted them abundant rain to drink—

verses.translation: The places of worship are ˹only˺ for Allah, so do not invoke anyone besides Him.

verses.translation: Yet when the servant of Allah[1247] stood up calling upon Him ˹alone˺, the pagans almost swarmed over him.

verses.translation: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I call only upon my Lord, associating none with Him ˹in worship˺.”

name: The Wrapped One
intro: This early Meccan sûrah prepares the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) for the commandments yet to be revealed and the challenges ahead. The Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is advised, both in this sûrah and the next, to seek comfort in patience and prayer, whereas the arrogant disbelievers are warned of a horrible punishment in Hell. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Empowering the Prophet Through Prayer

verses.text: O you wrapped ˹in your clothes˺!
verses.translation: O you wrapped ˹in your clothes˺!

verses.translation: Stand all night ˹in prayer˺ except a little—

verses.translation: ˹pray˺ half the night, or a little less,

verses.translation: or a little more—and recite the Quran ˹properly˺ in a measured way.

verses.translation: ˹For˺ We will soon send upon you a weighty revelation.

name: The One Covered up
intro: Following his first encounter with the angel Gabriel at a cave in the outskirts of Mecca, the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) rushed to his house in total shock, asking his wife to cover him up with his cloak. Later, this Meccan sûrah was revealed, urging him ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) to shoulder the responsibility of delivering the message. Allah promises to deal with the pagan tyrants who oppose the truth, defame the Quran, and ridicule warnings of Hell. The pagan denial of the Hereafter is dealt with in the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful A Message to the Prophet

verses.translation: O you covered up ˹in your clothes˺!

verses.text: Arise and warn ˹all˺.

verses.translation: Purify your garments.

verses.translation: Do not do a favour expecting more ˹in return˺.[1251]

verses.translation: And persevere for ˹the sake of˺ your Lord.

verses.text: We have appointed only ˹stern˺ angels as wardens of the Fire. And We have made their number only as a test for the disbelievers,[1255] so that the People of the Book will be certain, and the believers will increase in faith, and neither the People of the Book nor the believers will have any doubts, and so that those ˹hypocrites˺ with sickness in their hearts and the disbelievers will argue, “What does Allah mean by such a number?” In this way Allah leaves whoever He wills to stray and guides whoever He wills. And none knows the forces of your Lord except He. And this ˹description of Hell˺ is only a reminder to humanity. Warning of Hell
verses.translation: We have appointed only ˹stern˺ angels as wardens of the Fire. And We have made their number only as a test for the disbelievers,[1255] so that the People of the Book will be certain, and the believers will increase in faith, and neither the People of the Book nor the believers will have any doubts, and so that those ˹hypocrites˺ with sickness in their hearts and the disbelievers will argue, “What does Allah mean by such a number?” In this way Allah leaves whoever He wills to stray and guides whoever He wills. And none knows the forces of your Lord except He. And this ˹description of Hell˺ is only a reminder to humanity. Warning of Hell

verses.text: But no! By the moon,
verses.translation: But no! By the moon,

verses.text: and the night as it retreats,
verses.translation: and the night as it retreats,

verses.text: and the day as it breaks!
verses.translation: and the day as it breaks!

verses.text: Surely Hell is one of the mightiest catastrophes—
verses.translation: Surely Hell is one of the mightiest catastrophes—

verses.text: a warning to humankind,
verses.translation: a warning to humankind,

verses.text: to whichever of you chooses to take the lead or lag behind. What Leads the Wicked to Hell
verses.translation: to whichever of you chooses to take the lead or lag behind. What Leads the Wicked to Hell

verses.text: Every soul will be detained for what it has done,
verses.translation: Every soul will be detained for what it has done,

verses.text: except the people of the right,
verses.translation: except the people of the right,

verses.text: who will be in Gardens, asking one another
verses.translation: who will be in Gardens, asking one another

verses.text: about the wicked ˹who will then be asked˺:
verses.translation: about the wicked ˹who will then be asked˺:

verses.text: “What has landed you in Hell?”
verses.translation: “What has landed you in Hell?”

verses.text: They will reply, “We were not of those who prayed,
verses.translation: They will reply, “We were not of those who prayed,

verses.text: nor did we feed the poor.
verses.translation: nor did we feed the poor.

verses.text: We used to indulge ˹in falsehood˺ along with others,
verses.translation: We used to indulge ˹in falsehood˺ along with others,

verses.text: and deny the Day of Judgment,
verses.translation: and deny the Day of Judgment,

verses.text: until the inevitable came to us.”
verses.translation: until the inevitable came to us.”

verses.text: So the pleas of intercessors will be of no benefit to them. Warning to Pagan Deniers
verses.translation: So the pleas of intercessors will be of no benefit to them. Warning to Pagan Deniers

verses.text: Now, what is the matter with them that they are turning away from the reminder,
verses.translation: Now, what is the matter with them that they are turning away from the reminder,

verses.text: as if they were spooked zebras
verses.translation: as if they were spooked zebras

verses.text: fleeing from a lion?
verses.translation: fleeing from a lion?

verses.text: In fact, each one of them wishes to be given a ˹personal˺ letter ˹from Allah˺ for all ˹to read˺.[1256]
verses.translation: In fact, each one of them wishes to be given a ˹personal˺ letter ˹from Allah˺ for all ˹to read˺.[1256]

verses.text: But no! In fact, they do not fear the Hereafter.
verses.translation: But no! In fact, they do not fear the Hereafter.

verses.text: Enough! Surely this ˹Quran˺ is a reminder.
verses.translation: Enough! Surely this ˹Quran˺ is a reminder.

verses.text: So let whoever wills be mindful of it.
verses.translation: So let whoever wills be mindful of it.

verses.text: But they cannot do so unless Allah wills. He ˹alone˺ is worthy to be feared and entitled to forgive. *** -- 522 of 694 --
verses.translation: But they cannot do so unless Allah wills. He ˹alone˺ is worthy to be feared and entitled to forgive. *** -- 522 of 694 --

name: The ˹Rising for˺ Judgment
intro: This Meccan sûrah refutes the pagan denial of resurrection and judgment. The sûrah makes it clear that death and judgment are inescapable. The fact that Allah created humans from humble fluids and is able to bring all to account is detailed in the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Warning to Deniers of Resurrection

verses.text: I do swear by the Day of Judgment!
verses.translation: I do swear by the Day of Judgment!

verses.text: And I do swear by the self- reproaching soul!
verses.translation: And I do swear by the self- reproaching soul!

verses.text: Do people think We cannot reassemble their bones?
verses.translation: Do people think We cannot reassemble their bones?

verses.text: Yes ˹indeed˺! We are ˹most˺ capable of restoring ˹even˺ their very fingertips. [1257]
verses.translation: Yes ˹indeed˺! We are ˹most˺ capable of restoring ˹even˺ their very fingertips. [1257]

verses.text: Still people want to deny what is yet to come,
verses.translation: Still people want to deny what is yet to come,

verses.text: asking ˹mockingly˺, “When is this Day of Judgment?”
verses.translation: asking ˹mockingly˺, “When is this Day of Judgment?”

verses.text: But when the sight is stunned,
verses.translation: But when the sight is stunned,

verses.text: and the moon is dimmed,
verses.translation: and the moon is dimmed,

verses.text: and the sun and the moon are brought together,[1258]
verses.translation: and the sun and the moon are brought together,[1258]

verses.text: on that Day one will cry, “Where is the escape?”
verses.translation: on that Day one will cry, “Where is the escape?”

verses.text: But no! There will be no refuge.
verses.translation: But no! There will be no refuge.

verses.text: On that Day all will end up before your Lord.
verses.translation: On that Day all will end up before your Lord.

verses.text: All will then be informed of what they have sent forth and left behind.
verses.translation: All will then be informed of what they have sent forth and left behind.

verses.text: In fact, people will testify against their own souls,[1259]
verses.translation: In fact, people will testify against their own souls,[1259]

verses.text: despite the excuses they come up with. The Prophet’s Rush to Memorize the Quran
verses.translation: despite the excuses they come up with. The Prophet’s Rush to Memorize the Quran

verses.text: Do not rush your tongue trying to memorize ˹a revelation of˺ the Quran.
verses.translation: Do not rush your tongue trying to memorize ˹a revelation of˺ the Quran.

verses.text: It is certainly upon Us to ˹make you˺ memorize and recite it.
verses.translation: It is certainly upon Us to ˹make you˺ memorize and recite it.

verses.text: So once We have recited a revelation ˹through Gabriel˺, follow its recitation ˹closely˺.
verses.translation: So once We have recited a revelation ˹through Gabriel˺, follow its recitation ˹closely˺.

verses.text: Then it is surely upon Us to make it clear ˹to you˺. Another Warning to the Deniers
verses.translation: Then it is surely upon Us to make it clear ˹to you˺. Another Warning to the Deniers

verses.text: But no! In fact, you love this fleeting world,
verses.translation: But no! In fact, you love this fleeting world,

verses.text: and neglect the Hereafter.
verses.translation: and neglect the Hereafter.

verses.text: On that Day ˹some˺ faces will be bright,
verses.translation: On that Day ˹some˺ faces will be bright,

verses.text: looking at their Lord.
verses.translation: looking at their Lord.

verses.text: And ˹other˺ faces will be gloomy,
verses.translation: And ˹other˺ faces will be gloomy,

verses.text: anticipating something devastating to befall them. Death of a Denier
verses.translation: anticipating something devastating to befall them. Death of a Denier

verses.text: But no! ˹Beware of the day˺ when the soul reaches the collar bone ˹as it leaves˺,
verses.translation: But no! ˹Beware of the day˺ when the soul reaches the collar bone ˹as it leaves˺,

verses.text: and it will be said, “Is there any healer ˹who can save this life˺?”
verses.translation: and it will be said, “Is there any healer ˹who can save this life˺?”

verses.text: And the dying person realizes it is ˹their˺ time to depart,
verses.translation: And the dying person realizes it is ˹their˺ time to depart,

verses.text: and ˹then˺ their feet are tied together ˹in a shroud˺.
verses.translation: and ˹then˺ their feet are tied together ˹in a shroud˺.

verses.text: On that day they will be driven to your Lord ˹alone˺.
verses.translation: On that day they will be driven to your Lord ˹alone˺.

verses.text: This denier neither believed nor prayed,
verses.translation: This denier neither believed nor prayed,

verses.text: but persisted in denial and turned away,
verses.translation: but persisted in denial and turned away,

verses.text: then went to their own people, walking boastfully.
verses.translation: then went to their own people, walking boastfully.

verses.text: Woe to you, and more woe!
verses.translation: Woe to you, and more woe!

verses.text: Again, woe to you, and even more woe! Allah’s Ability to Create and Resurrect
verses.translation: Again, woe to you, and even more woe! Allah’s Ability to Create and Resurrect

verses.text: Do people think they will be left without purpose?
verses.translation: Do people think they will be left without purpose?

verses.text: Were they not ˹once˺ a sperm-drop emitted?
verses.translation: Were they not ˹once˺ a sperm-drop emitted?

verses.text: Then they became a clinging clot ˹of blood˺,[1260] then He developed and perfected their form,
verses.translation: Then they became a clinging clot ˹of blood˺,[1260] then He developed and perfected their form,

verses.text: producing from it both sexes, male and female.
verses.translation: producing from it both sexes, male and female.

verses.text: Is such ˹a Creator˺ unable to bring the dead back to life? *** -- 524 of 694 --
verses.translation: Is such ˹a Creator˺ unable to bring the dead back to life? *** -- 524 of 694 --

name: Humans
intro: This Meccan sûrah reminds the human beings of how Allah created them, equipped them with different faculties, showed them the Way, and gave them free choice. The reward of those who choose to believe is mentioned at length in this sûrah but passingly in the next sûrah (77:41-44), whereas the reward of those who choose to disbelieve is mentioned passingly in this sûrah (verse 4) but in great detail in the next. The Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is advised to be steadfast and not yield to the deniers of Judgment Day. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Free Choice

verses.text: Is there not a period of time when each human is nothing yet worth mentioning?[1261]
verses.translation: Is there not a period of time when each human is nothing yet worth mentioning?[1261]

verses.text: ˹For˺ indeed, We ˹alone˺ created humans from a drop of mixed fluids,[1262] ˹in order˺ to test them, so We made them hear and see.
verses.translation: ˹For˺ indeed, We ˹alone˺ created humans from a drop of mixed fluids,[1262] ˹in order˺ to test them, so We made them hear and see.

verses.text: We already showed them the Way, whether they ˹choose to˺ be grateful or ungrateful. Reward of the Ungrateful
verses.translation: We already showed them the Way, whether they ˹choose to˺ be grateful or ungrateful. Reward of the Ungrateful

verses.text: Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains, shackles, and a blazing Fire. Reward of the Grateful
verses.translation: Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains, shackles, and a blazing Fire. Reward of the Grateful

verses.text: Indeed, the virtuous will have a drink ˹of pure wine˺—flavoured with camphor—
verses.translation: Indeed, the virtuous will have a drink ˹of pure wine˺—flavoured with camphor—

verses.text: ˹from˺ a spring where Allah’s servants will drink, flowing at their will.
verses.translation: ˹from˺ a spring where Allah’s servants will drink, flowing at their will.

verses.text: They ˹are those who˺ fulfil ˹their˺ vows and fear a Day of sweeping horror,
verses.translation: They ˹are those who˺ fulfil ˹their˺ vows and fear a Day of sweeping horror,

verses.text: and give food—despite their desire for it—to the poor, the orphan, and the captive,
verses.translation: and give food—despite their desire for it—to the poor, the orphan, and the captive,

verses.text: ˹saying to themselves,˺ “We feed you only for the sake of Allah, seeking neither reward nor thanks from you.
verses.translation: ˹saying to themselves,˺ “We feed you only for the sake of Allah, seeking neither reward nor thanks from you.

verses.text: We fear from our Lord a horribly distressful Day.”
verses.translation: We fear from our Lord a horribly distressful Day.”

verses.text: So Allah will deliver them from the horror of that Day, and grant them radiance and joy,
verses.translation: So Allah will deliver them from the horror of that Day, and grant them radiance and joy,

verses.text: and reward them for their perseverance with a Garden ˹in Paradise˺ and ˹garments of˺ silk. Pleasures in Paradise
verses.translation: and reward them for their perseverance with a Garden ˹in Paradise˺ and ˹garments of˺ silk. Pleasures in Paradise

verses.text: There they will be reclining on ˹canopied˺ couches, never seeing scorching heat or bitter cold.[1263]
verses.translation: There they will be reclining on ˹canopied˺ couches, never seeing scorching heat or bitter cold.[1263]

verses.text: The Garden’s shade will be right above them, and its fruit will be made very easy to reach.
verses.translation: The Garden’s shade will be right above them, and its fruit will be made very easy to reach.

verses.text: They will be waited on with silver vessels and cups of crystal—
verses.translation: They will be waited on with silver vessels and cups of crystal—

verses.text: crystalline silver, filled precisely as desired.
verses.translation: crystalline silver, filled precisely as desired.

verses.text: And they will be given a drink ˹of pure wine˺ flavoured with ginger
verses.translation: And they will be given a drink ˹of pure wine˺ flavoured with ginger

verses.text: from a spring there, called Salsabîl.
verses.translation: from a spring there, called Salsabîl.

verses.text: They will be waited on by eternal youths. If you saw them, you would think they were scattered pearls.
verses.translation: They will be waited on by eternal youths. If you saw them, you would think they were scattered pearls.

verses.text: And if you looked around, you would see ˹indescribable˺ bliss and a vast kingdom.
verses.translation: And if you looked around, you would see ˹indescribable˺ bliss and a vast kingdom.

verses.text: The virtuous will be ˹dressed˺ in garments of fine green silk and rich brocade, and adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a purifying drink.[1264]
verses.translation: The virtuous will be ˹dressed˺ in garments of fine green silk and rich brocade, and adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a purifying drink.[1264]

verses.text: ˹And they will be told,˺ “All this is surely a reward for you. Your striving has been appreciated.” Reassuring the Prophet
verses.translation: ˹And they will be told,˺ “All this is surely a reward for you. Your striving has been appreciated.” Reassuring the Prophet

verses.text: Indeed, it is We Who have revealed the Quran to you ˹O Prophet˺ in stages.
verses.translation: Indeed, it is We Who have revealed the Quran to you ˹O Prophet˺ in stages.

verses.text: So be patient with your Lord’s decree, and do not yield to any evildoer or ˹staunch˺ disbeliever from among them.
verses.translation: So be patient with your Lord’s decree, and do not yield to any evildoer or ˹staunch˺ disbeliever from among them.

verses.text: ˹Always˺ remember the Name of your Lord morning and evening,
verses.translation: ˹Always˺ remember the Name of your Lord morning and evening,

verses.text: and prostrate before Him during part of the night,[1265] and glorify Him long at night.[1266] A Message to the Deniers
verses.translation: and prostrate before Him during part of the night,[1265] and glorify Him long at night.[1266] A Message to the Deniers

verses.text: Surely those ˹pagans˺ love this fleeting world, ˹totally˺ neglecting a weighty Day ahead of them.
verses.translation: Surely those ˹pagans˺ love this fleeting world, ˹totally˺ neglecting a weighty Day ahead of them.

verses.text: It is We Who created them and perfected their ˹physical˺ form. But if We will, We can easily replace them with others.
verses.translation: It is We Who created them and perfected their ˹physical˺ form. But if We will, We can easily replace them with others.

verses.text: Surely this is a reminder. So let whoever wills take the ˹Right˺ Way to their Lord.
verses.translation: Surely this is a reminder. So let whoever wills take the ˹Right˺ Way to their Lord.

verses.text: But you cannot will ˹to do so˺ unless Allah wills. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
verses.translation: But you cannot will ˹to do so˺ unless Allah wills. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

verses.text: He admits whoever He wills into His mercy. As for the wrongdoers, He has prepared for them a painful punishment *** -- 526 of 694 --
verses.translation: He admits whoever He wills into His mercy. As for the wrongdoers, He has prepared for them a painful punishment *** -- 526 of 694 --

name: Those ˹Winds˺ Sent Forth
intro: Like the two previous sûrahs and the next two sûrahs, this Meccan sûrah makes it clear that Allah’s power to create should be taken as a proof of His ability to bring the dead back to life for judgment. The horrors of the Hour and the punishment of the wicked are stated in strong terms. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Judgment Day Is Inevitable

verses.text: By those ˹winds˺ sent forth successively,
verses.translation: By those ˹winds˺ sent forth successively,

verses.text: and those blowing violently,
verses.translation: and those blowing violently,

verses.text: and those scattering ˹rainclouds˺ widely!
verses.translation: and those scattering ˹rainclouds˺ widely!

verses.text: And ˹by˺ those ˹angels˺ fully distinguishing ˹truth from falsehood˺,
verses.translation: And ˹by˺ those ˹angels˺ fully distinguishing ˹truth from falsehood˺,

verses.text: and those delivering revelation,
verses.translation: and those delivering revelation,

verses.text: ending excuses and giving warnings.
verses.translation: ending excuses and giving warnings.

verses.text: Surely, what you are promised will come to pass. Horrors of Judgment Day
verses.translation: Surely, what you are promised will come to pass. Horrors of Judgment Day

verses.text: So when the stars are put out,
verses.translation: So when the stars are put out,

verses.text: and the sky is torn apart,
verses.translation: and the sky is torn apart,

verses.text: and the mountains are blown away,
verses.translation: and the mountains are blown away,

verses.text: and the messengers’ time ˹to testify˺ comes up—
verses.translation: and the messengers’ time ˹to testify˺ comes up—

verses.text: for which Day has all this been set?
verses.translation: for which Day has all this been set?

verses.text: For the Day of ˹Final˺ Decision!
verses.translation: For the Day of ˹Final˺ Decision!

verses.text: And what will make you realize what the Day of Decision is?
verses.translation: And what will make you realize what the Day of Decision is?

verses.text: Woe on that Day to the deniers! Allah’s Infinite Power
verses.translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers! Allah’s Infinite Power

verses.text: Did We not destroy earlier disbelievers?
verses.translation: Did We not destroy earlier disbelievers?

verses.text: And We will make the later disbelievers follow them.
verses.translation: And We will make the later disbelievers follow them.

verses.text: This is how We deal with the wicked.
verses.translation: This is how We deal with the wicked.

verses.text: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
verses.translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

verses.text: Did We not create you from a humble fluid,
verses.translation: Did We not create you from a humble fluid,

verses.text: placing it in a secure place
verses.translation: placing it in a secure place

verses.text: until an appointed time?[1267]
verses.translation: until an appointed time?[1267]

verses.text: We ˹perfectly˺ ordained ˹its development˺. How excellent are We in doing so!
verses.translation: We ˹perfectly˺ ordained ˹its development˺. How excellent are We in doing so!

verses.text: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
verses.translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

verses.text: Have We not made the earth a lodging
verses.translation: Have We not made the earth a lodging

verses.text: for the living and the dead,
verses.translation: for the living and the dead,

verses.text: and placed upon it towering, firm mountains, and given you fresh water to drink?
verses.translation: and placed upon it towering, firm mountains, and given you fresh water to drink?

verses.text: Woe on that Day to the deniers! Bad News for the Deniers of Hell
verses.translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers! Bad News for the Deniers of Hell

verses.text: ˹The disbelievers will be told,˺ “Proceed into that ˹Fire˺ which you used to deny!
verses.translation: ˹The disbelievers will be told,˺ “Proceed into that ˹Fire˺ which you used to deny!

verses.text: Proceed into the shade ˹of smoke˺ which rises in three columns,
verses.translation: Proceed into the shade ˹of smoke˺ which rises in three columns,

verses.text: providing neither coolness nor shelter from the flames.
verses.translation: providing neither coolness nor shelter from the flames.

verses.text: Indeed, it hurls sparks ˹as big˺ as huge castles,
verses.translation: Indeed, it hurls sparks ˹as big˺ as huge castles,

verses.text: and ˹as dark˺ as black camels.”[1268]
verses.translation: and ˹as dark˺ as black camels.”[1268]

verses.text: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
verses.translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

verses.text: On that Day they will not ˹be in a position to˺ speak,
verses.translation: On that Day they will not ˹be in a position to˺ speak,

verses.text: nor will they be permitted to offer excuses.
verses.translation: nor will they be permitted to offer excuses.

verses.text: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
verses.translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

verses.text: ˹They will be told by Allah,˺ “This is the Day of ˹Final˺ Decision: We have gathered you along with earlier disbelievers ˹for punishment˺.
verses.translation: ˹They will be told by Allah,˺ “This is the Day of ˹Final˺ Decision: We have gathered you along with earlier disbelievers ˹for punishment˺.

verses.text: So if you have a scheme ˹to save yourselves˺, then use it against Me.”
verses.translation: So if you have a scheme ˹to save yourselves˺, then use it against Me.”

verses.text: Woe on that Day to the deniers! Good News for the Believers
verses.translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers! Good News for the Believers

verses.text: Indeed, the righteous will be amid ˹cool˺ shade and springs
verses.translation: Indeed, the righteous will be amid ˹cool˺ shade and springs

verses.text: and any fruit they desire.
verses.translation: and any fruit they desire.

verses.text: ˹They will be told,˺ “Eat and drink happily for what you used to do.”
verses.translation: ˹They will be told,˺ “Eat and drink happily for what you used to do.”

verses.text: Surely this is how We reward the good-doers.
verses.translation: Surely this is how We reward the good-doers.

verses.text: ˹But˺ woe on that Day to the deniers! Warning to the Deniers
verses.translation: ˹But˺ woe on that Day to the deniers! Warning to the Deniers

verses.text: “Eat and enjoy yourselves for a little while, ˹for˺ you are truly wicked.”
verses.translation: “Eat and enjoy yourselves for a little while, ˹for˺ you are truly wicked.”

verses.text: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
verses.translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

verses.text: When it is said to them, “Bow down ˹before Allah,” they do not bow.
verses.translation: When it is said to them, “Bow down ˹before Allah,” they do not bow.

verses.text: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
verses.translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

verses.text: So what message after this ˹Quran˺ would they believe in? *** -- 528 of 694 --
verses.translation: So what message after this ˹Quran˺ would they believe in? *** -- 528 of 694 --

name: The Momentous News
intro: This Meccan sûrah thoroughly refutes the arguments of those who deny the Hereafter by citing some of the marvels of Allah’s creation to prove His ability to raise the dead to life and reward everyone according to their deeds. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Pagans Mock the Truth

verses.text: What are they asking one another about?
verses.translation: What are they asking one another about?

verses.text: About the momentous news,
verses.translation: About the momentous news,

verses.text: over which they disagree.[1269]
verses.translation: over which they disagree.[1269]

verses.text: But no! They will come to know.
verses.translation: But no! They will come to know.

verses.text: Again, no! They will come to know. Miracle of Allah’s Creation
verses.translation: Again, no! They will come to know. Miracle of Allah’s Creation

verses.text: Have We not smoothed out the earth ˹like a bed˺,
verses.translation: Have We not smoothed out the earth ˹like a bed˺,

verses.text: and ˹made˺ the mountains as ˹its˺ pegs,[1270]
verses.translation: and ˹made˺ the mountains as ˹its˺ pegs,[1270]

verses.text: and created you in pairs,
verses.translation: and created you in pairs,

verses.text: and made your sleep for rest,
verses.translation: and made your sleep for rest,

verses.text: and made the night as a cover,
verses.translation: and made the night as a cover,

verses.text: and made the day for livelihood,
verses.translation: and made the day for livelihood,

verses.text: and built above you seven mighty ˹heavens˺,

name: He Frowned
intro: In a ḥadîth collected by At-Tirmi ⱬi, a blind man by the name of ’Abdullâh ibn Um Maktûm, an early Muslim, came to the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) seeking to learn more about the faith, while the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) was in the middle of a discussion with an elite Meccan pagan, trying to convince him to abandon his idols and believe in the One True God. ’Abdullâh was so impatient that he interrupted the discussion several times. The Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) frowned and turned all his attention to the man he was already talking to. This Meccan sûrah was later revealed, telling the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) that he should have tended to the faithful man who was eager to learn. After this sûrah was revealed, the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) would honour ’Abdullâh, calling him ‘the man for whom my Lord rebuked me.’ He ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) even appointed him several times as his deputy over Medina. The sûrah calls upon the ungrateful disbelievers to reflect on how Allah produces plants out of the earth to realize how He can bring the dead out of their graves. The description of the horrors of the apocalypse is carried over to the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful A Lesson to the Prophet[1279]

name: The ˹Sky˺ Bursting Open
intro: As a follow-up to the previous sûrahs, this Meccan sûrah elaborates upon what to expect on Judgment Day. The believers will receive their records of deeds in their right hands and rejoice after an easy judgment, whereas the disbelievers will receive their records in their left hands and cry for instant destruction. The disbelievers are criticized for failing to submit to Allah, contrasted with the full submission of the sky and the earth in verses 1-5. More warnings to the evildoers appear in the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Horrors of Judgment Day

name: Constellations
intro: The beginning of this Meccan sûrah condemns the persecution of the Christians of Najrân (a city on the border of Yemen and Saudi Arabia) at the hands of the pagans around 524 C.E. The tyrants are warned of the torment of burning, whereas the believers are promised a great reward in Paradise. Both this sûrah and the next swear by the towering sky, emphasize Allah’s infinite power, pose a warning to the evildoers, and stress the divinity of the Quran. intro: In this Meccan sûrah, an oath is made that whatever a person does is recorded by vigilant angels and that the Resurrection is as easy for Allah as the first creation. Another oath is made that the Quran is a decisive message, and a warning is given to those who plot against Allah. name: The Most High
intro: Unlike the wicked who plot against Allah (according to the end of the previous sûrah), the Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is ordered at the beginning of this Meccan sûrah to glorify his Lord. This fleeting world is compared to the short life of plants (verses 4-5). The Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is reassured of Allah’s support, and the wicked are warned of burning in Hell. This warning is emphasized in the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful The Master Creator

name: The Overwhelming Event
intro: This Meccan sûrah compares the fate of the evildoers in the Hereafter to that of the good-doers. Those who disbelieve in Allah’s might are criticized for failing to reflect on the wonders of His creation, and are warned of the fate of some destroyed disbelievers mentioned at the beginning of the next sûrah. In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful The People of Hell

name: Dawn
intro: The Prophet ( ملسو هيلع هللا ىلص) is reassured in this Meccan sûrah that the Arab pagans are not immune to the torments that befell ’ Ȃd, Thamûd, and Pharaoh. A reference is made to the wicked who fail to be grateful in prosperity and patient in adversity. The evildoers will be regretful on Judgment Day, whereas the righteous will be honoured. Those who withhold Allah’s bounties are criticized in this sûrah (verses 17-20) and the next (90:11-16). In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful Fate of the Deniers
